review: One of the other reviewer ha mentioned that after watching just 1 Oz episode you 'll be hooked . They are right , a this is exactly what happened with me . The first thing that struck me about Oz wa it brutality and unflinching scene of violence , which set in right from the word GO . Trust me , this is not a show for the faint hearted or timid . This show pull no punch with regard to drug , sex or violence . Its is hardcore , in the classic use of the word . It is called OZ a that is the nickname given to the Oswald Maximum Security State Penitentary . It focus mainly on Emerald City , an experimental section of the prison where all the cell have glass front and face inwards , so privacy is not high on the agenda . Em City is home to many .. Aryans , Muslims , gangsta , Latinos , Christians , Italians , Irish and more .... so scuffle , death stare , dodgy dealing and shady agreement are never far away . I would say the main appeal of the show is due to the fact that it go where other show would n't dare . Forget pretty picture painted for mainstream audience , forget charm , forget romance ... OZ doe n't mess around . The first episode I ever saw struck me a so nasty it wa surreal , I could n't say I wa ready for it , but a I watched more , I developed a taste for Oz , and got accustomed to the high level of graphic violence . Not just violence , but injustice ( crooked guard who 'll be sold out for a nickel , inmate who 'll kill on order and get away with it , well mannered , middle class inmate being turned into prison bitch due to their lack of street skill or prison experience ) Watching Oz , you may become comfortable with what is uncomfortable viewing .... thats if you can get in touch with your darker side .

A wonderful little production . The filming technique is very unassuming- very old-time-BBC fashion and give a comforting , and sometimes discomforting , sense of realism to the entire piece . The actor are extremely well chosen- Michael Sheen not only `` ha got all the polari '' but he ha all the voice down pat too ! You can truly see the seamless editing guided by the reference to Williams ' diary entry , not only is it well worth the watching but it is a terrificly written and performed piece . A masterful production about one of the great master 's of comedy and his life . The realism really come home with the little thing : the fantasy of the guard which , rather than use the traditional 'dream ' technique remains solid then disappears . It play on our knowledge and our sens , particularly with the scene concerning Orton and Halliwell and the set ( particularly of their flat with Halliwell 's mural decorating every surface ) are terribly well done .

I thought this wa a wonderful way to spend time on a too hot summer weekend , sitting in the air conditioned theater and watching a light-hearted comedy . The plot is simplistic , but the dialogue is witty and the character are likable ( even the well bread suspected serial killer ) . While some may be disappointed when they realize this is not Match Point 2 : Risk Addiction , I thought it wa proof that Woody Allen is still fully in control of the style many of u have grown to love . This wa the most I 'd laughed at one of Woody 's comedy in year ( dare I say a decade ? ) . While I 've never been impressed with Scarlet Johanson , in this she managed to tone down her `` sexy '' image and jumped right into a average , but spirited young woman . This may not be the crown jewel of his career , but it wa wittier than `` Devil Wears Prada '' and more interesting than `` Superman '' a great comedy to go see with friend .

Basically there 's a family where a little boy ( Jake ) think there 's a zombie in his closet & his parent are fighting all the time . This movie is slower than a soap opera ... and suddenly , Jake decides to become Rambo and kill the zombie . OK , first of all when you 're going to make a film you must Decide if it a thriller or a drama ! As a drama the movie is watchable . Parents are divorcing & arguing like in real life . And then we have Jake with his closet which totally ruin all the film ! I expected to see a BOOGEYMAN similar movie , and instead i watched a drama with some meaningless thriller spot . 3 out of 10 just for the well playing parent & descent dialog . As for the shot with Jake : just ignore them .

Petter Mattei 's `` Love in the Time of Money '' is a visually stunning film to watch . Mr. Mattei offer u a vivid portrait about human relation . This is a movie that seems to be telling u what money , power and success do to people in the different situation we encounter . This being a variation on the Arthur Schnitzler 's play about the same theme , the director transfer the action to the present time New York where all these different character meet and connect . Each one is connected in one way , or another to the next person , but no one seems to know the previous point of contact . Stylishly , the film ha a sophisticated luxurious look . We are taken to see how these people live and the world they live in their own habitat . The only thing one get out of all these soul in the picture is the different stage of loneliness each one inhabits . A big city is not exactly the best place in which human relation find sincere fulfillment , a one discerns is the case with most of the people we encounter . The acting is good under Mr. Mattei 's direction . Steve Buscemi , Rosario Dawson , Carol Kane , Michael Imperioli , Adrian Grenier , and the rest of the talented cast , make these character come alive . We wish Mr. Mattei good luck and await anxiously for his next work .

Probably my all-time favorite movie , a story of selflessness , sacrifice and dedication to a noble cause , but it 's not preachy or boring . It just never get old , despite my having seen it some 15 or more time in the last 25 year . Paul Lukas ' performance brings tear to my eye , and Bette Davis , in one of her very few truly sympathetic role , is a delight . The kid are , a grandma say , more like `` dressed-up midget '' than child , but that only make them more fun to watch . And the mother 's slow awakening to what 's happening in the world and under her own roof is believable and startling . If I had a dozen thumb , they 'd all be `` up '' for this movie .

I sure would like to see a resurrection of a up dated Seahunt series with the tech they have today it would bring back the kid excitement in me.I grew up on black and white TV and Seahunt with Gunsmoke were my hero 's every week.You have my vote for a comeback of a new sea hunt.We need a change of pace in TV and this would work for a world of under water adventure.Oh by the way thank you for an outlet like this to view many viewpoint about TV and the many movies.So any ole way I believe I 've got what I wan na say.Would be nice to read some more plus point about sea hunt.If my rhyme would be 10 line would you let me submit , or leave me out to be in doubt and have me to quit , If this is so then I must go so let do it .

This show wa an amazing , fresh & innovative idea in the 70 's when it first aired . The first 7 or 8 year were brilliant , but thing dropped off after that . By 1990 , the show wa not really funny anymore , and it 's continued it decline further to the complete waste of time it is today . It 's truly disgraceful how far this show ha fallen . The writing is painfully bad , the performance are almost a bad - if not for the mildly entertaining respite of the guest-hosts , this show probably would n't still be on the air . I find it so hard to believe that the same creator that hand-selected the original cast also chose the band of hack that followed . How can one recognize such brilliance and then see fit to replace it with such mediocrity ? I felt I must give 2 star out of respect for the original cast that made this show such a huge success . As it is now , the show is just awful . I ca n't believe it 's still on the air .

Encouraged by the positive comment about this film on here I wa looking forward to watching this film . Bad mistake . I 've seen 950+ film and this is truly one of the worst of them - it 's awful in almost every way : editing , pacing , storyline , 'acting , ' soundtrack ( the film 's only song - a lame country tune - is played no le than four time ) . The film look cheap and nasty and is boring in the extreme . Rarely have I been so happy to see the end credit of a film . The only thing that prevents me giving this a 1-score is Harvey Keitel - while this is far from his best performance he at least seems to be making a bit of an effort . One for Keitel obsessive only .
If you like original gut wrenching laughter you will like this movie . If you are young or old then you will love this movie , hell even my mom liked it . Great Camp ! ! !

Phil the Alien is one of those quirky film where the humour is based around the oddness of everything rather than actual punchlines . At first it wa very odd and pretty funny but a the movie progressed I did n't find the joke or oddness funny anymore . Its a low budget film ( thats never a problem in itself ) , there were some pretty interesting character , but eventually I just lost interest . I imagine this film would appeal to a stoner who is currently partaking . For something similar but better try `` Brother from another planet ''

I saw this movie when I wa about 12 when it came out . I recall the scariest scene wa the big bird eating men dangling helplessly from parachute right out of the air . The horror . The horror . As a young kid going to these cheesy B film on Saturday afternoon , I still wa tired of the formula for these monster type movie that usually included the hero , a beautiful woman who might be the daughter of a professor and a happy resolution when the monster died in the end . I did n't care much for the romantic angle a a 12 year old and the predictable plot . I love them now for the unintentional humor . But , about a year or so later , I saw Psycho when it came out and I loved that the star , Janet Leigh , wa bumped off early in the film . I sat up and took notice at that point . Since screenwriter are making up the story , make it up to be a scary a possible and not from a well-worn formula . There are no rule .

Boll apparently bought the right to use Far Cry long ago even before the game itself wa even finsished . People who have enjoyed killing mercs and infiltrating secret research lab located on a tropical island should be warned , that this is not Far Cry ... This is something Mr Boll have schemed together along with his legion of schmuck .. Feeling loneley on the set Mr Boll invite three of his countryman to play with . These player go by the name of Til Schweiger , Udo Kier and Ralf Moeller . Three name that actually have made them self pretty big in the movie biz . So the tale go like this , Jack Carver played by Til Schweiger ( yes Carver is German all hail the bratwurst eating dude ! ! ) However I find that Tils acting in this movie is pretty badass .. People have complained about how he 's not really staying true to the whole Carver agenda but we only saw carver in a first person perspective so we do n't really know what he looked like when he wa kicking a * * .. However , the storyline in this film is beyond demented . We see the evil mad scientist Dr. Krieger played by Udo Kier , making Genetically-Mutated-soldiers or GMS a they are called . Performing his top-secret research on an island that reminds me of `` SPOILER '' Vancouver for some reason . Thats right no palm tree here . Instead we got some nice rich lumberjack-woods . We have n't even gone FAR before I started to CRY ( mehehe ) I can not go on any more .. If you wan na stay true to Bolls shenanigan then go and see this movie you will not be disappointed it delivers the true Boll experience , meaning most of it will suck . There are some thing worth mentioning that would imply that Boll did a good work on some area of the film such a some nice boat and fighting scene . Until the whole cromed/albino GMS squad enters the scene and everything just make me laugh .. The movie Far Cry reek of scheisse ( that 's poop for you simpleton ) from a fa , r if you wan na take a wiff go ahead .. BTW Carver get a very annoying sidekick who make you wan na shoot him the first three minute he 's on screen .

Kind of drawn in by the erotic scene , only to realize this wa one of the most amateurish and unbelievable bit of film I 've ever seen . Sort of like a high school film project . What wa Rosanna Arquette thinking ? ? And what wa with all those stock character in that bizarre supposed Midwest town ? Pretty hard to get involved with this one . No lesson to be learned from it , no brilliant insight , just stilted and quite ridiculous ( but lot of skin , if that intrigue you ) videotaped nonsense .... What wa with the bisexual relationship , out of nowhere , after all the heterosexual encounter . And what wa with that absurd dance , with everybody playing their stereotyped role ? Give this one a pas , it 's like a million other mile of bad , wasted film , money that could have been spent on starving child or Aids in Africa .....

Some film just simply should not be remade . This is one of them . In and of itself it is not a bad film . But it fails to capture the flavor and the terror of the 1963 film of the same title . Liam Neeson wa excellent a he always is , and most of the cast hold up , with the exception of Owen Wilson , who just did not bring the right feel to the character of Luke . But the major fault with this version is that it strayed too far from the Shirley Jackson story in it 's attempt to be grandiose and lost some of the thrill of the earlier film in a trade off for snazzier special effect . Again I will say that in and of itself it is not a bad film . But you will enjoy the friction of terror in the older version much more .

This movie made it into one of my top 10 most awful movie . Horrible . There wa n't a continuous minute where there wa n't a fight with one monster or another . There wa no chance for any character development , they were too busy running from one sword fight to another . I had no emotional attachment ( except to the big bad machine that wanted to destroy them ) Scenes were blatantly stolen from other movie , LOTR , Star Wars and Matrix . Examples > The ghost scene at the end wa stolen from the final scene of the old Star Wars with Yoda , Obee One and Vader . > The spider machine in the beginning wa exactly like Frodo being attacked by the spider in Return of the Kings . ( Elijah Wood is the victim in both film ) and wait ...... it hypnotizes ( sting ) it victim and wrap them up ..... uh hello ? ? ? ? > And the whole machine vs. human theme WAS the Matrix .. or Terminator ..... There are more example but why waste the time ? And will someone tell me what wa with the Nazi 's ? ! ? ! Nazi 's ? ? ? ? There wa a juvenile story line rushed to a juvenile conclusion . The movie could not decide if it wa a child 's movie or an adult movie and wa n't much of either . Just awful . A real disappointment to say the least . Save your money .

An awful film ! It must have been up against some real stinker to be nominated for the Golden Globe . They 've taken the story of the first famous female Renaissance painter and mangled it beyond recognition . My complaint is not that they 've taken liberty with the fact ; if the story were good , that would perfectly fine . But it 's simply bizarre -- by all account the true story of this artist would have made for a far better film , so why did they come up with this dishwater-dull script ? I suppose there were n't enough naked people in the factual version . It 's hurriedly capped off in the end with a summary of the artist 's life -- we could have saved ourselves a couple of hour if they 'd favored the rest of the film with same brevity .

After the success of Die Hard and it 's sequel it 's no surprise really that in the 1990s , a glut of 'Die Hard on a ..... ' movie cashed in on the wrong guy , wrong place , wrong time concept . That is what they did with Cliffhanger , Die Hard on a mountain just in time to rescue Sly 'Stop or My Mom Will Shoot ' Stallone 's career . Cliffhanger is one big nit-pickers dream , especially to those who are expert at mountain climbing , base-jumping , aviation , facial expression , acting skill . All in all it 's full of excuse to dismiss the film a one overblown pile of junk . Stallone even managed to get out-acted by a horse ! However , if you an forget all the nonsense , it 's actually a very lovable and undeniably entertaining romp that delivers a plenty of thrill , and unintentionally , plenty of laugh . You 've got to love John Lithgows sneery evilness , his tick every box band of baddie , and best of all , the permanently harassed and hapless 'turncoat ' agent , Rex Linn a Travers . He may of been Henry in 'Portrait of a Serial Killer ' but Michael Rooker is noteworthy for a cringe-worthy performance a Hal , he insists on constantly shrieking in painful disbelief at his captor 'that man never hurt anybody ' And whilst he surely ca n't be , it really doe look like Ralph Waite 's Frank character is grinning a the girl plummet to her death . Mention too must go to former 'London 's Burning ' actor Craig Fairbrass a the Brit bad guy , who come a cropper whilst using Hal a a Human Football , yes , you ca n't help enjoy that bit , Hal needed a good kicking . So forget your better judgement , who care if 'that could never happen ' , lower your acting expectation , turn up the volume and enjoy ! And if you 're looking for Qaulen , he 's the one wearing the helicopter .

I had the terrible misfortune of having to view this `` b-movie '' in it 's entirety . All I have to say is -- - save your time and money ! ! ! This ha got to be the worst b-movie of all time , it should n't even be called a b-movie , more like an f-movie ! Because it fails in all aspect that make a good movie : the story is not interesting at all , all of the actor are paper-thin and not at all believable , it ha bad direction and the action sequence are so fake it 's almost funny ....... almost . The movie is just packed full of crappy one-liner that no respectable person could find amusing in the least little bit . This movie is supposed to be geared towards men , but all the woman in it are SO utterly unattractive , especially that old wrinkled thing that come in towards the end . They try to appear sexy in those weird , horrible costume and they fail miserably ! ! ! Even some of the most ridiculous b-movies will still give you some laugh , but this is just too painful to watch ! !

What an absolutely stunning movie , if you have 2.5 hr to kill , watch it , you wo n't regret it , it 's too much fun ! Rajnikanth carry the movie on his shoulder and although there is n't anything more other than him , I still liked it . The music by A.R.Rehman take time to grow on you but after you heard it a few time , you really start liking it .

First of all , let 's get a few thing straight here : a ) I AM an anime fan- always ha been a a matter of fact ( I used to watch Speed Racer all the time in Preschool ) . b ) I DO like several B-Movies because they 're hilarious . c ) I like the Godzilla movies- a lot . Moving on , when the movie first come on , it seems like it 's going to be your usual B-movie , down to the crappy FX , but all a sudden- BOOM ! the anime come on ! This is when the movie go WWWAAAAAYYYYY downhill . The animation is VERY bad & cheap , even worse than what I remember from SPEED RACER , for crissakes ! In fact , it 's so cheap , one of the few scene from the movie I `` vividly '' remember is when a bunch of kid run out of a school ... & it 's the same kid over & over again ! The FX are terrible , too ; the dinosaur look worse than Godzilla . In addition , the transition to live action to animation is unorganized , the dialogue & voice ( especially the English dub that I viewed ) wa horrid & I wa begging my dad to take the tape out of the DVD/ VHS player ; The only thing that kept me surviving wa cracking out joke & comment like the robot & Joel/Mike on MST3K ( you pick the season ) . Honestly , this is the only way to barely enjoy this movie & survive it at the same time . Heck , I 'm planning to show this to another fellow otaku pal of mine on Halloween for a B-Movie night . Because it 's stupid , pretty painful to watch & unintentionally hilarious at the same time , I 'm giving this movie a 3/10 , an improvement from the 0.5/10 I wa originally going to give it . ( According to my grading scale : 3/10 mean Pretty much both boring & bad . As fun a counting to three unless you find a way to make fun of it , then it will become a fun a counting to 15 . )

This wa the worst movie I saw at WorldFest and it also received the least amount of applause afterwards ! I can only think it is receiving such recognition based on the amount of known actor in the film . It 's great to see J.Beals but she 's only in the movie for a few minute . M.Parker is a much better actress than the part allowed for . The rest of the acting is hard to judge because the movie is so ridiculous and predictable . The main character is totally unsympathetic and therefore a bore to watch . There is no real emotional depth to the story . A movie revolving about an actor who ca n't get work doe n't feel very original to me . Nor doe the development of the cop . It feel like one of many straight-to-video movie I saw back in the 90 ... And not even a good one in those standard .

The Karen Carpenter Story show a little more about singer Karen Carpenter 's complex life . Though it fails in giving accurate fact , and detail . Cynthia Gibb ( portrays Karen ) wa not a fine election . She is a good actress , but play a very naive and sort of dumb Karen Carpenter . I think that the role needed a stronger character . Someone with a stronger personality . Louise Fletcher role a Agnes Carpenter is terrific , she doe a great job a Karen 's mother . It ha great song , which could have been included in a soundtrack album . Unfortunately they were n't , though this movie wa on the top of the rating in USA and other several country

`` The Cell '' is an exotic masterpiece , a dizzying trip into not only the vast mind of a serial killer , but also into one of a very talented director . This is conclusive evidence of what can be achieved if human being unleash their uninhibited imagination . This is boldness at work , pushing aside thought to fall into formula and cliche and creating something truly magnificent . This is the best movie of the year to date . I 've read numerous complaint about this film , anywhere from all style and no substance to poorly cast character and bad acting . To negatively criticize this film is to miss the point . This movie may be a landmark , a tradition where future movie will hopefully follow . `` The Cell '' ha just opened the door to another world of imagination . So can we slam the door in it face and tell it and it director Tarsem Singh that we do n't want any more ? Personally , I would more than welcome another movie by Tarsem , and would love to see someone try to challenge him . We 've all heard talk about going inside the mind of a serial killer , and yes , I do agree that the `` genre '' is a bit overworked . The 90 were full of movie trying to depict what make serial killer tick ; some of them worked , but most failed . But `` The Cell '' doe not blaze down the same trail , we are given a new twist , we are physically transported into the mind and presented with nothing le than a fascinating journey of the most mysterious subject matter ever studied . I like how the movie doe not bog u down with too much scientific jargon trying to explain how Jennifer Lopez actually get to enter the brain of another . Instead , she just lie down on a laboratory table and is wrapped with what look like really long Twizzlers and jaunted into another entity . `` The Cell '' want to let you `` see '' what it 's all about and not `` how '' it 's all about , and I guess that 's what some people do n't like . True , I do like explanation with my movie , but when a movie venture onto new ground you must let it do what it desire and simply take it in . I noticed how the film wa very dark when it showed reality , maybe to contrast the bright visuals when inside the brain of another . Nonetheless , the set design wa simply astonishing . I would n't be surprised if this film took home a few Oscars in cinematography , best costume , best director and the like . If it were up to me it 'd at least get nominated for best picture . I 've noticed that I 've kind of been repeating myself . Not because there 's nothing else to say , but because I ca n't stress enough how fantastic I thought `` The Cell '' wa . If you walk into the movie with a very open mind and to have it taken over with wonder and an eye-popping feast then you are assured a good time . I guess this film wa just a little too much for some people , writing it off a `` weird '' or `` crazy '' . I am very much into psychology and the imagination of the human mind , so it wa right down my alley . Leaving the theater , I heard one audience member say `` Whoever made that movie sure did a lot of good drug . '' If so , I want what he wa smoking . * * * * ( out of 4 )

This film tried to be too many thing all at once : stinging political satire , Hollywood blockbuster , sappy romantic comedy , family value promo ... the list go on and on . It failed miserably at all of them , but there wa enough interest to keep me from turning it off until the end . Although I appreciate the spirit behind WAR , INC. , it depresses me to see such a clumsy effort , especially when it will be taken by it target to reflect the lack of the existence of a serious critique , rather than simply the poor writing , direction , and production of this particular film . There is a critique to be made about the corporatization of war . But poking fun at it in this way diminishes the true atrocity of what is happening . Reminds me a bit of THREE KINGS , which similarly trivializes a genuine cause for concern .

This movie wa so frustrating . Everything seemed energetic and I wa totally prepared to have a good time . I at least thought I 'd be able to stand it . But , I wa wrong . First , the weird looping ? It wa like watching `` America 's Funniest Home Videos '' . The damn parent . I hated them so much . The stereo-typical Latino family ? I need to speak with the person responsible for this . We need to have a talk . That little girl who wa always hanging on someone ? I just hated her and had to mention it . Now , the final scene transcends , I must say . It 's so gloriously bad and full of badness that it is a movie of it own . What crappy dancing . Horrible and beautiful at once .

'War movie ' is a Hollywood genre that ha been done and redone so many time that clichéd dialogue , rehashed plot and over-the-top action sequence seem unavoidable for any conflict dealing with large-scale combat . Once in a while , however , a war movie come along that go against the grain and brings a truly original and compelling story to life on the silver screen . The Civil War-era `` Cold Mountain , '' starring Jude Law , Nicole Kidman and Renée Zellweger is such a film . Then again , calling Cold Mountain '' a war movie is not entirely accurate . True enough , the film open with a ( quite literally ) quick-and-dirty battle sequence that put `` Glory '' director Edward Zwick shame . However , `` Cold Mountain '' is not so much about the Civil War itself a it is about the period and the people of the time . The story center around disgruntled Confederate soldier Inman , played by Jude Law , who becomes disgusted with the gruesome war and homesick for the beautiful hamlet of Cold Mountain , North Carolina and the equally beautiful southern belle he left behind , Ada Monroe , played by Nicole Kidman . At first glance , this setup appears formulaic a the romantic interest back home give the audience enough sympathy to root for the reluctant soldier 's tribulation on the battlefield . Indeed , the earlier segment of the film are relatively unimpressive and even somewhat contrived . `` Cold Mountain '' soon take a drastic turn , though , a the intrepid hero Inman turn out to be a deserter ( incidentally saving the audience from the potentially confusing scenario of wanting to root for the Confederates ) and begin a long odyssey homeward . Meanwhile , back at the farm , Ada 's cultured way prove of little use in the field ; soon she is transformed into something of a wilderbeast . Coming to Ada 's rescue is the course , tough-as-nails Ruby Thewes , played by Renée Zellweger , who help Ada put the farm back together and , perhaps more importantly , cope with the loneliness and isolation the war seems to have brought upon Ada . Within these two setting , a vivid , compelling and , at time , very disturbing portrait of the war-torn South unfolds . The character with whom Inman and Ada interact are surprisingly complex , enhanced by wonderful performance of Brendan Gleeson a Ruby 's deadbeat father , Ray Winstone a an unrepentant southern `` lawman , '' and Natalie Portman a a deeply troubled and isolated young mother . All have been greatly affected and changed by `` the war of Northern aggression , '' mostly for the worse . The dark , pervading anti-war message , accented by an effective , haunting score and chillingly beautiful shot of Virginia and North Carolina , is communicated to the audience not so much by gruesome battle scene a by the scarred land and traumatized people for which the war wa fought . Though the weapon and tactic of war itself have changed much in the past century , it 's hellish effect on the land is timelessly relevant . Director Anthony Minghella manages to maintain this gloomy mood for most of the film , but the atmosphere is unfortunately denigrated by a rather tepid climax that doe little justice to the wonderfully formed character . The love story between Inman and Ada is awkwardly tacked onto the beginning and end of the film , though the inherently distant , abstracted and even absurd nature of their relationship in a way fit the dismal nature of the rest of the plot . Make no mistake , `` Cold Mountain '' ha neither the trait of a feel-good romance nor an inspiring war drama . It is a unique vision of an era that is sure not only to entertain but also to truly absorb the audience into the life of a people torn apart by a war and entirely desperate to be rid of it terrible repercussion altogether .

Taut and organically gripping , Edward Dmytryk 's Crossfire is a distinctive suspense thriller , an unlikely `` message '' movie using the look and device of the noir cycle . Bivouacked in Washington , DC , a company of soldier cope with their restlessness by hanging out in bar . Three of them end up at a stranger 's apartment where Robert Ryan , drunk and belligerent , beat their host ( Sam Levene ) to death because he happens to be Jewish . Police detective Robert Young investigates with the help of Robert Mitchum , who 's assigned to Ryan 's outfit . Suspicion fall on the second of the three ( George Cooper ) , who ha vanished . Ryan slays the third buddy ( Steve Brodie ) to insure his silence before Young close in . Abetted by a superior script by John Paxton , Dmytryk draw precise performance from his three starring Bobs . Ryan , naturally , doe his prototypical Angry White Male ( and to the hilt ) , while Mitchum underplays with his characteristic alert nonchalance ( his role , however , is not central ) ; Young may never have been better . Gloria Grahame give her first fully-fledged rendition of the smart-mouthed , vulnerable tramp , and , a a sad sack who 's leeched into her life , Paul Kelly haunt u in a small , peripheral role that he make memorable . The politically engaged Dmytryk perhaps inevitably succumbs to sermonizing , but it 's pretty much confined to Young 's reminiscence of how his Irish grandfather died at the hand of bigot a century earlier ( thus , incidentally , stretching chronology to the limit ) . At least there 's no attempt to render an explanation , however glib , of why Ryan hate Jews ( and hillbilly and ... ) . Curiously , Crossfire survives even the major change wrought upon it -- the novel it 's based on ( Richard Brooks ' The Brick Foxhole ) dealt with a gay-bashing murder . But homosexuality in 1947 wa still Beyond The Pale . News of the Holocaust had , however , begun to emerge from the ash of Europe , so Hollywood felt emboldened to register it protest against anti-Semitism ( the studio always quaked at the prospect of offending any potential ticket buyer ) . But while the change from homophobia to anti-Semitism work in general , the specific do n't fit so smoothly . The victim 's chatting up a lonesome , drunk young soldier then inviting him back home look odd , even though ( or especially since ) there 's a girlfriend in tow . It raise the question whether this scenario wa retained inadvertently or left in a a discreet tip-off to the original engine generating Ryan 's murderous rage .

`` Ardh Satya '' is one of the finest film ever made in Indian Cinema . Directed by the great director Govind Nihalani , this one is the most successful Hard Hitting Parallel Cinema which also turned out to be a Commercial Success . Even today , Ardh Satya is an inspiration for all leading director of India . The film tell the Real-life Scenario of Mumbai Police of the 70 . Unlike any Police of other city in India , Mumbai Police encompasses a Different system altogether . Govind Nihalani creates a very practical Outlay with real life approach of Mumbai Police Environment . Amongst various Police officer & colleague , the film describes the story of Anand Velankar , a young hot-blooded Cop coming from a poor family . His father is a harsh Police Constable . Anand himself suffers from his father 's ideology & incidence of his father 's Atrocities on his mother . Anand 's approach towards immediate action against crime , is an inert craving for his own Job satisfaction . The film is here revolved in a Plot wherein Anand 's constant effort against crime are trampled by his seniors.This lead to frustration , a he can not achieve the desired Job-satisfaction . Resulting from the frustration , his anger is expressed in excessive violence in the remand room & bar , also turning him to an alcoholic . The Spirit within him is still alive , a he constantly fight the system . He is aware of the system of the Metro , where the Police & Politicians are a inertly associated by far end . His compromise towards unethical practice is negative . Finally he get suspended . The Direction is a master piece & thoroughly hard core . One of the best memorable scene is when Anand break in the Underworld gangster Rama Shetty 's house to arrest him , followed by short conversation which is fantastic . At many scene , the film ha Hair-raising moment . The Practical approach of Script is a major Punch . Alcoholism , Corruption , Political Influence , Courage , Deceptions all are integral part of Mumbai police even today . Those aspect are dealt brilliantly . Finally , the film belongs to the One man show , Om Puri portraying Anand Velankar traversing through all his emotion absolutely brilliantly .

My first exposure to the Templarios & not a good one . I wa excited to find this title among the offering from Anchor Bay Video , which ha brought u other cult classic such a `` Spider Baby '' . The print quality is excellent , but this alone ca n't hide the fact that the film is deadly dull . There 's a thrilling opening sequence in which the villager exact a terrible revenge on the Templars ( & set the whole thing in motion ) , but everything else in the movie is slow , ponderous & , ultimately , unfulfilling . Adding insult to injury : the movie wa dubbed , not subtitled , a promised on the video jacket .

One of the most significant quote from the entire film is pronounced halfway through by the protagonist , the mafia middle-man Titta Di Girolamo , a physically non-descript , middle-aged man originally from Salerno in Southern Italy . When we 're introduced to him at the start of the film , he 's been living a non-life in an elegant but sterile hotel in the Italian-speaking Canton of Switzerland for the last ten year , conducting a business we are only gradually introduced to . While this pivotal yet apparently unremarkable scene take place employee of the the Swiss bank who normally count Di Girolamo 's cash tell him that 10,000 dollar are missing from his usual suitcase full of tightly stacked banknote . At the news , he quietly but icily threatens his coaxing bank manager of wanting to close down his account . Meanwhile he tell u , the spectator , that when you bluff , you have to bluff right through to the end without fear of being caught out or appearing ridiculous . He say : you ca n't bluff for a while and then halfway through , tell the truth . Having eventually done this - bluffed only halfway through and told the truth , and having accepted the consequence of life and ultimately , love - is exactly the reason behind the beginning of Titta Di Girolamo 's trouble . This initially unsympathetic character , a scowling , taciturn , curt man on the verge of 50 , a man who wo n't even reply in kind to chambermaid and waitress who say hello and goodbye , becomes at one point someone the spectator care deeply about . At one point in his non-life , Titta decides to feel concern about appearing `` ridiculous '' . The first half of the film may be described a `` slow '' by some . It doe indeed reveal Di Girolamo 's day and night in that hotel at an oddly disjoined , deliberate pace , revealing seemingly mundane and irrelevant detail . However , scene that may have seemed unnecessary reveal just how essential they are a this masterfully constructed and innovative film unfolds before your eye . The existence of Titta Di Girolamo - the man with no imagination , identity or life , the unsympathetic character you unexpectedly end up loving and feeling for when you least thought you would - is also conveyed with elegantly edited sequence and very interesting use of music ( one theme by the Scottish band Boards of Canada especially stood out ) . Never wa the contrast between the way Hollywood and Italy treat mobster more at odds than since the release of film such a Le Conseguenze dell'Amore or L'Imbalsamatore . Another interesting element wa the way in which the film made use of the protagonist 's insomnia . Not unlike The Machinist ( and in a far more explicit way , the Al Pacino film Insomnia ) , Le Conseguenze dell'Amore us this condition to symbolise a deeper emotional malaise that 's been rammed so deep into the obscurity of the unconscious , it 's almost impossible to pin-point it cause ( if indeed there is one ) . The young and sympathetic hotel waitress Sofia ( played by Olivia Magnani , grand-daughter of the legendary Anna ) and the memory of Titta 's best friend , a man whom he ha n't seen in 20 year , unexpectedly provide a tiny window onto life that Titta eventually ( though tentatively at first ) accepts to look through again . Though it 's never explicitly spelt out , the spectator KNOWS that to a man like Titta , accepting The Consequences of Love will have unimaginable consequence . A film without a single scene of sex or violence , a film that unfolds in it own time and concedes nothing to the spectator 's expectation , Le Conseguenze dell'Amore is a fine representative of that small , quiet , discreet Renaissance that ha been taking place in Italian cinema since the decline of Cinecittà during the second half of the 70 . The world is waiting for Italy to produce more Il Postino-like fare , more La Vita è Bella-style film ... neglecting to explore fine creation like Le Conseguenze dell'Amore , L'Imbalsamatore and others . Your loss , world .

I watched this film not really expecting much , I got it in a pack of 5 film , all of which were pretty terrible in their own way for under a fiver so what could I expect ? and you know what I wa right , they were all terrible , this movie ha a few ( and a few is stretching it ) interesting point , the occasional camcorder view is a nice touch , the drummer is very like a drummer , i.e damned annoying and , well thats about it actually , the problem is that it just so boring , in what I can only assume wa an attempt to build tension , a whole lot of nothing happens and when it doe it utterly tedious ( I had my thumb on the fast forward button , ready to press for most of the movie , but gave it a go ) and seriously is the lead singer of the band that great looking , coz they do n't half mention how beautiful he is a hell of a lot , I thought he looked a bit like a meercat , all this and I have n't even mentioned the killer , I 'm not even gon na go into it , it just not worth explaining . Anyway a far a I 'm concerned Star and London are just about the only reason to watch this and with the exception of London ( who wa actually quite funny ) it wa n't because of their acting talent , I 've certainly seen a lot worse , but I 've also seen a lot better . Best avoid unless your bored of watching paint dry .

I bought this film at Blockbuster for $ 3.00 , because it sounded interesting ( a bit Ranma-esque , with the idea of someone dragging around a skeleton ) , because there wa a cute girl in a mini-skirt on the back , and because there wa a Restricted Viewing sticker on it . I thought it wa going to be a sweet or at least sincere coming of age story with a weird indie edge . I wa 100 % wrong . Having watched it , I have to wonder how it got the restricted sticker , since there is hardly any foul language , little violence , and the closest thing to nudity ( Honestly ! I do n't usually go around hoping for it ! ) is when the girl is in her nightgown and you see her panty ( you see her panty a lot in this movie , because no matter what , she 's wearing a miniskirt of some sort ) . Even the anti-religious humor is tame ( and lame , caricatured , insincere , derivative , unoriginal , and worst of all not funny in the slightest -- it would be better just to listen to Ray Stevens ' `` Would Jesus Wear a Rolex on His Television Show '' ) . This would barely qualify a PG-13 ( it is Not Rated ) , but Blockbuster refuse to let anyone under the age of 17 rent this -- a if it wa pornographic . Any little kid could go in there and rent the edited version of Requiem for a Dream , but they insist that Zack and Reba is worse . It is , but not in that way . In a way , this worry me -- the only thing left that could offend people is the idea of the suicide at the beginning . If anybody need to see movie with honestly portrayed suicide ( not this one , but better one like The Virgin Suicides ) , it 's teenager . If both of those movie were rated R purely because of the suicide aspect , then I have little chance of turning a story I 've been writing into a PG-13 movie ( the main character are eleven and a half and twelve ) . Suicide is one of the top three leading cause of death in teenager ( I think it 's number 2 ) , so chance are that most teen have been or will be affected by it . Just say no to this movie , though . 2/10 .

The plot is about the death of little child . Hopper is the one who ha to investigate the killing . During the movie it appears that he ha some trouble with his daughter . In the end the serial killer get caught . That 's it . But before you find out who dunnit , you have to see some terrible acting by all of the actor . It is unbelievable how bad these actor are , including Hopper . I could go on like this but that to much of a waste of my time . Just do n't watch the movie . I 've warned you .

Ever watched a movie that lost the plot ? Well , this did n't even really have one to begin with . Where to begin ? The achingly tedious scene of our heroine sitting around the house with actually no sense of menace or even foreboding created even during the apparently constant thunderstorm ( that are strangely never actually heard in the house-great double glazing ) ? The house that is apparently only a few mile from a town yet is several hour walk away ( ? ) or the third girl who serf no purpose to the plot except to provide a surprisingly quick gory murder just a the tedium becomes unbearable ? Or even the beginning which suggests a spate of 20+ killing throughout the area even though it is apparent the killer never venture far from the house ? Or the bizarre ritual with the salt & pepper that pretty much sum up most of the film inherent lack of direction . Add a lead actress who ca n't act but at least is willing to do some completely irrelevant nude shower scene and this video is truly nasty , but not in the way you hope . Given a following simply for being banned in the UK in the 80 's ( mostly because of a final surprisingly over extended murder ) it offer nothing but curiosity value- and one classic 'daft ' murder ( do n't worry-its telegraphed at least ten minute before ) . After a walk in the wood our victim come to a rather steep upward slope which they obviously struggle up . Halfway through they see a figure at the top dressed in black and brandishing a large scythe . What do they do ? Slide down and run like the rest of u ? No , of course not- they struggle to the top and stand conveniently nice and upright in front of the murder weapon . It really IS only a movie a they say ..

Okay , so this series kind of take the route of 'here we go again ! ' Week in , week out David Morse 's character help out his ride who is in a bit of a pickle - but what 's wrong with that ! ? David Morse is one of the greatest character actor out there , and certainly the coolest , and to have him in a series created by David Koepp - a great writer - is heaven ! ! Due to the lack of love for this show by many , I ca n't see it going to a season series - but you never know ? The amount of rubbish that ha made it beyond that baffle me - let 's hope something good can make it past a first series ! ! !

After sitting through this pile of dung , my husband and I wondered whether it wa actually the product of an experiment to see whether a computer program could produce a movie . It wa that listless and formulaic . But the U.S. propaganda thrown in your face throughout the film prof -- disappointingly -- that it 's the work of human . Call me a conspiracy theorist , but quote like , `` We have to steal the Declaration of Independence to protect it '' seem like way to justify action like the invasion of Iraq , etc . The fact that Nicholas Cage spews line like , `` I would never use the Declaration of Independence a a bargaining chip '' with a straight face made me and my husband wonder whether the entire cast took Valium before shooting each scene . The `` reasoning '' behind each plot turn and new `` clue '' is truly ridiculous and impossible to follow . And there 's also a bonus side plot of misogyny , with Dr. Whatever-Her-Name-Was being chided by all involved for `` never shutting up . '' She 's clearly in the movie only for look , but they felt the need to slap a `` Dr. '' title on her character to give her some gravity . At one point , Cage 's character say , `` Do n't you ever shut up ? '' and the camera pan to her looking poutily down at her hand , like she 's a child . Truly grotesque . The only benefit to this movie wa that it 's so astonishingly bad , you do get a few laugh out of it . The really scary thing is that a majority of the people watching the movie with u seemed to enjoy it . Creepy ....

It had all the clichés of movie of this type and no substance . The plot went nowhere and at the end of the movie I felt like a sucker for watching it . The production wa good ; however , the script and acting were B-movie quality . The casting wa poor because there were good actor mixed in with crumby actor . The good actor did n't hold their own nor did they lift up the others . This movie is not worthy of more word , but I will say more to meet the minimum requirement of ten line . James Wood and Cuba Gooding , Jr. play caricature of themselves in other movie . If you are looking for mindless entertainment , I still would n't recommend this movie .

This movie is based on the book , `` A Many Splendored Thing '' by Han Suyin and tackle issue of race relation between Asians and Whites , a topic that come from Han 's personal experience a an Eurasian growing up in China . That background , and the beautiful Hong Kong setting , give this love story a unique and rather daring atmosphere for it time . Other than that , the story is a stereotypical romance with a memorable song that is perhaps more remembered than the movie itself . The beautiful Jennifer Jones look the part and give a wonderful , Oscar nominated performance a a doctor of mixed breed during the advent of Communism in mainland China . William Holden never looked better playing a romantic lead a a journalist covering war torn region in the world . The acting is top notch , and the chemistry between the two lover provides for some genuine moment of silver screen affection sure to melt the heart of those who are romantically inclined . The cinematography really brings out fifty 's Hong Kong , especially the hilltop overlooking the harbor where the two lover spend their most intimate moment . The ending is a real tear-jerker . Some may consider sentimental romance passé , but , for those who enjoy classic Hollywood love story , this is a shining example .

Of all the film I have seen , this one , The Rage , ha got to be one of the worst yet . The direction , LOGIC , continuity , change in plot-script and dialog made me cry out in pain . `` How could ANYONE come up with something so crappy '' ? Gary Busey is know for his `` B '' movie , but this is a sure `` W '' movie . ( W=waste ) . Take for example : about two dozen FBI & local law officer surround a trailer house with a jeep wagoneer . Inside the jeep is MA and is `` confused '' a to why all the cop are about . Within second a huge gun battle ensues , MA being killed straight off . The cop blast away at the jeep with gary and company blasting away at them . The cop fall like domino and the jeep with Gary drive around in circle and are not hit by one single bullet/pellet . MA is killed and gary seems to not to have noticed-damn that guy is tough . Truly a miracle , not since the six-shooter held 300 bullet ha there been such a miracle .

I had heard good thing about `` States of Grace '' and came in with an open mind . I thought that `` God 's Army '' wa okay , and I thought that maybe Dutcher had improved and matured a a filmmaker . The film began with some shaky acting , and I thought , `` well , maybe it will get better . '' Unfortunately , it never did . The picture start out by introducing two elder -- Mormon missionary -- and it seems that the audience will get to know them and grow to care about them . Instead , the story degenerate into a highly improbable series of unfortunate event highlighting blatant disobedience by the missionary ( something that undeniably exists , but rarely on the level that Dutcher portrays ) and it becomes almost laughable . Dutcher 's only success in this movie is his successful alienation of his target audience . By unrealistically and inaccurately portraying the life of Mormon missionary , Dutcher accomplishes nothing more than angering his predominantly Mormon audience . The film in no way reflects reality . Missions are nothing like what Dutcher show ( having served a Mormon mission myself I can attest to this fact ) and gang life in California certainly contains much more explicit language than the occasional mild vulgarity . The conclusion , which I 'm assuming wa supposed to touch the audience and inspire them to believe that forgiveness is available to all , wa both unbelievable ( c'mon , the entire mission gather to see this elder sent home -- and the mom and the girl are standing right next to each other ! ) and cheesy . Next time , Dutcher , try making a movie that SOMEONE can identify with .

This movie struck home for me . Being 29 , I remember the '80 's and my father working in a factory . I figured , if I worked hard too , if I had pride and never gave up I too could have the American Dream , the house , a few kid , a car all to call my own . I 've noted however , without a degree in something ( unlike my father that quit at ninth grade ) and a keen sense of greed and laziness , you ca n't get anywhere . I would like to know if anyone ha this movie on DVD or VHS . it 's made for TV , and I just saw it an hour ago . Ic a n't find it anywhere ! I 'd love to show this to my friend , my pseudo friend , family and other relative , see what they think and remind them that once upon a time , Americans WOULD work for the sake of feeling honor and that we had pride in what we accomplished ! ! I think the feeling is still there , but in a heavy downward spiral with so many thing being made overseas ...

As a disclaimer , I 've seen the movie 5-6 time in the last 15 year , and I only just saw the musical this week . This allowed me to judge the movie without being tainted by what wa or wa n't in the musical ( however , it tainted me when I watched the musical : ) ) I actually believe Michael Douglas worked quite well in that role , along with Kasey . I think her 'Let me dance for you scene ' is one of the best part of the movie , a worthwhile addition compared to the musical . The dancer and singing in the movie are much superior to the musical , a well a the cast which is at least 10 time bigger ( easier to do in the movie of course ) . The decor , lighting , dancing , and singing are also much superior in the movie , which should be expected , and wa indeed delivered . The song that were in common with the musical are better done in the movie , the new one are quite good one , and the whole movie just delivers more than the musical in my opinion , especially compared to a musical which ha few decor . The one bad point on the movie is the obvious cut between the actor talking , and dubbed singer during the singing portion for some of the character , but their dancing is impeccable , and the end product wa more enjoyable than the musical

Protocol is an implausible movie whose only saving grace is that it star Goldie Hawn along with a good cast of supporting actor . The story revolves around a ditzy cocktail waitress who becomes famous after inadvertently saving the life of an Arab dignitary . The story go downhill halfway through the movie and Goldie 's charm just doe n't save this movie . Unless you are a Goldie Hawn fan do n't go out of your way to see this film .

How this film could be classified a Drama , I have no idea . If I were John Voight and Mary Steenburgen , I would be trying to erase this from my CV . It wa a historically accurate a Xena and Hercules . Abraham and Moses got melded into Noah . Lot , Abraham 's nephew , Lot , turn up thousand of year before he would have been born . Canaanites wandered the earth ... really ? What were the scriptwriter thinking ? Was it just ignorance ( `` I remember something about Noah and animal , and Lot and Canaanites and all that stuff from Sunday School '' ) or were they trying to offend the maximum number of people on the planet a possible- from Christians , Jews and Muslims , to historian , archaeologist , geologist , psychologist , linguist ... a a matter of fact , did anyone not get offended ? Anyone who had even a modicum of taste would have winced at this one !

Preston Sturgis ' THE POWER AND THE GLORY wa unseen by the public for nearly twenty or thirty year until the late 1990s when it resurfaced and even showed up on television . In the meantime it had gained in notoriety because Pauline Kael 's THE CITIZEN KANE BOOK had suggested that the Herman Mankiewicz - Orson Welles screenplay for KANE wa based on Sturgis ' screenplay here . As is mentioned in the beginning of this thread for the film on the IMDb web site , Kael overstated her case . There are about six narrator who take turn dealing with the life of Charles Foster Kane : the newsreel ( representing Ralston - the Henry Luce clone ) , Thatcher 's memoir , Bernstein , Jed Leland , Susan Alexander Kane , and Raymond the butler . Each ha his or her different slant on Kane , reflecting their faith or disappointment or hatred of the man . And of course each also reveals his or her own failing when they are telling their version of Kane 's story . This method also lead to frequent overlapping re-tellings of the same incident . This is not the situation in THE POWER AND THE GLORY . Yes , like KANE it is about a legendary business leader - here it is Tom Garner ( Spencer Tracy ) , a man who rose from the bottom to being head of the most successful railroad system in the country . But there are only two narrator - they are Garner 's right hand man Henry ( Ralph Morgan ) and his wife ( Sarah Padden ) . This restricts the nearly three dimensional view we get at time of Kane in Garner . Henry , when he narrates , is talking about his bos and friend , whom he respected and loved . His wife is like the voice of the skeptical public - she see only the flaw in Henry . Typical example : Although he worked his way up , Tom becomes more and more anti-labor in his later year . Unions are troublemaker , and he doe not care to be slowed down by their shenanigan . Henry describes Tom 's confrontation with the Union in a major walk-out , and how it preoccupied him to the detriment of his home life . But Henry 's wife reminds him how Tom used scab and violence to end the strike ( apparently blowing up the Union 's headquarters - killing many people ) . So we have two view of the man but one is pure white and one is pure black . I 'm not really knocking THE POWER AND THE GLORY for not duplicating KANE 's success ( few film do - including all of Orson Welles ' other film ) , but I am aware that the story is presented well enough to hold one 's interest to the end . And thanks to the performance of Tracy and Colleen Moore a his wife Sally , the tragedy of the worldly success of the pair is fully brought home . When they marry , Tom want to do well ( in part ) to give his wife and their family the benefit he never had . But in America great business success come at a cost . Tom get deeply involved with running the railroad empire ( he expands it and improves it constantly ) . But it take him away from home too much , and he loses touch with Sally . And he also notice Eve ( Helen Vinson ) , the younger woman who becomes his mistress . When Sally learns of his unfaithful behavior it destroys her . Similarly Tom too get a full shock ( which make him a martyr in the eye of Henry ) . Eve marries Tom , and present him with a son - but it turn out to be Eve 's son by Tom 's son Tom Jr. ( Philip Trent ) . The discovery of this incestuous cuckolding cause Tom to shoot himself . The film is not a total success - the action jump at time unconvincingly . Yet it doe make the business seem real ( note the scene when Tom tell his Board of Directors about his plan to purchase a small rival train line , and he discus the use of debenture for financing the plan ) . Sturgis came from a wealthy background , so he could bring in this type of detail . So on the whole it is a first rate film . No CITIZEN KANE perhaps , but of interest to movie lover a an attempt at business realism with social commentary in Depression America .

Average ( and surprisingly tame ) Fulci giallo which mean it 's still quite bad by normal standard , but redeemed by it solid build-up and some nice touch such a a neat time twist on the issue of vision and clairvoyance . The genre 's well-known weakness are in full gear : banal dialogue , wooden acting , illogical plot point . And the finale go on much too long , while the denouement prof to be a rather lame or shall I say : limp affair . Fulci 's ironic handling of giallo norm is amusing , though . Yellow clue wherever you look . 3 out of 10 limping killer

Return to the 36th Chamber is one of those classic Kung-Fu movie which Shaw produce back in the 70 and 80 , whose genre is equivalent to the spaghetti western of Hollywood , and the protagonist Gordon Liu , the counterpart to the western 's Clint Eastwood . Digitally remastered and a new print made for the Fantastic Film Fest , this is `` Presented in Shaw Scope '' , just like the good old day . This film is a simple story of good versus evil , told in 3 act , which more or le sum up the narrative of martial art film in that era . Act One set up the premise . Workers in a dye-mill of a small village are unhappy with their lot , having their wage cut by 20 % by incoming manchu gangster . They ca n't do much about their exploitation because none of them are martial art skilled to take on the gangster , and their bos . At first they had a minor success in getting Liu to impersonate a highly skilled Shaolin monk ( one of the best comedy sequence ) , but their rouse got exposed when they pushed the limit of credibility by impersonating one too many time . Act Two show the protagonist wanting to get back at the mob . However , without real martial art , he embarks on a journey to Shaolin Temple , to try and infiltrate and learn martial art on the sly . After some slapstick moment , he finally get accepted by the abbot ( whom he impersonated ! ) but is disappointed at the teaching method - kinda like Mr Miyagi 's style in Karate Kid , but instead of painting fence , he get to erect scaffolding all around the temple . Nothing can keep a good man down , and he unwittingly build strength , endurance and learns kung-fu the unorthodox way . Act Three is where the fight fest begin . With cheesy sound effect , each obvious non-contact on film is given the maximum impact treatment . But it is rather refreshing watching the fight scene here , with it wide angled shot to highlight clarity and detail between the sparring partner , and the use of slow-motion only to showcase stunt in different angle . You may find the speed of fight a tad too slow , with some pause in between move , but with Yuen Wo Ping and his style being used ad-nausem in Hollywood flick , they sure do n't make fight scene like they used to ! Return to the 36th chamber get a repeat screening on Monday , so , if you 're game for a nostalgic trip down memory lane , what are you waiting for ?

* * * SPOILERS * * * All too , in real life a well a in the movie , familiar story that happens to many young men who are put in a war zone with a gun , or rifle , in their hand . The case of young and innocent , in never handling or firing a gun , Jimmy Davis , Franchot Tone , ha been repeated thousand of time over the century when men , like Jimmy Davis , are forced to take up arm for their country . Jimmy who at first wanted to be kicked out of the US Army but wa encouraged to stay , by being belted in the mouth , by his good friend Fred P. Willis , Spencer Tracy , ended up on the front line in France . With Jimmy 's unit pinned down by a German machine gun nest he single handedly put it out of commission picking off some half dozen German soldier from the safety of a nearby church steeple . It wa when Jimmy gunned down the last surviving German , who raised his arm in surrender , that an artillery shell hit the steeple seriously wounding him . Recovering from his wound at an Army hospital Jimmy fell in love with US Army volunteer nurse Rose Duffy , Gladys George . Rose wa really in love with Jimmy 's good friend the happy go lucky Fred despite his obnoxious antic towards her . It 's when Fred wa lost during the fighting on the Western Front that Rose , thinking that he wa killed , fell in love and later married Jimmy . When Fred unexpectedly showed up in the French town where Jimmy , now fully recovered from his wound , wa stationed at thing got very sticky for both him and Rose who had already accepted Jimmy 's proposal of marriage to her ! With WWI over and Jimmy marrying Rose left Fred , who 's still in love with her , a bitter and resentful young man . It wa almost by accident that Fred ran into Jimmy on the street of New York City and discovered to his shock and surprise that he completely changed from the meek and non-violent person that he knew before he wa sent to war on the European Western Front . Smug and sure of himself , and his ability to shoot a gun , Jimmy had become a top mobster in New York City 's underworld ! Not only that but a Fred later found out his wife Rose had no idea what Jimmy wa really involved in with Jimmy telling her that he work a a law abiding and inoffensive insurance adjuster . Jimmy 's life of crime came full circle when Rose , after she found out about his secret life , ratted him out to the police to prevent him from executing a `` Valentine Day '' like massacre , with his gang member dressed a cop , of his rival mobster . While on trial Jimmy came to his sens and admitted his guilt willing to face the music and then , after his three year sentence is up , get his life back together . * * * SPOILER ALERT * * * Hearing rumor from fellow convict that Rose and his best friend Fred were having an affair behind his back Jimmy broke out of prison ending up a fugitive from the law . It 's at Fred 's circus , where he work a both manger and barker , that Jimmy in seeing that Rose a well a Fred were true to him that he , like at his trial , had a sudden change of heart . But the thought of going back to prison , with at least another ten year added on to his sentence , wa just too much for Jimmy ! It wa then that Jimmy decided to end it all by letting the police who by then tracked him down do the job , that he himself did n't have the heart to do , for him !

Bela Lugosi appeared in several of these low budget chiller for Monogram Studios in the 1940 's and The Corpse Vanishes is one of the better one . Bela play a mad scientist who kidnaps young bride and kill them and then extract fluid from their body so he can keep his ageing wife looking young . After a reporter and a doctor stay the night at his home and discover he is responsible for the bride ' death , the following morning they report these murder to the police and the mad scientist is shot and drop dead shortly afterwards . You have got almost everything in this movie : the scientist 's assistant consist of an old hag , a hunchback and dwarf ( her son ) , a thunderstorm and spooky passage in Bela 's house . Bela and his wife find they sleep better in coffin rather than bed in the movie . The Corpse Vanishes is worth a look , especially for Bela Lugosi fan . Great fun . Rating : 3 star out of 5 .

As someone ha already mentioned on this board , it 's very difficult to make a fake documentary . It requires tremendous skill , pacing , patience , directorial 'distance , ' a plausible premise , a narrative 'flow , ' and REALLY believable acting ( aka GREAT acting ) . Such is not the case with 'Love Machine ' . It start to show it faux hand about the 20-minute mark ( with 60 minute left to watch ) , and the viewer start to realize that he or she is being taken in . It 's downhill from there . Director Gordon Eriksen simply peaked too soon . But to be fair to Eriksen , his problem started early : a he explains in the extra , he began wanting to do a REAL doc , could n't get funding , and settled for a cheaper way of making his film . The premise -- people who have secret life by posting themselves on a porn website -- wa perhaps more interesting in 1997-98 , when the film wa made . Eriksen doe a lot of tricky stuff -- a pushy 'host , ' hand-held camera , zoom , grainy black and white -- all , I guess , to elicit a sense of authenticity , but it just doe n't work . The film is confusing and forced , but what ultimately brings it down is the believability of the actor and the pretty awful dialogue .

The Hills Have Eyes II is what you would expect it to be and nothing more . Of course it 's not going to be an Oscar nominated film , it 's just pure entertainment which you can just lose yourself in for 90 minute . The plot is basically about a group of National Guard trainee who find themselves battling against the notorious mutated hillbilly on their last day of training in the desert . It 's just them fighting back throughout the whole film , which includes a lot of violence ( which is basically the whole film ) a blood and gut are constantly flying around throughout the whole thing , and also yet another graphic rape scene which is pointlessly thrown in to shock the audience . I 'd give the Hills Have Eyes II 4 out of 10 for pure entertainment , and that only . Although even then I found myself looking at my watch more and more a the film went on , a it began to drag due to the fact it continued to try and shock the audience with graphic gore and the occasional jump scene just to make sure the audience stay awake . The Hills Have Eyes II is just decent entertainment , something to pas time if you 're bored , and nothing else . 4/10

NO SPOILERS ! ! After Hitchcock 's successful first American film , Rebecca based upon Daphne DuMarier 's lush novel of gothic romance and intrigue , he returned to some of the more familiar theme of his early British period - mistaken identity and espionage . As the U.S. settled into World War II and the large scale 'war effort ' of civilian building plane , weaponry and other necessary militia , the booming film entertainment business began turning out paranoid and often jingoistic thriller with war time theme . These thriller often involved network of deceptive and skilled operator at work in the shadow among the good , law abiding citizen . Knowing the director wa at home in this espionage genre , producer Jack Skirball approached Hitchcock about directing a property he owned that dealt with corruption , war-time sabotage and a helpless hero thrust into a vortex of coincidence and mistaken identity . The darker element of the narrative and the sharp wit of literary maven Dorothy Parker ( during her brief stint in Hollywood before returning to her bohemian root in NYC ) who co-authored the script were a perfect match for Hitchcock 's sensibility . This often neglected film tell the story of the unfortunate 25 year old Barry Kane ( Robert Cummings ) who , while at work at a Los Angeles Airplane Factory , meet new employee Frank Frye ( Norman Lloydd ) and moment later is framed for committing sabotage . Fleeing the authority who do n't believe his far-fetched story he meet several character on his way to Soda City Utah and finally New York City . These memorable character include a circus caravan with a car full of helpful 'freaks ' and a popular billboard model Patricia Martin ( Priscilla Lane ) who , during the worst crisis of his life a well a national security , he fall madly in love with ! Of course in the land of Hitchcock , Patricia , kidnapped by the supposed saboteur Barry , fall for her captor thus adding romantic tension to the mix . In good form for this outing , Hitchcock brew a national network of demure old lady , average Joes , and respectable businessmen who double a secret agent terrorist that harbor criminal , pull gun and detonate bomb to keep thing moving . It 's a terrific plot that take it time moving forward and once ignited , culminates in one of Hitchcock 's more memorable finale . Look for incredibly life like NYC tourist attraction ( all of which were recreated by art director in Hollywood due to the war-time 'shooting ban ' on public attraction ) . While Saboteur may not be one of Hitchcock 's most well known film , it 's a popular b-movie that is certainly solid and engaging with plenty of clever plot twist and a usual - terrific Hitchcock villain . Remember to look for Hitchcock 's cameo appearance outside a drug store in the second half of the film . Hitchcock 's original cameo idea that wa shot ( him fighting in sign language with his 'deaf ' wife ) wa axed by the Bureau of Standards and Practices who were afraid of offending the deaf !

I just watched The Dresser this evening , having only seen it once before , about a dozen year ago . It 's not a `` big '' movie , and doe n't try to make a big splash , but my God , the brilliance of the two lead leaf me just about speechless . Albert Finney and Tom Courtenay are nothing le than amazing in this movie . The Dresser is the story of Sir , an aging Shakespearean actor ( Finney ) , and his dresser Norman ( Courtenay ) , sort of a valet , putting on a production of King Lear during the blitz of London in World War II . These are two men , each dependent upon the other : Sir is almost helpless without the aid of Norman to cajole , wheedle , and bully him into getting onstage for his 227th performance of Lear . And Norman life his life vicariously through Sir ; without Sir to need him , he is nothing , or think he is , anyway . This is a character-driven film ; the plot is secondary to the interaction of the character , and a such , it requires actor of the highest caliber to bring it to life . Finney , only 47 year old , is completely believable a a very old , very sick , petulant , bullying , but brilliant stage actor . He hiss and fume at his fellow actor even when they 're taking their bow ! And Courtenay is no le convincing a the mincing dresser , who must sometimes act more a a mother than a a valet to his elderly employer . Employer is really the wrong term to use , though . For although , technically their relationship is that of employer and employee , most of the time Sir and Norman act like nothing so much a an old married couple . Yes , there are others in the cast of this movie , but there is no question that the true star are Finney , Courtenay , and the marvelous script by Ronald Harwood . That is not to say that there are n't other fine performance , most notably Eileen Atkins a the long-suffering stage manager Madge . There is a wonderful scene where Sir and Madge talk about old desire , old regret , and what might have been . Although it doe n't get talked about these day , it is worth remembering that The Dresser wa nominated for five Academy Awards : Best Actor nomination for both Finney and Courtenay , Best Picture , Best Director ( Peter Yates ) , and Best Adapted Screenplay . I had remembered this a being a good movie , but I wa n't prepared to be a completely mesmerized a I wa from beginning to end . If you want to see an example of what great acting is all about , and be hugely entertained all the while , then I encourage you to see The Dresser .

What happened ? What we have here is basically a solid and plausible premise and with a decent and talented cast , but somewhere the movie loses it . Actually , it never really got going . There wa a little excitement when we find out that Angie is not really pregnant , then find out that she is after all , but that wa it . Steve Martin , who is a very talented person and usually brings a lot to a movie , wa dreadful and his entire character wa not even close to being important to this movie , other than to make it longer . I really would have liked to see more interaction between the main character , Kate and Angie , and maybe try not for a pure comedy , which unfortunately it wa not , but maybe a drama with comedic element . I think if the movie did this it could have been very funny since both actress are quite funny in their own way and sitting here I can think of numerous scenario that would have been a riot .

I 've just watched Fingersmith , and I 'm stunned to see the 8/10 average rating for the show . Not only wa the plot wa difficult to follow , but it seems character development wa randomly applied . The actor were adequate , but in the process of attempting to create twist and turn , their character are rendered entirely one dimensional . Once this happens , the story really fall flat and becomes tedious . And just in case anyone did n't see the predictable lesbian undertone from mile way , this is hammered home in the most banal term at the end of the film . The end scene is disappointing and phoned in , and anyone who sat back and went `` Ohhh , so they were carpet muncher all along ! `` , must have been out for the evening . Two star for the tonsil hockey in the earlier scene which wa at least a bit raunchy , none for the rest of it ...
