An unmarried woman named Stella ( Bette Midler ) get pregnant by a wealthy man ( Stephen Collins ) . He offer to marry her out of a sense of obligation but she turn him down flat and decides to raise the kid on her own . Things go OK until the child named Jenny ( Trini Alvarado ) becomes a teenager and thing gradually ( and predictably ) become worse . I 've seen both the silent version and sound version of `` Stella Dallas '' . Neither one affected me much ( and I cry easily ) but they were well-made if dated . Trying to remake this in 1990 wa just a stupid idea . I guess Midler had enough power after the incomprehensible success of `` Beaches '' to get this made . This ( predictably ) bombed . The story is laughable and dated by today 's standard . Even though Midler and Alvarado give good performance this film really drag and I wa bored silly by the end . Stephen Collins and Marsha Mason ( both good actor ) do n't help in supporting role . Flimsy and dull . Really -- who thought this would work ? See the 1937 Stanwyck version instead . I give this a 1 .

DO N'T TORTURE A DUCKLING is one of Fulci 's earlier ( and honestly , in term of story-line , better ... ) film - and although not the typical `` bloodbath '' that Fulci is known for - this is still a very unique and enjoyable film . The story surround a small town where a series of child murder are occurring . Some of the colorful character involved in the investigation - either a suspect , or those `` helping '' the investigation ( or in some case both ) - include the town police force , a small-time reporter , a beautiful and rich ex-drug addict , a young priest and his mother , An old man who practice witchcraft and his female protégé , a mentally handicapped townsman , and a deaf/mute little girl . All of these people are interwoven into the plot to create several twist and turn , until the actual killer is revealed ... DO N'T TORTURE A DUCKLING is neither a `` classical '' giallo or a typical Fulci gore film . Although it doe contain element of both - it is more of an old-fashioned murder mystery , with darker subject matter and a few scene of graphic violence ( although nothing nearly a strong a some of Fulci 's later work ) . This is a well written film with lot of twist that kept me guessing up until the end . Recommended for giallo/murder-mystery fan , or anyone looking to check out some of Fulci 's non-splatter film - but do n't despair , DO N'T TORTURE still ha more than it 's fair share of violence and sleaze . Some may be put off by the subject of the child killing , and one main female character ha a strange habit of hitting on very young boy , which is also kind of disconcerting - but if that type of material doe n't bother you , then definitely give this one a look . 8.5/10

Busty beauty Stacie Randall play PVC clad , bad-ass bitch Alexandra , the faithful acolyte of Faust , an evil entity trapped in hell . Determined to free her master , the malevolent minx break into a warehouse to steal a magical gem vital to her success ; but whilst conducting a satanic ritual to summon Faust , the silly mare accidentally enters the pentagram she ha drawn on the floor , which result in the loss of the gem and the release of two diminutive , troll-like creature called Lite and Dark . Now Alexandra must find a replacement gem , which is n't going to be easy : the only other stone that will do the trick is worn around the neck of her ex-lover , police detective Jonathan Graves ( Peter Liapis ) , who is investigating the warehouse robbery and who know only too well what evil Alexandra is capable of . Meanwhile , wise-cracking inter-dimensional half-pint Lite and Dark get into all sort of zany trouble a they try to find a way back home . In the warped movie world of Jim Wynorski , all female are big-breasted babe with the fashion sense of a cheap hooker . Ghoulies IV is no exception : every woman in this filmwhether she be a police captain , a curator of antiquity , or a mental patient in an asylumis hot , hot , hot and wear not a lot , and it 's this fact that make this otherwise totally unwatchable piece of STV crap just about bearable . But be warned , even though the presence of semi-naked , quality crumpet make the going slightly easier , there is still plenty about this film to warrant it being labelled a an ordeal : the acting is wooden and the dialogue is painful ; the black humour ( a the DVD blurb describes it ) is about a funny a a knee to the knacker , with the comedic banter of Lite and Dark being particularly cringe-worthy ; and the special effect are bargain basement , consisting of rubbery creature and visual effect that would have looked dated ten year earlier . 3/10 solely for the high bimbo quotient .

I 'm not sure why the producer needed to trade on the name of a somewhat successful movie franchise because the title suggests that it is a sequel to the first three movie .. which it is not . Even though Marques Houston did appear in `` HP3 '' , he played a totally different character ( he wa , eight year older ) in this film . Okay ... so Reid and Martin were n't the most talented and could n't carry a film all by themselves .. but to trade on the HP franchise seems to me that there could have made some sort of reference ( albeit minor ) to the earlier movie . I 'm sure everyone who wanted to see it wa `` hoodwinked '' -- into thinking that they were seeing a sequel -- not a totally different film with a familiar name . And I 'm sorry ... Kym Whitley is not funny , and could not hold a candle to the late Robin Harris , Ketty Lester , or DC Curry in the earlier film . Although Meagen Good and Mari Morrow are a substantial visual diversion ... I have to give this a THUMBS DOWN ! ! Just naming the film `` Down to the Last Minute '' would have been OK . Furthermore , the Hudlin brother ( who produced the first three movie ) were not involved in the making of this film .

This film laboured along with some of the most predictable story line and shallow character ever seen . The writer obviously bought the playbook `` How to write a space disaster movie '' and followed it play by play . In particular , the stereo-typical use of astronaut talking to their loved one from outer space - putting on a brave show in the face of disaster - ha been done time and time again . Max Q appears to have been written in the hope that the producer would throw $ 50 million at the project . But , judging by the latter half of the film which contained numerous lame attempt at special effect , the producer could only muster $ 50 thousand . To learn that the film wa nominated for a `` Special Visual Effects '' Emmy ha me absolutely gob-smacked . I think a handful of high school student with a pas in Media Studies could have created more believable effect ! And the plot hole are too numerous to mention . But I will pick one out a an example . Now , I 'm no NASA expert , but surely it 's highly implausible that a worker attached to the shuttle simulator would suddenly hold a position of power in the control room when thing start to go pear-shaped with the program . Surely there is someone more experienced at Mission Control who the Program Director would call on rather than a twenty-nine year old who ha not been in the control room before . The only saving grace for this film is the work of Bill Campbell . He manages to make a good attempt at salvaging something out of the train wreck that is this script . I give this film 2 out of 10 , with the above-average work of Bill Campbell in the lead role saving it from a lower mark .

Caddyshack Two is a good movie by itself but compared to the original it cant stack up . Robert Stack is a horrible replacement for Ted Knight and Jackie Mason , while funny just cant compete with Rodney Dangerfield . Ty Webb is funny , being the only character from the original . Most of the other character in the movie lack the punch of the original ( Henry Wilcoxon for example ) except for the hystericly funny lawyer Peter Blunt , being played by Randy Quaid . Every line he say reminds me of the original humor , especially the scene at his office ( I do n't go in for law suit or motion . I find out where you live and come to your house and beat down your door with a f * * * ing baseball bat , make a bonfire with the chippindale , maybe roast that golden retriever ( arff arff arff ) then eat it . And then I 'm comin ' upstairs junior , and I 'm grabbing you by your brook brother pjs , and cramming your brand new BMW up your tight a * * ! Do we have an understanding ? ) . Offsetting his small role however , is Dan Acroyd , who is obviously no replacement for Bill Murray . His voice is beyond irritating and everything he doe isnt even funny , it just stupid . Overall Caddyshack II is a good movie , but in comparison to the awesome original it just cant cut it .

Honestly - this short film suck . the dummy used in the necro scene is pretty well made but still phony enough looking to ruin the viewing experience . the Unearthed DVD is crisp and clear and I have n't made up my mind if this help or hinders it . If the film wa a little grainy it might have added some `` creepiness factor '' to what wa going on . I have no idea why this film ha so much hype surrounding it other than the subject matter - but to be honest the necrophilia scene in film like NEKROMANTIK and VISITOR Q among others , are more shocking than in AFTERMATH . All this talk about the film being about loneliness and all other manner of deep philosophy is bull * * * * . This is an expensive , beautifully filmed turd . It 's not that shocking , it 's not that disgusting . if you insist on viewing it - rent it . I give it a 3 for the fact that not many people make explicit movie about necrophilia ( there should definitely be a bigger selection for u sickos ; ) - the filming is good and it doe have some `` gore '' ( if watching a rubbery looking doll get cut open is considered gore ... ) but other than that - absolutely nothing going for this over-hyped mess . On the other hand - GENESIS - Cerda 's `` sequel '' to AFTERMATH ( now available a a `` double feature '' released by Unearthed film ) is an absolute masterpiece of a short film , really showing what a good director Cerda really is when given the right material . Although I do n't care for AFTERMATH at all , GENESIS is so well made that I will forgive Cerda and Definitely keep an eye out for him in the future ...

I thought that Mukhsin ha been wonderfully written . Its not just about entertainment . There 's tonne of subtle message that i think Yasmin wa trying to bring across . And yes , it might be confusing to some of you ( especially if you did n't watch Sepet and/or Gubra for 76 time ) . I bet u noticed how they use character from the two movie before right ? Its really ironic how the character relate . Like the bossy neighbour is that prostitute from Gubra . And the chick at the snooker pad turn out to be the religious and wife of the pious man in the future . And i absolutely love the voice-overs . Its crude yet awakeningly fresh . Like , when they took a shot of the Rumah Tumpangan Gamin signboard , then there wa suddenly Mukhsin 's voice saying 'Bismillahhirrahmannirrahim .. ' ( the scene when he climbed the tree ) . It captured Malaysian 's attitude ( and in some mild way , sniggering at how pathetic it is ) portrayed in the character . For example , even the kid can be really sharp tongued ( complete with the shrill annoying voice ) and simply bad mouth ppl all movie long . And how you can be such a busybody and talk about ppl , when ur own life is n't sorted out . All i can say is , this movie totally reached my expectation if not exceeded it . It kept me glued to the screen , i could n't even take my eye off it . Not even to make out in the cinema . Ha ha .

I am not a golf fan by any mean . On May 26 about 10:30 PM the movie started with a scene in the late 1800 's . Old movie I like but not golf however , within the first scene a young boy ( Harry Vardon ) is awaken by the voice of men . He go outside to inquire what they are doing and is told they are going to build a golf something ... So , then I turned the television off but something stirred me and it wa back on . The movie is excellent . We then see this young boy now a man ; professional golf player who is haunted with vision from his childhood . Then we meet the true focus of the movie Francis and the decision he make for golf . You meet his mother and father who want to protect him from the class thing that is so obvious during the period . Then there is little Eddie Lowery his caddy with encouraging word and little push that are instrumental in Francis winning . Do n't want to give away too much . I wa up until 2 A.M . This is super please see the movie .

Upon viewing Tobe Hooper 's gem , Crocodile , in 2000 , I developed a great interest in the college/crocodile niche of the exploitation/monster genre . I look forward to a wayward producer to follow up with several sequel to these delightful bonbon of camp goodness . If only Ed Wood could bring his subtle sense of flair and dignity to these remarkable script . With Ed writing the script , and a room full of monkees creating crocodile special effect on a computer , all we 'd need would be a cast of crocky fodder with Russ Meyer breast and Ren Hoek pectoral implant . While Tobe Hooper 's crocky opus referenced his own movie , Blood Surf chose to dish out a bunch of aging theme from the chum bucket of other movie . See if you can look past the Revenge of the Nerds sequel set to find the allusions/homages ? /rip-offs to Jaws , Temple of Doom , Indiana Jones ' Last Crusade , The Convent , Godzilla 2000 , and any James Bond movie . Also , try to find the ready-for-tv fade where the editor gave up on making sense of the stock . I wa disappointed the crock did n't get to try out it sotto voce tenor with a soliloquy on environmentalism ... or crocky appreciation , but the quasi-Captain Ahab of the story doe get his tour de force speach . Perhaps , in the coming year , we 'll see a crock galloping off after a shootout into a golden sunset . Or hopefully , a monkey will flush a crocky down the toilet of an international space station for midget and enjoy the exploitative waltz of zero-G monkey/midget/crocodile bloodshed . All-in-all , the lack of a whammy bar in the surf music irked me .

It try to be the epic adventure of the century . And with a cast like Shô Kasugi , Christopher Lee and John-Rhys Davies it really is the perfect B-adventure of all time . It 's actually is a pretty fun , swashbuckling adventure that , even with it 's flaw , capture your interest . It must have felt a the biggest movie ever for the people who made it . Even if it 's made in the 90 , it doe n't have a modern feel . It more ha the same feeling that a old Errol Flynn movie had . Big adventure movie are again the big thing in Hollywood but I 'm afraid that the feeling in them will never be the same a these old movie had . This on the other hand , just ha the real feeling . You just ca n't hate it . I think it 's an okay adventure movie . And I really love the soundtrack . Damn , I want the theme song .

The Last Hard Men find James Coburn an outlaw doing a long sentence breaking free from a chain gang . Do he and his friend head for the Mexican border from jail and safety . No they do n't because Coburn ha a mission of revenge . To kill the peace officer who brought him in and in the process killed his woman . That peace officer is Charlton Heston who is now retired and he know what Coburn is after . As he explains it to his daughter , Barbara Hershey , Coburn wa holed up in a shack and wa involved in a Waco like standoff . His Indian woman wa killed in the hail of bullet fired . It 's not something he 's proud of , she wa a collateral casualty in a manhunt . Lest we feel sorry for Coburn he let u know full well what an evil man he truly is . Heston is his usual stalwart hero , but the acting honor in The Last Hard Men go to James Coburn . He blow everyone else off the screen when he 's on . Coburn get the bright idea of making sure Heston trail him by kidnapping Hershey and taking her to an Indian reservation where the white authority ca n't touch him . He know that Heston ha to make it personal then . Coburn 's gang includes , Morgan Paull , Thalmus Rasulala , John Quade , Larry Wilcox , and Jorge Rivero . Heston ha Chris Mitchum along who is his son-in-law to be . The Last Hard Men is one nasty and brutal western . Andrew McLaglen directed it and I 'm thinking it may have been a project originally intended for Sam Peckinpaugh . It sure show a lot of his influence with the liberal use of slow motion to accentuate the violence . Of which there is a lot . For a little Peckinpaugh lite , The Last Hard Men is your film .

Maybe it wa the title , or the trailer ( certainly not the interview on the DVD , which is with the director a he keep saying `` hi , kid '' into the camera like a buffoon ) , but I had expectation for Entrails of a Virgin to be at least a bit of sleazy fun with some good sex scene and brutal , bloody killing by a weird Japanese penetrator . Turns out it 's way too sleazy for it own good , or bad , or whatever . There 's a problem- and one can see this also in the Italian sexploitation flick Porno Holocaust , similar to this in many respects- in not having balance to the sex and violence . Too much sex and it will turn into a prototypical porno , and not even with much production quality in comparison with most professional porno movie ! And with the killing scene , there ha to be at least a little tack , and maybe just a smidgen of ingenuity , in creating the creature/killer/whatever . Entrails of a Virgin ha neither . It 's safe to say it 's a pretty soulless movie , even if is n't one of the very worst ever made- it 's there just for horn-dog Japanese fetishist to get off on girl in trouble and men who have all their brain in their 'other ' head . In this case , we 're given a photo team where the guy are taking some shot of some girl , nothing too salacious , and then by way of a dense fog they stay off at some house one night and are picked off one by one by `` A Murderer '' a he 's credited . First off , the director Kazuo 'Gaira ' Komizu decides he ha to put in a quota of random sex scene early on- we get spliced in ( or phoned in , take your pick ) clip of one of the photographer having sex with one or more of the girl elsewhere . It look like it 's from another movie . Then once settled into the house , there 's a 'wrestling ' scene that 's poorly choreographed and shot ( yeah , we really need to see him 'all ' there ) , and then on to the rape and killing . First the rape , by the photographer , who promise the girl some job for their time . Then the Murderer , who like D'Amato 's creature is simply covered in mud and given a stupid facial , and who for an unknown reason kill the men and/or rape the woman one by one . Now , the latter of those , taken by themselves , should be considered the highlight of the movie . This is like saying , however , that the croûtons are the best part of a wretchedly tasting salad . An eye-gouging scene , a spike thrown like an Olympic event ( that scene , actually , is kind of cool ) , and finally the entrailing of the overly sex-crazed girl , whose inconsequential name I ca n't remember . Even * this * becomes disappointing just by not being correct to the title ! On top of this , the sex scene , which become tedious through 'Gaira ' and his indulgence in long-takes-without-cutaways where everything by the Japanese censor is blurred anyway , are dubbed over by the actor ( you 'd think that they seem to be enjoying themselves enough , hence the need to let them 'speak ' for themselves ) . But the overall feeling from Entrails of a Virgin is that of a lumpy one , where it 's just there to be gawked at and without a shred of suspense or true horror ( watch a the last girl left alive , the virgin of the picture , try to stop the murderer from getting to her , which last five minute a she keep throwing stick at him ! ) You just want it to be done with , for the ' I hate woman ' mantra to ease up or be rid altogether .

The few scene that actually attempt a depiction of revolutionary struggle resemble a hirsute Boy Scout troop meandering tentatively between swimming hole . When Sharif or , please God , Palance try their hand at fiery oratory , they sound like Kurtz swallowing a bug . The display of strategic brilliance incorporate a map of Cuba replete with smiling fishies in the ocean , and a positively Vaudevillian hypothesis on how the Bay of Pigs came to pas . What doe that leave u with ? One comical dentistry scene ; a surfeit of uppity Hollywood peasant who address the camera a though it were a moving train ; and , just for kick , a passel of homoeroticism that is not limited to Castro 's manic and unremitting cigar-fellatio . Never trust a Medved , but even a busted clock is right twice a day : this is a HISTORICALLY awful movie .

This film took me by surprise . I make it a habit of finding out a little a possible about film before attending because trailer and review provide spoiler after spoiler . All I knew upon entering the theater is that it wa a documentary about a long married couple and that IMDb reader gave it a 7.8 , Rotten Tomatoes user ranked it at 7.9 and the critic averaged an amazing 8.2 ! If anything , they UNDERRATED this little gem . Filmmaker Doug Block decided to record his parent `` for posterity '' and at the beginning of the film we are treated to the requisite interview with his parent , outspoken mother Mina , and le than forthcoming dad , Mike . I immediately found this couple interesting and had no idea where the filmmaker ( Mike & Mina 's son Doug ) wa going to take u . As a matter of fact , I doubt that Doug himself knew where he wa going with this ! Life take unexpected twist and turn and this beautifully expressive film follows the journey . It is difficult to verbalize just how moved I wa with this story and the unique way in which it wa told . Absolutely riveting from beginning to end and it really is a must-see even if you are n't a fan of the documentary genre . This film will make you think of your own life and might even evoke memory that you thought were long forgotten . `` 51 Birch Street '' is one of those rare filmgoing experience that make a deep impression and never leaf you . The best news of all is that HBO had a hand in the production so instead of playing to a limited art house audience , eventually , million of people will have a chance to view this incredible piece of work . BRAVO ! ! ! ! ! ! ! !

Stephen Hawkings is a genius . He is the king of genius . Watching this movie make me feel dumb . But it 's a great movie . Not highly entertaining , but very very intriguing . The movie center around wheelchair bound Stephen Hawkings , a man who make Einstein look average , and his theory and scientific discovery about the universe , time , the galaxy , and black hole . Everyone at sometime or another during a really intense high come to a moment when they think they ' v got the universe and the cosmos figured out and they swear a soon a they sober up they 'll write it all down . Well here is a man who actually held that feeling for more then six hour . Here is a man who despite suffering from Lou Gehrig 's disease ha become the greatest mind the world ha yet seen . Watch this and listen in on how he ha formulated theory on black hole . Awesome . You wo n't be the same after you see it .

The story is about a psychic woman , Tory , who return to her hometown and begin reliving her traumatic childhood past ( the death of her childhood friend and abusive father ) . Tory discovers that her friend wa just the first in a string of murder that are still occurring . Can her psychic power help solve the crime and stop the continuing murder ? You really do n't need to find out because , Oh My God ! This wa so so so so bad ! I know all the Nora Roberts fan will flock to this movie and give it ton of 10 's . Then the rest of u will see an IMDb score of 6 and actually think this movie is worth watching . But do not be fooled . The ending wa predictable , the acting TERRIBLE ( do n't even get me started about the southern accent * y'all * ) and the story wa trite . Just remember .... you were warned !

Oh God , I must have seen this when I wa only 11 or twelve , ( do n't ask how ) I may have been young , but I wa n't stupid . Anyone could see that this is a bad movie , nasty , gross , unscary and very silly . I 've seen more impressive effect at Disneyland , I 've seen better performance at a school play , And I 've seen more convincing crocodile at the zoo , where they do nothing but sit in the water , ignoring the child tapping on the glass . The story is set in northern Australia . A handful of ambitious young people , are trying out a new water sport , surfing in shark filled water . It soon becomes evident that something more dangerous is in the water . After they learn what , they get the help of a grizzly middle aged fisherman , who want to kill the animal to avenge the eating of his family . I think I have seen every crocodile film made in the last fifteen year , the best of which is Lake Placid , and the worse of which is it sequel . Blood Surf would have to be the second worst croc flick I think , with Primeval and Crocodile tailing closely behind . The Australian Saltwater Crododile is one of the most dangerous creature out there , resulting in more than a hundred injury or death every year . Movies like Blood Surf however ruin not only the ferocious image of such a creature , but a good hour and a half of the viewer 's life . Unless you really want to see it , avoid Blood Surf .

`` Fate '' lead Walter Sparrow to come in possession of a mysterious novel that ha eerie similarity and connection to his life , all based around the number 23 . As the story unfolds in real life and fiction , Sparrow must figure out his connection to the book and how the story will eventually end . The Number 23 offer an intriguing premise that is undone by a weak execution . The film just failed on many different level which is pretty disappointing because it held so much potential . The screenplay wa probably the worst part about it . It wa filled with silly sequence and laughable dialog that just killed the mood of the movie . It seemed like the screenwriter had a good idea , he just did n't know how to develop it to stretch over a ninety minute running time . The second half of the film wa running low on idea , the twist wa pretty obvious and the ending wa awful . Joel Schumacher is responsible for one of the worst movie ever and he did redeem himself a little with Phone Booth and a few other film but The Number 23 reminds me that he 's still capable of making a stinker . He ha the movie drenched in style but he just ca n't get a good focus . He move the film at a clunky and slow pace . He switch from reality to what 's actually happening in the book which quickly got annoying . The actual book in the film that 's titled `` The Number 23 '' is an awful detective story and the audience get stuck listening to Carrey narrate it which just bored me to tear . When Carrey is finally done with book , we get stuck watching him run around trying to solve the mystery . At this point , the audience ha lost interest and there is no real tension . We impatiently wait for the movie to reach it 's horrible ending and unconvincing explanation before celebrating that film ha finally finished . The acting wa mostly average and pretty forgettable . Jim Carrey wa clearly just sleepwalking through his performance and he did n't even seem to be trying . He wa either completely over the top in some scene or just very wooden . His narration wa a complete bore to listen to and he put no life inside his character . Virginia Madsen did the best she could with a limited role but she need to pick better script . Logan Lerman wa pretty bland a wa Danny Huston . Overall , The Number 23 wa an awful thriller that offered more laugh than suspense or thrill . Rating 3/10

We brought this film a a joke for a friend , and could of been our worst joke to play . The film is barely watchable , and the acting is dire . The worst child actor ever used and Hasslehoff giving a substandard performance . The plot is disgraceful and at point we wa so bored we wa wondering what the hell wa going on . It try to be gruesome in place but is just laughable . Just terrible

This wa probably the worst movie i have ever seen in my life ! ! It wa stupid there wa no plot and the special affect were ridiculous ! ! And i have never seen such bad acting in my life ! The only good part about the movie were all the hot guy ( especially Drew Fuller ) . I do n't know what these people were thinking when they made this movie ! ! I did n't even want to finish the whole thing because you get to this point in the movie where the guy are all in bed touching themselves . I mean it wa like some kind of sick and twisted kiddy porn ! I would advise anyone who ha heard of this movie and wa interested in seeing it to just forget about it and find another movie to watch ! I wa very disappointed ! ! The whole movie wa a complete waste of time in my opinion .

This is a typical Steele novel production in that two people who have undergone some sort of tragedy manage to get together despite the odds . I would n't call this a spoiler because anyone who ha read a Steele novel know how they ALL end . If you do n't want to know much about the plot , do n't keep reading . Gilbert 's character , Ophelia , is a woman of French decent who ha lost her husband and son in an accident . Gilbert need to stop doing film where she is required to have an accent because she , otherwise a good actress , can not realistically pull off any kind of accent . Brad Johnson , also an excellent actor , is Matt , who is recovering from a rather nasty divorce . He is gentle , convincing and compelling in this role . The two meet on the beach through her daughter , Pip , and initially , Ophelia accuses Matt of being a child molester just because he talked art with the kid . All of them become friend after this episode and then the couple fall in love . The chemistry between the two lead is not great , even though the talent of these two people is not , in my opinion , a question . They did the best they could with a predictable plot and a script that border on stereotypical . Two people meet , tragedy , bigger tragedy , a secret is revealed , another tragedy , and then they get together . I wish there wa more to it than that , but there it is in a nutshell . I wanted mindless entertainment , and I got it with this . In regard to the genre of romantic film , this one fails to be memorable . `` A Secret Affair '' with Janine Turner is far superior ( not a Steele book ) , a are some of Steele 's earlier book turned into film .

Oh no one of these attack of the Japanese ghost girl movie ... i do n't even remember how many i 've seen . maybe it sell ... but not to me . not scary at all . the japanese horror movie are have been very similar since the first one of these ... also the pulling of the kid . i have seen that pulled under scene so many time in so many horror movie . cellphone scene is also nothing new ... the dramaticness of the guy getting hit by a train kinda sucked ... i mean it lacked all dramaticness ... OK this is for kid 14-16 who listen to japanese rock and think they are so unique ... we 'll let me tell you . there 's a million of you =D this is one of them . 3/10 i 've seen worse but you wo n't be missing anything by NOT seeing this !

Nicholas Walker is Paul , the local town Reverand who 's married to Martha ( Ally Sheedy ) , but also is a habitual womanizer and decides to fake his own death to run away with his current affair , Veronica ( Dara Tomanovich ) . However in so doing , he get a bout of amnesia ( hence the name of the film ) . Sally Kirkland is also on hand a a crazy old coot who pine for the good Reverand in a shade of `` Misery '' type of way . It 's sad to see a pretty good cast wasted like this . Not the least bit John Savage in a horridly forgettable role a a shoddy private investigator . In a film billed a a 'black comedy ' , one ha to bring BOTH element into said movie . While this doe bring the former in spade , it sadly contains none of the latter . Furthermore you ca n't emphasize with any of the character and a thus , have absolutely no vested interest in them . Technically not an all-together bad movie just an extremely forgettable one . Eye Candy : Dara Tomanovich get topless ; Sally Kirkland also show some skin My Grade : C- Where I saw it : Showtime Showcase

Hollywood movie industry is the laziest one in the entire world . It only need a single hit to flood theater with the same old crap re-invented over and over again . Take superheroes for example , for each X-Man and Spiderman , there are Daredevil , Elektra , Ghost Rider and Hulk . Japanese horror remake are even worst . It only took The Ring , which wa pitch-perfect ( mostly because of Mr. Gore Verbinsky ) , to bring a ton of look-alike creepy-woman based horror , e.g . The Ring 2 , The Eye , Dark Water ( which wa fine , but pointless ) , and the grudge . The first Grudge wa n't entirely bad . It wa scary most of the way , which is what one could expect from it . Plus , the plot had some brain mixing narrative . Grudge 2 is exactly like the previous ; this could be a good thing , but hey , what boy Men in Black II ? Was it a nice thing to xerox the entire screenplay and just change the villain ? For the Grudge 2 , the critic go the same way . Tired scare , bad acting ( except for Amber Tamblyn ) , and clichés all over the place . Three story take place , on different place and time . There is Aubrey ( Tamblyn ) investigating what drove her sister Karen ( Sarah Michelle Gellar ) to death ; Allison ( Arielle Kebbel ) who is taken by colleague to visit the house where the incident depicted in the first movie took place ; and finally , an American family that witness strange stuff happening on the apartment next door . Glad to say ( and I mean it ) that everything is tied up at the end , but one must not rely on the end to make a good picture , when everything else is simply tiresome and dull . The chill are all over there , a girl alone in the locker , someone who should n't enter a house , others that dig too deep . Meanwhile , ghost keep killing and killing and killing , which seems even more deadlier than ten world war or the Ebola epidemic . Hey , doe n't that seem just like another bad Japanese remake , something called Pulse ? Yeah , day after day it 's getting easier to hold a grudge ... against Hollywood bullshit .

`` Down Periscope '' ha been in our library since it first arrived in VHS . Since then , we have acquired the DVD and a digital from Cinema Now . It is a quirky flick that doe not go militarily overboard a either pro or con . It is first and foremost a comedy and a a vehicle for the main character , I am quite surprised that a sequel ha never been offered . The movie ha gained a following that border on a cult obsession , even among the very young . I became aware of this while visiting the USS Drum in Mobile , Alabama in 2002 . A group of Cub Scouts , my grandson among them , had all taken up the role from the movie and planned to relive it during their overnighter on board . It is a fun romp that make you proud both of our Navy and Hollywood ... which is rare company . Thanks to Kelsey Grammar , Lauren Holly and Rob Schneider for making what could have been an otherwise unremarkable movie , such great entertainment !

If you came here , it 's because you 've already seen this film and were curious what others had to say about it . I feel for you , I * really * do . And I profusely apologize a a Canadian ( because that 's what we do ) that this film ever had to cross your eye , if only for a moment . I hear there is no cure for the retinal bleeding reported out of every dozen case . I , like everyone else , rented this movie believing it to be some stupid B-movie ripoff of Blade . I thought , `` sure I could use a good laugh at a stupid movie . '' I 'll give the creator of this film ONE positive comment about their 'creation ' : Thanks for removing the REC XX/XX/XX from the bottom right-hand corner of the screen . I can see how that would have been a distraction from seeing this movie . And for the record , I * saw * the movie , but did not watch it . The dialogue wa incoherent and most of the scene took place in my grandmother 's trailer , I swear to God . You know what ? I 'm not writing anymore about this . It 's just too painful .

Deanna Durbin , Nan Grey and Barbara Read are `` Three Smart Girls '' in this Universal film from 1936 , which introduces Deanna Durbin to film audience . It also star Ray Milland , Mischa Auer , Charles Winninger , John King , Binnie Barnes and Alice Brady . It 's a sweet story about three young woman , now living in Switzerland with their divorced mother , who hear their father ( Winninger ) is marrying again . Not having seen him in 10 year and knowing their mother still love him , they board a ship to America , with the help of the housekeeper/nanny , determined to stop the wedding . Realizing that the intended , called `` Precious '' ( Barnes ) is nothing but a gold-digger aided and abetted by her mother ( Brady ) , they arrange for her to be introduced to a wealthy Count . This is arranged by their father 's accountant ( King ) . The man he chooses is a full-time drunk ( Auer ) , but the girl mistake him for an actual wealthy count ( Milland ) . What a mess . This is a delightful film , not cloying or overly sugary at all , with some nice performance , particularly by Auer , Milland , Barnes and Brady . The young woman are pretty and all do good work . The emphasis , of course , is on young Durbin , who is a natural actress and a beautifully-trained singer . In fact , her voice a a youngster is much more even than it would be a an adult - she ha no trouble with the high note , a she did later on because she put too much weight in the middle voice . She sings a delightful `` Il Bacio '' in a police station . One of the nicest thing about the film is to see the father , played by Charles Winninger , not want his child around - until he see them and get to know them . Barnes a the gold-digger is n't all that young , but the girl ' mother look way up there , so the inference probably wa the older man seeking his youth with a younger , more glamorous woman . In fact , he find the youth he wa seeking in his daughter . Universal give Durbin the big star buildup here - she ha the final shot in the movie . Ray Milland at this point wa still paying his due , and it will probably be a surprise even to film fan how young and attractive he is . Very entertaining and of course , this led to a sequel and big stardom for Deanna .

If anyone is wondering why no one make movie like they used to , with conversation , character and a simple theme of friendship struggling to evolve into something new , better and different , those folk need to take in this film and see top notch writing , directing , and acting that meld into a wonderful evening of observation on how thing used to be in Italy and England . Other day , other time funneled into a terrific comedy of entertainment , made in 1992 with Alfred Molina , Joan Plowright , Polly Walker , Josie Lawrence , Jim Broadbent , Miranda Richardson , and Michael Kitchens in the major role . Under the brush stroke direction of Mike Newell , these actor accomplish vividly memorable performance that are photographed with a sublimely subtle painter 's eye . Reminiscent of the theatrical bedroom farce of the turn of the century , this film might be called a friendship farce that becomes a worthwhile experience in the growth of the romantic nature within each character , and the viewer , too . An artistic telegram on the importance of caring about those around u .

I watched this series out of curiosity , wanting to see if they could possibly and with ALL this modern technology , out do Cecil B. DeMille 's classic epic of 1956 , starring Charleton Heston , Yul Brenner and Sir Cedric Hardwicke . Of course , I wa let down . Yes , they had all the Biblical character correct , but they did n't give u any of the spectacular theatrical scene , that held your interest throughout the first movie . If you going to have a mini-series , you have to have some `` rivoting '' scene , the `` Burning bush '' , Parting the `` RED Sea '' , drowning `` Pharohs Armies '' , `` building Sethi 's Pyramids '' , could have been done with today ' technology on the scale of blockbuster movie such a `` Lord of the Rings '' or the Matrix . Obviously , they did n't want to leave a LASTING impression of `` faith and sacrifice '' , which is much needed in these trouble time .

Daniel Day-Lewis is the most versatile actor alive . English aristocratic snob in A Room With a View , passionate Irish thief in In the Name of the Father , an impudent , violent butcher in Gangs of New York ( in a performance ten time stronger than Adrian Brody 's in the Pianist ) and a the outrageous Cristy Brown with cerebral palsy in My Left Foot ( just to name a few ) . His role all influence eachother , but each is seperate , and utterly unique . He change completely , with each character he take on . And I 'm beginning to believe that he can act a anything . Anything . As Cristy Brown he is stunning . He doe not ridicule the character , and he doe not pity the character . A difficult achievement . And Cristy Brown come to life . A smart man . An outrageous man . Human . This movie , despite small scene-transition fault and the like , is an inspiration . Yes , it 's predictable . But is it stupidly sentimental ? No . I laughed . I cried . Not a single moment of cheese . Proof that this is n't a Hollywood movie . My favourite scene is the scene in the restaurant , when Cristy is discussing painter with Eileen , Peter and her friend . Here 's where Daniel Day-Lewis reach an acting climax . `` I 'll kick you in the only part of your anatomy that 's animated . '' `` Wheel out the cripple ! '' And his performance never slows down , never falter , and is beautiful . Simply . He ha a lot of screen time here . I watch it again again , and I never get tired of Cristy 's perspicacious eye , twitching and guttural speech . A must-see . Fo sho , yo !

My guess would be this wa originally going to be at least two part , and thus at least a quarter longer , because otherwise how can one explain it confused , abbreviated storyline . I wa never completely lost , but I wa often partially lost and usually unclear on character motivation . The movie feel a though joining plot point were dropped to squeeze it into it time slot . If it were longer , it might make more sense , but it still would n't be much good . The movie 's most interesting idea is of the war between Zeus and Hera a being a war between the male and female , but the movie drop the ball on this , making Hera 's follower fairly horrible while not being clear on what Zeus ' follower do or believe . The movie is also interesting because you do n't see the god and there 's no real certainty that they exist . So it 's got a couple of intriguing idea , but it doe n't do anything useful with them . Bad dialog , cardboard character , and one interesting scene involving Hercules and his three antagonistic son . Not unwatchable but also not worth watching .

Well , I like to watch bad horror B-Movies , cause I think it 's interesting to see stupidity and unability of creator to shoot seriously good movie . ( I always compare this movie to - for example - some Spielberg 's work and again-and-again do n't understand the huge difference in what I see . ) I like Ed Wood 's movie cause it 's so inept it 's very funny . But people ! ! ! `` The Chilling '' is not funny and is not even `` interesting '' . It 's EXTREMELY BORING horror movie without ANYTHING what make even bad movie watchable . There 's no acting , no screenplay , no direction , no thrill and not even blood . It 's extremely inept amateurish film . It 's definitely the WORST movie I had ever seen ( and I had seen a lot of `` worst movie '' - believe me ) . I warned you ! ! ! 1/10

This IS the worst movie I have ever seen , a well a , the worst that I will probably EVER see . I see no need to rehash what all the others have said previously , just be forewarned ... This IS NOT one of those bad movie you think you want to watch because you want to be able to make fun of it , it just plain BAD BAD BAD BAD BAD . This movie is the equivalent to having a `` pet rock '' a your friend . You wait and wait and wait and wait and wait and wait and wait and wait for something to happen . Unfortunately , it never doe . At least with a pet rock you knew what you were getting into . Lion 's Gate completely deceives on this bombshell ... No ... this is a disaster . After watching this film , you would swear George W. Bush had his hand all over the making of this film ... yes it that idiotic . Stay away , unless of course you just want to watch the worst movie of all time . Its probably how Lion 's Gate figured it would make some money off this piece of tripe .

I have been a Mario fan for a long a I can remember , I have very fond memory of playing Super Mario World a a kid , this game ha brought back many of those memory while adding something new . Super Mario Galaxy is the latest installment in the amazing Mario franchise . There is much very different about this game from any other Mario before it , while still keeping intact the greatest element of Mario , the first noticeable difference is that the story take place in space . The story begin much like any other Mario game , Mario receives a letter from Princess Peach inviting him to a celebration at her castle in the Mushroom Kingdom . Upon arriving at Peach 's castle Mario find Bowser and his son ( Bowser Jr. ) attacking the castle with their airship . Bowser kidnaps Princess Peach and then lift her castle up into space . In the midst of the castle being lifted into space Mario fall off and land on an unknown planet . Mario is found by a talking star named Luma and is taken back to the Luma 's home , a floating space station , here Mario meet many other Lumas and also meet their leader , a woman named Rosalina . Rosalina tell Mario that Bowser ha taken away the space station 's Power Stars and scattered them across the universe , it is up to Mario to help the Lumas find them and save Peach , thus the adventure begin . The way you play the game is by flying from the space station to other galaxy , each galaxy consists of multiple planet that Mario travel amongst in level via these shooting star to retrieve the Power Stars . Mario can at many time walk all the way around planet without losing gravity , some planet are small and others are big , many planet are similar to classic Mario environment . The best thing about the game are the control , all of the stuff like jumping and such is still the same , but the wiimote is used in many unique way in this game . You shake the remote Mario will perform a spin that is used a the primary attack in the game , and it will a well activate the shooting star . You can also point the remote at the screen and use the pointer to fire star bit at enemy or object in the environment . Then there is the graphic , these are by far the best graphic on the Wii , it is just so hard to describe how great this game look , you could probably almost say it look a good a some 360 game . My only minor gripe is that the going upside down effect take some getting used to , and also the story is pretty weak . The worst part is that you lose all of your life when you turn off the game , no matter how many you had when you last quit you restart at 4 life . Still these minor problem aside it 's a superb game that is highly entertaining and is very challenging . This is the type of game that we 've been waiting for on the Wii . A perfect 10 out of 10 !

This short film that inspired the soon-to-be full length feature - Spatula Madness - is a hilarious piece that contends against similar cartoon yielding multiple writer . The short film star Edward the Spatula who after being fired from his job , join in the fight against the evil spoon . This premise allows for some funny content near the beginning , but is barely present for the remainder of the feature . This film 's 15-minute running time is absorbed by some odd-ball comedy and a small musical number . Unfortunately not much else lie below it . The plot that is set up doe n't really have time to show . But it 's surely follows it plot better than many high-budget Hollywood film . This film is worth watching at least a few time . Take it for what it is , and do n't expect a deep story .

Okay , last night , August 18th , 2004 , I had the distinct displeasure of meeting Mr. Van Bebble at a showing of the film The Manson Family at the Three Penny in Chicago a part of the Chicago Underground Film Festival . Here 's what I have to say about it . First of all , the film is an obvious rip off of every Kenneth Anger , Roman Polanski , Oliver Stone and Terry Gilliam movie I 've ever seen . Second of all , in a short Q & A session after the show Mr. Van Bebble immediately stated that he never made any contact with the actual Manson Family member or Charlie himself , calling them liar and saying he wanted nothing to do with them , that the film wa based on his ( Van Bebble 's ) take on the trial having seen it all from his living room on TV and in the news ( and I 'm assuming from the Autobiography and the book Helter Skelter which were directly mimicked through the narrative ) . So I had second dibs on question , I asked if he wa trying to present the outsider , Mtv , sex drug and rock 'n roll version and not necessarily the true story . This question obviously pissed off the by now sloshed director who started shouting `` f * * * you , shut the f * * * up , this is the truth ! All those other movie are bullsh * * ! '' Well anyway , I did n't even think about how ridiculous this wa until the next day when I read the tagline for the film , `` You 've heard the law side of the story ... now hear the story a it is told by the Manson Family . '' Excuse me , if this guy ha never even spoken to the family and considers them to be liar that he doe n't want to have anything to do with , how in God 's name can he tell the story for them ! ? This is the most ridiculous statement I have ever heard ! The film wa obviously catered to the sex drug and rock 'n roll audience that it had no trouble in attracting to the small , dimly lit theatre , and wa even more obviously spawned by the sex drug and rock 'n roll mind of a man who could n't even watch his own film without getting up every ten minute to go get more beer or to shout some sort of Rocky Horroresque call line to the actor on screen . This film accomplishes little more than warping the public 's image of actual event ( which helped shape the state of America and much of the world today ) into some sort of Slasher/Comic Book/Porno/Rape fantasy dreamed up by an obviously shallow individual . The film wa definitely very impressive to look at . The soundtrack wa refreshing a it contained actual sample of Charlie 's work with the Family off of his Lie album . The editing wa nice and choppy to simulate the nauseating uncertainty of most modern music video . All in all this film would have made a much better addition to the catalogue at Mtv than to the Underground Film Festival or for that matter the mind of any intellectual observer . I felt like I wa at a midnight Rocky Horror viewing the way the audience wa dressed and behaving ( probably the best part of the experience ) . The cast wa very good with the exception of Charlie who resembled some sort of stoned Dungeons and Dragons enthusiast more than the actual role he wa portraying . The description the film gave of him a full of energy , throwing ten thing at you and being very physical about it all the while did not match at all the slow , lethargic , and chubby representation that wa actually presented . All in all the film basically explains itself a Sadie ( or maybe it wa Linda ) declares at the end , `` You can write a bunch of bullsh * * book or make a bunch of bullsh * * movie ... etc . etc . '' Case in point . Even the disclaimer `` Based on a True Story '' is a dead giveaway , signalling that somewhere beneath this psychedelic garbage heap lay the foundation of an actual story with content that will make and ha made a difference in the world . All you have to do is a little bit of alchemy to separate the truth from the the crap , or actually , maybe you could just avoid it all together and go read a book instead . All I can say is this , when the film ended I got a free beer so I 'm glad I went , but not so glad I spent fifteen dollar on my ticket to be told to shut the f * * * up for asking the director a question . Peace .

I bought this game on an impulse buy from walmart . I am glad I did . It wa very entertaining listening to Sean Connery and playing the game . I thought the graphic were the best I have ever seen in a movie/game remake . The bonus level were very hard ! The sniper one I think wa too hard , it made me so frustrated I did n't play the game for a week and a half . There were too many people shooting at you with nothing to hide behind or life to handle it . The only thing I might change wa the upgrade system . I did n't notice any difference from un-upgraded equipment to the upgraded , such a buying an armor upgrade did n't seem to make the armor stronger or more filling on my life meter . I really liked the Q copter . I think the developer did a good job .

No , this hilariously horrible 70 's made-for-TV horror clinker is n't about a deadly demonically possessed dessert cake . Still , this exceptionally awful , yet undeniably amusing and thus enjoyable cathode ray refuse reach a breathtaking apex of absolute , unremitting silliness and atrociousness that 's quite tasty in a so-execrable-it's-downright-awesome sort of way . Richard Crenna , looking haggard and possibly inebriated , and Yvette Mimieux , who act a if she never got over the brutal rape she endured in `` Jackson County Jail , '' sluggishly portray a disgustingly nice and respectable suburbanite couple whose quaint , dull , sleepy small town existence get ripped asunder when the cute German Shepard they take in a the family pet turn out to be some ancient lethal evil spirit . Pretty soon Mimieux and her two repellently cutesy kid Kim Richards and Ike Eisenmann ( the psychic alien moppet from the Disney `` Witch Mountain '' picture ) are worshiping a crude crayon drawing of the nasty , ugly canine entity in the den . Boy , now doe n't that sound really scary and disturbing ? Well , scary and disturbing this laughably ludicrous claptrap sure ai n't , but it sure is funny , thanks to Curtis ( `` Night Tide '' ) Harrington 's hopelessly weak direction , cartoonish ( not so ) special effect , an almost painfully risible'n'ridiculous plot , and a game cast that struggle valiantly with the absurd story ( besides the lead , both Martine Beswicke and R.G . Armstrong briefly pop up a member of a Satanic cult and Victor Jory ha a nice cameo a a helpful Native American shaman ) . Favorite scene : the malicious Mephestophelion mutt put the whammy on Crenna , practically forcing him to stick his hand into a wildly spinning lawnmower blade . While stuck-up snobby fright film fan may hold their nose at the perfectly putrid stench of this admittedly smelly schlock , devout TV trash lover should deem this endearingly abominable offal the boob tube equivalent to Alpo .

It is easy to tell early in this movie exactly what will happen , and who will die . It is about 4 woman and a man who on a vacation . This movie , like the others of that era , contrives to bring this about , and the viewer know this . There is no mystery or suspense . For some reason , the guy is attracted to the blonde , who is really not much to look at , and ignores a super hot looking brunette that any heterosexual man would go nut over . One must remember that in the seventy , movie were meant to appeal to woman and not men . Totally crap and totally depressing .

Marion Davies star in this remarkable comedy `` Show People '' released by MGM in 1928 . Davies play a hick from Savannah , Georgia , who arrives in Hollywood with her father ( Dell Henderson ) . The jalopy they arrive in is a hoot - a is Davies outrageous southern costume . Davies land a job in slapstick comedy , not what she want , but it brings her success . She meet fellow slapstick star William Haines , who is immediately smitten with her . Well , Davies then get a job at a more prestigious studio ( `` High Art Studios '' ) and land a job in stuffy period piece . A handsome but fake actor ( Andre Telefair ) show her the rope of how to be the typical pretentious Hollywood star . Davies abandon her slapstick friend and father for the good life , but of course learns that is not who she really is . Marion Davies is wonderful throughout , a she - outrageously - run the gamut of emotion required of a `` serious '' actress . William Haines is his usual wonderful comedic self , and there are cameo by Charles Chaplin , John Gilbert , and other famous star of the day , including the director of the film , King Vidor . This is a silent film with a few `` sound effect '' a sound picture were just coming into their own . A treasure of a film .

The performance of every actor and actress ( in the film ) are excellently NATURAL which is what movie acting should be ; and the directing skill is so brilliantly handled on every detail that I am never tired of seeing it over and over again . However , I am rather surprised to see that this film is not included in some of the actor ' and director , Attenborough 's credit that puzzle me : are n't they proud of making a claim that they have made such excellent , long lasting film for the audience ? I am hoping I would get some answer to my puzzle from some one ( possibly one of the `` knowledgeable '' personnel ( insider ) of the film .

While Star Trek the Motion Picture wa mostly boring , Star Trek The Final Frontier is plain bad . In this terrible sequel , the crew is on shore leave when they get a distress signal from the Federation that ambassador representing Earth , Romulus and Kronos ( the Klingon home world ) have been kidnapped by a renegade Vulcan bent on his quest to attain a starship to venture into the great barrier . There , he hope to find God . Using mysticism and bad writing , he persuades many of the senior officer of the Enterprise to betray Kirk and get a hold of the ship . They do reach the inside of the great barrier and find a planet where they do meet a god-like alien . This one is so bad it is hard to figure out where to begin . At the core is a good idea that is never really developed . The plot go nowhere instead of where no man ha gone before . It is almost like the writer had no idea how to end this fiasco . The action scene do n't have the suspense of Wrath of Kahn , the philosophy is boring , and the humor is stale . Now I will focus most of my anger on William Shatner . When he take the director 's chair , the ego get bigger . Most of the focus is on him , Spock , and McCoy , but doe not give the others enough to do . Moreover , whereas Shatner is usually guilty of over-acting in previous movie and television spot , he is just plain bad in this one . Now Kirk is reckless , a practical joker , and silly . One of the worst scene involves the three leader singing the song , `` Row Row Row your Boat '' in a round by a campfire . In any case , this is the worst of the Star Trek franchise . I should have given it three out of ten instead of five .

Despite later claim , this early-talkie melodrama ha very little in common with `` Citizen Kane '' : It 's a biopic of a ruthless but human fictional plutocrat , told in flashback but hopping around time . The scriptwriter , Preston Sturges , show none of his later gift for sparkling dialog , and none of the myriad cinematic innovation of `` Kane '' are evident . Still , it 's very watchable , with a young Spencer Tracy ( his old-man makeup make him look just like , well , an old Spencer Tracy ) showing depth and authority , and Colleen Moore -- a little past her prime , and not physically well matched -- playing a multifaceted woman-behind-the-man . There 's also Helen Vinson a one of the most treacherous femmes fatales in movie history , sending the final third into ecstatic soap-opera reverberation . The surviving print is jumpy and ha missing audio snippet , and there are some plot hole left open ( how would she know whose son it wa if she 's sleeping with both of them ? ) , and the music is awfully hokey . For all that , I wa quite fascinated .

This is the best version ( so far ) that you will see and the most true to the Bronte work . Dalton is a little tough to imagine a Rochester who Jane Eyre declared `` not handsome '' . But his acting overcomes this and Zelah Clark , pretty a she is , is also a complete and believable Jane Eyre . This production is a lengthy watch but well worth it . Nearly direct quote from the book are in the script and if you want the very first true 'romance ' in literature , this is the way to see it . I own every copy of this movie and have read and re-read the original . The filming may seem a little dated now but there will never be another like this .

Apparently , the people that wrote the back of the box did not bother to watch this so-called `` movie . '' They described `` blindingly choreographed intrigue and violence . '' I saw no `` intrigue . '' I instead saw a miserable attempt at dialogue in a supposed kung fu movie . I saw no `` violence . '' At least , I saw nothing which could cause me to suspend my disbelief a to what could possibly hurt a man with `` impervious '' skin -- but here I am perhaps revealing too much of the `` plot . '' Furthermore , a a viewer of many and sundry film ( some of which include the occasional kung fu movie ) , I can authoritatively say that this piece of celluloid is unwatchable . Whatever you may choose to do , I will always remain Correct , Jonathan Tanner P.S . I wa not blinded by the choreography .

I liked Boyle 's performance , but that 's about the only positive thing I can say . Everything wa overdone to the point of absurdity . Most of the actor spoke like you would expect your 9-year-old nephew to speak if he were pretending to be a jaded , stone-hearted cop , or an ultra-evil villain . The raspy voice-overs seemed amateurish to me . I could go buy a cheap synthesizer and crank out better opening music . And what 's with the whole 1984ish police torture stuff ? It wa totally superfluous and had nothing to do with the actual event of the story . Cox added a lot of thing , in fact , that he apparently thought would be really cool , but had nothing to do with the story . That 's a big disappointment because one of the thing that make Borges ' story so good is his minimalism -- they are tightly bound , with no superfluous detail . This movie is just the opposite . I stopped watching after the scene where Lonnrot is questioning the guy from the Yidische Zaitung , or thereabouts . I wasted $ 4 renting this , but at least I can get some satisfaction from writing this review and hopefully saving others from making the same mistake .

The Assignment is an outstanding thriller with several plot twist driven by character , rather than star turn , the need to stage special effect , obligatory romance , and endless car chase . However , there is a car chase in here , and a dandy it is . Aidan Quinn is wonderful a both the terrorist and the naval officer `` recruited '' to eliminate him . It is rare that a second or third tier actor , such a Quinn , is given an important starring role like this that carry a film . Usually , such a role is given to an A-list actor with box office draw , which is probably why I never heard of this film before I saw it . Donald Sutherland is great a the morally ambiguous , somewhat creepy at time , agent that recruit Quinn . Ben Kingsley is fine also a the Israeli agent . The plot is very complex and there are multiple story line , which converge in gradual fashion toward the end , and not all at once a we 're used to seeing . The paranoia and claustrophobia of these type of thriller is captured and portrayed with both moral ambiguity and frightening intensity . The location are convincing and effective . The soundtrack is nothing special , but rarely do we get all of the above mentioned quality these day , without dumb and/or meaningless plot development ; unconvincing star turn ; loud , annoying , music video type soundtrack ; a villain that ham it up ; and repeatedly a cast , costume , and plot that cater mostly to an audience under 25 . This is an outstanding thriller , which most assuredly did not get it just due upon it release . * * * 1/2 of 4 star .

this is one of the finest movie i have ever seen .... the stark scenery ... the isolation ... the ignorant bigoted people hiding behind their religion ... a backdrop for some wordliness and sophistication ... the acting is completely natural ... but for me a a '' foodie ' the best is the actual choosing and preparation of the feast .. i have spent time in paris and know the cuisine well ... whether or not the cafe anglais really exists i do n't know but i do know of similar establishment and babette 's menu and choice of wine are authentic ... and of course the end where despite themselves the perfect meal mellows them back to friendship is the only ending there could be .. this is a 10 out of 10 film and should be seen by anyone with enough brain and taste to understand it

Set in the 1794 , the second year of the French republic formed after the execution of Louis XVI , this film portrays the power struggle between the revolutionary leader Danton ( Gerard Depardieu , at his finest ) and Robespierre ( a commanding performance by the Polish actor Wojciech Pszoniak ) . The moderate revolutionary Danton ha returned to Paris from his country seat where he ha been since being deposed a leader of the Committee of Public Safety in the previous year by Robespierre . He is opposed to `` The Reign Of Terror '' which ha resulted in the execution of thousand of citizen , mainly by guillotine , who are thought to be opposed to the Revolution . Danton is confident of the support of the ordinary people and try to persuade Robespierre to curb the bloodletting . But Robespierre and the Committee are afraid that the popularity of Danton will lead to them being overthrown , and put Danton and his supporter on trial for being traitor . This wa the first French language film made by Andrzej Wajda after he had arrived in France from Poland . His Polish film company wa closed down by the government due to his support for the Solidarity trade union , which had opposed the Polish government in the late seventy and early eighty . His previous film `` Man Of Iron '' ( 1981 ) had dealt with the Solidarity union and it leader Lech Walesa , and it is easy to draw comparison between the relationship of Walesa and the Polish leader General Jaruselski , and that between Danton and Robespierre . Danton/Walesa are the voice of reason opposed to Robespierre/Jaruselski who continue dictatorial rule despite having lost the support of the people they claim to represent . The film is based on the Polish play `` The Danton Affair '' written by Stanislawa Przybyszewska in the 1930s , and on it release the film wa criticised by some for being static and theatrical . But what the film doe is to concentrate on the behind-the-scenes meeting of the Committees and the scene in the National Assembly and the courtroom rather than the activity on the street of Paris .

I have now seen quite a few film by Pedro Almodóvar , but this would have to be the most disappointing so far . This film seemed to lack the zaniness that is usually everywhere in his film , and the story just never got me interested . Many Almodóvar regular appear in this film , so it 's not like there wa a lack of on-screen talent , but this film just seemed more serious than his other film . If there wa a comedic edge to this movie , I certainly could n't find it , and it made for one surprisingly weak movie .

I greatly enjoyed Margaret Atwood 's novel 'The Robber Bride ' , and I wa thrilled to see there wa a movie version . A woman frame a cop boyfriend for her own murder , and his buddy , an ex-cop journalist , try to clear his name by checking up on the dead woman 's crazy female friend . It 's fortunate that the movie script fix Ms. Atwood 's clumsy plotting by focusing on the story of these two men , victim of scheming woman ... Heh . Okay , you got me . If these guy are mentioned in the book , and I 'm pretty sure they 're entirely made up for the movie , I 'll eat the dust cover of my hardback copy . Apparently , the three main female character of the novel are n't enough to carry the movie . Zenia 's manipulation are n't interesting unless we see them happen to a man , and a man 's life is screwed up . Roz , Charis , and Toni tell their story -- to a man . Because it 's not important if a man doe n't hear them . I liked the character in the book . It hurt to see them pushed off to the side for a man 's story . I normally do not look for feminist angle on medium , and I tried to enjoy the movie a is . If I had n't read the book , I might have enjoyed the movie a lot more . So if you like the cop and the ex-cop , and you want to read more about them , you 're out of luck . Read the novel , if you want to enjoy luscious prose and characterization subtly layered through a plot . It 's the same plot : the movie excavated it , ironed it , and sprinkled it with male angst . It 's like Zenia 's revenge on Margaret Atwood .

Ingrid Bergman , playing dentist Walter Matthau 's faithful receptionist who harbor a little crush on her bos , is absolutely wonderful in this film . She handle the witty repartee in the script with aplomb and steal a terrific scene where she and Goldie Hawn talk in a record booth ( Ingrid 's monologue is a front , but her face tell you she belief in it with all her heart ) . Matthau is an odd choice for the leading man ( he 's too old for Goldie Hawn and too unrefined for Bergman , not to mention too unfocused to be a dentist ) , but I liked the way he try hard to please Goldie and stumble around trying to free himself from a lie . Hawn ( who won a Supporting Oscar ) is just a fresh and bubbly a she is today . This bedroom farce is n't terribly sophisticated ( and faintly reminds one of `` Any Wednesday '' besides ) , but it 's a welcome relief from the noisy , teen-oriented comedy they turn out today . `` Cactus Flower '' is a lovely sigh ! * * * from * * * *

`` A bored television director is introduced to the black art and astral projection by his girlfriend . Learning the ability to separate his spirit from his body , the man find a renewed interest in his life and a sense of wellbeing . Unfortunately , the man discovers while he is sleeping , his spirit leaf his body and his uncontrolled body roams the street in a murderous rampage , '' according to the DVD sleeve 's synopsis . The synopsis is n't entirely correct , a it turn out . Anyway , the movie open with a dizzying `` out-of-body '' example of handsome director Winston Rekert ( a Paul Sharpe ) 's newly discovered `` astral body '' experience ; it also foreshadows an upcoming dogfight . Young Andrew Bednarski ( a Matthew Sharpe ) , being a kid , draw picture of `` The Blue Man '' , a his murder spree begin . Handsome detective John Novak ( a Stewart Kaufman ) discovers the victim are connected to Mr. Rekert . Mr. Novak 's investigation lead to the supernatural ; a prime example of which is Karen Black ( a Janus ) , with whom Rekert fear he is falling in love . Several in the cast perform well ; but , `` The Blue Man '' wind up tying itself up in a knot . Aka `` Eternal Evil '' , it unsatisfying story try to be far too clever for it own good .

Ah yes the 1980s , a time of Reaganomics and Sly , Chuck and a host of other action star hiding in a remote jungle blowing away commie . At the time I couldn ` t believe how movie like RAMBO , MISSING IN ACTION and UNCOMMON VALOR ( And who can forget the ridiculous RED DAWN ? ) made money at the box office , they ` re turgid action crap fests with a rather off putting right wing agenda and they have dated very badly . TROMA ` S WAR is a tongue in cheek take on these type of movie but you ` ve got to ask yourself did they need spoofing in the first place ? Of course not . TROMA ` S WAR lack any sort of sophistication - though it doe make the point that there ` s no real difference between right wing tyrant and left wing one - and sometimes feel more like a grade z movie than a send up . Maybe it is ?

This tale based on two Edgar Allen Poe piece ( `` The Fall of the House of Usher '' , `` Dance of Death '' ( poem ) ) is actually quite creepy from beginning to end . It is similar to some of the old black-and-white movie about people that meet in an old decrepit house ( for example , `` The Cat and the Canary '' , `` The Old Dark House '' , `` Night of Terror '' and so on ) . Boris Karloff play a demented inventor of life-size doll that terrorize the guest . He dy early in the film ( or doe he ? ) and the resident of the house are subjected to a number of terrifying experience . I wo n't go into too much detail here , but it is definitely a must-see for fan of old dark house mystery . Watch it with plenty of popcorn and soda in a darkened room . Dan Basinger 8/10

`` Revolt of the Zombies '' prof that having the same director revamp and recycle an idea doe n't necessarily make lightning strike twice . The Halperin brother , responsible for the horror classic `` White Zombie '' , made this trite piece of garbage a mere few year later to cash in on it popularity and even recycled close-ups of Lugosi 's eye from that previous film . There wa a court battle with the `` White Zombie '' film 's right owner , who did n't want the Halperins to be able to use the word 'zombie ' in this title . That word wa the only thing that could help this film , because , a everyone know , bad film can make much more money simply by having the word 'Zombie ' appear in the title . Knowing what Victor Halperin wa capable of a few year before only make this uninteresting film more insulting . It seems he never directed another horror film after this debacle . The zombie here seem not to be true walking dead , but simply hypnotism victim . Wan na create a mind-controlled army of zombie ? Be ready to crack a few egg , including your own . THE LAME PLOT : Man fall in love with scheming woman who play with his heart and becomes engaged to him only to make his friend , whom she love , jealous . This sends man into a spiral of madness in which he try using zombie mind-control technique to change thing to his advantage in an attempt to win over a woman who is n't worth spit . This includes one of the most blatantly obvious plot development I 've ever seen . You 'd have to be blind or stupid not to see the ending coming . The acting is n't even good . This movie make the racially insensitive `` King of the Zombies '' ( which appeared on the same double bill DVD I bought ) seems like an atmospheric horror masterpiece by comparison and reminds u that not every black and white film is a classic . It make the atomic age sci-fi alien zombie cheese fest `` Invisible Invaders '' seem like a serious drama . This is one big ball of cheese so ridiculously melodramatic it could probably make many a Korean film fan twitch ( South Korean film are often known for their use of melodrama ) . The credit list the ironically named company Favorite Films . I 'm not sure whose favorite film this would be , but they 're obviously an idiot . Not recommended for fan of : zombie , romance , or classic film .

Two hour ago I wa watching this brilliant movie which overwhelmed me with it imprisoning photography . It is quite understandable how it won the prize of Best Camera in Cannes 2000 . Only two person are principally to be seen in most of it . An interesting music and especially three song or theme accompanied the movie nearly all the time . Each one of these theme represented a certain atmosphere during the whole movie . Silence and slow movement characterize the movie . Some scene were extended moment or a serious of close-ups . Not only Tony Leung deserves a prize for his superb acting since Maggie Cheung wa also so brilliant . I wonder how many dress she wa wearing in the different scene .
