In short I would recommend the fan of artistic movie to watch it in the cinema .

Luckily for Bill Murray this is such a light-weight project since he pretty much ha to carry it . Meatballs is the story of low-rent Camp Northstar and how it counselor deal with the camper a well a one another . Then there is much made of their wealthy rival from across the lake named Camp Mohawk which culminates in a two-day Olympiad competition . Above it all is Bill Murray clowning around and making a pretty memorable film debut . The film is sprinkled with medium-sized laugh , chuckle , and more than a few guffaw along the way . The biggest laugh come from the prank played on the nerdy camp director . Three of them involve the counselor moving his bed outside in various location while he 's sleeping . Morty , or `` Micky '' a everyone call him , wake up along the side of a road , strung up in some tree several foot above the ground , and finally floating on a raft in the middle of the lake ! There are also some funny moment involving the counselor hitting on one another , but this is a PG rated film with little in the way of raunchiness . The film take a serious note involving a shy camper named Rudy who is played by Chris Makepeace . Of course it 's up to Murray to teach the kid how to open up , and give him the confidence he need to run a marathon during the Olympiad . The sentimentality of Rudy 's situation seems tacked on to a great degree . Notice how when Murray first see the kid sitting alone in the grass after getting off the bus he tell him , `` you must be the short depressed kid we ordered . '' Makes you wonder if that line wa really in the script or Murray wa just ad-libbing while the camera were rolling . In other word , Murray might a well have said to Makepeace , `` you must be that actor we hired to play the stereotypical lonely kid you see in most summer camp film who doe n't fit in . '' But before it 's all over , Murray 's performance make this plot device more than bearable . He really seems to have some good chemistry with Makepeace . The film culminates with the game between the two rival camp . Very little of the event we are shown are even slightly believable , but `` it just doe n't matter '' . This is a pretty good film on many level . Do n't let the absurd 5.6 rating this film is currently getting scare you off . Murray will keep you laughing throughout . Just be warned ..... avoid the sequel ! ! ! ! Especially the one with Corey Feldman ! ! 8 of 10 star . The Hound .

`` The Danish Bladerunner '' is boldly stated on the box . Are you kidding me ? ! This film is a complete drag . When I 'm thirsty and go for a soda in the kitchen , I usually pause the vcr , so I wo n't miss anything . Not this time . I actually found myself looking long and hard in the fridge , just so I would n't have to go back . One of the premise of film , is that our hero ( who 's a hacker ) , ha a little computerassistant to help him ( the Microsoft Office paperclip finally caught on in the future ) . When he loses the assistant in the movie , he 's helpless and ca n't get into any computer . HE 'S A HACKER ! It 's like saying , that you ca n't drive your car , if you do n't have your lucky `` driving-cap '' on . I wo n't even go into the lightning-effect when he recieves electroshock ...

Anyone who think Kool Moe Dee , Carol Alt , and Corey Feldman comprise a list of good actor must be smoking something I 'd love to try sometime . Where to begin : lousy soundtrack , hammy acting , `` action '' in place . This is the typical amateurishly written hack fodder that washed-up has-been and never-was 's love to star in . I actually felt embarrassed for the `` star '' in this `` film '' . The only thespian missing to top this turd wa Gary Coleman , who if he would have been in the movie , would have made it at least somewhat howlingly bad , rather than just plain bad . There wa one part in the film where Carol Alt screamed , `` DO YOU THINK I 'M AN IDIOT ? ! ? '' Yes , Carol , I do , your agent doe , and PLEASE for the love of all that is decent and holy ... GO AWAY and stop degrading yourself like this ! This film is something Anna Nicole Smith would take part in . This film could have been a decent re-make , and gosh know it tried ( or Ms. English tried ) . Assembling talented actor together with a successful & experienced writer/director should be a formula for a decent film . But Ms. English 's experience - according to her IMDb bio - is exclusively limited to television work , and it is glaringly obvious throughout this film . I am surprised that none of the review I have read mention what I found most unlikeable about this film , and what kept it from reaching even a portion of it potential : it looked and felt like it wa made for television . To give some credit to Ms. English , many of the joke that simply did NOT work on a movie screen would have been terrific on TV ( and maybe a laugh track would have helped ) . So much of the camera usage and the lighting would have played out fine on TV but looked awkward or odd on a big screen . If the whole film had been chopped up into a mini-series or a sit-com , I think it could have worked . But this is cinema and sadly Ms. English 's talent did n't translate . I cringed at so many different point in my embarrassment for the actor & the writer that I felt like I came out of the theater half shriveled ! Meg Ryan is her usual perky , cute self ( except for the awful plastic surgery she ha had on her face ) , but where did she have a chance to use her talent ? ! She ha made film where she doe n't recreate her stereo-typed role and done them well ... but not here . Annette Bening seemed to simply go through the motion - such a great talent and yet such a poor performance ! I enjoyed the other woman character but they were more caricature than substance , and it wa sad to see . What worked in this film in the 1930s doe n't translate to the 2000s , and no one helped Ms. English get the change & update or subtlety right . If only she ( a writer , director AND producer ) had reached out for some assistance , I think it could have been good . But it wa not . It 's so frustrating to go to a movie that ha good star and a good writer or director and come away feeling it wa a waste of everyone 's time & money ! This New Yorker cartoon I saw yesterday is appropriate : A few movie exec are having a meeting & the caption read : `` Let 's remake a classic with worse everything ! ''

I find it very intriguing that Lee Radziwill , Jackie Kennedy 's sister and the cousin of these woman , would encourage the Maysles ' to make `` Big Edie '' and `` Little Edie '' the subject of a film . They certainly could be considered the `` skeleton '' in the family closet . The extra feature on the DVD include several contemporary fashion designer crediting some of their idea to these oddball woman . I 'd say that anyone interested in fashion would find the discussion by these designer fascinating . ( i.e . `` Are they nut ? Or am I missing something ? '' ) . This movie is hard to come by . Netflix doe not have it . Facets doe , though .

C'mon guy some previous reviewer have nearly written a novel commenting on this episode . It 's just an old 60 's TV show ! This episode of Star Trek is notable because of the most serious babe ( Yeoman Barrow 's ) ever used on Star Trek and the fact that it wa filmed in a real outdoor location . Unlike the TNG and Voyager series which were totally confined to sound stage . This use of an outdoor location ( and babe ) give proper depth and an almost film like quality to a quite ordinary episode of this now dated and very familiar show . Except a few notable exception i.e `` The city on the edge of forever '' , `` assignment Earth '' and `` Tomorrow is Yesterday '' The old series of Star Trek need to be seriously moth-balled and put out of it 's boring misery . Half a dozen good episode from 79 is quite a poor batting average . This is typical of the boring stuff Gene Roddenberry produced back then actually , contrary to popular belief where some people worshiped the ground he walked on , he actually made a LOT of rubbish ! He doe n't deserve to be spoken of in the same breath a Irwin Allen for example . Just look at the set of the bridge of the Enterprise from a modern point of view . They used wobbly plywood for the floor , cafeteria chair with plastic back and cheap cardboard above the instrument panel . You can clearly see the fold in the paper ! Every expense spared or what !

I just watched this movie on it 's premier night out of curiosity and sheer nostalgia . I liked ( not loved ) `` Mork & Mindy '' a a kid , mostly for Robin William 's zany energetic performance . This movie made me remember why . Was the original show great ? Not really , but Robin certainly wa . Which brings me to this movie . I wa pleasantly surprised , expecting nothing more than a paint by number chronological retelling of the show ( which in a way it wa ) . But , of course , the real focus wa on Robin . It wa interesting to see Robin 's journey from struggling street jester to national t.v star , and how such a drastic difference affected him and his long suffering wife . And my hat is off to star Chris Diamantopoulos a he portrayed Mr. Williams with integrity , sensitivity , and heart ; not just a cute impression , although it wa even dead-on . ( On an unrelated note , I noticed that Robin 's struggle were in some way similar to Andy Kaufman , who wa under-appreciated by network t.v . and held back creatively , but that 's the `` Taxi '' behind the scene biopic . ) All in all , this wa a very enjoyable flick , in which I felt I got to know a little more of the man behind the Orkan . The acting wa solid by all- never melodramatic like I suspected- and the story moved along well . Performances that were particularly good were by those who played Garry Marshall and John Belushi ( the scene in which Belushi heckle Robin wa a hoot ! ) . Not a great masterpiece by any mean ( I would have liked to have seen a tad more about Pam Dawber ) , but definitely watchable , especially for those Robin Williams and `` Mork & Mindy '' fan out there . Nanoo , nanoo !

I caught this film on AZN on cable . It sounded like it would be a good film , a Japanese `` Green Card '' . I ca n't say I 've ever disliked an Asian film , quite the contrary . Some of the most incredible horror film of all time are Japanese and Korean , and I am a HUGE fan of John Woo 's Hong Kong film . I an not adverse to a light hearted film , like Tampopo or Chung King Express ( two of my favourite ) , so I thought I would like this . Well , I would rather slit my wrist and drink my own blood than watch this laborious , badly acted film ever again . I think the director Steven Okazaki must have spiked the water with Quaalude , because no one in this film had a personality . And when any of the character DID try to act , a opposed to mumbling a line or two , their performance came across a forced and incredibly fake . I honestly did not think that anyone had ever acted before ... the ONLY person who sounded genuine wa Brenda Aoki .. I find it amazing that this is promoted a a comedy , because I did n't laugh once . Even MORE surprising is that CBS morning news called this `` a refreshing breath of comedy '' . It wa neither refreshing , nor a breath of comedy . And the ending wa very predictable , the previous reviewer must be an idiot to think such thing . AVOID this film unless you want to see a boring predictable plot line and wooden acting . I actually think that `` Spike of Bensonhurst '' is a better acted film than this ... and I walked out half way through that film !

Before I begin , let me get something off my chest : I 'm a huge fan of John Eyres ' first film PROJECT : SHADOWCHASER . The film , a B-grade cross of both THE TERMINATOR & DIE HARD , may not be the work of a cinematic genius , but is a hugely entertaining action film that became a cult hit ( & spawned two sequel & a spin off ) . Judge and Jury begin with Joseph Meeker , a convicted killer who wa sent to Death Row following his capture after the so-called `` Bloody Shootout '' ( which seems like a poor name for a killing spree  Meeker kill three people while trying to rob a convenience store ) , being led to the electric chair . There is an amusing scene where Meeker talk to the priest about living for sex but meeting his one true love ( who wa killed during the shootout ) , expressing his revenge for the person who killed her  Michael Silvano , a washed-up football star who spends his day watching his son Alex practicing football with his high school team ( and end up harassing his son 's coach ) . But once executed , Meeker return a a revenant ( or a Kelly Perine call `` a hamburger without the fry '' ) , whose sole aim is to get his revenge , which basically mean making Silvano 's life a misery . Let me point out the fact that Judge and Jury is not a true horror film . It is a supernatural action film , with Meeker chasing Silvano , using his ability to change form ( which amount to David Keith dressing up a everything from an Elvis impersonator , a French chef ( with an accent a bad a his moustache ) , a drag queen , a clown & a stand-up comedian ) , a shotgun which fire explosive round & an invulnerability to death ( although that doe n't stop Martin Kove from shooting Keith with a Desert Eagle ) , to pay Silvano back for killing Meeker 's wife . Director John Eyres doe not seem interested in characterisation , instead focusing solely on action scene , which the film ha plenty of . But that is the film 's main flaw , since there 's nothing to connect the action scene together . The acting is surprisingly good , with Keith delivering the best performance , supported ably by Kove , a well a Paul Koslo , who play the washed-up cop quite well . Kelly Perine is annoying a the cabbie who try to help but make the situation worse .

Ye Lou 's film Purple Butterfly pit a secret organization ( Purple Butterfly ) against the Japanese force in war torn Shanghai . Ding Hui ( Zhang Ziyi ) and her ex-lover Hidehiko Itami ( Toru Nakamura ) find themselves on opposite side of the conflict after a chance meeting . I agree with the reviewer from Paris . The film substitute a convoluted , semi-historical conflict for a plot , without giving the audience a single reason to care about the character or their cause . The sudden time shifting doe n't help matter a it appears completely unwarranted and pointless . Normally I do n't mind dark movie , but the absence of light , the bone-jarringly shaky camera footage , and the generally bad film-making technique really make this a tough film to watch and stay interested in . I also agree with the viewer from Georgia that this film `` ha a chaotic editing style and claustrophobic cinematography '' , but I do n't think that help the movie . The backdrop to the film is one of the most potent event of the 20th Century , and I do n't believe you can do it any justice by editing it a if it were a Michael Bay film . The overly melodramatic moment do n't add to it watchability . The actor are all suitably melancholy . Zhang Ziyi once again show that she ha an exceptionally limited acting range a she spends the entire movie doing what she seems to do best in all her film , brooding and looking generally annoyed . However , at least she add some variety to this role by chainsmoking and engaging in the worst love-making scene since Michael Biehn and Linda Hamilton in The Terminator . All in all , a very disappointing film , especially seeing a how it come from the director of Suzhou He . 2/10

After hearing about George Orwell 's prophetic masterpiece for all of my life , I 'm now 37 , but never having read the book , I am totally confused a to what I 've just seen . I am very familiar with the concept covered in the novel , a i 'm sure most are , but only through hearsay and quote . Without this limited knowledge this film would have been a complete mystery , and even with it I 'm still no more educated about the story of 1984 than I wa before I watched it . On the plus side ... The cinematography is amazing , Hurt & Burton deliver fine performance and the overall feel of the movie is wonderfully grim and desolate . The prostitute scene wa a fantastically dark piece of film making . Now for the down side , and there are plenty ... There is a war going on , ( at least a far a the propaganda is concerned ) , but why & with who ? Nothing is explained . There are a couple of name bandied about ( Eurasia etc ) , but they mean nothing without explanation . Who is Winston ? what doe he do ? where doe he come from ? where doe he work ? why is he changing news report ? why is n't he on the front line ? Why doe n't he eat the food in the canteen ? What is that drink he 's drinking through the entire film ? Why is he so weak & ill ? Why is n't he brainwashed like the rest of them ? What 's the deal with his mother & sister ? What happened to his father ? A little back story would have been nice , no scrub that , essential for those like myself that have n't read the book . Without it , this is just a confusing and hard to follow art-house movie that constantly keep you guessing at what is actually going on . The soundtrack wa dis-jointed and badly edited and the constant chatter from the Big Brother screen swamp the dialogue in place making it even harder to work out whats going on . I accept that this may have been an artistic choice but it 's very annoying all the same . Also , I know this ha been mentioned before , but why all the nudity ? It just seemed totally gratuitous and felt like it had been thrown in there to make up for the lack of any plot coverage . I personally ca n't abide the way Hollywood feel it ha to explain story line word for word these day . We are not all brainwashed simpleton , but this is a few step too far the other way . I can only imagine that it totally relies on the fact that you 've read the book because if this film really is the 'literal translation ' that I 've seen many people say , I would find it very hard to understand why 1984 is hailed a the classic it is . There 's no denying that it wa light year ahead of it 's time and ha pretty much predicted every change in our society to date , ( maybe this ha been a sort of bible to the power that be ? ) , but many sci-fi novelist have done the same without leaving gaping hole in the storyline . I guess I have to do what I should have done from the start and buy a copy of the book if i 'm to make any sense out of this . All in all , very disappointed in something I 've waited for year to watch .

This cute animated short feature two comic icon - Betty Boop and Henry . Henry is the bald , slightly portly boy from the comic who never speaks . Well here he doe speak ! He want to get a puppy from Betty Boop 's pet store , and when he is left to mind the store - some hilarious hijinks ensue . Betty sings a song about pet , Henry get in a battle with bird and a monkey , but everything work out in the end .

I just got back from this free screening , and this `` Osama Witch Project '' is the hands-down worst film I 've seen this year , worse than even `` Catwoman '' - which had the decency to at least pas itself off a fiction . In `` September Tapes , '' a `` film crew '' of `` documentary journalist '' head to Afghanistan - despite being thoroughly unprepared for the trip , the condition and , oh yeah , the psychotic and ridiculous vendetta of their filmmaker leader to avenge his wife 's death on Sept. 11 - to track down Osama bin Laden . They `` made '' eight tape on their journey , which now `` document '' their travel and , of course , their attempt to kill the terrorist leader . ( The eight tape , thankfully , all end at point significant in the narrative , which is convenient for a `` documentary . '' ) The psychotic , idiotic protagonist - who is given to long , significant speech that he probably learned watching `` MacGyver '' - care nothing for his own life or the life of his innocent crew a he get them further and further into danger through a series of completely dumb mishap . I do n't know why he did n't just wear a sign on his back that said `` Shoot me . '' The crew 's translator , supposedly their sensible voice-of-reason , doe little more than whine and get baffled a the idiot hero lead them into doom . You wish they 'd brought along someone on their trip to call them all moron . Around `` Tape 4 , '' I began rooting for the terrorist to shoot the film crew .

I remember seeing this film in the theater in 1984 when I wa 6 years-old ( you do the math ) . I absolutely loved it . I wa Tarzan for the 2 week after seeing it ( climbing the furniture , jumping around making monkey sound ) . It started a fascination with Tarzan and monkey , but oddly enough a longer lasting love for Christopher Lambert ( keep in mind that I saw Highlander very shortly after this ) . 1984 wa the last time I saw that film , until about a month ago . It happened to be on cable a I wa getting ready for bed at 3:30 am and even though it wa late and I wa tired and I had to be at work at 9:00 am , I stayed up to watch this movie that I loved a a kid . Upon viewing it I realized that it wa not that great of a film and even odder then that , that Andie MacDowell 's voice wa dubbed by someone else . Ian Holme wa of course solid a usual , and surprisingly the monkey suit still kind of held up , but what wa most surprising wa how good Lambert wa a Tarzan . He wa great ! The depth he managed to capture in so few line , his primal body language and most importantly his ability to bring this character through it extremely large ark , were just amazing . As I stated earlier I am Lambert fan , but I 'm used to Highlander , The Hunted and Fortress . In this film he wa really quite good and it is a shame that he never got a chance to portray a character with such depth again . So to make a short story way too long , I wa a little disappointed that the film wa not that good , but I wa glad to see that Lambert wa good and I do not regret staying up until 6:00am to see it .

A family is traveling through the mid West . There 's widower Ben ( Charles Bateman ) , his girlfriend Nicky ( Ahna Capri ) and Ben 's little daughter K.T . ( Geri Reischl ) . Then hit a town named Hillsboro where everyone act more than a little strangely . Their car break down and they 're forced to stay . They soon find out a witch coven ha a spell over the town and is up to incredible evil . The story is not that good . People just figure thing out of nothing and they just happen to find out where the witch are at the end . Also there are a lot of loophole left dangling at the end . The acting is pretty poor too . Bateman and Capri are bland and everybody else is about the same . Only old pro Strother Martin and L.Q . Jones give good performance . Still this movie doe work . It forgoes blood and gore ( there 's some but this is PG ) and mange to work with some very creepy visuals and atmosphere . The acting hamper a lot of it but it still work . Martin especially chew the scenery in his role . I ca n't explain exactly why I ( sort of ) like this movie but it did work on me . It 's a quiet kind of horror that is n't made anymore . Hardly a masterwork but this deserves to be rediscovered . A 7 .

Francis Ford Coppola wrote and directed this stunningly personal story of a married woman 's flight from her husband -- and the reality that perhaps the youthful glee and excitement of her younger year are behind her . We learn little about this woman 's marriage except that she ha been feeling her independence slipping away a of late ; she 's also recently learned she 's pregnant , which ha further complicated her heart ( she doe n't want to be a complacent wifey , despite the maternal way she speaks to her husband over the phone ) . She meet two men on her journey : a former college football hero who -- after an accident during a game -- ha been left with permanent brain damage , and a sexy , strutting motorcycle cop who ha a great deal of trouble in his own life . The clear , clean landscape ( a photographed by the very talented Wilmer Butler ) are astutely realized , a are the character . Shirley Knight , James Caan , and Robert Duvall each deliver strong , gripping performance , most especially since these are not very likable people in conventional term . Some scene ( such a Knight 's first call home from a pay-phone , or her first night alone with Caan where they play 'Simon Says ' ) are almost too intimate to watch . Coppola toy with reality , turning the jagged memory of his character into scrapbook we 've been made privy to . He allows scene to play out , yet the editing is quite nimble and the film is never allowed to get too heavy ( there are at least two or three very frisky moment ) . It 's a heady endeavor -- so much so that the picture wa still being shown at festival nearly five year later . Some may shun Coppola 's unapologetic twisting of event in order to underline the finale with bitter irony , however the forcefulness and drive behind the picture nearly obliterate it shortcoming . * * * from * * * *

This movie wa not very well directed . they almost totally disregarded the book.I guess they were trying 2 save time . the only upside 2 me wa that the actor who played finny wa cute . Some of the dialog between the main character appeared a little gay which wa not the case in the book . Major part of the book were once again chopped out.You lost the over all effect it wa not a haunting a the book and left me lacking severely . Also the strong language although it wa brief wa very unnecessary . Also i wa surprised ( not pleasantly ) by a new character that wa no where in the book.One of my favorite character ( leper ) wa poorly interpreted and portrayed . He seemed more sinister in the movie than the real leper wa in the book . Over all disappointing .

The buzz for this film ha always been about the fabulous graphic that make Kevin Bacon disappear . Sadly , they stopped there . They should have continued to make the script disappear , then the silly set , and finally every visible element of this film . Because , there 's nothing else there to show . Gary Thompson and Andrew Marlowe are listed a the writing credit for this film . I do n't really think they exist . I think they bought this script at `` Scripts-R-Us '' , where you buy a standard blank `` Monster Movie '' script and just fill in the blank . There 's a monster stalking u . Let 's split up . ( They actually `` let 's split up '' in this movie ) . Hit Alien/Giant-bug/Monster/Invisible-man with crowbar . Not dead yet . Burn Huge-rabbit/Shark/Invisible-man in unsurvivable fire . Not dead yet . You know , the standard stuff . Even the minimum number of element that were specific to an invisible man movie ( IR glass , spraying with something like paint ) were handled badly . What is sad is that there were lot of possibility for this to be a fascinating movie . They psychological issue for the subject , the deterioration of the mind due to the process , treating an invisible subject , and many other idea were touched on for usually le than 2 second and would have been far more interesting . Had there been any desire to save Kevin Bacon in the end , it would have been a much better movie . All in all , it stunk . I would mention some of the incredibly stupid element of the ending of the movie , but I do n't want to do any spoiler . Suffice it to say that these character are so stupid they do n't think about pulling the plug on a machine rather than ...

A young girl becomes a war-time marine 's pen-pal , and when he visit at war 's end expecting someone a bit more `` available , '' comic complication ensue . All ultimately work out well , naturally , but not before everyone involved ha thoroughly chewed the scenery . Errol Flynn 's dead-on impression of Humphrey Bogart from `` Casablanca '' is a highlight , a are various send-ups of his own swashbuckling image ( the `` jumping '' scene in the kitchen with Forrest Tucker is a riot ) . It is Tucker , though , who `` tuck '' the movie under his arm , lower his head and barrel over the goal line . He demonstrates the comic flair more fully developed twenty year later in `` F-Troop '' and imparts a liveliness and energy that Flynn repeatedly play off to raise his own performance . Eleanor Parker doe a fine job a the woman being pursued , and little Patti Brady charm a Tucker 's actual pen-pal friend . A fine , lightweight `` coming home '' comedy in a genteel setting that child and romantic of all age should find entertaining .

This movie is a perfect adaptation of the English Flick Unfaithful . Ashmit play the role of Richard Gere , Emran that of Olivier and Malikka the perfect cheating wife role of Lane.They have changed the second half of the film to adapt for the Indian mass . Even then the movie ha got the full trace of Unfaithful , though it could n't catch up with the original . It wa a cheap soft porn of the Bollywood lover , where Mallika showed a lot more skin than anyone dared to show . Emran did more role like this and wa even nicknamed the serial killer . In the future if the Indian Directors plan to remake a English movie then they have to look into the feasibility of the plot with the Indian Censors . Though the film bombed at the box office , the actor got the undue recognition . In future the director should be a little more careful in remaking a Oscar nominated film . All said , this is not a family film , so take the extra caution while watching it at home with family .

Robert Altman 's downbeat , new-fangled western from Edmund Naughton 's book `` McCabe '' wa overlooked at the time of it release but in the past year ha garnered a sterling critical following . Aside from a completely convincing boom-town scenario , the character here do n't merit much interest , and the picture look ( intentionally ) brackish and unappealing . Bearded Warren Beatty play a turn-of-the-century entrepreneur who settle in struggling community on the outskirt of nowhere and help organize the first brothel ; once the profit start coming in , Beatty is naturally menaced by city tough who want part of the action . Altman creates a solemn , wintry atmosphere for the movie which give the audience a certain sense of time and place , but the action in this sorry little town is limited -- most of the story being made up of vignette -- and Altman 's pacing is deliberately slow . There 's hardly a statement being made ( just the opposite , in fact ) and the languid actor stare at each other without much on their mind . It 's a self-defeating picture , and yet , in an Altman-quirky way , it wear defeat proudly . * * from * * * *

What seemed at first just another introverted French flick offering no more than baleful sentiment became for me , on second viewing , a genuinely insightful and quite satisfying presentation . Spoiler of sort follows . Poor Cedric ; he apparently did n't know what hit him . Poor audience ; we were at first caught up in what seemed a really beautiful and romantic story only to be led back and forth into the dark reality of mismatch . These two guy just did n't belong together from their first ambiguous encounter . As much a Mathieu and Cedric were sexually attracted to each other , the absence of a deeper emotional tie made it impossible for Mathieu , an intellectual being , to find fulfillment in sharing life with someone whose sensibility were more attuned to carnival festivity and romp on the beach . On a purely technical note , I loved the camera action in this film . Subtitles were totally unnecessary , even though my French is `` presque rien . '' I could watch it again without the annoying English translation and enjoy it even more . This wa a polished , very professionally made motion picture . Though many scene seem superfluous , I rate it nine out of ten .

I do n't think I 've ever gave something a 1/10 rating , but this one easily get the denomination . I find it hard just to sit through one of his joke . It 's not just that the joke are so bad , but combine that with the fact that Carson Daily ha zero charisma , ca n't set up or finish a punchline , and you 've got a late night comedy recipe that will really turn your stomach . I have watched the show , never in it entirety , but many time still . It just creep up on me after Conan . I usually watch a minute or two just to see if Carson daily is still the worst talk show host ever . Actually if you ever do see him interviewing a guest , it 's just that , an interview . I feel so sorry every time he ha a guest on and their confused smile try to mask their body language that 's screaming , `` get me the hell away from this freak ! '' I do recommend watching the show , not for a laugh , but to ponder , how he got on the air and what he 's still doing there . Watch a much a you can , I think you will find it complete awkwardness ... interesting .

In the standard view , this is a purely awful movie . However , it rate a near perfect score on the unintentional comedy scale . I can think of few actual comedy that make me laugh a hard a I did watching this movie . Andy Griffith 's ghost dressed in Native American garb dancing sends me into hysteric everytime . I would n't waste the gas or energy driving to the video store to rent it , but if you happen to be laying on the couch at 3 in the morning and it come on TV , check it out .

From the film 's first shot - Keira Knightley a Elizabeth Bennet wandering reading through a field at dawn , thus invoking all the clichés cinema ha developed to address the phenomenon of the strong-minded rebellious female character in period drama - I knew I wa in for something to make me want to kill myself . Joe Wright seemed not only to have not read the book , but to be under the regrettable misapprehension that what he wa filming wa not in fact Jane Austen 's subtle , nuanced comedy of manner conducted through sparkling , delicate social interaction in eighteenth century English drawing-rooms , but a sort of U-certificate Wuthering Heights . Thus we were treated to every scene between Elizabeth and Darcy taking place outside for no apparent reason , in inappropriately rugged scenery and often in the pouring rain . Not to mention that Jane Austen , and in particular P & P , is not about passion , sexual tension or love . It 's about different strategy of negotiating the stultification of eighteenth century society . Which wa completely ignored , so that the Bennets ' house wa a rambunctious , chaotic place where everybody shout at once , run around , leaf their underwear on chair , and pig wander happily through the house ; the society ball become rowdy country dance one step away from a Matrix Reloaded style dance-orgy ; and everybody say exactly what they think without the slightest regard for propriety . The genius of Jane Austen lie in exploring the void created by a society in which nobody say what they think or mean because of an overwhelming regard for propriety , and the tragic predicament of her character arise from misunderstanding and miscommunications enabled by that speechless gap . So both the brilliance of Jane Austen and the very factor that allows her plot - particularly in this film - to function wa completely erased . Subtlety in general wa nowhere int his film , sacrificed in favour of an overwrought drama which jarred entirely with the material and the performance . It wa so obviously trying to be a * serious * film . The humour - which IS Pride & Prejudice , both Austen 's methodology and her appeal - wa almost entirely suppressed in favour of all this po-faced melodrama , and when it wa allowed in , wa handled so clumsily . Pride & Prejudice is a serious narrative which make serious point , yes , but those serious point and weightier theme are not just intertwined with the humour , they are embedded in it . You ca n't lose Jane Austen 's technique , leaving only the bare bone of the story , and expect the theme to remain . Not even when you replace her technique with your own heavy-handed mystical-numinous fauxbrow cinematography . Elizabeth Bennett is supposed to be a woman , an adult , mature and sensible and clear-sighted . Keira Knightley played the first half of the film like an empty-headed giggling schoolgirl , and the second half like an empty-headed schoolgirl who think she is a tragic heroine . Elizabeth 's wit , her combative verbal exchange , her quintessential characteristic of being able to see and laugh at everybody 's folly including her own , her strength and composure , and her fantastic clear-sightedness were completely lost and replaced with ... what ? A lot of giggling and staring into the distance ? Rather than being able to keep her head when all about her were losing theirs , she started to cry and scream at the slightest provocation - and not genuinely raging , either ; no , these were petulant hissy fit . And where the great strength of Austen 's Elizabeth ( at least in Austen 's eye ) wa her ability to retain integrity and observance while remaining within the boundary of society and sustaining impeachable propriety , Knightley 's Elizabeth had no regard whatsoever for convention . Furthermore , she seemed to think that wandering around barefoot in the mud in the eighteenth century version of overall established her beyond doubt a spirited and strong-minded , and therefore nothing in the character a written or the performance had to sustain it . An astonishingly unsubtle and bland performance . In which quest for blandness and weakness , she wa ably matched by Matthew Macfayden . Donald Sutherland a Mr Bennet seemed weak , ineffectual and permanently befuddled without the wicked sense of humour and ironic detachment at the expense of human relationship that make Mr Bennet so fascinating and tragic . His special bond with Lizzie , a the only two sensible people in a world of fool , wa completely lost , not least because both of them were fool in a world of fool , and that completely deprived the end of the film of emotional impact . Mr Bingley wa no longer amiable and well-meaning to the point of folly , but wa played a a complete retard for cheap laugh , and the woman who wa playing Jane wa so wildly inconsistent that she may a well not have tried to do anything with the character at all . The script veered wildly between verbatim chunk of Jane Austen - delivered with remarkable clumsiness - and totally contemporaneous language which would not be out of place in a modern day romantic comedy . Just get the BBC adaptation on DVD and save yourself the heartache .

I 've always enjoyed film that depict life a it is . Life sometimes ha boring patch , no real plot , and not necessarily a happy ending . `` A River Runs Through It '' is the perfect name for this film ( and Norman Maclean 's novel ) . Life ebb and flow like a river , and it ha it 's rough spot , but it is a wonderful trip . Robert Redford brings a lot to the film . His narration ha a friendly feel that fit the picture perfectly . As a director , he is restrained and calm , and capture some incredibly beautiful scene . As for the acting , Craig Sheffer and Brad Pitt work surprising well a brother . I do n't know quite how to describe Tom Skerritt and Brenda Blethyn 's performance , except that they truly feel real . `` A River Runs Through It '' is a wonderful film . 8.6 out of 10

Even though I 'm quite young , The Beatles are my ABSOLUTELY FAVOURITE band ! I never had the chance to hear their music a it wa release but have loved them since I can remember . It 's the sort of film that is worth trying the once . I can see why it wa n't released in the cinema but it is certainly a great film to put on the TV . I wa flicking through my TV guide and happened to see this film , it did n't much detail except something like , 'John Lennon and Paul McCartney meet after The Beatles have broken up , Jared Harris Stars ' . I 'd never heard of him ( he played John ) or Aiden Quinn who played Paul . However they are certainly underestimated actor ! The film had a slow start but a it developed , I could see how well Quinn but especially Harris played their character . As a huge fan , I sort of know what the real Lennon and McCartney are like . The script wa brilliant and Harris got Lennon 's accent , personality and mannerism spot on ! Quinn played McCartney quite well but sometimes went into his Irish accent . THe make-up artist made them look excellent . THIS PARAGRAPH MAY BE COUNTED AS A * SPOILER * : As I mentioned before , it got off to a slow start but soon developed and became quite an emotional film . I found the bit in the park a total waste of time and quite out of character for both of the musician . As for Lennon 's rude line in the Italian restaurant , totally unnecessary . The ending wa very poignant and brings a tear to my eye whenever I watch it . It is quite different from the other biographical film I 've seen where it 's about how The Beatles got together and became famous , and those never really did the character that well . E.g . 'Backbeat ' . In conclusion , I would say , if you 're a Beatles or John Lennon or Paul McCartney fan , give it a chance you may have pleasent surprise . At only about 95 minute long , it 's worth waiting for the film to develop . If anyone doe know whether the meeting of 1976 really did happen please send it to the 'comments page ' for this film , I 'd be very interested .

This is just one more of those hideous film that you find on Lifetime TV which portray the abhorrent behavior of some disgusting woman in an empathetic manner . Along with other such nasty film a `` The Burning Bed , '' `` Enough , '' or `` Monster , '' this film take a disgusting criminal and attempt to show the viewer why she 's not such a bad person after all . Give u a break ! Here 's my question to the filmmaker : If LeTourneau were a man , and Vili were a 12 year old girl , would you have made a picture sympathizing and empathizing with this person ? Answer : Hell no . Imagine switching the gender in this film , and then you 'll see just why myself and others here consider this a worthless piece of garbage . Were the gender switched , there would be no attempt to empathize with the criminal . Instead , we 'd likely be treated to a portrayal of a monstrous and hideous man preying upon a young girl , his lascivious behavior landing him in prison , and his brainwashed victim suffering from Stockholm Syndrome . The only reason LeTourneau doe not receive the same treatment in this film is by virtue of her sex . Let 's call a spade a spade . LeTourneau is a pedophile . Plain and simple . No ifs , ands or buts . She 's a criminal who belongs in prison , and deserves our derision and contempt , but certainly not our pity or empathy .

The Lives of the Saints start off with an atmospheric vision of London a a bustling city of busy , quaint street and sunshine . I wa hoping it would maintain this atmosphere , but it get bogged down in a story that go pretty much nowhere . Othello work for big , fat Mr. Karva , his crime-boss step-dad ( at least I think that is what he is supposed to be because it 's never really defined , but he doe drop kitten into deep fat frier , so trust me , he 's a prick ) doing scrappy little errand while his skanky girlfriend give daddy hand-jobs . One of his colleague is Runner , a black dude who is always dashing from A to B . Until the day he come across almost mute homeless child who grant him his wish of being able to stop running . Runner dump the lost boy in Othello 's flat , where he promptly start granting more wish . Keen to have some of his own desire fulfilled , Karva ha the boy kidnapped . But he is n't sure of what would really bring him happiness . Is it the innocence of being a child again or is it another hand-job ? Either way , I do n't want to see the little boy grant him the second . It just take age to get going and there are load of repetitive scene . The ending try to be shocking but since there 's hardly any back-story on investment in any of these character it only serf a a release for the bored audience . Writer Tony Grisoni , a favourite of Terry Gilliam , try to blend in some kind of religious allegory which end up being pretentious a all hell , ironically . If he gave u something more accessible or at least had better explanation for the character suddenly acting all weird then it would have been a more enjoyable film . As it is , we are introduced to a bunch of annoying loudmouth who then miraculously seem to develop intelligence when confronted by the mysterious boy . Who 's origin are never revealed . That 's just plain irritating ! Aside from sporadic moment of atmosphere and a moody score , this film ha little to recommend .

Adults wo n't learn anything surprising ( well , if you must , fast-forward to just before the end credit for a Educational Bit about an Interesting Cosmic Phenominon ) . We do n't usually end up doing a adult what we wanted to do a kid a reality tends to get in the way . Well , duh , I could have told you that ( so can four year of college at an art school , but I degress ) . I have no idea what the heck kid could possibly get out of this movie . Most likely it will only upset them ( we get to watch the moment when Russ wa traumatized at eight year old ) . There 's a better movie , `` Kiki 's Delivery Service '' , that ha essentially the same message but handle it litely instead of drilling it into your head . And the adult will like it too ! By the way , there is a moment in the movie made with amature MST3K-ers in mind , if they think of that OTHER Bruce Willis movie with a sad little kid in it .
