The Elegant Documentary - Do n't watch this movie ... if you 're an egotistical know-all student of physic . This much le than one percent ( miniscule fraction ) of the population may find that this show just tell them what they have already learned and already know . Do watch this movie ! - If you 're one of the massive majority of people that fall into the greater than 99 % of the population that doe not study or already have a sound knowledge of the theory of physic including Relativity , Quantum , String and M-theory . What a brilliantly architected documentary . Starting with some helpful historical background you will be lead step by elegant step into a Universe of pure magic - and dimension beyond . I have always had a huge appreciation of Mathematics . This movie can easily give you an insight into what an exquisitely beautiful language mathematics is without making you feel like you 're about to fail the grade . The show is repetitive at time a the original format wa a mini-series split over three show . It therefore make sense to give u polite little reminder of the principle being presented . I found this immensely helpful a it kept reminding me of the multitude of question and possible answer that make up this amazing tapestry of our very existence . We are all ( and everything around u ) is vibrational-energy with a natural tendency towards harmony . This movie may blow your mind - or at least help you realize that the universe is far far bigger than that which we see around u ( even with the Hubble Telescope ) and far far smaller than the proton and neutron within the atom we learned about in high-school . M-theory hold many magnificent magnitude of 'possibility ' . It just seemed so appropriate that all of this elegance should by it 's very nature move ( by admission by the many brilliant scientist presenting ) out of the realm of Science and into the realm of Philisophy . You do not have to be religious at all to feel like this movie brought you one step closer to God . Bravo Brian Greene . Well done indeed . P.S . If you 're interested in feeling even more comfortable and at home in your place in the Universe and would like some more insight into the 'possibilities ' Quantum mechanic blended with Spirituality ( of all thing ) can bring then I highly recommend that you also watch `` What the Bleep ! ? - Down the Rabbit Hole '' . Yes I know they make a few silly mistake by suggesting a Shaman may not be able to see a boat if he ha n't seen one before ( my eye process light reflection just fine - I see thing everyday that I 've never seen before ) and brain cell are cell in the body that actually do n't divide . But if you can get over these little hurdle and put down the thing you do n't like and hang on to those that you do - there is a lot to like about this film . Then watch `` The Secret '' ( 2006 documentary about The Law of Attraction - search for IMDb title `` tt0846789 '' ) . This information just might change your life profoundly - forever . If you search deeper you might even find the Universe is talking to u with thought ( if you 'll listen ) - and some are - and that is truly incredible . There is a modern day Jesus/Mohammad/Buddha ( those , among others , that history suggests have communicated with the non-physical ) alive today and she life in Texas . I know some of you know what I 'm talking about . I do not consider myself religious by any traditional definition but I have never felt more at home or a comfortable in the Universe a I do now .

In 1993 , with the success of the first season of Batman : The Animated Series , Warner Brothers commissioned the team responsible for the hit-show with producing a feature-length movie , originally slated for Direct-To-Video , but bumped up to theatrical status . It would become known a Batman : Mask of the Phantasm . Ten year after Phantasm , we have had an additional three feature-films released from the boy at the WB , Sub-Zero , Return of the Joker , and now , Mystery of the Batwoman join the family . The plot is basic and in many way similar to Mask of the Phantasm : A new female vigilante modeling herself after Batman ha begun targeting operation run by Gotham mob bos Rupert Thorne and Oswald Cobblepot AKA The Penguin . Now , Batman must attempt to unravel the mystery of the Batwoman before she cross the line . The animation is the sleeker , futuristic style that wa utilized for Batman : The Animated Series ' fifth and sixth season ( AKA The New Batman Adventures ) . , it 's quite nicely done , and just a sleek a Return of the Joker 's animation . There is also some use of CGI , but it 's minor compared to the overabundance of it in Sub-Zero . The music wa alright . Different and exotic and similar to the Justice League score , although the point in the score when the old animated Batman theme come up will be sure to send wave of nostalgia through the older fan ' rodent-shaped heart . Kevin Conroy , a always , doe a wonderful job a Bruce Wayne and Batman . It 's also great to have the old Batman : The Animated Series alumnus back ; that includes Bob Hastings ( Commissioner Gordon ) , Robert Costanzo ( Detective Bullock ) , Tara Strong ( Barbara Gordon/Batgirl ; her cameo hint at the romantic-relationship between her and Bruce that wa mentioned in Batman Beyond ) , and Efrem Zimbalist Jr. ( Alfred ) . Villains were also great - especially given that Rupert Thorne , the old mob bos from the original series , appears for the first time since the fourth season . Overall , while not quite reaching the standard set by Mask of the Phantasm ten year ago , MOTB carry on the torch quite nicely for the animated Batman film . And if you have the DVD and are a hardcore fan , you will love the five-minute short Chase Me .

I think this movie wa supposed to be shocking . But the only way in which it is indeed shocking is how shocking badly it 's been made ... and simply is . It 's one-and-a-half hour of torment . Even more so for the viewer than for the character in the movie ( the five girl ) . Sure the main character get their bloody piece in a bad way , which is basically fine , since it 's a horror-movie . And I ( usually ) like horror-movies . I 've no problem with violence in these type of movie per se . However all the violence in this film serf no end whatsoever . It 's no spectacle other than that it 's simply grotesque . It 's so lame it even get boring , and really quick too . The worst thing ( if the above wa n't bad enough for ya ) about this movie is that they 've tried to copy the Blair Whitch Project , by filming with cheap hand-held-cameras . But ( again , this too ) serf no end whatsoever . In the `` Blair Which '' , sure enough , there 's an explanation , namely they are their with a camera looking for the blair witch . In this film , there 's no other explanation than : `` Hey ya 'll we wanted this to LOOK LIKE the Blair Whitch ! ! '' The sound in the movie is also something to get depressed about . The girl are screaming so hysterically that many a time you ca n't make out what they 're saying . Also , no effort ha been made to make anything any better , sound-wise or other wise . Than finally , there 's the soundtrack , which is just a bad a the rest , and varies from cheap euro-house to the worst grungy hard-rock ... My advise : Do n't watch this under ANY circumstance .

Why ca n't a movie be rated a zero ? Or even a negative number ? Some movie such a `` Plan Nine From Outer Space '' are so bad they 're fun to watch . THIS IS NOT ONE . `` The Dungeon of Horror '' might be the worst movie I 've ever seen ( some of anyway . I HAD to fast forward through a lot of it ! ) . Fortunately for the indiscretion of my youth and senility of my advancing age , there may be worse movie I 've seen , but thankfully , I ca n't remember them . The set appeared to be made with cardboard and finished with can of spray paint . The special effect looked like a fifth grader 's C+ diorama set in a shoebox . The movie contained unforgivable gaff such a when the Marquis shoot and kill his servant . He then immediately get into a scuffle with his escaping victim , who take his flintlock and shoot him with it , without the gun having been reloaded ! This movie wa so bad my DVD copy only had name credit . I guess no company or studio wanted to be incriminated . Though I guess when you film in your garage and make set out of cardboard box a studio is n't needed . This movie definitely rank in my cellar of all time worst movie with such horrible sacrilege a `` The Manipulator '' , the worst movie I have ever seen with an actual ( one time ) Hollywood leading man-Mickey Rooney . The only time I would recommend watching `` The Dungeon of Harrow '' ( or `` The Manipulator '' for that matter ) would be if someone were to pay you . ( I 'm kind of cheap ) I 'd have to have $ 7 or $ 8 buck for `` Dungeon '' and at least ten for `` Manipulator '' . phil-the never out of the can cinematographer

This movie took me by surprise . The opening credit sequence feature nicely done animation . After that , we 're plunged into a semi-cheesy production , betraying it low budget . The character , typical American teen , are introduced slowly , with more personal detail than is usually found in movie like this . By the time the shlitz hit the fan , we know each one of the character , and either like or hate them according to their distinct personality . It 's a slow uphill set-up , kind of like the ride up a slope of a really tall roller coaster . Thankfully , once the action kick in , it 's full blown old school HORROR ! Steve Johnson 's make-up effect are awesome . Equal in quality to much bigger budgeted film . And the scare are jolting . Kevin Tenney delivers his best movie ever , with heart-stopping surprise and creepy suspenseful set-ups . The tongue-in-cheek , sometimes cheesy , humor mark this film a pure 80 horror , a opposed to the sullen tone of earlier genre fare like `` Night of the Living Dead '' or `` Hills Have Eyes . '' But for true horror fan , this one is worth checking out . Play it a the first entry on a double bill with the 1999 remake of `` House on the Haunted Hill . '' The set-up and character dynamic are so similar that you really have to wonder what film they were actually remaking ?

Though I 'd heard that `` Cama de Gato '' wa the worst Brazilian movie of the decade , I watched it giving it a chance ; after all , first-time director/producer/writer Alexandre Stockler managed to make his debut feature ( shot in video ) for just US $ 4,000 and -- though it look even cheaper -- I ca n't begin to imagine all he went through to finally get it exhibited in theater with no big sponsor or production company behind it ( then a I watched it I realized why ) . But whatever chance you 're ready to give to `` Cama de Gato '' , they shrink to zero within 10 minute : it 's an unbelievably preposterous , verbose , ideologically fanatical and technically catastrophic attempt to portray Brazilian upper-middle class youth a a bunch of spoiled neo-Nazis hooked on bad sex , drug and violence ( and they 're made to look like closeted gay too ) , made with no visible trace of talent , imagination , expertise or notion of structure . Visually and aurally , it recall the worst amateur stuff you can find on YouTube -- only here it last NINETY TWO ( count'em ) minute of unrelenting hysteria and clumsiness , and it 's not even funny-bad . We 've all seen the story before : bored young guy want to have fun , go partying , take drug and everything go wrong -- there 's gang-rape , spanking , murder , the accidental death ( falling down the staircase ! ! ) of the mother of one of the boy , culminating with the boy deciding to burn the corps of the girl and the mother in a garbage landfill . Moral and literal garbage , get it ? The film is heavily influenced by Larry Clark ( especially `` Kids '' and `` Bully '' ) , but Clark 's film -- though also moralist and sexploitative -- are high-class masterworks compared to this crap . I do n't think there wa ever such monomaniacal drive in a filmmaker to stick his idea down the audience 's throat : Stockler grab u by the collar and try to force his non-stop moralist rant into our brain by repetition and exhaustion -- you DO get numb-minded with so much babbling , yelling , inept direction , shaky camera and terrible acting going on . Stockler doe n't care a bit about technique ( the quality of the image , framing , sound recording , soundtrack song , dialog , set , editing , etc is uniformly appalling ) , but he 's a narcissistic control-freak : he anticipates the criticism he 's bound to get by adding subtitle with smartie/cutie comment , and by making the protagonist comment at one point how far-fetched and phony it all is ( I could relate to THAT ) . Despite his megalomaniac ambition , Stockler seems incapable of giving u a minimum of visual or narrative structure -- he ca n't even decide if he want gritty realism ( hand-held video camera etc ) or stylization ( repetition of scene , use of alternate take , etc ) . Damn , he ca n't even decide WHERE to put his camera ( there 's use of subjective camera for the THREE lead ) ! The dialog feature some of the most stupefyingly banal verbosity ever ; the plot exists simply to justify the director 's profound hatred for his character and what they stand for . All you see is a filmmaker being hateful , preachy , condemning , moralizing without the benefit of a minimum of talent ( or technique ) to go with it . It 's very disappointing to find Caio Blat in this mess . Certainly one of the most promising young film actor in Brazil , with his sleepy-eyed puppy dog look and emotional edge that often recall Sal Mineo 's , Blat can be highly effective under good direction ( a in `` Carandiru '' , `` Lavoura Arcaica '' , `` Proibido Proibir '' ) . Here , he 's told to go over the top and he ha to play with some of the most embarrassingly under-equipped `` actor '' in recent memory . He also enters the risky realm of graphic sexploitation scene ( so goddawful they look rather like web-cam porn ) . The film open and end with real interview with `` typical '' ( ? ) middle-class youth -- Stockler want u to take those interview a `` proof '' of what he 's trying to preach in fiction . But he blatantly despises and make fun of his interviewee , selecting a highlight of abject , racist , sexist , stupid statement ( which only show asshole exist everywhere ) . Stockler want to prove that Brazilian middle-class youth are ALL present or future fascist BECAUSE they 're middle-class and enjoy recreational drug ( is he saying all neo-fascists are on drug ? ? Or that drug potentialize fascist behavior ? ? I could n't tell ) . With it dogmatic self-righteousness , headache-inducing technique and mind-bending boredom , `` Cama de Gato '' is bad for a 1,000 reason but , above all , it 's harmful in a very insidious manner : it give detractor of Brazilian cinema a powerful case of argument . `` Cama de Gato '' is best unwatched , unmentioned , buried and forgotten .

An unforgettable masterpiece from the creator of The Secret of Nimh and The Land Before Time , this wa a very touching bittersweet cartoon . I remember this very well from my childhood , it wa funny and sad and very beautiful . Well it start out a bit dark , a dog who escaped the pound , and get killed by an old friend , end up in Heaven , and come back . But it becomes sweet when he befriends an orphaned girl who can talk to animal . Some scene were a bit scary contrary to other cartoon , like the dream sequence of Charlie , but everything else wa okay , and the song were fair . A memorable role of Burt Reynolds and Dom DeLuise , I just love that guy , ahehehe . And Judith Barsi of Jaws The Revenge , may God rest her soul , poor girl , she did n't deserve to die , but she is in Heaven now , all good people go to Heaven . Overall this is a very good animated movie , a Don Bluth classic enough to put anime and Disney to shame . Recommended for the whole family . And know this , if you have the original video of this , you 'll find after the movie , Dom DeLuise ha a very important and special message , got ta love that guy , ahehehe .

This movie wa a failure a a comedy and a film in general . It wa a very slow paced movie that seemed to be trying to convey a message , but the message wa a cliché , hopeless mess to begin with . This movie fall on shameless environmental point , even making a self-righteous point of destroying an SUV and promoting Animal Planet . In sitting through this , I could n't help but notice that Steve Carell got no more than a single truly funny line . The only thing that could hypothetically mark this a a comedy is the pitiful attempt to give comic relief line to Wanda Sykes . Her character get frequent , cringe-worthy line where they absolutely do not fit . Far from the brilliance of Bruce Almighty , Evan Almighty blow it whole record-breaking budget on special effect plot device that turn out to barely advance the plot . The movie spends the first half building up to the construction of Evan 's ark , but by the end , we learn that the ark wa completely meaningless , and the whole plot wa a just a vessel for the stupid gag and even stupider message . The movie concludes when we learn that the whole ark , flood , and animal gathering wa just a weak political statement by none other than God . Yes , God wa trying to influence politics .

It is so gratifying to see one great piece of art converted into another without distortion or contrivance . I had no guess a to how such an extraordinary piece of literature could be recreated a a film worth seeing . If you loved Bulgakov 's book you would be , understandably , afraid of seeing some misguided interpretation done more for the sake of an art-film project than for actually bringing the story 's deeper meaning to the screen . There are a couple example of this with the Master and Margarita . As complex and far-fetched a the story is , the movie leaf out nothing . It is a if the filmmaker read Bulgakov 's work the same way an orchestral conductor read a score -- with not a note missed . Why ca n't we find such talent here in the U.S. ? So now my favorite book and movie have the same title .

This movie is very violent , yet exciting with original dialog and cool character . It ha one of the most moving story and is very true to life . The movie start off with action star Leo Fong a a down and out cop who is approaching the end of his career , when he stumble on to a big case that involves corruption , black mail and murder . This is where the killing start . From start finish Fong delivers in this must see action caper . This movie also co-star Richard Roundtree . I really enjoyed this film a a child but a I got older I realized that this film is pretty cheesy and not very good . I would not recommend this film and the action is very , very bad .

The day ha finally come for me to witness the perpetuation of Azumi 's fate a an assassin , fruition of her character and the ultimate attempt to draw me deeper into the world she rampaged through so mercilessly during the first saga . That 's a poetical a I 'll get when talking about Azumi 2 : Death or Love , because when I cringed over the heavy sentimentality of House of Flying Daggers and complained about the credibility of Aya Ueto portraying a blood-driven assassin , after watching Azumi 2 I started to appreciate the previously mentioned shortcoming more than ever before . Not only doe the determination of each assassin feel sluggish and uninspiring but also many important element are omitted from the entire experience . In Azumi 1 we saw the assassin use various stealth tactic ( which is their number one priority ) a well a logic to make easy work of their mark with swift execution and quicker ability to escape . But I wo n't hold that against this movie too much since the story is slightly tweaked this time around and many more obstacle are planted in Azumi 's way to prevent her from reaching the warlord and displaying any sign of charisma . By the way , Chiaki is foolishly shelved for the most part of the film and is basically playing a toned down version of Go Go , minus the cool weapon and sense of menace . This brings me to the final blow which is the action , simply disguised in the title a the 'Death ' side of the epic . In the first half of the film we see the debut of many promising adversary with flashy look and even flashier weapon . To no one 's surprise they meet their end one way or another but the film fall short when each of them start dying too fast and too easily . In Azumi 1 , the young assassin were mostly overpowering the opposition with quick but somewhat satisfying battle and the final showdown between Azumi and Bijomaru in comparison to the fight in Azumi 2 wa at least climaxed and worthwhile . Some interesting effect were introduced but they were unable to achieve innovation due to the shortness of each encounter . I am in no way knocking down the conventional style of samurai film with their quick and realistic battle but character in both Azumi film were so imaginative and straight out of anime that the rule could have been broken and the action should have been further enriched . The romance side of Azumi is there to fill in time between the fight scene and unfortunately at the end it serf no purpose nor provides a much needed resolution . As a fan with an open mind for wide variety of movie and animation , I wo n't lie and I 'll admit to my neutrality and unimpressiveness towards the first Azumi film , but I 'll step right up and say that after watching Azumi 2 , the original wa made to look like a flawless masterpiece . For what it 's worth , Azumi 2 : Death or Love could have gone straight to video , with it invisibly richer budget and a failed potential to add or even expand on the bumpy journey of desperate assassin , doing their best to restore the peace , with an unwavering courage to die trying .

This ha to be the worst piece of garbage I 've seen in a while . Heath Ledger is a heartthrob ? He looked deformed . I wish I 'd known that he and Naomi Watts are an item in real life because I spent 2 of the longest hour of my life wondering what she saw in him . Orlando Bloom is a heartthrob ? With the scraggly beard and deer-in-the-headlights look about him , I ca n't say I agree . Rachel Griffiths wa her usual fabulous self , but Geoffrey Rush looked a if he could n't wait to get off the set . I 'm supposed to feel sorry for bankrobbers and murderer ? This is a far cry from Butch Cassidy , which actually WAS an entertaining film . This wa trite , cliche-ridden and boring . We only stayed because we were convinced it would get better . It did n't . The last 10-15 minute or so were unintentionally hilarious . Heath and his gang are holed up in a frontier hotel , and woman and child are dying because of their presence . That 's not funny . But it wa funny when they walked out of the hotel with the armor on , because all we could think of wa the Black Knight from Monty Python and the Holy Grail . I kept waiting for them to say `` I 'll bite yer leg off ! '' We were howling with laughter , a were several other warped member of the audience . When we left , pretty much everyone wa talking about what a waste of time this film wa . I may not have paid cash to see this disaster ( sneak preview ) , but it certainly wa n't free . It cost me 2 hour of my life that I will never get back .

A very ordinary made-for-tv product , `` Tyson '' attempt to be a serious biopic while stretching the moment of angst for effect , fast forwarding through the esoterics of the corrupt sport of boxing , and muddling the sensationalistic stuff which is the only thing which make Tyson even remotely interesting . A lukewarm watch at best which more likely to appeal to the general public than to boxing fan .

I 'm sure deep in the recess of Jack Blacks mind the character of Nacho Libre is absolutely hilarious but no it is n't . You can tell ol Jacks having a whale of a time hammin it up playing a smarmy , slimy Mexican friar with dream of becoming a wrestler but this movie is a total misfire in just about every single department . I just sat there through most of the movie thinking `` Is this supposed to be funny '' and `` This is the guy from Tenacious D right ? '' . The truth is this film ha NOTHING to offer . AT ALL ! It 's a lousy script with crappy character and really naff acting and direction . You 'll watch endless moment where you think something funny is surely about to happen but it just doe n't . I wa bored stupid about 10 minute in but though it would surely pick up . It did n't . 90 minute later I 'd barely managed to stave off an aneurism it wa that painful . It 's like , remember year ago when you 'd see anything with your fave actor in it , even some of their really early pap from before they were famous , and you 'd be really embarrassed that said actor wa actually in such a load of plop . Yeah it 's like that . I 've enjoyed some of Jack Black 's earlier movie like Shallow Hall and I 'm really looking forward to seeing Pick of Destiny but come on man . If you do this to u again Jack I 'm gon na have to come round there and hammer your kneecap or something . At the least give you a serious talking to . I know it 's a cliché but this is one of the worst movie I 've ever seen and for so many reason ....

I have n't read the Anne Rice novel that this movie wa based on , but who know , maybe reading the book is cheaper than renting QUEEN OF THE DAMNED and is probably better for your health . It is n't that this movie is necessarily bad for your health , but a book can be very relaxing and certainly exercise the active part of your brain more so than this movie . You can count the number of page by Anne Rice that I 've read on one hand , but after seeing this movie and Interview with a Vampire , I get the feeling that she writes really good novel . The plot for both movie hint at a whole sea of deep and interwoven vampire history . Still , Stuart Townsend 's voice-over narration get a heck of a lot more annoying than Brad Pitt 's vampire narrative ever did , and you can tell that QUEEN OF THE DAMNED 's limited production resource barely give enough flesh to the Anne Rice storyline . While Interview decided to go with lace and elegance , QUEEN relies on low budget special effect that try really hard to be taken seriously . One can see that the original novel had potential a a movie and that the production team focused it attention in the wrong place . The costume and rock & roll stage could have been replaced with more blood and an eerier soundtrack . However , I 'll give credit where credit is due . The soundtrack is excellent . Korn and Disturbed had me down with the sickness bobbing my noggin like Butthead . The film open with a very cool Goth-rock zoom & splice montage , but after the first ten minute or so , the directing degenerate quickly . It 's a if the movie wa so long that the director realized that there wa n't enough time and enough money to do an Anne Rice novel justice . What result are some mediocre vampire scene and plenty of cheesy special effect . Unfortunately , QUEEN OF THE DAMNED fails to do the genre justice just a it John Carpenter counterpart fail to impress . Where are the yellow contact ? Where 's the pale blue make-up ? Scene after scene , I shook my head reminiscing about the day of Salem 's Lot and Fright Night when low budget wa done right . There are redeeming quality though that save this movie from being garbage . Props to Aaliyah , and may her soul forever rest in peace . She might have become a renowned actress , had her life not been taken from u so prematurely , for she did give this movie a decent performance with plenty of nice belly dancing . Did I mention that the soundtrack wa good ? Let 's see , what else can I say ? It wa n't too long . The Anne Rice novel could have easily been a three hour movie if an ambitious director like Francis Ford Coppola got his hand on it . There are a few twist and turn here and there in the plot . But all in all it wa a legitimate rock and roll addition to the slew of second-rate vampire movie out there . The director of this movie went on to direct a new Battlestar Galactica mini series if that tell you anything . JY Jimboduck-dot-com

While I count myself a a fan of the Babylon 5 television series , the original movie that introduced the series wa a weak start . Although many of the element that would later mature and become much more compelling in the series are there , the pace of The Gathering is slow , the makeup somewhat inadequate , and the plot confusing . Worse , the characterization in the premiere episode is poor . Although the rating chart show that many fan are willing to overlook these problem , I remember The Gathering almost turned me off off what soon grew into a spectacular series .

Leonard Maltin gave this film a dreaded BOMB rating in his 1995 Movie and Video Guide . What film wa he looking at ? Kid Vengeance or God 's Gun are bomb . This film is a delight . It is fantastic . It is literate . It is well mounted . It is beautiful photographed , making a brilliant use of color . Right from the opening scene the film grab your attention and tip you off that this film is a well-done satire of the whole Spaghetti Western genre . The film is played for laugh from the beginning to the end with homage to Douglas Fairbanks , 77 Sunset Strip , and the famous showdown in the Good , the Bad , and the Ugly . Edd Byrnes , George Hilton , and Gilbert Roland work brilliantly together to make the satire work . It is too bad Mr. Maltin rated this film so poorly a it is undeserved . One can only guess a to his reason . I suspect that he missed the point of the movie entirely and wa expecting something more serious than this film is meant to be . Kudos belong to everyone involved in this project . This film is a little gem waiting to be discovered by people who care about literate movie and appreciate satire .

I do n't believe there ha ever been a more evil or wicked television program to air in the United States a The 700 Club . They are today 's equivalent to the Ku Klux Klan of the 20th century . Their hatred of all that is good and sweet and human and pure is beyond all ability to understand . Their daily constant attack upon million and million of Americans , a well a billion of human the world over , who do n't happen to share their bigoted , cruel , monstrous , and utterly insane view of humanity is beyond anything television ha ever seen . The lie they spout and the ridiculous lie they try to pas off a truth , such a the idea of `` life after death '' or `` god '' or `` sin '' or `` the devil '' is so preposterous that they actually seem mentally ill , so lost are they in their fantasy . Sane people know that religion is a drug and should n't let themselves get addicted to that type of fantasy . However , The 700 Club is in a class by itself . They are truly a cult . While I believe in freedom of speech , they way they spread hatred , lie , disinformation , and such fantastic idea is beyond all limit . I hope that one day the American Psychiatric Association will finally take up the study of those people who delude themselves in this way , people who let themselves sink so deeply into the fantasy land of religion that they no longer have any real concept of reality at all . Treatment for such afflicted individual is sorely needed in this country , a so many people have completely lost their mind to the fantasy of religion . The 700 Club though , is even more horrible a it rise to the legal definition of 'cult ' but due to The 700 Club 's vast wealth ( conned daily from the million of Americans locked in their deceitful grip ) they are above the law in this country . For those of you who have seen the movie `` The Matrix '' you know that movie wa a metaphor for religion on earth : the evil one who are at the top of each of the religion who drain the one they have trapped and cruelly abuse for their own selfish purpose , and those million who are held in a death sleep and slowly being drained of their life force represent those many people who belong to religion and who have lost all ability to perceive what is really going on around them . In le civil time , the good townsfolk would have run such monster a those associated with The 700 Club out of town with torch and pitchfork . But in today 's world where people have lost all choice in their choice of television that is presented to them , we have no way to rid ourselves of the 700 Club plague . The television rating system and the `` V '' chip on TV 's should also have a rating called `` R '' for religion , so that rational people and concerned parent could easily screen such vile intellectual and brutal emotional rape , such a presented by The 700 Club every day all over our country , from themselves and their child .

If you wish to see Shakespeare 's masterpiece in it entirety , I suggest you find this BBC version . Indeed it is overlong at four and a half hour but Jacoby 's performance a Hamlet and Patrick Stewart 's a Claudius are well worth the effort . It never cease to amaze me how clear `` Hamlet '' is when you see it in it length and order a set down by the Bard . Every film version of `` Hamlet '' ha tinkered with it structure . Olivier concentrated on Hamlet 's indecision , Gibson on his passion . Jacoby is able to pull all of these aspect of Hamlet 's character together with the aid of Shakespeare 's full script . Why doe Hamlet not kill Claudius immediately ? Hamlet say `` I am very proud , revengeful , ambitious ... '' Hamlet is extremely upset , not only for his father 's death ( and suspected murder ) , or his mother 's marriage to his uncle , but also , and mostly , because Claudius ha usurped the throne belonging to Hamlet . He is furious at his mother for marrying Claudius ( marriage between royal kin is not unknown ; done for political reason ) but that her marriage solidified Claudius ' claim to the throne before he could return from Wittenburg to claim it for himself . He is , therefore , impotent to do anything about it . And this is true even after he hears his father 's ghost cry vengeance . He can not simply kill the King or he will lose the throne in doing so . He must `` out '' the King 's secret and here is the tragedy ! At the moment Hamlet is successful in displaying Claudius ' guilt in public , he ha opportunity to kill him and doe not . WHY ? He want it ALL ! He want revenge , the throne AND the damnation of Claudius ' soul in hell . Hamlet OVERREACHES himself in classic tragic form . His own HUBRIS is his undoing . He kill Polonius thinking it is Claudius and the rest of the play spiral down to the final death of Rosencrantz , Guildenstern , Ophelia , Laertes , Gertrude , Claudius and Hamlet himself .

The Golden Door is the story of a Sicilian family 's journey from the Old World ( Italy ) to the New World ( America ) . Salvatore , a middle-aged man who hope for a more fruitful life , persuades his family to leave their homeland behind in Sicily , take the arduous journey across the raging sea , and inhabit a land whose river supposedly flow with milk . In short , they believe that by risking everything for the New World their dream of prosperity will be fulfilled . The imagery of the New World is optimistic , clever and highly imaginative . Silver coin rain from heaven upon Salvatore a he anticipates how prosperous he 'll be in the New World ; carrot and onion twice the size of human being are shown being harvested to suggest wealth and health , and river of milk are swam in and flow through the mind of those who anticipate what the New World will yield . All of this imagery is surrealistically interwoven with the character and help nicely compliment the gritty realism that the story unfolds to the audience . The contrast between this imagery versus the dark reality of the Sicilian people help provide hope while they 're aboard the ship to the New World . The voyage to the New World is shot almost in complete darkness , especially when the sea tempest roar and nearly kill the people within . The dark reality I referred to is the Old World and the journey itself to the New World . The Old World is depicted a somewhat destitute and primitive . This is shown a Salvatore scramble together to sell what few possession he ha left ( donkey , goat and rabbit ) in order to obtain the appropriate clothing he need to enter the New World . I thought it wa rather interesting that these people believed they had to conform to a certain dress code in order to be accepted in the New World ; it wa almost suggesting that people had to fit a particular stereotype or mold in order to be recognized a morally fit . The most powerful image in the film wa when the ship is leaving their homeland and setting sail for the New World . This shot show an overhead view of a crowd of people who slowly seem to separate from one another , depicting the separation between the Old and New Worlds . This shot also suggested that the people were being torn away from all that wa once familiar , wanted to divorce from their previous dark living condition and were desirous to enter a world that held more promise . As later contrasted to how the New World visually look , the Old World seems dark and bleak a compared to the bright yet foggy New World . I thought it wa particularly interesting that the Statue of Liberty is never shown through the fog at Ellis Island , but is remained hidden . I think this wa an intentional directing choice that seemed to negate the purpose of what the Statue of Liberty stand for : `` Give me your poor , your tired , your hungry '' seemed like a joke in regard to what these people had to go through when arriving at the New World . Once they arrived in the Americas , they had to go through rather humiliating test ( i.e . delousing , mathematics , puzzle , etc . ) in order to prove themselves a fit for the New World . These test completely changed the perspective of the Sicilian people . In particular , Salvatore 's mother had the most difficult time subjecting herself to the rule and law of the New World , feeling more violated than treated with respect . Where their dream once provided hope and optimism for what the New World would provide , the reality of what the New World required wa disparaging and rude . Salvatore doe n't change much other than his attitude towards what he felt the New World would be like versus what the New World actually wa seemed disappointing to him . This attitude wa shared by mostly everyone who voyaged with him . Their character arc deal more with a cherished dream being greatly upset and a dark reality that had to be accepted . The film seems to make a strong commentary on preparing oneself to enter a heavenly and civilized society . Cleanliness , marriage and intelligence are prerequisite . Adhering to these rule is to prevent disease , immoral behavior and stupidity from dominating . Perhaps this is a commentary on how America ha learned from the failing of other nation and so wa purposefully established to secure that these plague did not infest and destruct . Though the rule seemed rigid , they were there to protect and help the people flourish .

Nifty little episode played mainly for laugh , but with clever dollop of suspense . Somehow a Martian ha snuck aboard a broken-down bus on it way to nowhere , but which passenger is it , ( talk about your illegal immigrant ! ) . All-star supporting cast , from wild-eyed Jack Elam ( hamming it up shamelessly ) , to sexy Jean Willes ( if she 's the Martian , then I say let 's open the border ! ) , to cruel-faced John Hoyt ( the most obvious suspect ) , along with familiar face John Archer and Barney Phillips ( and a nice turn from Bill Kendis a the bus driver ) . Makes for a very entertaining half-hour even if the action is confined to a single set .

Phantasm .... Class . Phantasm II ..... awesome . Phantasm III ..... erm ..... terrible . Even though i would love to stick up for this film , i quite simply ca n't . The movie seems to have `` sold out '' . First bad sign come when the video ha trailer for other film at the start ( something the others did not ) . Also too many pointless character , prime example the kid ( who is a crack shot , funny initially but soon you want him dead ) , the woman who us karate to fight off the ball ( erm not gon na work , or rather should n't ) and the blooming zombie ( what the hell are they doing there , there no link to them in the other Phatasms ) . Also there is a severe lack of midget running about . The only good bit are the cracking start and , of course , Reggie B . Overall very , VERY disappointing . 3 / 10

Ludicrous . Angelic 9-year-old Annakin turn into whiny brat 19-year-old Annakin , who somehow seems appealing to Amidala , 5 year his senior . Now 22-year-old Jedi warrior hero Annakin ha a couple of bad dream , and so take to slaughtering child , his friend , and the entire framework of his existence because a crazy old man convinced him a ) his precious wife might really die , and b ) only he can prevent this . Ludicrosity squared . I think the people who like this movie are not paying attention . The story is ridiculous . The character are unbelievable ( literally , not the perverted sense of `` fantastic '' , `` wonderful '' , etc. ) . Obi-wan Kenobi wa the wise and kind anchor for the entire series , but in the climax , he hack off Annakin 's leg , let him burn in the lava , and leaf him to suffer . Does n't anyone think that 's a little out of character ? Not to mention it wa pretty stupid to take a chance on him living , a it turn out . I wa expecting at least a story that showed consistent character with plausible motivation . None of that here . The story could have been written by a 10 year old . Oh yeah , the CGI is pretty cool .

With no likable character , including , but not limited to , a kid who 's the freakiest looking guy since `` Friday the 13th part 2 '' ' a girl who lead men on and then go into hissy fit when they want to touch her , and the token fat slob , because after all what would an '80 's sex comedy be without a fat slob ? ? If you keep rigid historical perspective out of it , this film is actually quite entertaining . It 's got action , adventure and romance , and one of the premiere casting match-up of the era with Errol Flynn and Olivia de Havilland in the lead role . As evident on this board , the picture doe n't pas muster with purist who look for one hundred percent accuracy in their story telling . To get beyond that , one need only put aside the history book , and enjoy the story a if it were a work of fiction . I know , I know , that 's hard to do when you consider Custer 's Last Stand at the Little Big Horn and it 's prominence in the history of post Civil War America . So I guess there 's an unresolved quandary with the picture , no matter how you look at it . There 's a lot to take in here though for the picture 's two hour plus run time . Custer 's arrival at West Point is probably the first head scratcher , riding up a he doe in full military regalia . The practical joke by Sharp ( Arthur Kennedy ) putting him up in the Major 's headquarters probably should have gotten them both in trouble . Ironically , a lot of scene in this military film play for comedy , a in Custer 's first meeting with Libby Bacon , and subsequent encounter that include tea reader Callie ( Hattie McDaniel ) . I had n't noticed it before in other film , but McDaniel reminded me an awful lot of another favorite character actor of mine from the Forties , Mantan Moreland . So much so that in one scene it looked like it might have been Moreland hamming it up in a dress . With that in mind , the owl scene wa a hoot too . As for Flynn , it 's interesting to note that a year earlier , he portrayed J.E.B . Stuart opposite Ronald Reagan 's depiction of General Custer in `` Santa Fe Trail '' , both vying for the attention of none other than Olivia de Havilland . In that film , Reagan put none of the arrogance and flamboyance into the character of Custer that history remembers , while in Flynn 's portrayal here it 's more than evident . But it doe n't come close to that of Richard Mulligan 's take on the military hero in 1970 's `` Little Big Man '' . Let 's just say that one wa a bit over the top . The better take away the picture had for me wa the manner in which Custer persevered to maintain his good name and not gamble it away on a risky business venture . That and his loyalty to the men he led in battle along with the discipline he developed over the course of the story . Most poignant wa that final confrontation with arch rival Sharp just before riding into the Little Big Horn , in which he declared that hell or glory wa entirely dependent on one 's point of view . Earlier , a similar remark might have given u the best insight of all into Custer 's character , when he stated - `` You take glory with you when it 's your time to go '' .

The film quickly get to a major chase scene with ever increasing destruction . The first really bad thing is the guy hijacking Steven Seagal would have been beaten to pulp by Seagal 's driving , but that probably would have ended the whole premise for the movie . It seems like they decided to make all kind of change in the movie plot , so just plan to enjoy the action , and do not expect a coherent plot . Turn any sense of logic you may have , it will reduce your chance of getting a headache . I doe give me some hope that Steven Seagal is trying to move back towards the type of character he portrayed in his more popular movie .

Interesting and short television movie describes some of the machination surrounding Jay Leno 's replacing Carson a host of the Tonight Show . Film is currently very topical given the public drama surrounding Conan O'Brien and Jay Leno . The film doe a good job of sparking viewer ' interest in the event and showing some of the concern of the stakeholder , particularly of the NBC executive . The portrayal of Ovitz wa particularly compelling and interesting , I thought . Still , many of the character were only very briefly limned or touched upon , and some of the acting seemed perfunctory . Nevertheless , an interesting story .

Any film about WWII made during WWII by a British production company ha no latter-day peer in my opinion , respectfully . The confluence of so many thing near and dear to my heart are in At Dawn We Dive : a a descendant of Admiral Horatio Nelson and student of all aspect of World War Two and particularly naval warfare , I favor depiction of sub and action in the North Atlantic and especially those which include the German side of thing . For those unacquainted with target priority , an attack on an enemy warship is the greatest event that a submarine can hope to encounter and such a rare opportunity would develop surprisingly similarly to what we see here . The pacing is deliberate and typical of the work coming out of the Ealing , Rank and British-Gaumont studio back in the day : frankly I prefer it quieter , more cerebral approach for it humanity and realism that engages far better than any over-produced Hollywood movie ever could . This reminds me of Powell and Pressburger 's The 49th Parallel thanks to the powerfully persuasive Eric Portman , a favorite of mine . John Mills receives second billing and a smaller font in the title , so this is clearly meant to be Mr. Portman 's film but the whole cast shine . As for the title sequence , am I the only one who is utterly charmed by Gainsborough Production 's lovely pre-CGI Gainsborough Girl ?

A brilliant horror film . Utterly gruesome and very scary too . The Thing is a remake from John Carpenter , but please , do not let that put you off this film . It is simply brilliant . The start of the film ha the alien 's spacecraft hurtling towards the Earth century before mankind walked the planet with an explosion that unleashes the film 's title in amazing shining white and blue stating 'THE THING ' . One of the best opening credit for a horror film ever . The cast of actor who play the twelve man science team are a joy to behold and the location for the setting of their Station in Antartica is visually impressive on DVD widescreen . It must have been great in the cinema . I regret not seeing this on the big screen . Kurt Russell is excellent a Macready , the helicopter pilot who reluctantly becomes the leader of the men trying to combat a lethal shape changing monstrosity that ha infiltrated their base . All the actor in this are really good and create terrific scene of paranoia and tension a to who the thing ha infected . My favourite scene in the whole film ha to be when Macready test everyone thats still alive for infection , it is tense , scary and finally spectacular . I love it because it funny a well . Special mention must go to Rob Bottin for his truly amazing make up effect and shape changing design of the alien itself . If he did n't get an Oscar for best visual effect at the time then he damn well should have . This is also debatable a to whether this is John Carpenter 's greatest film ... it certainly a gruesome masterpiece . Wait for a cold winter night . Get some Budweiser from the fridge . Sit down and watch The Thing , a horror masterpiece of flame throwing hero fighting shape changing tower of gore and slime . Utterly brilliant . Ten Out Of Ten .

A new way to enjoy Goldsworthy 's work , Rivers and Tides allows fan to see his work in motion . Watching Goldsworthy build his piece , one develops an appreciation for every stone , leaf , and thorn that he us . Goldsworthy describes how the flow of life , the river , and the tide inspires and affect his work . Although , I wa happy the film covered the majority of Goldsworthy 's piece ( no snowball ) , I do feel it wa a bit long . The film maker did a wonderful job of bringing Goldsworthy 's work to life , and created a beautiful film that wa a joy to watch .

Eddie Deezen vacillates between `` Three Stooges '' slapstick and a bad Woody Allen imitation . Fatally flawed , `` Mob Boss '' is so derivative that boredom quickly overcomes comedy and the film drag on with car chase , hidden weapon in a restaurant bathroom , and numerous other nonsense . - MERK

I saw this at the London Film Festival last night , apparently the shorter version . James McNally 's summary of the content of the film is very good . Nossiter very deftly blend his investigation of the wine business into wider concern about globalisation , homogenisation , the effect of the mass medium , the power of capital and the need for diversity . The film is shot on hand-held DV which some might find offputting , but which doe enable Nossiter to catch people off guard on a number of occasion which probably would not have been possible using more conventional equipment . Despite the sprawling feel of the film , the editing is very sharp , not only giving u a parade of the world 's dog , but also undercutting a number of interviewee ' comment with somewhat contradictory visual image , and giving others sufficient rope to hang themselves . To a degree this evoked Michael Moore 's recent work ( although Nossiter operates in a more subtle way ) , but probably the root of the film go back to Marcel Ophuls ' `` The Sorrow and the Pity '' , both in the way the film is constructed and in the emergence of 'salt of the earth ' French peasant a the star . De Montille pere et fils were present at the LFF screening and answered question afterwards . We do indeed all need a little disorder - bravo Hubert ! Overall an excellent film with implication that go way beyond the world of wine into the way we construct ourselves a people , and organise our world .

I ca n't believe this movie managed to get such a relatively high rating of 6 ! It is barely watchable and unbelievably boring , certainly one of the worst film I have seen in a long , long time . It 's one of those `` festival film '' that only please the pseudo-intellectuals because they are so badly made those people think it make it `` different '' , therefore good . Bad film-making is not `` different '' , it 's just bad film-making .

This movie really woke me up , like it wake up the main male character of this bravely different movie from his life slumber . This guy John ( Ben Chaplin ) lead his mediocre safe life of a bank teller in a small provincial English town , until the stunningly gorgeous , wild , girl-to-die-for Nadia ( Nicole Kidman ) , ordered by email from Russia , enters his life to become his beloved wife , by Johns plan . However a glitch turn up - Nadia doe not speak a word of Johns language . Although calm and emotionless on the outside , John becomes so interested in beautiful Nadia that instead of using the full refund policy of the matching service , he buy her a dictionary to start the communication process . What happens henceforth in the plot really shake poor John from his slumber of a decently-paid safe-feeling clerk into a decision-making decently thinking action figure , giving the viewer a subliminal message `` you would have probably acted likewise '' . Kidman , Cassel & Kassovitz make a great team acting Russians and they are almost indistinguishable from the real thing , `` almost '' only due to the slight accent present in their Russian dialogue , however slight enough to amaze a native Russian by the hard work done to get the word sound right . Nicole Kidman prof her talent once again by playing a character quite different from the previous role , at least from the cultural background . The pace of the film is fast and captivating , and you certainly are not ready to quit watching when the end title appear , you rather feel that you 're in the middle of the plot , and are left with a desire to see the sequel a soon a it come out . My advice is to go out and get this film immediately and watch it and enjoy . To sum it up , it ha an unusual plot , great acting , and idea below the surface . Like the idea of the `` rude awakening '' from the artificial safe routine life of a wheel in a Society 's machine , the life which member of the Fight Club were so keen to quit and the machine of which Pink Floyd sings ( `` Welcome to the machine ! '' ) . I bet that in the end , John wa rather off with Sophia on their way to the unknown than not having met her at all . Thank you , writer , for the great story , and everyone else for this great movie ! Please make a sequel ! And you can stage it whereever and name the location whatever , because the authenticity of the place is irrelevant to the 99.9999 percent of the potential viewer , I am sure of it .

Howard ( Kevin Kline ) teach English at the high school in a small Indiana city . He is finally getting married to Emily ( Joan Cusack ) , much to his parent delight . The town is abuzz , too , because one of it own , Cameron ( Matt Dillon ) ha been nominated for an acting Oscar . Everyone , including Howard and Emily , is watching the Academy Awards on television a Cameron is declared the winner ! In his acceptance speech , Cameron announces that he wa able to fulfill his role a a gay military man , in part , because of lesson he learned from a gay teacher he had in high school . You guessed it , it Howard ! But , Howard ha never `` come out '' ; in fact , he belief he is straight ! With the whole town , and member of the medium , waiting and observing the happening , will Howard and Emily go ahead and get married ? Or , is Howard truly gay and realize he can not go through with the ceremony ? This is a wonderful , funny , and humane film about a gay man and his situation . As the man-who-did-not-realize-he-was-gay , Kline is excellent and touching . The rest of the cast is equally fine , with Cusack a stitch a the mixed-up fiancé and Dillon , Bob Newhart , Debbie Reynolds , Tom Selleck , and others on hand to delight the audience a well . The costume are very nice and the setting in the lovely Indiana heartland is beautiful . Then , too , the script , the direction , and the production are very , very nice . But , the insightful , humorous , and the thoughtful look at the gay population is the film 's best asset , no doubt . For those who would be offended by a gay-themed film , yes , just skip over this one . But , for everyone who want to laugh heartily , and gain a better understanding of the gay situation at the same time , this is definitely the best film out there .

When the opening shot is U.S. Marines seriously disrespecting the U.S. flag , a movie ha a tough road ahead , but unfortunately it wa downhill from there . There is a military adviser credited , who is also apparently a retired U.S. Marine , making it even more baffling that this incredible breach of protocol , and law , went unnoticed . Even more baffling is the way they simply glossed over how a Marine is reported KIA , then buried , in very short order , without the slightest explanation of how they identified the body , or if there even wa a body . The U.S. government is still finding the missing from WWII , and it take month to identify the remains . Military shot down remain MIA for month or year and are only declared KIA when the remains have been positively identified , or after year of red tape . Here we are expected to believe that it happens within a matter of day or week . Maybe this happens in Denmark , but not in the U.S. Clearly none of the people involved ever had the slightest involvement with , or respect for , the U.S. military . Beyond that , there are a number of other utterly laughable moment when character come up with zinger out of nowhere . There must have been some really extended meeting between auteur and actor a they struggled to find their motivation for such hogwash . Having a script that worked might have helped , but this one seems to have been made up on the spot , working from Cliffs Notes . There 's no way to know if the script wa this awful originally , or if it wa the auteur , or the middle-management kid at the studio who bear responsibility . Either way , this is an awful movie that should have never been made .

We usually think of the British a the expert at rendering great adventure from the Imperial age , with the like of The Four Feathers ( 1939 ) and Zulu , simply because the Imperial age wa , for the most part , British . Here , in The Wind and the Lion , we see a wonderful rendering of America 's own Imperial age . America 's projection of power under Teddy Roosevelt is the backdrop for this conventional tale of the kidnapped damsel who , despite her gentility , is smitten by the rough , manly nobility of her captor , who in turn is disarmed by her beauty and scorn . ( Politically correct prig eager to see some slight of `` native '' people or culture can rest assured , that the way Arabs and Muslims are depicted here is far more flattering than the way their modern counterpart depict themselves on the current world stage . ) What make this story different are the terrific production value - faultless photography , composition and editing - the terrific casting - the underappreciated Brian Keith playing a bully Teddy - and vivid history . Though The Wind and the Lion is told largely through the eye of the son , every member of the family can identify with one of the character , whether it be Sean Connery 's noble brigand , Candace Bergen 's feisty heroine , John Huston 's wily John Hay or Steve Kanaly 's spiffy , radiant , ruthless can-do lieutenant , Roosevelt 's `` Big Stick '' . There is a transcendent scene at the end , when the little boy is symbolically swept away by the dashing Moor on his white steed . This is high adventure at it best .

I had been looking forward to seeing Dreamgirls for quite a while ... what with all it 's raving review , nomination and medium attention . And I must say , the first quarter of the movie wa good ! It really portrayed the black music scene back then . However , a the movie wore on , me and my whole family were bored out of our wit . The singing just kept coming , one after the other . I mean seriously , just one more music number and it would have broke even with RENT . Furthermore , I noticed hardly any character development in any of the character ; I just did n't care what happened to them ! Even when Eddie Murphy 's character died of a drug overdose , I knew I should have been sad , but I just could n't feel any emotion for that character . The character were given a flimsy background about singing in their childhood and whatnot , but there personality were not revealed enough to draw me in . Finally , the conflict wa simply not significant enough to make the viewer care , which go along with the lack of character development . This movie reminded me of a copy-cat movie based on Ray , Chicago , and Rent ( Ray and Chicago were wonderful movie in my opinion ) . Overall I think this movie would best suit someone who doe n't really care about an overall story , yet would enjoy two hour of entertaining and fun singing performance .

One of Starewicz 's longest and strangest short film follows a toy dog in search of an orange after becoming animated by the tear of the mother of a girl who longs for an orange . The dog come upon an orange after falling out of the back of a car on his way to be sold , but at night must protect the orange when he come enters a devilish nightclub featuring many bizarre and scary character . With the help of a stuffed cat , the dog get the orange back to the little girl and she is saved from a terrible scurvy death . The Mascot feature new technique I have not yet seen in Starewicz 's film . The addition of sync sound and a mixture of live action with the stop-motion animation make for a new twist on Starewicz 's old style of puppetry . Live scene of moving car and people 's foot walking by a a puppet sits on the concrete sidewalk is impressive and fresh . The honking of car and cry of street vendor is noteworthy due to the fact that small studio shift to sound were costly and Starewicz 's utilization of the new technology seems like old hat . New puppet character in this film are frightening contribution to the devil 's club scene . Twigss and newspaper shred come to life . Skeletons of dead bird lay egg which hatch skeleton chick . Characters come flying in from all over on pat and pan and rocking horse . A new editing technique us quick zoom which are accomplished through editing to speed up the pace of what before might have been a slow scene . Overall , Starewicz is able to update his style of film-making to meet the demand of a new audience making this film one of the best example of his work .

Nice character development in a pretty cool milieu . Being a male , I 'm probably not qualified to totally understand it , but they do a nice job of establishing the restrictive Victorian environment from the start . It is n't a bleak a it really wa and the treatment of woman wa probably even harsher . What make this go is a wonderful chemistry among the principal character . Each ha their own `` thing '' that they contend with . Once they come out of the rain and break out of the spider web , they begin to interact and slowly lose their sense of suspicion . What I enjoyed about this movie is that it did n't go for cheap comedy when it could have . It did n't try to pound a lesson into u . The people who seem utterly without merit are really nicely developed human being who get to see the light . I did have a little trouble with the Alfred Molina character having such an epiphany so quickly , but , within this world , it needed to happen . Good acting all around with something positive taking place in the life of some pretty good people .

Prussic gas , a murderer donning a red clansman suit and hood wielding a white whip , and the murder of college school girl at the hand of paid convict enlisted by a mysterious mastermind who keep his face hidden within an office containing aquarium of turtle and fish . The inspector at Scotland Yard , Higgins ( IJoachim Fuchsberger ) and his superior Sir John ( Siegfried Schürenberg ) certainly have their hand full with this case . It all seems to center around student Ann Portland ( Uschi Glas ) , who , when she turn 21 , is to inherit a great deal of wealth . The girl who are targeted share a room with Ann , but the reason for their murder remains a mystery SY 's finest must figure out . The staff of the girl ' dormitory all seem to be hiding something and certain member of the faculty are falling prey to the killer in the red monk robe disguise , talented enough to precisely strangle the neck of those attacked with the whip . Two prisoner are commissioned by a mystery man to use the newly created toxic gas created by a scientist murdered at the beginning of the film during what wa supposed to be a monetary exchange for his creation . It 's a clever scheme where a driver , Greaves ( Günter Meisner ) meet the convict ( .. who hide in a barrel ) who are assisted by a corrupt prison guard . Taken blindfolded to the secret room of the mastermind , he give them order on who to kill and how . Uncovering this operation is a top priority for Higgins and Sir John for it will lead them to the truth they seek in regard to the murder and why they are happening . Under suspicion are girl ' dormitory headmistress , her author brother , a sweaty , incredibly nervous chemistry teacher , a snooping gardener , and the Bannister . Some are red herring until they are disposed of , throwing the viewer for a loop each time until the real mastermind is discovered . The ending feature multiple twist . Out of the Krimi film I 've seen , THE COLLEGE GIRL MURDERS is the closest to a giallo with it 's colorful killer , a convoluted plot yielding lot of surprise and potential suspect , & sordid shenanigan between adult and the college girl at the dormitory . I think you can also see the influence of James Bond on this particular Krimi film with the villain mastermind 's secret hideout with an alligator pit ( .. which is n't used ) , the fake bible/water pistol , when opened , fire the gas into the face of startled victim , the Greaves ' Royles Royce which ha latch that cause flap to darken the window without revealing the passenger in the back seat , and the peep hole used to spy on the girl in their room and while swimming . Many might consider Sir John a liability due to his bumbling , buffoonish behavior and how he often undermines Higgins ' ability to get at the truth ( .. perhaps poking fun at know-it-all British inspector who harm a case more than solve it ) .. I felt he wa used a comedy relief , particularly with his attempt at psychoanalyzing suspect and potential victim , often misunderstanding what are told to him . Higgins , using the skill adopted over his year a an investigator , instead follows the clues/facts , often avoiding Sir John a much a possible . Capable direction by the reliable Alfred Vohrer who keep the pace humming at a nice speed , and the screenplay is full of interesting character and lurid content .. the fact that so many of the adult surrounding the dormitory are suspect , any of them might be the one wielding the whip or calling the shot behind those murdered girl ' execution . I 'd say this may be one of the best ( .. if not the best ) example of the Krimi genre , for it keep you guessing , always one more ace up it 's sleeve .. the revelation unearthed at the very end are quite eye-opening ( .. and , you even get a literal unmasking of the real mastermind pulling the string to top it all off ) .

I wa very lucky to see this film a part of the Melbourne International Film Festival 2005 only a few day ago . I must admit that I am very partial to movie that focus on human relation and especially the one which concentrate on the tragic side of life . I also love the majority of Scandinavian cinematic offering , there is often a particular deep quality in the way the story unfolds and the character are drawn . Character building in this film is extraordinary in it detail and it depth . This is despite the fact that we do encounter quite a number of character all with very particular personal situation and location within their community . The audience at the end of the screening wa very silent and pensive . I am still playing some of those scene in my mind and I am still amazed at their power and meaningfulness .

This movie is really bad . Most of it look like it wa filmed either in a park or a basement . There 's a giant spider but all we see of it is one leg . The whole thing is just laughable .

The three main character are all hopeless , and yet you only feel sorry for one of them : Ernesto , hopelessly devoted to Mercedes . When you least expect it , Quentin Tarintino is doing half a monologue , and Anthony Quinn turn Ernesto into a wealthy man . Time and again great moment appear in the story , but in the end it 's hard to know what to feel about this movie . It doe n't have a happy ending , or even a complete one , but it somehow feel right . This movie is strange , but then so am I ; no wonder I liked it .

This is yet another western about a greedy cattle baron looking to push out small rancher and farmer . It 's certainly all been done before and since . But The Violent Men is something special . What make it special is Barbara Stanwyck playing the role of vixen a she often did in her later film . She 's married to the crippled Edward G. Robinson who 's the cattle baron here , but Robinson is crippled and there is some hint that his injury may have left him impotent . No matter to Barbara , whose need are being met by her brother-in-law Brian Keith . That doe n't sit well with either Dianne Foster who is Robinson and Stanwyck 's daughter , nor with Lita Milan who is Keith 's Mexican girl friend . The infidelity subplot almost take over the film , but Glenn Ford a the stalwart small rancher who is a Civil War veteran come west for his health manages to hold his own here . He 's every inch the quiet western hero who people make the mistake of pushing once too often . I almost expect those famous word from Wild Bill Elliott to come out of Ford 's mouth , `` I 'm a peaceable man . '' Would have been very applicable in The Vioilent Men . The Fifties wa the age of the adult western , theme were entering into horse opera that had n't been explored before . The following year Glenn Ford would do another western , Jubal , one of his best which also explores infidelity a a plot component . There 's enough traditional western stuff in The Violent Men and plenty for those who are addicted to soap opera a well .

Apparently , The Mutilation Man is about a guy who wanders the land performing show of self-mutilation a a way of coping with his abusive childhood . I use the word 'apparently ' because without listening to a director Andy Copp 's commentary ( which I did n't have available to me ) or reading up on the film prior to watching , viewer wo n't have a clue what it is about . Gorehounds and fan of extreme movie may be lured into watching The Mutilation Man with the promise of some harsh scene of splatter and unsettling real-life footage , but unless they 're also fond of pretentious , headache-inducing , experimental art-house cinema , they 'll find this one a real chore to sit through . 82 minute of ugly imagery accompanied by dis-chordant sound , terrible music and incomprehensible dialogue , this mind-numbingly awful drivel is the perfect way to test one 's sanity : if you 've still got all your marble , you 'll switch this rubbish off and watch something decent instead ( I watched the whole thing , but am well aware that I 'm completely barking ! ) .

This movie wa absolutely pathetic . A pitiful screenplay and lack of any story just left me watching three loser drool over bikini babe . All in all , it seems Emran doe n't have a good script from the Bhatts to back him up this time .

I Feel the Niiiiiight Heat ! I feel your HEEAAAAAAAAAART-beat ! Something ai n't right ! '' Theme song written by B.J . Cook from Skylark- David Foster 's old band and wife . Yes i 'll say before i start commenting , this movie is incredibly underrated . Sharon Stone is great in her role of Catherine Trammell a is Morrissey a Dr glass .
