Based on a Edgar Rice Burroughs novel , AT THE EARTH 'S CORE provides little more than mean to escape and give your brain a rest . A Victorian scientist Dr. Abner Perry ( Peter Cushing ) invents a giant burrowing machine , which he and his American partner ( Doug McClure ) use to corkscrew their way deep into the earth to explore what mystery it may hold . They soon discover a lost world of subhuman creature having conflict with prehistoric monster . Cushing come across a an absent minded professor to the point of being annoying . Instead of being a bold adventurer , he come across effeminate . On the other hand McClure overacted enough to make himself also laughable . Caroline Munro play the pretty Princess Dia that refuse to leave her world near the center of the earth . Also in the cast are : Godfrey James , Cy Grant and Michael Crane .

I have seen this film at least 100 time and I am still excited by it , the acting is perfect and the romance between Joe and Jean keep me on the edge of my seat , plus I still think Bryan Brown is the top . Brilliant Film .

This show make absolutely no sense . Every week , two lady go to an estate to do some gardening , and every week without fail , they somehow stumble upon a murder . Because everyone who owns a big house with a large garden is involved in a murder , right ? But even if they did somehow happen to stumble upon murder after murder , would n't the smart thing to do be to tell the police ? You know , the people who can actually do something about it ... But every week , these two fool go around , polluting evidence , committing crime of their own , and , in some case , causing more murder . Once they do miraculously solve the murder , there is no way the murderer could ever be convicted . All the evidence ha been sabotaged . And you 'd think people who are covering up murder would think not to hire these two , would n't you ? Yay ! We 've solved the murder ! Now like every other week , let 's go and confront the murderer ourselves and , with no back-up , tell them that we know about it . There is no way we could get ourselves into any danger , is there ? Rosemary and Thyme is one of the worst show on television , and certainly the most ridiculous .

This movie wa so bad it wa funny ! For awhile there I thought I wa actually watching a parody of a bad movie ( a la `` For Your Consideration '' ) . The `` cliffhanger '' scene at the end had me laughing until my inside hurt . The script wa dreadful enough , but coupled with Sean Young 's terrible acting -- especially while she explains the entire plot in great detail ( complete with flashback ) while dangling off a cliff -- make it a truly classically bad movie worth watching ! In fact the fakey shot in this scene reminded me of an Ed Wood movie . I still ca n't believe how this thing got made . First of all , how did such a bad script get the green light ? How did star actor get attached ? Were they at low point in their career ? Questions , question .

Meryl Streep is such a genius . Well , at least a an actress . I know she 's been made fun of for doing a lot of role with accent , but she nail the accent every time . Her performance a Lindy Chamberlain wa inspiring . Mrs. Chamberlain , a portrayed here , wa not particularly likable , nor all that smart . But that just make Streep 's work all the more remarkable . I think she is worth all 10 or so of her Oscar nomination . About the film , well , there were a couple of interesting thing . I do n't know much about Australia , but the theme of religious bigotry among the general public played a big part in the story . I had largely missed this when I first saw the film some year ago , but it came through loud and clear yesterday . And it seems the Australian press is just a accomplished at misery-inducing pursuit and overkill a their American colleague . A pretty good film . A bit different . Grade : B

'Airport 4 ' is basically a slopped together mess for Universal Studios to try and work a new twist - the Concorde supersonic airliner - into their 'disaster-in-the-sky ' formula . Bogged down with unintentional humor , the best of which is when George Kennedy stick his hand out of Concorde 's window at supersonic speed to fire a flare gun at a heat-seeking missile following the aircraft 's flight path , and the simple fact that these dumb passenger keep re-boarding the same plane to continue their flight despite all the problem in the air . Many star in this one including Robert Wagner , Sylvia Kristel , Alain Delon , and Martha Raye a a nervous passenger . Not really related to the other 'Airport ' film .

Supposedly a `` social commentary '' on racism and prison condition in the rural South of the 1970 's , `` Nightmare '' is full of bad Southern stereotype , complete with phoney accent . Not only would it be offensive to the sensibility of most American Southerners , this tawdry piece of work come off a just a thinly-disguised `` babe in prison '' movie -- especially in it uncut original version . Nevertheless , acting is generally above average and the late Chuck Connors , in particular , doe a good job of making viewer hate him -- even though he look somewhat uncomfortable in several scene . There 's also a change-of-pace role for the late Robert Reed , who appears a the lecherous warden , and Tina Louise ( previously Ginger of `` Gilligan 's Island '' ) made a rather believable sadistic prison guard . My grade : D .

OK , I bought this film from Woolworths for my friend for a joke present on his birthday , because the front cover had a sexual innuendo in it . But we decided it to watch it anyway . Just for hilarity purpose . And I 'm sorry , but this ha got to be , one of THE worst film in history . It began off alright , and we thought `` Ok this might actually be OK '' . But after about 10 minute , we were sadly mistaken . It began when the `` mysterious paint baller '' turned out to be the most obvious character , the Scouser/Australian ( I say that because he had an accent which could n't be identified ) , who 's acting might I just say , wa abysmal . Then it got to the end , and by that time , we had all lost the will to live . The paint ball final . The only thing I did like about this plot is that they did n't actually win , but annoyingly enough they won by default . And I know this ha nothing to do with it , but the name the team were given wa just awful . Critical Damage . I mean they could of picked a more awesome name , like `` The Destroyers of the Anti-Christ '' or something . Or that 's what the film should of been called anyway .

Insignificant and low-brained ( haha ! ) 80 's horror like there are thirteen in a dozen , yet it can be considered amusing if you watch it in the right state of mind . The special effect are tacky , the acting atrocious and the screenplay seems to miss a couple of essential paragraph ! `` The Brain '' take place in a typical quiet-American town setting , where every adolescent work in the same diner and where the cool-kid in high school flush cherry bomb down the toilet . It is here that a TV-guru named Dr. Blake and his adorable pet-brain begin their quest for nation-wide mind controlling . Under the label of `` independent thinker '' , a giant cheesy brain sends out wave through television set and force innocent viewer to kill ! How cool is that ? Now , it 's up to the Meadowvale teen-rebel to save the world ! The funniest thing about the plot is that it never explains where Dr. Blake and his monstrous brain actually come from . There are obvious reference towards extraterrestrial life but that 's about it . Meh , who need a background in a movie like this , really ? There 's not that much bloodshed unfortunately and the `` evil '' brain look like an over-sized sock-puppet . The only more or le interesting element for horror buff is taking a look at the cast and crew who made this movie . Director Ed Hunt and writer Barry Pearson are the same men who made `` Bloody Birthday '' ( guilty pleasure of mine ) and `` Plague '' . Both those are much better movie and they wisely decided to resign the film industry . The most familiar face in the cast unquestionably is the great David Gale , whom horror fan will worship forever for his role in Re-Animator . A girl named Christine Kossak provides the nudity-factor and she 's obviously a great talent She ha exactly 3 movie on her repertoire of which THIS is her `` masterpiece '' . In her debut , she wa credited a 'runaway model ' and in `` 3 men and a baby '' , her character is referred to a 'one of Jack 's girl ' . I really wonder how she feel about her career a an actress

Does anyone remember the alternative comedy show THE COMIC STRIP PRESENTS . One edition featured Charles Bronson ( Robbie Coltrane ) being interviewed about his new movie GLC : `` It 's about a man , an ordinary man whose wife and family get wiped out by creep and I have to hunt them down and kill them in a sadistic and graphic manner `` `` And after GLC what next for Bronson ? `` `` We 're using a new angle . My family do n't get wiped out but I go after creep just the same `` This accurately describes THE EVIL THAT MEN DO . It 's a Bronson vigilante thriller where his motivation is n't down to a blood feud but this lead to credibility becoming strained Bronson is a retired hit-man who is n't giving up his retirement for anything until someone show him a video tape featuring interview with the victim of `` The Doctor `` , not the legendary time traveler but a infamous expert on torture . It 's never really explained why The Doctor is so infamous since any police state ha a myriad of these sadist nor is it explained why The Doctor and his sister have ridiculous English accent As you may guess it 's a lazily written movie and incident happening because the screenwriter need thing to happen to further the plot no matter how unlikely they are like one of the bad guy getting invited to a threesome so he can be killed or thing being revealed like The Doctor 's sister being a lesbian so some T & A can be included In many way it 's like one of those nasty Chuck Norris vehicle that were being released at the same time , but the most disappointing thing is that the director is also the same man who made ICE COLD IN ALEX and THE GUNS OF NAVERONE two very well regarded war drama that are often shown on Sunday afternoon . Believe me this movie wo n't be shown until well after the watershed

Well , here 's another terrific example of awkward 70 's film-making ! The rudimentary premise of `` What 's the matter with Helen ? '' is quite shocking and disturbing , but it 's presented in such a stylish and sophisticated fashion ! In the hand of any other movie crew , this certainly would have become a nasty and gritty exploitation tale , but with director Curtis Harrington ( `` Whoever Slew Auntie Roo ? '' ) and scriptwriter Henry Farrell ( `` Hush Hush Sweet Charlotte '' ) in charge , it became a beautiful and almost enchanting mixture of theme and genre . The basic plot of the film is definitely horrific , but there 's a lot more to experience , like love story , a swinging 1930 's atmosphere and a whole lot of singing and tap-dancing ! The setting is unquestionably what make this movie so unique . We 're literally catapulted back to the 1930 's , with a sublime depiction of that era 's music , religion , theatrical business and wardrobe . Following the long and exhausting trial that sentenced their son to life-imprisonment for murder , Adelle ( Debbie Reynolds ) and Helen ( Shelley Winters ) flee to California and attempt to start a new life running a dance school for young talented girl . Particularly Adelle adapts herself perfectly to the new environment , a she fall in love with a local millionaire , but poor old Helen continues to sink in a downwards spiral of insanity and paranoia . She only listens to the ramblings of a radio-evangelist , fear that she will be punished for the crime her son committed and slowly develops violent tendency . The script , although not entirely without flaw , is well written and the film is adequately paced . There 's never a dull moment in `` What 's the matter with Helen '' , although the singing , tap-dancing and tango sequence are quite extended and much unrelated to the actual plot . But the atmosphere is continuously ominous and the film definitely benefice from the terrific acting performance of Shelley Winters . She 's downright scary a the unpredictable and introvert lady who 's about to snap any second and , especially during the last ten minute or so , she look more petrifying than all the Freddy Kruegers , Jason Voorhees ' and Michael Myers ' combined ! There are several terrific supportive character who are , sadly , a little underdeveloped and robbed from their potential , like Michéal MacLiammóir a the cocky elocution teacher , Agnes Moorehead a the creepy priestess and Timothy Carey a the obtrusive visitor to the lady ' house . There are a couple of surprisingly gruesome scene and moment of genuine shock to enjoy for the Grand Guignol fanatic among u , but particularly the set piece and costume design ( even nominated for an Oscar ! ) are breathtaking .

Resnais , wow ! The genius who brought u Hiroshima Mon Amour take on the challenge of making a 1930s French musical in vibrant colour . The opening voice-over with old , embellished inter-titles wa a nice touch . Then the camera aperture open ( like the old hand crankers ) on a black & white placard . The camera back off ( or rather , up ) , suddenly showing u the surprisingly brilliant colour of an elegant table set for a tea party . This is all in the first 60 second . Then the music start . A rather banal and forgettable diddy featuring an unconvincing chorus of 3 girl blabbering some nonsense which ha no relevance to the film ( and yes , I speak French , so I ca n't blame it on the subtitle ) . Those character whiz out the door and are replaced by more people who break into an even more forgettable song . Then they leave , and finally Audrey Tautou appears and we hear our first appreciable dialogue 15 minute into the film . I 'm not sure what Resnais intended by starting off with such a yawning waste of time & musical cacophony . But the effect on the viewer is to make you want to hurl skittle at the screen and storm out . I endured . It did n't get much better . I 'll tell you why . There is absolutely no familiarity with any of the character . We do n't even see their face half the time ( a Resnais seems too intent on showing off the expensive scenery to care about the actual people in front of the camera ) . People flit on & off stage like moth around a lamp , and we the audience are unable to focus on any particular person or plot . It 's a if you were to take every episode of the Brady Bunch and cram it into a 2 hour movie . With bad song . The only thing that kept me watching a long a I did ( 1 hour ) wa that I wa looking at the camera technique , lighting and scenery which were all , I admit , excellent . But is that enough to hold your attention for 2 hour ? Not me . Maybe tomorrow I 'll try watching the end . Aw , who am I kidding . I have more important thing to do . I 'm sure you do , too . Skip this .

I saw this movie in the middle of the night , when I wa flipping through the channel and there wa nothing else on to watch . It 's one of those film where you stop to see what it is - just for a moment ! - but realize after twenty minute or so that you just ca n't turn it off , no matter how bad it is . One of those movie that is somewhere in between being so bad it 's good and so bad it 's , well , just plain BAD , it 's worth seeing just to experience the confusion of realizing that it 's both ! Great middle-of-the-night fare , if only for the fabulous tennis drag . Do n't even bother asking yourself why nobody can tell that Chad Lowe is so obviously male , because logic doe not apply .

This movie take the plot behind the sci-fi flick `` Doppelganger '' ( an astronaut from our Earth crashing on a 'counter-Earth ' on the opposite side of the Sun , and the Cold War totalitarian vibe on that world ) and try to turn it into a pilot for a TV series . However , the whole thing sank without a trace , and TV is probably better off for it . Everyone here is perfectly adequate in a 'made for TV ' way . Cameron Mitchell turn in his usual solid performance . So doe Glenn Corbett ( who seems to be a kind of poor man 's John Saxon ) who play the rugged individualist whose very existence pose a threat to the foundation of the 'World Order ' on counter Earth . But the low budget and low energy and inconsistent script and the lack of any real imagination in the set design and cinematography keep this Sci-Fi adventure firmly tethered on the launch pad . I 'll give one example : in the original template for this pilot , ( `` Doppleganger '' ) , the astronaut lose control of their landing vehicle in a thunderstorm , and crash their ship in a truly appalling sequence ( it wa obvious that their ship wa never going to fly again ) . Then the two astronaut stagger helplessly from the smoking remains of their vehicle in the middle of howling rain and wind , only to be smacked down and overcome by faceless men yelling through loudspeaker . In `` Stranded in Space '' , the astronaut are sitting in their seat when buzzer sound , thing start shaking , and the camera blur into a blackout ( and a a friend pointed out , it wa pretty obvious that the actor were simply shaking themselves on their seat , the director wa n't even shaking the camera or the set ) . I 've seen episode of `` The Twilight Zone '' and `` The Outer Limits '' that took more effort to establish mood and setting than this made-for-TV mediocrity . And that , in essence , is what 's wrong with `` Stranded In Space '' . No budget , no time , no imagination ... just making the token gesture and hoping the sci-fi Fan Boys ' imagination and enthusiasm will fill in the rest . Sorry , guy , it did n't work . I 'm sure that everyone here just finished their work on this one and walked away , and never thought of it again , except a a listing on their C.V. And that 's what you , the viewer will do . You 'll remember , if pressed , that you once watched a TV movie called `` Stranded In Space '' , but it made no lasting impression on you , and you ca n't recall too much about it .

Black comedy is n't always an easy sell . Every now and then you get a black comedy that is hugely successful , like Fargo , for example . But usually they do n't often find big audience . People seem to either set their mind for comedy , or for serious mayhem . There doe n't seem to be a big market for a good mixture of both . Throw Momma From the Train wa a fairly decent hit , yet few people seem to remember much about it in this day and age . Danny DeVito just about hit this one all the way out of the park back in 1987 . DeVito play an odd mamma 's boy named Owen looking to rid himself of his outrageously overbearing and unpleasant mother whom he still life with . The mother is played by Anne Ramsey , who passed away shortly after this wa released , and she is quite a caricature . She is loud , ugly , rude , and overbearing . Though Owen hardly seems like he could take care of himself , he want desperately to have his mother offed . He fantasizes about it in some truly weird scene , but he clearly doe n't have the gut to actually do it himself . That 's where Billy Crystal come in . Crystal play Larry Donner , Owen 's creative writing teacher at a nearby community college . Larry is a paranoid would-be intellectual novelist who claim his ex-wife stole his novel and made million off it . He is currently trying to write a new one , but can not even come up with a decent first sentence . `` The night wa .... '' Owen hears Larry wish his ex-wife were dead during an outburst at the school cafeteria . And borrowing the idea from Strangers on a Train , Owen decides to travel to Hawai ' i and murder Larry 's ex-wife . Once it appears he ha done so , he expects Larry to return the favor and kill his mother . The resulting action is often quite funny , and even poignant . It 's certainly never dull and often full of surprise . The acting is exceptional , even if Ramsey wa a bit over the top . Crystal is a good a he can be , and DeVito ha always been undervalued a a performer . The film relies on quite a bit of physical comedy which usually work , often painfully so . The film make use of some truly innovative editing technique in some scene , and the off-beat tone is truly refreshing . I have often been critical of the late 1980s a being a time of artistic malaise and down right lazy film-making . Throw Momma From the Train take chance . Both in how it character are drawn a well a it general plot . How many comedy revolve around a son having his mother murdered ? The film is n't too long , and it is chock full of laugh . Writers are apt to find it more interesting than the general public , but it can still be enjoyed by just about anyone . 9 of 10 star . The Hound .

Back in 1994 , I had a really lengthy vacation around the Fourth of July - something like 17 day off in a row what with two week paid vacation , weekend and the holiday itself . I stayed in town during that time , hanging out at my parent ' house a lot . I did n't have a TV in my apartment so I used to watch my parent ' tube . I had just finished watching a segment of the X Files when a program came on called Personal FX . I wa hooked instantly . I had always been fascinated with item in our home that had come from my parent ' family home and through inheritance from relative ' estate , and often wondered about their history , value , etc . After my long vacation , I used to go to my folk ' house on my lunch-hours just to catch Personal FX . I can remember one episode during which co-host Claire Carter announced that the New York apartment in which the series wa filmed wa being renovated and that once said renovation were complete that Personl FX would return to the air . It never did ! Personal FX wa the first -and best - of the collectible show . And it vanished from the air ! Almost fifteen year later , I 'm still sore . Way to go , FX .

Paul Verhoeven 's predecessor to his breakout hit 'Basic Instinct ' is a stylish and shocking neo-noir thriller . Verhoeven ha become known for making somewhat sleazy trash film , both in his native Holland and in America and this film is one of the reason why . The Fourth Man follows the strange story of Gerard Reve ( played by Jeroen Krabbé ) ; a gay , alcoholic and slightly mad writer who go to Vlissingen to give a talk on the story he writes . While there , he meet the seductive Christine Halsslag ( Renée Soutendijk ) who take him back to her house where he discovers a handsome picture of one of her lover and proclaims that he will meet him , even if it kill him . Paul Verhoeven twist the truth many time in this film , and that ensures that you never quite know where you are with it . Many of the occurrence in The Fourth Man could be what they appear to be , but they could easily be interpreted a something else entirely and this keep the audience on the edge of their seat for the duration , and also make the film work a this narrative is what it thrives on . Paul Verhoeven is not a filmmaker that feel he ha to restrain himself , and that is one of thing I like best about him . This film feature a very shocking scene that made me feel ill for hour afterwards ( and that doe n't happen very often ! ) . I wont spoil it because it need the surprise element to work ... but you 'll see what I mean when you see the film ( make sure you get the uncut version ! ) . There is also a number of other macabre scene that are le shocking than the one I 've mentioned , but are lovely nonetheless ; a man get eaten by lion , another one ha a pipe sent through his skull , a boat is smashed in half ... lovely . The acting in The Fourth Man is n't anything to write home about , but it 's solid throughout . Jeroen Krabbé hold the audience 's attention and look the part a the drunken writer . It is Renée Soutendijk that impress the most , though , a the femme fatale at the centre of the tale . Her performance is what Sharon Stone would imitate nine year later with Basic Instinct , but the original fatale did it best . Paul Verhoeven 's direction is solid throughout a he directs our attention through numerous point of view , all of which help to create the mystery of the story . Verhoeven ha gone on to make some rubbish , but he obviously ha talent and it 's a shame that he doe n't put it to better use . Of all the Verhoeven film I 've seen , this is the best and although it might be difficult to come across ; trust me , it 's worth the effort .

I accept that most 50 's horror are n't scary by today 's standard , but what the hell is this ? When you see a title like this you expect to see blood and a blood thirsty beast . Instead we get no blood at all and a beast who either want to take over the world or live in peace on Earth .... yeah which is what the people wanted . The overall story is fine with the astronaut coming back to life and being one with the beast .... but the title really kill the movie . Night of the Beast would have made the fan more happy because there really is n't any blood to speak of . I like how the 50 's movie had ending that left room for a sequel but wisely never made one . This movie is n't the worst i 've ever seen but it almost up there . 2 out of 10

Demon Wind is about a much fun a breaking your leg . It is definitely an awful example of a film . So awful in fact that I do n't even consider it a movie . I describe it more a a thing ... a monstrous thing . A thing that must be stopped at all cost . My friend and I first discovered this ... thing buried under a big box of video tape at my friend 's house . It wa a late night and we had nothing better to do so we decided to watch some cheesy horror movie ( we unfortunately picked this one . ) Well , during the 90 minute that this thing played we ended up laughing so hard that we almost threw up . The thing is literally pointless in every sense of the word . It 's just a cheap , poorly done rip-off of Evil Dead . The whole `` story '' seems to be nothing more than some guy wanting to knock off his friend by inviting them to an abandoned house and letting demon rip them to piece . I have a bet that the writer were actually writing the story while it wa being filmed . I 've seen bad horror movie before ( Manos , Troll 2 , HOBGOBLINS ! ! ! ) ( shudder ) I would have to say that Demon Wind could definitely contend with any and all of these film on term of sheer stupidity . Watch it only if you enjoy laughing at stupid film . Fun fact : This film is like a cockroach on steroid ! Much like the ouija board , every time we try to get rid of it , it always seems to mysteriously reappear . Kind of scary huh ?

There is a difference between a `` film , '' and a `` movie . '' A film , regardless of quality , is ready for public consumption . A movie is what a group of friend get together to make over the course of a weekend with a camcorder . In my time a a viewer , I have seen may example of both . On September 19 , I attended a screening of writer/director Jon Satejowski 's `` Donnybrook . '' Now having read the script and having seen two different cut ( a rough cut and the `` finished '' product ) of this piece , I can safely say it is a movie . And a student movie , at that . It is , for lack of a better word , competent , which is to say , the director knew how to push record on a camera and capture moving image . The visuals are , for the most part , static and unimpressive , and dialog scene are reduced to mostly long shot , with little to no close up shot to allow the audience to establish a relationship with the character . I understand that this is a modestly budgeted film , but some visual flair would have been appreciated , and it would have gone a long way toward keeping the audience interested . Granted , there have been independent picture that have shown that limited camera work can be over come with well a well written , engrossing story and some sharp dialog . Steven Soderbergh 's `` sex , lie , and videotape '' come immediately to mind . This movie , however , ha neither . The main story is weak and unfocused . If the main plot is Davie trying to mend his relationship with his father , then I feel this movie miss the point . What I got out of it is that Davie 's main aspiration is to `` change the face of rock 'n ' roll . '' However , we see very little activity on his part to show this . While there is one dream sequence at the beginning , and an impromptu performance of his at the end , all we seem to get are scene of Davie listening to music or casually strumming a guitar . We are simply told that Davie ha played a lot of gig , but we never see him in full rock out mode . Next time , SHOW do n't TELL the audience . Anyone who ha taken a creative writing class know this . Also , Davie doe n't look like someone that would have been big in the glam rock era of the 1970 's ; he look like he 'd be more comfortable in the early day of rock 'n ' roll , posing a James Dean 's le talented brother . In the meantime , the rest of the movie event seem to happen at random to rather cliché character , and story thread , that have little or nothing to do with the slim main story , are brought up and abandoned with alarming frequency ( i.e . the subplot involving Terry 's father ) . If I want to see a film with this kind of haphazard construction , I will consider watching `` Napolean Dynamite '' again , a film I could barely make it through the first time . As for the above mentioned dialog scene , I guess I should mention that they are few and extremely far between . Is it too much to ask for character who do speak ? I do n't think it is . When the character do speak , it is in short , choppy sentence ; collection of oh so insightful question , angered grunt or wildly over-the-top outburst . These character simply do not behave like normal , rational people . Working with material like this , it is easy to understand why there is only one good performance in the film , Al Hudson 's , and that 's just because he 's doing a poor imitation of Sam Elliott for his time on screen . A good director , or at least one who is ready for the challenge of a feature director , would have been able to spot these problem and get the writer and camera people to correct them . However , with Satejowski being so close to the material , he simply doe n't see them , or , if he doe , he is unwilling to take the necessary step to fix them because it 'll hurt his creative vision . Being unable or unwilling to deal with criticism in a constructive manner , is the mark of a self-indulgent , misguided fool . Just ask Rob Schneider . In the end , we are left with a poor , high-school-set , knock-off of Zach Braff 's amazing `` Garden State '' combined with the equally amazing `` Velvet Goldmine , '' two film far more worthy of your time . Now before any of the cast or crew come out of the word work to take me to task for this review , allow me to offer this . The best I can do is compliment Mr. Satejowski for having the ambition to make a film of his own and to put it out there for an audience to see . However , the hope that this movie will be picked up and distributed are simply deluded vision of grandeur . This is a student movie , nothing more , nothing le . If the movie hold any promise ( and let 's face it , at this point , it is n't going to come from the acting , writing , or directing ) , it is this : If , IF , the people associated with this film are willing , then , please , learn from this movie , file it away , and use the lesson learned on your next attempt ; do n't attack your critic , or have friend or family do it for you . If you are able to do this , maybe the next one will be worthy of distribution , worthy of being called a `` film . '' I am your audience , and I am willing to watch .

please re-watch all 3 series and do not go see this movie , the trailer is completely misleading and the 3 weakest character in the series stretch a badly thought out 25min TV episode into the most painful 2hrs of my life , truly an awful film . tubbs and edward are in it for a few min , micky ha 1 line , and her lipp just reel out the same tired old pun , also mr bris 's accent just change about 5 time in the film ton of badly acted extra , and really a few laugh that they seem to recycle for 2 hr i honestly feel this series ha been completely ruined by this god-awful piece of crap .......... batman and robin all is forgiven

Finally ! An Iranian film that is not made by Majidi , Kiarostami or the Makhmalbafs . This is a non-documentary , an entertaining black comedy with subversive young girl subtly kicking the 'system ' in it as . It 's all about football and it funny , it really funny . The director say `` The place are real , the event is real , and so are the character and the extra . This is why I purposely chose not to use professional actor , a their presence would have introduced a notion of falseness . '' The non-actors will have you rooting for them straightaway unless a. your heart is made of stone b. you are blind . Excellently scripted , the film challenge patriarchal authority with an almost absurd freshness . It ha won the Jury Grand Prize , Berlin , 2006 . Dear reader , it 's near-perfect . WHERE , where can I get hold of it ?

Sometimes you just have to have patient when watching indie horror . If you can just toe-tap your way through the slow-paced early scene , sometimes a real gem will present itself ... This ( unfortunately ) wa not the case with `` Satan 's Whip '' . Written and directed by Jason Maran , `` Satan 's Whip '' attempt to drag u along on a boring snore-fest of a film , with no real pay off at the end . I 'm guessing that the black & white ( and blue ) cinematography must have been for a reason , however it is never explained why the majority of the blood is blue , and I found this increasingly annoying a the film went on . The story in itself is not that bad , and actually had some originality and decent content but the acting is simply pathetic . This , combined with the slow-pacing and lack of any real ( red ) gore made `` Satan 's Whip '' one to forget quite quickly . I will give it a `` 4 '' rating for some witty dialog that made me chuckle , but ala that could not save this boring waste of my time .

Tainted look at kibbutz life This film is le a cultural story about a boy 's life in a kibbutz , but the deliberate demonization of kibbutz life in general . In the first two minute of the movie , the milk man in charge of the cow rape one of his calf . And it 's all downhill from there in term of the character representing typical `` kibbutznikim . '' Besides the two main character , a clinically depressed woman and her young son , every one else in the kibbutz is a gross caricature of well evil . The story center on how the kibbutz , like some sort of cult , slowly drag the mother and son deeper into despair and what inevitably follows . There is no happiness , no joy , no laughter in this kibbutz . Every character/situation represents a different horrific human vice like misogyny , hypocrisy , violence , cultism , repression etc . For example , while the protagonist is a strikingly handsome European looking 12 year old boy  his older brother is a typical kibbutz youth complete with his `` jewish '' physical appearance and brutish personality . He care more about screwing foreign volunteer than the health of his dying mother . He treat these volunteer like trash . After his little brother pleads of him to visit his dying mother whom he ha n't seen in a long time due to his military service , he order , Quote  `` Linda , go take shower and I cum in two minute . '' There is one other `` good '' character in this movie  a European foreigner who play the mother 's boyfriend . When the animal rapist try to hit the mother 's son , the boyfriend defends him by breaking the rapist 's arm . He is summarily kicked out of the kibbutz then for `` violent '' behavior against one of the kibbutz member . More hypocrisy : The indescribably annoying French woman who play the school teacher preaches that sex can not happen before age 18 , or without love and give an account of the actual act that 's supposed to be humorous for the audience , but is really just stupid . She of course is screwing the head of the kibbutz in the field who then in turn screw the little boy 's mom when her mental health take a turn for the worse . The film portrays the kibbutz like some sort of cult . Children get yanked out of their bed in the middle of the night and taken to some ritual where they swear allegiance in the field overseen by the kibbutz elder . The mother apparently ca n't `` escape '' the kibbutz , although in reality , anyone was/is always free to come and go a they choose . It 's a mystery how the boy 's father died , but you can rest assured , the kibbutz `` drove him to it '' and his surviving parent are another pair of heartless , wretched character that weigh down on the mother and her son . That 's the gist of this movie . One dimensional character , over dramatization , dry performance , and an insidious message that keep trying to hammer itself into the audience 's head  that kibbutz life wa degrading , miserable and even deadly for those who did n't `` fit in . '' I feel sorry for the guy who made this film  obviously he had a bad experience growing up in a kibbutz . But I feel a though he took a few kernel of truth regarding kibbutz life and turned them into huge atomic stereotyped bomb .

( When will I ever learn- ? ) The ecstatic reviewer on NPR made me think this turkey wa another Citizen Kane . Please allow me to vent my spleen ... I will admit : the setting , presumably New York City , ha never been so downright ugly and unappealing . I am reminded that the 70 's wa a bad decade for men 's fashion and automobile . And all the smoking- ! If the plan wa to cheapen the character , it succeeded . For a film to work ( at least , in my simple estimation ) , there ha to be at least ONE sympathetic character . Only Ned Beaty came close , and I could not wait for him to finish off Nicky . If a stray shot had struck Mikey , well , it may have elicited a shrug of indifference at the most . I ca n't remember when I detested a film a strongly . I suppose I 'm a rube who doe n't dig `` art '' flick . Oh , well .

`` Lost '' , `` 24 '' , `` Carnivale '' , `` Desperate Housewifes '' ... the list go on and on . These , and a bunch of other high-quality , show prof that we 're in the middle of a golden age in television history . `` Lost '' is pure genius . Incredible layer of personal , and psychologically viable , story , underscored by sublime cinematography ( incredible to use this word , when describing a TV-show ) , a killer score , great performance and editing . Anyone who is n't hooked on this , are missing one of the most important creative expression in television ever . It may have it problem , when watching only one episode a week , but the DVD format is actually an incredible way to watch this . Hope they keep it up ( a I 'm sure they do ) .

Clifton Webb is one of my favorite . However , Mister Scoutmaster is not one of his best . His patented curmudgeon role seems forced and even unpleasant rather than funny . The film itself is overflowing with mawkish sentimentality . In addition , the viewer is presented with numerous ham-handed reference to religious faith and U.S. patriotism that come off a over-reverent rather than genuine . Clifton Webb doe his best with a poor script . Edmund Gwenn play yet another jovial clergyman and is given nothing to do . The child actor lead is played by a talentless child who display a flat affect throughout the entire film . His sole claim to fame a a performer evidently is a bullfrog-like low voice unusual for someone of his age . However , once you 've heard it , you 've heard it and you do n't need to hear it again . Unfortunately , he is in the majority of the film 's scene . I find this child so irritating that I fast forward whenever he show up . Since he ha a lot of scene in this film , this mean that I fast forward through a lot of the film . There were and are so many talented child actor ; it 's a pity this film doe n't have any of them in it . Still , Clifton Webb in the traditional broad-brimmed hat and short is a sight worth seeing .

This is a must-see documentary movie for anyone who fear that modern youth ha lost it taste for real-life adventure and it sense of morality . Darius Goes West is an amazing roller-coaster of a story . We live the life of Darius and the crew a they embark on the journey of a lifetime . Darius ha Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy , a disease which affect all the muscle in his body . He is confined to a wheelchair , and need round-the-clock attention . So how could this crew of young friend possibly manage to take him on a 6,000 mile round-trip to the West Coast and back ? Watch the movie and experience the ups and down of this great adventure - laugh and cry with the crew a they cope with unimaginable challenge along the way , and enjoy the final triumph when they arrive back three week later in their home town to a rapturous reception and some great surprise !

The message of a world on the brink of war is disregarded by the mass ; the mythical city of Everytown in 1940 represents England in general , but it could just a well stand for any nation of the world . When war finally doe arrive , it 's ravage continue not for another five year , but until 1966 at which time Everytown is completely destroyed . Adding to the desolation and toll on humanity is the `` wandering sickness '' , a pestilence that continues for another four year . `` Things to Come '' balance both a fatalistic and futuristic world view , where science hold out a hope for a revived civilization . The `` Wings Over the World '' concept play out a bit corny , though it 's spokesman Cabal ( Raymond Massey ) is unwavering in his mission and dedicated to his cause . If he fails , others will follow . This message is continually reinforced throughout the film , brought home convincingly in Massey 's end of movie speech . Man 's insatiable need to test the limit of knowledge and achievement requires an `` all the universe or nothing '' mindset . The film 's imagery of automation and machinery in the second half is reminiscent of the great silent film `` Metropolis '' . As Everytown is rebuilt and transformed by the year 2036 , the spectacle of the city 's rebirth strike a resonant chord , a architecture of modern city of today suggest the movie 's eerily prophetic vision is coming to fruition . Where the movie get it wrong by sixty seven year though is man 's first mission to the moon , but in 1936 , a hundred year timetable probably seemed more legitimate than 1969 . `` Things to Come '' is one of those rarity in film , a picture that make you think . Which side will you come down on , the force for advancement in the face of uncertainty or maintain the status quo ? It 's not a comfortable question , a both choice offer inherent danger and unknowable outcome . Those who choose to be bystander risk being swept away by force beyond their control .

Fulci ... Does this man brings one of the goriest and weirdest movie ever made ? Answer : yes ! Cat in the Brain , also known a Nightmare Concert is Fulci 's last masterpiece . Yes it is , no matter what some people will say about it . There are few fact why this movie is one of the best Fulci 's movie . Fulci make a fun of himself and his movie with this one . Lead roll in this movie is no other then Fulci himself , who play ... well horror-splatter-gore director , who think he is slowly going insane . It 's filled with black humor which unlike in the most of the modern horror movie work here . Being Fulci flick , you need to know it 's gory . How much ? Well pretty much . I always loved gore in the movie and I never get enough of it , but Cat in the Brain actually stopped my thirst for gore , and believe me , it 's a hard to archive . Even the Braindead did n't stop it . CITB is all about gore . Almost every scene revolves about Fulci , who after being hypnotized by * khmmm * evil psychiatrist is seeing all kind of horror for everything that happens to him or everything he see . Some of the scene involves him accidentally dropping the whiskey , and instead of that he see rotten corpse lying on the floor , which start to spit some ooze from it 's wound . Forget the Beyond or Zombie 2 , this IS the goriest Fulci movie ! Now I like how Fulci manage to apply all those comic part in the gorefest movie . He is such a brilliant director . Some funny moment and line happens from time to time , like one where Fulci say `` making gore movie is kind of a sickness '' Ending is very good considering that Fulci ( and most of the Italian horror master ) is know for making ending with no sense or many plot hole . If you are fun of the Fulci , make sure you check it out . If you have a weak stomach , avoid this and repeat `` Its only a movie '' p . some of the gore scene within this movie : Chainsaw dismemberment ( full ) , tongue torn out , eyeball torn out , maggot infested corps , zombie , decapitation , face being putted in boiling water , stab in the shower ( to head ) , throat slit , many part of the body and organ being toast aside , hammer smashed face ...

What an incomprehensible mess of a movie . Something about a cop who extract bullet from himself after he get shot and keep them in a glass jar in his bathroom ( and from the size of the jar he 's been shot about fifty time by now ) and a top secret tank guarded by five or six incompetent soldier who for some reason drive it into Mexico . Whether they were sent there intentionally or just got really really lost is never made clear . And you 'll never hear another screenplay feature the word `` butthorn '' either . Gary Busey try out the Mel Gibson role from `` Lethal Weapon '' and while Busey is a serviceable actor the screenplay damn the whole movie to mediocrity . William Smith doe another turn a a Russian soldier , the same character he played in `` Red Dawn '' a few year earlier . After playing biker heavy for most of the 70 it wa sort of nice to see him expand his range playing Communist heavy . Sadly he 'll probably always be remembered best a the guy who Clint Eastwood whupped in `` Every Which Way You Can . ''

WARNING : REVIEW CONTAINS MILD SPOILERS A couple of year back I managed to see the first five film in this franchise , and wa planning to do an overview of the whole Elm St. series . However , just two year on and I find I ca n't remember enough about them in order to do it  I guess they could n't have made much of an impression . From what I do recall , some of the sequel  Dream Warriors in particular  were n't a bad a is often made out , though even the original wa no classic . Generally , the predictability of the premise ( if people fall asleep they get murdered in their dream ) doe n't lend itself to narrative tension . But while I can not recall much of the first five film , I do know they never plumbed the depth of Freddy 's Dead . An indication of how sick of Freddy the public wa at this point can be judged by the fact that the film wa promoted solely on the character 's demise . The fact that the movie 's conclusion is not even hidden , but in fact the entire purpose for the film 's being go to illustrate how vacant , soulless and cynical this venture wa . Taking the morally questionable idea of having a child molester a the charismatic villain , Robert Englund 's in-no-way-scary interpretation boom with laughter . I always thought Freddy 's mockery of the teenage victim wa le aimed at the character than at the teenage audience that could ever watch this tripe . It 's like Englund 's cry out `` we know this is garbage  but you 're paying to see it , so who 's the one laughing ? '' And I 'm sure victim of child abuse would be disheartened to see such an insensitive depiction of their plight . Was Freddy 's appearance in the film always so rudimentary ? All he get to do here is a few `` haaaaaaaaaaaaaarr  har  har  hars '' and that 's it . If this wa the only Elm St. film you 'd ever seen you would n't get to know the character at all . Even a the character pre-death in a flashback Englund play him a a boo-hiss pantomime villain with a slop of Transatlantic ( ie . overstated , misplaced and not at all funny ) irony . Acting is almost universally poor . Just look at how many time Breckin Meyer overacts with his hand gesture and body language . Only Kananga himself , Yaphet Kotto , keep his dignity . And when Roseanne , Tom Arnold and Alice Cooper show up , you can almost visibly see the film sinking further into the mire . The script , too , is absolutely lousy , almost wholly without merit . Carlos ( Ricky Dean Logan ) open a road map , upon which the Noel Coward-like Freddy ha wittily written `` you 're f * * ked '' . When prompted for the map , Carlos responds `` well the map say we 're f * * ked '' . Who wrote the screenplay , Oscar Wilde ? Or how about the scene where Carlos is tortured by Freddy , his hearing enhanced to painful level ? So Freddy torment him by threatening to drop a pin  a potentially fatal sound , given that all sound are magnified . Oddly , the fact that Carlos shout at the top of his voice for him not to drop it seems to have no effect . `` Nice hearing from you , Carlos '' , quip Freddy , hoping some better line will come along . It 's also worth noting that dream sleep doe n't occur instaneously , so being knocked unconscious would n't allow instant access into Freddy 's world . Though a part of the narrative contains a human computer game and a 3-D finale plot logic is n't that high on the list of requirement . The teenager heading the cast this time are really the most obnoxious , dislikeable group in the whole series . Tracy ( Lezlie Deane ) is the only one who get to greet Freddy with `` shut the f * * k up , man '' and a kick in the scallop . And wa incongruous pop music always part of the ingredient ? Freddy 's Dead . No laugh . No scare . No interest . No fun .

Some comment here on IMDb have likened Dog Bite Dog to the classic Cat III film of the 90 , but although it is undoubtedly brutal , violent and very downbeat , this film from Pou-Soi Cheang is n't really sleazy , lurid or sensationalist enough to earn that comparison . However , it still pack a punch that make it worth a watch , particularly if gritty , hard-edged action is your thing . Edison Chen play Pang , a Cambodian hit-man who travel to Hong Kong to assassinate the wife of a judge ; Sam Lee is Wai , the ruthless cop who is determined to track him down , whatever the cost . With Wai closing in on his target , Pang will stop at nothing to ensure his escapeuntil he meet Yue , a pretty illegal immigrant who need his help to escape her life of abuse . A relentlessly harsh drama with great cinematography , amazing sound design , a haunting score , and solid performance from Chen and Lee ( a well a newcomer Pei Pei a Pang 's love interest ) , Dog Bite Dog is one for fan of hard-hitting Asian hyper-violence ( think along the line of Chan-wook Park 's Vengeance trilogy ) . Stabbings , shooting , merciless beating : all happen regularly in this film and are caught unflinchingly by director Cheang . Of course , this is the kind of tale that is destined to have an unhappy ending for all involved , and sure enough , pretty much everyone in this film dy ( rather nasty death ) . Unfortunately , there is a fine line between tragedy and ( unintentional ) comedy , and in it final moment , Dog Bite Dog cross it : in a laughably over-dramatic final scene , Pang and Wai are locked in battle a a pregnant Yue look on . Eventually , after all three have suffered severe stab wound during the fracas , a wounded Pang performs a DIY Ceasarean on ( a now dead ) Yue , delivering their baby moment before he himself dy . Whilst this film might not be a 'classic ' slice of Hong Kong excess , with it deliriously OTT action and stylish visuals , it 's still worth seeking out .

I have decided to not believe what famous movie critic say . Even though this movie did not get the best comment , this movie made my day . It got me thinking . What a false world this is . What do you do when your most loved one deceive you . It 's said that no matter how often you feed milk to a snake , it can never be loyal and will bite when given a chance . Same way some people are such that they are never grateful . This movie is about how selfish people can be and how everyone is ultimately just thinking about oneself and working for oneself . A brother dy inadvertently at the hand of a gangster . The surviving brother decides to take revenge . Through this process , we learn about the futility of this world . Nothing is real and no one is loyal to anyone . Amitabh gave the performance of his life . The new actor Aryan gave a good performance . The actress who played the wife of Amitabh stole the show . Her role wa small but she portrayed her role so diligently that one is moved by her performance . Chawla had really great face expression but her role wa very limited and wa not given a chance to fully express herself . A great movie by Raj Kumar Santoshi . His movie always give some message to the audience . His movie are like novel of Nanak Singh ( a Punjabi novelist who 's novel always had a purpose and targeted a social evil ) because they have a real message for the audience . They are entertaining a well a lesson-giving .

The torture and abuse of child ? Whats wrong with you people ? Lynch is truly ha a disgusting , ugly mind .

I ca n't say much about this film . I think it speaks for itself ( a do the current rating on here ) . I rented this about two year ago and I totally regretted it . I even /tried/ to like it by watching it twice , but I just could n't . I can safely say that I have absolutely no desire to see this waste of time ever , ever again . In New Orleans , an illegal immigrant feel sick and leaf a poker game while winning the smalltime criminal Blackie ( Walter Jack Palance ) . He is chased by Blackie and his men Raymond Fitch ( Zero Mostel ) and Poldi ( Guy Thomajan ) , killed by Blackie and his body is dumped in the sea . During the autopsy , the family man Lieutenant Commander Dr. Clinton Reed ( Richard Widmark ) of the U.S. Public Health Service find that the dead man had pneumonic plague caused by rat and he need to find who had any type of contact with the man within forty-eight hour to avoid an epidemic . The City Mayor assigns the skeptical Captain Tom Warren ( Paul Douglas ) to help Dr. Clint to find the killer that are infected with the plague and inoculate them . `` Panic in the Streets '' discloses a simple story , but it is still effective and with a great villain . The engaging plot ha not become dated after fifty-seven year . Jack Palance performs a despicable scum in his debut , and the camera work while he try to escape with Zero Mostel is still very impressive . My vote is seven . Title ( Brazil ) : `` Pânico na Ruas '' ( `` Panic in the Streets '' )

There have been many documentary that I have seen in which it appeared that the law wa on the wrong side of the fence - The Thin Blue Line and Paradise Lost come to mind first and foremost . But this is the first film that had me seething with anger after I saw it . It seems blatantly clear to me from the evidence presented in this film that what happened at Waco wa at the very least an unprofessional and sloppy mess on the part of the FBI and AFI , and at the very worst an act of murder . Like most people , when the siege at Waco wa occurring I assumed that David Koresh wa a completely evil madman who wa leading a violent cult . After seeing this , I think that Koresh wa more likely a slightly unbalanced and confused guy who inadvertently caught the attention of the U.S. government through his eccentric action . Sure , there were lot of weapon at the Branch Davidian compound . But none of it wa illegal . It wa absolutely heartbreaking to see the video footage of the people inside the compound , all of them seeming to be very nice and harmless . And it wa angering to see the callous testimony of the men in charge of the government force on the Waco site , the clueless testimony of Janet Reno , and the partisan defense of the attack on Waco , a defense led by a few of the committee Democrats . Standing out most in my mind wa NY representative and current U.S. senator from NY Charles Schumer . I voted for the man when I lived in NY state - I 'm a Democrat , pretty left-leaning too . After seeing his action on this committee , I wish I could go back in time and vote for D'Amato instead ! For anyone remotely interested in the government , this is a very crucial film , a must see . I even think this should be shown in class - it 's that important .

Yes , I call this a perfect movie . Not one boring second , a fantastic cast of mostly little known actress and actor , a great array of character who are all well defined and who all have understandable motif I could sympathize with , perfect lighting , crisp black and white photography , a fitting soundtrack , an intelligent and harmonious set design and a story that is engaging and work . It 's one of those prime quality picture on which all the pride of Hollywood should rest , the mark everyone should endeavor to reach . Barbara Stanwyck is simply stunning . There wa nothing this actress could n't do , and she always went easy on the melodramatic side . No hysterical outburst with this lady - I always thought she wa a better actress than screen goddess like Bette Davis or Joan Crawford , and this movie confirmed my opinion . Always a tough a nail and at the same time conveying true sentiment . It is fair to add that she also got many good part during her long career , and this one is by far the least interesting . The title fit this movie very well . It is about desire , human desire I think everyone can understand . Actually , no one seems to be scheming in this movie , all character act on impulse , everybody want to be happy without hurting anybody else . The sad fact that this more often than not lead to complication make for the dramatic content into which I will not go here . I liked what this movie ha to say about youth , about maturing and about the necessity to compromise . The movie I associate most with this one is Alfred Hitchcock 's Shadow of a Doubt , it creates a similar atmosphere of idealized and at the same time caricatured Small Town America . The story ha a certain similarity with Fritz Lang 's considerably harsher movie Clash by Night , made one year earlier , where Stanywck star in a similar part . I can also recommend it .

I had some reservation about this movie , I figured it would be the usual bill of fare -- - a formula movie about Christmas . Being in the middle of a heat wave in late June , we decided to give it a shot anyway , maybe we would see some snow . This movie turned out to be one laugh after another . Ben Affleck wa believable in his character , but the real star of this one is James Gandofini . He delivered his line with a real wit about him and made a great `` dad '' . If you want to have an enjoyable couple of hour , definitely check this one out .

When I first saw this film around 6 month ago , I considered it interesting , but little more . But it stuck with me . That interest grew and grew , and I wondered whether my initial boredom and response had more to do with the actual VHS quality rather than the film itself . I purchased the Criterion DVD box set , and it turn out that I wa right the second time . Alexander Nevsky is a great film . It is rousing , and I 'm sure it succeeded in it main aim : propaganda against the Germans . That is the most common criticism against this film , and against Eisenstein , that it is merely propagandist and nothing else . It 's untrue . He is an amazing film artist , one of the most important whoever lived . By now , the world is far enough beyond Joseph Stalin to be able to watch Eisenstein 's film a art .

Focus is another great movie starring William H. Macy . I first discovered Macy in Fargo and I 've seen a few of his film and he ha n't yet deceived me . Macy is the archetypal `` nice guy with something to hide '' . In Focus , he play the role of Lawrence Newman , a loyal and hard-working stiff , who harbour his handicapped mother at home . The scene is set after World War II , at the height of McCarthyism . Newman is the head of Human Resources for a company which is basically , anti-Semite . After he accidentally hire a woman of Jewish descent , he is asked to buy a pair of glass , to improve his failing eyesight . Unbelievably , the simple act of buying glass ha great repercussion on his life and that of Gertrude Hart , his wife ( played by a great Laura Dern ) . As the film unravels , Newman will begin to see a whole different world , where being Jewish is akin to being an animal . The movie is disturbing in the way it show that being racist wa something fairly normal . The chilling thought is that in some place , it probably still is .

In `` Brave New Girl , '' Holly come from a small town in Texas , sings `` The Yellow Rose of Texas '' at a local competition , and get admitted to a prestigious art college in Philadelphia . From there the movie grows into a colorful story of friendship and loyalty . I loved this movie . It wa full of great singing and acting and character that kept it moving at a very nice pace . The acting wa , of course , wonderful . Virginia Madsen and Lindsey Haun were outstanding , a well a Nick Roth The camera work wa really done well and I wa very pleased with the end ( It seems a sequel could be in the making ) . Kudos to the director and all others that participated on this production . Quite a gem in the film archive .

Despite a totally misleading advertising campaign , this flick turn out to be an irritatingly clichéd , sub-par haunted house flick with a totally implausible ending . Clue # 1 for all considering seeing this turkey : Sam Raimi did n't direct it . Although commercial for the movie play up his involvement , in truth he is one of four producer . It 's too bad that someone a talented a Raimi ha allowed his name to be used in conjunction with such a poor movie . I do n't think he would ever have directed something like this ; that task wa left to the Pang Brothers . The screenplay for this film seems to have been cobbled together from numerous other `` horror '' film , so you 'll find absolutely zero original content in `` The Messengers . '' What we get are a scene here and there that wa plucked straight out of `` Pulse , '' a couple that could have come from `` The Birds , '' one or two from `` The Others , '' etc . Nearly every scene , almost every line of dialogue , is one that ha been lifted from any number of other movie . The whole thing make for such a predictable movie that almost anyone will be able to figure out the `` surprise ending '' long before it come . Right about here would be a good time to point out that the advertising campaign , centered on the idea that only child can see ghost , ha nothing to do with this movie . In fact , everyone can see the ghost . The teenage daughter and mother character certainly see them , even quite early in the movie . I 'm sure that whomever wa in charge of marketing came up with this campaign because the film needed a unique angle to have any box office appeal , which otherwise is entirely absent . Now you know , so do n't be fooled ! Perhaps what this movie lack most of all is anything resembling chemistry between the actor . It simply is n't there . All of the interaction come across a awkwardly stilted . Coupled with the hackneyed story and ridiculous plot hole ( just what is a guy who murdered his whole family doing still lurking around the small town where the murder happened , anyhow ? Did n't anyone think to maybe arrest him ? ) , it all add up to a profoundly unsatisfying ghost flick that only manages to surprise anyone over the age of ten with cheap shot : loud noise , visual flash , and anything short of a sheeted figure jumping out of a closet and yelling `` Boo ! '' All we get for our buck this time around is yet another poorly-made film about spirit attempting to warn people away from a house . If there 's any message that `` The Messengers '' delivers , it 's `` Do n't waste your time on this movie . ''
