I wa looking forward to The Guardian , but when I walked into the theater I wa n't really in the mood for it at that particular time . It 's kind of like the Olive Garden - I like it , but I have to be in the right mindset to thoroughly enjoy it . I 'm not exactly sure what wa dampening my spirit . The trailer looked good , but the water theme wa giving me bad flashback to the last Kevin Costner movie that dealt with the subject - Waterworld . Plus , despite the promise Ashton Kutcher showed in The Butterfly Effect , I 'm still not completely sold on him . Something about the guy just annoys me . Probably ha to do with his simian feature . It took approximately two minute for my fear to subside and for my hesitancy to slip away . The movie immediately throw u into the midst of a tense rescue mission , and I wa gripped tighter than Kenny Rogers ' orange face lift . My concern briefly bristled at Kutcher 's initial appearance due to the fact that too much effort wa made to paint him a ridiculously cool and rebellious . Sunglasses , a tough guy toothpick in his mouth , and sportin ' a smirk that 'd make George Clooney proud ? Yeah , we get it . I wa totally ready to hate him . But then he had to go and deliver a fairly strong performance and force me to soften my jab . Darn you , ape man ! Efficiently mixing tense , exciting rescue scene , drama , humor , and solid acting , The Guardian is easily a film that I dare say the majority of audience will enjoy . You can quibble about it clichés , predictability , and rare moment of overcooked sappiness , but none of that take away from the entertainment value . I had a bad feeling that the pace would slow too much when Costner started training the young guy , but on the contrary , the training session just might be the most interesting aspect of the film . Coast Guard Rescue Swimmers are hero whose story have never really been portrayed on the big screen , so I feel the inside look at what they go through and how tough it is to make it is very informative and a great way to introduce audience to this under-appreciated group . Do you have what it take to be a rescue swimmer ? Just think about it -you get to go on dangerous mission in cold , dark , rough water , and then you must fight disorientation , exhaustion , hypothermia , and a lack of oxygen all while trying to help stranded , panicked people who are depending on you for their survival . And if all that is n't bad enough , sometimes you ca n't save everybody so you have to make the tough decision of who life and who dy . Man , who want all that responsibility ? Not me ! I had no idea what it wa really like for these guy , and who would have thought I 'd have an Ashton Kutcher/Kevin Costner movie to thank for the education ? Not only doe The Guardian do a great job of paying tribute to this rare breed of hero , but lucky for u it also doe a good job of entertaining it paying customer . THE GIST Moviegoers wanting an inside look at what it 's like to embark on a daring rescue mission in the middle of the ocean might want to give The Guardian a chance . I saw it for free , but had I paid I would 've felt I had gotten my money 's worth .

Going into see Seven Pounds i wa n't clearly sure what to think because the preview left to much open to grasp what the movie wa really about . So within the first 20 min or so you are completely lost in the plot , have no idea what is going on and you think Tim , who claim to be Ben , is just a big asshole . All of this come to an end when the `` twist '' , so to speak , is unraveled at the very last minute of the movie . Basically Tim ( will smith ) wa troubled and haunted by a big accident he made causing the end of seven people life . By this he decides to scope out seven new people who are in need of help badly who he in turn give his life to . The acting of this film is great , a i feel will smith no matter what part he seems to impress . Rosario Dawson , to me , this is one of her better movie , aside from eagle eye which i think is up there to . She ha been in some bad some good but she doe deliver in this film . Other actor , such a woody Harrelson , have very small role and not a big enough role to grasp the character . Although the casting of the film wa still good . This movie wa definitely not what i expected and certainly a lot slower pace in which i hoped . The movie , however , wa still pretty good . Nothing is revealed until the last 5 min of the movie and everything fall into place . Up until then it just seems like a pointless love story . Final thought seven pounds=seven Stars .

I saw Brother 's Shadow at the Tribeca Film Festival and loved it ! Judd Hirsch and Scott Cohen are great a father and son . The film follows Scott Cohen from parole in Alaska back to his family in Brooklyn . He show up there because his brother ha died , and he embarks on a journey to slowly repair his estranged relationship with his brother 's wife and child and his father who ha never forgiven him for being the black sheep of the family . The story take u deep into the heart and mind of this family and allows you to more deeply understand the complexity of their life . Also , the imagery of the woodworking business and the Brooklyn backdrop set the tone for this rich and revealing family portrait .

`` Mararía '' really disappointed me . I ca n't consider it a a bad movie , but the development just seemed too rushed and non-believable for it to evoke any emotion . Dr. Fermín display some unprecedented bizarre behaviour out of a passion that one ca n't really understand where it wa born from . I mean , how many time doe he ever have a conversation with Mararía ? ? Maybe once ? Also , Mararía never appeared to be a real character , instead more like a film stereotype that just needed to be in the movie ( ... or else another title wa needed ? ) . Some of the best acting came from a role that wa n't really important to the story , that of Marcial , the sub-intelligent yet humble drunkard . Of course , the scenery , the cultural tidbit of the Canary Islands , and other `` wow '' moment were interesting , but the movie fell short of a documentary ( in case this wa it real intention ) , and most importantly , a a solid drama .

Serum is about a crazy doctor that find a serum that is supposed to cure all disease through the power of the mind . Instead it creates some kind of monster that need to eat human flesh and brain . The mad doc creates some zombie out of cadaver and ha some problem . There is a very long lead into all the action with many scene getting you acquainted with the character . The mad doctor 's nephew get into a car accident and the mad doc try to use his new serum on the boy . The result are not good . This is a class C film with OK acting but some trouble directing and some continuity error . There is n't much zombie action in this one and the effect , while adequate , are nothing special . You can fast forward through the slow part and get some enjoyment out of the action scene . Watch out for some nudity and bad language .

witty . funny . intelligent . awesome . i wa flipping channel late one night year ago . came across this and a wildfire started . i wa staying up late every night and taping it for everyone i know . a few . like 3 people out of the almost 100 people i made watch this did n't think it wa a awesome a i did . the others were laughing out loud so hard they were cry and thanking me at the same time . please do yourself a favor . run do n't walk . watch this and enjoy . intelligence and humor . it 's a win-win situation . i wish i could have afternoon tea with him and meet the truly rare comedian that we a a society need more of .... sanechaos .

It 's a unique film , a it give u our only chance to see the young Noel Coward in all his ironic glory . Because he seems so reserved & detached he 's perfect for the role of an unloved cad who matter-of-factly us all those around him . However in the deadly serious ( no pun intended ) last act , when Coward must make like the Flying Dutchman , he 's much le comfortable . But his way with an epigram is peerless , and Hecht & Macarthur have given him some gem ( Macarthur , really -- he wa the wit of the pair ) . The film is superbly lighted by the great Lee Garmes , but ha little camera movement aside from a storm sequence . Hecht and Macarthutr cared about one thing -- getting their dialogue on screen . ( NOTE : H & M themselves have blink-and-you'll-miss-'em cameo a bum in the flophouse scene ) . The most notable supporting player is the one and only Alexander Woolcott , notorious Broadway columnist and close friend of both Macarthur and Coward , who appears a one of the bitchy author always kept waiting in the reception room of publisher Coward . Curious that Woolcott would agree to do a film that clearly lampoon the legendary Algonquin Round Table , of which he wa a founder , and Macarthur something of an auxiliary member . The Scoundrel actually won an Oscar for best story , though that victory is probably due more to Coward 's imposing presence than any brilliance in the plot . It 's Coward , Woolcott , and the dialogue you remember ...

This is definitely a `` must see '' film . The excellent Director Alain Chabat ( also acting a Ceasar ) ha managed to capture the very essence of the `` Adventures of Astérix '' ( the French comic book it 's based upon ) and to create a fantastically modern and intelligent comedy , which is also an homage to the world of animated film . This movie is so funny , so full of joke ( both visual and spoken ) that it might take you two or three screening before you notice them all , between your burst of laughter . The only drawback is that a non-French audience ( or at least a non-French speaking audience ) might not get all the `` private joke '' . There are so many dialogue impossible to translate , so many situation directly related either to the comic book or to the French way of life , that the fun might be lessened . However , it 's still totally worth seeing for the beautiful picture , the amazing stunt , the music , the totally crazy atmosphere and the excellent acting . All actor are great , but the film would not be the same without Jamel Debouze , Gérard Darmon and Edouard Baer . And please do n't EVER compare this magnificent film to the terrible previous one based on the same comic book : `` Astérix et Obélix Contre César '' and directed by Claude Zidi .

I thought this movie wa stunning , with completely outstanding performance by Valentina Cervi ( Artemisia Gentileschi ) . Cervi portrays Artemisia so beautifully , with tentative yet confidant mannerism , her hand mapping out an idea before moving her model into place . The passion to which Artemisia give to her art is just spectacular to watch . Although not each character wa overtly beautiful , this made the film more realistic a the facial hair and clothing wa perfect for that point in time . Overall i thought this film wa fantastic .

I consider myself a bit of a connoisseur of boxing movie and a such there is only one thing that prevents me from calling `` Gentleman Jim '' the best boxing movie ever made . That is the Robert Wise/Paul Newman flick `` Somebody Up There Likes Me . '' That movie might be number 1 , but `` Gentleman Jim '' is a close number 2 . The movie doe n't just chronicle the rise of James J. Corbett , it also show the sport of boxing at a crucial time of transition . In the late 1800s boxing wa moving away from the brutal day of bare-knuckle rule to the more `` gentlemanly '' day of the gloved , Marquis of Queensbury rule . And the sport wa moving away from the day when it wa an illegal spectacle and towards a time of acceptance and respectability . `` Gentleman Jim '' is not a realistic look at those day . It is romanticized and , yes , even a bit hokey at time . But always delightfully so . Errol Flynn is perfect a the `` Gentleman '' Jim who really is n't a `` gentleman '' at all but merely a fast talker from a working class family . Alexis Smith is quite ravishing a the upper class woman with whom he ha a love/hate relationship ( and we all know it is , of course , love that will win that match in the end ) . At the end of `` Gentleman Jim '' the great John L Sullivan ( whose famous line wa NOT `` I can lick any man in the world '' of course ... romanticism again ) hand over his belt to Corbett . This is truly one of the best scene in any sport move ever made . Realistic ? No . But wonderful . Hey , if you want realism watch `` Raging Bull '' instead . That is a much more realistic boxing movie . But `` Gentleman Jim '' is a lot more fun .

That this movie ha been stapled to the wall of a chapel a proof that God is truly dead . Am I the only one that really saw ( rather sleptwalked ) through this `` film '' ? This is the only movie I 've ever seen in the theater that I regret not walking out on and demanding my money back -- it wa just that dull . And I even saw `` Highlander 2 : The Quickening '' at the local cinema . From beginning to end , Gibson and Downey have absolutely no chemistry a two unlikelies , cast together by circumstance , who eventually work together a best buddy . The action ( what little there is ) is goofy and a dull a the skullbone of the writer . Thank whatever deity is chortling down at u a it observes our `` cinema '' that there 's no chance for an `` Air America 2 . ''

Well , there 's no real plot to speak of , it 's just an excuse to show some scene of extreme violence and gratuitous sex ( which can sometimes be fun , too , but it 's not in this case ) . What else can I say about this ... ? The action , when happening , is inventive and there 's a cool scene where two character are falling from a skyscraper ( one that ha to be several mile high ) , but overall there 's not much to recommend `` Kite '' . Watch it if you want , but you 're not missing much if you skip this one ...

This is the best film the Derek couple ha ever made and if you think this is a recommendation then you have n't seen any of the others . There are the usual ingredient : it is just a poorly acted a their other effort , we can watch Bo disrobing or auditioning for wet T-shirt contest quite frequently , the story is just laughably idiotic , and the film take itself much too seriously . And then : Orang Utans in Africa ? But it ha a few thing going for it . Bo look great , the production value ( set , costume , etc . ) are quite good , and this greatly enhances it camp value . In a strange way it is actually quite funny , simply because it try to be serious and fails so badly .

Some people drift through life , moving from one thing or one person to the next without batting an eye ; others latch on to a cause , another person or a principle and remain adamant , committed to whatever it is -- and figuratively or literally they give their word and stand by it . But we 're all different , ` Made of different clay , ' a one of the character in this film put it , which is what make life so interesting . Some people are just plain crazy , though -- and maybe that 's the way you have to be to live among the mass . Who know ? Who know what it take to make thing -- life -- work ? Writer/director Lisa Krueger take a shot at it , using a light approach to examine that thin line between being committed -- and how one ` get ' committed -- and obsession , in ` Committed , ' starring Heather Graham a a young woman who is adamant , committed , obsessive and maybe just a little bit crazy , too . Her name is Joline , and this is her story . Admittedly , Joline ha always been a committed person ; in work , relationship , in life in general . She 's a woman of her word who stick by it no matter what . And when she marries Carl ( Luke Wilson ) , it 's forever . The only problem is , someone forgot to tell Carl -- and 597 day into the marriage , he 's gone ; off to ` find ' himself and figure it all out . When Joline realizes he 's not coming back , she refuse to give up on him , or their marriage . Maybe it 's because of that ` clay ' she 's made of . Regardless , she leaf their home in New York City and set off to find him , which she doe -- in El Paso , Texas , of all place . But once she know where he is , she keep her distance , giving him his ` space ' and not even letting him know she 's there . She considers Carl a being in a ` spiritual coma , ' and it 's her job to keep a ` spiritual vigil ' over him until he come to his sens . And while she watch and wait , her life is anything but dull , a she encounter a young woman named Carmen ( Patricia Velazquez ) , a waitress at one of the local eatery ; Carmen 's ` Grampy , ' ( Alfonso Arau ) , who is something of a mystic ; T-Bo ( Mark Ruffalo ) , a truck driver who ha issue concerning Carl ; and Neil ( Goran Visnjic ) an artist who make pinata and take a fancy to her . For Joline , it 's a journey of discovery , during which she learns a lot about Carl , but even more about herself . There 's a touch of humor , a touch of romance , and some insight into human nature in this quirky film that is more about characterization and character than plot . And Krueger present it all extremely well , delivering a film that is engaging and entertaining . Her character are very real people , with all the want , need and imperfection that make up the human condition ; a rich and eclectic bunch through which she tell her story . We see it from Joline 's point-of-view , a Krueger make u privy to Joline 's thought and therefore her motivation , which put a decided perspective on the event a they unfold . That , along with the deliberate pace she set that allows you to soak up the atmosphere and the ambiance she creates , make for a very effective piece of storytelling . There 's an underlying seriousness to this subject matter , but Krueger chooses to avoid anything heavy-handed or too deep and concentrate instead on the natural humor that evolves from the people and situation that Joline encounter . And the result is a well textured , affecting and upbeat look at that thing we call life . Heather Graham take hold of this role from the first frame of the film to make Joline a character totally of her own creation . She immerses herself in the part and give a performance that is convincing and believable , adding the little personal trait and nuance that make all the difference between a portrayal that is a mere representation of a person , and one that is real . And for this film to work , it wa imperative that Joline be viable and believable -- and Graham succeeds on all front . Her screen presence ha never been more alluring , and her vibrant personality or even just the way she us her eye , is enough to draw you in entirely . it 's all a part of the character she creates ; there 's an appeal to Joline that exudes from her entire countenance , who she is inside and out . She 's a likable , agreeable person , and because you 've shared her innermost thought , you know who she is . It 's a good job all the way around , beginning with the way the character wa written , to the way Graham brings her so vibrantly to life . As Carmen , Patricia Velazquez is totally engaging , a well . Her performance is very natural and straightforward , and she us her instinct to effectively create her character . She ha a charismatic presence , but is le than flamboyant , and it give her an aspect that is attractively down-to-earth . She is refreshingly open and up-front ; you get the impression that Carmen is not one to hold anything back , but is totally honest on all front , and that , too , is part of her appeal . And , a with Joline , this character is well written , and Velazquez brings her convincingly to life . Overall , there is a number of notable performance that are the heart and soul of this film , including those of Luke Wilson , Casey Affleck ( a Joline 's brother , Jay ) , Goran Visnjic , Alfonso Arau and especially Mark Ruffalo a T-Bo , who , with very little actual screen time , manages to create a memorable character . The supporting cast includes Kim Dickens ( Jenny ) , Clea Du Vall ( Mimi ) , Summer Phoenix ( Meg ) , Art Alexakis ( New York Car Thief ) , Dylan Baker ( Carl 's Editor ) , and Mary Kay Place ( Psychiatrist ) . A film that say something about the value of stepping back to consider The Big Picture -- reflecting upon who we are , where we 're going and what we really need -- ` Committed ' is an enjoyable experience ; a ride definitely worth taking . 8/10 .

I wa looking forward to this so much , being a big fan of the book . However , when it came out I remember thinking it wa one of the biggest waste of money and time I 've ever spent at the cinema . In principle , the acting , the set and the music were excellent , and are the main reason why I 'm rating this a 4 . In this version , Sara is a little too self-sacrificing for my taste . There is no way she would have deliberately lied to Miss Minchin just to stop her punishing the other girl ; in the book she make a point of describing lie a `` not just wicked , but vulgar . '' There 's also far too much of a Disneyfied ending for me ; Sara 's father coming back from the dead and all of them trotting off into the Indian sunset . While the book doe have a happy ( and critic might say equally improbable ) ending , it doe n't leave you thinking , `` Oh puh-leeze . '' About the only thing true to the book were : 1 . Sara 's father being a soldier 2 . The line between Sara and her father ( `` Are you learning me by heart ? '' / '' No . I know you by heart . You are inside my heart . '' ) 3 . Sara 's friendship with Becky , and her 'adopting ' Lottie ( although this last one wa n't developed a much a it could have been ) 4 . The changing of her room by adding various luxury item . That part wa brilliantly done . 5 . The basic core - a rich girl being flung into poverty suddenly - is there , but that 's about all that is . People might say that this adaptation is more for the younger audience . Possibly . All I can say to that is I have two cousin - aged 7 and 12 respectively - who were big fan of this film until they read the book . If all you want is a 'feel-good ' family film , then this delivers . If you 're looking for a film that actually tell the story of A Little Princess ( in fact , if you 've read the book ) do n't waste time with this one . It 's such a shame ; with a cast like this , if they 'd stuck to at least the basic story it could have been fantastic . Am I harping on about 'read the book ' this and 'read the book ' that a little too much ? Very probably . But if someone attempt to adapt a book - especially such a classic - into a movie , then they should at least have done the same thing . Preferably more than once .

Every high praise word fell way short before the height of this movie . This movie is the true example of how a psychological horror movie should be . The plot seems to be a bit confusing at first viewing but it will definitely explain a bit about what 's going on and you really want to view it for the second time . But after second viewing you will start to join the piece together and then you will know how amazing a movie can be . A word of advice for slasher flick fan stay away from this movie . This is not your dumb as teenage slasher movie , in which you just switch off your brain and sit in front of the screen just to see big b * * b and lot of blood . If you want to heighten the psychological horror factor of this movie then watch it all alone with a great home theater system that support Dolby Digital or DTS 5.1ch , without any of your ill mannered friend that crack joke on a really tense situation . And do n't forget to switch the light off . My point on different aspect : - Direction = 9/10 Acting = 8/10 Atmosphere = 10/10 Sound Effect = 9/10 Total = 9/10

Ken Burns ' `` Baseball '' is a decent documentary ... it present a clear origin of the game , a great depiction of baseball 's early year and hero . There 's plenty in this movie for any baseball fan ... that said , the film ha several glaring flaw . 18 hour is simply too long for the human attention span . It 's clear that Burns stretched his film out to fit his `` nine inning '' concept . It 's not even a tight 18 hour ... the pace on every segment is slow , almost morose ... the music always nostalgic and wistful . Is n't baseball ever exciting and fun ? Why is every player and their accomplishment presented in the form of a tragedy ? Talking head after talking head turn every pitch into an emotional heartbreak , yakking about baseball a a metaphor , baseball a Americana , the psychology and theology of baseball ... enough ! This is syrupy , mawkish drivel . Billy Crystal is here to sell u all the Yankee hokum he 's sold u before . Ken Burns us the National Anthem a the series ' theme song , and manages to play `` Take Me Out To The Ballgame '' so many time you might vomit . We get it , dude . Clearly Burns is a neo-Hollywood faux-liberal , so he spends probably a third of the film on the Negro league ... these segment are spent chastising white of yesterday for not being a open-minded a Kenny is today . For shame ! He chides baseball for being segregated in the thirty and forty but fails to realize that America wa segregated in those time ! Burns fall head over heel in love with Buck O'Neil , a former negro-league player , and drool over every piece of footage in which the elderly O'Neil wax poetic about his playing day . Nonsense ... Burns would have been better off with an adult to help him edit his creation down . `` Baseball '' wind up a mushy , gushy , civil-rights propaganda disguised a Americana . Its clear that Burns is not a baseball fan ... otherwise he would know we watch game laughing and cheering , not weeping and reciting soliloquy ... are you listening , Mr. Burns ? There 's no cry in baseball .

`` Quitting '' may be a much about exiting a pre-ordained identity a about drug withdrawal . As a rural guy coming to Beijing , class and success must have struck this young artist face on a an appeal to separate from his root and far surpass his peasant parent ' acting success . Troubles arise , however , when the new man is too new , when it demand too big a departure from family , history , nature , and personal identity . The ensuing split , and confusion between the imaginary and the real and the dissonance between the ordinary and the heroic are the stuff of a gut check on the one hand or a complete escape from self on the other . Hongshen slip into the latter and his long and lonely road back to self can be grim . But what an exceptionally convincing particularity , honesty , and sensuousness director Zhang Yang , and his actor , bring to this journey . No clichés , no stereotype , no rigid gender role , no requisite sex , romance or violence scene , no requisite street language and , to boot , no assumed money to float character act and whim . Hongshen Jia is in his mid-twenties . He 's a talented actor , impressionable , vain , idealistic , and perhaps emotionally starved . The perfect recipe for his enablers . Soon he 's the `` cool '' actor , idolized by youth . `` He wa hot in the early ninety . '' `` He always had to be the most fashionable . '' He need extreme , and go in for heavy metal , adopts earring and a scarf . His acting mean the art , friend -- and role , But not the kind that offer any personal challenge or input . And his self-criticism , dulled by the immediacy of success , open the door to an irrational self-doubt , self-hatred -- `` I did n't know how to act '' `` I felt like a phony '' -- and to readily available drug to counter them . He say `` I had to get high to do what director wanted . '' So , his shallow identity a an actor becomes , via drug , an escape from identity . Hongshen 's disengagement from drug and his false life is very gradual , intermittent -- and doggedly his own . Solitude , space , meditative thinking , speech refusal , replace therapy . The abstract is out . And a great deal of his change occurs outdoors -- -not in idealized location but mainly on green patch under the freeway , bridge , and high-rise of Beijing . The physicality is almost romantic , but is not . The bike ride to Ritan Park , the long spontaneous walk , the drenching sun and rain , grassy picnic , the sky pattern and kite that absorb his musing are very specific . He drift in order to arrive , all the while picking up cue to a more real and realistic identity . `` I started to open up '' he say of this period in retrospect . And the contact seems to start with his lanky body which project a kind of dancer 's positioning ( clumsy , graceful , humorous , telling ) in a current circumstance . If mind or spirit is lacking , his leg can compel him to walk all night . Central to his comeback is the rejection of set role . To punctuate his end to acting and his determination to a new identity , he smash his video and TV , and bang his head till bloody against his `` John Lennon Forever '' poster . He ha let down his iconic anti-establishment artist -- -but he 's the only viable guide he know . He even imago himself a John 's son ( Yoko Ono ) , and adopts his `` Mother Mary '' a an intercessor in his `` hour of darkness '' and `` time of trouble . '' ( the wrenching , shaking pain in the park -- hallucinatory and skitzoid ordeal ) `` Music is so much more real than acting '' he say . And speaks of Lennon 's influence a `` showing me a new way . '' In the mental institute , the life-saving apple ( resistance , nourishment ) reflect Lennon 's presence , a doe Hongshen 's need to re-hang his hero 's poster in his redecorated room . If Lennon 's influence is spiriting , Hongshen 's father 's influence is grounding . Although father and son are both actor and user ( drug and drink ) , it is Fegsen 's difference from his son that underwrites his change . For the father is more secure in himself : he accepts that he 's Chinese , a peasant in a line of peasant , a rural theater director . And he exercise control over both his habit and his emotion . It 's this recognizable identity that drive Hongshen to treat him like a sounding board , sometimes with anger and rage , sometimes with humor ( the blue jean , Beatles ) and passivity . In his most crazed , and violent exchange with his father in which he accuses him of being a liar , and a fake , he expose more of himself than his father : `` all the act I acted before were bullshit ... life is bullshit . '' And to Hongshen 's emphatic `` you are NOT my father , '' he softly reply , `` why ca n't a peasant be your father ? '' Under these two teacher and with much additional help from his mother , sister , friend , inmate at the rehab inst. , he make some tangible connection to a real ( not whole ) self . As the long term drug effect recede , so doe his old identity . Indebtedness replaces pride , trust distrust . Integrity banishes his black cloud . All his edge soften . `` You are just a human being '' he repeat endlessly after being released from the strap-down incurred for refusing medicine . Back home , lard peasant soap is fine with him now . And his once `` rare and true friendship '' begin again a is so evident in the back to poignant back-to-back fence scene with his musician buddy . Hongshen say of this movie : `` it 's a good chance to think about my life . '' And I might add , become a New Actor , one bound to art and life . Like Lennon , he ha gained success without a loss of identity .

If only I had read the review by Alex Sander ( sic ) on here rather than looking at the rating of over 6 from a select choice of the ignorant viewing public I would not have seen this desecration . Alien wa a fantastic , dramatic and well made horror/sci-fi . Predator wa a great sci-fi/action mess-about . I do really have only myself to blame though a I saw 'Alien versus Predator ' . It too ha an average grading of over 6 star from the connoisseur of film that frequent this site . STOP READING NOW IF YOU HAVE ANY FEAR OF THIS EVER SO SUSPENSE RIDDEN PLOT BEING RUINED FOR YOU . Right from the beginning this film wa ridiculous . No explanation wa offered for the Predator ship overrun/not overrun by Aliens . OK so maybe they were again going to throw alien down to Earth to hunt them and something went wrong but how did this result in an Alien/Predator hybrid and why did the rest of the crew not realise sooner despite their great technology ? The start wa actually the most coherent and interesting part of the film because we had some idea of who wa who or what wa what and perhaps why . From then on it get really ridiculous . I always leave my disbelief strictly suspended above the door of the screen before entering and collect it on the way out . I could n't here . A father and son are hunting in the wood . The damaged ship crash land to ( from the view given ) I would calculate at the very least 10 odd mile away through thick woodland . The man and boy track there alone and find the ship and get face hugged . Even at this point you feel very little for them mainly because the face hugger are almost comical rather than scary in their movement and action and the father seems like such an irresponsible , dumb redneck muppet . An edgy , thriller-type scenario is introduced with an ex-con returning to the town near the crash site to be met by his somewhat emotionless , dull now cop friend from the bus . When I say introduced I mean a feeble attempt with crap actor and no feeling is played out . A slasher/horror element is then introduced with a sexy girl and the usual supposedly nerdy or somehow undesirable cute guy who get beaten up by the over protective , crazy , nasty Jock type ( American sportsman not a Scottish man ) . Oh the cute/not cute boy is the ex-con 's brother by the way . Yes they 're clever these director brother whose name I will research in order to avoid any other shite they put out again . Then a modern role reversal oh so boring attempt at PC , Ripley credential type character introduction come with a female soldier returning home to her husband and child . Guess what happens next ? I wo n't tell you much more about the actual ( smile sadly to himself about the demise of storytelling in the large majority of recent film ) plot just in case you have got this far and are not the brightest star in the Alien-ridden universe . The Predator is stupid for the reason stated by the previous poster whose post I read too late . The Aliens are boring . The Predator-Alien is ridiculous . The action is at time exploitative , gratuitous , disgusting nonsense . The hospital scene with the pregnant mother ? ! ? ! Oh I wa shocked alright . Shocked at how low some people will go to get what ? A scare ? Some shock ? To titillate the perverse ? What ? If you really wanted to shock , titillate and scare people who are not pregnant or expecting father or who have no soul why not just have the Alien/Predator shagging the saucy woman and teenage girl rather than killing them ? The character have no depth and neither doe the plot . It 's filmed and paced badly . It 's acted by disinterested people not that I can blame them . It further tarnish two rather interesting and good set of sci-fi character . This film wa rubbish and if you gain enjoyment from it I really have to worry about you . If you have n't seen it then well please make your own decision . PS Did I even mention the way that trained soldier are all killed in about 20 second while amateur civilian survive throughout ?

Although most Americans have little knowledge of his work other than Star Wars , Alec Guinness produced an amazing body of work -- particularly in the 1940s-1950s -- ranging from drama to quirky comedy . I particularly love his comedy , a they are so well-done and seem so natural and real on the screen -- far different from the usual fare from Hollywood . This being said , this wa the film that sparked my interest in these movie . It 's plot wa so odd and cute that it is very unlikely the film would have been made anywhere -- except for Ealing Studios -- which had a particular fondness for `` little '' film like this one . Guinness is a nerdy little scientist that work for a textile company . He want to experiment in order to create a synthetic fabric that is indestructible , though he is not working for the company a a researcher but for janitorial work ! So , he tends to sneak into lab ( either during the day if no one suspect or at night ) and try his hand at inventing . Repeatedly , he is caught ( such a after he blew up the lab ) and given the boot until one day he actually succeeds ! Then , despite the importance of the discovery , he set off a completely unanticipated chain of event -- and then the fun begin . The film is a wonderful satire that poke fun at industry , union , the government and people in general .

Victor McLaglen 's performance is one of the finest in film history . I think we can all feel for `` Gypo '' because we 've all struggled with what is right and what is n't and been wrong . This wa one of the first art-house picture to be released by a major American movie studio ( RKO Radio Pictures ) . Joseph H. August 's cinematography is at it very best here . However , August 's stunning portion wa mostly overlooked ; he did n't receive the Oscar nomination he rightly deserved . This is a psychological drama , with thought , philosophy , sadness , all conveyed with a little word a possible .

How do you take a cast of experienced , well-known actor , and put together such a stupid movie ? Nimrod Antel ha the answer : Armored . Six co-worker at an armored car business decide to steal a large shipment of cash themselves . But , just a they get to first base with their plan , everything unravels quickly . With a plot like this , you 'd think it could n't be too bad , at least for an action movie . However , in the first 40 minute or more of this movie we see what appear to be 6 normal , everyday kind of guy . They joke , they laugh , have a few drink together , etc . Then , we suddenly learn they 're planning to rob their own business . The hero Ty , ( Columbus Short ) , is sucked into the scheme because of the cold , cruel world , even though he 's a decorated veteran , nice guy , and reliable employee . Oh my , oh my ! Then in the last 40 minute of the film , these former regular guy nearly all turn into money-crazed psycho , willing to butcher each other for cash . In the last scene Mike , ( Matt Dillon ) , go on a suicidal rampage for no other reason than to kill his former friend . The viewer ha no hint before this ending that these men are this ruthless and bloodthirsty . It 's utterly unbelievable and `` B movie '' is almost too kind for this sort of cheesy plot . I would say do n't waste your time -- too bad no one gave Laurence Fishburne , Jean Reno or Fred Ward the same advice before making this picture .

The sexploitation movie era of the late sixty and early seventy began with the allowance of gratuitous nudity in mainstream film and ended with the legalization of hardcore porn . It 's peak year were between 1968 and 1972 . One of the most loved and talented actress of the era wa Monica Gayle , who had a small but fanatic cult of follower . She wa actually able to act , unlike many who filled the lead role of these flick , and her subsequent credit proved it . And her seemingly deliberate fade into obscurity right when her career wa taking off only heightens her mystique . Gary Graver , the director , wa also a talent ; probably too talented for the sexploitation genre , and his skill , combined with Monica Gayle 's screen presence , make Sandra , the Making of a Woman , a pleasantly enjoyable experience . The film never drag and you wo n't have your finger pressed on the fast-forward button .

Flynn , known mostly for his swashbuckling role ( and his bedroom antic ! ) take a different tack with this film and it work beautifully . Playing real-life boxing champ Jim Corbett , Flynn turn on the charm full blast a he make his way from a stifled San Francisco bank teller to a celebrated pugilist , all the while setting one eye on society deb Smith . He and best pal Carson attend an illegal bare-knuckle fight and are arrested along with score of other men ( and a dog ! ) including a prominent judge . The next day , he get a chance , via Smith , to gain entrance to the judge 's private club . He us this opportunity to weasel his way into the good grace of it exclusive member and land a spot a the club 's resident boxer . His unusually adept skill in the sport soon ha him taking on all comer , up to and including the world champion John L. Sullivan ( Bond . ) Flynn is downright magical here . He is the epitome of charm , charisma and appeal in this role . He look terrific ( especially in a hangover scene with his hair mussed and wearing a white union suit ) and doe virtually all of his own stuntwork ( impressively ! ) His line delivery is delicious and he is credible and sympathetic and at the same time duplicitous and rascally . Smith exudes class and taste from every pore and is a good match for Flynn . At this stage , he needed a female costar who could stand up to his advance and reputation ( he wa undergoing statutory rape charge at the time ) and she doe so admirably . She is repulsed by his freshness and cavalier attitude , yet can hardly help but fall under his enchanting spell . Bond is incredibly burly , brawny and towering , yet tender when the script call for it . Amusing support is provided by a young and ebullient Carson . Frawley is his dependably cantankerous self a Flynn 's manager . The rest of the cast is excellent a well including Flynn 's rambunctious family and an assortment of stuffy Nob Hill type . The whole thing is beautifully appointed and securely directed . A few of the set are amazingly presented . Some of Smith 's gown border on the garish , but she suit the upswept hairstyle very well . It 's a terrific glimpse into the earliest day of championship boxing , but it 's also so much more . Some of it ( like the character trait shown by Flynn ) is enhanced or exaggerated for entertainment purpose , but a lot of it is authentic ( like the method and costume shown in the fight scene . ) One line is particularly memorable : `` I believe you like me more than I like you , but it 's entirely possible that I love you more than you love me . '' It 's classic romantic dialogue ( and there are more than a few zinger sprinkled throughout the script a well . )

Often laugh out loud funny play on sex , family , and the class in Beverly Hills milk more laugh out of the zip code than it 's seen since the day of Granny and Jed Clampett . Plot center on two chauffers who 've bet on which one of them can bed his employer ( both single or soon to be single lady , quite sexy -- Bisset and Woronov ) first . If Manuel win , his friend will pay off his debt to a violent asian street gang -- if he loses , he must play bottom man to his friend ! Lots of raunchy dialogue , fairly sick physical humour , etc . But a lot of the comedy is just beneath the surface . Bartel is memorable a a very sensual oder member of the family who end up taking his sexy , teenaged niece on a year long `` missionary trip '' to Africa . Hilarious fun .

Thought provoking , humbling depiction of the human tragedy of war . A small , but altruistic view of one family 's interaction with the enemy during the civil war in Kentucky . This movie lessens the `` glamor '' of war ; showing it 's effect on not only the soldier but the entire family unit . A lot of today 's movie show war a an opportunity to highlight the `` hero 's '' and other glamorous feature of war , but very little attempt to show the true effect war actually take on a community . This movie attempt this through a retelling of a person 's memory of those day . This movie is stated to be loose translation of an actual event , when in reality , this movie is probably a factual reality of hundred , perhaps thousand of `` actual event '' during the civil war . I highly recommend those interested in our civil war to watch this movie .

Despite having an absolutely horrid script ( more about that later ) , this film is still vaguely watchable just because it star two excellent actor , Barbara Stanwyck and Henry Fonda . Aside from one or two REAL stinker , I 'd probably watch just about anything with them in the film , a I am a huge fan of Hollywood 's golden age of the 1930s and 40 . However , no matter how much I love their film , I just ca n't recommend this film . The movie begin with Fonda and Stanwyck on vacation at some ski resort . The two have n't yet met , but the film begin loudly and obnoxiously with a scene in which Fonda horribly yodel while skiing . It wa done so unsubtly and made my teeth grind but I stuck it out -- especially when Fonda fell into a snow bank and this stopped the yodeling ! ! In hindsight , perhaps I should have just turned it off then ! Fonda is knocked out in the fall and Barbara go for help . Back at the ski lodge , he seems okay but fortunately she is ALSO a doctor and ha him x-rayed and nurse him back to health . He , in turn , becomes infatuated with her and proposes to her . Despite hardly knowing each other , they marry and so far the film seems like a sweet but very slight romantic comedy . Once home , however , all is n't rosy a she jump right back into her job a a family doctor and he begin exhibiting sign that he is a controlling and potentially dangerous man due to his jealousy . The film play it all for laugh , but frankly Fonda 's behavior were really creepy -- spying on her and her male patient , attacking or threatening ANY man she treat , tripping a patient who already ha a back injury and stomping into a surprise party and insisting that everyone there ( men and woman ) are out to steal away his wife . He come off a a combination of a sociopath and paranoid schizophrenic , but it 's all supposed to be for laugh . Considering that he seems like a dangerous nut , you would think that Stanwyck would file for an annulment along with a restraining order ! But , oddly , she get mad but just ca n't stay mad at Fonda because he 's so ........ ? I ca n't think of the right word -- 'creepy ' is all that come to mind ! ! ! Later , out of the blue , multi-millionaire Fonda get a job working the counter at a department store . Then , through magical thinking , he and Babs seem to assume his hostility and violent jealousy is all a thing of the past -- so a job apparently cure anger and suspicion . When this job fall through , the film end with Fonda buying his own hospital , giving Barbara a job there and they live happily ever after . They do n't go any further with the story , but I assume based on Fonda 's character that he then spent most of his time a hospital administrator beating up all the male patient . The first portion at the ski lodge and the next did NOT fit well together , nor did the final `` Horatio Alger '' inspired section where the rich boy made good in the business world . They were like three separate plot but despite this , the most serious problem with the film wa it seeming to excuse away domestic violence and delusional jealousy ! What a creepy little film ! Thank goodness neither Fonda nor Stanwyck are known for this yechy film but for all their other lovely film .

Directed by Diane Keaton and adapted from a book by Franz Lidz . A young mother Selma Lidz ( Andie MacDowell ) is battling a very serious illness and her self proclaimed inventor husband Sid ( John Tururro ) is a little lacking in the emotion department . Unhappy with the new home situation , their sensitive son Steven ( Nathan Watt ) decides he want to stay with his two eccentric uncle Danny ( Michael Richards ) and Melvin ( Lou Cutell ) until his mom is well . Steven seems to be happier and even take interest in his strange uncle 's living habit ; he even decides he want to change his name to Franz . Set in the early 60 's , this drama is a bit comedic ... change that to zany . Not being a MacDowell fan , UNSTRUNG HEROES assures my attitude ; albeit I enjoyed the film and it is not a total waste .

Perhaps the most gripping and intelligent of crooked cop movie is Otto Preminger 's 'Where the Sidewalks Ends , ' from a really excellent script by Ben Hecht based on the novel 'Night Cry ' by Frank Rosenberg ... Dana Andrews is the honest , tough New York policeman , always in trouble with his superior because he like his own strong-arm method a much a he detests crook ... When he hit someone , his knuckle hurt ... And the man he want to hit is a smooth villain ( Gary Merrill ) who point up the title . 'Why are you always trying to push me in the gutter ? ' he asks Andrews . ' I have a much right on the sidewalk a you . ' Dana Andrew 's obsession and neurosis are implanted in his hidden , painful discovery that he is the son of a thief ... His deep hatred of criminal led him to use their own illegal method to destroy them , and the pursuit of justice became spoiled in private vendetta ... By a twist of irony unique to the film itself , Dana Andrews and Gene Tierney of 'Laura ' are united once more , and Andrews now seems to be playing the same detective a few year later , but no longer the romantic , beaten down by his job , by the cheap crook ... This time , he go too far , and accidentally kill a suspect ... The killing is accidental , the victim worthless , yet it is a crime that he know can break him or send him to jail ... Using his knowledge of police procedure , he cover up his part in the crime , plant false clue , and try to implicate a gang leader , but can not avoid investigating the case himself ... The double tension of following the larger case through to it conclusion without implicating himself in the murder , is beautifully maintained and the final solution is both logical , satisfying , and in no way a compromise ... The film is one of the best detective film of the 50 's , with curious moral value , also one of Preminger 's best ... Preminger us a powerful storytelling technique , projecting pretentious camera angle and peculiar touch of the bizarre in order to externalize his suspense in realism ...

In sum , overlong and filled with more subplots than swiss cheese ha hole ! The director and co-writer say he wanted to mix genre - in this case drama and comedy . Well , at least here , these two mix like vinegar and oil . To boot , the comedy is not very funny and juvenile . Additionally , the film is not really realistic . Liberties are taken regarding the legal system in committing French Citizens against their will and the apparent ease of absconding with drug in French Hospitals . I watched this film on my big screen TV at home and found myself shouting at the film to move on . Eventually toward the end I fast forwarded the final long speech one of the main character make to his ex-lover 's son . By that time I wa worn out by the preposterous confused plot that deal with a dead lover , marriage of convenience and a nutty ex-lover . At time the plot diverts to the family of the two main character and then reverts back to one of them - either Ismael or primarily Nora . To the detriment of the audience , viewpoint keep changing from Nora and Ismael , her ex-lover confined against his will in a psychiatric hospital . There probably are two potentially interesting film here neither of which are well developed . The epilogue doe not really wrap up many of the sub-plots and seems to want the viewer to believe Nora somehow will find happiness although given her circumstance in real life the chance are equivalent to a snow ball 's chance in hell . The actor do their best and are appealing , but this is not enough to overcome all the glaring fault of poor writing , editing and lack of focus .

Incomprehensibly dreadful mishmash of the probably most notorious of all Roman emperor who went insane , leaving infamous party orgy and ruthless killing in his path ... I know there are several version of this , and this is based on the 102 min ' one that I watched - but I ca n't fathom how that possibly can make any difference to lift the rest of this movie out of the muck ! I 'd heard for long about the alleged `` shocking '' content of sex/nudity ( which honestly there is n't much of here at all - and boring when there is ) and blood , but beware - it 's the technical production amateurishness that well and truly shock here : Everything look plain and simply like a junior film school flunk project ! Camera-work is hopelessly inept , full of strange zoom , failed framing and confusing pan ( to and from what mostly look like a huge theater stage ! ) complete with a grainy , cheapish photo quality . Lighting and color scheme are terrible and uneven - is it day or night ? Are they in- or outside ? Have they changed scene ? Who is , or is meant to be in the shot ? Editing is the final sin here , making a confusing mess of everything with randomly jumpy cutaway , continuity flaw and random transition that destroy any chance of momentum , story progression - and involvement . There is potentially interesting dialog and an equally interesting true historical story ... but these fault distract so much it 's tragic . A story with SO many possibility to be great is just one gargantuan , burnt ( and Fellini-like ) turkey that 's only good for a few gobble-laughs and Peter O'Toole , who make a most memorable Tiberius . Oh yes , which brings u to the big-name actor . I 'd like to line them all up one by one and just ask : Who did you get free access to bonk in the orgy to be a part of this ? There , I 've wasted enough line on one of the truly worst film of all time - period ! 1 out of 10 from Ozjeppe

Did anyone edit this film ? Or wa it only the DVD release that had huge thirty second gap between scene ? It 's OK though , I fell asleep watching it the first time . Then I fell asleep the second time and the third time . The plot is actually not the worst I 've seen , but it 's close . The acting is not the worst I 've seen either ... but it 's close . The production .... well , I can honestly say that it wa the worst I had ever seen in my life ! Not trying to be spiteful , but Unhinged could have used some more production . Please do n't think I 'm a hater of horror film , or even that I did n't enjoy this film . I just felt I wa laughing at the film much more than I felt I wa laughing along with it . The gruesome moment were not too poorly done , but could have been done better even with a shoestring budget . Characters seemed awkwardly developed , or ignored all together , twist ending wa pretty bad , and the exposition took forever without exposing much . I 'd recommend avoiding this movie . 1/10

Most of the comment on this movie are positive so I thought I would try and redress the balance . I came out of this movie wondering what wa going on . I now know and still consider it to be a poor movie . I intially discounted a dream sequence a that seemed too obvious . I wa glad that I had a free ticket to the movie or I would have asked for my money back . The 8+ rating this movie ha is so misleading . In 20 year time this film will not compare to true great such a The Godfather . Pepe le Moko , played by Charles Boyer , is some sort of international criminal mastermind wanted in country throughout Europe , and to stay free he hole himself up in the Casbah , a mysterious part of Algiers where even the police are reluctant to go , until a senior officer is sent from Paris to capture le Moko once and for all . For le Moko , although the Casbah allows him to remain out of police custody , it also becomes a sort of prison at the same time - a place he ca n't leave , because the moment he doe , he know he 'll be arrested . Boyer 's performance wa good , and I can understand why he wa nominated for an Oscar . He capture the essence of such a character - a perfect combination of very dangerous and yet very classy at the same time . The movie itself , unfortunately , wa quite a letdown . A number of part of the story seemed inconsistent , of which I 'll mention two . First wa the idea that the police would n't enter the Casbah . That wa stated pretty clearly at the beginning of the film by the local commander , and yet repeated reference in the movie suggest that in fact the police did enter the Casbah fairly regularly . So , neither the suggestion by Commissioner Janvier that the police would n't enter , nor the statement by Inspector Slimane ( also a decent performance by Joseph Calleia ) that they could get into the Casbah but not out seemed to make much sense . I also found it difficult to believe that le Moko - hardened criminal mastermind that he wa - could be so quickly swept off his foot by Gaby ( Hedy Lamarr ) to the point where he entertains the local populace by singing love song and then leaf the Casbah to find her , essentially giving himself up . I understand the irony of the final few scene , of course , a Pepe leaf the freedom of his prison ( the Casbah ) only to find real freedom in his capture ( because he 's shot and killed by the police . ) I just found it impossible to believe that someone like le Moko would fall into such a trap . This is worth watching for Boyer , and to a lesser extent Calleia , but the story is disappointing and inconsistent . 3/10

Man with the Screaming Brain certainly is n't a perfect movie , but I 'm pretty sure it wa never meant to be anything more than a star vehicle for Bruce Campbell , meaning it work a kind of a summary of his entire career : slapstick , sarcasm , cheese , action , and happy ending . Campbell is , a a writer , uneven -- there are lot of thing in the story that do n't make a great deal of sense ( why doe the robot suddenly have breast merely because a female brain ha been implanted into it ? ) , and some of the scene feel like retread of other , better incarnation ( the scene in the restaurant , where Yegor and William battle for control of William 's body , is straight out of Evil Dead II ) . There are , however , lot of little touch and non-sequiturs that feel rather brilliant , such a when William is in the height of his panic and scream at a statue , `` What are you looking at ? ! '' The movie look like a Sci-Fi Channel original , probably because it wa . The acting is actually pretty good . I particularly enjoyed Tamara Gorski a Tatoya ; she wa ruthless and cunning , yes , but seemed to have a tragic air about her in certain moment that the story never explored . Ted Raimi handled the standard `` bumbling assistant '' role admirably enough , and Bruce is funny a the arrogant , sardonic , condescending American jerk . ( Now that he 's writing his own film , you 'd think he 'd give himself a role that he ha n't been typecast in already . ) Man with the Screaming Brain is a bizarre , nonsensical B-movie that ought to be enjoyable for anybody who can avoid taking a cinematic experience too seriously .

This film held my interest enough to watch it several time . The plot ha hole , but the lead performer make it work . Catherine Mary Stewart ( Julia Kerbridge ) , doe a great job a a woman of 37 who ha sacrificed everything else to become a physician . She worked year to earn the money to go to medical school . She is performing brilliantly in her residency and is just about to take her board exam and realize her dream . Meanwhile , Julia 's sister and brother-in-law are murdered and a the nearest living relative she is compelled to take in her niece Amanda ( Arlen Aguayo-Stewart ) to avoid having her become a ward of the state . Amanda is about 7 year old from her appearance . Amanda is so traumatized from her parent 's murder that she ha become mute . Needless to say , Julia 's 16-hour day get longer caring for Amanda . Rob Lowe play Kevin Finney , a charming neighbor man in their apartment building who work his way into the life of Julia and Amanda . He is always there with a trick or a joke to help Amanda deal with her distress . Amanda really start to warm up to Kevin a the film progress , perhaps more than to her aunt . Julia start to rely on Kevin to take some of the load of caring for Amanda a she attempt to handle her case load and prepare for her board examination . Kevin is always there whenever some crisis erupts for Julia . The chemistry between Rob and Catherine Mary wa great . You keep watching to see them get together before the end of the film . The chemistry between Rob and Arlen wa good a well . Arlen managed to convey quite a lot without the benefit of word . The plot had Julia and Amanda gradually warming up to each other . You can see them working out a relationship a the film progress . We discover that Julia 's sister and brother-in-law ( the Meyers ) were involved in industrial espionage . They stole an extremely valuable prototype microchip from their employer . They had three associate who intended to share the proceeds of the theft . Julia discovers that the Meyers were planning to skip the country under assumed identity . The plot is unclear whether the Meyers intended to double cross their associate or were themselves double crossed . In any case the Meyers are murdered in their home by 2 of their former associate . The killer make no attempt to extract the location of the microchip from the Meyers before killing them . The killer search the home and fail to find their prize . They leave a living witness to their crime , Amanda . The killer then spend the remainder of the film making clumsy attempt to extract the microchip from Julia and Amanda who have no idea where the prize is located . Eventually , the killer kidnap Amanda in hope she know something about the microchip 's location . Eventually Julia discovers the truth about Kevin . He is an investigator hired to recover the stolen microchip . After some rough moment in the relationship they manage to rescue Amanda and dispatch the bad guy . The predictable ending ha the three forming a family and moving happily into a future together . What struck me about the plot were major hole . Kevin move into the same apartment building a Julia and Amanda the day after the murder of the Meyers . How doe he know that the microchip is not already in the hand of the killer ? The killer blithely leave fingerprint at the murder scene , with no concern for concealing their identity . The killer that pretend to be a psychiatrist is revealed to Amanda by the remnant of red paint from the murder scene on his shoe sol . He wa not shown in the murder scene at the start of the film . There are other weakness along these line too numerous to mention . The film could have been a lot better if the script had been refined more before filming . Filling in the plot hole would have added little expense and greatly improved the effort .

Like the previous poster , I am from northern Vermont , and I wa inclined to like this film . However , not since `` Red Zone Cuba '' have I seen such a confusing plot . The thing the people to bootleg make no sense . Two of the gang paddle across the border send a second party across in a car . Uhm , why ? Then they meet two others , and drive up at night in to the bad guy 's hideout in a luxury Packard . -- Would n't just two people in a flatbed truck make more sense ? Then , parked outside the garage that hold the targeted hooch , the four fall asleep ! When they waken in the morning and and start hauling the whiskey out , of course they 're spotted and shot at , losing some of their precious cargo in the process . Then two of the smuggler put the whiskey in a boat and float it over the border . Again , why ? I am told by someone whose great uncle really did smuggle in the area , all one needed wa to drive a vehicle that could outrun than the U.S. Canada Border Patrol , which back then had a fraction of the resource it ha now . And do n't get me started on the last half hour , which made no sense whatsoever . The only good thing I can say about the film is that Kris Kristopherson ha actually grown some charisma with the year .

Watched this last night and wa bowled over by the heartfelt story line , the excellent character development , and the good karmic vibe emanating from the acting and movie a a whole . Without giving away too much of the plot , it begin with an ordinary joe who commute to his office job every day who becomes inspired to take dance lesson . Along the way the protagonist and the assorted character he meet in his quest to be smooth on the dance floor learn lesson about others and about themselves . The story ha a prologue about what dancing in Japan symbolizes sociologically , so it is n't exactly a simple to learn to dance in Japan a it is here in the U.S . The film is lighthearted ; you 'll laugh out loud at some of the sight gag . Yet it is also dignified in a way hard to describe . All of the film 's character are taken seriously , a they are , and none are diminished because of their `` imperfection . '' I 've been thinking about taking social dance class with some friend . It just so happened a friend lent me the video on learning to dance . Is this synchronous or what ? I think so because now I 'm really geeked to give it a try . Watch this wonderful family film ( small child might not get it , but teen certainly would ) and smile at the genuine caring you see shown in it time and again . Why they would make a remake of Shall We Dance is a mystery , a it is perfect as-is .

Recap : Something mysteriously dense that transmits radio signal is discovered in the ice of Antarctica . The mysterious block is dug out and brought to a research station on Antarctica . Julian Rome , a former SETI-worker , is brought in to decipher the message . Problem is that one of the researcher is a old girlfriend of his , and the situation quickly turn awkward , especially since the other female researcher practically throw themselves at him . And the block of ice with the thing inside is melting unnaturally quickly . Soon the object is in the open . The mystery continues though a the object generates a huge amount of electricity . It is decided to open the object , but just before that is done , Julian decodes the signal . `` Do not open '' . But too late , and the object explodes a it is finally breached , and two thing unleashed on earth . The first is an alien , that had been dormant in the object , and the other is a virus that instantly kill the research staff . And Washington , that is suspiciously updated on this historic event , decides that those thing can not be unleashed upon the earth . So a Russian nuclear submarine , carrying nuclear weapon is sent to Antarctica . Comments : The movie hold a few surprise . One is Carl Lewis who surprisingly put in a good acting performance , and the other is that the special effect that are beautiful , well worked through and a lot better than expected . Unfortunately the story hold a lot of surprise of it own , and this time not in a good way . Actually it is so full of plot hole that sometimes the movie seem to consist of almost randomly connected scene . It is never really explained why Washington know so much , why Washington is able to command Russian submarine , why the object is in the Antarctic and ha woken up now . It is really puzzling that the alien pod is transmitting in understandable English . Some might want to explain this with that the alien had been to Earth before and knew the language ( and obviously chose English , why ? ) . But then it is very confusing why the nice alien that apparently want to save the Earth from the virus , send their `` Do not open '' message encoded ! And finally the end is a open a an end can be . The movie is a little entertaining but too much energy ( from me ) must be diverted to fill in the void in the plot . Therefore the total impression of the movie is not too good . 3/10
