Had I checked IMDb BEFORE renting this DVD from Netflix , I 'd have a couple of hour of my life back . I 'm frankly suspicious when I see that a film 's director also wrote it . In this case , according to the credit , the same guy wa `` writter and director '' - unfortunately , an indication of the overall quality of this production . There were a few interesting moment ( e.g. , Judy Tenuta 's scene reminded of her early comedy routine touting Judy-ism ) which led me to rate this two star rather than one . Those moment , however , were few and far between ... and I almost did not get to see them because the opening sequence wa nearly incomprehensible to me , not to mention reprehensible in it violence . I admit I went back to watch that part again to see if I had missed something that would help me figure it out once I 'd seen the whole thing . Nope , though I at least recognized who the character were who would turn out to be important later . The `` spinning camera '' technique wa overused and essentially pointless . I found myself talking to the TV screen : `` What ? ! ? '' or `` For goodness sake , get ON with it ! '' Not recommended .

The endless bound of our inhumanity to our own kind never fails to stun me . This truly astonishing story of a horrifically abused and largely unheard-of population is compelling , well-documented and enraging . As an American , I am constantly humiliated by my country 's behaviour and this is just another in our long catalogue of international debasement . We suck . This is probably the first John Pilger documentary I 've seen , but it immediately made me want to see what else he 's done . My only complaint , and the reason I gave this film only 8 out of 10 , is that Pilger show u this travesty and the appalling collaboration of the US and UK government , demand that we viewers/citizens are complicit in our own inaction ... but make no suggestion of how to help . I do n't know about Britain , but America 's made it nearly impossible for the citizenry to take part in their government 's doings . A gesture in the right direction might help these islander ' cause .

This flick is so bad it beyond belief.Even for an independent low budget film ... it just , well , sucks.I ca n't even believe even Troma would put out such crap.I have been a fan of some Troma flick for year ( Toxic Avenger , Squeeze Play , Rockabilly Vampire to name a few ) .But LLoyd , come on , this go way beyond the boundary of any taste.It feature some of the worst acting imaginable.I think it would have been possible to find unemployed street people who could have been a good ... oh , wait , that is what they did.I mean it , these character have negative charisma.With any luck , the producer and director of this film will have a huge karmic debt because of this atrocity.As will the special effect people.But beyond the terrible acting and the horrid special effect , the dialogue is absolutely traumatic to the ears.The script is full of plot hole the size of Alaska , and there are severe continuity problems.The worst part however , is that it not entertaining in even the smallest way.And this is the most unforgivable sin in film making.But , do n't take my word for it.Go out and waste four buck renting it.Just do n't say I did n't warn you .

This is a very memorable spaghetti western . It ha a great storyline , interesting character , and some very good acting , especially from Rosalba Neri . Her role a the evil villainess in this film is truly classic . She steal every scene she is in , and express so much with her face and eye , even when she 's not speaking . Her performance is very believable . She manages to be quite mesmerizing without being over the top ( not that there 's anything wrong with being over the top ) . Mark Damon is surprisingly good in this movie too . The music score is excellent , and the theme song is the kind that will be playing in your head constantly for day after seeing the movie , whether you want it to or not . There are a couple of part that are very amusing . I especially like the part where Rosalba Neri undress in front of the parrot . There 's also lot of slick gun-play that 's very well done . I would probably have given this movie 8 or 9 star if it wa n't for two thing . The first being a silly bar room brawl that occurs about 25 minute into the film . This is one of the most ridiculous looking fight I have ever seen in a movie . It is very poorly choreographed , and look more like a dance number from a bad musical than any kind of a real fight . One might be able to overlook this if it were a Terence Hill/Bud Spencer comedy , but this is a more serious western , and the brawl really needed to be more realistic . The other thing that annoyed me about this movie wa Yuma 's cowardly Mexican sidekick . I guess he wa supposed to be comic relief or something , but the character wa just plain stupid and unnecessary in a movie like this , and he wa n't at all funny . All I can say is where is Tuco when you need him ? All that having been said , let me assure everyone reading this that Johnny Yuma is a classic spaghetti western despite the fault I have mentioned , and all fan of the genre need to see this movie .

The plot : Michael Linnett Connors ha done everything in film but direct , and is looking for his 1st big chance . He discovers Molly in a play and at once know she will be a big film star . He sign her to a contract with the stipulation that he must direct . The producer agrees and their big time career are under way . What follows is a recreation of the silent film era and early sound movie with great emphasis on comedy . And , oh yes , there 's romance , and a little sadness too . The performance by Don Ameche and Alice Fay are top notch . The music is a real plus too with some old familiar tune heard . Lots of DVD extra a well in this restored version released in 2008 . It must be emphasized that this movie is a story 1st , not just a tribute to silent film . Later year would bring similar film such a , Singin ' in the Rain ( 1952 ) & Dick Van Dyke-Carl Reiner 's , The Comic ( 1969 ) . What is special about this film , though , is recreating silent movie in 1939 . We see portion of them a the cinema audience would in that bygone era ( although some sound effect are included ) in glorious b & w , while the rest of the movie is in pristine color . One of the greatest in the silent era , Buster Keaton , who at this point wa on an uphill climb , is used superbly in 2 silent film recreated scene and he is on the top of his game ! It is said that he had some input on his scene a well . But the real reason to watch the movie , if your a motion picture history fan , is that beyond everything else , Hollywood Cavalcade is Mack Sennett 's film legacy . It doe n't take a genius to realize this movie is a `` positive '' reworking of Mack Sennett 's and Mabel Normand 's life . The character Michael `` Linnett '' Connors is Mack Sennett , whose real name wa Michael Sinnott . And Molly , of course is Mabel . Sennett had the pie throwings , the bathing beauty and Keystone Cops . He worked with Buster Keaton , Ben Turpin ( cameo ) , Roscoe `` Fatty '' Arbuckle ( body double ) and fell in love with his leading lady . Not only all that , but Sennett wa technical adviser for this film and appears in it a well . As most film viewer today prefer sound feature , those who were associated with short subject and silents are left out to pasture . As Mack Sennett fell into that category , it is fortunate that there is Hollywood Cavalcade ! Sennett wa of course very instrumental in the evolution of comedy in movie . His career started in 1908 a an actor , then writer , director & producer . He semi retired in 1935 with about 500 film to his credit . He had worked with the best , such a Charlie Chaplin , Gloria Swanson , Bing Crosby , W.C. Fields , Keaton , Harry Langdon , Arbuckle , and even Roy Rogers ( in Way Up Thar ) .As film comedy is an extremely difficult path to continue for an entire career , Mack played it wise & did only selective work for the next 25 year . In 1931 he had receive an academy award in the short subject category , and another in 1937 for a lifetime of work . In the 1940 's his presence wa still felt , e.g . Here Come the Co-Eds ( 1945 ) where a recreation of the oyster soup scene used in Mack 's Wandering Willies ( 1926 ) is done . In 1947 , The Road to Hollywood , used some of Sennett 's Crosby film . 2 year later brought some nostalgia with the film Down Memory Lane in which he participated . With his knack of always associating with the right people , a guest role with the eternally popular Lawrence Welk & his radio show came about later in the year . 1950 brought a re-release of his greatest triumph , Tillie 's Punctured Romance ( 1914 ) with sound . In 1952 he wa honored on TV 's , This Is Your Life , then his autobiography , The King of Comedy ( 1954 ) , which is a great companion piece to Hollywood Cavalcade , wa published . 1955 brought a more concrete association with Abbott & Costello , a he had a cameo in A & C Meet the Keystone Kops . Finally in 1957 , another tribute with the compilation film , The Golden Age of Comedy . So when you watch Hollywood Cavalcade it is the legacy of a motion picture pioneer . In the film at the banquet scene the camera pan over the guest at a long table . As we get to the silver haired Mack , he alone turn his head to the camera a if to say , `` here I am ! '' . When he rise to give a speech a short while later , he is at his most subdued , underplaying the word given him a if to mentally convey , `` I know my influence on comedy will never end , but will people forget Mack Sennett the individual . Maybe this movie will help . ''

It got to be a running joke around Bonanza about how fatal it wa for any woman to get involved with any Cartwright men . After all Ben Cartwright wa three time a widower with a son by each marriage . And any woman who got involved with Adam , Hoss , and Little Joe were going to end up dying because we could n't get rid of the formula of the widower and the three son that started this classic TV western . Perhaps if Bonanza were being done today the writer would have had revolving woman character who came in and out of the life of the Cartwrights . People have relationship , some go good , some not so good , it 's just life . And we 're le demanding of our hero today so if a relationship with one of them go south we do n't have to kill the character off to keep the survivor 's nobility intact . But that 's if Bonanza were done today . But we were still expecting a lot from our western hero and Bonanza though it took a while to take hold and a change of viewing time from NBC certainly helped , the secret of Bonanza 's success wa the noble patriarch Ben Cartwright and his stalwart son . Ben Cartwright wa THE ideal TV Dad in any genre you want to name . His whole life wa spent in the hard work of building that immense Ponderosa spread for his three child . The kid were all different in personality , but all came together in a pinch . The Cartwrights became and still are an American institution . I daresay more people cared about this family than the Kennedys . Just the popularity that Bonanza ha in syndication testifies to that . Pernell Roberts a oldest son Adam wa written out of the show . Rumor ha it he did n't care for the noble Cartwright character which he felt bordered on sanctimonious . Perhaps if it were done now , he 'd have liked it better in the way I describe . This wa just the beginning for Michael Landon , how many people get three hit TV show to their credit . Landon also ha Highway to Heaven and Little House On the Prarie where he had creative control . Little Joe wa the youngest , most hot headed , but the most romantic of the Cartwrights . When Roberts left . the show kept going with the two younger son , but when big Dan Blocker left , the heart went out of Bonanza . Other character had been added on by that time , David Canary , Tim Matheson , and Ben Cartwright adopted young Mitch Vogel . But big , loyal , but a little thick Hoss wa easily the most lovable of the Cartwrights . His sudden demise after surgery left too big a hole in that family . So the Cartwrights of the Ponderosa have passed into history . I got a real taste of how America took the Cartwrights to heart when I visited the real Virginia City . It doe n't look anything like what you see in Bonanza . But near Lake Tahoe , just about where you see the Ponderosa on the map at the opening credit , is the Cartwright home , the set maintained and open a a tourist attraction . Like 21 Baker Street for Sherlock Holmes fan , the ranchhouse and the Cartwrights are real . And if they were n't real , they should have been .

Years ago , when DARLING LILI played on TV , it wa always the pan and scan version , which I hated and decided to wait and see the film in it proper widescreen format . So when I saw an inexpensive DVD of this Julie Andrews/Blake Edwards opus , I decided to purchase and watch it once and for all . Boy , what a terrible film . It 's so bad and on so many level that I really do not know where to start in describing where and when it go so horribly wrong . Looking at it now , it 's obvious to any fan of movie that Blake Edwards created this star vehicle for his wife simply because so many other director had struck gold with Andrews in musical ( MARY POPPINS , SOUND OF MUSIC , THOROUGHLY MODERN MILLIE , etc ) but also because Andrews wa snubbed from starring in project made famous on stage by Julie herself ( CAMELOT , MY FAIR LADY , etc ) because Hollywood thought she wa n't sexy or glamorous enough . So Blake created this stillborn effort , to showcase his wife in a bizarre concoction of spy story/war movie/romance/slapstick comedy/musical . DARLING LILI suffers from multiple personality , never knowing who or what it is . Some specific scene are good or effective but a a whole , it just doe n't work at all to a point of it being very embarrassing . Mind you , the version on the DVD is the `` director 's cut '' , or in this case , `` let 's salvage whatever we can '' from this notorious box office flop . In releasing the DVD , Edwards cut 19 scene ( 19 ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ) from the original bloated theatrical version into this more streamlined and yet remarkably ineffective version . The film move along with no idea of what it is . We are 25 minute into it and we still do n't know what 's going on or why we 're watching what 's going . What kind of spy is Lili ? How powerful is she ? Was she ever responsible for someone 's death ? Instead we watch a thoroughly bored looking Rock Hudson trying to woo a thoroughly bored looking Julie Andrews . Things are n't helped much with the inexplicable reason why the two fall in love . Why doe Julie fall for Hudson ? Why him and not other men she got involved with ? There should have been one of her ex hanging around , trying to win her back or trying to decipher her secret . This would have given u some much needed contrast to the muddled action . It would also have given u some impetuous to the sluggish proceeding . There 's no catalyst in this story . One only ha to look at the cut scene to clearly see that Edwards and the writer just came up with idea inspired by Andrews ' ( and Edwards ' ) previous success . The best ( or worst ) example is the scene when Andrews and Hudson follows a group of child who sing in the middle of a forest . Edwards channeling SOUND OF MUSIC . It 's no wonder he removed it from the DVD . Back in 1970 , that scene might have worked on a certain level but today , that moment reek of desperation . There are other plot element directly inspired by Andrews/Edwards other film . The endless scene of dogfight is inspired by the much better MODERN MILLIE . The musical moment `` I 'll give you three guess '' wa created just to make fun of Julie 's MARY POPPINS persona , which is turned `` raunchy '' with Julie doing a striptease in the act . The ending , bird 's eye view of Julie running towards Hudson 's plane , is another `` wink '' at SOUND OF MUSIC . The whole thing is confusing . Julie play a singer , born from a German father and British mother , who life in England but sings her ( English ) song in Paris . You never know exactly where the story take place . Some moment are just badly edited . Like when Julie and her `` uncle '' are on horseback . They talk and talk and then Julie suddenly sprint off in mid-sentence . I 'm like `` what happened here ? '' The comedy bit are unfunny and cringe-worthy . Every scene with the French police are pathetic . Where 's Peter Sellers when you really need him . The action is stupid beyond belief . When Julie and her `` uncle '' are on their way to Germany on that train , Hudson 's squadron shoot round of bullet at the train , almost killing Lili in the process . Brilliant . What 's also funny about that scene is the two leave on the train in the middle of the night but Hudson and his squadron reach the train even though they fly off the next morning . That 's one slow moving train there . The musical moment . The beginning is the best part of the entire film ( and the reason I gave this film 3 star ) but it 's effect is diminished considerably because it 's repeated at the end . Speaking of redundant , did we really need to see a can-can dance , Crepe Suzette stripping scene and Julie stripping too ? The `` Girl in no man 's land '' is OK even if it 's bleeding obvious , but that moment just doe n't make any sense whatsoever because Lili sings it to a group of injured soldier at a French hospital , making me wonder : how many soldier there were injured indirectly by the result of her spying ? The whole project is listless and without energy . The romance is 100 % unbelievable . Rock Hudson is way too old and tired looking ( check out the museum scene ) . Julie look dazed , like she 's on Valium . But what really kill this ill-conceived project is Julie playing a German spy . Edwards desperately wanted to dispel the Mary Poppins syndrome afflicting his wife and believed that playing a traitor wa a good career decision . As much a I like Julie , she 's no Greta Garbo , who pulled it off so beautifully in MATA HARI . Funny enough , even if Julie play a German spy , she still come across a cloying and cute . How bad is DARLING LILI ? Even after 37 year since it release , Blake Edwards felt he still needed to work on it for it DVD release .

This series , made for Televisión Española ( TVE ) is basically a series of chapter in the life of an ordinary family in 1968 , primarily a seen through the eye of the youngest son . Based on a background of historical event , such a the May 1968 student uprising in France , the decaying Franco regime , the war in Viet-Nam , the rise of imperialism , and others specifically related to Spanish life at that particular moment , one might regard this series a a simple compilation of characteristic foible which make themselves so apparent in this kind of entertainment . Generally treated in a lightweight vein though not lacking in certain moment which might be called dramatic , the series would seem to be aimed at people of around fifty who can rember those time , a , it should be stated , anyone younger either chooses to ignore such happening or is busily occupied in other thing . The best thing that can be said of this series is Ana Duato 's rôle a mother of three child : she play the part of the total housewife of the time really well , manifesting that peculiar Spanish penchant , especially noticeable among woman , of letting all her thinking and her doings be carried forward by the impetus of her heart , without any resorting to the use of the brain . As we say in Spain , common sense is one of the least common sens . Imanol Arias offer very little , apart from not being his usual stereotyped hard policeman a in other television series . Indeed , a an actor , he should not be trusted in anything which is not a TV series . His resource are too limited ; however , his part a father of the working-class household is not at all bad . Not really recommendable for other audience , even Spanish-speakers in Latin America : the theme are all too parochially related to a specific spot in contemporary Spanish history , such that if the viewer wa not living here at that time he will miss most of the reference . It is even probable that certain situation which cause a few Spanish smile would not mean anything to other viewer .

I want the 99 minute of my life back that wa wasted on this pathetic excuse for a movie . The acting wa horrific ! I used to be a fan of Cameron Diaz and Vincent D'Onofrio . I will never look at them the same again . Keanu Reeves and Dan Aykroyd were not a surprise . Everyone know they never could act . Thankfully , only Dan attempted an accent . His accent wa a disaster a expected . I think he wa either confused about the location of the film or had never actually spoken to anyone from Minnesota . I hope this review help anyone who is undecided about what to do with their precious time . The only reason I wa able to sit through the whole movie wa because I wa stuck somewhere without anything better to watch or read .

One of my favorite movie which ha been overlooked by too many movie goer , an observation which mystifies me . Not only directed by the acclaimed Ang Lee , it had many young actor who were to become major star , e.g. , Tobey Maguire ( before Spiderman ) , Skeet Ulrich ( before Jericho ) , Jonathan Rhys Meyers ( before Tudors ) , James Caviezel , Simon Baker , Mark Ruffalo , Jeffrey Wright , Tom Wilkinson , and Jewel . All of the acting wa superb and each of the actor mentioned gave memorable performance , especially Meyers who portrayed an evil villain who killed for the sake of killing . When the biography and accomplishment of the director ( even when he won an academy award ) and the actor are listed , this film is usually omitted from their past performance . I discovered the film on DVD by accident and it became one of my most often watched film . However , it is seldom every seen on cable . I look forward to reading what others suggest are the reason this film is not well known .

It 's nice to see a romantic comedy that doe not have the prissy man lead , this ha solid acting from both male lead and also from the female lead and although the story is a little long and a little cliché you cant help but like it . I think the story wa a little rushed at the end , but extending that would have made the story even longer . Superior to other romantic comedy such a 100 day with Mr arrogant , and possibly tied with my tutor friend . It would make an interesting introduction to Korean cinema , not a great a My sassy girl , but still good .

Of all the movie of the seventy , none captured to truest essence of the good versus evil battle a did the Sentinel . I mean , yes , there were movie like the Exorcist , and other one ; but none of them captured the human element of the protagonist like this one . If you have time , check this one out . You may not be able to get past the dated device a such , but this is a story worth getting into.Then there are all the star and soon-to-be star . My absolute favorite were Eli Wallach , Sylvia Miles , and Burgess Meredith . Then there are the subtle clue that lead to what 's going on too . Pay close attention . I had to watch it four time to catch on to all the smaller weird statement like 'black and white cat , black and white cake ' . Plus , the book are really good a well . I 'm just sorry that they 're not going to turn the second book into a film . It 's so scary that it would outdo this movie .

This is apparently the second remake of this film , having been filmed before in 1911 and 1918 . And , in so many way it reminds me of the later film , A YANK AT OXFORD . Both film concern a conceited blow-hard who arrives at one of the top school in the world and both , ultimately , show the blow-hard slowly learning about teamwork and decency . In this film , William Haines is `` Tom Brown '' and his main rival , `` Bob '' is played by Frances X. Bushman . And , in a supporting role is Jack Pickford -- always remembered a the brother of Mary . Of these three , Pickford come off the best , a the sympathetic loser who becomes Tom 's pal -- he actually ha a few decent scene a well a a dramatic moment just before the Big Game ! All the standard clichés are there and the movie , because it wa done so many time before and since , offer few surprise . However , it is pleasant film and is enjoyable viewing . In my opinion , for a better silent college film , try Harold Lloyd 's THE FRESHMAN -- it 's football scene are frankly more exciting and Harold is far more likable and sympathetic than the annoying Tom Brown . THE FRESHMAN is probably the best college picture you can find from the era . Another reason why BROWN AT HARVARD is a lesser picture is that William Haines played essentially the same unlikable and bombastic character with the same plot again and again and again ( such a in WESTPOINT and THE SMART SET , among others ) -- and if you 've seen one of these film , you 've seen them all . Well made , but certainly NOT original ! And , because it is just a rehash of his other film , anyone giving the film a score of 10 is STRONGLY advised to see these other film . 4/25/08==I just checked and saw this this small film wa the highest rated film on IMDb from the 1920 ! ! Talk about over-rated ! There are dozen and dozen of better film -- how this film got to be # 1 is anyone 's guess .

This movie illustrates like no other the state of the Australian film industry and everything that 's holding it back . Awesome talent , outstanding performance ( particularly by Victoria Hill ) , but a let down in practically every other way . An `` adaptation '' of sort , it brought nothing new to Macbeth ( no , setting it in present-day Australia is not enough ) , and essentially , completely failed to justify it existence , apart from ( let 's face it , completely unnecessarily ) paying homage to the original work . If there 's one body of work that ha been done ( and done and done and done ) , it 's Shakespeare 's . So any adaptation , if it 's not to be a self-indulgent and pointless exercise , need to at least bring some new interpretation to the work . And that 's what this Macbeth fails to do . As it wa done , this film ha no contemporary relevance whatsoever . It 's the same piece that we have seen countless ( too many ! ) time before . Except with gun and in different outfit . Apart from the fundamental blunder ( no other way to put it ) of keeping the original Shakespearian dialogue , one of the more cringeful moment of the movie is the prolonged and incredibly boring slow motion shoot out towards the end , during which I completely tuned out , even though I wa looking at the screen . I never thought I had a short attention span , but there you go . I suppose the movie succeeds on it own , very limited term . But a Australia continues to produce world-class acting talent , it movie-makers need to stop being proud of succeeding on limited term , and actually set high enough standard to show that they respect for the kind of acting talent they work with . A shame . An absolute shame .

Owen love his Mamma ... only he 'd love her better six foot under in this dark , laugh-out-loud comedy that both star and is directed by Danny DeVito , with admirable assist from Billy Crystal and Anne Ramsey in the title role . `` Throw Momma From The Train '' is a terrific comedy , even if it is n't a great film . It 's too shallow in part , and the ending feel le organic than tacked on . But it 's a gut-splitting ride most of the way , with Crystal and DeVito employing great screen chemistry while working their own separate comic take on the essence of being a struggling writer ( DeVito is avid but untalented ; Crystal is blocked and bitter ) . Crystal 's Professor Donner belief his ex-wife stole his book ( the unfortunately titled `` Hot Fire '' ) and ca n't write more than the opening line of his next book , which doe n't come easy . He teach a creative writing class of budding mediocrity , including a middle-aged woman who writes Tom Clancy-type fiction but doe n't know what that thing is the submarine captain speaks through ; and an upholstery salesman who want to write the story of his life . Mr. Pinsky is probably the funniest character for laughs-per-minutes-on-screen , an ascot-wearing weirdo who see literature a an excuse to write his opus : `` 100 Girls I 'd Like To Pork . '' Then there 's DeVito 's Owen Lift , who call himself Professor Donner 's `` star pupil '' even though the teacher wo n't read his work in class . Owen is a somewhat unusual character to star in a movie , a man-child in his late 30 who life with his overbearing mother , Anne Ramsey , who call him `` lardass '' and other endearing sentiment . In any other movie , we 'd be asked to feel sorry for Owen , but `` Throw Momma From The Train '' pile life 's cruelty onto this sad sack for laugh and expects u to go along . That 's one big reason why this film probably loses a lot of people . For those of u who enjoy the humor of this character , even identifying with him , and take the rest of what we see here a a lark , it 's not a big a stretch to go along with the bigger gambit this comedy take , asking u to watch in amusement while Owen enlists Professor Donner 's help in a plan to kill his mother . Actually , he first go to Hawaii to kill Donner 's hated ex , then tell the professor it 's his turn to kill Mrs . Lift , `` swapping murder '' a seen in Hitchcock 's `` Strangers On A Train . '' As a director , DeVito not only complement his actor ' performance with scene-setting that place the accent on dialogue , he make some bold visual statement , throwing in bit of amusing unreality to keep the audience on it toe ( and away from taking thing too seriously . ) Also helping matter is writer Stu Silver , who keep the laugh coming with his quotable patter . `` You got rat the size of Oldsmobiles here . '' `` She 's not a woman ... She 's the Terminator . '' `` One little murder and I 'm Jack the Ripper . '' Those are all Crystal 's word , but some of the funniest line , which work only in context but absolutely kill , are DeVito 's and Ramsey 's . Apparently Silver never wrote another screenplay after this , according to the IMDb , and that 's a shame , because he had real talent for it . The best scene in this movie , when Crystal meet Ramsey , wa actually used in it entirety a a theatrical 'coming attraction ' presentation , the only time I 've seen a movie promoted that way . Owen introduces the professor to his mother a 'Cousin Patty , ' and when Momma say he doe n't have a Cousin Patty , panicky Owen loses it . 'You lied to me , ' he yell out , slamming the professor 's forehead with a pan . Of course , in reality the professor would n't groan out something witty from the floor , but 'Throw Momma From The Train ' work effectively at such moment , when playing it Looney Tunes vibe for all it worth . DeVito ha n't disappeared from film , of course , but it 's a mystery why he ha n't really followed up on the directorial promise of this movie . Maybe it 's because , a 'Throw Momma From The Train 's lack of mainstream success show , his kind of vision is n't to everyone 's taste . That 's too bad for those of u who can watch this over and over , and like it .

A Compelling Thriller ! ! , 10 December 2005 Author : littlehammer16787 from United States Just Cause Starring : Sean Connery , Laurence Fishburne , and Blair Underwood . A liberal , though good-hearted Harvard law professor Paul Armstrong is convoked to the Flordia Everglades by unjustly convicted black guy Bobby Earl.Confessing that sadistic , cold-hearted cop vilifyied and beat him to a pulp to get the confession of a gruesome murder of an eleven year old girl . As he dig further and further into the mysterious case he realizes that Bobby Earl is a victim of discrimination.That the black police detective Lt.Tanny Brown of the small community is corrupt and villainously mean . When the infamous , psychotic serial killer Blair Sullivan is introduced.He discovers that he know the location of the murder weapon that butchered the little girl.When Armstrong find that there are lucid coincidence of Sullivan 's road trip through the small town and the letter he personally wrote . Bobby Earl get a re-trial.Is unfettered from prison and eludes his horrific punishment . All seems swimmingly well until an unexpected phone call from serial killer Sullivan come into focus.Armstrong discovers a lurid double killing which happens to be Sullivan 's parents.Whom he immensely detests.Sullivan divulges to Armstrong the truth of Joanie Shriver 's heinous murder and why he wa brought here.It turn out that Bobby Earl is a psychopathic murderer and he really did rape and kill Joanie Shriver.He just merely struck a bargain with fiendish psycho Sullivan . To get loose so he could kill again for revenge.Upon Armstrong 's beautiful wife and daughter.Now Sullivan is executed to his death . Armstrong and tough good guy Brown chase the malevolent villain to the Everglades in order to thwart him.When they arrive Armstrong learns that the psychotic sicko Bobby Earl plan to kill his wife and daughter for a former rape trial that inevitably made him endure agonizing pain and castration.But good , virtuous cop Brown emerges and thwart the brutal baddie.Is stabbed and eaten by ruthless , man-eating alligators.Paul Armstrong , Tanny Brown , his wife , and daughter survive and live happily ever after . A good thriller that works.Delivers both mystery and subterfuge.How reluctant black are hazed by racist lawmen.Sentenced to unfair penalties.Even though sometimes the wrongfully convicted innocent , friendly black man may in truth be the vicious baddie . Sean Connery is great a the oblivious , holier than thou hero.Laurence Fishburne is watchably amazing a the mean , arrogant , but good guy cop . Underwood and Harris are over the top and invigorating a the malevolent psychos.Capeshaw is okay.Ruby Dee is great a the tenacious grandmother.The rest of the cast is wonderful a well .

Filmfour are going to have to do a lot better than this little snot of a film if they 're going to get the right sort of reputation for themselves . This film is set in Glasgow ( although only a couple of secondary character have anything approaching a Scottish accent ) . The premise , about people who 's life are going nowhere , who all meet up in the same cafe in the early hour of the morning a they have night job , COULD have made for a really funny , insightful , quirky , cultish film . Instead we have a group of self-obsessed saddos and a plot which ha been so done to bit I 'm suprised it ha n't been banned . X and Y are friend . X is sleeping with Z. Y sleep with Z a well . Oh you figure it out . A total waste of time . Painful dialogue - it sounded like something that a group of 16 year old would have written for a GCSE drama project . The female character wa completely superfluous - just written in a a token female in the hope that woman would be cajoled into seeing it . If you 're the sort of thicko lad who laugh at beer advert and can usually be found wandering round in pack shouting on Saturday night in nondescript town centre then you will love this film and find it `` a right laff '' . Everyone else , run , do n't walk away from this sorry little misfit . And one question , when the group left the `` boring '' seaside town ( Saltcoats incidentally although they changed the name on the film ) , to go back to Glasgow , WHY did they do it via the Forton motorway service at LANCASTER which is in England ?

Doctor Mordrid is one of those rare film that is completely under the radar , but is totally worthwhile . It really reminds me of the old serial from the 30 and 40 . Which is why I 'd have loved to see follow-up movie ... but judging by the rest of Full Moon 's output there simply were n't enough tit to satisfy the typical audience . It doe n't happen very often , but occasionally one man can make a difference -- a big difference . George Crile 's 2003 best seller , CHARLIE WILSON 'S WAR , is a fascinating and eye-opening account of the most unlikely `` difference maker '' imaginable . A relatively obscure Congressman from the Second District of Texas , `` Good Time Charlie '' wa known more for his libertine lifestyle than his libertarian legislation . Likable and licentious ( even for a politician ) , Charlie Wilson served his constituency well since the good folk of Lufkin only really wanted two thing , their gun and to be left alone . It 's Easy Street replete with his bevy of beltway beauty known , appropriately enough , a Charlie 's Angels . When asked why his entire office staff wa composed of attractive , young aide his response is a classic , `` You can teach 'em to type , but you ca n't teach 'em to grow tit . '' No argument there . But even the most rakish rapscallion ha a conscience lurking somewhere underneath , and for Charlie Wilson the unimaginable atrocity being committed in Afghanistan moved him to muster his entire political savvy toward funding the utter , humiliating defeat of the Russian military and , possibly , to even help hasten the end of the Cold War a a result . Fat chance , huh ? Under the skillful direction of Mike Nichols and a smart , snappy screenplay by Adam Sorkin , CHARLIE WILSON 'S WAR is a sparkling , sophisticated satire that chronicle the behind-the- scene machination of three colorful character comprising `` Charlie 's Team . '' The on-screen `` Team , '' is composed of three marvelous actor with four ( 4 ) Academy Awards and nine ( 9 ) nomination between them . Charlie is beautifully portrayed by Tom Hanks in a solid , slightly understated fashion that is among his best work in year . He 's aided , abetted and abedded by Joanne Herring , a wealthy Houston socialite played by the still-slinky Julia Roberts . Hey , why else have the bikini scene than to let the world know this ? By all account Ms. Roberts look good and hold her own , but the screenplay never give u even a hint why Kabul and country is so important to her character . Maybe the two Afghan hound usually by her side know -- but we a an audience never do . As for the third member of the `` Team , '' Philip Seymour Hoffman steal every scene he appears in a Gust Aurakotos , a smart , street- wise ( i.e . non Ivy League graduate ) CIA malcontent who know the score -- both in the Agency 's boardroom and in Wilson 's bedroom . For the Mujahideen to succeed , the most important assistance the U.S. can provide is the ability to shoot down the dreaded MI-21 helicopter gunships which rule the sky . This take money , lot of money , and eventually `` Charlie 's Team '' covertly coerces those in Congress to fund the effort to the tune of $ 1 billion dollar for advanced weaponry to arm the Afghan rebel . This includes top-of-the-line , state-of-the-art anti-aircraft and anti-tank rocket a well a other highly sophisticated killing device . Nasty , nasty stuff . That this kind of multi-billion dollar illicit activity can and doe take place behind Congressional door is truly alarming . Every American should see this movie or read this book because it reveals a truly frightening aspect of the business-as-usual political scene rarely seen outside the wall of our very own government . Oh momma , I wish it were n't so ... Even though the initial outcome for `` Team Charlie '' wa an unqualified success , the unimaginable , unanticipated final result is that these sophisticated weapon are now used against our troop by the Taliban and others . Since the funding wa entirely `` covert , '' the young generation in this part of the world ha no idea the fall of Soviet oppression and the end to Russian barbarity wa the direct result of American intervention . Yes , once the Russkies left , so did our aid -- zip for school , zip for infrastructure , zip on maintaining meaningful relationship with the Afghan people . As a result , the overall consequence is an unmitigated disaster -- it 's like the forerunner to `` Mission Accomplished . '' As Nichol 's film so pointedly point out , `` The ball you 've set in motion can keep bouncing even after you 've lost interest in it . '' Mike Krzyzewski know this , Eva Longoria Parker know this , little Lateesha in Lafayette know this , but the typical American politician doe n't . So we go from good guy to bad guy because we could n't let the world know we were the good guy . Talk about a Catch-22 ( another Mike Nichols film ) . Perhaps Charlie Wilson said it best , `` We f & % ked up the end game . '' Again .

I 'm a big fan of surrealist art , but this film by Bunuel ( with some idea from Dali ) left me cold . Bunuel had a life-long grudge against the Catholic church and delighted in trying to offend Catholics in fairly silly way . This is one of the silliest ; almost like what you 'd expect from a smart-aleck 18-year-old in film class . The last few minute of the movie , which have nothing to do with anything else , are a final nose-thumbing at religion . If you read the `` scholar '' regarding this slow-paced , occasionally amusing film , it 's all about how the church and society are guilty of sexual repression . If that is indeed the point , then Bunuel express it in the most roundabout fashion possible . The central male character is a nasty brute who love kicking dog and knocking blind men down in the street , and who mentally turn billboard ad into strange sexual fantasy . Is this behavior the church 's fault ( for interrupting his lovemaking ) , or is he just a jerk ? I vote for the latter . I think Bunuel must have had a lot of personal hangups and chose the Catholics a the one to blame . There are a few moment where you might cry , `` Aha ! surrealism ! `` : a cow in a bed , a giraffe falling out a window ( a poor model ) , a man shredding a feather pillow , a woman flushing a toilet while we watch picture of seething lava ( or a mud pit ... hard to tell in B/W ) . The rest is forgettable self-indulgence . Unfortunately , Bunuel wa still chasing the same bogey-men through the rest of his career ( Viridiana , Discreet Charm ... ) . If you 're interested in seeing surrealism on the screen , check out Jean Cocteau 's early work .

This ludicrous film offer the standard 1970 's `` hippie mentality '' in a nut shell and bore u in the process . Its an attempt to rationalize absurd marriage of young , innocent woman with old age sex fiend and wash ups . A naive young hippy played by the waif-like ( Kay Lenz ) hitch hike and sleep with all the wrong guy , and then one day she meet the ridiculous ( Holden ) , already in old age , hard liquor drinking and washed up a an actor , and she decides that she is in `` love '' with him . If you think that is superficial , the whole film encapsulates such scene . She keep saying how much she `` love '' him and she only met him , it wear thin and really quick . I could n't help but laugh throughout the film . Its obvious she 's just using him a a meal ticket but the director is immature enough to think we are going to buy that there is actually any love taking place . A disgusting scene is where the two are naked and having sex , I had to fast forward it because it almost inspired me to vomit . A corny offering of music from the 70 's is also spread through the film . Avoid this if you can . Grade D .

Pathetic attempt to use science to justify new age religion/philosophy . The two have nothing to do with each other and much of what is said about Quantum Physics in this mess is just plain wrong . Examples ? Quantum theory support the idea in eastern religion that reality is an illusion . How ? Well , in the world of the subatomic , you can never definitely predict a particle location at a specific time . You can only give the odds of it being precisely at one spot at one time . Also , the act of observation seems to affect the event . Solid particle can pas through barrier . All of this , so far , is accurate . But then they assert that that mean that if you believed sincerely enough that you could walk through a wall , you could indeed do it . This is complete poppycock . Instead , the theory asserts that at our level , it is possible for you to walk through a wall , but it is merely by chance and ha nothing to do with belief . Also you 'd have to keep walking into the wall for eternity to ever have even the remotest chance of passing through the wall , the odds are so astronomically against it . This is but one example of how they misrepresent the science . But much more annoying is the narrative involving an unhappy photographer , played by Marlee Maitlan . About halfway through the picture it becomes so confused a to be incomprehensible . Something to do with negative thought leading to addiction and self-hate . There may be some truth to that , but Quantum physic ha nothing to do with it . Plus , string theory is the hot new thing in physic nowadays . Instead of wasting your time with this dreck , I suggest you rent The Elegant Universe , an amazing series done for NOVA on PBS that give you a history of physic from Newton and gravity to Ed Witten and M Theory in only 3 hour-long episode . Quantum mechanic is explained there quite well if you want to know it without the fog of metaphysical appropriation .

I wa truly looking forward to this title . It sounded and looked fun . The idea of someone making a cheesy 50 monster movie could have been worth a few laugh , but instead this title only bore . First off , there is almost no Froggg in the entire movie which is the biggest disappointment . I have to sit through 75+ minute of lame drama and dialog to get a few glimpse of the Froggg humping a bare breasted chick . Why ? On top of that the film lack any sort of fun plot . I mean give me something thats a bit more interesting than just a bunch of talking head . I wanted to see some hot chick search for the creature in the swamp , I wanted to see some cuties dragged off to his lair in desperate need of rescue ( Creature from the Black Lagoon stuff ) , I wanted to see a few goofy action scene of the Froggg going on a killing spree , or it maybe escaping a silly trap . Something exciting ! Geez , have fun with it , be creative ! Who want to sit through endless and tiring dialog scene in a creature flick ? My advice to the filmmaker : Keep going , your concept are good , but your execution need to be a lot more inspired . Have some fun with the creature , put the humor in the action and most important ... put more creature in a creature movie ! ! !

Chuck Jones 's 'Rabbit Seasoning ' , the second in the much beloved hunting trilogy , is often considered to be the best of the three . While I find it almost impossible to choose between this trio of fantastic cartoon , I would have to concede that 'Rabbit Seasoning ' is the most finely honed script . Here , the emphasis is placed on language a Bugs and Daffy run through a series of complex dialogue in the grand tradition of Abbot and Costello 's 'Who 's on next ' routine . As a long term Daffy fan , I have always been delighted by the hunting trilogy because it is consistently Daffy who get all the best line ( the famous `` Pronoun trouble '' being one of the all time classic ) and doe most of the work . Bugs play the role of cool manipulator while Elmer , a always , is the befuddled dupe . Part of what make the hunting trilogy so much fun is that Daffy and Elmer pose so little threat to Bugs that he is basically just kicking back and having some easy laugh . Elmer fall into every trap that is laid for him but it is poor old Daffy who come off worst , being shot in the face again and again , his beak ending up in more and more ridiculous position . It all build to the inevitable climactic declaration `` You 're despicable '' . As intricate an example of Chuck Jones 's impeccable timing a you 'll come across , 'Rabbit Seasoning ' is a true classic .

`` Crossfire '' is a justifiably famous 1947 noir that 's a murder mystery with a strong message . It star Robert Young , Robert Mitchum , Robert Ryan , Sam Levene , and Gloria Grahame , and is strongly directed by Edward Dmytryk . We witness the murder in shadow at the beginning , and for the rest of the film , Young , a the detective , Finlay , in charge of the case , seek to figure out which of three soldier is responsible for the death , and just a important , why . The victim , Joseph Samuels ( Sam Levene ) is someone the soldier meet in a bar ; they go up to his apartment to continue their visit , and Samuels wind up dead . I do n't know about 1947 , but seeing `` Crossfire '' today , one know who did it and why the minute we see the suspect . I do n't suppose it wa so apparent back then , a these actor were just getting started . Nevertheless , the film pack a big punch with it powerful acting , good direction , violence , and unsparing anti-Semite language . The characterization are vivid , including that of Gloria Grahame in a smallish role - she 's a woman who meet Mitchell ( George Cooper ) , one of the suspect soldier , in a bar and can provide him with an alibi . The big performance in the film belongs to Robert Ryan , but everyone is excellent . Robert Young especially is effective a a tough but intelligent police detective . Mitchum is very likable a a soldier trying to help his confused friend Mitchell , a lonely man unsure if he still ha feeling for his wife . Truly excellent , and a must see .

Goldeneye will always go down a one of thee most legendary game in VG history . Their is no doubt about that . But this game , although quite different , could quite possibly be the modern-day Bond champ , of it time . This wa not a bond game based on material from another medium . ( wouldnt be bond without it , haha ! ) Gameplay wa excellent , and if you 're a fan of the bond game or film alike , you 'll enjoy it . Even after beating the game there 's still plenty more to be done . With the ranking system and unlockables to be achieved , a well a it multi-player mission , this is a stand-out game . Despite being quite old now , in video game year . It 's still a good game that you can pick up & play whenever you feel the need to get a little more Bond in your life . Which can only be named Awesome , Completely Awesome . I 've got ta go throw this game on now . If you have n't played it yet , you 're missing out !

I commented on this when it first debuted and gave it a `` thumb in the middle '' review , remarking that I 'd give it the benefit of the doubt beyond just the first episode . I 've seen a total of six episode now up to this point in June 2006 . And a a lifelong Batman fanatic , I can say without hesitation : this show is utter crap . Everything 's wrong with it . Everything . Getting past just the lousy animation and design , the story are ridiculously convoluted and with no character development or apparent interest by the writer of this dreck to give any substance to any story . And for God 's sake ... is it just me , or is the Joker in EVERY EPISODE ? ? Is Gotham that much of a revolving-door justice system ? Or , again , is it just a complete lack of interest in the writer to put any effort into other villain ( see `` no character development '' , above ) . And to make matter worse , every single Joker tale is the same 3-part formula . 1 ) Joker gas people . 2 ) Joker set out to gas the whole city . 3 ) Batman save the day . Pfeh . There wa one episode I saw that wa n't a Joker story . The title escape me , but the villain wa that nefarious Cluemaster ... the `` Think Thank Thunk '' episode with the quiz show . That wa the single-worst Batman story I 've ever seen , heard or read . Yes , worse than `` I 've Got Batman in My Basement . '' I ca n't really say what I feel this show is because it 's probably against the ToS , but it start with `` B '' and rhyme with `` fastardization '' . Thank goodness for the existence of the Timm/Dini/etc . era of Bat-entertainment , back from the Fox and Kids WB day . Stuff that good , and I should have known this , just could n't possibly have lasted forever , unfortunately .

Just because someone is under the age of 10 doe not mean they are stupid . If your child like this film you 'd better have him/her tested . I am continually amazed at how so many people can be involved in something that turn out so bad . This `` film '' is a showcase for digital wizardry AND NOTHING ELSE . The writing is horrid . I ca n't remember when I 've heard such bad dialogue . The song are beyond wretched . The acting is sub-par but then the actor were not given much . Who decided to employ Joey Fatone ? He can not sing and he is ugly a sin . The worst thing is the obviousness of it all . It is a if the writer went out of their way to make it all a stupid a possible . Great child 's movie are wicked , smart and full of wit - film like Shrek and Toy Story in recent year , Willie Wonka and The Witches to mention two of the past . But in the continual dumbing-down of American more are flocking to dreck like Finding Nemo ( yes , that 's right ) , the recent Charlie & The Chocolate Factory and eye-crossing trash like Red Riding Hood .

`` Hey Babu Riba '' is a film about a young woman , Mariana ( nicknamed `` Esther '' after a famous American movie star ) , and four young men , Glenn , Sacha , Kicha , and Pop , all perhaps 15-17 year old in 1953 Belgrade , Yugoslavia . The five are committed friend and crazy about jazz , blue jean , or anything American it seems . The very close relationship of the teenager is poignant , and ultimately a sacrifice is willingly made to try to help one of the group who ha fallen on unexpected difficulty . In the wake of changing communist politics , they go their separate way and reunite in 1985 ( the year before the film wa made ) . I enjoyed the film with some reservation . The subtitle for one thing were difficult . Especially in the beginning , there were a number of dialogue which had no subtitle at all . Perhaps the conversational pace required it , but I could n't always both read the text and absorb the scene , which caused me to not always understand which character wa involved . I watched the movie ( a video from our public library ) with a friend , and neither of u really understood part of the story about acquiring streptomycin for a sick relative . This Yugoslavian coming of age film effectively conveyed the teenager ' sense of invulnerability , idealism , and strong and loyal bond to each other . There is a main flashforward , and it wa intriguing , keeping me guessing until the end a to who these character were vis-a-vis the 1953 cast , and what had actually happened . I would rate it 7 out of 10 , and would like to see other film by the director , Jovan Acin ( 1941-1991 ) .

After a snowstorm , the road are blocked and the highway patrolman Jason ( Adam Beach ) come to the diner of his friend Fritz ( Jurgen Prochnow ) and advises his client that they will only be able to follow their trip on the next day . Among the weird stranger , Jason meet his former sweetheart Nancy ( Rose McGowan ) , who ha just left her husband in Los Angeles . Along the night , without any communication with his base , Jason face distressful and suspicious situation with the client , and find some corps , indicating that among them there is a killer . `` The Last Stop '' could be an average thriller , but the screenplay is simply awful . Most of the character are despicable person and the motif of the surprising serial killer are never disclosed , and the viewer have no further explanation why the killer decided to kill the guest . My vote is four . Title ( Brazil ) : `` Encurralados '' ( `` Trapped '' )

This movie wa a fairly entertaining comedy about Murphy 's Law being applied to home ownership and construction . If a film like this wa being made today no doubt the family would be dysfunctional . Since it wa set in the 'simpler ' forty , we get what is supposed to be a typical family of the era . Grant of course perfectly blend the comedic and dramatic element and he work with a more than competent supporting cast highlighted by Loy and Douglas . Their shenanigan make for a solid ninety minute of entertainment , 7/10 .

What can you say about the film White Fire . Amazing ? Fantastic ? Disturbing ? Hilarious ? These word are not big enough to describe the event which is White Fire . From wobbly , garbled beginning to profound end , this movie will entertain throughout . Our movie begin in the wood of a country somewhere in the world . A family is hiding from unmarked soldier in costume shop uniform . When the father separate from the mother and their childen , you get a real sense of what kind of movie you 're about to watch . Father make sure to roll down hill in his all white outfit , and is polite a he get people 's attention before he shoot them , but ala , dad is burned alive in what look like a very unsupervised , unsafe stunt . Meanwhile , mom and the kid are running down a beach with an armed soldier trailing about 5 foot behind them . He too give a stern warning before action in the form of a bizarre `` HALT ! `` , and then promptly waste the mother . This action sequence set up the happy childhood of our hero Bo and Ingred . So now we fast forward about 20 year ( 30 if you 're honest about the hero 's age ) to beautiful Turkey , where Bo and Ingred have settled a professional thief , or diamond prospector , or something . Ingred work at a diamond mine where she help herself to the good , while Bo ( masterfully played by the dynamic Robert Ginty ) drive around the desert in his denim outfit . Bo and Ingrid have an interesting relationship . They do n't seem to have any friend other than each other , and they spend all of their time together . That coupled with the fact that Bo ha expressed his desire to sleep with his sister a evidenced in line such a `` you know it a shame you 're my sister '' he say to her while she 's stark naked , make for a very dynamic duo . Bo is then crushed when Ingrid is killed , a he wanders the beach of Turkey with his ceremonial pink grief scarf . A renewal of hope occurs when Bo find a girl who look like Ingrid , and give her plastic surgery to make her look exactly like Ingrid . This open the door for Bo to have sex with his sister without it being technically wrong . Bo is a real fan of ethical grey area , and he is overjoyed with his new love . So anyway , there 's a lot of fun action scene , ridiculous violence , great acting , impossible to follow plot-lines , Fred `` the hammer '' Williamson ( for some reason ) , and a big chunk of dirty ice which is supposed to be a giant diamond ( which later explodes ) . All of these thing are great , but the Bo and Ingrid relationship is what make this movie special .... really special . So I heartily encourage everyone to behold the majesty that is White Fire . You may be glad you did .. or not .

I am so disappointed . This movie left me feeling jipped out of my time and mental energy . Here wa the quintessential Woody Allen film all over again : the neurotic upper-class Manhattanites debating whether or not they will cheat on their spouse . Woody , I 've seen these character already , I 've seen the storyline from you ten time already . Where did your creativity go ? ? ? You need to open your eye and look around you . The world ha changed dramatically since Annie Hall - and you need to change along with it . There are far more interesting and funny scenario to which you can apply your brand of angst and neuroticism - why not try them out instead of rehashing the same old slop over and over and over again . When I hear that Woody Allen ha a new project coming out , it doe nothing for me - because now I 've come to expect his old standby : the couple who are growing tired of each other and end up cheating . Depressing and same old , same old . If Woody want to win his fan back , then he ha to understand that our sense of humor and intelligence ha to be stimulated - not insulted .

This movie is all ultra-lightweight fluff , predictable from beginning to end . As a Don Knotts vehicle , `` The Incredible Mr. Limpet '' wa much better , with Knott 's character there not nearly a incompetent or ignorant . His performance there wa toned down , with none of his trademark goggle-eyed stare , although that may have something to do with him being replaced for most of the movie by a cartoon fish . Knotts made a living of playing the likable imbecile , much a Bob Denver did . Neither really seemed to be able to break out to other type of role , assuming they were simply typecast . It wa probably because of the slouch , the wild stare and the high-pitched voice . John Ritter , whom Knotts worked with in `` Three 's Company , '' wa able to transcend his genre , branching out successfully into dramatic role like `` The Dreamer of Oz , '' but the closest Knotts ever got wa a small role in `` Pleasantville . '' Even Leslie Nielsen wa a bad fit here , uncomfortably neither straight dramatic actor a he wa at the time nor deadpan comedic actor a he later became in `` Airplane ! '' and `` Police Squad . '' There 's also no way the then-43 year-old Knotts could pas for a 35 year-old , a his character insisted he wa . It wa a ludicrously unbelievable a Tom Hanks at 38 playing the college-age Forrest Gump . The film wa clearly made on a shoestring budget , very much looking like a hastily-filmed TV episode . It 's especially evident in the `` exterior '' scene of the `` town '' where Roy go after he 's fired . It 's unlikely even a pre-schooler would be fooled by the Mayberry-like soundstage artificiality . Even viewing this strictly a a child 's movie , it 's very disappointing . It 's not because it lack action or special effect , although it doe . The pace is much too slow , the situation repetitive . How many time can you watch Roy getting onto a bus ? A comedy for kid should at least sometimes be madcap , with breakneck gag , otherwise you risk boring them ( and any adult in the theater a well ) . Movies , even kid 's movie , have improved quite a bit in the intervening decade . Even many contemporary comedy were better filmed and written . Disney 's `` The Love Bug , '' for instance , at least had some interesting race action .

If you are interested in learning more about this sort of thing happening in modern civilization , there is an excellent book called `` Outlaw Seas '' or `` The Outlaw Sea '' , and it describes , in story after story , how these thing do happen . The lawlessness of the high sea is a reality for a number of reason . One , many of the world 's freighter are of questionable registry ( nationality ) and it 's difficult to impossible to enforce international law when the ship owner do n't have an office in a real country . Two , many ship line employ crew from dirt poor third world country . The crew are often ( like illegal immigrant worker ) threatened and bullied into complying with questionable or illegal practice . Three , there is often a language barrier , not only between the officer and the crew , but also between the crew member themselves . The crew are rewarded for their compliance and their silence . Four , once committing an illegal act , the ship are able to hide in plain sight with little more than a fresh coat of paint . Anyway , it 's fascinating reading . Horrifying story , excellent movie . Does anyone else notice how HBO seems to make the best and most important movie ? Hollywood ha trouble releasing enough Oscar worthy movie in any given year , so that several of the top 5 contender usually come from Britain . Jerry Bruckheimer = the end of quality cinema . I loved the thoroughly evil performance by Sean Pertwee . I also , a usual , loved Omar Epps .

Gamers : DR is not a fancy made movie , it 's more like amateur video . Horrible magic effect , really fake fireball , terribly made dungeon , castle , village ...... sword , axe , shield , robe , plate ..... okok ... everything . You will need about 10 minute to adjust your expecting on visual , then you will get 105 minute of fun . I 'm from Hongkong and it 's really hard to find RPers , none of my friend play RPG and I always fancy to be one of the character in the world of D & D . Watching Gamers : DR just show me what would it be like to be a gamer . You see rule book , dice , game set , etc etc etc ; You hear term like `` fighter '' , `` wizard '' , `` hit point '' , `` level '' , `` character '' , `` flaming hand '' , `` Chaotic Evil '' . What RPG fancy me is that it let you do anything u want to , not bonded by software RPG . Gamers : DR provide the same element , you wont know what happen next and it probably just make you laugh to dead . The movie go both gamers 's real life a well a in the D & D world . You will hear the gamer cast the dice when the character in game take action , which make you feel you really participle in the game . I do n't want to spoil anything , but in short , Gamers : DR is a must watch movie for RPG lover . For people never play RPG game , I 'm sure you still get many fun from it .

In all honesty , I have n't seen this film for many year , but the few time I have tend to make part of it stick in my memory , a anyone who ha seen it will understand . I first saw it a a child at a YMCA Halloween party in the early Sixties , and it scared the hell out of u kid , in a fun way . I remember feeling genuine anxiety about the unknown thing lurking in the maze . I ca n't risk giving away the ending , except to say that it wa surprising , to say the least . I remember vaguely the entire audience of young boy letting out a big scared holler , followed by laughter when the terrible secret wa revealed . The ending ha been seen by most viewer a one of the greatest unintentionally funny climax to a movie in film history , and yet oddly moving , in a way . You have to see it for yourself , which is not easy these day . I do n't know if it 's available on home video or not , but it would still make a great Halloween feature for both kid and adult .

This is the only thing I will be able to look back on from the year 2006 and say now that rocked . It rocked hard , and yet it also rocked tasty . Mr.MEATLOAF added a nice little touch to this dish of a film before the opening credit even rolled . Now that tell you something , this filmed rocked even before it STARTED ! Now I do n't want to give to much away or be a `` spoiler '' but this movie ROCKED ! If you have heard the new album and thought to yourself `` this seems a bit substandard Tenacious material , it is like I a merely playing badminton with Satan , what give ? '' Then this movie will elevate your appreciation for the music and you will marvel at this steamy satanic masterpiece . For those who would want it better do not know what they want , because better would no longer be the D. This movie is the D period . ! So venture if you dare to the local viewing theater if you to want to have your sock rocked .

You 'd think you 're in for some serious sightseeing when the premise of the movie take place primarily between two character a they travel 3000 mile or so from France to Saudi Arabia , going through most of Europe - Italy , Bulgaria , Croatia , Slovenia , Turkey , before arriving in the Middle East . But this is not a tour , and there are no stopover for soaking in the sight . Reda 's father is in his twilight year , and wish to do the Haj . However , since walking and taking the mule is out of the question , he chooses to travel to Mecca by car . He ca n't drive , and therefore enlists the help of Reda , to his son 's protest , to get him there in their broken down vehicle . But Reda doe n't see the point of having him go along , when his dad could opt for the plane . He resents the idea of having put his personal life on hold for this pilgrimage he could n't understand . And hence , we set off in this arduous journey with father and son , being not the best of pal . The beauty of this movie is to witness the development of the father and son pair , the challenge they face , the weird people they meet , having to duke it out in varied weather condition , and alternating rest stop between motel and sleeping in the car . We see an obvious generation gap in them trying to communicate to each other , the father trying to impose on his son , and the son trying to assert himself a an adult , but circumstance we see , reveal that Reda is quite a fish out of water . Through the many encounter , they actually team up quite well despite their difference . It 's perhaps quite apt to have this film released here last week to coincide with Hari Raya Haji , and having the opportunity to watch our protagonist join the other pilgrim in their Haj . The final scene in Mecca is truly a sight to behold , and you too would feel the claustrophobia and fear a Reda try to hunt down his dad amongst the thousand of people congregating . The sight of Europe were perhaps deliberately not dwelled upon , so a to build up the anticipation of and focus on the final destination . It certainly rang home the thought of telling and showing loved one how much you appreciate them for who they are . Do n't miss this , and yes , book early - I wa pleasantly surprised that this evening 's session wa still a full house .

I watched this movie based on the good review here , and I wo n't make that mistake again . The first couple minute show that a group of people have been brought together by some tragedy , but you do n't see what it is . Flashback 12-hours and we get to see the boring life of each of these people , which in the end are totally meaningless to what is about to happen . When the ending is finally reveled , you realize that you just wasted an hour of your life waiting for a big payoff that doe n't happen and mean nothing to what you have been watching . The only connection these people have is that they have all had a `` bad day '' -- but even that continuity get lost in the boredom . If this wa supposed to be a `` Crash '' clone , it 's a complete failure .

A great Bugs Bunny cartoon from the earlier year ha Bugs a a performer in an window display at a local department store . After he 's done for the day the manager come in to tell him that he 'll be transferring soon . Bugs is happy to oblige into he figure out that the new job is in taxidermy ... and that taxidermy ha to do with stuffing animal . Animals like say , a certain rabbit . This cause a battle of wit between the rascally rabbit and his now former employer . I found this short to be delightful and definitely one of the better one of the early 1940 's . It still remains a funny nearly 60+ year later . This animated short can be seen on Disc 1 of the Looney Tunes Golden Collection Volume 2 . My Grade : A-

I firmly believe that the best Oscar ceremony in recent year wa in 2003 for two reason : 1 ) Host Steve Martin wa at his most wittiest : `` I saw the teamster help Michael Moore into the trunk of his limo `` and `` I 'll better not mention the gay mafia in case I wake up with a poodle 's head in my bed `` 2 ) Surprise winner : No one had Adrien Brody down for best actor ( Genuine applause ) or Roman Polanski for best director ( Genuine jeer and boo ) but they won Last year 's award ceremony wa n't too bad but there wa little in the way of surprise and I wa happy to see RETURN OF THE KING sweep the award even if it wa n't the best in the trilogy ( FELLOWSHIP wa much better ) but what let the BBC coverage down wa Jonathan Ross getting a few of his sycophantic mate round and pretending they were hilarious when they were anything but . So when I heard Sky were doing the coverage for British TV I wa expecting Barry Norman and Mark Kermode to be doing the link , but instead we ended up with Jamie Theakston and Sharon Osbourne ! Oh gawd if British TV are desperate for film critic ( Obviously they are ) I 'm sure both Bob The Moo and Theo Robertson will happily fly over to LA to give their honest opinion on the winner and loser Chris Rock wa n't too bad , but he 's no Steve Martin while the location seemed to resemble a sport hall with seat put in ! Not much of a glitzy arena in my opinion . The main problem I had with the ceremony wa the format with the `` minor `` Oscars handed out to the winner who were sitting in their seat ! There 's no such thing a a `` minor `` Oscar and just because the award is for Best Animated Short or Best Costume Design they 're a well deserved a Best Picture or Best Director . All the winner should be allowed to march up to the podium . What a bunch of arrogant snob the Academy are becoming and I quite agree with the comment that this format is disgraceful and if it wa n't for the surprise this could possibly have been the worst ceremony in history . As for the award themselves Best Supporting Actress - Cate Blanchett . No great surprise for a competitive category Best Supporting Actor - Morgan Freeman . No real complaint since Freeman is one of America 's greatest living character actor Best Actor - Jamie Foxx . Most predictable award of the night . Yawn Best Actress - Hilary Swank . Major surprise since everyone thought Annette Benning wa going to win simply down to academy politics but Swank did deserve it and gave the best speech of the night Best Director - Clint Eastwood . Major surprise since everyone thought Scorsese wa going to get the award simply because he 'd never won one . Actually I 'm glad about this because if he did n't deserve it for TAXI DRIVER , RAGING BULL or GOODFELLAS he did n't deserve it for THE AVIATOR Best Film - MILLION DOLLAR BABY . Again another major surprise since everyone thought the academy would split the award for best director and best picture while I thought the Hollywood friendly plot of THE AVIATOR would have made it a dead cert for Best Picture while MDB 's controversial subject matter would have turned a lot of voter off What these award perhaps illustrate is that this year the voter have decided to ignore Oscar politics and genuinely give out award to people who deserve it something they have n't done in the past , I mean A BEAUTIFUL MIND beating THE FELLOWSHIP OF THE RING for gawd 's sake ! And long may the academy vote with their head instead of their heart

While in a plane , flicking through the large choice of movie , I came across Live ! almost accidentally . oh boy ! what a choice . I remembered vaguely seeing the trailer over a year ago and completely forgot about it expecting no more than another cheesy nonsense movie about a stupid reality show . Now I can easily say this ha been a hell of a ride . I do n't remember last time I have been so excited , terrified . Not sure if it wa the high altitude playing with my sens , but the suspense grow gradually through the movie until reaching a climax where you ca n't turn away from the screen , literally sitting on the edge of your seat and biting the remaining nail you 've got . You will first go through a personal moral assessment of where you stand about the righteousness of the show . You will drift from thinking `` how come the human being can be so vicious '' to `` why not after all ? `` .Ask yourself would you do it . Then learn about the contestant , their motif and start guessing . You will then watch contestant pulling the trigger one by one and get excited even though you know the first candidate is safe . Good acting , good directing , with a movie experience that reminds you those old movie where you knew what would happen in the next scene but still were craving for more . * Spoilers * couple of thing i would have changed : - the casting of the contestant . i have really been moved by the farmer and we should have had a bit more like him . The idea of a rich writer who want to be famous is a bit stupid , it felt like you did n't care about some of the contestant . Although this might have been done on purpose , i think the audience should have been able to associate with the majority of the contestant . - game rule , a big glitch : what happens if the 5th contestant doe n't die when he pull the trigger . do you seriously think the last standing guy will pull the trigger and execute himself ! ! ! they should have given a chance to all contestant to live , ie : if 5th is a blank too , then no one dy . interestingly I have n't been bothered too much by this bad point cause i really had a good time . just wish i had some popcorn with me !

Ah , another movie with motorcycle , hell 's angel posse and Steve A-Lame-o a the not-so-cool car driver . This movie doe not rely on story but lot of drinking , pot smoking , and lot of moronic act . Steve 's rendition of a dying cat during his `` I love what I know '' serenade had me vomiting for hour . Bike chick Linda ( rrrr ) make out with everyone ! Fats did the best acting since he just grunt and make sound . I also dare you to try to make out what Banjo is saying . `` You messin ' wit private stock . '' This is scriptwriting folk . I liked the ending . What better place to have the climax than a lighthouse ! You have to see this to detest it . DIE Jeter , DIE ! ! !
A rating of `` 1 '' doe not begin to express how dull , depressing and relentlessly bad this movie is .

I feel dumber after watching the first 20 min , luckily i walked out and saved the rest of my brain , people should watch better film and take note on why they are rated highly , not because of the budget of the film or the special effect , just simply good acting and getting simple thing right , and MOst importantly -- not being LAME -- , but i guess this wa produced for those Sheeple without taste and not a clue of what is `` A good Movie '' do n't be scared of rating film low , save your under-appreciated high score for `` once in a life time movie '' . The most self-indulgent movie I have every had the misfortune to rent . Unwatchable . Much of the movie is obviously improvised , and not well . It look like Toback took the first take of everything . The movie get good for a couple of minute when Robert Downey Jr. show up , then go to hell again real quickly .

This ha got to be the worst movie I haver ever seen Nielson in . This movie just doe not have what he need to be funny . I think the reason that the Naked Gun and the like movie is that they did not require Nielson to be funny . He just played the role a straight a he could while all of the comedy that went on wa mostly visual . But when you put him in a movie where he ha to be funny , he is n't . The movie had only one good part , and this may be considered a spoiler by some , and that the beginning credit were animated . If the whole movie had been animated , it might have been good . I had no intention of seeing this movie when I saw the ad for it , and the only reason I did see it wa because the ticket were given to me by someone who won them in a radio contest .
