I like Ghost story . Good ghost story of bump in the night , voice that can not be explained . Now I 've see many of them . As special efx have a ever more grip on today film , some time to find a real gem , you got ta turn the clock back to the time when the writer and director really had to use their head to create really good ghost story . Now this one , very rare , pilot episode for the TV series Ghost Story called `` The New House `` wa one of the most scariest film I ever saw . It wa on once in 1972 , ... I wa only 9 , .. but nothing since then even compared to it . With all the remake going on in Hollywood , some one should do this one `` a is `` with no more special efx than the original . This episode wa down right creepy a hell . I 'm lucky to find it finally on DVD today and very rare and hard to find . The only other 2 Ghost Stories to even come close wa the ORIGINAL `` The Haunting `` and George C. Scott in `` The Changling `` . Wish someone would do more ghost story like these .

Okay , I 've watched this movie twice now , I have researched it heavily on the net , I have asked several people on there opinion . I have even gone to the length of reading the original Sheridan Lafanu Classic 'Carmilla ' , a book that this movie is supposed to be based on . I feel that the best way to review this movie is to describe a game to play whilst watching it . As the plot of the movie doe n't seem to make any sense at all , here is the plot of the book . Laura life in a castle in Syberia with her Father , Mr De Lafontaine . They carry on with their life blissfully and peacefully . One day they get a letter from the 'General ' a man who ha made it his mission in life to avenge his daughter death . He make claim of supernatural power being at work , and explains that he will visit them soon . Meanwhile , a chance encounter with a strange woman result in the Lafontaines looking after her Daughter , Carmilla , for several month . Soon Laura start to be overwhelmed by strange dream , and begin to come down with a strange illness . Who is this mysterious Carmilla ? And just what ha she to do with Laura 's condition , and the General ? I have invented this game and would like a many people a possible to play it , and let me know what their result are . I even have a catchy name , and would have a jingle too , but I ca n't be bothered with that . It 's called the `` this movie doe n't make any sense '' game . All you have to do is , whilst watching the movie , try to come up with a complete plot that explains what is happening . I mean complete , all question answered , everything make sense , absolutely complete . It will have to answer such question a ... * Why can vampire walk around in day light ? * Why are they all lesbian ? * Why is a girl called Bob ? and why doe she shoot herself ? * When is the movie a dream and when is it real ? * Why doe killing zombie appear to be an accepted part of life that doe n't make anyone bat an eyelid ? * Why doe Travis Fontaine spot and run down a zombie without slowing down whilst driving his car , yet when faced with a woman with an obvious hostage in the back of her car , accept the excuse that she is a zombie too ? * And why doe he then let a girl , which he later openly reveals that he know is the head vampire , drive with him in his car ? * And then let her drive off , alone with his daughter in a stolen car ? What the hell is the asylum scene all about ? * What the hell is the green goo all about ? * Why doe the head vampire suddenly start dressing like a nurse ? * Why are there never any vampire fighting Zombies ? * What is the significance of the necklace ? what is it made of ? why doe it kill vampire ? and how doe Jenna know that ? In fact sod it , it 's just a much fun trying to come up with a many question about this movie too . I have my plot , and I have to admit it is not quite there , but it is a pretty good effort . In Conclusion 'Vampires v Zombies ' ha no moment in it where there are actually Vampires fighting Zombies . Everyone in the movie seems to know exactly what is going on , yet they seem very reluctant to let the audience in on this . And somehow it is based on a classic 19th century horror novel . How ? Why ? What the hell is going on ?

This would 've been a * great * silent film . The acting really is good , at least in a Look Ma , I 'm Doing Really Big Acting ! sort of way . Everything is HUGE . Every line is PROFOUND ! Every scene is SHATTERED BY HUMAN TRAGEDY ! Mostly , I felt like gagging . Yet , like any train wreck , I could n't tear my eye away . This dialogue might 've worked on the stage , although I doubt it . On the screen , it wa cluttered , haphazard , hackneyed and pretty much every other stereotypical negative adjective you can come up with to describe a really bad dramatic work . If you enjoy your melodrama in huge , heaping dos , you * might * enjoy the movie . Be prepared to wait , however . For all that melodrama , this thing sure plod along at it own pace . This script must 've sounded a lot different when the actor involved were reading it to themselves . It simply doe n't work once they get around to delivering it in front of the camera . IMDB doe u a great disservice , at time , when it us it goofy computer-controlled `` weighted score '' . Curse of the Starving Class deserves le than a 1 . Character-driven fiction is great , but when you develop your character by simply pushing them through hoop with no plausible explanation for their maturation or evolution , it is n't character development ! Your character must have a motivation . Being drunk for a while and waking up in a field is * not * character development . That 's a plot contrivance . Stay away from this movie . Or at the very least , watch it muted . Perhaps you 'll get some amusement from all the arm-waving the character do . Oh , and word to the wise -- to prove that this is truly an artsy film , you see James Woods in all his dangly male `` look-at-me , I'm-the-figurative-and-literal-representation-of-the-naked-vulnerability-of- man '' glory . Do n't say you were n't warned .

This movie start with the main character lying in a coma in a hospital ward , attended by two orderly . The unconscious main character is heard in a voice over , saying that the orderly are gay . The orderly kiss . I watched this in a DVD version and I have the suspicion that this is supposed to be funny  it said comedy '' on the DVD case , after all and it go on like that . Had I seen this in a movie theater I probably would have heard part of the audience roar with laughter , because it is so funny  and because they are supposed to sit in a comedy . While it is fascinating to think about what it is funny and what is n't , this movie unfortunately only delivers argument about what is n't . Brilliant brain can MAKE anything funny , people like Ernst Lubitsch , Billy Wilder or Mel Brooks have proved that fact . But you have to know the mechanics '' , I suppose . Director and co-scriptwriter Dani Levy doe not bother about those mechanic , he think that certain thing simply ARE funny , the fact that two orderly are gay and kiss over a man in a coma , for example . Do not get me wrong , some people can MAKE that funny , Dani Levy ca n't , not for me , anyway . The main problem I have with this movie is that I ca n't see a reason behind the way the main character behave . I could not understand why the two brother , one an orthodox Jew from West Germany one a third class carbon copy of Fast Eddie Felson from former East Germany so strongly disliked each other . They are both rather bland character . Their child are boring apart from the fact that they are sexually attracted to each other ( well , one is a lesbian now but raise the daughter she ha with her cousin ) . But even these incestuous relationship  if anything they are embarrassing - just come through a an excuse because the scriptwriter could not come up with anything better . The acting is not bad , Udo Semel I actually came to like quite a lot although he reminded me more of ex chancellor Helmut Kohl ( a lighter version ) than of a venerable Orthodox Jew . The direction in itself is not really bad either , but maybe Levy should stick to directing movie , leaving the scriptwriting to someone else . Now I heard he did a comedy about Hitler . Oi , Vai !

This story about three woman is a very sensitive study about : Muriël ( Charlotte Van Den Eynde ) the youngest , Laura ( Els Dottermans ) who is about 37 and Martha ( Frieda Pittors ) the oldest who is the mother of Muriël . They live together in the same building . They have different expectation of life . The vital Laura want a child . Muriël come from a village and want to change her life in Brussels . Martha dream about her youth when she wa a young girl . In fact nothing happens in this movie so you wait for something - for instance an accident - which could dramatize this story . As time go on , you discover that the director Dorothée Van Den Berghe only want to develop a psychological portrait of the three woman and nothing more . This movie is disappointing because you expect the woman to learn from their experience which is not the case , so one is left with a feeling of emptiness .

First and foremost , I loved the novel by Ray Bradbury . It 's the kind of horror that get under your skin and stick with you later . It wa one of his best book , with , you know , Fahrenheit 451 and Dandelion Wine . I a just hoping that this movie would be all right . It had lot of chance , with a great cast , like Jason Robards and Jonathn Pryce . And Bradbury even wrote the script himself . And on top of all that , it ha PAM GRIER ! How could it fail ? There may be spoiler within . First of all , it wa dumbed down . Much of the horror from the book wa lost a Bradbury must have been forced to keep the violence to a minimum . All the visuals from the book ... gone . Everything that made you squirm ... gone . And then there 's the acting . Like a lot of movie that Disney threw out in the 80 , the kid in this movie can not act . And , this bugged me a lot , neither of them looked 13 but 9 or 10 . Their strong friendship wa n't addressed . It wa more like they were acquaintaces . You 'd think Jason Robards and Jonathan Pryce could pull this off in their role of Mr. Halloway and Mr . Dark . But here it 's like they just do n't care . All they want to do is somehow pay off some mortgage or something . This is far from being some of their best performance . Pam Grier wa fine a the witch , but the charecter of the Dust Witch herself wa n't well pulled off . She 's a lot le evil and doe n't have the presence a she did in the book . And everything that wa left out of the book . The ballon night chase , the marking of Jim 's house , the real death of Mr . Dark , what happened to Mr. Coogan on the merry-go-round , the fate of the lightening rod salesman , the real death of the witch , and oh so much more . And the special effect were bad , even for the 80 . The merry-go-round of doom for one thing with the superimposed horse going around wa n't really creepy , and that weird green mist that really had nothing to do with anything . I could keep going about how this movie ripped apart the original novel , but it make blood boil . Do n't see this movie but read the book . It 's a classic of Bradbury .

This film is so old I never realized how young looking Ray Milland looked in 1936 , I remember him playing in a great film , `` Lost Weekend '' . Ray play the role of Michael Stuart , who is a very rich banker . There are three girl in this picture who are not very happy about their father and mother separating and they find out their father is going to get married to a young blonde who is a gold digger only looking for a rich sugar daddy . They hire a man to pose a a very rich Count , his name is Count Ariszted , ( Misha Auer ) who is drunk all the time and is penniless and give plenty of comic laugh throughout the picture . Deanna Durbin , ( Penny Craig ) surprised everyone when she wa booked in a police station and told the chief of police that she wa an opera star and then Penny start singing with the most fantastic soprano voice I have every heard , the entire police department and convict started applauding , which wa a very entertaining and enjoyable scene from this film . This is Deanna Durbin 's first film debut and she became an instant success over night and went on to become a great movie star with Universal Studios after leaving MGM .

I had eagerly awaited the first screening of this film ever since it wa given to me on DVD at Christmas . Having reserved a special slot for it last night , I sat down to watch it with my daughter ( aged 17 and a Film Studies student ) , with chocolate of course , in eager anticipation . We love Jane Austin . After just the first two minute we knew we were sunk . The shaky camera shot and angle , general poor cinematography , direction and wooden performance had already left u feeling flat and dissatisfied . Despondent , we viewed on . Anne , played by Sally Hawkins , looked oddly and with no particular purpose , directly at the camera on several occasion , breaking our hard-won 'fantasy of the moment ' and engaging u directly in an almost ' I 'll find you ' stalking fashion . Poor Rupert Penry-Jones , who played Captain Wentworth , did his best with the script and direction , bless him . I hope they paid him well , however , a he wa practically drowned on one occasion by a huge wave which predictably breached the seawall , drenching him and his co-actor . They were nearly swept out to sea . Health and Safety would have had a field day ! Poor Rupert wa left spitting out sea water in order to deliver his line . Presumably there wa not enough money left in the kitty for a re-shoot of this scene . Anyone with any sense would have not attempted it on such a day in the first place . Other than Mr. Penry-Jones , Alice Krige gave the only convincing performance a Lady Russell but her effort were soon counterbalanced by those of Anthony Head 's unconvincing portrayal of annoying Sir Walter Elliott . Towards the long-awaited end of the film , Captain Wentworth appeared to oddly grace Anne with a visit every two second having taken great pain to avoid her for the majority of the movie . It wa a if he had developed a memory impediment which caused him to forget his very reason for being . In contrast , Anne ran , hyper-ventilating , from pillar to post in search of the good Captain who , in the meantime , had managed to call upon almost the entirety of Bath we are told , in the course of only three or four minute , without even having worked up a sweat . We experienced none of Anne 's charm crossing the screen . Indeed , we were left wondering what charismatic Captain Wentworth had ever seen in plain , spineless , opinion-less Anne and why someone , anyone , did not tell mean , winging Sir Walter to just shut the heck up . The crucial kiss , normally our favourite girlie moment , wa painfully drawn out . As they moved in closer , Anne kept opening and closing her mouth which had the effect on screen of making her look a if she were chewing gum before lip finally met . Eww ! The most enjoyable thing about last night wa the chocolate and the half hour exchange of view between mother and daughter on just how bad the film had been . What a pity to ruin such an enchanting and engaging story , filmed in some of England 's finest scenery . Sorry Jane .

If you like Sci-Fi , Monsters , and Ancient Legends , then you will love this movie ! ! The Special Effects are by far the best I have seen since Juarassic Park hit the big screen year ago . While the acting may have been a little le than desirable , the story line and effect adequately compensated for it . I wish now I had seen this at the movie on a theater screen instead of our 42 inch big screen TV . If you like non-stop action , awesome visuals , and taste for myth and lore .... you have to see this movie ! !

A rather silly little film you just may love . Although rather corny and cliché at time , it nonetheless work and make for good clean fun . Five team are engaged on a scavenger hunt and battle each other and their wit to win the all night contest - just for the sheer joy `` knowing yours is the best team . '' Notable for several screen debut including David Naughton 's first film role after his Dr. Pepper `` Be a Pepper '' commercial and before his major 1981 hit `` American Werewolf in London '' . Also feature Paul Ruebens in what I believe is his first Pee Wee Herman-esquire roll a year before he became known for it . And last but not least , Mr . Spin City and Alex Keaton himself , Michael J . Fox get his first film role here . Fans will remember Stephen Furst a Flounder in Animal House . Outside of that , no name , but all funny character . Doubt it ha ever made it to DVD , but there are still probably some VHS copy floating around and you might even catch on a late , late show sometime . If you do , is worth your watch . You may hate it , but it may also become a quirky little movie you come to love .

This is an OK adaptation of the breath taking book of Dan Brown . I ca n't say it is novel or very good but they made a movie that you can enjoy . Given the excellent story , the result could have been better though . The movie is pretty long but at the end I wa feeling like some thing were missing . Sound effect and sound track were very good . Acting wa well done but the character development phase wa very weak . For people who did n't read the book , thing may look happening too quickly . From my point of view , instead of trying to put a much a stuff from the book , they could have tried to do the important scene more proper . What make the book very good wa all the puzzle like story combined with the excellent portrait of Vatican . You see neither of it in the movie . Too much rush and using the time not in a good way , these are main problem of the movie . So , it is worth watching but could have been done better .

I never fell asleep during a movie . Never . This movie did the impossible . While many people claim the superiority of Japanese horror film over their American counterpart , this movie wa a lesson in over abundance . As in , the movie wa 30 minute too long . It would have helped if the movie had a little more movement in the plot and the camera work , but instead , all we got were awkward silence and a lot of slow movement . The acting wa absolutely terrible , bordering on bad student film level while everyone struggled to ad-lib something called a script . Did these people even get any direction ? Were they coaxed to be boring and dull ? Either therory would n't surprise me . What wa even worse wa the rather unscary make-up involved with the creature from the other side . Either way , they all stunk . Do n't watch this film . That 's all I can say ( unless you 're an insomniac ) .

What can I say ? Not a bad a many here have made it out to be . The only reason I even watched this film that I had previously never heard of before , wa strictly for IAN McSHANE . I wa not disappointed in the least . IAN McSHANE wa absolutely brilliant and brings an amazing subtlety to his role . He 's always great to watch and for my money ... an extremely underused actor . As for the rest of the film .... Every other actor in the movie delivered strong , solid performance . These people certainly were n't being paid huge amount of cash for their participation ( a this wa a fairly low budget film ) but this did not mean that any of them `` mailed '' their appearance in . Everyone wa convincing and compelling with the part given to them . I wa even pleasantly surprised at ADRIAN PAUL 's performance though I must admit I have only ever seen him in the HIGHLANDER Television series before this movie . The plot wa well paced and the storyline intriguing and much like real life , not everything end up tied in a nice neat little package for you at the end of the film . Anybody who expected a clear-cut , by-the-numbers , connect the dot `` conclusion '' or `` answer '' at the end of the movie ... CLEARLY wa n't watching the film closely enough ! This film is not going to tell you what the `` meaning of life '' is ! The idea is that after seeing the film , you might go and discus the unanswered question with your friend over a coffee . I certainly did . No car chase ... No explosion ... No bar room brawl .... ( sound pretty dull , huh ? ) But the reality is that I wa completely absorbed by the film and it 's just a well written little piece with an interesting hook and solid character performance by all party involved . * * * * * * WARNING ... * * * * * * If you 're the kind of person who dislike movie that dangle an enormous `` question '' a the central engine of the story and then end the movie without answering that particular question directly ... YOU MIGHT NOT ENJOY THIS FILM .

Originally harped a a sequel to `` The Slumber Party Massacre '' series , this film fall flat on it 's face with a new title . First off , if you are going to include the word `` massacre '' in your film 's title , you better deliver . This one certainly doe not . There is no gore , no on screen murder and no chainsaw , a the box art would lead you to believe . Instead , we get a paper thin , overdone plot about a group of cheerleader who get stranded in an abandoned cabin on the way to a football game , only to be offed one by one . Again , this film could have been OK if the gore quotient wa upped a bit . Why director , especially those doing direct-to-video flick , are afraid to show ANY gore is beyond me . Now , I am not a huge fan of excessive gore , but come on ... why else would anyone rent a movie called `` Cheerleader Massacre ? ? '' Besides that problem , the film suffers from a shot-on-a-home-video-camera cheapness . It look cheap , sound cheap , and the actor are n't all that good . It try to throw u off track to who the killer may be , but even that fails . The ending end up being a ridiculous mess . Folks , if you run across this film , walk away and go find the original `` Slumber Party Massacre . '' 2 out of 10 .

A killer , cannibal rapist is killed by a crazed cop on the scene of his latest murder . At his grave a cult have gathered with plan to resurrect him by peeing onto the grave . This of course work and he awakes ripping the guy penis off and he is back into his old killing way with an all new zombie look . The two cop one of who is going a little crazy about the scum of the city and ha a drug problem , are back on the case . Two of the original cult member also try to stop the killer by resurrecting some other kind of dead thing . Thinking they have filed they leave but out from the grave come a plastic baby doll that wa used in the original resurrection . Sounds a bit confusing really but no it just rubbish . The acting is terrible and one of the cop is the same guy that play Dr Vincent van Gore in the face of gore series and he is just a terrible a the annoying cop in this film . The other cop just about struggle to get his terrible line out . Now I 'm all for low budget cinema but this film is just terrible . If it wa n't for the very easy on the eye lady and their nakedness I would probably have fallen asleep . There is a bit of gore but it 's never more than some animal gut placed on the stomach of the victim . The zombie makeup on the other hand look great and his foot long penis that he us to rape his victim with is kind of funny at time . There is also a half decent scene where the killer fall in love with a sex doll . The doll with the chipmunk voice is the stupidest thing I have ever seen in a film . It is just a plastic toy on a fishing line . The ending is extremely bad . You would expect the killer to put up much more of a fight than he doe . God know how they made enough money to make a sequel . 4/10

Days of Heaven is one of the most painfully boring and pointless film I have ever seen . In no way , shape , or form would I recommend it to anyone ... unless you 're trying to put your kid to sleep or , God forbid , give someone an aneurysm . If I could go back in time and do one thing , I would set fire to the reel before they were sent to theater . Why ? Days of Heaven 's plot is simple , but extremely vague . Long sequence devoid of dialogue compose much of the film . The character are too shallow and ridiculously stupid to relate with . The climax of the story doe not touch you : by this time your brain ha worked so hard to figure out the plot and the array of hidden metaphor that your ability to think is gone . The only thing working are your eye , and unfortunately , your ear , who must listen to the sound of Linda , the little girl in the story , who talk like a man . I am now dumber for seeing this movie . Do n't let it happen to you .

In 1929 , director Walt Disney and animator Ub Iwerks changed the face of animation with the release of the very first installment of their `` Silly Symphonies '' series , `` The Skeleton Dance '' . Iwerks and Disney had been collaborating together since the early 20 , in Disney 's `` Laugh-O-Gram '' cartoon series ; however , their friendship suffered a tremendous blow when Iwerks accepted an offer by a competitor to leave Disney and start his own animation studio . That wa the birth of Celebrity Productions , where Iwerks continued developing his style and technique ( and where he created the character of Flip the Frog ) . While his work kept the same high quality , it wa n't really popular and by 1936 the studio wa closed . Later that year , Iwerks wa hired by Columbia Pictures , and Iwerks decided to return to his old skeleton for another dance , this time in color . 1937 's `` Skeleton Frolics '' is essentially , a remake of the 1929 classic `` The Skeleton Dance '' , the movie that borough him fame and fortune . Like that short film , it is set on an abandoned graveyard , where at midnight the creature of the night come alive and begin to play . The dead rise from their coffin , ready for the show that 's about to begin , a a group of skeleton ha formed an orchestra , and begin to play a happy tune . Now , it 's not easy to be a musician made of just bone , a some of the orchestra member have problem with their body part , however , the band manages to put a good show and another group of skeleton begin to dance . A lovely couple of them face the same problem that troubled the orchestra : it 's hard to dance with loose body part . Everything end at dawn , and just when the sun is about to rise again , the skeleton run towards their graf . Directed and animated by Ub Iwerks himself , `` Skeleton Frolics '' follows faithfully the pattern set by `` The Skeleton Dance '' year before , although with a crucial difference : Iwerks did the whole film in Technicolor . The bright tonality allowed Iwerks to create a more visually appealing film , and also to use the many new technique he had been practicing since leaving Disney , creating even better effect of depth and dynamism than those he conceived before . It is certainly a more experimental film than `` The Skeleton Dance '' , although sadly , this doe n't mean it 's necessarily a better film . For starter , the film is practically identical to the one he did with Disney , with the only difference being the music ( more on that later ) and the color effect . It look beautiful , no doubt about it , but it definitely feel kind of unoriginal after all . However , it is not the unoriginality of the concept what truly hurt the film ( after all , Iwerks executes it in a wonderful way ) , but the fact that the musical melody created by Joe DeNat for the film is pretty uninteresting and lack the charming elegance and whimsical fun of the one done by Carl W. Stalling for `` The Skeleton Dance '' . In other word , while DeNat 's tune is effective and appropriate for the theme , it 's easy to forget about it rapidly while Stalling 's song ha a unique personality that make it unforgettable . Being a musical film , this is of high importance , and so the mediocrity of the music brings down Iwerk 's flawless work of animation . Personally , I think that with a better musical accompaniment , `` Skeleton Frolics '' would be remembered a fondly a `` The Skeleton Dance despite not being a groundbreaking , a it 's still a fun film to watch . It 's kind of sad that most of the work Iwerks did after leaving Disney is now forgotten due to his poor success , however , it must be said that if Iwerks lacked the popularity of Disney or Fleischer ( Disney 's main rival ) , he did not lack the quality of those company ' film . It wa probably just a case of bad luck what made the man who gave life to Disney 's mouse for the first time to face failure out of Disney . Despite it shortcoming , `` Skeleton Frolics '' is a very funny and visually breathtaking film , that while not exactly the most original and fresh film ( one just ca n't help but thinking of `` The Skeleton Dance '' while watching it ) , it definitely reminds u that Iwerk 's skeleton are still here to haunt u , and inspire u . 8/10

Yes , indeed , it could have been a good movie . A love biangle , ( sorry for the poetical license , but is not a triangle ! ) an interesting story , unfortunately badly told . The image is sometimes weird , sometimes OK , the picture look crowded and narrow-sighted . The sound need more attention ( it usually doe in Romanian movie ) , the light and color filter are sometimes badly chosen . The soundtrack is short and is not helping the action . About the acting ... sorry but the best actress is the landlady . The others are acting immaturely and can not convince the viewer . The acting is poetical when it should be realistic , and realistic when it should be poetical . It 's a picture for adult , told by the child . Bother only if extremely curious .

You wear only the best Italian suit from Armani , hand stitched and fitted to your exact measurement . Your automobile is the finest that German engineering ha to offer , and is equipped with a many gadget a horse under the hood . You 're a member of the finest polo club , frequently dine at restaurant such a Spago , and are always accompanied by at least two of the most beautiful woman in the world . Your pocket watch double a a nuclear explosive , while your trusty pen can also be used a a semi-automatic .22 caliber gun . You snow ski in the Alps , go deep sea diving in the Caribbean , sky dive over the Andes , and all the while your hair is never , ever , out of place . You are Bond , James Bond , the world 's most renown spy , favorite son of the good Queen , bad boy of the British SS , and perhaps the most desired man in the world . The character of James Bond wa created by Ian Fleming , and is the movie industry 's longest lasting icon , being the subject of over fifteen film spanning over four decade . The latest man to play the role is Pierce Brosnan , who took over the role of James Bond from Timothy Dalton in 1996 , and made his 007 debut in Goldeneye . This is the setting for the first major title developed by a third party on the Nintendo 64 . Goldeneye , developed by Rare for Nintendo , ha been on the market for some time . Its continued dominance in the sale chart is just one testament to how good this game is , and no review library would be complete without it . Let 's face it -- most of the time movie-licensed game are flop . Although the two seem like a good mix , the result , for the most part , have been horrendous . Games like Cliffhanger , True Lies , Lethal Weapon , and not to mention all the Star Trek flop , are ammunition enough against this mix . And for the record I am not a fan of movie licensed game , especially if I 've seen the movie . At least that 's how I used to think . In the case of Goldeneye , I had more reservation than normal . While not a bad movie , Goldeneye the film did n't have that much appeal to it , and I do n't rank it in the top ten amongst Bond movie . As a game , however , let 's just say it 's a completely different story . The game is a first-person shooter , and in order to be successful , you 'll need at least a much brain a brawn . For those who have seen the movie , which I imagine is most of you reading this , the story is very consistent and follows the path of the movie with little variation . A plot to control the world 's most dangerous satellite , Goldeneye , ha begun in the USSR , and in the process a beautiful woman ha been captured . Your mission will be many , the danger extreme . You will have to rely on your wit and experience to get you through the most grueling mission the world ha ever known . M will brief you a soon a you 're ready . Good day , James .

This is an excellent film about the character in a adult swimming class , their problem , relationship and interaction with each other . It should have managed a wider distribution a it 's much better than similar film from major studio out at the same time . The swimming instructor is an almost-Olympian , reduced to teaching adult basic lesson , and often the target of horndogging from his female student . He attempt , more or le , to fend them off , with varying result . The student character are mainstream U.S.A ; teacher , policeman , college student and retired people , all of whom have n't learned to swim for some reason . The movie cover their relationship , including friend , relative and romantic conquest a they go through the class . Several subplots provide amusing fodder , including a teacher going through a divorce , some high school student making a documentary , and a girl who is only in the class to meet guy . This is a good date movie , or just one to watch when you 're in the mood for a romantic drama with overtone of reality .

This mostly routine fact-based TV drama get a boost from the fine performance by Cole . This is the story of a highly trained military man , unhappy with his wife and child , fake his demise and run off with the other woman . To support her in the manner in which she is accustomed he robs bank . Predictable , but not a bad watch .

I watched Six of a Kind for W.C. Fields - he 's only in it for around 10 minute and ha one long scene , the infamous pool sequence he made famous in vaudeville , and several other great moment . The reamaining 55 minute are also delightful , thankfully , mostly due to the hilarious Charlie Ruggles a the bumbling banker J. Pinkham Whinney . He is everyone 's foil . He stutter and stumble about to our pleasure . Also , his comedy partner , Mary Boland play his wife , Flora . Joining in the proceeding are George Burns and Gracie Allen . Boland is particularly funny near the beginning and near the end , but Gracie and Ruggles use up most of the picture . Gracie 's funny , quite , but she can also get tiring . And poor George Burns ha absolutely nothing to do except repeat Gracie all the time . I do n't remember laughing at him once ( although he ha one great scene with Ruggles , where Ruggles try desperately to get George to take Gracie and leave him and his wife alone for a while , and one with Fields , where he asks Fields to sell him a sweater ; that bit is exclusively Fields ' , though ) . The situation is constantly funny : the Whinneys are going to drive to California , but to help them with expense , George and Gracie are recruited . 8/10 .

EDMUND LOWE ( who reminds me somewhat of Warren William ) , head the nice cast of an interesting little mystery that move at a brisk pace and run just a little over an hour . Douglas Walton play the unlucky jockey who appears to be intent on his own demise ( hypnotism , anyone ? ) , and the suspect include a good number of the supporting cast -- everyone from Virginia Bruce , Kent Smith , Frieda Inescourt , Gene Lockhart , Jessie Ralph , Benita Hume , Rosalind Ivan and H.B . Warner . As an added bonus , there 's Nat Pendleton a a dimwit detective -- and furthermore , get a load of that art deco set decoration for the fancy interior of a wealthy home . Must have been a set that wa used in many a subsequent film . On the plus side , the mystery is not so complicated that anyone can follow the plot with reasonable assurance of not being too baffled . It 's all suddenly clear to detective Philo Vance -- and then he ha a final confrontation with the murderer that give the film a nifty five minute of unmitigated suspense . Nicely done and pass the time in an entertaining manner .

This movie is lame and not funny at all . The plot doe n't even make sense . Some scientist who work on the fringe of science open a doorway to another dimension ( maybe hell ? ? ? ) and his daughter get sucked through it or something , then one day for no apparent reason she come back and now she ha big breast and wear a skimpy outfit ( I guess the demon in the other dimension made it for her ? ) The main character is a guy who want to marry his girlfriend but she is gay so obviously she 's more interested in her new girlfriend , and they stumble upon this witch spell book ( they want to be witch or something ? ? ? ) and the evil spell end up getting read again which is how the evil demon come to earth which only the bikini top girl and the spurned guy in love can stop apparently . There is topless scene for no reason and a guy in it who my boyfriend say is a well known wrestler but his part is completely unnecessary , obviously they made something up just to put him in it because then maybe wrestling fan will actually watch this pointless movie . I 'm sure the topless girl doe n't hurt there either . The extra feature on the DVD were even more confusing than the rest of the movie , I thought it might help explain what wa going on but it actually just made thing more confusing . Basically this is a go-camping-to-make-out-then-fight-a-monster movie but there are a bunch of thing ( like the other dimension and book seller ) than make it confusing . Although I wa hoping that I 'd like it a little more , this wa still certainly an impressive film . There were great performance by all the lead , and the story , while not what I 'd call chilling , wa still effective and it kept me interested . For me , the best part of this film wa the look of the picture , for it always looked cold and damp and it just really seemed to suit the film well . I also thought that the low budget suited this movie , for I do n't think that a crisp picture and clear sound would have worked a well in a film this grim . All thing considered , it fell a little short of my expectation , but I 'm still very glad that I finally sat down to watch this movie .

Imagine this : a high school . Except it 's boarding school , and the kid do n't have parent around . Oh , and it 's in Malibu . And the kid are all thin , white , and gorgeous , with the exceptional token minority or fat kid to play the `` weird '' outcast . And there are n't any reasonable rule , like how they have co-habitation , nuclear weapon in their dorm , coffee stand , a sushi bar , and a complimentary laptop per student . Here 's the story : A girl , Zoey Brooks , attends PCA , a formerly all-boys school . Absolutely perfect in every possible way , she is smart , pretty , thin , athletic , creative , and everything a perfectionist want to be . Almost all the boy in school want her , and every girl want to be her friend . She 's the one everyone come to for advice , the one who save the day with a simplistic plan , and is just wonderful . Too bad none of this make her likable . Are we supposed to believe that if we do n't even come close to Zoey 's perfection , we 're bad people ? In the show , nothing 's her fault , and if anyone contradicts her , they 're portrayed a the bad guy ( Logan ) . He may be a jerk , but at least he ha some kind of brain that think for himself instead of simply agreeing with the princess every time . Her loyal group of blind follower are : Chase , the average dumb as that ha a secret crush on her , Michael , the token black guy ( and the only decent actor on the set ) , Lola , a wannabe actress and anorexic , snobby airhead , Quinn , the smart but clueless girl when it come to teen stuff , and Logan , the rich jerk who ha a soft side . Yeah , this show basically spews out stereotype . What tick me off , though , is that they all try to pretend they 're normal kid . They complain that Logan get too much money while they have to work themselves , even though they already go to a too-good-to-be-true boarding school and have relatively nice thing that many teenager ca n't afford . They drink coffee and eat sushi on a regular basis , hardly have homework , and suntan almost every day . Wow , they have it hard ! Any other problem ? I 'm too good-looking , rich , and stress-free ! I guess Zoey 101 ( what 's the 101 for , anyway ? ) is Nick 's attempt at trying to portray teen realistically . Except they caught a glimpse of reality , did n't like it , and decided to give the kid life like the ass on The Hills . But hey , at least the set 's pretty .

I had been amazed by director Antal 's Kontroll back in 2003 . His first American project , Vacancy , wa le impressive but a decent start . Armored is his second feature and while the visual signature is recognizable , the film never rise above the level of a B movie . It 's a shame because the main premise ha all the ingredient for twist and turn and the ensemble cast featuring many quality actor should be able to deliver . Antal could have made a great heist film but instead go for an action flick . Then again he could have shot a cool action flick but it doe n't really deliver in that department either . What you are left with is one implausible situation after another , a group of poorly sketched character bicker and fight over a sum of money . If you look past the sharp cinematography , cast and the tight music score , you 're left with what could have been a below average direct-to-video featuring Van Damme or Seagal . This wa probably the most disappointing movie for me in quite some time .

First of all , the reason I 'm giving this film 2 star instead of 1 is because at least Peter Falk gave his usual fantastic performance a Lieutenant Columbo . He alone can get 10 star for trying to save this otherwise utterly worthless attempt at making a movie . I wa initially all fired up at reading one poster 's comment that Andrew Stevens in this movie gave `` the performance of his career . '' To me , it wa the abysmal performance by Stevens that absolutely ruined this movie , and so I wa all prepared to hurl all sort of insult at the person who made the aforementioned comment . Then I thought to myself , what else ha Stevens done ? So I checked and , you know , that person wa absolutely right . In the 17 year since this Columbo movie wa made , apparently every one of the 33 project that Stevens ha been in since then ha been utter crap , so it is doubtful that anybody ha even seen the rest of his career . If you like Columbo , see every other of the 69 title before watching this one . Do yourself a favor and save the worst for last .

Michael Callan play a smarmy photographer who seems , nonetheless , to be regarded a a perfect `` catch '' by any woman that run across him ; could this have anything to do with the fact that he also co-produced the film ? He 's a `` hero '' whom it 's very difficult to empathize with , so the movie is in trouble right from the start . However , it 's trouble do n't end there . It ha the production value of a TV-movie ( check out that head made of clay or something , near the end ) , and the ending cheat in a way that I ca n't reveal , in case anyone want to see the movie ( highly unlikely ) . Let 's just say that the killer know more than we were let to know he know . ( * 1/2 )

I wa drawn to `` Friends '' by the soundtrack scored by a very young and yet to be famous Elton John whom I had see in a club in nearby Houston . I had no idea of the emotion and impact the movie would make . Recently I wa brought back to the movie by a song that Heart did called `` Seasons '' , then I found the Elton John song `` Friends '' thinking it wa the same song ... it 's been 35 year of so . Anyway , the flood of the emotion of `` Friends '' came back like seeing an old photograph of your first real love . I have more recall of the way the movie hit me than I do of the actual detail of the production , plot , etc . so forgive me for a rather poor review . I remember taking a couple of special friend on a date to see the movie and them being a moved and teary-eyed at the end a I wa . I 'm both anxious and nervous to find a copy and see it now . So many movie which seemed so important to me back then ( i.e . `` The Graduate '' `` Easy Rider '' ) now just seem silly and I do n't want this to fall into the same category . But , I will find it and if it turn out silly , then at least I 'll be able to turn my wife onto a great ... no .. outstanding soundtrack . When we met , we went through this with `` Last Tango in Paris '' . The youngster I work with ( I 'm 56 ) respect my opinion but it 's hard to explain the feeling of the sixty and the movie and song that reflect such strong feeling but seem a little `` aged '' now . I just ca n't figure out if the the aging process is the movie ... or me . `` Friends '' is a very special , sensitive and wonderful movie . It will bring back a lot of special feeling I 'm sure . By all mean , rent or buy a copy ... Indies were not near the strong genre then that they are today .

During the Clete Roberts preface , I wa beginning to think this wa an Ed Wood production , however , what roll out here is some pretty hard hitting stuff . The story of crime and corruption in a Southern town is told using a cast culled from Hollywood 's Poverty Row , and this make the movie all the more realistic . There are no punch pulled here , and at time the film is reminiscent of `` The Well '' ( 1951 ) . The Black and White texture give a newsreel-like quality . For certain , younger viewer will be reminded of `` The Blair Witch Project '' but this one IS based on REAL event !

I decided to watch this one because it 's been nominated for Oscar this year . I guess a many folk here I really wanted to like this movie , but ended up bored and disappointed . First scene wa OK but the whole rest of the movie in `` shaky hand '' camera mode is really annoying . i guess the main reason for making such a movie and nominating it for Oscar is this : American `` military machine '' ( people , who make money on war ) urgently need an excuse or justification of war in Iraq by bungling up something ( sort of ) patriotic . why these `` heroic '' effort of director and the main character to _inspire_ the audience with an idea of `` loving-war-like-a-drug '' ? .. Oh , please , come on ! what a bore ! watch this to get an idea of how low the movie academy can fall ...

Mom should really be given a different title to distinguish it from all the other movie out there called Mom or with the word Mom in the title . This is a vastly superior zombie movie to so much of the rubbish that get churned out time after time and all end up much the same a every other zombie movie out there . It is so different and refreshing it almost defies categorisation . The kind old lady who take in a creepy lodger , who just happens to be a flesh eater , who then infects the old lady who also turn into a flesh eating zombie , or ghoul , quite which exactly is not defined . There is pathos in the story a her son realises what she ha become and while at first horrified , attempt to help her by supplying 'food ' . ( I shall say no more about that , for fear of inserting a spoiler ! ) It is one of those 'quiet ' movie a opposed to gun blasting , explosion raging , car chase , etc boring etc that make so many movie all the same rubbish , but still with enough gory moment to satisfy horror fan , whilst also inserting sadness into the story , along with nice touch of humour a opposed to downright silliness of some so-called 'horror ' movie . There is a particularly nice atmospheric shot at the beginning of the film , where the old lady is sitting alone in her room with only her Christmas tree for company and look so 'innocent ' , but , what she becomes ! ! Oh my ! A gem of a movie and even if not your thing , should at least be viewed if only once by any true horror fan .

Empire of Passion start out deceptively - that is , if you 're immediately expecting it to be a horror movie . It 's like a riff on James M. Cain 's The Postman Always Rings Twice , at first : Seki ( Kazuko Yoshiyuki ) is a mother of two and a dutiful , hard-working wife to rickshaw driver Gisaburo ( Takahiro Tamura ) . But when he 's not around , and she 's at home with the baby , the feisty and aimless young man Toyoji ( Tatsuya Fuji ) come around to bring some goody for Seki ... and a little extra . They 're soon sleeping together , but after he doe something to her ( let 's just say a `` shave '' ) , he know that he 'll find out , and immediately proposes that they kill Gisaburo . They drink him up , strangle him , and then toss him down a well . Naturally , this will come back to haunt them - but that it 's literally , at least to them ( at first super-terrified Seki and then only later on skeptical Toyoji ) , change gear into the 'Kaidan ' , a Japanese ghost story . This is a film where the horror come not simply out of `` oh , ghost , ah '' , but out of the total dread that build for the character . In a way there 's the mechanic of a film-noir at work throughout , if only loosely translated by way of a 19th century Japanese village a opposed to an American city or small town ( i.e . the snooping cop , the `` evidence '' found possibly by another , word getting around , suspicion aroused , etc ) . It 's compelling because Seiko actually wa against the plan from the start , manipulated by the lustful but ill-prepared Toyoji , and her reaction to Gisaburo 's re-appearances are staggering to her . Take the one that come closest to poetry : Gisaburo 's ghost , pale-blue face and mostly silent , chilling stare , motion for Seiko to get on the rickshaw . She doe , reluctantly , and he push her around on a road she doe n't know , in the wee hour before dawn , surrounded by smoke . Most Japanese ghost story wish to heaven they could get this harrowingly atmospheric . While it start to veer into hysteric towards the end , there 's so much here that director Oshima get right in making this a distinctive work . After hitting it huge in the international cinema world with In the Realm of the Senses ( which , ironically , got banned in his own country ) , he made something that , he claimed , wa even * more * daring that 'Senses ' . Maybe he wa right ; Empire of Passion ha le graphic sexual content by far than it predecessor ( also starring Tatsuya Fuji , a magnificently physical actor with an immense lot of range ) , but it daring lie in crafting a world of dread . You can believe in ghost in this story , but you also have to believe how far down to their own personal hell these two would-be lovebird will go . The snooping detective or the gossiping townspeople are the least of their worry : the fate of their very soul is at stake . And Oshima take what in other hand could be merely juicy pulp ( sadly , it would n't surprise me if an American remake wa already in the work ) and craft shot after gorgeous shot , with repetition working it way into the mis-en-scene ( i.e . the shot of Seiko and Toyoji walking on that road , the camera at a dutch angle , the world tilted and surrounding them in a grim blue hue ) a well a some affecting movement that will stay with me long after I finish typing this ( i.e . Toyoji throwing the leaf by one hand into the well in slow motion , or how Seiko 's nude body is revealed after she becomes blind ) . It 's daring lie in connecting on a level of the spirit- not to be confused with the spiritual , though there may be something with that a well- about life and death 's connection to one another , inextricably . It 's a classic waiting to be discovered .

Oh , my goodness . I would have never thought it wa possible for me to see a thriller worse than Domestic Disturbance this soon , but here it is . Armed with rotten plot , terrible editing , stilted acting , and headache-inducing 'style ' ( sorry , I have no other word for it ) , Sanctimony is the kind of movie that almost force you to re-evaluate an entire genre ; that is , this film is so bad that even the thriller I condemned a complete failure now seem a little better . Now , not only Sanctimony is a terrible film in itself , it also succeeds in the difficult task of ripping off better movie and do a pathetic job with it . Right from the main title -- nothing but a blatant attempt to reproduce the one from Se7en -- I wa under the impression that something did n't smell quite right . As soon a the movie started with a series of corny , wanna-be hip quick-cuts full of gory image and bombastic color , I knew where that smell wa coming from . It turn out that two policeman , or rather policeman Jim Renart ( Michael Paré ) and policewoman Dorothy Smith ( Jennifer Rubin ) , are investigating on a murder spree in Vancouver . A serial killer , known a `` Monkey Killer '' ( what a menacing , chilling nickname , uh ? ) for his working method , ha killed quite a lot of people . You see , this nut apparently work following the proverb `` see no evil , hear no evil , speak no evil '' and cut eye , ear , and tongue out of his victim . So far , six eye , six ear , and three tongue . In very ingenious fashion , Renart and Smith figure out that the Monkey Killer is probably going to kill other three people ... well , because he probably want to complete the number 666 . So suddenly the film focus on Tom Gerrick ( Casper Van Dien ) , a young , successful , good-looking businessman , with a dreadful temper . And that 's where the rip-off of American Psycho kick in . So we follow the life of the two police officer and the young psychopath , none of which is interesting in the least , until they finally meet . Along the way to that , a disco where Renart barely miss Gerrick unintentionally offer u one of the funniest scene in recent memory : Renart go in the back of the disco club , because ... well , just because the script tell u it 's a suspect place ; then , with one single punch in the stomach , Renard get rid of a big guard who block the path , and the guard is never heard of again ? Does this scene strike anyone else a completely unrealistic ? Anyway , after another murder , Gerrick turn in a a witness , but Smith and especially Renart immediately suspect he might be the killer . In typical Basic Instinct fashion , Smith get some date with the young businessman , under the assumption that she might discover his true identity . I wo n't spoil the ending but it is , quite simply , an embarrassment ; there are contradiction , some plot hole , issue that never get resolved , and especially there is one last scene where a brutal mass murder , supposed to be shocking and sad , come off a such laughably overdone and nonsensical that I frankly ca n't imagine how anyone could not laugh at it . At 87 minute , Sanctimony is really pushing it . You never care about one single character , because they are all so flat ( not to mention boring ) that you know exactly who is who the first time you meet them . You are never pulled into the story , because the scene are connected through weak plot device when not downright unnecessary and out of place . The acting range from average ( Van Dien ) to downright atrocious ( Rubin , and most of the supporting cast ) ; the music is abysmal generic techno , and the photography is one of the worst I have ever seen . Of course , like every fiasco of the genre , we are provided with a little bit of gratuitous nudity . 3/10

The Man With a Golden Arm wa one of a trio of great film around that same time that dealt with drug addiction . The other two were Monkey On My Back and A Hatful of Rain . But I think of the three this one is the best . Maybe if Otto Preminger had shot the thing in the real Chicago instead of those obvious studio set the film might have been better yet . Who know , maybe Preminger could n't get enough money to pay for the location . It 's the only flaw I find in the film . Frank Sinatra is a heroin addicted card dealer who wa busted for covering for his bos Robert Strauss when the game wa raided . He took the cure while in jail and want a new life a a jazz drummer . But a whole lot of people are conspiring against him . First Bob Strauss who want him back dealing , especially because a couple of heavyweight gambler are in town . He us a few underhanded method to get Sinatra 's service back . Secondly Darren McGavin is the local dope dealer who want Sinatra good and hooked a a customer again . And finally Eleanor Parker his clinging wife who 's working a con game to beat all , just to keep him around . Frank Sinatra got a nomination for Best Actor for this film , but lost to Ernest Borgnine in Marty . Sinatra might have won for this one if he had n't won for From Here to Eternity in the Supporting Actor category a few year back and that Marty wa such an acclaimed film in that year . His scene going through withdrawal locked up in Kim Novak 's apartment will leave you shaken . Eleanor Parker doe not get enough credit for her role . She 's really something a the crazy scheming wife who want Sinatra tied to her no matter what the cost . If she had not been nominated that same year for Interrupted Melody , she might have been nominated for this . 1955 marked the high point of her career . Darren McGavin got his first real notice a the very serpentine drug peddler . His performance is guaranteed to make your flesh crawl . Elmer Bernstein contributed a great jazz score to accentuate the general dinginess of the bleak Chicago neighborhood the character live in . Not a place you 'd want to bring up your family .

This film wa basically set up for failure by the studio . One , Anne Rice ( author of the book ) offered to write the screen play but wa refused by the studio . Two , they tried to stuff 2 in depth novel in to a 2hour movie . I maintain the only way for these two book -Vampire Lestat and Queen of the Damned- to work in a live action form would be through a mini-series . First off the the Vampire Lestat alone take place from the 1700 's to the 1980 's and ha a plethora of character vital to the plot understanding of the main character , Lestat . The entire book Vampire Lestat set up the event of the second part Queen of the Damned . Without that full understanding the premise of a movie is destroyed . Lestat wa not cruel and vicious to all , he wa not wanting to go along with Akasha 's plan , Marius did not make Lestat , Lestat did not love Jesse or make her , Lestat could not go remain unscathed by the light , Marius wa not after David nor the other way around , every character wa completely represented wrong , BASICALLY same name different story . If they wanted to make a vampire movie , fine . Even if you wanted to be inspired by these novel , fine . But do n't piggie back into the theater off the success of Rice 's great novel and character just to destroy what her loyal reader have come to love . If you have n't read the book you wo n't understand the film really , if you have read the book you will be insulted . That being said , I am such a huge fan I had to see the movie knowing full well this wa going to be the case and still went for it . Catch 22 , must see it , will hate it .

Do n't waist your time this movie ísnt entertaining , if you wan na cry it might suffice though , even though your tear will be wept due to seeing Wesley Snipes in the tragic action film wannabe comedy ... I give this 2/10 it really wa awful , if you wan na see a decent movie go see shooter or rent it , it all the good thing this movie is n't .
