When MJ ( Silkk ) get stabbed at first he struggling but after that he fight normally and wa stabbed in the thigh-WITH OUT BLOOD . and when MJ confesses killing a cop co the cop wa beating up his friend Benny wa weird , Benny is n't introduced in this movie and the scene is n't in the film . it doe hold weight to the fact why Corrupt want to kill MJ but is still make u scratch your head . wen Jody writes a letter to Miss Jones character explaining what happened to them afterwords doe n't mention what happen 2 other main character MJ and Lisa . the film did show the horror and poverty of the ghetto-which plague the life of Latinos and Blacks word wide-was a good part of the film , even though the clip of the project wa re-used thousand of time . and the scene where Miles kill the Latino brother by crashing his bike at full speed ( not wearing a helmet ) and running into my Latino brother car would of killed him . the movie wa similar to the film Urban Menace and half the actor were in both of these movie a well a the production team . it wa OK tho . but me being from poverty i love hood film , however if u do n't love em like i do Do n't WATCH IT . only thing saving me from walking out is it reminded me of the first movie i made which wa made with 100 dollar , and my love of the genre . Nathaniel Purez

I am a huge fan of the Farcry Game , HUGE fan . It still hold a place in my top-10 game list of all time ! The story line wa new , fresh ... A truly brilliant foundation to base a movie on ... or so i thought ... Farcry the Movie is no le than another director attempt at cashing in on a successful game franchise ( see Doom : The Movie , and many more ... ) . The Video Game begin a the player ( Jack Carver ) awakes in a sea side cave after been shot off his boat by an RPG from an unknown soldier . Jack then find a communication device where ( Harlan Doyle ) guide him across island , shipwreck , jungle , installation and VOLCANOES , to find his ( lady friend ? ) ( Valerie Constantine ) , all the wile battling mutated super soldier , and genetically enhanced animal . The Movie play out very , very differently : 1 : There 's a needle 30 min ( 1/3 of the movie ) of `` backstory '' before we even get to the 'boat blowing up ' scene . 2 : Jack then walk onto the beach , kill some goon , then drive off ... Nothing like the game ... 3 : There is no communicator with Doyle on the other end ... 4 : The 'Modified Soldiers ' look like albino with singlet on ... And there wa no mutated 'monkey-like ' creature jumping out of the bush . A part of the Farcry game i enjoyed allot ... 5 : There is no sun filled beach scene , no aircraft carrier , no communication station on huge cliff , LITTLE reference to any in-game content ( characters/items/vehicles ) , in fact no attempt to follow the story line at all . 6 : The climactic Volcano scene from the game is replaced with an old industrial building . 7 : There 's an Ending scene ... where everyone ( except Krieger ) live happily ever after ... WHAT THE ! I recommend avoiding this movie at all cost ! If you are a Gamer , you will HATE this movie will all your soul . It is a movie clearly intended for male , so girl , stay away ... So if your a male , 12-29 year of age , have never played Farcry , and are not disgusted by director attempt at porting books/games to the cinema ... then this is for you ...

one of the best ensemble acted film I 've ever seen . There is n't much to the plot , but the acting- incredible . You see the character change ever so subtly , undr the influence of the rented villa in Italy , and love . And happiness . The film cast a mesmerizing spell on you , much a the villa doe on all the woman . Truly `` enchanted '' .

I have n't seen this movie in about 5 year , but it still haunt me . When asked about my favorite film , this is the one that I seem to always mention first . There are certain film ( work of art like this film , `` Dark City '' , and `` Breaking the Waves '' ) that seem to touch a place within you , a place so protected and hidden and yet so sensitive , that they make a lifelong impression on the viewer , not unlike a life-changing event , such a the ending of a serious relationship or the death of a friend ... This film `` shook '' me when I first saw it . It left me with an emotional hangover that lasted for several day .

Today , I wrote this review in anger at Uwe Boll and Hollywood . Hollywood ha produced movie based on one of the darkest day of our nation . 911 changed everything . It changed our perception of security . It changed our understanding of the evil of man and humanity . Most importantly and devastatingly , it changed our world . However , I ca n't not stress how utterly repulsed , disillusioned , and angry I am at the careless , blatant ignorance of Hollywood seeking to make a lucrative profit out of death and destruction . This film and those like it are bound to cause controversy amid word-of-mouth among moviegoer and critic alike ; most surely to be echoed by the mainstream press . Hollywood ha sunk to a new low . Even lower than the low-down bastard who perpetrated the most barbaric act of savagery and unrelenting cruelty . Behind it all is Uwe Boll . I am very angry at this movie . How dare they disrespect the memory of family of those lost ? How dare they mock the life of the brave men and woman who risked their life to save those trapped in the doomed tower on that fateful day of infamy ? ! ? ! ? How dare they try to satirize and at the same time capitalize on a national tragedy in the mist of a mourning and weary post-911 world ? ! ? ! ? ! How ... dare ... they ? To those who have the gall to even think of seeing this morally appalling travesty , I say this with a heavy heart with all my strength : Remember . Think back to that day and ask yourself whether or not you are a sane and moral person . Think back to that day , ask yourself whether or not this film is a disgrace and dishonor to the life lost on that day . Think back to that day of the outcry of family of loved one . Think back to that day of the life lost on those two plane . Think back to the further carnage it caused following the attack . Ask yourself if you have a soul . Think . Remember . Respect the memory of the life lost on 911 by not seeing this film at all .

You can not deny that we have an affinity for speed . That 's why movie like Fast and the Furious , Dhoom , Rempit get made to play to the satisfaction of audience , especially local one . We live on a tiny island , and I can not fathom why , for the relative efficiency of the public transportation system , most of u want to get into debt by owning a set of wheel which come with 100 % tax when they reach our shore , and the myriad of tax and bill to pay when operating one . Not only that , the high end sport car were once quipped by a prominent politician up north that they will never reach fourth gear , lest they reach the sea . And these movie are relatively easy to make . Hot wheel and hot chick always go down well together in targeting the required demographic . For once , those plunging neckline exposing uncanny buxom and short skirt accentuating leg two meter long , ca n't compete with the attention given to those beautiful curve that exotic car posse in movie such a these . Of course there are amongst u ( ahem ) those that go for the sexist portrayal of woman a mere sexual object ( otherwise explain why motor show come with truckloads of model , and movie such a these can not do without a leggy model in a frame ) , however , they do n't warrant the kind of collective orgasmic sigh whenever the four wheeler come on screen , even when they do exactly nothing and have their gear into Park . The guy sitting beside me , I swear he wet his pant every time his dream car ( s ) appear , and creamed his pant even more when he hears those growling engine moan . So there we have it , the fan boy who turned up in drove just to watch which of the latest cool car get featured in the movie . With the Fast and the Furious franchise , the Japanese model like the Evos and the Skylines take centerstage , a doe the GT . Here , the Ford GT take on an incredibly drool-worthy facade modification , that even I 'm impressed , alongside the latest model like the Ferrari Enzos , Porshe Carerra GTs , Koenigsegg CCXs , and every car out there that ha wing for door . But seriously , my heart go out to the car each time they 're mercilessly wrecked just for entertainment . I mean , this are perfectly fine , high performance model that are at the apex of motoring , but yet because whoever financed the movie had million to blow , they do so because they can , There 's no story in Redline , just excuse to put together a movie full of beauty ( the car that is ) that can rip down the tarmac in probably the most boring fashion possible , and with the usual shot of pedal ( always the accelerator , mind you , tapping the brake pedal is tantamount to blasphemy , and earn you no respect ) , steering wheel , gear shift ( always shifting up and not down ) , all these while having the actor make pretend that they 're the baddest ass with an engine , snarling and giving each other dirty look . Not a very tall order for an actor , and that 's why we get the most woeful performance ever , with line that seem to be written by elementary schoolkids . The heroine ( yes , it made a statement that girl can drive ) Natasha ( a very plasticky looking Nadia Bjorlin ) is one of those million dollar find - a girl with model look who do n't mind getting down on four and immersed in oil , who ha racing pedigree within her , and performs with a rock band singing song with lyric that are just plain laughable ( every line had to do with car , and when singing about love , just had to string those innuendo like shifting gear shaft , lubricant and going for ride ) . Introduced against her wish to illegal racing by a gangsta called Infamous ( Eddie Griffin ) , she get drawn into family squabble involving a Leo DiCaprio lookalike Iraq war veteran , and some sleazy lecherous looking rich uncle . Everything else , well like I said , just serf a an excuse for the movie to go from race to race . And it 's almost always the same , a there 's very limited to what you can do to heighten tension between race car , especially when you know the race is rigged ( for narrative reason ) and can see the race outcome a mile away from the finishing line . While Fast and Furious had quite charismatic actor , and I will put my head on the chopping block by naming Paul Walker , Sun Kang , and of course , the star it created - Vin Diesel , Redline had none , just pretty face with lot of air unfortunately . It look like a TV movie in it treatment from the get go , with a very insipid opening sequence where it 's one man , one car , and a 105 minute race against time to get to Vegas . If not for the car , then this movie seriously is a piece of junk , with bad acting , bad line and bad action . Strictly for the car fan , or those who like their movie with countless of bevy beauty who pimp their body without any speaking line .

Seven Ups ha been compared to Bullitt for the chase scene , but doe not come anywhere near matching Bullitt . Bullitt ha a beginning that build build build . When McQueen leaf the seedy hotel , get into his Mustang , which is parked under the Embarcadero Freeway ( now torn down ) and notice the Charger sitting nearbye , you know you are about to see something spectacular . From that moment on , when McQueen start that car , begin the best car chase sequence ever filmed . Adding to it is a terrific Lalo Schriffin If I remember correctly sound track . This go on for a long time before you actually hear the first tire squealing . That shot of McQueen 's Mustang suddenly appearing in Bill Hickman 's rear view mirror is unmatched for visual impact . Hickman 's look of surprise and double take really add to the effect . Then of course , San Francisco is unmatched for the setting of car racing up and down hill and around bend . Also , Bullitt being filmed in the 60 when car were still `` Hot '' ( Mustang GT and Dodge Charger ) made for a better set of wheel then two boring , smog device laden Pontiacs in the 1970s Seven Ups . Bill Hickman wa the driver of the bad guy car in both movie . I saw him sitting at an insider movie preview once on the Univeral lot when I wa doing movie review for a paper . They gave it a good try in Seven Ups though with the chase scene . Seven ups had a few `` jump '' over little hill , ( Yawn ) but of course they were not San Francisco hill . The Seven Ups chase , where they are actually going fast , is longer than the go fast sequence in Bullitt . But the scene of a single shotgun blast totally blowing the hood OFF of Roy Schieders Pontiac is the height of absurdity . Strictly Hollywood , I would say , except that it wa filmed in New York .

Have you ever heard the saying that people `` telegraph their intention ? '' Well in this movie , the character ' action do more than telegraph future plan -- they show up at your house drunk and buffet you about the head . This could be forgiven if the setting had been used better , or if the character were more charismatic or nuanced . Embeth Davidtz 's character is not mysterious , just wooden , and Kenneth Branagh doe n't succeed in conveying the brash charm his character probably wa written to have . The bottom line : obvious plot , one-note performance , unlikeable character , and grotesque `` Southern '' accent employed by British actor .

`` Night of the Living Homeless '' wa a fairly strong finish to the first half of Season 11 . Obviously a parody of various zombie movie , most notably Dawn of the Dead , this episode parallel the homeless with the living dead , a creature who feed and thrive off of spare change rather than brain . Kyle is blamed for the sudden mass outbreak of homeless people when he , out of the goodness of his heart , give a $ 20 to a homeless man in front of his house . More homeless people begin to infiltrate South Park , until the town is completely overrun with them . This is a very strong Randy Marsh episode , a he assumes the role of the shotgun-wielding leader of the adult who take refuge on the roof of the Park County Community Center . But before Randy make it to the community center , he is accosted by hundred of homeless people while hilariously screaming `` I do n't have any change ! ! '' Unfortunately , the refugee end up losing Gerald Broflofski to the homeless , when he try to escape by catching a bus out of town , and unwittingly toss away all his change for the bus to distract the homeless people . Then he becomes one of them , asking everyone for change . The boy attempt to find out why there are so many homeless people in South Park , and find a man who is a director of homeless study . They find out that the nearby city of Evergreen used to have a similar problem with the homeless , so they escape to Evergreen to find out what they did to solve the problem . Unfortunately , homeless people break into the man 's house , and he attempt to take the easy way out by shooting himself . However , he fails several time , a he shoot himself in the jaw , in the eye , in the chest , in the neck , in the shoulder , screaming horribly until he finally dy . This scene may have been funnier had a similar scene not happened in `` Fantastic Easter Special '' two week ago . Meanwhile , a member of the refugee discovers that due to the homeless problem , the property value have nosedived , thus the bank ha foreclosed on his house , making him homeless . Randy immediately turn on him , holding the gun to the man 's head . When the man finally begs the others for a few buck to help him out , Randy pull the trigger . In Evergreen , the boy find out that the citizen of the town sent the homeless to South Park , and that the passing of homeless from town to town happens all over the country . The boy modify a bus that lead the homeless out of South Park and take them all the way to Santa Monica , California . The zombie movie parallel and the great Randy Marsh line make this one definitely re-watchable . 8/10

DOCTEUR PETIOT , starring Michel Serrault , is a brutal story about a brutal man . A doctor who heals the sick in occupied France , even if their ability to compensate is not there . Yet , he prey on the weakest amidst the populace . The imagery and cinematography are superb , and lend an additional macabre feeling to this complex story . He is the perfect psychopath . Seductive and altruistic , intelligent and caring , calculating and murderous . A movie certain not to be forgotten soon by the viewer . Kudos to Mr. Serrault , for his chilling portrayal .

I just got this video used and I wa watching it last night . The acting started out extremely bad ( hey -- -- -- hey -- -- -- twister ) but got very good soon after ward . The tornado looked extremely fake , and many of the CGI effect were very dodgy , but the scene with the house cracking apart and the content inside being blown around and sucked out were extremely well done , and just about on par with movie like Twister . The scene of devastation were also extremely well done too . The story wa very well written , and it 's refreshing to see a movie like this stray away from the same old `` disaster formula '' movie of this genre seems to have been stuck in for 30 year . While this movie had a very weird mix of FX and acting quality , this merit an A in my book .

The first Cube movie wa an art movie . It set up a world in which all the major archetype of mankind were represented , and showed how they struggled to make sense of a hostile world that they could n't understand . It wa , on the non-literal level , a `` man vs. cruel nature '' plot , where the individual who represented innocence and goodness came through in the end , triumphing to face a new , indefinable world beyond man 's petty squabble ; a world where there were no more struggle , but peace . I rated Cube a 10 out of 10 , and it 's a movie that wa never meant to have any sequel . The second movie , Hypercube wa a massive disappointment . Some of the idea were kind of cool , but in the context of the original movie , both the story and the setting made no sense and had no meaning . Still , for being fairly entertaining , I rated it a 5 out of 10 . The third movie , Cube Zero , while ignoring the second , play like a vastly inferior commercial B-movie rehash of the first , sans the symbolism . There is no `` homage '' or `` tribute '' here ; there is only ripping off . The same kind of plot , with some element idiotically altered ( like having letter instead of prime number between the cube - an idea which show more clearly than anything else that this is a rip-off with absolutely no originality and nothing to say ) . That we see something from `` behind the scene '' mean nothing , because the watcher are just part of the Big Bad Experiment , the architect of which we hear nothing of . And , in this movie , those who get through to the exit ( like Kazan did at the end of the first movie ) are just killed - where the * bleep * is the sense in that ? ! That 's just flippin ' stupid . I 'm glad I did n't pay to see this . The production value and acting in Cube Zero are not too bad , but the story and the idea are so utterly devoid of any inspiration that this movie can only get from me a rating of 3 out of 10 .

I believe Shakespeare explained what I just read beautifully . Me think he ( the lady ) doth protest too much . The whole thing sounded to me a if the author wa trying to convince himself ! He site profane literature ( writing from the same time period but not connected with the bible ) a number of time however I can think of at least three reference off the top of my head which lend historical accuracy to event contained in the bible . Anyone can skew data & prove anything they like but it doe n't make it true . Customs change , word definition change over time ( look at English & German where it is very obviously a common root ) nothing stay the same , it 's always growing and changing . The bible ha many different translation but the King James version is the one I 've found to be the best when it come to any kind of research . In the King James version you will notice there are certain word written in italic . These word have been added by the translator and can be dropped & the mean of the entire verse change . Writings from around the time of Christ were written without space , without punctuation , without paragraph & without numeric verse . These writing look like one long word & the translator added all of the above . For example how would you read this : GODISNOWHERE do you read it a God is nowhere or do you read it a God is now here ? Same string of letter two entirely different meaning . This is why many biblical researcher use a 'Lexicon ' to assist them in translation a it provides a word for word translation from the original Arabic , Greek or Hebrew depending on the language in which the scripture wa originally written . It 's also interesting to note that when translated into symbolic logic you can prove God exists but you can not prove He doe n't exist ! In the end I just love listening to people who think they are so smart that they are qualified to judge the almighty . Talk about ego ! Putting soapbox away , God Bless Maegi

Another Spanish movie about the 1936 Civil War . This time we 're told about the story of Carol ( lovely played by débutant Clara Lago ) , a little girl which come to live to a little Spanish village from New York . It is such an initiating trip , and soon she 'll find about the injustice of the human race , their stupid fight and conflict , their contradiction . Imanol Uribe make his best film since `` Días Contados '' ( 1994 ) with such a sober pulse , a beautiful photography , and a nice script . He try not to take part in the conflict , he just show u some fact and let u decide ( ok , the fact are explicit enough to make u decide in which band are we in ) and he take a huge advantage of the presence and the freshness of the young starring couple : Clara Lago and Juan José Ballesta . A well cared production . My rate : 7/10

A response to previous comment made by resident of the region where this motion picture wa lensed : One person suggested that the closing and destruction of the Ocean View Amusement Park led to a downturn in the surrounding neighborhood . This is simply not true . Prior to the construction of Interstate 64 , which bypass the Ocean View area , the primary route for traffic went through the heart of Ocean View . Once the interstate wa completed , Ocean View rapidly became a ghost town with business closing up and an increase in crime . This led to a huge reduction in revenue for the park , which also faced new competition from nearby Busch Gardens in Williamsburg . Meanwhile , in the past few year , the City of Norfolk ha done a remarkable job of fostering redevelopment so that the area ha become a sought-after location for construction of high-end housing . It ha also been said that the destruction footage of the roller coaster wa used in the film `` Rollercoaster '' . This is also untrue . Footage wa shot of two coaster car careening off the ride for that film , but the actual explosion and collapse are exclusive to `` Death of Ocean View Park '' . As to the film itself , the storyline of a `` supernatural '' force in the water adjacent to the park wa certainly silly , but somewhat typical for B-grade movie of the time . With the cast involved , there should be no surprise that the scenery wa gnawed in almost every scene by the primary actor . I do n't believe this film wa intended to be another `` Citizen Kane '' ; I believe Playboy wa experimenting with a new non-nude format to determine if this wa an area for the company to expand into ( apparently not ! ) . A strange force in the water causing strange event in an old amusement park probably sounded good at the conference table , but proved unmanageable in execution . The roller coaster and the rest of the park wa destined for the wrecking ball anyway ; `` let 's come up with a weird way to justify an explosive demise ! '' . For the casual movie viewer , this would be a `` see once and forget about it '' film ( except for Diana Canova fan ) ; but for the thousand of people who live in the region and have fond memory of the park , this movie is like a `` walk down memory lane '' for footage of the park a well a old footage of downtown Norfolk , the first `` Harborfest '' , and Old Dominion University . Even a limited release of this film on DVD would be welcome .

A trio of buddy , sergeant all in the British Army , carouse & brawl their way across Imperial India . Intensely loyal to each other , they meet their greatest & most deadly challenge when they encounter the resurgence of a hideous cult & it demented , implacable guru . Now they must rely on the lowliest servant of the regiment , the water carrier GUNGA DIN , to save score of the Queen 's soldier from certain massacre . Based more on The Three Musketeers than Kipling 's classic poem , this is a wonderful adventure epic - a worthy entry in Hollywood 's Golden Year of 1939 . Filled with suspense & humor , while keeping the romantic interlude to the barest minimum , it grip the interest of the viewer and hold it right up to the ( sentimental ) conclusion . It is practically fruitless to discus the performance nuance of the three star , Cary Grant , Victor McLaglen & Douglas Fairbanks Jr. , a they are really all third of a single organism - inseparable and , to all intent & purpose , indistinguishable . However , this diminishes nothing of the great fun in simply watching them have a glorious time . ( It 's interesting to note , parenthetically , that McLaglen boasted of a distinguished World War One military career ; Fairbanks would have a sterling record in World War Two - mostly in clandestine affair & earning himself no fewer than 4 honorary knighthood after the conflict ; while Grant reportedly worked undercover for British Intelligence , keeping an eye on Hollywood Nazi sympathizer . ) The real acting laurel here should go to Sam Jaffe , heartbreaking in the title role . He infuses the humble man with radiant dignity & enormous courage , making the last line of Kipling 's poem ring true . He is unforgettable . Montague Love is properly stalwart a the regimental major , whilst Eduardo Ciannelli is Evil Incarnate a the Thuggee guru . The rest of the cast , Joan Fontaine , Robert Coote , Lumsden Hare , are effective but have little to do . Movie maven will recognize Cecil Kellaway in the tiny role of Miss Fontaine 's father . The film pick it villain well . The demonic Thuggee cult , worshiper of the hideous , blood-soaked Kali , Hindu goddess of destruction , wa the bane of Indian life for 6 century , ritualistically strangling up to 30,000 victim a year . In 1840 the British military , in cooperation with a number of princely state , succeeded in ultimately suppressing the religion . Henceforth it would remain the stuff of novel & nightmare .

I went to see `` Passion of Mind '' because I usually get a kick out of the genre of alternate reality romance , i.e . `` Sliding Doors , '' `` Me , Myself , I , '' etc . But this wa the worst one I 've ever seen ! I had to force myself to sit through it . I did n't even stay through the credit which is unheard of for me . The magical realism wa completely missing because Demi Moore wa grim and the lover she wa two-timing were guy who usually play villain , though each wa kind of sexy and appealing . There wa actually a psychological explanation provided for the dual life , with a distasteful frisson of The Elektra Complex ; maybe the magic should n't be explained for this genre to work . ( originally written 5/28/2000 )

I thought that ROTJ wa clearly the best out of the three Star Wars movie . I find it surprising that ROTJ is considered the weakest installment in the Trilogy by many who have voted . To me it seemed like ROTJ wa the best because it had the most profound plot , the most suspense , surprise , most emotional , ( especially the ending ) and definitely the most episodic movie . I personally like the Empire Strikes Back a lot also but I think it is slightly le good than than ROTJ since it wa slower-moving , wa not a episodic , and I just did not feel a much suspense or emotion a I did with the third movie . It also seems like to me that after reading these surprising review that the reason people cited for ROTJ being an inferior film to the other two are just plain ludicrous and are insignificant reason compared to the sheer excellence of the film a a whole . I have heard many strange reason such a : a ) Because Yoda died b ) Because Bobba Fett died c ) Because small Ewoks defeated a band of stormtroopers d ) Because Darth Vader wa revealed I would like to debunk each of these reason because I believe that they miss the point completely . First off , WHO CARES if Bobba Fett died ? ? ? If George Lucas wanted him to die then he wanted him to die . Do n't get me wrong I am fan of Bobba Fett but he made a few cameo appearance and it wa not Lucas ' intention to make him a central character in the film that Star Wars fan made him out to be . His name wa not even mentioned anywhere in the movie ... You had to go to the credit to find out Bobba Fett 's name ! ! ! Judging ROTJ because a minor character died is a bit much I think ... Secondly , many fan did not like Yoda dying . Sure , it wa a momentous period in the movie . I wa not happy to see him die either but it make the movie more realistic . All the good guy ca n't stay alive in a realistic movie , you know . Otherwise if ALL the good guy lived and ALL the bad guy died this movie would have been tantamount to a cheesy Saturday morning cartoon . Another aspect to this point about people not liking Yoda 's death .. Well , nobody complained when Darth Vader struck down Obi Wan Kenobi in A New Hope . ( Many consider A New Hope to be the best of the Trilogy ) Why wa Obi Wan 's death okay but Yoda 's not ... hmmmmmmmmmmmm .... Another reason I just can not believe wa even stated wa because people found cute Ewoks overpowering stormtroopers to be impossible . That is utterly ridiculous ! ! I can not believe this one ! ! First off , the Ewoks are in their native planet Endor so they are cognizant of their home terrain since they live there . If you watch the movie carefully many of the tactic the Ewoks used in defeating the stormtroopers wa through excellent use of their home field advantage . ( Since you lived in the forest all your life I hope you would have learned to use it to your advantage ) They had swinging vine , rope , log set up to trip those walker , and other trap . The stormtroopers were highly disadvantaged because they were outnumbered and not aware of the advantage of the forest . The only thing they had wa their blaster . To add , it wa not like the Ewoks were battling the stormtroopers themselves , they were heavily assisted by the band of rebel in that conquest . I thought that if the stormtroopers were to have defeated a combination of the Star Wars hero , the band of rebel , a well a the huge clan of Ewoks with great familiarity of their home terrain , that would have been a great upset . Lastly , if this scene wa still unbelievable to you .. How about in Empire Strikes Back or in A New Hope where there were SEVERAL scene of a group consisting of just Han Solo , Chewbacca , and the Princess , being shot at by like ten stormtroopers and all their blaster missed while the hero were in full view ! ! And not only that , the hero , of course , always hit the Stormtroopers with their blaster . The trooper must have VERY , VERY bad aim then ! At least in Empire Strikes Back , the Battle of Endor wa much more believable since you had two army pitted each other not 3 hero against a legion of stormtroopers . Do n't believe me ? Check out the battle at Cloud City when our hero were escaping Lando 's base . Or when our hero were rescuing Princess Leia and being shot at ( somehow they missed ) a Han Solo and Luke were trying to exit the Death Star . The last reason that I care to discus ( others are just too plain ridiculous for me to spend my time here . ) is that people did not like Darth Vader being revealed ! Well , in many way that wa a major part of the plot in the movie . Luke wa trying to find whether or not Darth Vader wa his father , Annakin Skywalker . It would have been disappointing if the movie had ended without Luke getting to see his father 's face because it made it complete . By Annakin 's revelation it symbolized the transition Darth Vader underwent from being possessed by the dark side ( in his helmet ) and to the good person he wa Annakin Skywalker ( by removing the helmet ) . The point is that Annakin died converted to the light side again and that is what the meaning of the helmet removal scene wa about . In fact , that 's is what I would have done in that scene too if I were Luke 's father ... Is n't that what you would have done if you wanted to see your son with your own eye before you died and not in a mechanized helmet ? On another note , I think a subconscious or conscious expectation among most people is that the sequel MUST be worse ( even if it is better ) that preceding movie is another reason that ROTJ doe not get a many accolade a it deserves . I never go into a film with that deception in mind , I always try to go into a film with the attitude that `` Well , it might be better or worse that the original .. But I can not know for sure .. Let 's see . '' That way I go with an open mind and do not dupe myself into thinking that a clearly superior film is not a good a it really wa . I am not sure who criticizes these movie but , I have asked many college student and adult about which is their favorite Star Wars movie and they all tell me ( except for one person that said that A New Hope wa their favorite ) that it is ROTJ . I believe that the result on these poll are appalling and quite misleading . Bottom line , the Return of the Jedi wa the best of the Trilogy . This movie wa the only one of the three that kept me riveted all throughout it 135 minute . There wa not a moment of boredom because each scene wa either suspenseful , exciting , surprising , or all of the above . For example , the emotional light saber battle between Luke and his father in ROTJ wa better than the one in the Empire Strikes Back any day ! ! ! Finally , I hope people go see the Phantom Menace with an open mind because if fan start looking for nitpicky , insignificant detail ( or see it a `` just another sequel '' ) to trash the movie such a `` This movie stink because Luke is not in it ! '' then this meritorious film will become another spectacular movie that will be the subject of derision like ROTJ suffered unfortunately .

Crossfire remains one of the best Hollywood message movie because , unlike the admirably intentioned Gentleman 's Agreement , which it beat to theatre by a few month , it chooses to send it message via the form an excellent noir thriller rather than have an outraged star constantly saying `` It 's because I 'm Jewish , is n't it ? '' It 's much easier to get the message that hate is like a loaded gun across when the dead body are actual rather than metaphorical . Somewhat shamefully , the brief featurette on the Warners ' DVD doe n't mention that novelist Richard Brooks disowned the film over the shift from a homophobic murder to an anti-Semitic one , but it 's interesting to note that while the victim is killed primarily because he is Jewish , there 's little doubt in Sam Levene 's performance that the character is in fact also gay  not a mincing caricature , but there 's definitely a two lost soul aspect to his scene with George Cooper 's confused soldier . There 's not much of a mystery to who the murderer is : even though the killing is carried out in classic noir shadow , the body language of the killer is instantly recognisable , but then the film ha it character drift to the same conclusion before the halfway point : the tension come from proving it and saving the fall guy . There 's an element of Ealing Films to the gang of soldier teaming together to get their buddy out of a fix ( you could almost see that aspect a a blueprint for Hue and Cry ) , but the atmosphere is pure RKO noir . Set over one long sweltering night , the film ha a great look filled with deep dark black and shadow born a much out of economy a style ( it cut back on lighting time and allowed director Edward Dmytryk more time to work with the actor ) and the excellent cast make the most of the fine script : a laid-back but quietly charismatic Robert Mitchum , Robert Young 's Maigret-like detective , Gloria Grahame 's tramp and the perpetually creepy Paul Kelly a her compulsive liar admirer , a guy who try on story the way other people try on tie . But the lasting impression is of Robert Ryan 's excellent performance a a guy who could do with a good leaving alone a he doe his best to help the wrongly accused man all the way to death row . A big surprise hit in 1946 , a a reward , Dmytryk and producer Adrian Scott found themselves investigated by the HUAC , which itself had a notable tendency to target Jews . So much for crusading

This movie basically is a very well made production and give a good impression of a war situation and it effect on those involved . It 's always interesting to see the story from the 'other ' side for a change . This movie concentrate on a group of German soldier who after fighting in the North Africa campaign are send to Stalingrad , Russia , where one of the most notorious and bloodiest battle of WW II is being fought . It 's interesting to see the other side of this battle , since we mainly just always see the Germans simply a the 'villains ' . In this movie those 'villains ' are given an humane face and voice and it sort of make you realize that the only true enemy in war is war itself and not necessarily those who you 're fighting against . At first it 's kind of hard to concentrate on the movie because you always just have in the back of your mind that the German 's are the evil villain . But of course you get accustomed to it quickly and you soon adapt the Germans a the main character of the movie and you even start to care -and be interested in them . The way this story is told is n't however the best . It 's hard to keep track of the story at time , a it jump from the one sequence and location to the other . The movie is n't always logic in it storytelling and feature a bit too many sequence that remain too vague . It also is most of the time pretty hard to keep the character apart and see who is who . It doe n't always make this movie an easy on to watch but than again on the other hand , there are plenty enough sequence and moment present in this movie to make it worthwhile and an interesting one , just not the most coherent one around . In that regard Hollywood movie are always better than European movie . The production value are high and feature some good looking set and location , though the movie wa n't even shot in Russia itself . It help to create a good war time situation atmosphere . The character are mostly interesting although perhaps a tad bit formulaic . But I do n't know , for some reason formulaic character always work out fine in war movie and strenghtens the drama and realism . It also help that they 're being played by well cast actor . All of the actor are n't the best known actor around ( Thomas Kretschmann wa also at the time still a fairly unknown actor ) but each of them fit their role well and give it character an unique face and personality . All in all not the best or most consistent WW II drama around but definitely worth a look , due to it original approach of the German side of the battle of Stalingrad and it good production value . 7/10

What a boring film ! To sum it all up , it wa basically just Nana Patekar beating up his daughter-in-law Karisma Kapoor , while she tried to flee from the village , with her son . Can someone say BORING ? ? ? The concept wa n't too bad , but it wa poorly executed . The Canadian locale , and some of the village scene were nicely shot . However , overall the cinematography came up short . The story could have been great , but the movie just seemed to drag on . There is only so much stupidity a person can take , let alone three bloody hour of it . The best part of the whole movie wa the song `` Ishq Kamina '' , and that wa only five minute long . Other than that , this movie wa a piece of crap .

{ rant start } I did n't want to believe them at first , but I guess this is what people are talking about when they say South Korean cinema ha peaked and may even be going downhill . After the surprisingly fun and moving monster movie `` Gwoemul '' ( aka `` The Host '' ) of 2006 -- which actually succeeded in making a sharp satire out of a B-movie genre -- successive Korean blockbuster have become more and more generic , even though their budget ( mainly spent on special effect ) have become more and more fantastic . Do South Korean movie-makers really want to squander all the audience and investor goodwill , which their industry ha built up since the 1999 break-out film `` Shiri/Swiri '' , by making a whole series of big budget mediocre movie like mainland China did ? { rant end } The only `` reason '' I can fathom for making this movie is to dupe the investor into financing the most detailed and fluid digital animation of a Korean/ East Asian-styled dragon I have seen to date , for the final scene . Now if they had introduced that dragon at the beginning and given it more personality and purpose like in the 1996 `` Dragonheart '' , the movie might have had a few more redeeming quality other than having lot of digitally animated dragon . Remember `` Dungeons & Dragons '' in 2000 ? Has n't anyone learnt that the trick is not how MUCH special effect you use , but how WELL you use it ? I hope there are more ( and better ) Korean legend they can use , because they have just killed a lot of international interest in Korean dragon legend with the way they filmed this one . In short , I agree with all the negative review gone before and wonder how Koreans felt about having their folk anthem `` Arirang '' being played at the very end . As a creature feature , I would have given it at least 5 star out of 10 if the special effect or action sequence had been worth it , but I 've seen many video game with better camera work and scripting ( just le dragon ) .

As a native Chinese , I can not accept this kind of idea that some people must die for a 'better world ' . I said 'better world ' because it is a lie that Chinese people have been indoctrinated for thousand year ! I guess most western audience may do n't know Qin Shihuang ( mean the first emperor ) , the king in this film is the most notorious tyrant in ancient China . The Tianxia ( Chinese word wa spoken by the king , mean 'the land and the people ' ) spoken from his mouth is totally lie . From then on , one after another , all the king in ancient china spoke the same thing but very few of them did a what they said . Another fact is , Qin Shihuang 's empire only lasted about twenty year before it wa destroyed by people . Well , I do like the beautiful scene of this movie , but it can not make me accept the idea that people should die for a tyrant .

This had a great cast with big-name star like Tyrone Power , Henry Fonda , Randolph Scott , Nancy Kelly , Henry Hull and Brian Donlevey and a bunch more lesser-but-known name with shorter role . It also had Technicolor , one of the few movie made with it in 1939 . Now the bad news ....... regrettably , I ca n't say much positive for the story . It portrayed the James boy in a totally positive light .... and Hollywood ha done that ever since . Why these criminal are always shown to be the `` good guy '' is beyond me . This film glamorizes them and made their enemy - the railroad people - into vicious human being . The latter wa exaggerated so much it wa preposterous . Well , that 's the film world for you : evil is good ; good is bad . Hey Hollywood : here 's a news flash - The James boy were criminal ! Really - look it up !

I remember watching this series avidly , every Saturday evening . It wa the highlight of the week . I loved everything about it , the location , the costume , the actor and the wonderful music by Clannad ( I still have their Legend album ) . I loved the way they solved the problem of Michael Praed leaving by creating another Robin , this time the Earl of Huntingdon . I believe there were legend of several Robins in medieval time . Another thing I loved wa the fact that it wa filled with young actor , I 'm sure Robin and his men would have young , after all people did n't live that long in those day . Other Robins always look too old ( Kevin Costner with his ridiculous accent looked like Robin 's granddad ) . The only sad thing wa the ending , it 's a shame they could n't at least have done a one off special to tie up all the loose end and give it a happier ending .

I do n't normally write review , but this `` film '' wa special . I could n't turn it off . I do n't believe I 've ever seen a worse movie , but there I sat , watching . It wa like a horrible car wreck with blood flowing all over the highway . It wa disgusting , but I could n't turn away . Where do I start ? The movie seems to think it 's a sport thriller , but it 's so utterly ridiculous , it can only be a comedy , but it 's not funny , not even in a dumb/silly way . It 's like watching your cousin try to act out a skit on family get-togethers . It 's painful to watch , but at least it 's only for a minute or two . Second String went on for over an hour . Whoever wa involved with making this movie should not work again . The writing , directing , acting , and everything wa just terrible . The problem is I ca n't describe how bad it wa ; you just had to see it . And I 'm sure this will NEVER be shown again , so unless you saw it , you 're out of luck . I mean it wa almost worth seeing just for the fact that it gave me some appreciation for every other `` bad '' film I 've seen over my lifetime . And for every film I see in the future that I ca n't stand , I will think to myself , well , at least it wa n't bad a the Second String .

Few would argue that master animation director Hayao Miyazaki is one of the few to hold this ability . ( No . Too many are focused on John Lassiter 's `` amazing '' ability to steal other movie plot , turn them into pretty puppet show and then be lauded a a genius . . . but i digress . ) Miyazaki ha given u film after film that deal with important mature issue ( usually ecologically themed ) , and ha an intelligent script that even the most jaded viewer who would normally despise any film that wa animated could thoroughly enjoy if given the chance . Still , Miyazaki ( almost ) never forgets who will undoubtedly be in the audience of these movies- child . That said , I am at a loss to think of another filmmaker with this ability . Where else are you going to have a film where a three year old ( my nephew Link ) will sit still throughout the move , enthralled , a 7 year old ( my niece Amber ) loving it all her own ( and able to appreciate the `` star power '' of Frankie Jonas and Noah Cyrus , a 12 year old ( my nephew Aaron ) who 's review wa `` of course it wa good ! Everything Miyazaki-san doe is good ! , '' a 32 year old animation fan brought to tear by the powerful directing and gorgeous animation ( er , that would be me ) , and a 58 year old woman ( my mother ) able to connect with the mother character ( and I 'm betting the older chara too ) and loving the `` cuteness '' of the child character . And that is what I respect most about Miyazaki-san . He seems to speak to his audience in a completely different way than the average filmmaker . On the surface , `` Ponyo '' could be seen a a simple story about a little fish-girl who get a taste of the human world and want to join it and the friend she make there , a little boy name Soske ( somewhat like `` The Little Mermaid '' ) , but there is an entire different level at play here . True to form , Miyazaki populates his film with intensely strong female character Ponyo 's Mother , Soske 's mother , the older lady in a nursing home are all genuine character with mind of their own and extremely strong willed . But the girl who take the cake is Ponyo herself . Once she decides that she like the human world , she simply us her own will to achieve her dream . Her father is trying to keep her innocent , and keep her a magical fish , but young Ponyo know what she want and becomes human out of simply her own determination . Once human , she team up with her friend , Soske , whom she love very much ( although maybe not a much a ham ) . Soske is asked to be the man of the house ( at age five ) when his mother Lisa decides she ha to help the people at the rest home where she work during a typhoon that ha been inadvertently caused by Ponyo on her quest to become human . Frankie Jonas ( yes . He 's related to the Jonas brother . Can we just get past that please ? ) give , perhaps , the best performance in the film a young Soske ( which is good since he ha the most line ) . His character is also strong willed , but also very respectful and friendly- characteristic you 're not likely to find in a child character on THIS side of the Pacific . In the end , Ponyo 's father , Fujimoto must cope with his daughter 's decision and his estranges wife 's wish to allow her to be human . He hope that Ponyo and Soske will `` remember him fondly . '' And once again , Miyazaki REFUSES to allow a character to become the stereotypical `` bad guy . '' Although Miyazaki ha ( for some reason ) received some criticism for this , it is , honestly , what make his movie magical and yet relatable . No one in real life is completely a `` bad person . '' All human are various shade of gray . And that is exactly what Miyazaki doe with his character . And then there 's the animation itself . In a time when CGI would certainly have helped with the copious amount of effect shot in this film , especially the water , Miyazaki ha chosen to incorporate NO CGI whatsoever . Certainly the hand drawn animation wa colored by digital mean , but every film in this wa hand-drawn and I , for one , wa extremely grateful for that . The character animation wa extremely fluid , and there even appeared to be some lip-sync going on ( quite unusual for an anime film ) . The background seemed to be rendered with colored pencil and had an effect all it own on the audience . This is what animation used to look like- and what it SHOULD look like . In the end , I found Ponyo to be thoroughly enjoyable . Certainly not Miyazaki 's best ( in my opinion , that honor is still held by Kiki 's Delivery Service ) , but still a 10-star fun movie for the ENTIRE family .

Attractive Marjorie ( Farrah Fawcett ) life in fear after being accosted by a lone biker . She is mortally shaken with the fact her attacker know her address . As expected , Joe ( James Russo ) , the attacker force his way into Marjorie 's home and subject her to humiliating terror . Bruised and bloody , Marjorie manages to get an upper hand on her attacker , knocking the living daylight out of the jerk and render him helpless thanks to wasp spray in his eye and throat . Hog tied and battered himself , Joe try to explain himself to Marjorie 's roommate ( Diana Scarwid and Alfrie Woodard ) when they get home . There is almost a hint of mercy , but it is not coming from Marjorie . Should she continue to render her own punishment ? Violence , sexual abuse and rough language make for an R rating . Fawcett really get away from the ditsy role that would forever stain her career . Kudos to director Robert M. Young .

I watched this movie on TV last night , hoping for a realistic account of what could happen if there were an outbreak of some highly transmittable disease . I have seen some disaster movie , in particular those weather one , which are actually so bad they are amusing . This film is a little gem .

THE GREAT CARUSO wa the biggest hit in the world in 1951 and broke all box office record at Radio City Music Hall in a year when most `` movergoers '' were stay-at-home watching their new 7 '' Motorola television . Almost all recent box office figure are false -- - because they fail to adjust inflation . Obviously today 's $ 10 movie will dominate . In 1951 it cost 90c to $ 1.60 at Radio City ; 44c to 75c first run at Loew 's Palace in Washington DC , or 35c to 50c in neighborhood run . What count is the number of people responding to the picture , not unadjusted box office `` medium spin . '' The genius of THE GREAT CARUSO wa that the filmmaker took most of the actual life of Enrico Caruso ( really not a great story anyway ) and threw it in the trash . Instead , 90 % of the movie 's focus wa on the music . Thus MGM gave u the best living opera singer MARIO LANZA doing the music of the best-ever historic opera singer ENRICO CARUSO . The result wa a wonderful movie . Too bad LANZA would throw his life and career away on overeating . Too fat to play THE STUDENT PRINCE , Edmund Purdom took his place -- - with Lanza 's voice dubbed in , and with the formerly handsome and not-fat Lanza pictured in the advertising . If you want to see THE GREAT CARUSO , it 's almost always on eBay for $ 2.00 or le . Do n't be put off by the low price , a it reflects only the easy availability of copy , not the quality of the movie .

I attended an advance screening of this film not sure of what to expect from Kevin Costner and Ashton Kutcher ; both have delivered le than memorable performance & film . While the underlying `` general '' storyline is somewhat familiar , this film wa excellent . Both Costner and Kutcher delivered powerful performance playing extremely well off each other . The human frailty and strength of their respective character were incredibly played by both ; the scene when Costner confronts Kutcher with the personal reason why Kutcher joined the Coast Guard rescue elite wa the film 's most unforgettable emotional moment . The `` specific '' storyline wa an education in itself depicting the personal sacrifice and demanding physical training the elite Coast Guard rescuer must go through in preparation of their only job & responsibility ... to save life at sea . The special effect of the rescue scene were extremely realistic and `` wowing '' ... I have n't seen such angry sea since `` The Perfect Storm '' . Co-star Clancy Brown ( HBO 's `` Carnivale '' - great to see him again ) played the captain of the Coast Guard 's Kodiak , Alaska base in a strong , convincing role a a leader with the prerequisite and necessary ice water in his vein . The film wonderfully , and finally , give long overdue exposure and respect to the Coast Guard ; it had the audience applauding at the end .

1 ) I am not weapon expert , but even i can see difference between U.S. army riffle in WWI and WWII . In movie we can see private , armed with `` M1 Garand '' ( invented in year 1932 ! ) , not authentic `` 1903 Springfield '' ( aka `` Silent Death '' ) , who private use until WWII . Difference - M1 can load 1,5 time more ammunition and 3 time more fire rate ! M1 wa semi - automatic , Springfield requires reloading after every shot . Little difference ? ! 2 ) German army uniform ha borrowed from 1940 Year too . Especially - helmet . German helmet until end of WWI have significant pike on top , we can not see even one in movie . And if we make little additional search in archive - how much truthful is this `` True Story '' ? I am surprised , how much `` truthful '' can be film director in a pursuit of cheap propagation .
