But wait ... you 'll get to hear Andie McDowell sing ! Yeah . Hollywood really s * * t all over u with this one !

The film began with Wheeler sneaking into the apartment of his girlfriend . Her aunt ( Edna May Oliver -- a person too talented for this film ) did n't like Wheeler -- a sentiment I can easily relate to . The aunt decided to take this bland young lady abroad to get her away from Wheeler . They left and Wheeler invested in a revolution in a small mythical kingdom because they promised to make him their king . At about the same time , Woolsey wa in the same small mythical kingdom and he wa made king . So when Wheeler arrived , it wa up to the boy to fight it out , but they refused because they are already friend -- which greatly disappointed the people , a killing and replacing king is a national pastime . I am a huge fan of comedy from the Golden Age of Hollywood -- the silent era through the 1940s . I have seen and reviewed hundred , if not thousand of these film and yet despite my love and appreciation for these film I have never been able to understand the appeal of Wheeler and Woolsey -- the only comedy team that might be a bad a the Ritz Brothers ! Despite being very successful in their short career in Hollywood ( cut short due to the early death of Robert Woolsey ) , I ca n't help but notice that practically every other successful team did the same basic idea but much better . For example , there were many element of this film reminiscent of the Marx Brother 's film , DUCK SOUP , yet CRACKED NUTS never made me laugh and DUCK SOUP wa a silly and highly enjoyable romp . At time , Woolsey talked a bit like Groucho , but his joke never have punchlines that even remotely are funny ! In fact , he just seemed to prattle pointlessly . His only funny quality wa that he looked goofy -- surely not enough reason to put him on film . Additionally , Wheeler had the comedic appeal of a piece of cheese -- a piece of cheese that sang very poorly ! A missed opportunity wa the old Vaudeville routine later popularized by Abbott and Costello a `` who 's on first '' which wa done in this film but it lacked any spark of wit or timing . In fact , soon after they started their spiel , they just ended the routine -- so prematurely that you are left frustrated . I knew that `` who 's on first '' had been around for many year and used by many team , but I really wanted to see Wheeler and Woolsey give it a fair shot and give it their own twist . Once again , I have found yet another sub-par film by this duo . While I must admit that I liked a few of their film mildly ( such a SILLY BILLIES and THE RAINMAKERS -- which I actually gave 6 's to on IMDb ) , this one wa a major endurance test to complete -- something that I find happens all too often when I view the film of Wheeler and Woolsey . Where wa all the humor ? !

I wa really hoping that this would be a funny show , given all the hype and the clever preview clip . And talk about hype , I even heard an interview with the show 's creator on the BBC World Today - a show that is broadcast all over the world . Unfortunately , this show doe n't even come close to delivering . All of the joke are obvious - the kind that sound kind of funny the first time you hear them but after that seem lame - and they are not given any new treatment or twist . All of the character are one-dimensional . The acting is - well - mediocre ( I 'm being nice ) . It 's the classic CBC recipe - one that always fails . If you 're Muslim I think you would have to be stupid to believe any of the white character , and if you 're white you 'd probably be offended a little by the fact that almost all of the white character are portrayed a either bigoted , ignorant , or both . Not that making fun of white people is a problem - most of the better comedy are rooted in that . It 's only a problem when it is n't funny - a in this show . Canada is bursting with funny people - so many that we export them to Hollywood on a regular basis . So how come the producer of this show could n't find any ?

First of all `` Mexican werewolf in Texas '' is not a werewolf movie . This title is bullcrap . The story is actually about a Chupacabra that kill all the local villager in the little town of Furlough in Texas . I suppose the distributor renamed the original title so that it would make some extra buck or something . And I guess it actually work because that 's the reason why I bought this piece of crap , it sounded so stupid . Anyway the movie is n't any good . Actually it 's bloody awful . But I did n't expect anything else when I bought it . It 's a low budget horror movie with a Chupacabra monster . If you enjoy low budget horror with bad dialog , actor and some gore then you should check into this movie . But I must warn you , this movie is really baaaaaaad . This movie ha some of the worst acting I have ever seen . The actor try to hard and t it get completely ridiculous . They almost never say a line in a normal way . They always have this completely wrong tone about just everything they say . It 's so stupid it almost look like a freakin parody . It 's like they shot each scene only one single time and were happy about it . The worst of them all is the blond girl which is supposed to play a bimbo . She 's the worst of them all . I have never seen an actor a bad a her ( And I 've seen Pteradactyl ) . Even when her boyfriend dy she ca n't stop being a bimbo about it . I hate her . Some of the shot in this movie were actually quite good . The one that where shot in the daytime are all pretty decent for a low budget project . But most of the movie is shot in the night when the Chupacabra strike and the lighting is way too dark . The gore scene are few and short , but really grizzly and violent . The effect are pretty hilarious really , but that 's the way I like it . The Chupacabra look pretty messed up , and it 's easy to see that it 's a guy in suit . Overall this movie should only be watched by extreme fan of low budget flick and it 's very important to not watch this alone because you will probably be bored to death . I recommend watching this flick with your friend and some beer .

This movie is so God-awful that it wa literally a chore to watch . I wanted to eject it from my vcr and throw it across the room , but kept thinking ( foolishly ) that it would eventually get funny and then everything would be all right . `` You lose , we win , yay ! '' This movie should be required viewing for anyone who even once entertained the thought that Jackie Mason wa funny . After that , beat them ove the head with this movie until the tape crack . And if you 're even considering renting this turd ( or worse yet , have ! ) I have one thing to ask of you : did n't you even look at the cover ? I mean , with crap like this you can tell with just a glance how bad it is ! `` Oy vey ! '' This movie sucked .

The symbolic use of object , form editing , the position of character in the scene ... these were all used with such joyous abandon by Hitchcock that you can really see what a fertile genius he had . The way the wife move from one corner of the ring to the other a the fight progress , the editing when the wedding ring is placed on her finger ... while these may seem a bit obvious by today standard , in the silent era they spoke volume about the story without a word being spoken . Even the title ha a least four meaning that I can see ; the boxing ring , the wedding ring , the bracelet the lover buy , and the love triangle at the heart of the story .

I found this movie to be very good in all area . The acting wa brilliant from all character , especially Ms.Stone and Morissey . Tramell 's Character just get smarter and more psychologically twisted by the minute . The plot is interesting even though , this movie is more for the mind playing between the main character and how Catherine continues her writing with new way and twist for her novel . The setting wa also fabulous and the whole atmosphere of the movie wa that mysterious , thriller like masterpiece . Go see this film now , it deserves better than what it got from the audience , which wa misled by some faulty terrible review about the movie ( Before it even started ) ..... You wo n't regret it , if you go see it ...

Rather like Paul Newman and Steve McQueen with their racing car movie this ha all the appearance of a `` jolly '' project for Robert Redford , a he get to ski up hill and down dale in the Alpine sunshine . The story is a light a powdered snow with Redford 's small-town boy David Chappellet ( what kind of lead name is that ? ) who with his eye on the prize of Olympic glory , get up the nose of , in no particular order , his coach , father and team-mates . Women are a mere side-show in his insular world a evidenced by a fairly distasteful pick-up scene with an old girlfriend in his hometown and then his selfishly petulant pursuit of , heaven above , a free-thinking , independent woman , played by Camilla Sparv . The ski-ing sequence are fine with some good stunt-work involving numerous bump and scrape on the piste but their effectiveness is dimmed by our subsequent familiarity with top TV coverage of skiing event down to the present day . Plus I 'm not convinced that the Winter Olympics ha the same mass identification with the general public a the summer game so that when Redford eventually win his gold medal in the final reel , I could n't really be that excited for him one way or another . Of the actor , Redford , best profile forward , doe n't need to do much and indeed doe n't , while Gene Hackman doe better with equally meagre material . Ms Sparv doe well a the chief female interest well who treat Redford the way he 's doubtless treated every other woman in his chauvinistic way . In truth though , there 's a lack of dramatic tension throughout for which the action sequence do n't fully compensate and you do n't care a fig for any of the leading character . One of those film where the actor probably enjoyed making it more than the viewer did watching it .

I would recommend this film to anyone who is searching for a relaxing , fun-filled , thought-provoking movie . The absence of sex , vulgarity and violence made for a most pleasant evening . I especially enjoyed the Buffalo scene , but that 's probably because I live a short distance from there . Even so , this film could have been produced in any city ; it 's the theme that 's so important here . I 'm just grateful that Manna From Heaven dropped down on u . Try it ... you 'll like it !

This is an art film that wa either made in 1969 or 1972 ( the National Film Preservation Foundation say 1969 and IMDb say 1972 ) . Regardless of the exact date , the film definitely appears to be very indicative of this general time period -- with some camera-work and pop art stylings that are pure late 60s-early 70 . The film consists of three simple image that are distorted using different weird camera trick . These distorted image are accompanied by music and there is absolutely no dialog or plot of any sort . This wa obviously intended a almost like a form of performance art , and like most performance art , it 's interesting at first but quickly becomes tiresome . The film , to put it even more bluntly , is a total bore and would appeal to no one but perhaps those who made the film , their family and friend and perhaps a few people just too hip and `` with it '' to be understood by u mortal .

I read the book and saw the movie . Both excellent . The movie is diamond among coal during this era . Liebman and Selby dominate the screen and communicate the intensity of their character without flaw . This film should have made them star . Shame on the studio for not putting everything they had behind this film . It could have easily been a franchise . Release on DVD is a must and a worthy remake would revive this film . Look for it in your TV guide and if you see it listed , no matter how late , watch it . You wo n't be disappointed . Do yourself another favor - read the book ( same title ) . It 'll blow you away . Times have changed dramatically since those day , or at least we like to think they have .

A drifter looking for a job is mistaken for a hit man in a small Wyoming town , leading to all kind of complication . Cage is perfectly cast a the unlucky schmuck hoping to make a quick buck and get out of town but finding he ca n't escape the title town . Hopper doe what he doe best , playing a psycho known a `` Lyle from Dallas , '' the real hit man . Walsh a a crooked sheriff and Boyle a a femme fatale round out the fine cast . The script by brother John and Rick Dahl contains delicious twist and turn , and John 's direction creates a terrific `` neo noir '' atmosphere . Witty and very entertaining , it suck the viewer in from the start and never let up .

I really liked this movie . I have seen several Gene Kelly flick and this is one of his best . I would actually put it above his more famous American in Paris . Sometimes it seems the story get lost in Gene Kelly movie to the wonderful dance and song number , but not in this movie . It is definitely worth renting .

Although promoted a one of the most sincere Turkish film with an amateur cast , Ice-cream , I Scream is more like a caricature of sincerity . The plot open with the dream of Ali , a traveling ice-cream salesman in a Western Anatolia town , in which he see himself becoming successful using the same marketing method of big ice-cream company . He dream of playing in his product 's TV commercial with beautiful model in bikini , dancing around him . As his dream turn into a nightmare , he wake up with a big erection next to his gargantuan wife , who reject to make sex with him for 6 year with no apparent reason . Is it because he is not successful in his job ? Apparently , because he say he wa selling better in the old day when there wa no pressure from global ice-cream company . But this is what he say ; we actually do n't see him suffer that much : he still sell good , traveling the neighboring village while his apprentice stay at the shop , selling ice-cream to the people in the town . Ali blame big company for using sweetening and coloring agent while he is using real `` sahlep '' ( powdered root of mountain orchid ) . Ali buy a motorbike with a bank loan to be a traveling vendor , and give ad to a local TV channel which prefers to broadcast even the news bulletin in local dialect . His wife is not fond of his way of doing business , they always quarrel , and Ali threatens her that he may do very bad thing in a moment of frenzy . In a very successful day , his lousy bike is stolen by the misbehaving little boy of the town . In search of his stolen bike , Ali go to the police , blame the big company for the theft , but , of course , nobody take him seriously . Annoyed by the nagging of his wife , Ali go to a tavern and becomes drunk . One of his friend at his table , a wannabe socialist of the town , give a didactic speech and criticizes globalism , and with no real connection , jump to the subject of global freezing . Ali return home and decides to kill himself with poison . His wife wake up and prevents him . An old neighbor take him to a night walk and advises him about life . According to him , Ali can even sell hot sahlep drink if the world face with global freezing . When he return home , suddenly we see that his wife understood his value , treating him like a hero and praising his manhood . Meanwhile , the thief boy got sick eating too much ice-cream . They confess to the doctor that they stole Ali 's bike . Ali forgives them and there come the happy end . Although the plot may look promising in a way , it 's the story-telling which make this film insincere and cheesy . First , the director doe n't show much of an effort to tell the story visually ; everything is based on dialog . And the dialog never stop to show u that cinema is actually a visual art . Even Ali 's trouble are not convincing because we do n't see it , we just understand it from his word . The director market his film a a righteous fight of Ali against big ice-cream company , but there is nothing in the film about big company . We do n't see their pressure enough . The film actually ridicule Ali for believing that big company are behind the theft . And when his motorbike is found , it solves every problem : Ali becomes a happy and powerful husband . Not a real criticism of globalism . Second , the film is cheesy because of the crude humor . Maybe the people of that part of Turkey is cursing so much and making so many vulgar joke in their daily life , but vulgar language and crude humor are not enough to make a film funny . I may have accepted it if they were both vulgar and `` clever '' but they are not clever joke at all , they are just cheesy . Maybe I 'm wrong , maybe American people may like oriental version of American Pie style humor . But American Pie never had any claim to be a nominee for the Oscars , or to have a political message ! If you think that you can laugh by just seeing a man 's big erection in his short ( and we had to endure this joke twice ! ) or an old villager woman saying `` f * * k you , '' then you may find this film funny .

Stan Laurel and Oliver Hardy are the most famous comedy duo in history , and deservedly so , so I am happy to see any of their film . Ollie is recovering from a broken leg in hospital , and with nothing else to do , Stan decides to visit him , and take him some boiled egg and nut , instead of candy . Chaos begin with Stan curiously pulling Ollie 's leg cast string , and manages to push The Doctor ( Billy Gilbert ) out the window , clinging on to it , getting Ollie strung up to the ceiling . When the situation calm down , Stan get Ollie 's clothes , a the Doctor want them both to leave , and he also manages to sit on a syringe , accidentally left by the nurse , filled with a sleeping drug , which come into effect while he is driving ( which you can tell is done with a car in front of a large screen . Filled with some likable slapstick and not too bad ( although repetitive and a little predictable ) classic comedy , it is n't great , but it 's a black and white film worth looking at . Stan Laurel and Oliver Hardy were number 7 on The Comedians ' Comedian . Okay !

OK I have to admit that I quite enjoyed House of the Dead despite it well documented failing . This however wa the worst film I have seen since Demons at the Door . Compared to DATD the effect are vastly superior . However the plot is weak , the acting reminiscent of everyone 's favourite , the porn film , and the decision and action of the `` character '' consistently verge on the moronic . I feel like trying out Uwe Boll 's latest cinematic outing just to get some sense of perspective over HOTD2 . I am not suggesting that he is really the cure , more a case of a different disease , but when your sens have been insulted in such an abhorrent manner the only way is up . OK there it is . I have managed the ten line minimum and shall waste no more of our time on the waste of celluloid that is House of the dead 2 .

I wa -Unlike most of the reviewers- not born in the 80 's . I wa born on may 14th 1994 . Despite this , my life wa very much in the style of the 80 's . When other kid had playstations , I wa playing Zelda on my NES etc . Now , this movie hold a special place in my heart already despite me being only 15 year old at the time of writing this review . I , because of my 80 's style early Childhood , watched many TV show and saw Many movie that other kid did n't see , and this movie wa one of those , and one of the greatest too . It start off in the Los Angeles home of Alvin Seville , Simon Seville , Theodore Seville and David Seville . David , the Chipmunk 's adoptive father , is in a rush to get to the airport a he is going on a business trip around Europe . His taxi is almost there and The Chipmunks help him pack . While they are talking , Alvin express his will to come with Dave and to see the world ( Even though , technically Dave is only going to Europe , so to Alvin , apparently only America and Europe qualify a `` The World '' ) . David is leaving the Chipmunks in the care of Miss Miller , much to the displeasure of the boy . Soon Dave is off to the airport and the Chipmunks are left at home with Miss Miller . Later , at a local Café the Chipmunks are playing a game of `` Around the World in 30 day '' against the Chipettes ( Brittany , Jeanette and Eleanore ) . After losing the game to Brittany after having his Hot air Balloon eaten out of the sky by a crocodile , Alvin get 's in an argument with Brittany about who would really win a race around the world . Two diamond smuggler sitting at a nearby table , Klaus and Claudia Furschtien overhear their argument and , needing a safe way of transporting their diamond over the world , decide to fool the child into delivering them for them . They set up a race around the world , where each team will have to deposit a doll in their own likeness ( Secretely filled with diamond ) at drop offs around the world and receive a doll in the opposing team 's likeness ( secretely filled with the payment for the diamond ) to `` varify that they were there '' . The winning team would then receive a 100.000 dollar reward . They do this because they believe that Jamal ( An Interpol agent who ha been hot on their heel for some time now ) would never suspect them because they are just kid ( However , this seems to be redundant , because on their travel , the kid do not have to go through any security check and are never even questioned about the doll , I suspect that neither would Klaus or Claudia if they had taken the diamond there personally . ) And so begin a great adventure . This film is a classic and I see no reason why anyone would not like it . It feature great animation and top-notch voice acting , not to mention the Kick-ass music ( Pardon my french : P ) . My favorite song is without a shred of doubt `` The Girls and Boys of Rock and Roll '' An amazing rock song that can not be topped . It 's also my favorite moment in the film . Other notable song include `` Getting Lucky '' ( Kind of Suggestive for a kid 's film eh ? ) and `` My Mother '' a well a `` Wooly Bully '' and `` Off to see the world '' Not to mention the main theme of the movie heard during the opening credit performed by the Royal London Philharmonic Orchestra . The scene with `` My mother '' still brings a tear to my eye . In relation to the song `` Getting Lucky '' I first did n't think anything of it , but when I grew older and learned about life , it became clear that that song wa a little bit suggestive . That song , along with the fact that the animator insist on the audience knowing the color of the Chipettes panty . This is especially apparent in the scene in Egypt when the Chipettes are being chased by the Arabian Prince 's men , when Eleanor lean over the side of the hot air balloon basket and her skirt defies gravity completely . While this doe nothing to draw from the overall quality of the film , it 's one of those unexplained thing like why nobody in the world seems to mind that there are 4-feet tall Chipmunks walking around and speaking in incredibly high-pitched voice and treat them just like they would any human child . Anyway , A bit after that scene , the Chipettes discover the diamond in the doll and decide to go find the Chipmunks and get home . The Direction of Janice Karman perfect this movie a she and her husband , Ross Bagdasarian Jr. know the character better than anyone . They even do the voice of the Chipmunks and the Chipettes . Ross doing the voice for Alvin and Simon ( a well a Dave ) and Janice doing the voice for All the Chipettes and Theodore . Speaking of male character that are voiced by female voice actress , Nancy Cartwright ( The voice of Bart Simpson ) make an appearance in this movie . She play the part of the Arabian Prince , a very small , but important role . The ending is of course , a happy one . The Crooks have been caught , the loose end tied and The film end when the Children , Dave and Miss Miller are driving into the sunset , Alvin complaining about not having gotten his 100.000 dollar reward for winning the race , which annoys Dave until he finally yell `` ALVIN ! '' and the screen fade to black Classic ending , by the way . I hope you found my review of this movie useful , and if you have n't seen this flick , give it a watch , It 's worth the money . This Nostalgic classic from the 80 's get a solid 10 out of 10 . ''Headin ' for the top , Do n't you know ! we never stop believing now ''

Just when I thought I would finish a whole year without giving a single movie a `` Bomb '' rating , a friend brought this notorious turd to my house last night . I feared the worst knowing it reputation , and it wa a God-awful a I 'd anticipated . This is a Mexican-made mess , dubbed into English , and produced by K. Gordon Murray . It 's got terrible set and effect , and feature a rather frightening Santa who doe n't operate at the North Pole , but instead from a cloud in outer space , and who doe n't have little elf helping him make his toy but rather all different group of child from practically every country there is . The opening sequence , where St. Nick chuckle heartily a he observes monitor showing all these kiddy working hard while singing terrible holiday song in a variety of language , seems to go on forever , and with no story . Obviously , THIS Santa Claus doe n't observe the child labor law ! Eventually we get some nasty and slinky red-suited apprentice of the devil himself traveling from hell to Earth , just to make little kid naughty and turn Santa 's Christmas Eve round into a nightmare . Watching this movie is a trippy and twisted experience , and it 's bound to frighten little child and turn them off Santa Claus and the holiday forever . Oddly , the name of Jesus Christ is mentioned often in this Christmas film , which somehow make it all the creepier in the context of all the bizarre thing that are going on . This easily make my personal list of the `` Worst Movie I 've Ever Seen '' , but I 'm sure that 's nothing unique .

As is often the case when you attempt to take a 400 plus page book and cram it into a two hour film , a lot is lost . Here director John Madden ( Shakespeare in Love ) take on an extremely ambitious project and almost pull it off . What we get is a charming and emotionally compelling film that seems somehow incomplete . There is much about this film that is wonderful and fantastic . The cinematography by John Toll ( Cinematographer for Braveheart and Legends of the Fall , winning Oscars for both ) is splendid . Working with Madden , the choice for location on the Greek island of Kefallonia are superb and the visual image that come from photographing these majestic location in varying light are lush and beautiful . Madden also us numerous Greek actor a the townspeople , giving the town an authentic feel . The soundtrack is also terrific and the mandolin passage and vocal by the Italian soldier are marvelous . Madden doe an excellent job of bringing u the Italian occupation and the romance , which take up the greater part of the film . There are numerous sweet and funny moment throughout this segment . However , by the time the serious battle drama is ready to unfold , there is n't much film left in the reel and this component is extremely rushed and abbreviated . While the battle scene are well done , subsequent to the battle it is obvious that increasingly greater compromise are being made to keep the film from running too long . By the time we reach the post war scene , the treatment is merely skeletal . Another negative is that the DVD is particularly sparse on feature . Nicholas Cage is charming in the romantic lead a the sentimental Captain who seems to have joined the army to sing rather than fight . When fight he must , Cage switch gear seamlessly into a man of fierce principle and resolve and somehow remains believable in both persona . Penelope Cruz , whom the camera love , give an uninspired performance a Pelagia . In part this is because Cage so dominates the screen , but Cruz just seems too placid in a part that should be emotionally torrential and dynamic . She allows the character to be objectified a Corelli 's love interest rather than establishing her a a powerful character in her own right . John Hurt give a fantastic performance a the wise old doctor , who know a much about human nature a medicine . However , Christian Bale seems a bit overwrought and stiff a Pelagia 's fiancé . I rated this film an 8/10 . Despite some drawback , this is a touching film that is well worth seeing . The photography alone is worth the price of admission .

My father grew grew up watching George Reeves a Superman and when I wa a little kid he had episode on VHS and let me view them including this movie ( passing them down in the family if you will ) , and I loved it . Clark Kent and Lois Lane get sent to a small town with and oil mine and from the mine emerge mole men radioactive and targeted by the town assumed to be deadly and it 's up to Superman to stop this mayhem . It 's just so wonderful and fun to view . The old style special effect and sound - the crew pulled off such a beauty with such little technology . George Reeves wa my hero when I wa a little kid , and I 'm 16 now , it just go to show how timeless and classic these adventure are .
This unpretentious Horror film is probably destined to become a cult classic . Much much better than 90 % of the Scream rip-off out there ! I even hope they come up with a sequel !

I read the book before watching the movie and it left me emotionally drained but I felt that it truly transported me to Afghanistan , a culture I know very little about . I had great hope for this movie and it did not disappoint . I watched this with someone who did n't read the book and he also enjoyed it . They had to shorten some thing in the movie but it wa a well acted and well shot film . It leaf you thinking about the movie long after it is over . You feel for the character and their plight . I highly recommend this movie to those who like emotionally draining drama and want to experience Afghani culture . There are some disturbing scene not suitable for child to watch . It is a heavy drama depicting the horror of life under a restrictive regime .

Years ago , Sara , a young girl witnessed her parent being murdered , now a an adult she suffers from various mental ailment ( did I mention she ha an imaginary friend ? ) This film lull the viewer , not into a sense of tension , mind you , but rather a sense of sleepiness . Deathly boring , I found it hard to sit through a I could feel my eyelid growing heavier and heavier with each endless minute of mindless prattle and supposed 'mystery ' . Is Sara going crazy ? or is it the paranormal ? A better question would be , Who care ? And the answer to that , no one . No one at all . Skip this film , save yourself some time better suited to do other more worthwhile task . My Grade : D-

In short if you want to watch Burt Reynolds best film than this one must be included . If you do n't like Burt you may still like this . If you love Burt this may become one of your favorite movie of all time ! Being from Atlanta it doe hit home but it 's also nice to see a cop/action/drama that take place somewhere other than NY City , Chicago , Miami , or LA . The film is funny at point with & good plot & good performance from a great supporting cast ( every character is real & the bad guy are not so one sided they are really well thought out ) A nice offbeat romance in the 2nd half & it ha some good old fashion shootout & fistfight ( no CGI thank God REAL ACTION ! ) If Clint Eastwood did his best impression of a Burt Reynolds movie with `` Every Which Way But Loose '' & `` Any Which Way You Can '' then Burt responded with his best Clint type flick with this , & it come off great !

I have watched Love Jones over thirty time . It is one of the rare film that depict a love story about people who happen to be African-Americans . The dialogue wa realistically written , and delivered with honesty . It wa so nice to see a film where the story line centered on young professional African-Americans . This is virtually an untapped market . Love Jones wa visually captivating a well . The chemistry between Lorenz Tate and Nia Long will bring memory of past and present love . The feeling of the film is jazz and blue , and brings to mine the sensuality of a warm creamy hot chocolate with a splash of Kahlua and Butterscotch . If you had n't guessed , I loved it !

The basic genre is a thriller intercut with an uncomfortable menage-a-trois . Fellowes ha tried to make a lot more out of this , using the lie of the title in order to bring about all manner of small twist , invariably designed to surprise the character more than the audience . It 's really rather messy though . Fellowes doe n't seem interested presenting the thriller element in a fashion that will keep u seat-edged . Rather his focus is on the moral predicament themselves . The dialogue is inconsistent , stagey here , vernacular there and with the constant surprise of realism undone by the occasional cliché-landmine . Though there is no fussing over the location so that the actor can get on with existing in their space the dreadful score ca n't create a further dimension and often work against the emotional momentum of given set piece . There 's also a very prosaic , dare I say it British feel to the filming . I did n't want to see a document of two successful middle class people caught in an extraordinary situation , I wanted to see some sort of artful recounting of the story . Finally it is , in fact , the story which let the rest down . Just a the element of suspense are rather flat so the story is an asymmetric sum of subplots of different shape and size , woven a a vehicle for character examination . Wilkinson and Watson support this meta-essay with good performance and John Warnaby 's ebullient colleague Simon to Wilkinson is a welcome foil for much of the brow-furrowing . I 'm disappointed ; not that it 's bad , but that it could have been much better . 3/10

This is absolutely the best movie I have ever watched . At the age of 12 I wa up late and ran across the movie . It wa on the USA channel , Gilbert Godfrey 's Up All Night . I will never forget . At the time my friend and I were really struggling with different issue , some sexual . You know 12 is a very rough and weird age . It seems you are stuck in between being a little girl , and being a young lady . This movie really helped to answer a lot of question for me . I now have a daughter that is 12 . Have been searching for a couple year for this movie . If it ever doe come out on DVD I would be the first to buy . Would recommend for any parent to watch this with their child when they reach that very rough and difficult age .

Holes is an awesome movie . I love it a lot and it 's one of my favorite film . It 's one of the few flick produced by Disney that is n't cheesy . Holes is generally a very cool motion picture . I wish Disney would make more picture like it . Holes is indeed a rare breed of Disney flicker show that is cool . Do n't get the wrong idea , I do n't mean to bad mouth Disney but most of it 's stuff is aimed towards kid and THAT 'S OKAY . Children deserve to have their entertainment too . But Disney ha been guilty of trying to appeal to the teen audience and they usually fail . But not with Holes . It 's the type of movie anyone of any age can watch and enjoy and not once think it 's corny . Really , it 's the kind of movie that even a lot of young hood might enjoy since there are character in it that they can relate to . Holes doe a good job of being a mix of good family entertainment but not being too cheesy and living a little on the edge . I hope Disney take more risk and make more edgy flick like this .

I can not hate on the show . When the old ( and better ) tech TV had to hit the brick , the channel wa reformatted and new show stepped in . `` Attack of the Show '' is the replacement for the Screen Savers , with 3 co-hosts in the beginning . They were Kevin Rose , Kevin Pereira and Sarah Lane . Brendan Moran came to be something of a co-host a well , but he mostly did prerecorded piece for the show . Kevin Rose decided to leave the show , and eventually there wa a contest to see who would be the third host , but that did n't pan out for some reason . Eventually ( I just learned this from this very IMDb messageboard ) Sarah Lane and Brendan Moran moved on because ( hey , this is what I read ) the two got married . That wa a big secret to me ! Now there is a new female co-host , the not-as-hot ( my opinion ) Olivia Munn . She 's hiding something in those top she wear , while Sarah Lane had a perfect body and she wa n't afraid to show it . AHEM ! Sorry . `` Attack of the Show '' deal with everything young people want to know about . It 's music , movie , comic book , the internet and television . This is what 's great about the show . If you do n't want to bother with scouring the net or waste time watching MTV , you can get all you want on AOTS . Some segment and bit they do are funny . They have regular guest and contributor who are in the industry , a well a guest who range from insignificant internet star to actual big name . Even though the host are n't a geek a I 'd like them to be , I still have found `` Attack of the Show '' to be entertaining , even with it latest lineup .

Some people may call `` Cooley High '' the same sort of thing a `` American Graffiti '' , but I would n't . For starter , in `` AG '' , everyone wa white , whereas in `` CH '' they 're all black . Moreover , this one ha a Motown soundtrack . Specifically , the movie focus on several working-class African-American student in 1964 Chicago and their antic . The movie deal mainly with home life and relationship . In their apartment , we see that there 's never any dad around . But these young men always know how to live life to the fullest . One thing that really distinguishes this movie from most other portrayal of black people is that the teenager in this movie are portrayed a very responsible , worrying about missing school . Two really funny scene are the gorilla scene , and the one white guy in the movie . But overall , the main star is the soundtrack . It is truly one of the best soundtrack in movie history ( we even have it on vinyl here at home ) . A classic in the real sense of the word .

So wonderful , so quirky , so romantic , so Italian . The film is so feather -light you float off into it refracted reality and you never want to return to the humdrum again . A kitchen sink world of bakery , and hairdresser , and plumbing , but one that shimmer with a soft luminescence . Should the credit go to the screenplay or the direction ? Take your pick -- they 're both faultless . Let me get back to that New York City that lie just beyond the looking glass .

This film is , quite simply , brilliant . The cinematography is good , the acting superb and the story absolutely breathtaking . This is the story of Donald Woods , a white South African who thought himself a liberal until he found out the reality of apartheid . Kevin Kline is completely convincing - so much so that when Donald Woods himself appeared on TV some year later , I recognised him from Kline 's portrayal . Denzel Washington also turn in a masterful performance , a ever . I urge you to watch this . It is long , but it is worth your patience because it tell such an incredible story . Remember , folk , this really happened .

I have recently seen this production on DVD . It is the first time I have seen it since it wa originally broadcast in 1983 and it wa just a good a I remembered . At first a wa worried it would seem old fashioned and I suppose it is a little dated and very wordy a the BBC serial were back then . ( I miss those wonderful costume drama that seemed to be always on Sunday afternoon back then ) But that aside it is a near perfect a it could have been . I am a bit of a `` Jane Eyre '' purist a it is my favourite book and have never seen another production that is a faithful to the book a this one . I have recently re-read the book a well and some of the dialogue is just spot on . Reading the scene near the end where Rochester question Jane about what St John wa like I noticed their word were exactly reproduced on screen by Dalton and Clarke and done perfectly . All the other production that have been done all seem lacking in some way , some even leave out the `` Rivers '' family and their connection to Jane altogether . I also think this is the only production to include the `` Gypsy '' scene done correctly . The casting is perfect , Zelah Clarke is like Jane is described in the book `` small plain and dark '' and I disagree that she looked too old . Timothy Dalton may be a little too handsome but he is absolutely perfect a Rochester , portraying every aspect of his character just right and acting his sock off ! I agree with other comment that he even appears quite scary at time , like in the scene when he turn around slowly at the church when the wedding is interrupted , his expression is fantastically frightening . But then in another favourite scene his joy is wonderful to see when Jane run down the stair and into his arm the morning after they declare their love for one another . A love that is wonderfully portrayed and totally believable . Oh to be loved by a man like that ! There were a couple of scene that were strangely missing however , like when Jane climb in to bed with the dying Helen and also when Rochester take Jane shopping for her wedding thing ( I thought that one wa in it but maybe my memory is playing trick ) . Finally if you never see another production of Jane Eyre - you simply most see this one it is simply perfection !

In a time of bad , if not plain awful , comedy , King of Queens is more than just a breath of fresh air , it 's a complete oxygen tank ! It is in my opinion one of the 5 best comedy show of all time . Nothing ha been this good since Married with Children . Kevin James and Jerry Stiller are comic genius ! And believe me , it take a lot to make me label someone a comic genius . These guy truly understand what is funny . I could watch ten episode of Seinfeld and would n't get half the laugh from seeing KOQ just once . Other funny people in this show are Carrie , Janet Heffernan , Spence and Doug Pruzan ( Carrie 's bos ) . I 'm so happy they managed to get so many season from this gem . The show ha been a hilarious winner in a time of mostly comic loser . Check it out if you have n't ! !

PREY Aspect ratio : 1.37:1 Sound format : Mono A lesbian couple ( Sally Faulkner and Glory Annan ) living in a remote country house are driven apart by the arrival of a young man ( Barry Stokes ) who turn out to be a flesh-eating alien , the vanguard of a massive invasion ... Despite it shoestring budget and leaden pacing , Norman J. Warren 's follow-up to SATAN 'S SLAVE ( 1976 ) amount to a great deal more than the sum of it meager part , thanks to a surprisingly complex script by Max Cuff ( apparently , his only writing credit ) : Faulkner and Annan indulge an obsessive relationship whilst living in isolated splendor within the English countryside ( rendered alternately beautiful and ominous by Derek V. Browne 's eye-catching cinematography ) , though Annan 's discovery of bloodstained clothing in an upstairs room mark one ( or both ) of these doe-eyed lovely a psychologically disturbed , which may explain the absence of their respective family , some of whom appear to have lived in the house at one time or another and 'left ' under mysterious circumstance . Stokes ' unexpected arrival throw the relationship into disarray , partly because Faulkner ha a pathological hatred of men and partly because Annan is attracted to him , creating tension which result in a climactic whirlwind of violence . There 's an extraordinary , multi-layered sequence in which Faulkner attempt to 'emasculate ' their clueless visitor by dressing him in woman 's clothing , though Stokes ' alien mentality allows him to rise above the intended mockery . In the early scene , at least , the relationship between Faulkner and Annan is depicted with uncommon grace and dignity , but this heartfelt sapphic liaison quickly devolves into crowd-pleasing episode of sex and pulchritude , culminating in an explosion of horror when Annan allows herself to be ravished by Stokes following a violent argument with Faulkner . The closing sequence are ( quite literally ) gut-wrenching , especially Annan 's final scene , which appears to have been clipped for censorship reason in 1977 and never fully restored ( what remains is still pretty vivid , so brace yourselves ! ) . Excellent performance by the three lead , bolstered by Warren 's unobtrusive direction , which take full advantage of the stunning woodland location , thereby compensating for the film 's budgetary shortcoming . Originally released in the US a ALIEN PREY .

The tourist season ha just ended on a remote island off the coast of Scotland , winter is beginning to set in and the inhabitant , both human and sheep alike are settling down to much quieter time ahead . Michael Gaffikin ( James Warwick ) a former paratrooper in the British Army , is the local dentist , he 's not an islander by birth and a such his relationship with local artist and cartographer Fiona Patterson ( Celia Imrie ) is always being viewed with a little suspicion , not maliciously , but just out of the protective instinct the tight knit community have for their kin . The island serenity is broken when Gaffikin out for a solitary round of golf find the headless remains of a brutally slain woman . He immediately report his gruesome find to Insp Inskip ( Maurice Roëves ) at the island police station , Inskip arranges for delivery of the remains to local GP , Dr Goudry , for closer inspection . A quick search for the killer prof fruitless , a doe a search for a missing local woman . Over dinner that night with Michael Gaffikin , Fiona realises that the dead woman might be Sheila Anderson , a woman from the mainland , who life on the island through the winter month . A quick search at her home Dove Cottage reveals the missing remains of her body , her home proving to be the murder scene , but why did the killer drag her torso over a mile into the wood ? Suspicion immediately fall on the one stranger left on the island , one Colonel Howard ( Jonathan Newth ) who also happened be the last person to see her alive a they came across on the last ferry together . Goudry asks Gaffikin for some dental expertise on the victim body , it reveals that she had been torn apart my somebody or something with great strength , one set of teeth mark on the body seem to point at a human killer , another point to that of an unknown animal of some kind . A sheep is found mutilated and then a Canadian ornithologist is found slain . With a heavy fog rolling in , the island is cut off from the mainland and any possibility of help , the radio also doe n't work , seemingly being blocked and the phone line have been cut . Reports of UFO 's and the sighting of a camouflaged soldier are compounded by the finding of an odd looking craft hidden behind rock on the beach . Inskip is confused and refuse to listen to anything but the fact and laugh off Gaffikin 's idea that alien might be involved , but a rise in radioactive level on the island , ha him doubting himself . The Nightmare Man is based on the novel , Child of the Vodyanoi by David Wiltshire , it is here adapted by Dr Who and Blake 's 7 scriptwriter Robert Holmes and directed by Douglas Camfield who also had directing experience on both Sci/Fi classic and the film benefit from having such experienced genre expert on board . The Nightmare Man though is on the whole , a succinctly better crafted piece , that build it plot alongside solid character development , even down to the minor character , time is given to giving them all a firm background . The island setting is perhaps a genre cliché that ha been used over and over , but it one that I enjoy very much , the remoteness , the sense of being under siege with no way out always add to the atmosphere and here it is given an extra oomph by having an impenetrable fog close in to hamper all effort . In many genre effort of this kind it is very easy for proceeding to get silly and for the plot to resort to melodrama , but credit to Camfield , he hold it all together with the emphasis being on believability at all time . There is an authenticity about proceeding , the character even speaking Gaelic at time to further this point . If there is one negative about the killer it that , we are given his/her/its POV for the killing , an acceptable cliché on it own , but when seen through a red filter and a fish eye lens , it just scream of overkill and date the film just a little . Still though you will be hard pressed to guess the outcome or the identity or for that matter the specie of the killer , given the clue presented , but it 's a fun and very well acted piece . The local Scottish cast are exceptional , the local bobby Roeves and Cosmo in particular spar well off each other and are a delight to behold . Imrie , never one i 've taken to in other work , is also pretty good and display hew womanly physique a if she were in a Hammer production . The outlandish , maybe even preposterous ending may irk some viewer , it disappointed me in some way , but taking into account when it wa made , it an understandable and acceptable addendum that if you think about it , is even more terrifying .

This review also contains a spoiler of the first movie -- so if you have n't seen either movie and want to but do n't want the spoiler , please do n't read this review ! While this movie is supposed to be about Christian and Kathryn meeting for the first time , the movie is a poor copy of the first Cruel Intentions . The actor that they had portray Ryan Phillippe 's Christian and Sarah Michelle Gellar 's Kathryn are very poor substitute indeed . Neither can pull off the smarmy , snooty rich-kid attitude that the original actor did . It 's absolutely appalling that some of the dialog wa verbatim -- not so much between Christian and Kathryn , but if you listen closely enough you 'll recognize it . There are also inconsistency in the plot - if this were truly the first meeting of Christian and Kathryn , then why is it that Christian fell in love with a girl at the end of the movie ? He supposedly wa supposed to be in love for the first time in the original movie ( with Reese Witherspoon 's character ) . Also , the tie-in with the photography/ '' You could be a model '' comment at the end wa totally lame and did n't add anything at all . Overall , this movie wa a waste of time . I ca n't believe they made a Cruel Intentions 3 .

This movie is ridiculous . It 's attempting to be a comedy but the screenplay is horrible . The whole movie is done in low light and you cant grasp the fact that it 's a comedy . Truly is bad cinematography . You really have to sit there and watch it to realize there 's a few joke here and there going on but either way they 're all inside joke amongst themselves . This is more like a wannabe drama flick that went bad . It really is a very pointless movie.Their expression reveal nothing but dismay and disaster which turn out that way anyway . Unless you want to be bored out of your as , I suggest you stay away from this gag of a movie .

In dramatising Wilde 's novel , John Osborne ha condensed event , eliminated a number of character , and generally implied rather than shown Dorian 's essential wickedness . If you want a more explicit rendering , see the 1945 film . Wilde and Robert Louis Stevenson lived in about the same time frame , but were certainly vastly different men and writer . This story really treat of a theme similar to Stevenson 's `` Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde '' , but note that Wilde chose to treat his story a fantasy , whereas RLS took the scientific route . Both the protagonist are men in whom good war with evil , with evil winning in the end . The actor in this BBC movie , take a different route , too , from those in the 1945 film . John Gielgud say all the same caustic and cynical quip a George Sanders , in his role really projecting Wilde himself , but with a subtle difference . You 'll suspect that Sanders really believed what he wa saying , but Gielgud may be saying what is expected of him rather than what he sincerely belief . Peter Firth , too , show the two side of his character in restrained fashion , but then we do n't get to see a many of his escapade a Hurd Hatfield had a chance to display . It 's a very good production , with the dramatisation reflecting the essential of the novel , if not all of it ramification .

It start out like a very serious social commentary which quickly make one think of other Clark movie like Kids , Bully , etc . But then just a quickly , it unravels into a direction-less mess . Who is the main character ? Is this a serious film or some Gregg Araki-esquire over the top goofy film ? Is this a skate documentary with moment of dialog inserted ? I have no clue . I found myself watching the clock and wonder when this turd wa going to end . I kept thinking there would be some big shocker culmination which never came . I cut a good 20 minute out of the movie by fast forwarding through the pointless skate scene . Yes , it illustrates the changing landscape between the have 's have not 's . I got it way back in the beginning . Kids and Bully wa done in such a way that I actually felt like I wa observing the reality of that group of friend . Wassup felt very staged , poorly constructed and ever worse acting . Teenage Caveman , which Larry did n't write but did direct , wa terrible . But at least it felt like it wa suppose to be a terrible movie that did n't take itself seriously . Wassup Rockers wa just plain bad .

This is my first Deepa Mehta film . I saw the film on TV in it Hindi version with it `` Sita '' character presented a Nita . I also note that it is Radha who underwent the allegorical trial by fire in the film and not Nita/Sita . Yet what I loved about the film wa it screenplay by Ms Mehta , not her direction . The character , big and small , were well-developed and seemed quixotic towards the end -- somewhat like the end of Mazursky 's `` An Unmarried Woman . '' They are brave woman surrounded by cardboard men . And one cardboard man ( Ashok ) seems to come alive in the last shot we see of him -- -carrying his invalid mother Biji . He seems to finally take on a future responsibility beyond celibacy and adherance to religion . Ms Mehta seems to fumble a a director ( however , compared to most Indian mainstream cinema she would seem to be brilliant ) a she can not use her script to go beyond the microscopic joint family she is presenting except presenting a glimpse of the Chinese micro-minority in the social milieu of India . She even dedicates the film to her mother and daughter ( not her father ! ) Yet her Radha reminesces of halcyon day with both her parent in a mustard field . Compare her to Mrinal Sen , Adoor Gopalakrishnan , Muzaffar Ali and she is dwarfed by these giant -- given her competent Canadian production team and financial resource ! Mehta 's film of two bisexual lady in an Indian middle-class household may be sacrilege to some , but merely capture the atrophy of middle-class home that doe not seem to aspire for something better than it immediate survival in a limited social space . Kannada , Malayalam , and Bengali film have touched parallel theme in India but did not have the publicity that surrounded this film and therefore have not been seen by a wide segment of knowledgeable cinemagoers . Ms Das , Ms Azmi , Mr Jafri and Mr Kharbanda are credible but not outstanding . Ms Azmi is a talented actress who gave superb performance under good director ( Mrinal Sen 's `` Khandar '' , Gautam Ghose 's `` Paar '' , Benegal 's `` Ankur '' ) a brilliance notably absent in this film . Ms Das sparkled due to her screen presence rather than her acting capability . All in all , the film 's strength remains in the structure of the screenplay which is above average in term of international cinema . I am sure Ms Mehta can hone her writing talent in her future screenplay .

At 2:37 , a high school student commits suicide . Not shown who ha taken their life or reason known , time skip back to the start of the day . From here we follow six separate student ; Marcus , Melody , Luke , Steven , Sarah and Sean . Each student is struggling with their own moral dilemma , all reaching boiling point , hitting to an end for one . After losing a friend to suicide , and surviving his own suicide attempt , writer/director Murali K. Thalluri ha created a revetting drama focusing on teen life and the horrible act of suicide . Suicide ha been a topic that ha been kept in the shadow , 2:37 is Thalluri 's attempt to bring it to light . If you have been touched by the act of suicide or anyone who ha , 2:37 becomes all the harder to view . With heavy and hard subject matter , Thalluri also tackle everyday teenage life crisis 's . Sex , pregnancy , sexual identity , bullying , friendship , Thalluri manages and show them in an extremely realistic manner . The factor on Thalluri 's talent is his subtlety . He respect his subject and the problem that everyone will have suffered through at sometime . It verge near documentary at time , it ha such a painful realism ; the interview with each character spliced through the film only heightens this . 2:37 ha a distinctive similarity to Gus Van Sants film Elephant . While the core of each film is different , both tackle teen life . Like Sant , Thalluri utilizes long tracking shot , with time skipping back and forth , to show each character interaction from different perspective . A defining point to Elephant wa it ethereal ambiance . With spare conversation , little development of character , and the long tracking shot , Sant created a haunting and mesmerizing atmosphere to a coming dread . While there resides this dread in 2:37 , the emotional connection to the character reach a higher level Sant could n't reach . As time go by , each character fragility creep out , dragging you along their emotional roller-coaster . The real hit in this film come with the inevitable suicide , foretold at the very beginning . The hard part about this scene is the complete intrusion and discomfort we have a an audience watching someone life end in a gruesome fashion . Though many film that have shown suicide , gloss over the act or romanticizes the act . Thalluri show the pain and agony involved with this act and that it not the best solution . With unknown in the lead and their first major role ; Teresa Palmereach , Frank Sweet , Joel Mackenzie , Marni Spillane , Charles Baird and Sam Harris all show immense talent and promising acting career . Compelling and revetting , 2:37 is an absolutely unmissable film .

The quote above just about say it all for `` Slipstream '' . I should have bailed out of this film after the first half hour , but decided I ought to be fair and give it a chance . I wo n't watch it again , so if anyone with the temerity to do so can get back to me with the number of clichéd line in the movie , I 'm sure it will set a record . Some otherwise fine and talented actor got mixed up with this clunker ; Mark Hamill portrays a futuristic bounty hunter and Bill Paxton is his quarry . Paxton 's character ha hijacked Hamill 's prisoner , an android taking his name from the poet Byron ( Bob Peck ) . Tasker ( Hamill ) shoot Owens ( Paxton ) with a dart containing a tracking device so he and his companion Belitski ( Kitty Aldridge ) can keep tab on the pair . The real question though is why did n't he just fire the device at Byron thereby cutting out the middleman . If you enjoy scene after disjointed scene with tedious characterization and artsy fartsy pretense , then I suppose you 'll find something of interest here . But you ca n't convince me that the film make sense on any level . Scenes of a futuristic Stone Age make way for high society snobbery , but the pinnacle of poor taste is reached when Paxton 's character is displayed following a night of revelry with hickey all over his torso . If anyone think there 's some hidden meaning here , you 're really stretching . Patiently waiting for the frame proclaiming `` The End '' to come into view , ala , even that wa denied . If beauty is in the eye of the beholder , then so is understanding ; this movie had neither . Yet there wa a single redeeming feature a the closing credit began their run - an awesome view of a half dozen hot air balloon . Apparently the film wa keeping them afloat .

Director Edward Sedgwick , an old hand at visual comedy , successfully lead this Hal Roach road show which tender a fast-moving and adroit scenario and excellent casting , employing a large number of Roach 's reliable performer . Although the film wa originally plotted a a vehicle for Patsy Kelly , sunny Jack Haley star a Joe Jenkins , a young Kansan who sell his auto repair business and journey to Hollywood , where he attempt to wangle a screen role for the girl he love , star-struck Cecilia ( Rosina Lawrence ) . Sedgwick , who prefers using the entire M-G-M studio a his set , doe so here a Cecilia , always ready for an audition , is treated by a would-be paramour , cinema star Rinaldo Lopez ( Mischa Auer ) , to behind-the-scenes action of , naturally , a musical comedy , featuring Broadway headliner Lyda Roberti . Laurel and Hardy provide several enjoyable interlude , including their well-known skit involving a tiny harmonica , and we watch fine turn by such a Joyce Compton , Russell Hicks and Walter Long . On balance , one must hand the bay to Mischa Auer , who clearly steal the picture a an emotional movie star , a role which he largely creates , and to the director for his clever closing homage to Busby Berkeley 's filmic spectacle .

The joke are obvious , the gag are corny , and the character are walking characatures - but I could n't stop from laughing at his highly entertaining movie . No matter how many time I see it , I still get a kick out of this one , and I recommend it highly for all lover of mindless entertainment . It contains many quotable moment , and some of the best sight-gags I 've seen to this day . If you 've had a bad week and you need a chuckle , rent this one on your way home Friday night to give your weekend a good start .

These slasher pic are past their sell by date , but this one is good fun . The valentine card themselves are witty , and well thought out . The film ha one Peach of a line ... `` He 's no Angel .... '' when he in fact IS Angel ! ! ! Watching Buffy rerun will never be the same ! The cast is a sizzling display of young talent , but the story doe not give them enough real depth . Denise Richards on the DVD extra seemed to think the girl on set bonded well together and this would give the feeling that you empathised with their character . Sorry but NO ! The direction is very good , managing to show very little actual gore , and relying on your imagination implied threat . Much can be said also for the similar manner in which Miss Richards and Heigel do not remove their clothes ... : - ( Essentially , the main directorial plus , lie within the `` borrowing '' of various other idea from previous slasher flick . Psycho 's shower scene is tributed , along with Halloween 's `` masking '' . Murdering someone hiding in a bodybag though is a pretty original one a far a I know ! ! ! Light viewing , not very scary but a few good jump moment . If it wa a choice between The Hole and this though , choose The Hole . Slasher movie have had their day , and this is just another slasher . A very good slasher , but nothing groundbreaking ! ! !

The only reason I gave this episode of `` Masters of Horror '' a 2 instead of a 1 is because the two lead actor are good , and it wa n't shot on VHS . The story , the dialog , and the plot are ridiculous . Talking / Driving zombie who come back to vote and sway the political tide against the war ! Give me a break ! What next , zombie who come back to go skydiving ? Maybe zombie who come back to host QVC show ? I never supported the Iraq war , but I do support the courage and sacrifice of the men and woman of our armed force ; and `` Homecoming '' wa disrespectful in that it mock the TRUE horror of war . With zombie being mass produced in today 's market ... this is the SPAM of zombie-related entertainment . How `` Homecoming '' made it onto `` Masters of Horror '' is beyond me .

Like most , I thought 'another crocodile movie ' . So far we 've had Primeval and Rogue in the last 12 month , what can they do that 's new ? Where both those film were about action and violence , this one 's about fear and tension . The performance are n't Oscar-worthy when there 's nothing going on , but in time of distress or terror , these people suffer so much it 's like torture . There are hole in the plot and maybe crocs do n't really behave like this a others have pointed out , but the fear is so effective it 's a stretch to say you 'll enjoy this movie . It 'll leave you feeling a uncomfortable a The Passion of the Christ .

There are a couple of prior comment here which opine about this flick 's abundance of clichés throughout -- and I agree completely , both with regard to the character AND the dialog . I 'd read about Elizabeth Berkly 's awful performance in the equally-awful `` Showgirls , '' which I 've never seen - and her performance here , while not awful , is barely up to the standard of Lifetime 's worse fare . There wa not a hint of depth to her character , but then there probably should n't have been . If so , it would have placed the film completely out-of-balance , since there wa n't a hint of depth or charisma - not a trace - in any one character , performer , or portrayal . The principal 's handling of Liz 's initial complaint after her tutee had kissed her in the hall wa laughable . Her husband 's initial reaction and advice were likewise ( Forrest Gump , attacking Jenny 's boyfriend in his car provided a more realistic , intelligent action , and , hell , he wa mentally-challenged ) . The smarmy , unctuous lawyer ( excuse the redundancy ) father of the lying student actually performed something probably worthy of praise in his performance : he wa both laughable and thoroughly annoying at the same time , no mean feat . Her attorney wa more of an insensitive nerd , also not unknown in the profession . Finally ( and frankly , I rather enjoyed this part ) , the police were such a collection of insensitive oaf , that you 'd rather depend upon Barney Fife , without Andy , to handle all law enforcement and investigation in your community . I know that most real-like cop fall a bit short of the sharpness , intelligence and empathy of the level displayed by most character on the `` Law and Order '' series ' , and the like -- but dolt of this level seem to be a staple on `` Lifetime . '' Finally , I found a kind of `` story within a story '' fascination with Josh 's concoction of his being the `` victim '' of his teacher . This scripted performance within the story wa even worse than his overall performance in the main story . This wa something of an achievement , like going from `` F '' to `` F-minus . '' This whole lame situation should have been resolved - in real life - in about 15 minute , following a realistic meeting between teacher and school authority , with husband involved . But then that would have precluded the contrived drama following , and left an hour 's blank film in the camera . But the writer ( s ) here , proved with their ending , they could do even worse . When the situation wa finally `` resolved '' and `` righted , '' this wa accomplished in all of about 45 second , with no indication of what measure might have been forthcoming in any `` real world '' context for the perpetrator and his parent , or whether they might have been able to find some sort of path toward redemption . This one 's a 2 * presentation ; the second `` * '' because it doe have some mild `` fascination . ''

If you have n't seen this yet , you really should , on DVD . I ca n't believe how much I enjoyed it ! It is amazingly realistic and believable . True , much of it is speculated , and I would have liked to have known more about what wa speculative and what were proven fact ( there are n't many of them ) , but it handle everything quite well with a `` Cruel Mother Nature '' theme . It will remind you of the nature program that you 've seen on Animal Planet and the Discovery Channel , only the animal here are Dinosaurs . They act natural ; they eat , kill , mate , play , and fight for survival . You will actually find yourself rooting for some of them and against others . For the most part , the effect are excellent . At time they will look a little too much like CGI 's , but then you will see them in a different angle that make them look more realistic . In some case , you will actually be convinced that you 've seen a dinosaur . My favorite were the Coelophysis , the raptor , the diplodocus , the iguanadons , the allosaurus and the arctic biped . I wa most disappointed with the T-Rex , however , which looked a little too computer generated at time . In any case , you should definitely see this production . It is educational , well made , and very entertaining . For what it is , it an A !

Why is it that Canada can turn out decent to good movie in every genre , other then action ? I caught Dragon Hunt on TV the other day and it wa like a train wreck . I just could not change the channel , it 's sheer stupidity sapped my willpower . Its pretty telling that the cast IMDb `` credit '' with this monstrosity apparently never worked again . Bad acting , bad writing , bad narration , bad music , bad hair , bad cinematography . It just go on and on . The movie really ha nothing to recommend it . If you 're looking for bad action film to enjoy by laughing out , there are a tonne of other film that wo n't require you to scorch out your retina afterwards . I hope this film did n't get money from the government for financing , otherwise I 'm never paying tax again .

Ab Tak Chhappan is a fictitious story surrounding a police department in Mumbai , India . Sadhu Agashe is a hard working , hard-edged cop heading up a plain clothed crime squad who make a name for himself by killing dangerous criminal in staged police encounter rather than locking them up in prison . His loyal officer obey him without question but a rift form when one of his officer , Imtiaz , becomes frustrated by Sadhu 's high ranking status and is secretly competing with him for criminal kill and status . A new recruit is also pushed into the fraternity and Imtiaz is angry when Sadhu allows him to take the lead on his first case . Further change come in the form of a new police commissioner who disapproves of Sadhu 's tactic and everyone get caught up in internal politics . I wa surprised to see such a well directed action thriller coming from India . The camera work is excellent , the story is well told and the tension is high when the drama unfolds . The acting , pace and political subterfuge convinces the viewer that they are a fly on the wall witnessing the blood , sweat and tear from a close up and personal view and that the event are based on reality which is no doubt why we are told that it is not at the beginning of the film although it is likely that the director , Shimit Amin , ha taken liberty with factual account . Nevertheless , Ab Tak Chhappan is an extremely polished piece of film-making .

Lackawanna Blues is and excellent movie . The casting wa perfect . Every actor and actress wa perfectly suited for the role they played . Their chemistry together wa amazing . The acting wa superb . I felt a if i knew the character . I could almost 'feel ' them . They reminded me of people that I knew a a child growing up in the 50 's and 60 's . Oh , the memory ! ! My personal belief is that this movie should have been on the big screen for all to see . I have watched this movie so many time , that I can almost recite the line a the character are saying them . I ca n't even list my favorite part , because I have SO MANY favorite part . Thank you for bringing back a part of my youth that I never see in this day and age ... and that is Black people loving each other , looking out for each other , respecting each other , caring about each other , and doing all we can to help each other . Got ta go now . I have to go watch it again .

Saturday June 3 , 6:30pm The Neptune Monday June 5 , 4:30pm The Neptune Few celebration of ethnic and cultural identity succeed a mightily a Carlos Saura 's brilliant interpretation of Isaac Albeniz ' masterpiece Iberia Suite . At the approach of it centennial , Saura drew together an unprecedented wealth of talent from the Spanish performing art community to create this quintessential love song to their homeland . The twelve `` impression '' of the suite are presented without narrative in stark surroundings , allowing the power of each performance to explode before Saura 's camera . Creative use of large flat and mirror , moved throughout the set , combined with screen , shadow , fire , rain and rear projection add glorious dramatic effect to the varied selection of song , dance and instrumental performance . Photographs of Albeniz reappear throughout the program , connecting the passion of the music to it great creator . Saura encompasses all Spaniards on his stage from the beautiful elegance of elderly flamenco dancer in traditional costume to child joyously dancing with their instructor .

Many of the review and comment I have read about this movie say that this is a rather stale film and performance by Clara Bow . Although the story-line wa rather typical of Clara 's later silents , I still find it somewhat heart-stirring and incredibly fun . Clara play a happy-go-lucky Hawaiian girl who will stop at nothing to win the man she love ... never mind that this man is married ! Clara 's lack of modesty wa shocking in the day , but I believe it lends to the sweetness and general fun of the movie . Though definitely not a brilliant story-line ( quite typical , actually ) , this movie is a nice showcase of Clara 's ability to make the audience laugh .

As the number of Video Nasties I 've yet to see dwindles , this little pile of garbage popped up on my `` to rent '' list when I saw it wa available . The premise involves a fashion model or something being kidnapped and taken into the jungle to be held for ransom by a motley crew of idiot . Some other goof get hired to bring her back and is given a sack of money to use a a bargaining chip , though if he return with the girl and all the money , he get a significant cut . He 's brought a helicopter and pilot with him and , wow , that pilot is one of the worst actor EVER ! Granted , they are all totally terrible and the dubbing will make you cry blood . After stealing away into the jungle , we learn that nearby is a cannibal cult whose flesheating earthbound god wanders the wood like a human King Kong looking for tribeswomen to ravage and devour . Now , this fellow is just a naked guy with some of the worst makeup ever , ping-pong ball for eye and that 's pretty much it . His growl and groan are an everpresent feature on the soundtrack , and I found myself muting much of those scene . Oh , did I forget to mention the almost constant nudity ? This is probably the main reason this film wa banned , though there is one specific scene , about one second long , where the god attack a girl and pull her gut out , but it 's not a redeeming factor for gore fan . Also , Jess Franco go beyond the usual T and A and show lengthy close-ups of female genitals , and , sadly , male a well . So , if you want `` fair '' in term of exploitation , you got it . I ca n't recommend this trash to anyone . It 's not even the good bad movie . It 's just atrociously padded trash that only a Video Nasty fan will probably view and even then , if you are making your way through the list , leave this for the very last . If you watch it first , you may get the notion that this is the norm for the list , which is certainly not true .

I found out about this film because Jewish Ben Chaplin from Game On wa in it . Game On is a funny British sitcom and apparently he left because he wanted to break into Hollywood and star in this film . He failed thank God . The film is a very simple romantic comedy with Janeane Garofalo playing an ugly woman who us her neighbour Uma Thurman to date Ben Chaplin because she think Ben Chaplin wo n't like her because she 's ugly . The film is just bad for so many reason . The plot is unbelievably predictable from the overtly slapstick bit to the serious mushy bit : ugh just that montage where all three of them are having fun and then the photograph bit . Those two scene made me cringe ! Janeane 's character is sickeningly arrogant ( and guessing from her role a stand-up `` comedienne '' and arch-feminist is in real life too ) . She claim that the film is `` anti-feminist '' when in fact it 's just realistic . Men more often than not go for look over personality . It 's interesting to note her hypocrisy too . She 'd been a feminist and `` comedienne '' for year before taking this role and then suddenly decides afterwards that the film wa bad . I imagine she hated the idea and script of this film before it wa released but she made sure she kept that quiet so she could get paid for this travesty of a film . I mean come on ! She acted in it for Heaven 's sake ! What this film wa really wa anti-men if anything . It portrays men a stupid animal whose brain are in their groin with the men doing stupid thing to attract the attention of Uma Thurman 's character Noelle . There are other bad thing about this film too like Ben Chaplin 's character being the British man every American girl find cute and Jamie Foxx being the token black best friend of Chaplin and of course Foxx had to try and mimic his accent a few time for good measure . Is that the best the script writer could come up with ? Blimey they 've never done that before except with every Hugh Grant and Dudley Moore film ever made . There 's also a truly awful phone sex scene which is just grotesque and prof how cheap the film is . The other comment on here all say how Janeane Garofalo is n't ugly but is actually beautiful . Erm wa I watching the same film a they were ? She 's certainly no looker and the only good thing about this film wa that she wa rightly cast a the ugly one . Although having said that , I fail to see the appeal of Uma Thurman a well : she 's lanky and gaunt looking . I guarantee three thing about this film if you 've never watched it : You will know what the ending will be ; You will find the phone sex scene painfully embarrassing and ; You will be bored after ten minute . Watch at your own peril .
