Having just seen Walt Disney 's The Skeleton Dance on the Saturday Morning Blog a linked from YouTube , I used those same source to watch a remake done in Technicolor for the Columbia cartoon unit and animated by the same man-Ub Iwerks . The color , compared to the earlier black and white , are really used imaginatively here and many of the new gags-like when one of the skeletal band player hit a wrong note constantly or when one loses his head and take another one 's off or when one dance with the other with part of that other gone-are just a funny a the previous short . It doe get a little repetitious near the end . Still , Skeleton Frolics is well worth seeing for any animation buff who want to compare this with the earlier Silly Symphony .

The cast of this film contain some of New Zealander 's better actor , many of who I have seen in fabulous role , this film however fill me with a deep shame just to be from the same country a them . The fake American accent are the first clue that thing are about to go spectacularly wrong . As another review rather astutely noted the luxury cruise ship is in fact an old car ferry , decorated with a few of the multi colour flag stolen from a used car lot . Most of the cast appear to be from the ( great ) long running New Zealand soap Shortland Street . It 's a if this movie wa dreamt up at a Shortland Street cast Christmas party , the result of too many gin , and possibly a bit of salmonella . Imagine `` Under Siege '' meet `` The Love Boat '' , staged by your local primary school and directed by an autistic and you get the idea . If you are an actor , I recommend you see this film , a a study on how to destroy your carer .

Emily Watson and Tom Wilkinson together - what a treat ! With Rupert Everett and Linda Bassett rounding off the supporting role to the foursome of lie and intrigue . Yet at the heart of it all , each character maintains a streak of decency - moral conscience held up in spite of obvious contradiction . `` Contradictions are the source of all movement and of all life . '' How true these word are . Watson 's Anne Manning is at the core of this intrigue - she 's the central conscience that the other three latched on . She is the decency undeterred . The circumstance of lie are to each it own : one to defend one 's professional name ; one to hold back due to family/partner pressure ; one simply do n't want to face the consequence ; one ironically ca n't believe the truth and lie to save friendship . These are all precarious situation . There lie the intrigue - fascinating to watch how each tackle truth and lie . Contradictions , indeed . In spite of the seeming dishonor , decency and heart remain strong . The treatment of the subject involved and how each of the character behaves are masterfully delivered simple with clarity . It 's not sensational or complex a another film `` Where the Truth Lies '' 2005 . Credits due to Fellowes ' writing and the nuanced performance of both Watson and Wilkinson . There is warmth somehow that come through the seemingly boldface or frustratingly hidden lie . Beneath it all , human frailty not excluded , they meant well . And following along with the story , the turn of event provided satisfaction and smile to how the two Manning 's seem to have grown and matured in their relationship . You might say there 's no obvious action drama or thrilling scene in `` Separate Lies , '' yet the intrigue is there and it will hold your attention . The deserving production effort include cinematography by Tony Pierce-Roberts ( a veteran to the Merchant-Ivory film ) and music by Stanislas Syrewicz , with mood and tone reminiscent of composer Zbignew Priesner ( of filmmaker Krzysztof Kieslowski 's Trois Couleurs , especially : Bleu 1993 . ) This is a British film you just might not want to miss . Emily Watson ( Anne , the wife ) : Breaking the Waves 1996 debut ; Hilary and Jackie 1998 ; The Luzhin Defence 2000 ; Gosford Park 2001 ; Punch-Drunk Love , Red Dragon , Equilibrium in 2002 . Tom Wilkinson ( James , the husband ) : The Full Monty 1997 ; The Governess , Rush Hour ( a villain ) in 1998 ; In the Bedroom 2001 , Normal ( HBO cable movie ) 2003 , Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind 2004 , recently a Father Moore in : The Exorcism of Emily Rose 2005 opposite Laura Linney . Rupert Everett ( Bill ) : He is simply delightful in `` My Best Friend 's Wedding '' 1997 opposite Julia Roberts and marvelous in `` An Ideal Husband '' 1999 d : Oliver Parker , an Oscar Wilde play . Recently a Sherlock Holmes with Ian Hart a Dr. Watson , in PBS Mystery : Sherlock Holmes and the Case of the Silk Stockings 2004 TV . Linda Bassett ( Maggie ) : she wa very effective a Ella Khan opposite Om Puri in `` East is East '' 1999 .

I am amazed with some of the review of this film . The only place that seems to tell the truth is RottenTomatoes.com . This film is awful . The plot is extremely lazy . It is not scary either . People out there who think that because it star Sarah Michelle Geller it is somehow like The Grudge should forget about it . This film is more like Dark Water , except it is even more predictable and slow moving than it . I wa extremely disappointed with this film . It did n't scare me nor interest me either . Let 's face it , this type of plot ha been flogged to death at this stage e.g . the dead trying to contact the living - Dragonfly , What Lies Beneath , Ghost Story , Dark Water , Darkness , The Changeling etc.etc . It seems to me that the only one writing original horror film nowadays are the Japanese and the Koreans . The film that are coming out of Hollywood , like this , are cynical exercise in money making without a shred of respect for the viewer . They 're just being churned out

Angela ( Sandra Bullock ) is a computer expert but , being shy and somewhat of a recluse , she doe all of her work from the confines of her condo . Just a she is about to take a vacation in Mexico , a co-worker sends her a computer disc with disturbing information on it . Angela agrees to meet with her fellow employee but he mysteriously dy in a plane crash . Angela head to Mexico but take the disc with her . While she is sunning on the beach , a terrific looking gentleman named Jack ( Jeremy Northam ) make overture to her . She fall for them and the two end up on a boat to Cozumel . However , Jack work for the folk who generated the secret information on the disc and he is out to get it . Even after Angela escape from his clutch and land back in the USA , Jack make thing difficult . He change Angela 's identity on every computer across the nation , making her lose her condo , her bank account , everything . Can Angela , a computer whiz , beat Jack at his own game ? This very exciting movie ha many asset . First , Bullock and Northam are two very beautiful , interesting actor and their presence add immediate captivation . The script is very clever and sure in it knowledge of the capability of computer and their relevance in today 's world . The costume , set , production , and direction of the movie are also quite wonderful . And , despite how it sound , there is a great deal of exciting action a Angela go on the run to defeat her enemy . If you love thriller without unnecessary bloodshed or violence , this is a great choice . It delivers twist and turn with great frequency , making it possible for the viewer to `` net '' a very good evening of entertainment .

I rented the DVD in a video store , a an alternative to reading the report . But it 's pretty much just more terror-tainment . While the film may present some info from the report in the drama , you 're taking the word of the producer - there 's no reference to the commission report anywhere in the film . Not one . The acting , all around , is pretty bad - pretty much all of the stereotype of 'hot shot ' bitchy foul mouthed government agent , each thinking they know more than everyone else . There may be some truth to it , but it really ha a bad Hollywood stereotype smell to it . IMDb 's user community rating & comment tend to be more right than wrong , and I have started to glance at the rating before renting whenever I can . I wish I had on this one .

It wa n't until I looked at the trivia section that I found out that the original producer/star of this movie Tyrone Power died during it making . This no doubt explains why everyone on screen seems to have their mind on other thing , a symptom of which appears in a very early scene involving a battle that can only be described a pathetic . You know when you 've been painting a wall until you 're completely bored ? Well that 's the sort of expression the combatant have on their face when they 're swinging their sword in a highly unconvincing manner The plot centre on Soloman the King of Israel having an affair with the Queen of Sheeba and his people not being happy about it . You ca n't really blame them since there 's few thing more beautiful in the world than those Israeli moteks , though the Israeli woman here all seem to look like Cherie Blair ! Modern day Israel is also very cosmopolitan with the majority of Israelis being born outside the country but would this have been true a couple of thousand year ago where everyone speaks in European and American accent After much talking and a dance sequence that ha to be seen to be believed ( And no that 's not praise ) we have a climax where the heavily outnumbered Israelis have to defend themselves against a massed Egyptian army who ca n't read a map otherwise they would have known there wa a canyon in front of them . This is what I do n't get - Even though their blinded by the sun the Egyptians spend ten minute charging towards the Israelis never ever realising they 're charging towards a gaping ravine ! Is n't this somewhat illogical ? It 's also something of a revealing error since the horse , chariot and men falling into the canyon are obviously miniature figure Anyway the film end with Soloman killing his treacherous brother and praising God for his victory . But who need Moshe Dayan , Arik Sharon or God when you 've got an idiotic enemy who ca n't see a ravine in front of him or wave a sword like he paint a wall ?

I am a huge Woody Allen fan and so when I saw that this wa playing at the cinema I could n't help myself . I wanted to see how Allen would follow up his magnificent film Match Point seeing a this is another one of his film shot in G.B . ( which is unique among Allen 's work ) along with what seems to be his new muse Scarlett Johanson . Scoop is much lighter than MP and the humor is Scoop 's most enjoyable aspect . The plot revolves around Johanson 's character ( a journalism student ) who get a tip on a hot story from beyond the grave . She fall in love with a suspected serial killer ( Jackman ) and she must decide whether the truth is worth finding . Oh and all of this is done with the help of a bumbling magician turned detective played by Allen . I must say that I thoroughly enjoyed Johanson 's performance but I am a bit bias , I could watch a three hour film with Johanson in ever frame and remain enchanted . She play a ditsy , yappy , bumbling sweetheart that is kind of a variation in a sense of Allen 's stereotypical neurosis stricken character . She add appropriate body language for comic effect . Needless to say almost anyone who see this will find Johanson 's character sickeningly cute and that is a plus . Allen is Allen ... He is still playing the same character much like Chaplin and his Little Tramp character . Something that occur in this film make me wonder if I will see the neurotic little hypochondriac again however . He is not in the cast of his next picture and ha been spending more time exclusively behind the camera a of late ... Jackman is also enjoyable a the suave , millionaire murder suspect . I can not say that Jackman doe anything in particular to make the role his but he suit his character none the le . In term of the plot I can not help but feel that this is fresh ... In fact it stink of Curse of the Jade Scorpion . Johanson and Allen are more detective-like than anything . However I must applaud Allen on his ending because it is a bit more clever than your typical unoutstanding Hollywood version of this film . Instead of everything being black and white , thing are painted in shade of gray . Being entirely innocent ha nothing to do with it nor doe unequivocal guilt . Though the plot seemed old Woody still ha a knack for one liner . I did find his allusion to his last film interesting ... Come for the humor , laugh and be merry . Needless to say if you enjoy Allen 's work watch it . If not watch something else ...

I rented this film because of my interest in American history , and especially the somewhat weird story of the Mormons . This movie attempt to make some sense out of how Joseph Smith could turn his `` vision '' into a major world religion . It first focus on the trouble the Mormons had in their settlement at Navuoo , Illinois . It portrays the trial of Joseph Smith . Within the course of that trial , Brigham Young stand up to tell of his conversion to Mormonism , and of his belief in the spiritual message of Smith . Then Smith is assassinated , and Young must deal with his own doubt about whether he ha been chosen to lead the Mormons to a new land . Despite his grave doubt , he perseveres , and finally ha a vision ( that Utah is the place for his colony ) that give him confidence in the rightness of his leadership . Later , a crop are destroyed by cricket , he again doubt that he ha truly been chosen -- however , a miracle occurs , which cement his place in history . I found the performance to be moving , and the story to be convincing and interesting . I would love to know whether Mormons believe that this is an accurate portrayal . Polygamy is a part of the story , but the reason why this is central to LDS are not raised . The issue is not emphasized . I 'm sure people stay away from this movie because of it religious subject-matter , but it ha a great cast and will hold your interest throughout .

1983 's `` Frightmare '' is an odd little film . The director seems to be trying to combine the atmosphere of classic '30s/'40s style horror movie with the shock factor of the then-exploding '80s slasher genre . It is n't totally successful ( mostly due to very obvious budgetary restraint , and the less-than-professional caliber of it cast of young actor ) but it still ha it moment , mostly due to the classy performance ( classier than the movie deserves ) by the late German actor Ferdinand Mayne , who play an aging old time horror movie star ( ala Vincent Price ) named `` Conrad Ratzoff . '' At the beginning of the movie we meet the has-been horror star a he 's shooting a commercial for denture and we quickly learn that ol ' Conrad is a bit of a hoity-toity , prima donna jerk-off . Just when you think he could n't be any more un-likable , the commercial director berates Conrad for blowing a take for the umpteenth time and the old goat push him off a balcony to his death . Nice , huh ? Conrad then visit some fan at a college campus horror movie club , unfortunately he suffers a heart attack in the middle of his speech to them and eventually end up back at his mansion waiting to die . Still feisty even at Death 's door , he manages to do away with a despised business associate by smothering him with a pillow before he finally kick the bucket himself . Conrad is then laid to rest in true Hollywood style in a high tech neon tomb with video screen above the casket , which will play personal video message from Conrad himself for visitor who enter to pay their respect . It is at this point that the kid from the college Horror Movie Society decide to pay Conrad 's grave an after hour visit , breaking into the tomb and taking his body back home with them for an all night party . ( Not exactly my idea of fun , but hey , these are character in an '80s horror film . Logic ha no place here . ) The college kid spend the evening having dinner with Conrad 's body seated in a place of honor , posing for photo with it and even dancing around the room with it , before parking Conrad and his coffin in the attic , planning to return him to his crypt in the morning . In the meantime , Mrs. Ratzoff , distraught over the theft of her husband 's body , ha called in a psychic friend to try and `` reach '' Conrad through a seance . You can pretty much figure out the rest from here . Since Conrad wa n't a very nice guy in life , it 's not much of a stretch to assume that he wo n't be any friendlier in death . Psychic Lady make contact with Conrad and he re-awakens in predictably ticked off fashion , then spends the rest of the movie strolling around the corridor of the student ' ridiculously huge house , picking off the young grave robber one by one . This is where the movie fall apart . Endless scene of teen wandering around empty hallway saying `` Hello ? Is anyone there ? '' are intercut with occasional burst of violence ( we do get a pretty gnarly decapitation scene , which is the highlight of the movie ) before the last two survivor finally figure out ( WAY later than any semi-intelligent people would have figured out the same thing ... but again , we 're in an '80s horror film ! ) that the only way to stop the mayhem is to get Conrad 's body back to it crypt where it belongs . The sluggish pacing is padded out with a lot of weird lighting and dry ice fog effect backed by a soundtrack made up almost entirely of sound effect rather than music ( thunder , moan and groan , howl , etc . ) that becomes severely annoying after a while . I ca n't really recommend `` Frightmare '' to anyone who did n't grow up watching cheap movie like this on late night cable back in the '80s . `` Modern Horror '' fan will doubtlessly find `` Frightmare '' incredibly slow moving and goofy . If you came of age in that magical decade , however , you may get a blast of nostalgia from `` Frightmare . '' Fans of Jeffrey ( `` Re-Animator '' ) Combs may also want to check it out , a the future Dr. West appears in an early role here a one of the unlucky film student . I will advise the reader to avoid the version of this film on the EastWestDVD label ( paired with Roy Ward 's `` Vault of Horror '' and sold at dollar store ) because the print quality is terrible . I 'm told the film ha gotten a deluxe release via the fine folk at Troma , which seems appropriate . If you 're a Troma kind of person then `` Frightmare '' will be right up your alley .

People watch movie for a variety of different reason . This movie did n't have the big budget , there 's no special effect , no car chase and there 's no explosion . Actually reality doe n't have much of these either . At least not in my life . This is a very real movie about very real people , none of them perfect in any way but together they are put into a situation where they learn to explore and accept what is different and that in turn make order out of chaos . I am not prepared to limit the possibility of parapsychology , since I 'm neither an expert nor use the full extent of my own brain . So watch this movie for the character . It is brim-full of a whole cast of wonderful quirky folk . Within the first three minute Kiefer Sutherland enacts Detective Michael Hayden 's life superbly and he keep developing the character throughout the movie . Excellent acting , very believable . Henry Czerny could not have been cast better and the rapport between his 'Harvey ' and Kiefer 's 'Mickey ' enhances the oppositeness of their character . I thoroughly enjoyed the cranky landlady , 'Mrs Ramsay ' , I 'm sure she and my mother-in-law are good friend ! ! ! There 's a host more of these wonderful character but space is limited here so watch the movie and enjoy them .

I think that you can not imagine how these people really work ... ! ! Before I came to the studio to watch the guy work there , I actually thought quite the same a you do . But since I saw and did the work the guy on that TV-show have to do , I have to say that they really do deserve respect for what they are doing all day long . That really is no easy work . And also the actor , which in your eye may be terribly bad , are really great people and a lot of them really can act ! I do n't think that the material given to them can really show that , a I think this material is n't very good . But THEY are truly good ! So I do n't think that you , before you have n't seen these guy doing there work , can judge over them ! And I should n't have judged over them a well before I met them , but I did and am now terribly ashamed of it . So please , do not allow yourself to judge over these great people unless you have n't seen them doing there job .

As usual , I am making a mad dash to see the movie I have n't watched yet in anticipation of the Oscars . I wa really looking forward to seeing this movie a it seemed to be right up my alley . I can not for the life of me understand why this movie ha gotten the buzz it ha . There is no story ! ! A group of guy meander around Iraq . One day they are here diffusing a bomb . Tomorrow they are tooling around the countryside , by themselves no le and start taking sniper fire . No wait here they are back in Bagdad . There is no cohesive story at all . The three main character are so overly characterized that they are mere caricature . By that I mean , we have the sweet kid who is afraid of dying . We have the hardened military man who is practical and just want to get back safe . And then we have the daredevil cowboy who doe n't follow the rule but ha a soft spot for the precocious little Iraqi boy trying to sell soldier DVDs . What do you think is going to happen ? ? ? Well , do you think the cowboy soldier who doe n't follow rule is going to get the sweet kid injured with his renegade way ? ? Why yes ! Do you think the Iraqi kid that cowboy soldier ha a soft spot for is going to get killed and make him go crazy ? Why yes ! There is no story here . The script is juvenile and predictable ! The camera is shaken around a lot to make it look `` artsy '' . And for all of you who think this is such a great war picture , go rent `` Full Metal Jacket '' , `` Deerhunter '' or `` Platoon '' . Do n't waste time or money on this boring movie !

A group of friend break down in the middle of nowhere ( one had a flat tire , the other 's Jeep mysteriously wo n't start ) . One of them take the tire to a run down service station and that is the last anyone see of him . When the remaining foursome go in search of their friend , they come across nice Mr. Slaussen who offer to help fix the jeep and offer cool drink and refuge from the heat in his equally run down , hermit-like house , which happens to be occupied by very realistic looking mannequin . He go with the one guy in the bunch out to work on the car and leaf the 3 girl in the house . Before he go he warns them not to leave and go up to the house behind his shack ; he warns them about `` Davy '' , his brother who is lurking about and is n't all there . Of course , one of them decides to venture out in search of a working phone and is never seen again . Is it Slaussen ? Is it Davy ? The mannequin ? ? Tourist Trap ha the usual horror requirement ( jiggly big boobed girl , goody two shoe girl , curiosity getting the better of people and never working out ! ) , but it stand apart from the rest of the 70 's genre in it 's twist of an ending . I started to feel sorry for Slaussen ( Chuck Conners is a terrific , creepy , over-the-top performance ) at a point in the film , and you almost see the character of Molly doing the same . This is a gem if you can find it ; I had taped it off of cable when I wa younger , and walking through a used video store I spotted a VHS copy that wa totally overpriced , but well worth it . Fans of Tanya Roberts wo n't be disappointed either . Best part of the film for me wa the scene with the soup ( and cracker ! ! ) I gave it a 7 because some of the movie wa and still is hard to explain .

Most Lorne Michaels film seem to fail because they 're essentially just extended version of skit that barely managed to make people laugh in five-minute segment . `` Tommy Boy '' is a character right from `` SNL '' - a big fat lovable ( in their opinion ) goof who doe n't know anything . David Spade get the Thankless Overwhelmed Everyman role . He 's paired with the Annoying Overweight Slob and they endure Miserable Misfortunes a they travel cross country to Save Daddy 's Business . The plot , for starter , is really faulty . The whole premise - daddy dy and rich stupid son ha to save the family biz - can be traced back to just about any movie you want . Like any SNL style film it is reduced to a simple motivation - empty , shallow ; just a reason to see a fat guy and a thin guy be `` funny '' together . The movie 's biggest `` influence '' is the 1987 comedy classic `` Planes , Trains & Automobiles . '' That movie is great because the plot is n't stale and recycled . It 's basic , yeah - a guy traveling home for Thanksgiving get stuck with a slob . But it 's real , dammit . It make all the difference . The character are real , the situation are far more real . `` Tommy Boy '' is pure slapstick and it ridiculous situation undermine the character - we feel nothing for them , and we do n't care about what 's happening on-screen . `` PTA '' walked the careful line between outrageous and utterly believable and relate-able - `` Tommy Boy '' is simply absurd , with joke like a simple deer-in-the-headlights turning into a crash turning into a struggle with a dead deer that really is n't dead , then awakens and wreck their car . The whole wrecked car thing is stolen completely from `` PTA '' and it 's eerie how much stuff in this film actually doe resemble the Steve Martin/John Candy movie . Farley is simply way too obnoxious to find likable - I 've never enjoyed watching him in any movie and this ha n't changed my mind . Spade 's given very little to do , serving a the movie 's most thankless character . Dan Aykroyd is wasted a the Evil Baddie who plan to destroy Daddy 's Business . The ending is a joke , and not in a `` har-har funny '' way . More like a `` oh god are they serious ? ! '' way . Some people dig it , that 's cool . But I just ca n't get into it , nor do I appreciate all the stuff it `` borrows '' from - not just counting `` PT & A '' - without any credit whatsoever .

Having read during many year about how great this film wa , how it established Ruiz among the french critic ( specially the snobbish Cahiers crowd ) , when I finally watched it about a year ago , I found it pretty disappointing ( but then , I guess my expectation were sky-high ) . Shot in saturated black and white , this deliberately cerebral film ( made for TV , and mercifully , only an hour long ) is told in the form of a conversation between an art connoisseur and an off-screen narrator a they ponder through a series of painting ( which are shown in the style of tableau vivants ) and try to find if they hold some clue about a hidden political crime . ( The awful Kate Beckinsale film Uncovered ha a similar argument ) . Borgesian is a word I read a lot in review about this movie , but I would say almost any Borges story is more interesting than this film .

Many teenage sex comedy movie come and go without much fanfare , however , every so often a movie might come along thats honest , funny , entertaining AND memorable . The Last American Virgin is a special movie that ha found it place and ha stood the test of time blending all four ingredient . This film follows three friend ( Gary , Rick and David `` The Big Apple '' ) misadventure into the world of first-time sex and true love . Along the way they learn hard lesson and the value of true friendship . We follow hopeless romantic Gary ( The main character ) on his quest to win over the girl of his dream which lead him down an uncertain road with a surprise twist at it 's ending . If you have n't been lucky enough to see this movie yet , by all mean take a look ... sprinkled with many memorable 80 song throughout the movie to keep thing moving at an even pace . L.A.V . truly is an original film , a rarity among film of it 's genre .

I did n't know what to except so I think it wa a lot better not having excepted much . Do n't get my wrong it not a bad short film . I wa never so bored in my life . Hours of pretentious , self-obsessed heroin-addicted basket case lounging around whining about their problem . It 's like watching lizard molt . Even the sex scene will induce a serious case of narcolepsy . If you have insomnia , rent this .

This movie is awesome on so many level ... and none of them are the level that it wa intended to be awesome on . Just remember this : When you 're watching Shaun of the Dead and other recent zombie movie ... be they good or bad ... THIS is the formula that they are using . THIS is what make zombie movie so great . And what make it BETTER than great is the story behind the movie . A simple web search will provide you with everything you need to know . All in all , it doe n't linger . There 's never a point where you think to yourself `` c'mon , get on with it '' ... it move quick and corner nicely . This is the sporty , little Italian number of zombie flick . So awful , it 's wonderful ! If your tongue spends an ample amount of time in your cheek ... rent it , buy it , love it . As a great trivia note : If you 're watching it on DVD , you 'll notice that there is sound effect during the menu screen , underneath the musical score ... Well ... that 's because that music wa lifted straight from the trailer ... which is probably the only working print of that music that still exists which is long enough to loop .

The Ladies Man is laugh out loud funny , with a great diverse cast a well a having some very stupid but excellent scene ( including the funniest love song ever written ) . Ferrell is his usual quality self in a brilliant side role . Tim Meadows play an idiot surprisingly well and ha written himself some of the funniest line you 'll find in any comedy out there . It is definitely worth a purchase a watching it every 6 month or so will lead to you still laughing a hard a you did first time round . I am distraught to think at the time of writing this that it ha a meagre 4.7 /10 and i urge you to vote ! And remember kids- `` Theres more motion in the ocean ''

when i first heard about this movie i thought it would be like The Duchess ( 2008 ) , but when i saw the first 30 minute of The Young Victoria i knew this would n't just be a solid movie . Almost everything in this movie is great , the costume are really amazing and the setting are also beautifully shot . The only thing that really let me down are the performance . Emily Blunt ( The Devil Wears Prada ) is the star of the film , bringing Victoria to life and with this movie she show that she is a great actress and maybe picking a first Oscar nomination for her performance . Rupert Friend is almost bland a Prince Albert but he ha great chemistry with Emily Blunt . Paul Bettany is also solid a Lord Melbourne although i expected more of him . Jim Broadbent and Miranda Richardson both have supporting role but are forgettable . To me the film feel like unfinished . Maybe that the screenwriter changed too many thing in the script , i do n't know but that 's how i feel about the movie . But overall it 's a great movie about the early year of Victoria with a Great performance from Emily Blunt .

A flying saucer manned ( literally ) by a crew of about 20 male space explorer travel hundred of million of light year from earth to check in on a colony founded some 25 year ago on a 'forbidden planet . ' What they find is a robot more advanced than anything imaginable on earth , a beautiful and totally socially inept young woman , and her father , a hermit philologist haunted by more than the demon of the ancient civilization he ha immersed himself in . On the surface , this story is a pulp scifi murder mystery . Some compare it to Shakespeare 's Tempest , but this is a stretch , and , in some way , an insult to the scifi genre . Stripped of what make it a scifi film , sure , it The Tempest , but how many hundred of film can you say something similar about ? Underneath , this is a cautionary tale about progress and technology and the social evolution necessary for it appropriate and safe use . Yet the film still proceeds with all the hopefulness for our future that we have come to expect from show like Star Trek . Anne Francis is not the only reason why this film is best described a beautiful . The special effect , and even the aesthetic of the backdrop are powerful enough to make the uninspired directing and uneven acting almost unnoticeable . If it were not for the goofy retro-art-deco-ness of 1950s sci-fi prop , you might think you were watching a 1960s piece . This is a classic of that very special sub-genre of sci fi I like to call 1950s sci-fi , and , though not , in my opinion , the best it is certainly a must see for anybody interested in sci-fi film and special effect . The clever plot , now rendered trite by it reuse in six or seven episode of Star Trek , Lost in Space , and even Farscape , is worth paying attention to , and will sustain the interest of most scifi fan . Trekkers will be particularly interested in the various aspect of the film which seem to have inspired theme of Star Trek 's original series aired about 12 year later , though they may find themselves disappointed by the ( relatively mild ) 1950s sexism and the lack of any kind of racial integration . While I do not mean to nitpick , the lack of social progress manifest in this film wa the one major problem I had with it . Some will probably see this film simply to catch a glimpse of young , good-looking Leslie Nielsen in one of his first starring role . Unfortunately , Nielsen 's performance is only average , and at time down-right poor ( especially at the climax of the film ) . Walter Pigeon , though quite excellent in other film , over-acts his role a well . Ms Francis , Earl Holliman , and the amazing Robby the Robot are the stand-out actor in this crowd , though on the whole the character actor filling in the ensemble do a good job . The problem with the featured performance , I think , are a much the fault of the director and the editor , a anything . Though they certainly got most of the film quite right .

I just saw this film on DVD last night , and decided to check out the review this morning . It seems that `` I , Robot '' ha polarized the critical viewing community here on IMDb ( and given rise to a lot of insult and name-calling , too ) . I find this somewhat surprising , a this film is not great ( or even good ) , but neither is it terrible ( or even really bad ) . What this film really is , is ... depressing . Depressing that the US film-goer population is so ready to lap up insipid , clichéd re-heats , and acclaim them a spectacular new work . This film a `` retread '' written all over it , from the plot line ( an uneasy mix of Asimov and modern-day uber-action ) to Smith 's character ( a smart-mouthed cynic with a backbone of titanium ) , to the special effect ( that borrowed from Matrix and a few others ) . `` I , Robot '' is , sadly , quite possibly the perfect action movie for today 's audience : superficial plot , insipidly snappy dialog , and lot and lot of adrenaline . Smith is mediocre , but we already knew that ( he seems to be Hollywood 's latest unsuccessful attempt to create a black Bruce Willis ) . The story ha lot of hole in it , of all size , but I do n't think most people drawn to this film are critically-minded enough to notice . Perhaps a blockbuster by today 's standard , but very B-movie compared to true winner .

This must have been one of the worst movie I have ever seen . I have to disagree with another commenter , who said the special effect were okay . I found them pretty bad : it just wa n't realistic and they were so fake that it just distracted from the actual story . Maybe that distraction is the reason that I did not fully understand the story . The archaeologist are looking for `` the set '' . They do not bother to tell what set , or what is so special about it . That also make it unclear why they search for it in California , while the intro of the movie take place in ancient Egypt . If you 're shooting a movie that take place in the desert , take the effort to actually go to the desert . The beginning - the ancient ceremony - look like it wa shot inside a studio instead of a desert . The action-level wa constant throughout the movie , no ups and down , no climax . It made the movie look short , and that 's certainly a pro for this particular movie .

Liam Neeson portrays the Scottish legend Robert Roy Macgregor from the early 18th century . He is a true actor . He captivates the audience with his charisma a he doe in all his role . Jessica Lange is excellent a his wife Mary . Mary is such a beautiful woman . It 's her love that make Rob Roy the legend , but it 's his passion that make her love undying . They need each other . Tim Roth a the evil Cunningham is perfect ; in one way or another , upon watching the movie , you will find Cunningham disgusting . The Scotland scenery is beautiful . The environment and condition of the time are depicted quite well . If you like history , romance , passion and love , you 'll enjoy Rob Roy . There is violence and blood , but it 's unavoidable in telling this story a it should be told ; no gratuitous violence . And you do have to listen carefully if you 're not used to a Scottish accent . One important point that make this movie so good is that no one actor or actress is glamorized ; they get dirty and actually look unattractive in various scene . It 's their skill a actor that attracts you , they do n't rely on marquee name , popularity or sex symbol appeal . This is something special .

Having seen Carlo Lizzani 's documentary on Luchino Visconti , I wa bound to higher expectation before watching this film made three year later by Adam Low . But the viewer like me did get dissatisfied ... I faced a need for critical opinion , which I generally do n't like giving due to the fact there are no documentary that will satisfy every viewer . There are also no documentary that will examine a theme totally . But when I read the review already written on this title , I also felt a bit confused . People sometimes do n't know what to criticize . Therefore , to be clear , I 'll divide this film into two major part that differ considerably : the former one about Visconti before his director 's career and latter one about Visconti the director . The aristocratic background , all the hobby , the wealth that young Luchino experienced and enjoyed are clearly presented . His effort in horse racing is mentioned a well a his relation with his mother so much disturbed after his parent ' divorce . We also get a very accurate idea of where Luchino wa brought up a a real count of Milano : in rich galore , with nanny , cook with access to everything , in TRUE ARISTOCRACY . For instance , his father 's splendid villa at Grazzano and other marvelous villa prove that . There is also an emphasis on Visconti 's crucial visit in Paris in the 1930s where he met eminent people ( `` left winger '' ) who later had impact on his style and message in art . That clearly explains the idea of a communist with the aristocratic upbringing ( a contrast at first sight ) . However , the part about his director 's career , which started with OSSESSIONE during WWII and ended with INNOCENTE just before the director 's death in 1976 , is poorly executed . His movie are not discussed well . Why ? Because there are very few people who really have something to say . Franco Zeffirelli , the director , remembers the work on LA TERRA TREMA and that is all right . There are also some interview with Franco Rosi . But later , such movie like IL GATTOPARDO , LA CADUTA DEI REI , LA MORTE A VENEZIA or LUDWIG are mostly discussed by Helmut Berger . Although I liked the actor in the role of Ludwig , I did not like the interview of his . Moreover , some thought he reveals are not accurate to entail in such a documentary ... There is no mention of significant work of Visconti like CONVERSATION PIECE , there are no interview with eminent cast Burt Lancaster . A mention about Silvana Mangano and Romy Schneider should also be made . There is one footage interview with Maria Callas that appears to be interesting but that is only a short bit . Franco Zeffirelli , though I appreciate him a a director , make fun of it all rather than say something really precious . For instance , he mention the event how Visconti separated from him after year of service . Therefore , I say : simplified and unsatisfactory . What I find a strong point here are footage interview with Visconti himself . As a result , we may get his own opinion about his work . For instance , I very much appreciate the word he say about death regarding it a a normal chapter of life and a natural a birth itself . He also discus his health problem after the stroke while filming LUDWIG . I believe it is better to see LUCHINO VISCONTI ( 1999 ) by Carlo Lizzani than this doc . Although it is shorter and condensed a a whole , you will get a better idea of the director . Visconti would be furious about that and the fury of his usually turned people 's emotion and viewpoint into stone ... 4/10

Time is precious . This film is n't . I must learn to ignore critic who rave about small film like Fargo and this complete waste of time . I have had more fun doing the laundry .

I saw it at the Legacy Theater in the Joseph Smith Memorial Building in Salt Lake City this morning . I 'm going to assume that one 's level of enjoyment during this movie will largely be based on one 's level of acceptance of Joseph 's story . However , that aside it wa very well made , well acted , and had a nice score . If you get to Salt Lake City , it is a must to see it in the Legacy Theater . I have never been in a nicer theater a far a picture quality , sound quality and ambiance in my entire life ... I wonder if the Church would let me watch Batman Begins there ! Being that I 'm LDS and regard Joseph a a prophet , I wa touched in several place and wa brought to tear quite a few time ... which I presume is expected since they handed out tissue BEFORE the movie started ! Anyway , I 'm told that this film is available in several LDS Visitor Centers around the globe , if you have 70 minute check it out because whether you believe Joseph Smith or not , he tell a fascinating story .

Adenoid Hynkel , a lowly soldier in World War One , rise in subsequent year to become the ruthless dictator of Toumania . He creates an aggressive , antisemitic war machine and cultivates a little toothbrush moustache . Sound like anyone you know ? From the safety of Hollywood , Chaplin us this soapbox to exhort Europe to take up arm and defy Hitler and Mussolini . Given that the United States in 1940 had more than a year of neutrality ahead of it , and no strong desire to embroil itself in Europe 's civil strife ( remember , it wa Hitler who declared war on the USA , not the other way round ) it is surprising that Chaplin wa allowed to distribute this immoderate polemic . The story involves on the one hand the the vulgar and repellant Hynkel and the reign of terror over which he ineptly presides , and life in the jewish ghetto where every single person is friendly , humane , brave , etc. , etc , Chaplin is Hynkel , and he also play The Jewish Barber , the little hero of the ghetto ( The Tramp in all but name ) . Needless to say , Chaplin writes , directs , star , composes the music and doe the catering . In 1940 the full truth wa not yet known about the Third Reich , and Chaplin can be forgiven for having something le than perfect historical foresight , but even by the standard of the day he get Hitler badly wrong . A comedian and a sentimentalist , Chaplin try to ridicule Hitler by making Hynkel silly and hapless . All this doe is to humanise him . When Hynkel the not-very-warlike soldier fool around with the big gun and the upside-down aeroplane , he becomes endearing rather than despicable . As dictator , he inspects his subordinate ' technical innovation which do n't work ( the parachute hat , the bulletproof uniform etc . ) and these passage are meant to make u think that the real-life Nazis are incompetent and can be swept aside . In fact , Hynkel 's regime is made cute and likeable by it bumbling bodgery . In truth , Chaplin 's day had already passed when he made this ill-considered polemic . At heart , he wa still a dinosaur of the silent screen ( check out the humour , with gag like staggering up and down the street semi-conscious , or the pantomime of the coin in the pudding ) . The hero Schultz is meant to represent a yardstick of European decency against which Hynkel can be judged , but Schultz look more like a character from operetta than a Nazi . Is it in any way believable that a Schultz figure ( if such had existed ) would say to the Fuehrer 's face , `` your cause is doomed to failure because it 's built upon the stupid , ruthless persecution of innocent people '' ? And how doe Schultz come to be in the cellar of the jewish ghetto ? If he is the object of an exhaustive manhunt , why doe he persist in wearing his Ruritanian uniform ? Chaplin did not yet know the full horror of Auschwitz-Birkenau or Treblinka , but the Nazi concentration camp which he offer u is hopelessly out of kilter with the grim spirit of the age . As usual , Chaplin think in term of 'silent ' comedy set-pieces , loosely pegged onto the narrative clothes line . There is the knockabout scrapping with the stormtroopers , shaving a man to the accompaniment of Brahms , and the globe ballet ( watch for the segment filmed in reverse ) . Paulette Goddard is the unremittingly perfect Hannah . Just a the people of the ghetto are impossibly nice , and the jewish haven in Osterlich is ridiculously idyllic , so Hannah is quite literally too good to be true . Brave , defiant , resourceful , hardworking and ( of course ) beautiful , she is the canary of judaism in the ghetto cage . `` Gee , ai n't I cute ? '' she asks , after the Barber give her a make-over . Too cute by far , is the answer . She doe n't come close to ringing true , because Chaplin ha made her a caricature . The 'would n't it be wonderful ? ' speech which Chaplin put into her mouth is typical of the author - too wordy , too emotionally cloying . Jack Oakie is great a Napaloni , the fascist dictator of Bacteria . He brings a whiff of much-needed comic brio to the proceeding , but the film 's underlying weakness remains . If Napaloni is silly and ineffective , how can we fear him ? And anyway , the stuttering stop-start of the back-projected train is a fine Chaplinesque example of a gag that is persisted with far beyond it comic worth . And where did the Jewish Barber acquire that immaculate Hynkel uniform ?

`` Milo '' is yet another answer to a question nobody ever asked.Do we really need more slasher ? I for one think we already have more than enough.I guess the professional tall guy overcharged so in this one we deal with a murderous kid that 's also a zombie or a ghost when he feel like it.A long time ago , he drowned but that did n't bother him and he still kill people ( `` Friday the 13th '' , what 's that ? ) .One day , his survivor have a big reunion and a a surprise twist , Milo come to pay them a visit.Through some really bad shot that show everything except the murder the cast is thinned out till only the final girl is left to find out Milo 's dull , I mean dark secret.She and her friend have been dying to know.Once discovered , Milo go on yet another murderous rampage ( is n't it his bedtime yet ? ) and the girl , well she scream a lot.The acting is not even bottom of the barrel , the barrel refuse to be associated with it.Milo can be one creepy bastard from time to time I give him that , but some movie just ca n't be saved without a great script or gratuitous nudity .

The story see Mickey piloting a steamboat until Captain Pete take him off the bridge , stopping to pick up cargo , and Minnie Mouse missing the boat . Being lifted on she drop her music sheet and a goat eats them , Mickey help her crank it 's tail and play the tune , and getting some other animal to be percussion , until Pete come along again to stop him , making Mickey peel potato . Mickey Mouse wa number 53 on The 100 Greatest Pop Culture Icons , and he wa number 31 on The 100 Greatest Cartoons . Very good !

The perfect murder is foiled when a wife ( played by Mary Ellen Trainor , once the wife to director Robert Zemeckis , who helmed this episode ) , who murder her husband with a poker , ha the misfortune of receiving a visitor a she is about to move the body outside .. an escaped insane madman dressed in a Santa Claus suit ( played by a deviously hideous Larry Drake ) . She fends for her life while trying to find a way of hiding her husband 's corpse . She decides to use an ax , once she down the Santa killer who miss several chance to chop off the woman 's head , to frame the killer for her husband 's murder . Santa killer lock her in a closet and pursues the woman 's daughter a she try desperate to free herself to save the child . This episode of TALES FROM THE CRYPT just recycles tired material involving the old `` Santa kill '' theme while also adding the oft-used ( add nauseum ) woman-murders-her-husband-for-a-man-she's-been-cheating-with routine . It 's essentially Trainor trying to find a way to avoid being caught with a dead body she kill while also keeping a safe distance from a maniac . There 's nothing refreshing or new about this plot which pretty much go through the motion . Not one of the show 's highlight .

The IMDb plot summary in no way describes the essence of this film . It should have read 'Be prepared to be catapulted back to the prison of the 3rd pew from the back of your family 's church at 8 year old , listening to the preacher drone on about God 's will while all you can think of is getting back home to your Lego ' . It start off well intentioned , building intrigue by planting some real and surreal clue such a Renny 's 'how did the cut on my thumb heal so fast ? ' moment . It then slowly morphs into a Christian jamboree , sacrificing it plot completely in a wash of evangelistic-induced babble . I believe I counted the use of the word 'pray ' about 53 time in a five minute span near the end . After the 31st , I tried to twist the context of the word to it synonym , 'prey ' . Sadly , this little mind game of mine made the film at least bearable for the last 20 minute . Plus it made me laugh whenever a character would say 'prayer ' ( 'preyer ' to me ) a it became totally zany . Indeed , even my Catholic wife sunk in her chair from boredom , almost to the point of ending up on the floor . For all the salivating Christians who ranked this film 8-10 star , I suggest sticking with your theology-reinforcing safety standard like Circle Square , The Ten Commandments , anything from Narnia , Jesus Christ Superstar and the like . Stay away from more cerebrally challenging subject matter in film such a Jesus Camp , The God Who Was n't There , What Would Jesus Buy , or the soon-to-be released Religulous . Maybe Robert Whitlow 's book is better .

TESS OF THE STORM COUNTRY is possibly the best movie of all of Mary Pickford 's film . At two hour , it wa quite long for a 1922 silent film yet continues to hold your interest some 80 year after it wa filmed . Mary give one of her finest performance at time the role seems like a `` greatest hit '' performance with bit of Mary the innocent , Mary the little devil , Mary the little mother , Mary the spitfire , Mary the romantic heroine , etc . characteristic that often were used throughout a single film in the past . The movie is surprisingly frank about one supporting character 's illegitimate child for 1922 and at one point our Little Mary is thought the unwed mother in question ! If the Academy Awards had been around in 1922 , no doubt the Best Actress Oscar for the year would have been Mary 's .

I first saw this movie when I wa about 10 year old . My mom bought it at our local Kmart because it wa on sale for $ 5 on VHS . She thought that it would be a nice Christmas movie for me and my brother to watch . This movie , however , scared the hell out of me . You may be asking yourself , how could a movie about Santa Clause scare anyone ? The plot of the movie revolves around Satan sending one his minion , Pitch , to earth in an attempt to kill Santa and ruin Christmas . That 's right , Satan sends a demon up from hell to kill Santa Clause . Pitch stalk Santa throughout Christmas eve in an attempt to trap him on earth when the sun rise on Christmas day , for if Santa doe n't make it back to his home in space , he turn to powder . Do n't get me wrong , the movie is funny and fairly entertaining , however , the image of demon and devil dancing in the depth of hell ( which occurs at the beginning of the movie ) is just downright creepy .

Although there are some snippet in this 4-part documentary hinting at the necessity for recreational drug law reform , these are not very well-developed , in contrast to the many snippet from those who feel that the drug that happen to currently be illegal are a scourge for which the only imaginable solution is incarceration of even those who are guilty even of mere possession of such drug . Although this program , a a whole , leaf the viewer with the impression that the drug war is largely a futile exercise and a waste of money , and for that it deserves some praise , almost nothing in this documentary address the very real problem that total war against those who merely posse illegal drug obviously cause and contributes to -- very real problem that most drug warrior themselves would tell you , if asked , they think the drug war is designed to solve . For example , while many minute are spent on the surge in violence associated with the rising popularity of crack cocaine in the 80 's , at no point doe this program even hint that the very law designed to suppress crack cocaine make it impossible for drug seller to enforce their contract and business arrangement in court of law , forcing them to resort to violence to stay in business . But instead of seeing the law a an important cause of the violence , the drug themselves seem to take the brunt of the blame . Inexplicably , alcohol prohibition , the violence that ensued , and the subsequent reversal of prohibition , is totally ignored by this program . This program will help to perpetuate ridiculous stereotype of drug user , and it is these that are the primary force in driving the very expensive and very problematic drug war . The possibility of incorporating drug other than alcohol into a happy and successful life is not really touched on . Use of any drug in excess is probably going to cause personal problem , but not all user do their drug in excess , just like not all alcohol user are alcoholic . If you want a point of view from someone who belief that adult have a moral right not to be incarcerated and have their life ruined by the criminal justice system just for using drug that the government , for mostly very arbitrary political reason rather than reason based on sound social policy and legitimate science , ha decided to totally prohibit , whose user it ha decided to not-so-metaphorically wage war against , just forget about it . None of that is in here . On the other hand , this is hardly in the category of anti-drug propaganda . It is mostly an interesting neutrally-presented history of drug in 20th century United States like marijuana , LSD , heroin , cocaine , MDMA , and Oxycontin . But there is a significant element of various people 's point of view with regard to drug law , and most ( but not all ) of that is not very thoughtful or well-informed and slanted in favor of the drug warrior mentality , especially with respect to drug other than marijuana . The criminal justice system , along with it often harsh life-ruining penalty , is obviously not the only answer or the most appropriate answer to every single social problem , but unfortunately there 's an epidemic in this nation of an as-yet unnamed disease whose primary symptom are a lack of imagination with respect to social policy when it come to certain drug , a lack of compassion for fellow human , a prejudice against people who use the drug that are not governmentally-approved , perhaps a vested interest in the growth of the prison/policing industry , and a horrid apathy with regard to human dignity . It 's morally wrong to kidnap or incarcerate people unless you have a very damn good reason for doing so , and the mere possession of an arbitrarily selected group of drug is clearly not such a reason . This is really the primary issue when it come to drug , yet this program ignores it . So , in sum , the part of this program that neutrally present history without feeding stereotype of drug user that are at the heart of the drug war mentality are pretty good and interesting and entertaining . But when it come to presenting a rational non-radical point of view with regard to drug policy , and giving the viewer example not only of people with drug problem but also the many people who successfully incorporate drug into happy and successful life , it 's pretty disappointing .

Considering this film wa released 8 year before I wa born , I do n't feel too bad for over-looking it for such a long time . Back in January of 98 though , I attended the Second Annual Quentin Tarantino film fest held in Austin , Texas . The particular theme of film this night wa `` Neglected 70 's Crime Films '' and boy wa her right . `` The Gravy Train ( or The Dion Brothers , a it appeared this print ) '' wa an absolute gem . Wonderful performance , quirky character , smart plot , hilarious comedy , and just an all around great time . Rarely do you see a Crime film that is so entertaining and fresh . Margot Kidder in one of her earliest film appearance is extremely sexy a well . I hope some cable network get a hold of this film and allows many more to see it . In the meantime , go to an indie video store and hope they have it .

The movie wa actually a romantic drama based on three sister who had desire to become a famous girl group . In their endeavor , the oldest sister meet a drug dealer and street hustler called Satin , whom Sister go after because she belief he is the `` big time '' who will give her everything she ever thought she wanted out of life . Though he could be accused of killing her , he really kill only her spirit and will to live , after which she becomes a drug addict and ultimately dy from an overdose . The story is n't about the street life or the Italian mobster who try to buy Stix off , then threatens him , it 's about how love can overcome even the worst tragedy in life a portrayed in song and style and the character that wa the life in the time for young woman trying to be `` discovered '' back then .

First , I realize that a `` 1 '' rating is supposed to be reserved for the worst of the worst . This movie get that from me because , a one reviewer point out , it 's not bad in a self-aware , over-the-top sort of way that might allow it to have some comic or cult value . It simply miss it mark on every count . * * Contains possible spoiler * * The dialog is completely disingenuous . The continuity is so deliberate it 's painful . Daniel just finish speaking of his lost love , and with his final word the flamenco dancer start . The mock-shock of what 's her name ( see ? I do n't even remember her character 's name , let alone the name of the forgettable actress ) when her husband ( the Baldwin ) first tell her that her friend is the bad guy . The car and the motorcycle chase did all the right thing . Vegetable cart gone flying . Cars crashing into each other . Motorcycles going down the stair . People nearly being hit , but remarkably , no one is . Oh , that 's right ... except for the one guy who ha been stabbed several time , is obviously stumbling along the curb with knife wound , and an approaching car apparently did n't notice him there . Hmmm . It 's becoming more and more remarkable to me that movie like this can be made . There is so much pressure in the film industry to make money , you 'd think that someone in Hollywood would think of making good film worth seeing . Now there 's a novel idea . My suggestion : do n't see this film . Do n't rent the DVD . Do n't watch it on cable . There are lot of other thing you could be doing that will leave you feeling more satisfied .

Picture the scene where a bunch of scriptwriter sit around a table and one say `` let have a black woman approach an unsuspecting member of the public ( also black ) in the street and ask him if he is black , then walk away '' . The other writer fall about laughing hysterically until one suggests they repeat it in every episode . More laughter . Now if you think the premise is funny , and the show contains many such type of situation , you will enjoy this show . For the rest , use your zapper and find something more entertaining like watching paint dry . Those that have written glowing report of this show should either get out more or be forced to watch television comedy that are really funny . Another example of the humor in the show , a girl try to get out of paying at a supermarket checkout by trying to hypnotise the cashier . Marginally funny the first time but why repeat it over and over in different show with different cashier ? I could give other example but these just might be treated a spoiler , divulging why this comedy just is not funny at all .

The year 2005 saw no fewer than 3 filmed production of H. G. Wells ' great novel , `` War of the Worlds '' . This is perhaps the least well-known and very probably the best of them . No other version of WotW ha ever attempted not only to present the story very much a Wells wrote it , but also to create the atmosphere of the time in which it wa supposed to take place : the last year of the 19th Century , 1900 using Wells ' original setting , in and near Woking , England . IMDb seems unfriendly to what they regard a `` spoiler '' . That might apply with some film , where the ending might actually be a surprise , but with regard to one of the most famous novel in the world , it seems positively silly . I have no sympathy for people who have neglected to read one of the seminal work in English literature , so let 's get right to the chase . The alien are destroyed through catching an Earth disease , against which they have no immunity . If that 's a spoiler , so be it ; after a book and 3 other film ( including the 1953 classic ) , you ought to know how this end . This film , which follows Wells ' plot in the main , is also very cleverly presented  in a way that might put many viewer off due to their ignorance of late 19th/early 20th Century photography . Although filmed in a widescreen aspect , the film go to some length to give an impression of contemporaneity . The general coloration of skin and clothes display a sepia tint often found in old photograph ( rather than black ) . Colors are often reminiscent of hand-tinting . At other time , color are washed out . These variation are typical of early film , which did n't use standardized celluloid stock and therefore presented a good many change in print quality , even going from black/white to sepia/white to blue/white to reddish/white and so on  a you 'll see on occasion here . The special effect are deliberately retrograde , of a sort seen even a late a the 1920s  and yet the Martians and their machine are very much a Wells described them and have a more nearly realistic `` feel '' . Some of effect are really awkward  such a the destruction of Big Ben . The acting is often more in the style of that period than ours . Some aspect of Victorian dress may appear odd , particularly the use of pomade or brilliantine on head and facial hair . This film is the only one that follows with some closeness Wells ' original narrative  a ha been noted . Viewers may find it informative to note plot detail that appear here that are occasionally retained in other version of the story . Wells ' description of the Martians  a giant head mounted on numerous tentacle  is effectively portrayed . When the Martian machine appear , about an hour into the film , they too give a good impression of how Wells described them . Both Wells and this film do an excellent job of portraying the progress of the Martians from the limited perspective ( primarily ) of rural England  plus a few scene in London ( involving the Narrator 's brother ) . The director is unable to resist showing the destruction of a major landmark ( Big Ben ) , but at least doe n't dwell unduly on the devastation of London . The victory of the Martians is hardly a surprise , despite the destruction by cannon of some of their machine . The Narrator , traveling about to seek escape , see much of what Wells term `` the rout of Mankind '' . He encounter a curate endowed with the Victorian affliction of a much too precious and nervous personality . They eventually find themselves on the very edge of a Martian nest , where they discover an awful fact : the Martians are shown to be vampire who consume their prey alive in a very effective scene . Wells add that after eating they set up `` a prolonged and cheerful hooting '' . The Narrator finally is obliged to beat senseless the increasingly hysterical curate  who revives just a the Martians drag him off to the larder ( cheer from the gallery ; British curate are so often utterly insufferable ) . This film last almost 3 hour , going through Wells ' story in welcome detail . It 's about time the author got his due  in a compelling presentation that build in dramatic impact . A word about the acting : Do n't expect award-winning performance . They 're not bad , however , the actor are earnest and they grow on you . Most of them , however , have had very abbreviated film career , often only in this film . The Narrator is played by hunky Anthony Piana , in his 2nd film . The Curate is John Kaufman  also in his 2nd film a an actor but who ha had more experience directing . The Brother ( `` Henderson '' ) is played with some conviction by W. Bernard Bauman in his first film . The Artilleryman , the only other sizable part , is played by James Lathrop in his first film . This is overall a splendid film , portraying for the first time the War of the Worlds a Wells wrote it . Despite it slight defect , it is far and away better than any of it hyped-up competitor . If you want to see H. G. Wells ' War of the Worlds  and not some wholly distorted version of it  see this film !

Of the element that make this the best at this point , I have to say # 1 is Christine McIntire . Shemp 's scene when poisoned and her reaction are truly magnificent . I imagine that , a one poster suggested , Christine wa trying to hold back laughter during that scene , but it actually made her seem even more deliciously evil , to be smiling at Shemp 's possibly dying . Another character who help this stand out is the Goon . His look wa a great cross between horrific and comedic goof-ball . Hardly a character I would choose to meet in a dark alley or , for that matter anywhere . I would have preferred a bit of true whodunit mystery in this , but hey , when a short is this good , who 's going to complain . Not I .

By now , the game 's stale , right ? The joke have been done . Its all over . The creative genius which drove this game for the first two game wa gone , after all . Wrong . The game is still intact , the joke are here , folk . Sure , they 're all rehash , but so wa Monkey Island 2 . And 1 , for that matter . The difficulty is well placed , somewhere between the slightly easy 1 and the ridiculously hard 2 . The ship fighting sub-game is badly innappropriate , in the tradition of sub-games . I decided to watch this movie because I 'd not seen Carol Lombard before in any movie . I 'm sorry it had to be this one because , quite frankly , this is a dog  and even with Jimmy Stewart and Charles Coburn , both of whom were great actor . The problem with the film is simple : it try to put too much , too quickly , in to a story about a young lawyer ( John Manson played by Stewart ) who marries Jane ( played by Lombard ) within an hour of meeting her . What 's that cliché ? Marry in haste , repent at leisure ... In short , the story is a series of episode that show the couple ' worsening financial status , their trouble with John 's live-in mother , their struggle to pay the bill , John 's diminished status at the office , the arrival of their baby son , John Jnr ( unexpected and causing additional friction at home with mother ) , the couple ' angst about their marriage , the baby 's sickness which worsens , thus necessitating an heroic flight by a lone pilot ( in a fierce storm ) to bring a special serum to save the child , and finally John being accepted a a junior partner at the law firm . How many more clichéd situation could the writer include ? Maybe Mother dying soon after ? There wa n't much comedy ; the drama wa lacklustre , at best ; the dialog wa painful to hear . Only the acting of the four main player wa adequate . This wa the period at the end of the Great Depression with the USA coming out of it long downturn  during which many people experienced all of the event portrayed in the movie . So , it made sense for Selznick to reaffirm good ol ' home spun American value of family , relationship , heroism , perseverance , and initiative  all against the backdrop of the `` average '' American family . Who better to use than Jimmy Stewart and Carol Lombard ? And , it should be noted that the film wa released in early 1939 ; so , it wa planned in 1938  soon after the USA began to get production going for the coming World War II . Hence , this sort of film wa a great booster for the general public , at that time , many of who would soon have to join England in war . As many here would know , Hollywood and Washington formed an uneasy alliance before , during and after the war . However , I 'm glad I saw it  a a piece of disguised socio-political propaganda . But , I 'll have to see other Lombard film to gain a better appreciation of her acting range . As another reviewer noted : see this one just to say that you 've seen all of Stewart 's movie ; otherwise , do n't bother .

Unfortunately the only spoiler in this review is that there 's nothing to spoil about that movie.Even if B. Mattei had never done any master piece he use to do his job with a bit of humor and craziness that made him a fun Eurotrash director .
