Hypothetical situation abound , one-time director Harry Ralston give u the ultimate post-apocalyptic glimpse with the world dead , left in the street , in the store , and throughout the landscape , sans in the middle of a forgotten desert . One lone survivor , attempting to rekindle his sanity , take food from the city to his bungalow in this desert . All alone , he hope for more , but with nobody around , he is left with white underwear , and a passion for a local Indian tribe  until the discovery of a camera which open up new door and break the barrier of human co-existence . Alan , a man of the book , is left on Earth after an unknown disaster . Thinking he is alone , he begin living life his way  until , Jeri Ryan , appears ( like she would in any dream ) out of the wood , disheveled , and unhappy to find the final man alive to be ... well ... like Alan . Anyway , they try to co-exist , fail , get drunk , and before creating the ultimate dystopia , they run into Redneck Raphael ( played by newcomer  Dan Montgomery Jr ) . Bonds are torn , confusion set in , a couple becomes a third wheel , and the battle between physically inept nerd vs. brainless jock . Even with nobody left on the planet , it becomes a truth that even the darkest of human nature will arise . Using a variable film technique , Ralston give u a mediocre story based loosely on another film entitled `` The Quiet Earth '' ( which I will be viewing next ) oddly which he never give any credit towards . With a borrowed story , I guess he doe a decent job of reinterpreting it . His punch seems to be lacking at the beginning while Ralston try to find his stride , borrowing yet again from other film director 's technique to attempt to find his own . He open the film interestingly enough , but fails to answer any direct answer . Sure , the final day have arrived , but could there be a concise answer a to `` how '' or better yet `` why '' these select few survived . A spookier beginning would have led u stronger into a comical film . The juxtaposition would have been like `` Shawn of the Dead '' , but instead left u feeling like we were watching a `` made-for-TV '' program . Listening to the audio commentary , I have respect for Ralston because he worked diligently to get this film made , and his passion nearly sell the film , but you could tell from his interaction with the cast that he wa n't a happy with his overall final product . There were mistake , one that he pointed out and others that he wa ashamed to point out . While this doe make for decent independent film-making , it sometimes feel cheap , and in Ralston 's case , it wa the latter . I must admit , David Arnott 's portrayal of Alan hooked me . He played that wimpy , school nerd , adult role very well . He wa funny to both watch and listen to , and thus he became sympathetic to the viewer . He wa a key player in keeping the film together , ala , I can not say the same for the rest . This wa Dan Montgomery 's first film , and it wa obvious  I mean  really really obvious . There were scene in which I thought the cue card wa about to come out and read the line for him , perhaps even giving u a more realistic performance , but ala , it wa n't the case . Then there wa Jeri Ryan . She pulled into her character near the end of the film , which to me , wa the culmination of the entire piece of art . She go from estranged unknown to bitter cranky insane girlfriend by the end . Confused ? Again , she fell into her character by the end , giving u just a glimpse of what she could have probably done a her acting matured . Even a the commentary progressed , all that she contributed wa a laugh , giggle , or `` ohhh , look at that color '' moment . While her beauty may sell ticket , one may want to consider knowledge to be just a beautiful . This wa her first film , so can I be too harsh ? Overall , this film felt like it wa missing something . I though the idea wa strong  the premise that even with only a peppering of people remaining on the Earth the evil of human nature still exists . Jealousy can not be killed by bacteria or bomb ( maybe because it is consumed by zinc ? ) and we a a race will always want what we can not have . Ralston is not a surprising director , his technique are flawed and pre-used , but he doe know how to make a low-budget comedy . I think our idea of `` funny '' is different , so that is why I could n't find myself laughing at many of the bit he found `` hysterical '' . His actor provided the level of acting needed for this film , which wa lower than average . His film wa loose , meaning that there were element never quite explained or tackled ( i.e . anything with wing survived ? ! ? ) , which overall harmed the intensity of the film . This wa a comedy , but it could have been much darker and much much funnier . For those thinking that Roger Avery wa a huge element to this film , a we learn from their commentary , all he wa there for wa money  the wa in essence , the bank for `` The Last Man '' . Do n't get your hope up for any classic Avery moment . Do n't expect more from Ralston  and that is how I will end it . Grade : * * out of * * * * *

I must admit , I wa expecting something quite different from my first viewing of 'Cut ' last night , though wa delighted with the unexpected Australian horror gem . I am a true horror fan a true a they come , and found 'Cut ' to not only be the best of the genre Australia ha ever produced , but one of the great parody/comedy film of late . My only concern is that mainstream audience may not pick up on a lot of the comedic element - the film wa not overly clever in it 's application but made me laugh at every turn trying to fit in EVERY possible cliche of the horror genre they could . I am certain this wa intended a humour .... hoping this wa intended a humour . And of course , there wa the gore . The use of the 'customised ' garden shear wa brilliance - besides the expected stab and slash . In short , there wa a huge amount of variety and creativity in the many violent death , enough to please even the skeptic of this film worth . The appearance of both Kylie Minogue ( short that her appearance wa ) and Molly Ringwald wa just another reason to see the film - both performance were fantastic , a well a Simon Bossell ( 'The Castle ' ) in a brilliant role a the jokey technician . All in all , I think this movie is one of the best horror product of the last couple or year , a well a a beautiful satire/parody - toungue-in-cheek till the very end . Loved it . Go see it !

I am so happy not to live in an American small town . Because whenever I 'm shown some small town in the States it is populated with all kind of monster among whom flesh hungry zombie , evil alien and sinister ghost are most harmless . In this movie a former doctor , who 's just done time for an accidental killing of his wife in a car crash , directs his step to the nearest small town - he must have never in his life seen a flick about any small town - which happens to be the Purgatory Flats . And , of course , a soon a he arrives there all the hell break loose . He meet a blond chick who out of all creature most resembles a cow both in facial expression and in brain functioning and at once fall in love with her . But there is a tiny handicap , she is already married to a very small-time drug dealer who in a minute get himself shot pitifully not dead . To know what ha come out of all this you should watch the movie for yourself . I 'll just tell you that it 's slightly reminiscent of U Turn by Oliver Stone but is a way down in all artistic property .

Like anyone else who bought this , I wa duped by the `` 20 piece of extreme gore '' and `` banned in 20 country '' or whatever it say in the box . I have to admit I am a huge gore fan and I am always amazed when film can lay it on thick and look convincing doing it . Tom Savini , Rick Baker and Greg Cannom are some of the best in the business . The revolutionized make-up effect in the 80 's . Today , you do n't need them a everything is done on computer . But computer can not compare to the visual wizardry that these three men could conjure up . But I digress . Watching fantastically gory film like Fulci 's Gates to Hell or even Savini 's crowning achievement , Friday the 13th the Final Chapter , you can appreciate all that go into making a terrifically gory film . You ca n't tell the difference between reality and magic . I ca n't imagine another reason why anyone would see Cannibal Ferox but the gore that is ostensibly omnipotent in this film . If that is the reason you seek this film , then you are wasting your money . As many other reviewer in here have noted , most of the gore is an aftermath . You do n't see the torture , or the bloodshed a it happens , you see whatever it look like afterwords . The gore ? Well , it 's here , but not a much a one would hope , or expect . A man doe get castrated and a woman doe get hanged by her breast , but other then those two scene , and one involving a scalping ; there is nothing really much else to this film . The scene of gore even in these three mentioned , are still pretty tame in comparison to what you were hoping for . Maybe it 's just me and my sick and twisted experience in the horror and gore genre , but I wa expecting a bit more . Call me sick or twisted , but is n't that the only reason people are watching this film in the first place ? I honestly found myself bored in a lot of place . Cannibal Ferox is just another film that try to capitalize on a craze of a superior film . While Cannibal Holocaust is not exactly a great film , it is much better than this tripe . If you go out of your way to buy this for $ 20.00 , you will feel cheated . 3/10

I always felt that Ms. Merkerson had never gotten a role fitting her skill . Familiar to million a the Lt. on Law and Order , she ha been seen in a number of theatrical release , always in a supporting role . HBO 's Lackawanna Blues change that and allows this talented actress to shine a Nanny , successful entrepreneur in a world changing from segregation to integration . But the story is really about the colorful array of character that she and her adopted son meet in a boarding house in Lackawanna , New York , a suburb of Buffalo . The story could be set in any major African-American community of the 50 's and 60 's from Atlanta 's Sweet Auburn to New York 's Harlem . But the segregation-integration angle is only a subtle undercurrent in the colorful life of the folk at Nanny 's boarding house . The story revolves around Nanny 's relationship with all kind of people , played by some of the best actor in the business ( I purposely did not say black actor -- this ensemble is a stunning array of talent who happen to be black , except for Jimmy Smits , of course ) I recommend this film a a fun and colorful look at a bygone day .

This will not likely be voted best comedy of the year , a few too many coincidence and plot hole . However we are talking about a movie where a hit-man and a white bread salesman become buddy so a few vagary should n't come a too much of a surprise . Brosnan is excellent in this role , gone is the wooden James Bond ( a role he wa wasted in ) . If he can maintain this kind of quality I hope he continues to make comedy . Greg Kinnear is also excellent a Brosnan 's straight man . I 've read a few negative comment in here about Hope Davis but I thought she wa quite good a a mousy housewife with a dark side buried deep within . There are lot of good chuckle a Brosnan sleaze his way through and a few scene where I nearly died laughing . My father ( a consultant ) nearly lost it when Julian describes himself a a `` facilitator '' . Much like `` Grosse Pointe Blank '' , another hit-man comedy , the humour can be very dark . If you are in to that be prepared to enjoy yourself .

As a casual listener of the Rolling Stones , I thought this might be interesting . Not so , a this film is very 'of it age ' , in the 1960 's . To me ( someone born in the 1980 's ) this just look to me a hippy purist propaganda crap , but I am sure this film wa not made for me , but people who were active during th '60 's . I expected drug galore with th Stones , I wa disappointed , it actually showed real life , hard work in the studio , So much so I felt a if I wa working with them to get to a conclusion of this god awful film . I have not seen any of the director other film , but I suspect they follow a similar style of directing , sort of 'amatuerish ' which gave a feeling like the TV show Eurotrash , badly directed , tackily put together and lacking in real entertainment value . My only good opinion of this is that I did n't waste money on it , it came free with a Sunday paper .

Watch the Original with the same title from 1944 ! This made for TV movie , is just god-awful ! Although it doe use ( a far a I can tell ) almost the same dialog , it just doe n't work ! Is it the acting , the poor directing ? OK so it 's made for TV , but why watch a bad copy , when you can get your hand on the superb original ? Especially a you 'll be spoiled to the plot and wo n't enjoy the original a much , a if you 've watched it first ! There are a few thing that are different from the original ( it 's shorter for once ) , but all are for the worse ! The actor playing the part here , just do n't fit the bill ! If you want , only watch it after you 've seen the original and even then you 'll be very brave , if you watch it through ! It 's almost sacrilege !

Director Don Siegel really impressed me with this film . It is starkly shot , graphic without being visually graphic , well-acted by all concerned , and cover some of the most taboo issue of any day in a workmanlike , almost expected normalcy hitherto not seen in any other film by this reviewer . I did n't know what to expect sitting down to watch this : a civil war movie or some kind of 70 's soft-core peddling with Eastwood descending on a school for girl in the South . But really is is neither of those thing but rather and examination , exploration , and descent into the soul of men and woman - a dark commentary on what is at the core of the civilized . a one reviewer previously noted , none - none - of the character are likable by the film 's end and yet each one is interesting , complex , and enigmatic . Eastwood play Cpl . McBurney , a Union soldier found by young Pamelyn Ferdin ( you 'll recognize that voice a soon a you hear it ) , a girl at a school for manner headed by Geraldine Page amidst the chaos that wa the Civil War - particularly in the South . Soon , Page , teacher Elizabeth Hartman , lovely , young seductress Carol , and even Ferdin ( Amy ) have emotional/sexual tie to Eastwood - each having their own need and secret and problem . Eastwood is not a nice man . he play the girl off of each other always trying to get the sexual advantage . In the unfolding we get some real interesting thing revealed from latent lesbianism to incest . The Beguiled , for me , is a masterpiece that far exceeded my expectation on every creative front . This might be ( except for Invasion of the Body Snatchers ) Siegel 's best film . It certainly is one of Eastwood 's best REAL performance . page is always so very good and Hartman , Fe5rdin , et al excellent . the Gothic manse set for the school is effectively claustrophobic . Some of the sexual-laced scene disturbing . And what happens to Eastwood is a leg up on much of the competition for creepy , eerie , demented film .

Anyone who lived through the age of Revenge of the Nerds and Girlpower will appreciate this film . It is one of those film that delivers everything you want in a `` spring break movie '' PLUS it make fun of the college film genre . It 's funny , it 's got a cast to die for ( Amy Pohler ! Rachel Dratch ! , Sophie Monk ! , Parker Posey ! Jane Lynch ! Amber Tamblyn ! Missi Pyle ! ) and it guaranteed to make you laugh out loud . Writer/ actor Rachel Dratch is a comic genius and Sophie Monk is such a great villain . Wilson Phillips ! OMG ! ( I 'm just repeating myself now ... ) It will live on with girl who like Miranda July but feel like eating ice cream and pretending they 're dumb .

Arguably the finest serial ever made ( no argument here thus far ) about Earthman Flash Gordon , Professor Zarkov , and beautiful Dale Arden traveling in a rocket ship to another universe to save the planet . Along the way , in spellbinding , spectacular , and action-packed chapter Flash and his friend along with new found friend such a Prince Barin , Prince Thun , and the awesome King Vultan pool their resource together to fight the evil and army of the merciless Ming of Mongo and the jealous treachery of his daughter Priness Aura ( now she 's a car ! ) . This serial is not just a cut above most serial in term of plot , acting , and budget - it is mile ahead in these area . Produced by Universal Studios it ha many former set at it disposable like the laboratory set from The Bride of Frankenstein and the Opera House from The Phantom of the Opera just to name a few . The production value across the board are advanced , in my most humble opinion , for 1936 . The costume worn by many of these strange men and woman are really creative and first-rate . We get hawk-men , shark men , lion men , high priest , creature like dragon , octasacks , orangapoids , and tigrons ( oh my ! ) and many , many other fantastic thing . Are all of them believable and first-rate special effect ? No way . But for 1936 most are very impressive . The musical score is awesome and the chapter beginning are well-written , lengthy enough to revitalize viewer memory of the former chapter , and expertly scored . Director Frederick Stephani doe a great job piecing everything together wonderfully and creating a worthy film for Alex Raymond 's phenom comic strip . Lastly , the acting is pretty good in this serial . All too often serial have either no name with no talent surrounding one or two former talent - here most everyone ha some ability . Do n't get me wrong , this is n't a Shakespeare troupe by any mean , but Buster Crabbe doe a workmanlike , likable job a Flash . He is ably aided by Jean Arden , Priscella Lawson , and the rest of the cast in general with two performer standing out . But before I get to those two let me add a another reviewer noted , it must have been amazing for this serial to get by the Hayes Office . I see more flesh on Flash and on Jean Rogers and Priscella Lawson than in movie decade later . The short Crabbe ( and unfortunately for all of u Professor Zarkov ( ( Frank Shannon ) ) wear are about a form-fitting a pair of short guy can wear . The girl are wearing mid drift throughout and are absolutely beautiful Jean Rogers may have limited acting talent but she is a blonde bombshell . Lawson is also very sultry and sensuous and beautiful . But for me the two actor that make the serial are Charles Middleton a Ming : officious , sardonic , merciless , and fun . Middleton is a class act . Jack `` Tiny '' Lipson play King Vultan : boisterous , rousing , hilarious - a symbol for pure joy in life and the every essence of hedonism . Lipson steal each and every scene he is in . The plot meander here , there , and everywhere - but Flash Gordon is the penultimate serial , space opera , and the basis for load of science fiction to follow . Excellent !

I have to say that the event of 9/11 did n't hit me until I saw this documentary . It took me a year to come to grip with the devastation . I wa the one who wa changing the station on the radio and channel on TV if there wa any talk about the tower . I wa sick of hearing about it . When this wa aired on TV a year and a day later , I wa bawling my eye out . It wa the first time I had cried since the attack . I highly recommend this documentary . I am watching it now on TV , 5 year later , and I am still cry over the tragedy . The fact that this contains one of the only video shot of the first plane hitting the tower is amazing . It wa an accident , and look where it got them . These two brother make me want to have been there to help .

Perfect movie are rare . Even my favorite film tend to have flaw - Rear Window look a little stagey at time , Chris Elliot 's character in Groundhog Day doe n't work , the music score in Best Years of Our Lives is too cheesy , the beginning of Nights of Cabiria is a little too slow - but this film is perfectly executed from start to finish . The script is brilliant , the acting is superb all around ( although Reese Witherspoon and Sam Waterston are amazing , the whole cast shine ) , the directing and the photography are inspired , and the music score is touching without being intrusive ( like some Miramax score that are too manipulative ) . Every sad moment is truly moving , every light moment make me smile . This truly is one of the best film I have ever seen and I wish there were more film like it . I am glad that Reese Witherspoon ha gone on to stardom after this film , but I am sorry to see that her recent movie are so much more escapist and silly than this serious film which is about real people , real feeling and real problem . Brilliant ! A must-see .

This ha to be one of the 5 worst movie ever made . The plot looked intriguing like that of Passenger 57 . But with the latter movie it somehow worked a lot better . The plot ha been worked out in the worst possible way . Just a few of the awful moment in the movie , A flight attendant is standing in the opened doorway of a flying 747 and trying to close the door without being sucked out by the 250 mile per hour wind ? ! ? Thereafter the land the aircraft from a few mile out starting at 8000 foot , thats impossible even for 747 pilot with thousand of hour experience . When on the runway ( perfectly straight of course ) she is instructed to pull on the flap , HUH ! ! Come on flap are there to ensure lift at low speed , when on the runway you use thrust reverse on the engine and give maximum power ! I can go on and on about little and mostly big mistake in the movie , but then my reply would become the size of the English dictionary . This is a movie you want to miss , take my word for it !

I want very much to believe that the above quote ( specifically , the English subtitle translation ) , which wa actually written , not spoken , in a rejection letter a publisher sends to the protagonist , wa meant to be self-referential in a tongue-in-cheek manner . But if so , director Leos Carax apparently neglected to inform the actor of the true nature of the film . They are all so dreadfully earnest in their portrayal that I have to conclude Carax actually take himself seriously here , or else ha so much disdain for everyone , especially the viewing audience , that he ca n't be bothered letting anyone in on the joke . Some auteur are able to get away with making oblique , bizarre film because they do so with élan and unique personal style ( e.g. , David Lynch and Alejandro Jodorowsky ) . Others use a subtler approach while still weaving surreal element into the fabric of the story ( e.g. , Krzysztof Kieslowski , and David Cronenberg 's later , le bizarre work ) . In Pola X , Carax throw a disjointed mess at the viewer and then dare him to find fault with it . Well , here it is : the pacing is erratic and choppy , in particular continuity is often dispensed with ; superfluous character abound ( e.g. , the Gypsy mother and child ) ; most of the performance are overwrought ; the lighting is often poor , particularly in the oft-discussed sex scene ; unconnected scene are thrust into the film for no discernible reason ; and the list go on . Not to be completely negative , it should be noted that there were some uplifting exception . I liked the musical score , even the cacophonous industrial-techno music being played in the sprawling , abandoned complex to which the main character retreat in the second half of the film ( perhaps a reference to Andy Warhol 's 'Factory ' of the '60s ? ) . Much of the photography of the countryside wa beautiful , an obvious attempt at contrast with the grimy city setting . And , even well into middle-age , Cathering Deneuve show that she still ha 'it ' . Her performance wa also the only one among the major character that did n't sink into bathos . There wa an earlier time when I would regard such film a `` Pola X '' more charitably . Experimentation is admirable , even when the experiment doe n't work . But Carax try nothing new here ; the film is a pastiche of element borrowed from countless earlier film , and after several decade of movie-viewing and literally thousand of film later , I simply no longer have the patience for this kind of unoriginal , poorly crafted tripe . At this early moment in the 21st century , one is left asking : With the exception of Jean-Pierre Jeunet , are there * any * director in France who know how to make a watchable movie anymore ? Rating : 3/10 .

It 's hard to praise this film much . The CGI for the dragon wa well done , but lacked proper modelling for light and shadow . Also , the same footage is used endlessly of the dragon stomping through corridor which becomes slightly tedious . I wa amazed to see `` Marcus Aurelius '' in the acting credit , wondering what an ex-Emperor of the Roman Empire wa doing acting in this film ! Like `` Whoopie Goldberg '' it must be an alias , and can one blame him for using one if he appears in this stinker . The story might been interesting , but the acting is flat , and direction is tedious . If you MUST watch this film , go around to your friend 's house and get drunk while doing so - then it 'll be enjoyable .

I remember going to see the movie in the summer of '78 with my parent , and being pretty into it at the time . Of course , I wa seven at the time . Right before the Jackson movie came out , my wife and I rented this movie since she had never seen it and I wa feeling nostalgic . Ralph Bakshi ran out of money about mid-way through the animation process for this movie , and wa forced to drastically cut corner on this production . Since this movie wa done primarily with rotoscoping , the animation technique for people on a budget , this is saying something . Much of this movie is animation only in the very loosest sense of the word . There are some scene which are very obviously just people standing in front of a screen , with maybe some animation effect superimposed on top of them . Because of budget constraint , the movie -- already a compression of `` The Fellowship of the Rings '' and part of `` The Two Towers '' -- wa pared down even more . What you get is sort of like a film-strip version of the Cliff Notes of the book . Its not all bad , though , the animation brings a warmth to it , that I found lacking in the Jackson movie . Its nice to imagine what it could have been like with decent funding . This movie is also noteworthy for having the sequel which never came . Several year later , a half-hearted half-hour long TV special wa aired , which wa meant to wrap thing up . All I will say about that is that it wa a musical .

Just finished watching 2FTM . The trailer intrigued me so much I actually went to see it on opening weekend , something I never do . Needless to say I wa very disappointed . The story ha so much potential and it 's frustrating to see it get screwed up . I really feel the problem with the movie wa the directing and Matthew McConaughey . First off I am not a MM hater , I thought he wa awesome in both Reign of Fire and Lone Star . I enjoyed his performance in those movie without having to see him with his shirt off 3-4 time . Yes we all get it that he a good-looking guy with a nice body , but I think most people knew this 10 year ago when he came on the scene in A Time to Kill . Showing him with his shirt off pumping iron like a sweaty madman 3-4 time in the movie is totally unnecessary . I think one time would have been sufficient . It would n't surprise me if they threw those unnecessary scene in so girlfriend and wife would be willing to tag along with their significant other , no woman want to see a movie about sport gambling , unless ...... Enough about that , let 's get into his role . I feel his acting wa very forced and he did n't seem very comfortable . I know his character wa supposed to be this charming southerner , but his line were corny and cheesy . It wa almost like he wa referencing Days and Confused line a few time ! In short , I did n't like his character even though I wa supposed to . The accent , his shirt off , corny pick up line , weak sale pitch . His character wa just too much of a tool , a Brandon or Jonathan . Pacino and Assante were great , but that ' no surprise . Piven is fun to watch a Arie .... oooops I mean Jerry . I just feel this movie wa very commercial and put together poorly . It 's insulting that they could take a great story , and throw in crap ingredient to try and make it a box office success . 1 . Cool story that appeal to the male man 2 . Hunky Hollywood actor for female woman ( make sure he ha numerous scene with shirt off lifting weight ) 3 . Al Pacino with 4 great speech scene , and 25 great one liner 3 . Every character shall be dressed in thousand dollar suite and have an extremely dark tan 4 . Jeremy Piven to play the same character he did in Entourage and Old School 4 . Throw in Armand Assante to seal the deal 5 . Plot , good writing , character development , and intelligent casting are unnecessary This will be good enough for most people , but not me ! Anybody who disagrees with me , ask your self this . Would this movie be much better if : A . Directed by Sodeberg B. DeCaprio or Ed Norton a Brandon instead of MM I will probably be part of the minority in thinking this movie suck . I realized this when the woman next to me started cry during the ridiculous ending scene of Pacino shedding a fake tear while embracing Russo . The financial success of this movie will ensure one thing . The movie going public get what the movie going public want , big budget crapola .
