Just remember if Jim Wynorski had anything to do with a movie .... steer clear .... to avoid from falling asleep keep repeating `` It 's almost over .. it 's almost over ... '' . 0 out of 5 .

I only heard about Driving Lessons through the ITV advert , and to be honest , I did n't know how much I would like it . I switched on the TV last night and wa totally surprised . Driving Lessons is a modest , simple film which draw you in right from the start . Rupert Grint play the part of socially awkward teenager Ben brilliantly . He 's definitely one to look out for in the future . Dame Eve Walton is played by the fabulous Julie Walters . I loved the simple plot and the way the actor portrayed their character with great sensitivity . The highlight of the film , for me wa Evie 's rather colourful poem . It show how friendship can form between the most unlikely pair . In my opinion , watching Driving Lessons is a great way to spend 2 hour . The scenery wa also striking , especially the countryside . Anyone who can call this sparkling comedy forgettable , I strongly disagree with

For Greta Garbo 's first talking picture , MGM wisely chose Eugene O'Neill 's Pultizer Prize winning 1921 play ANNA Christie . Also wisely , the producer backed Garbo up with not one but two member of the Original Broadway Cast ( George Marion a Anna 's father , Chris , and James T. Mack a Johnny the Priest - transmuted to `` Johnny the Harp '' for film so a not to offend ) . This little change is interesting . Like too many film accused ( by those who want MOVIES to be MOVIES and ignore their origin ) of being `` little more than filmed stage play , '' the problem is not the play but the movie maker who would n't be more faithful to the property . By diluting a great cinematic stage work so it would n't offend anyone , or opening it up because they COULD , too many lose the very quality which made the piece worth filming in the first place . Fortunately , the respect the studio had for both O'Neill and Garbo allowed ANNA Christie to survive the normally destructive process admirably in Frances Marion 's generally sensitive screen adaptation . Wonder of wonder , Marion even allows the POINT of the scene where Garbo 's Anna reveals her past on `` the farm '' to the man she badly want to marry and the father who sent her there in tact ! What the League of Decency must have thought of that ! The source play 's greatest problem ha always been that Chris 's friend Marthy tends to walk away with the first act and then disappears from the last two so that Anna can take stage - the two side of the genuinely good woman men do n't always recognize . The perfectly cast Marie Dressler ( who had cut her teeth on the Broadway stage a well before going to Hollywood ) is the perfect balance for Garbo 's Anna in this area a well and the fast moving film at only 90 minute , doe n't allow u too much time to miss her - one of the few benefit from atmosphere being shown rather than eloquently described in the original - AND screenwriter Marion is wise enough to stray from O'Neill to bring Dressler back for a touching scene two third of the way through the film that will remind many of Julie Laverne 's second act appearance in SHOW BOAT . Anna and Marthy 's early scene together on screen ( 16 minute into the film ) taking each other 's measure and setting up all the tension of the rest of the story is among the most affecting scene in the entire piece . Not to be missed . ANNA Christie is great tragic play and a good film drama . It 's hard to imagine that a latter day remake , which would almost certainly lose the grit and atmosphere of this 1930 remake ( it wa first filmed without sound in 1923 - also with George Marion 's original Broadway Chris ) could improve on this excellent filming . The internal scene hew closest to the play , but the exterior should n't be missed by anyone with an eye to atmosphere . While the background screen work is not to modern technical standard , the background give a better glimpse than most film of the era of the actual world in which the screen play is set ( especially in the New York harbor ) . Nearly all Garbo 's naturalistic performance of the sound era have held up superbly ( only the too often parodied death scene from CAMILLE , 7 year later , will occasionally draw snicker because of the heavy handed direction and the parody ) , but this ANNA Christie , together with the variety of her 1932 film , MATA HARI and GRAND HOTEL , and the sublime Lubitsch touch on her 1939 comedy , NINOTCHKA ( `` Garbo laugh ! `` ) , surely stand a her best . O'Neill fan who are taken with this play at the edge of his lauded `` sea play , '' should track down the fine World War II shaped film released in the year before the U.S. entered the conflict , THE LONG VOYAGE HOME ( 1940 ) . It is almost a skillfully drawn from those sea play a this one is from ANNA Christie , and feature a youngish John Wayne in one of his rare non-Westerns supporting a fine cast of veteran actor showing him the way .

Let me set the scene . It is the school holiday and there is absolutely nothing at the movie . I am with my friend deciding what to see . We look for a movie that is starting soon and `` The Grinch '' come up . We buy ticket not knowing what to expect . What we got wa a roller coaster of fun . Jim Carrey ( who may I add is my No.1 actor in the whole world ) wa absolutely magnificent a the Grinch in this Ron Howard 's best movie ( next to Apollo 13 ) . The way that this movie wa made , the scenery , the actor , the prop and the music wa just amazing . It really brought this childhood movie to life . The story is based upon the story of the grinch . As we all know the Grinch is a horrible person who just ca n't stand christmas . He life high above whoville and ha never mingled well with the townfolk . But one little girl is going to change The Grinch 's look on life and on others in a drastic way . Cindy Lou Who ( played by adorable new actress Taylor Momsem ) meet the Grinch a find the kind part of him straight away . She attempt to break the barrier and to help the Grinch move in and mingle with the town people . All up this movie is a barrel of laugh for the whole family both kid and parent . A SOLID 10/10 . Well done Jim .

As a long-time fan of all the Star Trek series , I found this a disappointing episode , and I wonder if the liberal use of `` flashback '' featuring Will Riker 's exploit , both positive ( and largely romantic ) and negative ( lot of pain , and a crewmate 's death ) wa a money-saving device , a were many of their `` bottle show '' ( episode in which all scene take place on the Enterprise ) . Diana Muldaur ( who also appeared at least twice on the original series ) deserved a better final appearance than this for her character , Dr. Kate Pulaski . Loyal viewer ( in the Star Trek world , is there any other kind ? ) also were shortchanged . This wa the last episode of second season ; thus , the season ended `` not with a bang '' but with `` a whimper . ''

This TV-series wa one of the one I loved when I wa a kid . Even though I see it now through the pink-shaded glass of nostalgia , I can still tell it wa a quality show , very educational but still funny . I have not seen the original French version , only the Swedish . I have no idea how good the dubbing wa , it wa too long ago to remember . The premise of the show wa to show you how the body work . I swear , school still ha n't taught me half of what I know from this show . It also tied in other thing , like what happens if you eat unhealthy food and do n't exercise , with nice example within the body . Who want to have another bar of chocolate when you know miniature virus tank can invade you ? : D The cartoon looked nice , very kid friendly of course , but done with care . Cells , virus , electric signal in the brain , antibody and everything else are represented by smiling cartoon figure , looking pretty much how you 'd expect what they should look like in the animated body . This , and the series about history ( especially the environmentally scary finale ) were key part of my childhood . I 'm so happy I found them here .

Fans of the HBO series `` Tales From the Crypt '' are going to love this MOH episode . Those who know the basic archetypal story that most of the classic EC comic were based on , will recognize this one right off the bat . Underrated indie favorite Martin Donovan ( also an excellent writer - co-author of the screenplay for APARTMENT ZERO and DEATH BECOMES HER ) is the kind of guy whose everyman good look can go either way . He could play a really nice if misunderstood guy-next-door , or he can play the same role with a creepy undertone of corrosive sleaziness . In the case of RIGHT TO DIE , he take the latter approach , and it definitely work . Donovan is a doctor who ha recently had an affair with his slutty office receptionist ( Robin Sydney ) , much to the displeasure of his inconsolable , unforgiving spouse , Abbey ( Julia Anderson ) . When the two of them get involved in a terrible car accident while returning from an unsuccessful weekend of `` making up , '' and she 's horribly burned in a fire , he 's reluctant to pull the plug on her , not without some enthusiastic nudging from his even sleazier lawyer and best buddy ( Corbin Bernsen , looking the worse for wear these day . ) But Abbey 's never been one to give up without a fight , and that 's where the EC-theme of the episode come in . Cuckolded husband - and wife - have always been the genre 's favorite subject matter for some spooky ( and OOKY ) supernatural shenanigan , and this case is definitely no exception . If anything , the ramped-up quotient of sex and gore must have Bill Gaines cackling with glee in his mausoleum somewhere . And that 's not to mention that John Esposito 's original script doe give the adultery angle just a slight twist . You do n't realize a you 're watching that you only know half the story , until close to the end ... ( think WHAT LIES BENEATH with more gut and gazongas , and you 're there . ) Not a bad effort , but not the best of the lot , either . At least Rob Schmidt doe display touch of flair here and there with the direction , especially in a scene that make cell phone picture messaging into a truly horrifying experience indeed ! As with most MOH episode , this one is following a prevalent theme this season of flaying and dismemberment , so the extremely squeamish need not apply .

Dirty War is absolutely one of the best political , government , and well written T.V . Drama 's in the 25 year . The acting is superb , the writing is spectacular . Diry War reveals the true side of why we are not ready to respond to a Nuclear , Biological , and Radiological Terrorist Attack here on American soil . Dirty War should be made into a major motion picture - It 's that good ! I highly recommend this great drama to everyone who desire to know the truth . This T.V . drama reveals how British Intelligence ( MI5 & MI6 ) attempt to expose a terrorist plot and conspiracy to destroy innocent victim -because of England 's involvement in the Iraq War . The scene of different part of London , England are also spectacular . Dirty War is a must see ! ! !

Some may go for a film like this but I most assuredly did not . A college professor , David Norwell , suddenly get a yen for adoption . He pretty much take the first child offered , a bad choice named Adam . As it turn out Adam doe n't have both oar in the water which , almost immediately , cause untold stress and turmoil for Dr. Norwell . This sob story drolly played out with one problem after another , all centered around Adam 's inability and seizure . Why Norwell wanted to complicate his life with an unknown factor like an adoptive child wa never explained . Along the way the good doctor managed to attract a wifey to share in all the hell the little one wa dishing out . Personally , I think both of them were one beer short of a sixpack . Bypass this yawner .

This is the Who at their most powerful . Although before the masterwork Who 's Next , which would provide anthem like Baba O'reily and Wont Get Fooled Again . This film show the group in transition from mod rocker to one of the biggest live band of the 70 's . Daltrey show what being a front-man is all about , Entwistle steady a ever . Moon is great , check out the ongoing conversation with the drum tech , and see him playing `` side saddle '' whilst having a bass drum head replaced ! Townsend even look like he 's enjoying himself occasionally ! Considering they took to the stage at 2am no one in the crowd wa asleep ! There are not many band these day could produce a set a tight a this and it is difficult to imagine any of the band of today producing a concert that in 36 year time will be be enjoyed a much a this one .

This filmmaker wanted to make a movie without having a story to tell -- and did so . Really awful jumble of unlikely/unexplained coincidence and unidentifiable plot line , all without character or clear motivation . We get cliché snapshot instead of character . One in particular is the diminutive and beautiful crime bos , who project an overdone `` tough guy '' persona and cast a cartoonish shadow of intimidation over the actual tough guy who have been brought in to work for her . Nothing much startling to look at in the film except for one shot when the boy hit the road and one of them carry a tiny suitcase ( a in , the smallest from a complete American Tourister set ) in a bright , sky blue , without explanation or apology . Otherwise it 's standard visually -- one other exception is a compelling shot of a beautiful bridge in CT .

They filmed this movie out on long Island , where I grew up . My brother and his girlfriend were extra in this movie . Apparently there is some party scene where they are all drinking beer , ( which they told me wa colored water , tasted disgusting , and wa very hard to keep swallowing over and over again , especially in the funnel scene ) . Yet none of u ever heard of the movie being released anywhere in any form . It never came out in the theater ( obviously ) and it , a far a I knew , wa never released on video , and I 'm sure wa n't released on DVD . Yet it look like it wa seen by some people , albeit it probably very few . So there must be something . I would absolutely love to purchase this for my brother , yet there is no way I can find it anywhere . Does anybody know anything about when/where/how this movie could be purchased ? And which format that would be ?

That 's how Burt Reynolds describes this film , which happens to be his best ever . He play Tom Sharky , a vice detective who 's on the trail of an international mobster ( Vittorio Gassman ) and the man he 's financing to be the next governor of Georgia ( Earl Holliman ) . In the novel by William Diehl , the story is more complex because the guy 's running for president . This is a very long movie that feel more like three hour instead of two . The filming in downtown Atlanta and the Peachtree Plaza hotel set the mood just right for the story . Reynolds doe n't do much laughing in this one compared to his comedy film . He 's very serious here , especially in the beginning of the movie because he get demoted for a dope bust that go wrong . At time though , the movie play more like a voyeuristic drama than a crime film with Burt trying to get close to the mobster 's woman . Only towards the end of the film doe the violence get cranked up that lead to the bang bang climax . Just like the great jazz score in DIRTY HARRY by Lalo Schifrin , Sharky 's Machine feature an excellent urban jazz soundtrack with many guest star including Chet Baker , Julie London , Flora Purim & Buddy De Franco , The Manhattan Transfer , Doc Severinson , Sarah Vaughan and Joe Williams . Al Capps handle the score with magic . This movie ha become one of the best crime drama ever . Check it out . Score , 8 out of 10 Stars

Human Traffic is a view into an average weekend for a group of friend , it is a fly-on-the-wall view into their life ( and mind ) which will show you how this group of friend relate to each other . There are many moment in that every one can relate to , Like being out of you skull at party and talking complete rubbish to stranger . The character are all people that you can relate to and they are believable in the role that they play in the movie . The situation that they are in are all situation that we all have found ourselves in , and that is where this film succeeds . The topic of sex and drug are handled superbly a to no get in the way of the character relationship with each other . The story to the film is not all that , but that is not a criticism . This is a film about people . This is a well written film , with a sound track to die for . D.J 's Pete Tong ha put together an superb selection of track for this file which all go to make this one of the best film that I have seen in 1999 . After watching this film I felt like I had been out partying all weekend . Fantastic Movie ! Jo Brand a the voice of reality - Need I say more !

This early Biograph short wa so much fun to watch . The second on disc one of D.W. Griffith 's `` Years of Discovery '' DVD set ( highly recommended ) it feature three excellent performance by the main lead , and interesting to see Henry B. Walthall ( The Little Colonel , Birth of a Nation ) a a campy musician giving a Countess the eye ( and other thing ) . The Countess ' husband go berserk at his wife 's betrayal and ha her walled into a little room with her paramour . It 's kind of incredible that they would n't hear the wall going up , but hey , maybe the wine had something to do with it . Here Mr. Johnson ( father of silent player Raymond Hackett ) gesticulates wildly and this add to the melodrama , but in an unexpectedly comical way . The best moment come at the end . As the lady pass out from shock and fear , once she realizes she 's doomed , Henry pick up his instrument and `` fan '' it over her . The way he did it wa so unexpected and in a strange way kind of sexy , and I just lost it , and laughed my head off . The expression on his face ! From that moment I wa charmed by Henry B. Walthall .

Baba - Rajinikanth will never forget this name in his life . This is the movie which caused his downfall . It wa released with much hype but crashed badly and laid to severe financial loss for it producer and distributor . Rajinikanth had to personally repay them for the loss incurred . Soon after it release , he tried venturing into politics but failed miserably . Its a very bad movie with horrible acting , bad-quality makeup and pathetic screenplay . Throughout the movie , Rajinikanth look like a person suffering from some disease . I 'm one of the unfortunate soul who saw Baba , first day first show in theatre . The audience were so bored that most of them left the theatre before the intermission . Sorry , I 'll not recommend this one to anyone .

Written by Oliver Stone and directed by Brian De Palma , SCARFACE paint a picture not easily forgotten . Al Pacino turn in a stunning performance a Tony Montana , a Cuban refugee than becomes a powerful player in the drug world a he ruthlessly run his self made kingdom of crime in Florida . This gangster flick is harsh , violent , loud , gross , unpleasant and must hold the record for uttering the word `` f -- k '' the most number of time . Almost three hour long , and yes it can get repulsive . A stout hearted constitution keep you in your seat cheering for the demise of a ruthless crime lord . Also playing interesting character are Michelle Pfeiffer , Steven Bauer , Robert Loggia , Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio , F. Murray Abraham and Angel Salazar . Pacino prof to be one of the greatest of his generation . He manages to bring reality to his character that leaf a strong impression . This will not be a movie for everyone for you leave thinking you walked away from a disaster . Is that powerful enough for you ? Crime doe not pay for long !

First , the CGI in this movie wa horrible . I watched it during a marathon of bad movie on the SciFi channel . At the end when the owner of the park get killed , it 's probably one of the worst example of CGI I have even seen . Even Night of the Living Dead had better animation . That said , the movie had almost no plot . Why were they on that island in particular ? Well , it wa n't stated in the movie . And , why would the people keep coming into the cat 's area ? Makes no sense . One thing that stood out in this movie wa moderately good acting . In what could be called a `` B made for TV movie '' movie , the acting wa very good . Parry Shen stood out in particular . If you have absolutely nothing to do on a Saturday , watch this movie . It may be good for some memorable quote .

I enjoyed it . There you go , I said it again . I even bought this movie on DVD and enjoyed it a couple of more time . Call me old fashioned but I prefer movie like this to garbage like Die Hard 4 which hold up the box office and get critical acclaim just because you have some old guy saving America . Van Damme move well for a guy of his age ( 47 I think ) , delivering kick that reminds one of Kickboxer . If you like old school action and and explosion , this is the movie to watch . This is one of Van Damme 's best work . Van Damme and Steven Seagal movie get released theatrically where I live so I never miss a chance to watch our old school action star on the big screen .
What a waste of talent . A very poor , semi-coherent , script cripple this film . Rather unimaginative direction , too . Some VERY faint echo of _Fargo_ here , but it just doe n't come off .

Although it stray away from the book a little , you ca n't help but love the atmospheric music and setting . The scene in Bath are just how they should be . Although if you have watched it a many time a I have you notice that the background people are the same in each scene , but that aside , I like the scene where they are in the Hot Baths , but did the men and woman really bathe together like that ? You could see all the men perched around the outside leering at the woman . It also seemed strange that they all had their hat on , but perhaps this wa the style at the time . The ballroom scene were very nice , the dancing and the outfit looked beautiful . I especially liked Catherine 's dress in the first ballroom scene . Northanger Abbey looked suitably imposing , but I enjoyed the Bath scene better . Schlesinger give a good but not exceptional performance a Catherine Morland . Googie Withers give the best performance a Mrs Allen I feel . Ugh Peter Firth a Mr Tilney , he just talk a load of rubbish , and is not a clergyman a he should be , it 's hard to think of him being in love with Catherine , but then the book never really gave that impression either . General Tilney is played reasonably well by Hardy , and Stuart also give a sort of good performance a Isabella . Ingrid Lacey did not give a good performance a Elinor Tilney . As for John Thorpe , well he give the impression of a seedy and lustful man , perhaps not the character portrayed in the book , but I quite like it . I can handle scene being cut from a book adaptation , but when new scene and character are added it usually annoys me . The marchioness ! I hate her . She is not part of the Northanger story and neither is her cartwheeling page boy . some of the script is peculiar . When Catherine is asking Elinor Tilney about her Mothers death she asks `` I suppose you saw the body ? How did it appear ? '' What a silly thing to say ! Elinor 's calm response is stupid too . anyway please tell me if you agree or disagree with me

Mario Lewis of the Competitive Enterprise Institute ha written a definitive 120-page point-by-point , line-by-line refutation of this mendacious film , which should be titled A CONVENIENT LIE . The website address where his debunking report , which is titled `` A SKEPTIC 'S GUIDE TO AN INCONVENIENT TRUTH '' can be found at is : www.cei.org . A shorter 10-page version can be found at : www.cei.org/pdf/5539.pdf Once you read those demolition , you 'll realize that alleged `` global warming '' is no more real or dangerous than the Y2K scare of 1999 , which Gore also endorsed , a he did the pseudo-scientific film THE DAY AFTER TOMORROW , which wa based on a book written by alleged UFO abductee Whitley Strieber . As James `` The Amazing '' Randi doe to psychic , and Philip Klass doe to UFOs , and Gerald Posner doe to JFK conspir-idiocy theory , so doe Mario Lewis doe to Al Gore 's movie and the whole `` global warming '' scam .

A lovely little film about the introduction of motion picture to China . Captures the amazement of film 's first audience pretty much a it 's described to have been worldwide , and us actual Lumiere film for most of the actuality . I do n't agree with other people about bad acting on the British fellow 's part - I thought he wa fine , but the Chinese lead really stole the show . In any case , I found myself with a smile on my face through most of the movie . People who fear subtitle might note that a lot of the film is in English ( which for some reason is given subtitle a well a the Chinese on the DVD ) .

Sigh . I 'm baffled when I see a short like this get attention and assignment and whatnot . I saw this film at a festival before the filmmaker got any attention and forgot about it immediately afterwards . It wa mildly annoying to see it swiping the Grinch Who Stole Christmas heart gag along with the narration , the set design seen many time before , the whole weak Tim Burton-ish style , and the story that go nowhere . And we got the `` joke '' about shooting the crow with the 45 the first time , alright ? But I guess what 's really unacceptable is that it even swipe it basic concept from a comic book circa 1999 called LENORE , THE CUTE LITTLE DEAD GIRL by Roman Dirge ! As any quick internet search will reveal . I mean , what is this ? This is what they base a Hollywood contract on and open door in Canada for a filmmaker ? `` Give your head a shake '' a Don Cherry might say .

Cute idea ... salesgirl Linda Smith ( Yolande Donlan ) inherits a teeny tiny little county of Lampidorra . That country , which wa n't even in North America , wa made the 49th state ... ( of course , there were only 48 state at the time , since this wa made in 1952 ... ) Linda travel to the country she ha inherited , and we follow her along a she try to figure out what to do with this strange country and it even quirkier people . At one point , she sings a song that she claim is from her people the Navajo , and it get ever-more sillier from there .... although Yolande Donlan 's heavy lipstick and omni-present smile never get ruffled or shmeared . There are other song scattered through-out a the citizen sing to welcome their new princess . Filmed in a glorious British version of technicolor , or some such equivalent , about the only big name here is Dirk Bogarde a British subject Tony Craig , cheese vendor . Bogarde made a big splash in the UK film industry after serving in the war , and wa even knighted by QE II . Craig and `` the new princess '' keep bumping into each other , and their adventure become more intertwined a Lampidorra 's financial problem worsen ... Fun little farce .... along the line of Marx Brothers film . Also note that Donlan later married Val Guest , the writer and director of our little project , and stayed married for 50 year ! Guest wa better known for writing and directing his sci-fi flick , in both the UK & the US .

Back in 1982 a little film called MAKING LOVE shocked audience with it frank and open depiction of a romantic love story that just happened to be about two men . I have been waiting for year for a good , old-fashioned romance between two men ; LATTER DAYS is all that and more . Yes , it is soapy , melodramatic , cliché-ridden , and quite corny . That is what make it so wonderful . There is nothing like a good romantic movie , and this movie is romantic in the best sense of the word . As to the issue of religion , sorry folk , but these thing do happen and are happening to gay people even now . It is not just the Mormon church that reject it gay member . Gay people in every religion have faced harsh judgment and rejection . I loved this movie . It ha a perfect blend of a fantasy-romance grounded in the reality of the day-to-day life of the character . If I could give it more than ten star I would . Good love story never go out of style ; great love story like LATTER DAYS are unforgettable . It 's about time !

The concept of having Laurel & Hardy this time in the role of chimney sweeper work out surprisingly hilarious . It guarantee some funny situation and silly antic , from especially Stan Laurel of course a usual . The movie also ha a subplot with a nutty professor who is working on a rejuvenation formula . It doe n't really sound like a logical mix of story line and incoherent but both plot line blend in perfectly toward the memorable ending . It 's still a bit weird but it funny nevertheless , so it work for the movie . The supporting cast of the movie is surprising good . Sam Adams is great a the stereotypical butler and Lucien Littlefield go deliciously over-the-top a the nutty professor . The movie is filled with some excellent timed and hilarious constructed sequence , which are all quite predictable but become hilarious to watch nevertheless thanks to the way they are all executed . It all help to make `` Dirty Work '' to be one of the better Laurel & Hardy short . 8/10

This movie came a a huge disappointment . The anime series ended with a relatively stupid plot twist and the rushed introduction of a pretty lame villain , but I expected Shamballa to tie up all the loose end . Unfortunately , it did n't . It added more plot hole than it resolved , and confused more than it clarified . The animation and voice acting were great , but with an idiotic plot , dull setting ( most of the movie doe n't even take place in dull WWII Earth rather than the Alchemy world ) , and disappointing ending ( Ed is useless for the rest of his day in a world with no alchemy , and he ditch Winry ? ) , it wa altogether pretty lackluster . Do yourself a favor -- disregard the last half of the anime a well a this movie , and read the manga .

Maybe I loved this movie so much in part because I 've been feeling down in the dump and it 's such a lovely little fairytale . Whatever the reason , I thought it wa pitch perfect . Great , intelligent story , beautiful effect , excellent acting ( especially De Niro , who is awesome ) . This movie made me happier than I 've been for a while . It is a very funny and clever movie . The running joke of the kingdom 's history of prince savagery and the aftermath , the way indulging in magic effect the witch and dozen of smart little touch all kept me enthralled . That 's much of what make it so good ; it 's an elaborate , special-effects-laden movie with more story than most fairytale movie , yet there is an incredible attention to small thing . I feel like just going ahead and watching it all over again .

I wa surprised that `` Forgiving the Franklins `` did not generate more buzz at this year Sundance Film Festival . There were time that the laughter at the screening I saw wa so loud that you could barely hear the movie . The movie ha some excellent acting and a story that really make one examine broader issue . You know little issue like Religion , sex and the truth . Lots of comedy 's seem to rely on the same old corny contrived situation , many leave you thinking `` I know they ripped this off from some sitcom `` .This film take off on it own unique direction . I really think that Jay Floyd did a fantastic job with a tight budget on this film .

They must issue this plot outline to all wannabe filmmaker arriving at the Hollywood bus station . They then fill in the blank and set their story in whatever hick town or urban ghetto from which they just arrived . You know exactly what this movie is about from the opening shot , four young boy playing in grainy slow motion , accompanied by voice over narration . Next stop after the bus station must be to buy stock footage of four young boy playing in grainy slow motion . Once they 're grown , it 's easy to spot the writer/director among the four . He 's the quiet , contemplative , long-haired one who is never seen without his composition book tucked in his pant . This mean that his superb writing talent will be his ticket from Hickville to Hollywood . Only there 's no writing , or directing talent on display here . And if you still ca n't figure out which one he is , here 's a hint : The auteur and his character have the same middle name . It took over an hour to figure out that these twenty-something men were supposed to still be in high school . What looked like a prison wa apparently a high school , the warden turned out to be the principal . Once more , the poor , misunderstood rebel can pound everyone in the movie into the pavement , murder and pillage , but is powerless to stand up to his alcoholic father . How about hitting back , kid , like you do everyone else ? Numerous fist fight scene for no apparent purpose . Howlingly bad dialogue . Many scene badly out of focus . Cartoon character keep popping up a bit player and extra , drawing unintentional laugh from the premiere audience . Overacting in the extreme . And if you do n't quite get the self-important speech , or the slow-motion scene , just listen to the overbearing music . It will clue you in and what you 're supposed to feel . Poor Marisa Ryan must be racking up lot of frequent flier mileage a she travel around the country working in these amateur regional film . The biggest sin is that the audience is supposed to feel sympathy for kid who gun down old lady , run over puppy chained to a tree , rob and steal , all the while complaining about their sad , sorry life . But if only we could get out of this hick town and go to college . Yeah , that 's the ticket . Why is it that every twenty-something filmmaker belief that his life so far is so important , so interesting , that the world ca n't wait to see it onscreen ? If this movie is a autobiographical a it seems , then the auteur better be looking over his shoulder for policeman bearing fugitive warrant .

I watched this movie so that you do n't have to ! I have great respect for Kris Kristofferson , but what wa he thinking ? He did this for scale ? At least the film 's title practice truth in advertising , since people and object routinely disappear throughout the film , adding to the confusion . Kristofferson mention this in his commentary that even he wa n't sure if Genevieve Bujold 's character really existed . This doe not bode well for the viewer being able to follow the story ! The `` making of '' feature wa far more interesting than the movie itself . It explores the difficulty cobbling together funding for an indie , even a the film is being shot . To it 's credit , this movie is visually pleasing and doe n't in any way look like a movie made with just slightly over 1M . Too bad the money wa n't spent on a better project .

Just saw this movie on opening night . I read some other user comment which convinced me to go see it ... I must say , I wa not impressed . I 'm so unimpressed that I feel the need to write this comment to spare some of you people some money . First of all `` The Messengers '' is very predictable , and just not much of a thriller . It might be scary for someone under 13 , but it really did nothing for me . The climax wa laughable and most of the audience left before the movie 's resolution . Furthermore the acting seemed a little superficial . Some of the emotional argument between the family were le convincing than the sub-par suspense scene . If you 've seen preview for this movie , then you 've seen most of the best part and have a strong understanding of the plot . This movie is not worth seeing in the theater .

I went to see this movie ( actually I went to see Family Portraits , which contains Cutting Moments + 2 other short film by Douglas Buck ) at the Mar del Plata festival ( Argentina ) ... I just could n't watch it ! I had to cover my eye after the 1st half of Cutting Moments and take a peek every once in a while . By the time it wa over , my stomach wa upside down and I felt light headed . I just HAD to leave the cinema a few minute after the 2nd short begun ( BTW , of course I wa not the only one who left the room ) . It wa WAAAAY too violent and disgusting for me ! I am impressed by the many brave people who actually loved it . I just do n't get how you can love that kind of movie ! The shocking and bloody and horrible image I saw got really stuck in my head for like two day ! ! I also try to analyze the story ( my boyfriend did see the whole thing and told me about it ) and I just do n't think it make any sense . I mean , that amount of violence and stuff , make no other sense than to try to shock people . And that 's not a good enough reason , I think . There 's absolutely nothing in this movie that I can say `` Well , at least ' x ' thing about it wa good '' . But well , I guess I will never understand that kind of film .

A well-made run-of-the-mill movie with a tragic ending . Pluses : The way the story move - begin with Soorya struggling to live followed by a long flashback about why he 's there . The Music . A disinterested look at the life of policeman . Minuses : The violence and the gore , but I guess they add to the realistic effect . Still , having people 's head chopped off and sent in box and sack could have been avoided . No complaint - 7/10

I do n't understand the positive comment made about this film . It is cheap and nasty on all level and I can not understand how it ever got made . Cartoon character abound - Sue 's foul-mouthed , alcoholic , layabout , Irish father being a prime example . None of the character are remotely sympathetic - except , briefly , for Sue 's Asian boyfriend but even he then turn out to be capable of domestic violence ! As desperately unattractive a they both are , I 've no idea why either Rita and/or Sue would throw themselves at a consummate creep like Bob - but given that they do , why should I be expected to care what happens to them ? So many review keep carping on about how `` realistic '' it is . If that is true , it is a sad reflection on society but no reason to put it on film . I did n't like the film at all .

Steven what have you done you have hit an all new low . It is weird since Steven 's last film shadow man wa directed by the same director who did this trash . Shadow man wa good this wa diabolically bad so bad it wa n't even funny Steven is hardly in the movie and feel like he is in a cameo appearance and when he is in the film he is dubbed half the time anyway . As for the action well let 's just say the wizard of oz had more action than this trash there is hardly any action in the film and when it doe finally arrive it is boring depressing badly shot so called action scene . Seagal hardly kill anyone unlike his over film where he go one man army ie under siege 1 and 2 and exit wound . the plot is so confusing with so many plot hole that it doe n't make scene sometimes . flight of fury better be good what a shame i wasted 5 pound on this garbage 0 out of ten better luck next time

A call-girl witness a murder and becomes the killer 's next target . Director Brian De Palma is really on a pretentious roll here : his camera swoop around corner in a museum ( after lingering a long time over a painting of an ape ) , divvy up into split screen for arty purpose , practically give away his plot with a sequence ( again in split screen ) where two character are both watching a TV program about transsexual , and stage his ( first ) finale during a thunderous rainstorm . `` Dressed To Kill '' is exhausting , primarily because it asks u to swallow so much and give back nothing substantial . Much of the acting ( with the exception of young Keith Gordon ) is mediocre and the ( second ) finale is a rip-off of De Palma 's own `` Carrie '' -- not to mention `` Psycho '' . The explanation of the dirty deed play like a spoof of Hitchcock , not an homage . Stylish in a steely cold way , the end result are distinctly half-baked . * * from * * * *

* Flat SPOILERS * Five med student , Nelson ( Kiefer Sutherland ) , David Labraccio ( Kevin Bacon ) , Rachel Mannus ( Julia Roberts ) , Joe Hurley ( William Baldwin ) & Randy Steckle ( Oliver Platt ) decide to attempt an experiment ; dying for exactly 5 minute ( it is the maximum amount of time somebody can do this before being risk of brain damage ) . Almost everyone doe this experiment , Randy being the lone exception , but they begin to have unwelcome visitor ; David see a little black girl shouting crude insult to him , Joe see all the woman he ha had sex with ( and which he videotaped ) asking him why from the TV Screen , Rachel relives her father 's suicide and Nelson face a little boy with murderous intention . Why are they here ? And how will they get rid of them ? This tense and interesting movie , set in an hallucinated city and into a Gothic Med School , is quite the experience , both for the story and the character , played by then-budding star such a Kiefer Sutherland , Julia Roberts , Oliver Platt , Kevin Bacon and William Baldwin . The director is Joel Schumacher , who had already worked with Sutherland in 'Lost Boys ' , and this second cooperation is even better than the first . A must for psychological-thriller-horror bud and metaphor lover ( this story is about forgiveness and righting of past wrong ) , this is one of the minor classic from the '80s that get respect even today , like the mention by Rebecca Gayheart in 'Scream 2 ' or the Tru Calling episode which used the movie 's premise . Flatliners : 9/10 .

One of my favorite show back in the '70s . As I recall it went to air on Friday ( or possibly Saturday ) night on the Nine Network ( ? ) here in Australia . Darren McGavin and Simon Oakland were great together . Each episode usually reached a climax with Kolchack having to engage in hand to hand combat with some sort of supernatural opponent . To their credit , the writer made a concerted effort to get away from the usual round of vampire and ghost a much a possible . I remember one episode in which the adversary wa the spirit of an ancient Indian Chief which/who 'came back ' a a massive electrical current which started to kill people in a city hospital . The final showdown saw Kolchack trying to short circuit the 'power beast ' amidst an explosion of spark and billowing flame . Oh well .... you had to be there at the time but it wa an interesting idea . McGavin always packed a lot of energy and enthusiasm into his role and this wa one of his best . Definitely deserves a place in TV 's `` Hall of Fame '' . To quote Tony Vincenzo .... 'Kolchack you are ON IT ' ... Or , in the case of the Hall of Fame , 'IN it ' !

I think my summary say it all . This MTV-ish answer to the classic Candid Camera TV show feature a Gen X ( or is that Gen Y ) type putting in false chopper and wearing various hat and wig and glass , and setting people up in fairly outlandish although often not very interesting situation . Example : Kennedy ha a guy invite his parent to his `` wedding . '' Kennedy is the bride , done up in a full bridal gown and long wig . The `` joke '' is that the parent immediately understand their son is marrying a man who claim to no longer have his `` bit and piece . '' Problem is , this schtick go on way too long , obviously to fill out time . And Kennedy is about a funny a a dead cod lying in the sun . Candid Camera would have run three or four scenario in the time it took Kennedy to get through this one , running around , constantly asking `` Do I look fat ? '' I recognize the show wa not made for me . It wa made for 12-year-old pinhead who think JACKASS is the height of comedy today . So let them laugh . Thank God the show wa short-lived .

Frownland is like one of those intensely embarrassing situation where you end up laughing out loud at exactly the wrong time ; and just at the moment you realize you should n't be laughing , you 've already reached the pinnacle of voice resoundness ; and a you look around you at the ghostly white face with their gaping wide-open mouth and glazen eye , you feel a piercing ache beginning in the pit of your stomach and suddenly rushing up your throat and ... well , you get the point . But for all it unpleasantness and punch in the face , Frownland , really is a remarkable piece of work that , after viewing the inarticulate mess of a main character and all his pathetic trouble and mishap , make you want to scratch your own eye out and at the same time , you feel sickenly sorry for him . It would have been a lot easier for me to simply walk out of Ronald Bronstein 's film , but for some insane reason , I felt an unwavering determination to stay the course and experience all the grainy irritation the film ha to offer . If someone set you on fire , you typically want to put it out : Stop ! Drop ! And Roll ! But with this film , you want to watch the flame slowly engulf your entire body . You endure the pain -- perhaps out of spite , or some unknown masochistic curiosity I ca n't even begin to attempt to explain . Unfortunately , mainstream cinema will never let this film come to a theater near you . But if you get a chance to catch it , prepare yourself : bring a doggie bag .

I saw this movie while surfing through infomercial and late-night 80 's sitcom on tv one night at 2 in the morning . I must say , I did n't expect much , and I did n't get much . Although Rose McGowan is hot , her performance and the performance of the rest of the cast wa not Oscar-worthy , to say the least . This movie ha it ups and down , and doe have a nice couple of twist at the end , but in all honesty it wa awful . Not even a typical slasher movie . No gore , no sex , no nudity , no real violence . Just bad acting . I 'd give it a 3 out of 10 .

I first saw this film when I wa about 8 year old on TV in the UK ( where it wa called `` Laupta : The Flying Island '' ) . I absolutely loved it , and wa heartbroken when it wa repeated a while later and I missed it . I wa enchanted by the story and character , but most of all by the haunting and beautiful music . It would have been the original English dubbed version which I saw - sometimes erroneously referred to a the `` Streamline Dub '' ( the dub wa actually by Ghibli themselves and only distributed by Streamline ) which is sadly unavailable except a part of a ridiculously expensive laser disc box-set . Unfortunately I feel that the release ha been partly spoiled by Disney . The voice acting is OK but the dialogue doe n't have the same raw energy that the `` streamline '' dub or the original Japanese had , and I think James Van Der Beek sound too old to play the lead . They have made some pointless alteration , such a changing the main character 's name from `` Pazu '' to `` Patzu '' , and added some dialogue . But worst of all I feel that they have ruined many scene with intrusive music - the opening scene of the airship for example wa originally silent but ha been spoiled thanks to Disney 's moronic requirement that there be music playing whenever anyone is not speaking , which I find annoying in many Disney film . This film still blow away most recent animated film , and I can not recommend it highly enough . The plot is simple yet captivating and the film show a flair which is sadly missing from most modern mass-market , homogenized animation .

This film ca n't make up it mind whether it message is `` human are evil and bad and animal are sweet and blameless '' or `` do n't ever go in the water again . '' A fisherman ( Nolan ) is out to nab a killer whale , a very bad thing , but when he accidentally ( ACCIDENTALLY mark you ) hit a pregnant cow instead of her mate , the cow -- and I use the word in all sens -- who is obviously a sick psycho-bitch and the canonical villain of the piece -- throw herself against the propeller trying to chew herself to bit in the most distressing and hideous not to mention ineffectual method of killing herself . ( I doubt it wa her first . ) When her unborn fetus abort from her hideous self-inflicted wound , her mate go mental with revenge and swears to hurt , kill and mutilate every human who even so much a talk to Nolan . Obviously a among human , total psycho date other total psycho . The film reek of half-thought out anti-human message , `` the poor poor whale ! ! the evil men must suffer and die ! '' and yet , it doe not succeed in demonizing Nolan at all . It 's true that when he set out his motif were selfish and cruel , but at the first squeal of the first whale he grows a heart and , a the film progress , he grows more and more compassionate to the whale 's pain until it seems he will walk out on the ice and give himself to the whale , just to make it feel a little better . The film final journey , in which Nolan follows the whale on a bizarre journey to the north , reminds me of Melville 's eerie man-whale connection , and for a moment hinted at a truly interesting conclusion , where these two husband might connect , understand even respect each other in their own grief , for Nolan lost his wife and unborn child also to an accident . It 's clear Nolan respect the whale and feel for it loss . However , it never go there . The whale-character ha no compassion or respect for anyone . The final scene loses this focus and becomes Jaws-like where the sea-monster finally kill everybody and Nolan and no-doubt through an oversight , fails to chomp up the whale-hugger ( tho he made a good snap for her head a little earlier . ) I love animal , and I detest whaling , and what is more I love orca whale , but if this film 's goal wa to make me feel that the whale wa the victim and that people are evil and detestable it completely failed . Nolan show compassion and growth , and feel for others , and all the whale think about is killing and maiming . The only message one can walk away with is `` If you see an orca whale , ever , anywhere , run the other way cause if you step on his FIN the wrong way , he will hunt you to the end of the earth destroying everything around you . ''

Why , o ' WHY ! ... did I pick this one up ? Well ... i needed a no-brainer in the summer heat , and the cover looked cool . Of course I should 've known better . This is a really , really bad movie . And it get embarasing when the maker know it 's bad , and try cover it up by adding some sexy/beautiful woman , and some sex-scenes to it . Well , folk ... it does'nt cut it , doe it ! If you WOULD like a cool movie about a big reptile that is actually very , very good , well-played and funny : go rent Lake Placid ! ( that is an order )

Only a very small child could overlook the absurdity in this bomb ; the first difficulty faced by the submarine `` Seaview '' is what appear to be chunk of -- rock ? falling down through the water and crashing into it hull . But it 's not rock , they 're under the North Pole -- it is ICE ! Everybody , except possibly hitherto mentioned small child ( and even some of them ) know that ICE FLOATS . Then , disaster strike -- that darn VAN ALLEN RADIATION BELT around the Earth catch fire ! No one know how this happened , we are told , which is understandable , because it is utterly impossible for radiation to `` catch fire '' , and even if it could , there is NO AIR IN SPACE for it to burn . There is literally no good reason to overlook science concept basic to 2nd grade school textbook when making a film ; however , Irwin Allen manages to do it again and again ; perhaps we are meant to focus on the `` people '' instead , which is pretty easy , a they are CARDBOARD . The cast try very hard not to look embarrassed in this ridiculous sub-kiddie romp , much like later episode of his `` Lost in Space '' TV series , the concept of which wa swiped outright from writer Ib Melchior and then rushed into production . The sub look pretty good , though , which is why this one get a `` 2 '' .

Our teacher showed u this movie in first grade . I have n't seen it since . I just watched the trailer though . Does this look like a first grade movie to you ? I do n't think so . I wa so horrified by this movie , I could barely watch it . It wa mainly the scene with Shirley McClain cutting that little girl in half , and then there wa the boy with ketchup ! I wa freaked out by this film . Now today , being 20 , I probably would not feel that way . I just wanted to share my experience and opinion that maybe small child should n't see this movie , even though it 's PG . Be aware of the possible outcome of showing this to kid . I do n't even remember what it wa about , once wa enough !

A plot that fizzled and reeked of irreconcilable difference in opinion constituted a judgmental havoc with one side pro-life and the other a destroyer of a demon 's seed . The horror wa left out and replaced with an overall dull effect quite possibly meant to be horrific , but , instead demonstrated an ill dose of belief which ridiculed each other to death , despite the title itself . Being a fan of Masters of Horror since the beginning , this ridiculous plot twist with it 's sordid depiction crashed apart like a spindly old rocking chair after being sat upon . I view this episode a being thrown together from the get go , never really taking off anywhere other than to see it through for what it worth and relieved when it finally came to `` The End '' ..

Scott Menville is not Casey Kasem . That is the first , most important , and most disturbing thing about this attempt at re-imagining Scooby-Doo and company . Shaggy 's voice is squeaky and doe not sound anything like he ha ever sounded in any of the previous incarnation of the Scooby show . They 've also changed the outfit and the classic mode of walking from the original . I 'm not sure what they 're on about yet with the villain angle , but it surely is n't following the formula used in any of the previous Scooby show . And the animation style is very bizarre and distorted . I like it , but it 's not real Scooby-Doo type animation . But the weird animation used for other WB show grew on me ; this might , too . It 's worth a glance at -- once -- if you can handle the lack of proper Shaggy voice . That right there is enough to jar one out of enjoying the show properly . Besides , I am trying not to be an inflexible , nitpicking fan . Evolve or die , a the saying go . We 'll see how it look after two more episode -- by then I 'll have formed a much more solid opinion .

I often wonder how movie like this even get made , and the most shocking part is that people actually pay to watch them . With Aksar it appears a though the director made up the story a he went along , adding twist and turn when he liked , no matter how ludicrous they were . The script wa non existent with inane dialog such a `` Jo Sheena Roy pehenti hai , wahee fashion hota hai '' and `` Yeh Versace hai Madam '' ( yeah right ) . Every one of the character wa shallow and underdeveloped . Acting wa awful . Constumes ( lycra for Udita and awful suit for a stocky Emran ) , locale ( the numerous house that were used for interior did not even vaguely resemble a Victorian mansion ) , screenplay etc etc , just one word- rubbish . For those people who love Hashmi and his movie , watch it . As for me , I 'll never get those two and a half hour back . The only redeeming factor wa some of the music which wa decent .

This movie is an amazing comedy .. the script is too funny .. if u watch it more than once you will enjoy it more . Though the comedy at time is silly but it really make u laugh ! ! Salman Khan and Aamir Khan have given justice to their role . After 1994 i have not come across any hindi movie which wa a funny a this .

Even this early in his career , Capra wa quite accomplished with his camera-work and his timing . This is a thin story -- and quite predictable at time -- but he get very good performance out of his cast and ha some rather intricate camera move that involve the viewer intimately . The first part look like a Cinderella story , though anyone with brain can see that the bottom will fall out of that -- the rich 'prince ' will lose his fortune . Nonetheless , because of his good cast and fast pace , it 's easy to get caught up in the clichés . Then the movie doe become more original , a the married couple have to find a way to make a living . The ending is very predictable but satisfying . I also want to compliment the title-writing : very witty and fun .

Uwe Boll slip back in his film-making skill once again to offer up a scifi horror tale of mercenary and reporter taking on super soldier on a remote island . An okay cast headed by the excellent Udo Keir is cast adrift by Boll who make the worst of script that should have worked . The mad scientist being investigated by a reporter ha been done to death but this script is amusing enough that the plot should have worked , additionally the effect and super soldier design with their dead lifeless eye have some degree of creepiness , however Boll somehow manages to film everything in an off handed way . Its a if he could n't be bothered to actually figure out what would work and instead rattled off stock camera placement and walked away . Additionally the assembly of scene ha no spark or life , I 'm guessing that Boll only shot one or two take and just used what he had . It really stink . Clearly Boll is in one of his periodic retrograde film where anything he 's ever learned about film get flushed . The last film he made that wa this bad wa Seed a serial killer movie that is one of the worst film I 've ever seen . This is n't that bad , but it is close simply because it should have been better . Then again Udo Keir is good enough that he doe make watching his scene worth the effort and make this a an almost so bad it good film . I 'd take a pas unless it 's late at night and you 're catching it on cable .

This video is so hilariously funny , it make everything else by Eddie Murphy seem very disappointing ( even Beverly Hills Cop and The Nutty Professor , which just go to show you how good this really is ) . To be honest , I do n't think that I 've ever laughed at something a much a this , including Naked Gun and the rarely seen Bargearse . This show is amazing , although it must be said that it is certainly filled with the word beginning with F that is four letter long ( plus it extended version beginning with M ) but it did n't bother me . See it , the funniest thing I 've ever seen and probably the funniest you ever have too .

This film is dreadful . It ha absolutely zero laugh . Hebrew Hammer ( Adam Goldberg ) set out to save Hannukah from Evil Santa ( Andy Dick ) . Perhaps a promising enough basis for a plot , in actual fact the film doe not progress beyond this premise . While there are some ( far and few ) nice touch and the plot is relatively coherent , it is laboured , hackneyed and ultimately , mindlessly boring . This despite the fact that Goldberg , Dick and Greer ( Hammer 's client/love interest ) all have quite considerable screen presence . Despite being played for what might be described a whacky over-the-top gag , this film is consistently middle-class middle-of-the-road muck . DO NOT waste 85 minute of your life on this . ( note- the music wa good .. ! )

It 's amazing that such a cliche-ridden yuppie angst film actually got made in the first place . The character are so weak , and the acting so uninspired , that it 's impossible to care about any of them -- especially Brooke Shields . The temptation to fast forward through the slow part is almost irresistible . If you like this genre , you 'd be better off renting `` Singles , '' or `` Bodies , Rest & Motion . ''

I never watched the 'Next Action Hero ' show , and until reading the other comment here , did not know that this movie wa the 'prize ' from that competition . I wa just flipping channel and came across this , and found myself watching , dare eagerly , all the way to the end . Yes , the plot 's been done ( The Most Dangerous Game , etc . ) but I wa hoping for , and almost received , the 'gotcha ' - how the protagonist wa going to beat the hunter in the end . I think the high-tech wa overdone ( GPS 's ) and gave me cold-sweat flashback of Night Rider , but it nevertheless wa not too overdone . The basic problem I had with this movie wa the degree of SOD ( Suspension of Disbelief ) that wa required of the viewer . Do we really think that someone flying in a helicopter could lob countless incendiary grenade at a public bridge and NO COPS show up to investigate ? Could a limousine do countless donut in a Las Vegas intersection and NO COPS show up ? Pleeease . Way too much of that type of thing - fun to watch , but keep it at least plausible , thank you very much . The final solution wa good , but the ending wa disappointing , with the after taste of a bad Star Trek episode . At least now I understand why the acting wa so cheesy - except for Zane , who doe n't get near a much work a he deserves IMHO - they were winner from a reality show . Knock me out .

I am a big fan of old horror movie , and since I am middle aged , old to me is a movie made before 1970 with most being made in the 1920 's to 1960 's period . I am not a big fan of more modern horror movie , with one exception being Creepshow 1 , which I thought wa great . I could reminisce about the story there but I really really enjoyed the monster in the box story with Hal Holbrook , and also the one about the really clean guy wa a great ending . All the story were great though . So why did I like them so much ? The character had some decent development , the line were very plain about who wa good and who wa bad , the horror bit were heightened with a close up of a face aghast with fear , and the funny bit were really funny ! This sequel is either greatly lacking of these element or they are totally absent ! I am writing this only having watched it partially because the movie wa a complete waste of time and I turned it off to do other thing like write movie review on IMDb.com , lol . When George Kennedy and an old Dorothy Lamoure get top billing it 's telling you something ..... 4 of 10 . Also , Romero 's expertise is hard to find here , they must had told him to tone it down to a PG standard ( I do n't know what this wa rated at but it look PG to me ) , and that 's not a good thing for a movie with nothing else going on . It 's shown on the Encore cable channel if your dieing ( yuck yuck ) to see it .

I just wanted to say that . I love Gheorghe Muresan , so I automatically loved this movie . Everything else about it wa so-so ... Billy Crystal is a good actor , even if he is annoying . But the thing that made this movie was- at least , for a basketball fan- seeing Gheorghe Muresan act .

I thought that this movie wa incredible . I absolutely loved it , even though my brother did n't that much . The special effect were outstanding , and this movie is about my favorite sport ; golf . The only thing that wa disappointing about this amazing movie is that it is hard to watch two time or more in a row . This movie just absolutely top everything else I have ever seen . It wa everything I would expect out of a movie . I just loved it . Also , it wa pretty kid-friendly . This movie helped me realize that when you put your mind to it , anything is possible . I would give it a pure 10/10 ! It wa better than The Legend of Baggar Vants , and the two Pirates of the Caribbean movie combined . Absolutely amazing . Loved it .

This is a funny film and I like it a lot . Cary Elwes play Robin Hood to a tee . This is , of course , the usual good v evil with Robin against the evil Sheriff of Nottingham . The humor is sort of in your face stuff for the most part , but still work well . A comedy for a night when you do n't want to have to think much , it 's well worth a rent !

Some here have commented that this is the WORST Elvis movie ever made . Well , they are only partly right . For me , this IS THE WORST MOVIE EVER MADE PERIOD !
