A true embarrassment to the Motion Picture Industry , this is n't even so Bad , it good . There is no campy trashy fun to be had here like in some of Elvis ' other bad movie like Clambake . This one is so rotten to sit through it painful . Pure Garbage . Native Americans should sue for their poor clichéd and stereotypical treatment here . Actually , perhaps ALL Human Beings should sue for the crime and disservice this movie doe to the specie a a whole 0 Stars , seriously . Grade : F

First of all yes I 'm white , so I try to tread lightly in the ever delicate subject of race ... anyway ... White People Hating Black people = BAD but Black People Hating White people = OK ( because apparently we deserved it ! ! ) . where do i start ? i wish i had something good to say about this movie aside unintended comedy scene : the infamous scene were Ice Cube and co. get in a fight with some really big , really strong , really really angry and scary looking Neo-Nazis and win ! ! ! the neo-Nazi where twice the size : ) , and the chase ! the chase is priceless ... This is NOT a movie about race , tolerance and understanding , it doe n't deliver ... this is a racist movie that re-affirm all the cliché stereotype , the white wimpy guy who get manhandled by his black roommate automatically transform in a skinhead ... cmon simply awful I do regret ever seeing it . Save your time and the dreadful experience of a poorly written , poorly acted , dull and clearly biased picture , if you are into the subject , go and Rent American History X , now thats a movie

Donald Pleasance and Peter Cushing united in one horror film ; that always sound like a terrific plan . Two of the most versatile cult actor of their generation , who previously already starred together in terrific genre outing like `` The Flesh and the Fiends '' and `` From Beyond the Grave '' , pairing up in a mid-70 's satanic themed exploitation flick . How can this possibly go wrong ? Well , unfortunately , it can . To my deepest regret `` Land of the Minotaur '' can hardly even be called mediocre , and that in spite of the cast , the exotic setting , the appealing title and the potentially great sounding premise . In a remote little area in Greece , more particularly near an archaeological site , multiple tourist vanish because Baron Peter Cushing and his docile follower keep feeding them to a fire-breathing Minotaur statue . Cushing , who never looked more bored and uninterested in any role he played before , owns a giant medieval castle and apparently in Greek this mean you also own the complementary archaeological ruin and an underground network of cavern . That is of course quite handy if your hobby is the kidnapping of random camper and amateur archaeologist . When three of his young friend also mysteriously disappear in the same area , Father Roch - the priest of a couple of town before ) - decides to investigate . `` Land of the Minotaur '' is a boring and extremely slow-paced horror effort that never really undertakes any major attempt to generate a satanic atmosphere and doe n't bother to elaborate on all the potentially fascinating element and pagan trivia detail . The titular Minotaur , for example , is an intriguing creature of Greek mythology with the head of a bull and the body of a person , but for some inexplicable reason the script never deepens out the significance . Instead , the film focus on tedious and overly talkative sequence and loud inappropriate music altered with experimental noise . The only reason to even consider giving this major disappointment of a film a chance is because of Donald Pleasance . His portrayal of rude , bossy and old-fashioned priest who criticizes everything that represents modern youth is powerful and reliable a always .

The three short included on this compilation issued in 1959 are timeless Chaplin classic , nothing wrong with them and nothing to criticize either . Chaplin 's score for these film and the framework added a bridging section between the short are also well done . The problem with this compilation is a minor one , yet annoying . The short have been stretch-printed to fit the 24 frame p.s . speed of contemporary film whereas the short themselves where shot at 20 frame p.s . This result is jerky motion that doe n't look very attractive , and yet this wa an excusable solution given the limitation of optical printing technology at the time , it 's just not excusable that the current DVD version is unrestored , the film look dirty a they did in 1959 and are still stretch printed . There are separate restored version of these classic available , even on DVD , and it would not be a problem to restore the image , but ala this ha not been done . A minor quibble ha taken up a lot of space in my article , but I say again a minor quibble , it should not detract all that much from the experience although it detracted one point from my rating . The short are still worth '10 ' .

1979 's Tourist Trap is a clever , unique B thriller that stand out a one of the best of it 's kind . Travellers stop at a lonely wax museum where the owner 's mannequin are a little too life-like for comfort . While the film ha hint of The Texas Chainsaw Massacre , Tourist Trap is mainly a creepy psychological thriller worthy of The Twilight Zone . Director David Schmoeller give this movie an atmosphere of darkness and mystery , that reach nightmarish proportion . Also , Schmoelloer add the occasional touch of comic relief to the bizarre happening . Venteran actor Chuck Connors is the best of the film 's decent cast . Pino Donaggio 's music score is excellent , having both lyrical and solemn theme that are perfect to the movie . A number of the film 's sequence are quite memorable . For horror and thriller fan alike , Tourist Trap is an unforgettable must-see film . * * * 1/2 out of * * * *

Years ago I saw The Godfather and it made a lasting impression on me , the atmosphere of the movie wa first class , the acting memorable and the storyline a classic . Recently I bought the Trilogy and after watching Part 1 again I looked eagerly to viewing Part 2 ...... I wa so pleased to realize early on into Part 2 that here wa a fitting follow on to the great Godfather movie , again everything wa just about perfect and I could not wait to see Godfather III ........ WRONG ! , I wish I 'd stopped at II . The storyline wa not good , it seemed to me like a story made up just to have a story , the character were weak especially the daughter . Pacino 's protege wa a weak character that would have been eaten alive in Godfather 1 or 2 . Then scene such a , Corleone being invested with all the trapping of the Catholic Church with full choir , the assassin on horseback riding away into the sunset , the unseen helicopter machine gunning of the meeting ( where the 'goodies ' get away and everyone else is shot ) , daughter and 1st cousin rolling bit of pasta across a board , the pathetic shooting on the step ..... Corleone stuffing sweet down him with orange juice for diabetes ( a man of his intelligence and guile is n't ready for an emergency ? ) ... NO it wa not good and with the best will in the world I wont be able to watch it again . But I 'll watch 1 & 2 many time down the year .

This little two-person movie is actually much bigger than it look . It ha so many layer . I 've watched it over and over , and always pick up on something new . I am amazed at the depth of the acting , and I feel if this movie had gotten wider release that there would be no question that Alan Rickman is a major star

UK newspaper review seem to have concentrated on the fact that the reviewer tend to know Toby Young , the journalist on whose real-life experience this movie is based . The key word here is `` based '' . How To Lose Friends is a fictitious romcom . Sidney Young join a prestigious gossip magazine in New York , where he proceeds to make gaffe after gaffe before finally Getting It Right and Making It . This involves him selling out , and the movie ha some serious point to make about journalistic integrity . However , they are not overdone : the main substance remains a comedy which centre around Sidney 's misadventure . The script ha it cake and eats it in that Sidney is a stupid , well-meaning buffoon at the same time a being a smart , moderately obnoxious skilled writer . This contradiction is never that much of an issue , because Simon Pegg ( a Sidney ) project likability too well . Jeff Bridges underplays Sidney 's editor a little too effectively , and Kirsten Dunst is rather anonymous a the conflicted eventual object of Sidney 's affection And , with regard to Megan Fox ( who play an airhead bimbo starlet ) , I can say only this : just say the word , Miss Fox , and I will leave my wife , sell all my belonging , and buy myself a plane ticket in order to take my place at your side a your consort . Of course , given that I 'm a fat 56-year-old English accountant , you might not find my offer too enticing , but it 's there on the table anyway . Given how short her career ha been so far , one might think it is a little too soon for Megan Fox to take on a role which mercilessly lampoon the sort of actress she might be thought to become : however , she doe it sweetly , with some skill , and extremely sexily . This girl will go far . There is stalwart support from a variety of seasoned performer - Miriam Margolyes and Bill Paterson from the UK , Gillian Anderson and Danny Huston from the US . There are several laugh-out-loud moment , and I smiled most of the way through . As ever , the F-word make appearance when it really doe n't need to , although at least a couple of these are very funny .

Alien Hunter : 5 out of 10 : Is it me or doe every movie that start in Roswell , New Mexico suck . Take Alien mixed with The Thing , mixed with Contact , mixed with of all thing On the Beach , The Andromeda Strain , the classroom scene from Raiders of the Lost Ark and a throw in a little Stargate to boot . Derivative doe n't even begin to describe this movie . Of course with nothing original plot wise they amp up the gore and sex right ? Nope gore is a blink and you miss it affair and sex is all tease . ( James Spader causally mention he need a shower and the delectable Leslie Stefanson asks to join him . he turn her down . AGGH ! ) In fact if a movie ever needed a shower scene to liven thing up this is it . I mean if your going to have impossibly good-looking woman in white bathing suit wandering around an Antarctica research base why not go for broke . With about 30 second of actual thrill in the entire movie Alien Hunter is remarkable serious and slow going for a sci-fi adventure . Needed a much better plot twist to liven it up and by the way the Alien itself is a horribly clichéd artifice and ha virtually no screen time for someone who share half the title . I also inquired during viewing what is with the Children of the Corn in space motif . ( Note that since Jason of Friday the 13th fame , Pinhead from Hellraiser and that Leprechaun have all traveled to space to slay nubile teenager why not the cornfield ? ) The character in the cornfield dress like Logan 's Run extra and I wa just waiting for the stalk to come alive and attack them . That however would have been exciting and apparently against this movie covenant . The acting is mostly fine a Spader reprises his Stargate role while Stefanson and Janine Eser model the latest in Antarctic beachwear . John Lynch however read the whole script and act the like the insane bad guy well before the story would indicate it . Alien Hunter is a disappointing derivative slog that make me pine for a proper Children of The Corn in Space movie .

I have a hard time putting into word just how wonderful this wa . Once in a while you see a film that just stick with you . `` You Are Alone '' is that movie ( for me ) . The film is constantly in my head and in my heart . I replay the scene mentally every day and analyze them and go through the emotion all over again , a if I am seeing it for the first time . There is nothing I did not like about the movie . Amazing soundtrack ! ! ! The ending wa perfect . Very emotionally stirring ! ! ! It wa compelling and riveting . I adored Jessica Bohl and her performance wa the greatest I have ever witnessed . I admired Brittany 's strength ( what a strong woman ) . The tag line is `` When your darkest moment come to life '' . We never know what we are capable of doing . Everyone say oh I would never do that , when really we have no idea what we would do in a situation . We are very capable of anything and this movie delf straight into that subject . The honesty of the movie may be my absolute favorite part . Thank you Gorman Becherd for a perfect piece of art ! ! ! !

I love this young people trapped in a house of horror movie . Not just because I 'm a huge Linnea Quigley-Jill Terashita fan , but because it is a lot of fun and actually scary at time . The special effect are awesome , especially Linnea 's scene with the lipstick and towards the end when almost everyone is dead and possessed . Plenty of nudity provided by Linnea and Jill , plenty of humor , cool soundtrack , high body count , etc ... By the way , if you have never seen this one , try and buy/watch the Unrated version which ha more gore and some scene the rated version is missing .

i saw the film and i got screwed , because the film wa foolish and boring . i thought ram gopal varma will justify his work but unfortunately he failed and the whole film got spoiled and they spoiled `` sholay '' . the cast and crew wa bad . the whole theater slept while watching the movie some people ran away in the middle . amithab bachan 's acting is poor , i thought this movie will be greatest hit of the year but this film will be the greatest flop of the year , sure . nobody did justice to their work , including Ajay devagan . this film do n't deserve any audience . i bet that this film will flop . `` FINALLY THIS MOVIE SUCKS ''

Lorna Green ( Janine Reynaud ) is a performance artist for wealthy intellectual at a local club . She fall prey to her fantasy a the promise of romantic interlude turn into murder a she kill those who believe that sex is on the horizon . It 's quite possible that , through a form of hypnotic suggestion , someone ( .. a possible task master pulling her string like a puppet ) is guiding Lorna into killing those she come across in secluded place just when it appears that love-making is about to begin . After the murder within her fantasy are committed , Lorna awakens bewildered , often clueless a to if what she wa privy to within her dream ever took place in reality . If someone asked me how to describe this particular work from Franco , I 'd say it 's elegant & difficult . By now , you 've probably read other user comment befuddled by what this film is about , since a large portion of it take place within the surreal atmosphere of a dream . Franco mentioned in an interview that he wa heavily influenced by Godard early in his career , a far a film-making style , and so deciding to abandon a clear narrative structure in favor of trying to create a whole different type of viewing experience . And , a you read from the reaction of the user comment here .. some like this decision , others find the style labouring , dull , and bewildering . I 'll be the first to admit that the film is over my head , but even Franco himself , when quizzed by critic who watched `` Succubus '' , admitted that he did n't even understand the film and he directed it ! Some might say that `` Succubus '' wa merely a precursor to his more admired work , `` Venus in Furs '' , considered his masterwork by Franco-faithful , because it also adopts the surreal , dreamlike structure where the protagonist doe n't truly know whether he/she is experiencing something real or imagined . In a sense , like the protagonist , we are experiencing the same type of confusion .. certainly , `` Succubus '' is unconventional film-making where we are n't given the key to what is exactly going on . And , a great deal of the elusive dialogue doe n't help matter . `` Succubus '' is also populated by beatnik type and `` poet-speak '' , Corman 's film , `` A Bucket of Blood '' poked fun at . My personal favorite scene tease at a possible lesbian interlude between Lorna and a woman she meet at a posh party .. quite a bizarre fantasy sequence where mannequin are used rather unusually . Great location and jazz score .. I liked this film myself , although I can understand why it doe receive a negative reaction . Loved that one scene at the posh party with Lorna , a wee bit drunk , writhing on the floor in a gorgeous evening gown a others attending the shindig ( .. equally wasted ) rush her in an embrace of kiss .

This outing of Knotts includes one of his best sidekick ever , Frank Welker . Welker make the film . Knotts and Welker compete for the laugh and both receive plenty . Knotts work for a small `` no where '' town where the city is being run by some of the most ignorant official . When thing go wrong the city father , allow Knotts to take the fall . Frank Welker 's character befriends Knotts and together they stumble together to clear up the mess and Knott 's good name . This film show the usual Knott 's scared to death character that made him famous for year on television and film . This may have been Knotts ' last good outing . When you have an extra 90 minute , get a good old fashioned laugh a great icon , Don Knotts .

Emma is a horribly flawed film based on Jane Austens classic novel . I have not read the book so I really did n't know that much about the plot , and yet I still predicted nearly the entire plot . There were also many scene that frustrated me because of the bad writing or directing . The film is though for some reason very entertaining and I loved it . Of course there were all the scene I disliked but the majority wa well acted and funny . Gwyneth Paltrow give one of her best performance a the heroine in Emma . The film also star Toni Collette ( Who ha okay but ha been much better ) Ewan Mecgreger ( Who ha also been better but he is still very good here ) Alan Cumming ( Who I have never really been impressed with and is pretty much the same here ) and Jeremy Northam ( Who 's performance is rather wooden at first look but actually fairly subtle , even if that wa not what it needed ) There have been much better adaptation of Jane Austen book but this one is still very entertaining and worth watching .

Why do I hate this ? Let me list the way : I have nothing against Mary Pickford but a 32 year old woman playing a 12 year old is just stupid . There 's a fight scene in which kid are throwing brick at each other and it 's considered funny -- -and it go on for 15 minute Strange how none of the kid are even remotely hurt The title card contain plenty of racial and ethnic slur For a `` family '' film the fight were WAY too violent ( loved it when Pickford wa punching it out with a little boy ! ) and the humor wa just stupid Seriously , 40 minute in I gave up and turned it off . The slur , racism and little kid throwing brick at each other got to me . Also there wa no plot that I could see . The only thing worth seeing in this film wa William Haines who wa a top leading man in the silent era . Just painful . Avoid .

Thank God this wa n't based on a true story , because what a story it is . Populated by despicable character whose depravity know no bound , Before The Devil is a mesmerizing , jaw-dropping excursion into perversion which would be laughable ( and sometimes is , even with - or perhaps because of - the sickeningly tragic undercurrent of human dysfunction throughout ) if it were n't carried out with such magnificent , overwhelming conviction by it star . The excellent script by Kelly Masterson and superb direction by none other than Sidney Lumet doe n't hurt either . The main dysfunction here is of a family nature , with the two majorly screwed up brother ( brilliant portrayal from Philip Seymour Hoffman and Ethan Hawke ) deciding to rob their own parent ' jewelry store , an attempt that go pathetically awry . The story is told with time-shifts ( which are noted on screen , such a : `` Charlie : Two Days Before The Robbery '' , so no one should be confused ) ; some people have said they did n't like this device but I thought it worked perfectly , adding to the skeweredness of the whole affair , considering that the two brother in question are hardly playing with full deck - between them you could n't make a decent poker hand to save your life . Throw in these cheesy extra tidbit : one of the brother is a drug addict , married to Gina ( Marisa Tomei , also excellent ) , who is having an affair with the other brother , toss in some monumental sibling rivalry , along with the fact that said drug addict brother hate his father ( a wrenching performance from Albert Finney ) , who ha apparently caused him serious past pain , and you 've got a Shakespearean/Greek tragedy on your hand . Proceed with caution .

If you want just about everything you want to know about WWII from multiple perspective , this DVD delivers , you WILL learn new thing guaranteed , so much so that you wo n't need any other documentary 's on the subject . Get this , watch it , learn from it . Good for school use a well . As a bonus , watch this with Tora tora tora , saving private ryan , patton , band of brother , a bridge too far , the longest day and other WWII epic along with this to make your knowledge of WWII even more complete . Sir Laurence Oliver 's voice add to the overall atmosphere of each episode in this 26 part series . Seriously you wo n't find a better WWII documentary set on the subject . PERFECT 10 ! ! !

The movie wa gripping from start to finish and it b/w photography of the American heartland is stunning . We feel we are right there with them a they cross the big sky country and then into Mexico and back to America again . Near the end of the movie , the reflection of the rain on Robert Blake look like small river of sweat and tear rolling down his face . In the end , we follow them up the stairway to their final moment . The two criminal , performed by Robert Blake and Scott Wilson , a Perry Smith and Dick Hickock could be seen on any street in any town . Hickock is a smiling boy next door and Smith , the guy with star in his eye from the wrong side of town . This point is made in the movie and it always surprise u that criminal are no different in appearance than anyone else . Evil , even the most vile , is part of the human condition . These two delusional men kill an entire family , looking for a safe that is n't there . Once on the run , they start writing bad cheque , carving out a trail for the authority . There are many fine supporting actor . I like John Forsyth a the detective on the case , Alvin Dewey . Also , Will Geer shine in a brief but excellent scene a the prosecuting attorney . I have often wanted to see this movie all the way through , having only caught it in short snatch ; I did finally get to it after buying the DVD . The result is the finest classic crime movie I have ever seen . Do n't miss this brilliant movie . To me , this is what great film-making is all about .

This is a great show with total freshness and innovation . That usual chair ( couch for a woman ) host , that mandatory band playing monotonous tune , the same old joke , the same pattern copied from the day of Nebuchadnezzer .... probably the pattern of Johnny Carson , copied by one and all , Latterman , Leno , Conan ... Daly , this show doe not seem to have any of these . I fell in love with this show within the first 10 minute and I am going to stick to it . Though it 's too early to say that , this show seems to be devoid of any intellectual pretension most talk show try so hard to project , and I hope that that is what would make this show different from all the rest . I hope that this show will last long ! Returning back after month , I still love this show , and I love his self-deprecating humor ( For example , his affirmation that only pothead loner would be home to watch his show at Saturday midnight and thus , the joke are funny only to the stoned guy ) which , however , doe not involve the usual monkeying of Conan O'Brien , for example ( I know it 's a cardinal sin to be repelled by O'Brien 's antic ; but I do really dislike his style and repetitiveness ) . I again watched it the other night with Tom Arnold in it . Ferensen 's spoof of Trading Spouses ( and Nanny 911 in an earlier episode ) are hilarious . Idiot paparazzo are fun , especially when a security guard caution them against taking people 's picture , and ( if I am not mistaken ) they start taking his picture shouting `` Gary Coleman '' . Added on 16th April , 2007 : Coming back once again , I am left confused by the neighbor and her dog . I can not decide if it is a joke or a real thing . Either way , it wa funny a hell . I do not expect Spike Feresten to read these page , but maybe he doe . He is crazier than a bunch of monkey and so , I would better write down my suggestion here for him : I would like him to do a full 30 minute show with Crazy Gideon , the star of late night TV commercial . I would like Crazy Gideon to have an interview in Spike 's talk show , sing a song ( and play guitar ) , do a skit in the line of SNL , and also to answer question from the audience regarding his potential mayorship of Los Angeles ( I know , Crazy Gideon may not be aware of this , but there are website detailing why he would be the perfect candidate for the post of the mayor of LA ) . God willing ! Returning back on 14th July , 2007 : Someone wrote here that the people who praised Spike 's talkshow must be bribed by Spike . I confess that Spike really bribed me , but I must also confess that Rockefeller named me in his will and last night I had sex with Cindy Crowford .

It 's all about getting what you want when you want it . And the message of Bluebeard 's Eighth WIfe is to be careful what you wish for , until what you wish for wish for you . Most men have heard the story about what happens when your sexual frustration is n't relieved and a certain part of your anatomy turning blue . Misogynistic pirate aside , Cooper play a very wealthy man who is very accustomed to getting what he want whenever he want it , learning only too late that it wa n't what he expected and never learning his lesson until he run into the feisty Claudette Colbert . Through a twisted ( in soul and in practice ) business deal , he end up marring/buying her with the intent of bedding her , but she will have none of it ( literally ) and frustrates him at every turn , and corner , and room , and tourist attraction . The film ha definite French sensibility which mean it ha strong double-entendres and boudoir humor for the day and a sharp edge you 're not accustomed to ( and may not enjoy seeing ) in either Cooper or Colbert . The whole reason I watched the film wa because they are `` likable '' actor , and the whole point of this movie is that they 're unlikable people , or at least likable people who have developed unlikable trait to protect themselves , they think , from the world . If you can accept it on it own term you 'll find satisfaction in this witty and sophisticated film ... and satisfaction , a we said , is what it 's all about . Such a movie with such a cast only come around , after all , once in a ... ummm ... blue moon .

Now i have read some negative review for this show on this website and quite frankly I 'm appalled . For anyone to even think that the Sopranos is not Television then i 'm afraid i do n't know what the world ha come to . Let me tell u something . I started watching many T.V show like Lost , Prison Break , Dexter , Deadwood and even Invasion . But all of those show lost their touch after the first season , especially Lost and Prison Break which i refuse to watch because the company took 2 genius idea and butchered them by making more than one season . Then we have The Sopranos . I can honestly say that this is the only television series that i have ever watched where i have been enthralled in all of it season , and more importantly all of it episode . There is no department that this show doe n't excel in . Acting- Nothing short of superb . James Gandolfini is one of my favourite actor and i feel that his acting is absolutely stunning in every episode , after i heard that HBO wanted Ray Liotta to play Tony i felt that it would 've been the better choice , however after watching the first few episode , i knew that HBO had done a great job in casting James a Tony . The raw emotion he display is superb . Then we have everyone else , Edie Falco , Michael Imperioli , Lorraine Bracco , Dominic Chianese ( whom i remembered a Johnny Ola in the Godfather Part 2 ) and my personal two favourite character Tony Sirico and Steve Van Zandt Paulie 'Walnuts ' Gualtieri and Silvio Dante . All of these actor perform to the best quality , and all giving an excellent performance in each episode . Then we have the story , never have i been so sucked into a T.V show before . The story is nothing short of excellent . Each episode is directed superbly and the Score of this show is just fantastic . I feel that The Sopranos is one show that i can watch again and again and never get bored of . Its got everything from hilarious humour to brutal violence , but nonetheless it is and will always be the best thing to ever grace the Television , and I challenge anyone to find a real flaw in the show . Not just say it too violent , or they feel that the character of Tony is immoral , i mean it is a mafia show at the end of the day , i do n't think that the character are going to be very honest or loyal to God . I implore everyone to watch this show because believe me , you 'll be hooked from the very first episode , i wa and i have even gotten a few friend who had firstly refused to watch the show , hooked on it . Trust me when i say that this show is a Godsend compared to the crap that come on T.V . After you 've watched the first season , you 'll inevitably agree with me when i once again say that this show dominates Television , and no T.V show current or future will ever upstage the marvel that is The Sopranos .

I 'd give this a negative rating if I could . I went into this movie not expecting much , but I had an open mind . The whole thing is stupid ! The snake are obviously fake and the first two thing they bite are a boob and a guy johnson . Oh how original ; if I were a 12 year old boy I might laugh at that . I have no idea how this movie became so popular . Seriously , the worst thing I 've ever seen . I wa n't entertained , it wa n't funny , I wa n't even bored ! I wa n't anything . It wa n't even so bad it wa good , it 's just bad . Ridiculous actually . Please do not waste your money on this movie . Do n't even rent this movie . No clue how it 's getting such a high rating .

Most people are totally unaware that this movie exists . Fox , which paid Judge to make it , ha kept it in the can for quite awhile and then spent nothing to promote it . I guess that made many people think it wa one of the garbage movie being flushed in late summer . Well , I am here to tell you that this is a funny and rather frightening look at a future that is not that hard to believe . Basically , Judge put forward the notion that the stupid are outbreeding the smart by a wide margin . Then these stupid are getting more stupid , by basically spending all of their time watching TV and having sex , which produce more stupid people . By 2500 , a person of average intelligence today , will appear to be a genius , that talk `` all faggy . '' Seriously , is this really that hard to believe . Oh sure , this future is painfully funny and ridiculously stupid , but still plausible . Luke Wilson is great a the time traveling army guy , hopelessly trying to get back to a more comfortable time . Where this story will gain it cult status is with the numerous funny one-liner , like `` can we family style her '' and `` hey man , I 'm 'bating here ! '' This is a funny movie and a rather sharp social commentary on an American society that seems to be fatuated with self pleasure , comfort and stupidity , and I guarantee you that I will be buying this on DVD the first day it come out and watching it over and over .

This is a great , ridiculous horror movie that capture the essence of the mid to late 80 ' obsession with how evil metal music supposedly wa . I can remember being freaked out by metal teen when I wa a kid . It doe n't help that I found a desecrated grave in my hometown 's graveyard when I wa ten . Turns out this weird metal kid had dug up some old body and used their bone in some weird sacrifice to satan . So maybe stuff like deterred me from metal for awhile , but I love it now , a a 24 year old . I bought this DVD used for 6 buck and I expected it to suck due to the lame cover , but to my surprise , it ruled . It is all about the extreme demonic power of metal . And you got ta love a scene where a guitar shoot lazers and vaporizes headbangers in the crowd . This movie is awesome , if you love 80 metal and bad movie , this one 's for you . 9/10 !

While not quite a good a A Murder is Announced , which wa not only delightful but almost surpassed the book , this is an excellent adaptation . And you know what , it is a huge improvement on the Geraldine McEwan version . Now I do n't take pride in bad mouthing the Geraldine McEwan adaptation , two or three of them were surprisingly good , but others started off well but ruined by either a poor script , a confusing final solution or both . The Geraldine McEwan version suffered from a plodding pace , and both of the above problem , and I would consider second worst of the ITV adaptation , worst being Sittaford Mystery , which even on it own merit turned out dull and confusing . This adaptation of the book Nemesis is a huge improvement , it not only respect the book , despite a few liberty , but it pretty much rectifies the problem the ITV version had . Despite the added character of Lionel coming across a rather irritating , more to do with how he wa written than how he wa acted , and one or two moment of sluggish pacing , this is solid a an adaptation of a decent book . It is beautifully filmed , with nice photography and period detail , and the music a always is excellent . The performance are wonderful this time around , and make the most of an in general well-done script , with Joan Hickson brilliant a always a Miss Marple , and solid turn from Liz Fraser , Helen Cherry , Joanna Hole and Anna Cropper . Margaret Tyzack is outstanding though in a chilling and moving performance a Clothilde . Overall , well worth watching , better than the recent version in pretty much all department . 9/10 Bethany Cox

Good Lord , what were they THINKING ? ? ! ! ! ! ! ! Here is your spoiler warning , even though I do n't think it 'll really matter . You wo n't be seeing this piece of trash anyway . A group of handpuppets go chasing after a group of really stupid people , who go on a really stupid hunt for them to try and kill them , and the puppet complicate thing by letting them live out their really stupid fantasy . In other word , the whole thing is really stupid . You KNOW it ha to be bad when even Mike and the Bots ca n't save something ! ! And they did n't ! I know , some of their line were funny , like what to add to the sign `` HIT '' and the hand comment , but , geez , this wa pretty dang sad . All I can say is DO NOT WATCH THIS PIECE O CRUD . IT IS NOT WORTH YOUR EYES .

I had heard ( and read ) so many good thing about Weeds that I wa looking forward to getting hooked on another great cable Series ( like Entourage , Sopranos or Mad Men ) but that slowly eroded away with each episode I watched from Season One . ( did n't make it past the first six episode ) The writing wa unoriginal , contrived and the portrayal of Blacks embarrassing . The dialog felt forced , like the writer are trying way too hard to be clever and hip . It wa a rare moment when I actually emitted an audible laugh . The character never developed enough for me to care about them , they were selfish and unappealing . I absolutely HATED the addition of the Brother-in-law ( who should have been hauled away on To Catch A Predator ) and the removal of the Hodes ' daughter Quinn from the cast by sending her to boarding school in Mexico wa so unoriginal and cliché , I had to conclude the writer were testing the viewer 's loyalty . Episode after episode I liked the character le and could n't get past many of the technical flaw in the story line . Add to that I heard that Season Two wa n't a good , so I lost all motivation to continue to watch this play out . If you 're a fan of good casting and writing , I suspect this show will be a challenge for you to like , unless of course you 're stoned and then all bet are off .

This movie is among my favorite foreign film , some of the others are Amilee and My Life As a Dog . The similarity with those movie a with so many great foreign film , is that it take a mundane slice of life and transforms it into a profound heartfelt lesson . In Japan , a man who is bored with his mundane life and the rut of his married life , see a beautiful Japanese woman staring out the window of a dance studio . In the instant that it take his train to pas , he is enthralled by her . But is it only by her beauty , by her faraway glance , or a connection that they will both discover that they share ? Shall We Dance ha memorable wonderful character who have to deal with painful reality by transcending them through the world of dance . Breaking traditional mould and stereo type of Japanese society , they risk all for happiness and find that joy is not too far away . It is one of those movie that is so magical and meaningful and , in itself , transcends the mundane by showing the true magic and miracle that life can be .

As if the film were not of value in itself , this is an excellent way to get an overview of the novel a a preface to reading it . In the summer of 1968 I saw the film in NYC ; that fall in graduate school , I read the book for the first time . Some of the pleasure in reading the novel wa my memory of the scrupulously detailed film . And for better or worse -- and I 've now read and taught the novel for over three decade -- Milo O'Shea is still Leopold Bloom .

This film is a lyrical and romantic memoir told through the eye an eleven year old boy living in a rural Cuban town the year of the Castro revolution . It is an obviously genuine worthy labor of love . The name CUBA LIBRE and CUBAN BLOOD are merely attempt to wrongly market this a an action film . DREAMING OF JULIA make much more sense . It ha more in common with European cinema than with RAMBO and the revolution is merely an inconvenience to people 's daily life and pursuit . That fact alone make the film more honest than most work dealing with this time period in Cuban history . The excessive use of the voice-over narrator doe undermine the story but the film make up for it with unqualified clip from Hollywood film that say so much more visually than the narrator could . The comparison to CINEMA PARADISO and are fair game a the film doe wax melancholy about movie , but there is an underlying pain at the loss of a lifestyle that surpasses lost love . The revolution , like the film JULIE , never seems to have an ending .

I saw ZP when it wa first released and found it a major disappointment . Its script seemed forced and arch and too fakey '60s . It 's politics too upfront and ridiculous . And let 's face it , I wa still under a love-spell known a BLOWUP : and I still have n't completely shaken it . Now the `` love '' is twisted up with all sort of nostalgia it evokes and , oh well . . . Good Luck to me ! But time march on and time ha been kind to ZP and time ha been a teacher to me . I revisit this film about every ten year and it just get better and better with age . And ZP is it 's own `` experience '' and is only really linked to BLOWUP through it creator , the late , great Mr. Antonioni . Twelve year ago , I had the great good fortune to see an absolutely pristine print , projected at it correct size ( immense ) , restored by an Italian government cultural agency who know a good work of art when they see it and know the importance of keeping such a thing of beauty in good shape . To this day I remember the gasp from the audience when the first shot of Death Valley appeared . It wa like a thousand volt visual shock Antonioni had intentionally delivered to wake u up to a new level of awareness . And indeed what follows from that point is an entirely different sort of `` place '' . What is astonishing to me is how this film is coming into it own . I remember the second time around seeing it -- - the early 80 -- - I had begun to feel affection towards the film a a whole and towards Daria and Mark in particular . Whereas , before these two seemed like a smart-alecky shadow version of Zefferelli 's Olivia and Leonard ( read : Romeo and Juliet ) they now were engaging me -- - particularly The Girl in her insistent slo-motion-ality . She-took-her-time . . . To Live . Everything , EVERYTHING dy around her . Upon exciting the theater the daylight of Reality quickly began to erase my new found `` enjoyment '' . The encroaching shoulder-padded , big haired 80 whispered `` But that 's a hippie fantasy -- - let it go '' The force of Antonioni 's vision had , I had realised , already worked itself inside of me the FIRST time around so I answered `` 80 '' with an `` Uh-Huh '' and guarded my `` love '' secretly , possessively and jealously . But , this , then is what good art doe it life inside of you , and , if you wish it ha it way and `` love '' you back : secretly , jealously , and possessively . And you get `` changed '' . Was thrilled to see that Turner Classic Movies had decided to show ZP in it March lineup . Undoubtedly , ZP must be seen on a gigantic screen so that it can truly take you into it constructed environment . But , hey , sometimes even a glimpse of the Beloved in a newspaper photo is no better than no glimpse at all . Today reality hit , ZP ha been withdrawn mysteriously and replaced with the whiney antic of ALICE 'S RESTAURANT . So , it is still too `` difficult '' , too `` disturbing '' , too `` what '' ? Maybe it 's that , a with all good art , it Lives while everything dy around it . Peace .

Very strange but occasionally elegant exploitation movie with no real story , but benefiting from it stunningly ravishing lead actress and a handful of nice , gruesome make-up effect . Daniella is a beautiful twenty-something girl , carrying with her the trauma of being raped at the age of 13 . Nightmares and hallucination lead her further into believing she 's the reincarnation of a female ancestor who wa said to be a werewolf . She kill her brother-in-law during a nightly encounter and get submitted in a hospital . She escape again , however , and randomly devours more men whilst on the run for police detective , doctor and relative . It 's all pretty to look at and listen too ( really great soundtrack ) , but the absence of plot and continuity become irritating quite fast . Luckily enough , leading lady Annik Borel rarely ever wear clothes and she fill up the boring moment by dancing naked around a fire . The film is too long , too weird and too forgettable . The biggest surprise come at the end , when suddenly and out of the blue , director Rino Di Silvestro try to make u believe that his movie wa based on true fact . Yeah , right ...

This is an interesting , hard to find movie from the early 70 's starring Jan Michael Vincent a a young man who doe n't make the cut a a marine . Dressed in 'baby blue ' outfit to humiliate them a they are sent home , the failed recruit are sent packing . Vincent stop at a bar and run into a very young Richard Gere who ha just returned from a tour in the Pacific a a hard-core Marine 'Raider ' . Gere 's character is already jaded and contemplating desertion , and he take advantage of Vincent 's innocence , stealing his 'baby blue ' uniform after getting him drunk and beating him in an alleyway . Vincent 's character , whose name is Marion , take Gere 's outfit and is suddenly transformed into a Marine 'Raider ' . Marion hitch-hikes his way into Wyoming and stop at a little Norman Rockwell-like little town . In the local café he meet Rose Hudkins , who immediately catch his eye . Staying with Hudkins parent , Marion attracts all sort of attention from the town folk . Mr Hudkins suspect Marion and wonder how a Marine 'Raider ' could still be so innocent . The story also brings up the Japanese Internment Camps , a the town folk go 'hunting ' 3 escapee . Marion is shot accidentally during this hunt . But there 's still a happy ending , which befuddled me a bit . I would have preferred a little more drama ! Anyway , this capture JMV at the peak of his 70 's performance . BUSTER AND BILLIE , BABY BLUE MARINE and WHITE LINE FEVER in the mid-70 's were amazingly good JMV performance . He wa both an action star and a heart-throb all at the same time ! ! ! He made a lot of quality movie during his career , and continued to do so up into the mid 80 's with the great TV show Airwolf . He doe a very good job in this a 'Hedge ' , quietly observing the way people treat him ( in his uniform ) a he travel across the country . He must have performed some of the stunt work a well- there is a harrowing river scene at the end of the movie-and it look like he 's the guy getting tossed down the river to me ! But really , at the height of his popularity , this movie could have done so much more with JMV 's talent and his look . Innocence can only be so interesting . Evil , a explored in `` Buster and Billie '' , is much more dramatic ! Anyway , Glynnis O'Connor is delightful a Rose . The whole look of the movie is like a Norman Rockwell painting . The outdoor scene are gorgeous - must have been filmed in Canada .

Johnny and June Carter Cash financed this film which is a traditional rendering of the Gospel story . The music is great , you get a real feel of what the world of Jesus looked like ( I 've been there too ) , and June get into the part of Mary Magdalene with a passion . Cash 's narration is good too . But .... 1 . The actor who played Jesus wa miscast . 2 . There is no edge to the story like Cash put in some of his faith based music . 3 . Because it is uncompelling , I doubt we 'll see this ever widely distributed again . I 'd love to buy the CD . Tom Paine Texas , USA

Jäniksen vuosi is one of Jarva 's most political movie . It take stance strongly against modern day society 's authority status in the life of the common man , and how it ha estranged men from the nature completely . It challenge the whole concept of freedom and wealth in our welfare society . Vatanen ( Antti Litja ) - smothered buy the concrete jungle with all it rule and regulation - try to rattle the chain of the society by escaping it all in to the wilderness of northern Finland - only to realize that the concept of a 'free country ' is n't all that unambiguous , in other word , the society ha the common man by the ball . Still the thing that make Jäniksen vuosi so exceptional - besides the visual and humouristic brilliance - is how it seems to illustrate the whole political atmosphere in Finland in the 70 's , a well a the whole identity of Finland a a nation . Vatanen is like an archetype of a classical finn in his solitudeness and social distantness . Since nature ha always played such an important role in the national identity of u Finns , the whole idea of that being slowly taken away by the modern society make Jäniksen vuosi emotionally exceptionally moving .

I love Jamie Foxx . And I enjoy 99 % of all movie I see . And I walked out of this one . Now , I admit , it may have had something to do with the two middle-aged white woman in the back of theatre who laughed at every little thing ( `` Oh no , Jamie 's knocking on a door ! HEE HEE HEE ! `` ) , but ... this wa just so incredibly annoying . There could be no sustained camera shot , and no camera shot from a conventional angle ... everything had to be in-your-face , loud , and annoying . The bad guy tried to be smooth and Malkovich-like , but at this point , it 's just old and tired . He brought nothing new or interesting . From all the character , too many line you saw coming , too many you 've heard before , and too many `` tough guy '' line ... and I do n't mind that sort of thing , really , a long a there 's a bit of originality to it . In fact , pretty much the entire supporting cast just sucked . I love Jamie Foxx , and I think he 's really funny , and I thought he wa funny in this movie ... but not nearly funny enough for me to endure everything else . This movie needed le shoot-em-up , le annoying camera shot , more emotion , more feeling , and more Jamie Foxx . I gave it a 2 .

After seeing Dick Tracy in the 6.99 $ bin at Future Shop I decided to give it a go with no previous knowledge and being a big fan of Mafia and Crime movie . I wa very surprised to see a very fun , smart entertaining movie with solid performance throughout . The movie move along well , it ha of course another solid performance from Warren Beatty , but the real standouts of the film are Al Pacino and Madonna . I wa happy to find out that Pacino wa nominated for his performance a an over the top gangster trying to take down the city . Madonna wa great a the damsel in distress , she really impressed me and added depth to her performance . If you go in with the attitude of wanting to watch a fun , smart movie with great acting and a solid script then give Dick Tracy a try . I do n't think you will be disappointed . And Watch for the cameo from Paul Sorvino , James Caan , Kathy Bates and Dustin Hoffman among others .

Send them to the freezer . This is the solution two butcher find after they discover the popularity of selling human flesh . An incredible story with humor and possible allegory that make it much more than a horror film . The complex character defy superficial classification and make the story intriguing and worthwhile - if you can stand it . Definitely a dark film but also a bit redemptive .

Wow ! I picked this off the rental shelf because I loved Robert Carlyle and Jonny Lee Miller in 'Trainspotting . ' This is a phenomenal movie ; it ha action , romance , suspense , intrigue and wit . When I wa n't laughing , I wa at the edge of my seat . This is definitely a film I would recommend to people with an appreciation for intelligent dialogue and a fresh perspective of the 18th century . This film ha everything to keep ME happy !

I do n't know why some people criticise that show so much . It is a great , funny show - probably not the right material for mainstream prime-time , but still ... The family dynamic are funny , and all in all the same you see in most comedy show . The supporting character are absolutely hilarious . The plot of the individual episode and the frequent Siegfried & Roy jibe are only just above average , but ever so often you have sub-plots or one-liner that make you roll on the floor laughing . This show wa well worth the 8 Pounds I paid for it . rating : 8/10

Mexican Werewolf in Texas is set in the small border town of Furlough where Anna ( Erika Fay ) life , her best friend is Rosie ( Martine Hughes ) & she ha a Mexican boyfriend named Miguel ( Gabriel Gutierrez ) who are determined to track a beast down that ha been terrorising the town , killing livestock & several resident including some of their friend . Local Mexican legend speak of the Chupacabra , an evil creature from myth & legend . Erm , I 'm struggling now because not that much else actually happens ... Written & directed by Scott Maginnis I wo n't beat about the bush here & simply say that Mexican Werewolf in Texas is awful , period . The script only ever mention the word Werewolf once & the rest of the time it 's referred to a Chupacabra , in fact I suspect this wa n't really conceived a a Werewolf flick at all . The 'Werewolf ' creature look mostly hairless & more like some vicious dog , there is no reference to anybody changing during the full moon & it actually attack during the day on a couple of occasion , there is no transformation scene & at the end when it is killed it doe n't change back into anyone either . To be honest apart from the title there 's nothing here to indicate a Werewolf film at all & even then the title is just a rip-off of the highly popular An American Werewolf in London ( 1981 ) . This is the type of home made crap that I personally think is killing the horror genre , how long ha it been since there wa a true low budget horror classic like Dawn of the Dead ( 1978 ) , The Evil Dead ( 1981 ) , Halloween ( 1978 ) or Friday the 13th ( 1980 ) which were all made on shoe string budget , maybe The Blair Witch Project ( 1999 ) but that 's it in recent year & crap like Mexican Werewolf in Texas ha absolutely no chance of ever being considered a classic . The character 's are awful & thing just happen around them , the dialogue is rubbish , the pacing is terrible , the story suck & virtually sent me to sleep & a a whole this film is just crap , I 'm sorry but I do n't know how else to describe it . Director Maginnis doe nothing to make this watchable , there 's the annoying hand held camera type cinematography which could easily give someone a headache & quick 'blink & you 'll miss something ' editing which just annoys & irritates in equal measure . It 's not scary , there 's no nudity , there 's no tension or atmosphere & the special effect are awful . The monster really doe look poor & it 's no wonder Maginnis keep it in the shadow or cut his scene so quickly you never get a good look at it . There 's virtually no colour to the picture either , it 's either almost pitch black or over saturated desert sand orange which make the thing an eye sore a well . The gore consists of some fake gut ( blink & you 'll miss them ! ) , a few bloody wound & a severed arm , big deal . With a supposed budget of about $ 300,000 I admit the budget wa low but I simply refuse to accept that for making such a rubbish film , there are plenty of low budget horror flick that make their meagre budget go far . The whole thing ha the look of a home movie , it ha no style & is throughly bland & dull to look at . The acting suck too although you probably already knew that . Mexican Werewolf in Texas will probably con a few people into renting/buying/watching it because they might mistakenly think it 's a sequel to John Landis ' classic which it most certainly is n't & it is n't even a proper Werewolf flick either . Do n't be fooled this is awful & I 'm fed up of having to waste time/money on home made amateur crap like this .

I found this to be a surprisingly light-handed touch at a 1950 's culture-clash movie . John Wayne would hardly be one 's first choice a a cultural attache , being about a diplomatic with his good intention a a bull-run in Harrods . But this time he wa left to play a part that wa far more passive than his usual bluff persona , and he accomplished his task with style . The Duke wa a guy who really could act well . His facial expression and body language could be extremely subtle . Despite his considerable presence both a an actor and in term of screen time , he failed to dominate this movie . Many of his good intention came a cropper . He had authority over nobody , and the intermittent narrative wa provided by the titular geisha to whom he wa the barbarian . The story of American attempt to curry favour with an isolationist Japan wa one of political intrigue rather than swashbuckling or hell-for-leather battle . I can not comment on the accuracy of it research but the strangeness of the Oriental culture to western sensibility wa demonstrated well . There wa a great deal of minutely-choreographed ceremony entailing what looked to this observer like authentic costume and prop . The set piece were complex and detailed . A lot of money and thought had been applied to it . The fractured romance between Wayne and his geisha added a little extra element , and stopped the movie becoming just a political or flag-waving effort . Script wa good without being too wordy . There wa a great deal of Japanese dialogue , but the lengthy period of translation did n't interfere with the narrative . It wa nice to see plenty of genuine oriental on the set . Whether or not they were Japanese , I could n't say . But anyway they looked the part . At least the lead were not played by cross-dressing Caucasians , unlike other effort such a 'Blood Alley ' ( yes , I know they were Chinese ) 'The Inn Of The Sixth Happiness ' or even 'The King And I ' . Frankly , I enjoyed this more than any of those other movie . The script wa better for a start . I never liked the song in 'The King And I ' , and wa n't impressed by the heavy-laden anti-communist subtext of 'Blood Alley ' . I confess to never having seen this work before and found it compared very favourably to many of The Duke 's more popular outing . Recommended .

I wa so glad I came across this short film . I 'm always so disappointed that short film are hard to come across , so when I saw this and saw that it wa nominated for the Live Action Short Film at the Academy Awards , I wa so pleased that I actually had a film that I wa rooting for . The plot is pretty simple , the director , writer , and star Nacho Vigalondo tried coming up with a reason people would suddenly break out into a song and dance number like they do in movie musical . The result is extremely entertaining and the song is actually really catchy . It 's a well made short film , well edited and the actor all do a great job . And the last shot of the film is perfect . I highly recommend this film .

I thought before starting with these movie that it might be a good one , but when i started with it i found it really awful . They said movie is being made in Afghanistan but i think 95 % of the movie is shot in India . you can see Indian made car . you can see lars drinking bisleri ( an Indian water brand ) , Hindi written on the road , you can also see temple in Afghanistan * hahah * it really funny and many more stuff which prof it not shot in Afghanistan . I think one should not waste his/her time watching this movie .. pure time waste .. i would recommend to do something else instead of watching this movie or may be might heart is better idea but do n't watch this waste of time

Truly appalling waste of space . Me and my friend tried to watch this film to it conclusion but had to switch it off about 30 minute from the end . And i can count the film I have switched off before the end on one hand . The script and direction are leaden and deeply uninspiring . I would n't be surprised if they found the script in a pile of cast off script from 1983 . For example the irritating scroat threatening the real estate guy from his house phone . I mean seriously . The police would be beating his door down in minute . The scene and event just wash by you like turd in a river . It is difficult to understand the actual thrust of the film . The narrative flick between character in a seemingly random manner breaking up the pathetic attempt at building the character . Oh and what `` character '' they are . The protagonist played by Rourke is dreadful . He could have just sent a cardboard cut out of himself and stayed in bed . After 60 or so minute of the film I had built absolutely zero attachment to this character . He is neither sympathetic nor hateful . Just a disfigured dummy from a shop window blundering through every single scene . His motivation is impossible to discern from his generally mumbled and emotionless delivery . Is he happy ? Is he sad ? Angry ? No idea . Just those same dead eye staring out at you from a disfigured chunk of flesh . And the native American theme is just awful and pointless . The good guy are at best unlikeable . A dull white collar stereotype and a simpering neurotic ex-wife stereotype . Cue archetypal wife with shotgun face off with bad guy , `` you are n't going to shoot me '' that is both tiresomely unoriginal and annoying . The richie nix character seems interesting at first but soon descends into an irritating one sided psycho character . Which seems at odds with the seeming intention of making the bad guy in some way sympathetic or at least realistically motivated . Roasario Dawsons character start with some promise but soon descends into a sickening and childlike parody of the gangster chick scene from Jackie Brown . You really want me to believe her character wa SO attracted to Rourke 's ? Or worse she is just a floozy who sleep with anything that move ? Realistic female character FTW ! In summary a complete mess of a film . Hopeless characterisation and performance . A leaden and hackneyed script along with uninspired direction . And ultimately extremely dull . Its not even comedy bad either . Laughing at Rourkes haggard face get pretty old after sitting through the first 15 turgid minute of the film .

One could wish that an idea a good a the `` invisible man '' would work better and be more carefully handled in the age of fantastic special effect , but this is not the case . The story , the character and , finally the entire last 20 minute of the film are about a fresh a a mad-scientist flick from the early 50 's . There are some great moment , mostly due to the amazing special effect and to the very idea of an invisible man stalking the street . But ala , soon we 're back in the cramped confinement of the underground lab , which mean that the rest of the film is not only predictable , but schematic . There ha been a great many remake of old film or TV show over the past 10 year , and some of them have their charm . But it 's becoming clearer and clearer for each film that the idea of putting ol ' classic under the nose of eager madman like Verhoeven ( who doe have his moment ) is a very bad one . It is obvious that the money is the key issue here : the time and energy put into the script is nowhere near enough , and a a result , `` Hollow Man '' is seriously undermined with clichés , sappy character , predictability and lack of any depth whatsoever . However , the one thing that actually impressed me , beside the special effect , wa the swearing . When making this kind of film , modern producer are very keen on allowing kid to see them . Therefore , the language ( and , sometimes , the violence and sex ) is very toned down . When the whole world blow up , the good guy go `` Oh darn ! '' and `` Oh my God '' . `` Hollow Man '' gratefully discard that kind of hypocrisy and the character are at liberty to say what come most natural to them . I 'm not saying that the most natural response to something gone wrong is to swear - but it make it more believable if SOMEONE actually swears . I think we can thank Verhoeven for that .

OK , so it owes Pulp Fiction , but in my opinion ha it 's own voice and identity mainly because of the music-video direction style , sketch-like narrative and great performance . Thomas Jane delivers great ( the drug-dealer show-down is extraordinary ) , Aaron Eckhart likewise . James LeGros ha a short and effervescent appearance-great humor- '' they got the Wong house '' . The Porzikova interrogation and rape scene is memorable , a is Mickey Rourke 's cameo appearance- '' take a peak '' . Great Hollywood popcorn B-production with strong performance of A-level aspirant and renegade ( Rourke ) . Well , take a peak , it 's worth .

As far a I know the real guy that the main actor is playing saw his performance and said it wa an outstanding portrayal , I 'd agree with him . This is a fantastic film about a quite gifted boy/man with a special body part helping him . Oscar and BAFTA winning , and Golden Globe nominated Daniel Day-Lewis play Christy Browna crippled man with cerebral palsy who spends most of his life on the floor , in a wheelchair and carried by his family . He ha a special left foot though , he can write with it , paint with it and hold thing with it . He learns to speak later in the film , it is very good for a guy like him . Also starring Home Alone 2 's Oscar winning , and Golden Globe nominated Brenda Fricker a Mrs. Brown and BAFTA winning Ray McAnally a Mr. Brown . It wa nominated the Oscars for Best Director for Jim Sheridan , Best Writing , Screenplay Based on Material from Another Medium and Best Picture , it wa nominated the BAFTAs for Best Film , Best Make Up Artist and Best Adapted Screenplay . Daniel Day-Lewis wa number 85 on The 100 Greatest Movie Stars , he wa number 20 on The 50 Greatest British Actors , he wa number 9 on Britain 's Finest Actors , and he wa number 15 on The World 's Greatest Actor , and the film wa number 28 on The 50 Greatest British Films . Outstanding !

All I ever heard while being raised wa equality of the sex , and here we have a film that not only exemplifies imbalance , but continues through with a whole concept that one sex is better . All the while watching I wa hoping for that redeeming quality to make the viewer feel a though there is hope for the future , and there wa n't . I 'll admit to not finishing the film , I had to turn it off at the part where the old man whore told the genetic man Adam that it wa ok to be a whore and get , and I quote , `` More tail than any man in the past time . '' I know not finishing it is a bad review on myself , but it is the responsibility of the writer and crew to develope a story that will keep a viewer interested , and they failed . This film betrays all true female nature quality of the mother figure and the need for balance . Instead it exemplifies what America ran by lesbian natzis would be like , and I 'm not against lesbian . Thank you Mr. Director ! Someone please give me a redeeming quality ... wait I have it ! There 's no sequel !

I do regret that I have bought this series . I expected more action , more objective picture and more consistency . This is just a pure propaganda series , very dark , without any charm , or romanticism , it is just boredom itself . I find the actor work quite weak a well . O'Donnell might seem charming a Robin ( with Batman ) , but in this picture he lack any charm . Probably while he becomes older , he is loosing his childish charm but doe not gain any charm of a grown up . It come a no surprise , that it wa not shown in a lot of country and is being sold in the UK for 40 % of the recommended price and wa not even released in the Netherlands .

The story ha been told before . A deadly disease is spreading around ... But the extra in this film is Peter Weller , his interpretation of Muller on the run is real . He is indeed a desperate person just going home to see his child . This person could be working next to you .

This film wa very well advertised . I am an avid movie goer and have seen preview for this movie for month . While I wa somewhat skeptical of how funny this movie would actually be , my friend thought it wa going to be great and hyped me up about it . Then I went and saw it , I wa sunk down in my seat almost asleep until I remembered that I had paid for this movie . I made myself laugh at most of the stuff in the movie just so i wouldnt feel bad and destroy the good mood I wa in , plus I wanted to get my monies worth out of the movie ! I always go into a movie with an open mind , not trying to go into them with too many expectation , but this movie wa not that funny . Now it wasnt the worst movie I 've ever seen , but it is definitely worth waiting for HBO . If you havent seen many preview for the movie or you like very slow and corny comedy you may enjoy it , but for true comedy fan Id say pas . Maybe even check out The Kings of Comedy again . Something told me to go see Meet the Parents instead ! ! !

As far a I know this wa my first experience with Icelandic movie . It 's such a relief to see something else than your regular Hollywood motion picture . Too bad that movie like this one have a small chance of succeeding in the big world . I can only hope that people watch this by accident , by recommendation or other ... Because it 's really worth while . I left the cinema feeling really sad . I could n't get the tragic destiny 's of the character out of my head . And it impressed me even more when I thought of the complexity of the film . Not only wa it a tragic story , it had excellent comic relief and a very good soundtrack . If you have the opportunity , watch it ! It 's really thought provoking and made me ponder a lot .

Very typical Almodóvar of the time and , in it own way , no le funny than many of his later work . And why is that ? There is nothing to be provoked or shocked about , and I guess any such effect is more coincidental than intentional . No , the great humor stem from an underlying , almost surreal , absurdity that is woven into the scenery : The character ' nearly complete lack of taboo . It 's the same kind of 'comic suspense ' you find in his later work , though you 'll find it in a more rough version here . He 's building up for masterpiece to come , but is not yet there . The sole reviewer who commented on this movie before I did , claimed that it had to be a `` very select '' group of people who 'd find this movie hilarious . I do .

Once again , Doctor Who delivers the good by the bucket load . It ha humour ( `` You 're just making it up a you go along ! '' `` Yup , but I do it brilliantly '' ) , action , monster ( in this case still more kick-ass cybermen ) , tragedy and scare tactic . In short , just what the doctor ordered ( pun intended ) . The way that the emotion move from one to the other is done so well that there is no feeling of `` get on with it '' . So , chalk up 3 out of the last 4 episode that have made you laugh , then made you cry , and made you go `` eek '' . In term of character development , this is clearly the clincher for Noel Clarke 's Mickey ( and Ricky ) . Being one of the Doctor 's companion , you know that he will do the right thing , and may even suspect the manner that he doe it . However , it is still an emotional wrench when he confirms his future path . While `` The rise of the Cybermen '' had more of the sinister build up to terror , `` The Age of Steel '' is an all out blast . Like `` Alien '' compared to `` Aliens '' - both true classic , but in different way . Can the series keep it up at this level ? Let 's hope so .

A Brother 's Promise is a wonderful family film . This is a biography of Dan Jansen , a champion Olympic speed skater . The movie depicts this athlete 's life from a young age through full adulthood . The love and support of the family member is evident throughout . How Dan and the rest of his family handle winning and losing race is a life lesson for all of u . The commitment and determination of Dan 's coach and his teammate , show what it take to make a real team . How Dan and his family deal with a devastating illness of a loved one is depicted without undo sentiment or sugarcoating . The faith of the family is shown in basic term and is obviously a major part of their life . This is a powerful family film which can be meaningful for a person of any age .

Well ... now that I know where Rob Zombie stole the title for his `` House of 1,000 Corpses '' crapfest , I can now rest in peace . Nothing about the somnambulant performance or trite script would raise the dead in `` The House of Seven Corpses , '' but a groovie ghoulie come up from his plot ( ha ! ) anyway , to kill the bloody amateur making a low-rent horror flick in his former abode ! In Hell House ( sorry , I do n't remember the actual name of the residence ) , a bunch of mysterious , unexplained death took place long ago ; some , like arthritic Lurch stand-in John Carradine ( whose small role provides the film 's only worthwhile moment ) , attribute it to the supernatural ; bellowing film director John Ireland dismisses it a superstitious hokum . The result come across like `` Satan 's School for Girls '' ( catchy title ; made-for-TV production value ; intriguing plot ) crossed with `` Children Should n't Play With Dead Things '' ( low-rent movie about low-rent movie maker who wake the dead ) ; trouble is , it 's nowhere near a entertaining or fun . `` The House of Seven Corpses '' is dead at frame one , and spends the rest of it 89 minute going through rigor mortis , dragging u along for every aching second ...

Director Sidney Lumet ha made some masterpiece , like Network , Dog Day Afternoon or Serpico.But , he wa not having too much luck on his most recent works.Gloria ( 1999 ) wa pathetic and Find Me Guilty wa an interesting , but failed experiment.Now , Lumet brings his best film in decade and , by my point of view , a true masterpiece : Before the Devil Knows You 're Dead.I think this film is like a rebirth for Lumet.This movie ha an excellent story which , deeply , ha many layers.Also , I think the ending of the movie is perfect.The performance are brilliant.Philip Seymour Hoffman brings , a usual , a magnificent performance and he 's , no doubt , one of the best actor of our days.Ethan Hawke is also an excellent actor but he 's underrated by my point of view.His performance in here is great.The rest of the cast is also excellent ( specially , the great Albert Finney ) but these two actor bring monumental performance which were sadly ignored by the pathetic Oscars.The film ha a good level of intensity , in part thanks to the performance and , in part , thanks to the brilliant screenplay.Before the Devil Knows You 're Dead is a real masterpiece with perfect direction , a great screenplay and excellent performances.We need more movie like this .

I loved this film . I thought it would be easy to watch , and easy to forget . I ran out after watching this to buy the DVD , obv not easily forgotten ! It 's not easy to find Judas Kiss on VHS ( it 's not available on DVD ) , but I wanted to add this rather obscure movie to my Alan Rickman movie collection . I ca n't understand how the talented Mr. Rickman get into these mediocre film ? Judas Kiss boast several wonderful actor , an interesting plot and intriguing twist , but it strange visual wandering and chopping editing ruined what might have been a great crime drama . Many scene seem to be missing vital information to explain the character 's action : Why wa our hero immediately suspicious of his boss ? Why did he mistrust the detective he replaced ? There were time when I honestly could n't tell if the director meant Judas Kiss to be a legitimate crime drama or a campy spoof . Why else would he toss in a topless/alien/lesbian porno scene in the first two minute ( that little surprise certainly made me scramble for the remote since my kid were playing nearby ! ) ? Did he purposely instruct his two distinguished English actor ( Alan Rickman and Emma Thompson ) to use such awful New Orlean 's accent ? As an Alan Freak , I confess that I still thought Mr. Rickman wa sexy : in a rumpled , weary , `` take-him-home-and-tuck-him-in '' sort of way . Judas Kiss is n't a great movie , but it doe have some intriguing moment , but I do n't recommend it unless you 're trying to immerse yourself in Alan Rickman .

First of all , I should point out that I really enjoyed watching this documentary . Not only it had great music in it , but the shot and the editing were also wonderful . However , all these positive thing about the film doe not change the fact that it play to the orientalist `` East meet West '' cliché that bother many Turks like myself . Okay , this film tell the story of traditional and contemporary Turkish music in a very stylish manner which is a good thing , something that would show ignorant Europeans and Americans that this country is not just about murdering Armenians and Kurds . However , the problematic of the film is that it look at what it defines a `` east '' from the eye of the `` west '' . I mean , like one jazz musician say in the film , maybe there is no east and west , maybe it is just a myth , a lie created by the ruling leader of `` western '' country in order to keep fear and hostility alive so that they could continue ruling the world and `` keep the cash flowing '' ? Why do n't you think about that ?

STMD ! is not a terrible movie , but it IS quite forgettable . Special effect are imaginative , but obvious . The gratuitous nudity essential for teen slasher flick is there , of course , along with the archetypical teenager , but the whole movie just doe n't gel . What wa needed wa some snappier dialogue and more tongue-in-cheek humor . I ca n't really recommend that you use your time watching this movie . I often give a nod to a movie based on just a scene or two that demonstrates imagination or humor , but these are sadly lacking in this film .

First off , I have no idea how this movie made it to the big screen . Its not even the low budget SCI-Fi channel movie , it just awful . Story : 1/10 CG : 5/10 Acting:3/10 I do n't drink ... but it would have helped before watching this movie

i am not exactly how sure the accuracy is with this movie , but i can tell you that i wa thoroughly entertained by this movie . the character of gust , played perfectly by Phillip Seymour Hoffman , wa one of the most unique , yet entertaining character in recent memory . this movie informed , yet managed to avoid preaching to the audience . it made me laugh , made me sad , made me feel alive , and glad to be spending the time to watch the movie . it take no time to understand what is going on , and take you on a roller coaster ride of genuine , human emotion . i thought i knew my history , apparently i did n't know it at all ! i give this move 9 out of 10 , and recommend it for all adult , and young adult , and the young at heart , just not the young . but a soon a they are allowed to see `` r '' rated movie , make it a priority .

I must have seen this a dozen time over the year . I wa about fifteen when I first saw it in B & W on the local PBS station . I bought a DVD set for the child to see , and am making them watch it . They do n't teach history in School , and this explains the most critical event of the 20th Century . It expands their critical thinking . Impartially , with the participant on all side explaining in their own word what they did and why , it detail what lead up to the war and the actual war . Buy it for your child , along with Alistair Cooke 's America . Watch it with them , and make them understand . You 'll be so glad you did .

Most of the blame must lie at the director 's foot for not even understanding the basic of film making , but Seagal doe not get off lightly , a one of the producer of this film , he must also share the blame . Oh , and I have n't even mentioned how awful the acting is , even by Seagal standard . Even a straight to video fodder , this is not worth a view even for Seagal fan . Give it a wide berth !

and I for one think that is a good thing . I 've just never been a Rosalind Russell fan although the original wa my favorite RR movie . But I love Bette and wa thrilled to hear she wa making this . Well done to Adam Jones and crew .
