Cinema 's greatest period started in post-War Europe with Italy 's Neo-Realist movement . During the next 2 or 3 decade that followed , France 's New Wavers caught everyone 's attention , and there wa always Bergman up there on his desolate Scandinavian island somewhere , making bitter masterpiece . But in 1971 , Luchino Visconti brought the art-form to full circle , geographically speaking , with his miraculous work * Death in Venice * , which might a well be called * The Death of Europoean Cinema * . After the Sixties wound down , so did the great European filmmaker , who , with some exception , generally grew exhausted and passed the torch to a new American generation of Movie Brats ( Coppola , Scorsese , & Co. ) . This movie absolutely feel like a grand summing-up , not just of Visconti 's particular obsession , but of the general attempt of European filmmaker to achieve the aesthetic ideal in movie . And rest assured , you will find no sterner task-master than the Visconti revealed here . He 's not playing to the crowd , folk : either you get behind him and follow along , or you get left behind . The pacing is a challenge : slow , but never without emotional weight . `` Incidents '' are few and far between , but each seems loaded with symbolic significance in a sturm-und-drang cosmos . We will probably never be in such rarefied company again , in term of the movie : one of the century 's great writer who inspired the tale ( Thomas Mann ) , one of the greatest filmmaker directing it ( Visconti ) , one of the greatest actor in the lead role ( Dirk Bogarde ) , and swelling almost ceaselessly in the background , Gustav Mahler 's 5th Symphony . Taking full advantage of Mahler 's ability to inspire Romanticism in even the most cynical breast , Visconti change the main character , Aschenbach , into a decrepit composer from his original persona a a writer , even making Bogarde up to LOOK like Mahler ( geeky mustache , spec , shaggy hair , duck-like walk ) . Bogarde , by the way , delivers what is probably greatest performance of an actor in the history of movie : it 's a largely silent performance , and the actor ha to deliver ream of meaning in a gesture or a glance -- a difficult trick without mugging like Chaplin or merely acting like an animated corpse . Cinema just doe n't get better than this . I 'll ignore the complaint from the Ritalin-addicts out there who say that it 's too slow , but even the more legitimate gripe concerning some of Aschenbach 's flashback with that antagonistic friend of his is misplaced . The flashback fit neatly within the movie 's thematic concern ( i.e. , which is the better path to aesthetic perfection : passion or discipline ? ) , and the suddenness and shrillness of these interruption serve to prevent sleepiness among the viewer . ( Of course , some viewer will sleep through this movie , anyway . ) A nonstop stream of Mahler and beautiful , dying Venice would be nothing more than a pretty picture ; but this movie is actually about something . And what it 's mostly about is suffering : Romantic ( capital R ) suffering , in particular . As a suffering Romantic himself , Visconti knew whereof he spoke . [ SPOILER . . . I guess ] If for nothing else , see * Death in Venice * for it portentous opening credit . . . and for it unforgettable ending , with Bogarde 's jet-black hair-dye dripping off of his sweaty , dying head and onto his chalk-white face . Meanwhile , off in the distance , young Tadzio , the object of Bogarde 's dying desire , stand in the ocean and point toward the horizon like a Michelangelo sculpture . The climatic sequence sum up with agonizing economy everything that the movie is about : love , lust , beauty , loss , the ending of a life set against the beginning of another life , and cold death in the midst of warm , sunny beauty . * Death in Venice * is a miraculous work of art . [ DVD tip : a with the simultaneously released Visconti masterpiece * The Damned * , I recommend that you turn the English subtitle ON while watching this movie . It 's ostensibly in English , but the DVD 's sound seems muddy and there 's a lot of Italian spoken during the film , anyway . ]

This is a stereotype plot . A young fighter try to enter a competition when he is not ready and is not selected to represent his fighting school . This lead to separation from the fighting school and naturally he find a strange new master to teach him to fight . The fight are not of high standard . They are way too `` simple '' in a way that 1+1 is simple to every adult . The fighter ha trained and enters the ring , but doe not do what he trained and get an as kicking . The coach yell do this and do that with no success . And after some more of this ridiculous beating he suddenly doe what he is told and hit his opponent once . This result in a turning point in the fight , although our hero ha been taking a beating of his life up until that point . Think about the Rocky movie and you 'll have a good point of reference of how much beating he really take . The fight are also shot poorly . There final thing that screw this film up is the stupid romance . Cheesy music and awkward moment are not what I call entertainment . These guy really could have made some quality entertainment , but the director wa n't up to the task . Or the other crew in my opinion . Maybe they had a small budget , I do n't know , but what matter in the end is that this movie is bad and deserves the rating of 3 out of 10 .

It is n't TOO bad , but ultimately it lack the quality that the Australian series ha . The joke are few and far between , the actor are attractive ( they should n't be ) , the film maker think far too much about the cinematography ( it 's supposed to look like a home video ) and it 's just like a serious version of Kath and Kim ... it 's stupid . It 's too normal to be Kath and Kim . Kath and Kim are supposed to be two curvy , middle-aged woman who think they are hot and wear ridiculous clothes . There are no `` Look at me Kimmy ! '' joke . The fat friend of Kim is not fat at all and she 's not even slightly stupid . She 's a stereotypical black/Latino chick . It 's just not a stupid or funny a the Australian series . It doe n't compare . Nothing is the same . I admit , this show is pretty funny at time , but it is NOT anything like the Aussie series . I wa looking forward to an American take on a bogan family . They failed . It 's supposed to be REALLY stupid and hilarious , but the actor do n't act stupid ! To me , this is just a typical American TV show . It 's a let down if you want it to be anything like the Aussie show . 2 Stars because it is an OKAY show , just nothing like what it should be .

From the decrepit rank of the already over-saturated 'Hillybilly Horror ' sub-genre come this woeful tale of a vacationing family terrorized by inbred redneck . Sound familiar ? Well it most definitely should to anyone with even a cursory knowledge of the horror genre . There is absolutely new here . The film seems content to recycle all thee old worn out clichés ( deformed hick , a peaceful family turned gun-toting killer when push come to show , the rebellious daughter , the one 'freak ' who 's good at heart , etcetera ... ) , but doe even that half-heartedly enough to make this an utter waste of time . This is forgettable dreck , but humorously enough lead J.D . Hart once starred in a movie called `` Films that Suck '' earlier in his career , quite an ironic omen indeed . My Grade : D-

This film is where the Batman franchise ought to have stopped . Though I will concede that the idea behind `` Batman Forever '' were excellent and could have been easily realised by a competent director , a it turned out this wa not to be the case . Apparently Warner Brothers executive were disappointed with how dark this second Batman film from Tim Burton turned out . Apart from the idiocy of expecting anything else from Burton , and the conservative cowardice of their subsequent decision to turn the franchise into an homage to the Sixties TV series , I fail to understand how `` Batman Returns '' can be considered at all disappointing . True , it is not quite the equal of the first film - though it repair all the minor deficiency of style found in `` Batman , '' a weaker script that split the antagonism between not just two but three character invite unflattering comparison to the masterful pairing of Keaton and Jack Nicholson a the Joker in the first film . Yet for all this it remains a gorgeously dark film , true to the way the Batman wa always meant to be , and highly satisfying . Michael Keaton return a the Batman and his alter ego Bruce Wayne , tangling with nouveau riche tycoon Max Schreck ( Christopher Walken , named in honour of the 1920s German silent actor ) , his partner-in-crime Oswald Cobblepot , the Penguin ( Danny DeVito in brilliant makeup reminiscent of Laurence Olivier 's `` Richard III '' ) , and Selina Kyle , the Catwoman ( Michelle Pfeiffer ) , whom Wayne romance both a himself and a the Batman . The four principal turn in excellent performance , especially Walken and DeVito , while together Keaton and Pfeiffer explore the darker side of double identity . There are some intriguing concept in this film . About the only weakness I can really point out is a certain limpness to the script in some place , which I think is due mostly to the way this film is a four-cornered fight . There simply is n't enough time to properly explore what 's going on . Nevertheless , this is a damn good film . I highly recommend watching this in conjunction with the first , and then weeping for how good the series could have been had it continued under Burton and Keaton .

The Quick and the Undead is , finally , the first movie to actually render it own storyline null and void . It is , essentially , one gigantic plot hole . Aside from that , the acting wa quite bad , character motivation nonexistent or unbelievable and there wa n't a single character worth hanging our hat on . The most interesting cast member ( who had great potential to be a dark horse protagonist ) got snuffed halfway through the proceeding . What the Quick and the Undead DOES serve a is an excellent example of how to do good color-timing . It looked excellent , when you take into account budget consideration . Unfortunately , it play out like a guy got his hand on a hundred grand and watched a few western ( most notably The Good , The Bad and The Ugly ) and then just threw a bunch of element haphazardly into a movie ... `` you know , they have movie where character do THIS ! Does it fit here ? No , but who care ! They do it in other movie so I should do it here ! '' Maybe a good view for burgeoning cinematographer and colorist ( first-year film-schoolers ) . Otherwise , a must-miss .

I wa stunned by this film . Afterwards , I did n't even want to see any film for a long time- any other film would be so unsatisfying by comparison . For many , it may be the worst of Antonioni- very slow , without an engaging conventional story line , microscopic examination of human emotion and interactions- and the worst of Wenders- verbose , confused transcendentalism . It is composed of short distinct episode linked by Wenders ' typical meandering hero 's stream of consciousness , so it doe n't produce the temporary oblivion of escapist cinema . But for fan , the worst is the best and the disjointed story line is sketching a single poetic image that stretch across the film . Wenders and Antonioni create a discourse between their segment that seek out the heart of thing .

Am I the only person who think that the entire Forensics and Scenes Of Crime community in the USA must detest this almighty slap in their face . A rookie cop is first to a crime scene where her back up is so slow to respond that she ha time to send the kid who found the body to the local store to buy a disposable camera . By the time he return ( still no senior cop , SOCOs or other assistance for the lovely Jolie - this is New York is n't it ? ? ) it ha started raining and she get to work photographing the evidence , only after she 'd stood in front of an Amtrak to stop it disturbing the scene . I want to know the name of that camera a the photograph were so incredibly detailed that no amount of zooming in distorted the image ! ! The horror continues : - not in the film itself ( pretty ordinary I 'm afraid ) but in the Lincoln Rhyme character a played by Mr Washington . This man is a highly dedicated Forensic Crime Scene Examiner with year of experience who , instead of the highly trained but invisible local Crime Scene Examiners , entrusts the work to an untrained cop , a rookie cop , who proceeds to find the very obviously placed clue and move them before photographing them thus contaminating every item and making DNA profiling well nigh impossible . Now that wa a bright idea eh ? I know one should be able to suspend disbelief to a degree but those who say this film is intelligent must have entirely disengaged their ability to think in order to find this film believable . I have given this film 4/10 for the superb acting of Denzel Washington and for Miss Jolie 's lip which are the only item requiring my disbelief to be suspended !
The one of the most remarkable sci-fi movie of the millennium . Not only a movie but an incredible future vision , this movie establishes a new standard of s/f movie . hail and kill !

This is the second Hitchcock film to appear on the list and the second Hitchcock film I 've seen in full , the first wa Rope , which I really enjoyed . With Saboteur Hitchcock wa more room to roam free , whereas Rope took place all in one room . I did n't enjoy this one a much a Rope but that 's not saying this is a bad film , it just seems like an average flick that could have been something more . It seems like a film Hitchcock would make a a break in between his more serious one . As a thriller , I feel it fails to really get my on the edge of my seat or engaged with the lead character who is running around the States . The climax of the film feel like a miss opportunity to really amp up the tension . The sound design is almost non existent . You can hear their dialogue and a bit of the environment around them , but the important thing are missing , the stitch ripping apart from the sleeve , the need of music to amp of the tension , all missing . Intentional no doubt , yet it lack the emotional punch one would want from such a scene . Then it end abruptly leaving you empty inside . The film doe n't feel like it should either , they are almost globe trotting from place to place , yet it feel more confined . The script itself is very average and seems to go about the more obtuse way to get the plot moving . The performance are there , but nothing amazing . Everyone play their part to scripted word on the page . The relationship between the two lead is weak and needed more work . The one stand out is Otto Kruger , who ha that rich , ego , evil persona down pat . In the end , I wanted more from this one . I understand it 's one of Hitchcock 's least exciting film , but I did have a good time watching it . I can recommend it , just not enthusiastically .

It is always difficult to bring a 450 page book down to a three hour film . I read the book before , and I found the BBC production dealing with this difficulty in the best way possible . The quality of the book have n't been lost : the dense and lively depiction of a fingersmith patchwork family in London in the 1860s , the cold and obscene cruelty in which Maud is brought up , the characterization of different social group by different way of speaking , the unexpected and surprising twist of the story , the way the film make the spectator look different at the same scene when they are told first from Sue 's point of view then from Maud 's one . The main actor do very good , and especially the growing love between the two woman is convincingly developed , with a first culmination in a very tender love scene between the two and finally forgiving all the evil they were ready to do and did to each other , because they still love each other . For each of her book the author , Sarah Waters , ha thoroughly investigated what life wa like in British 19th century . While in Tipping the Velvet it wa the world of the vaudeville theater and the beginning of social movement , in Affinity the dreadful reality of woman penitentiary and the fashionable evocation of spirit , in Fingersmith she depicts the public ceremony of hanging people in London and the inhuman treatment of person supposed or declared disturbed in asylum based on the reading of source and scientific research . This is very well transferred to the film so that the corresponding scene show a high grade of historic truth . I highly recommend this film production because it offer three hour of colorful Victorian atmosphere , vivid emotion , and suspense .

This is one of my all time favorite cheap , corny , vampire B movie . Calvin Klein underwear model ... oh , I mean , Stefan the Good Vampire , return to Transylvania to ascend the throne of Vampiric Royalty , but Manicure-impaired and eternally drooling half brother Radu ha other plan . Having killed their father the Vampire King , Radu now set his sight on Stefan , Stefan 's new mortal girlfriend Michelle and her two pretty friend , and the all-powerful Bloodstone . Okay , the scenery is beautiful , and it should be a it wa shot on location in Transyl-fricken-vania for gosh sake . The actress are no great shake and Stefan the Heroic Vampire is about a charming a a refrigerated fireplace poker , but who care ? There 's only one reason to watch this movie , and his name is RADU ! He 's a physical homage to Nosferatu and he ha the best line in the movie , all spoken in the raspy voice of a man who smoke ten pack of cigarette a day . The cemetery festival scene is one of the best scene in the film , a Radu slowly approach the camera and reveals his grinning , slobbering face for the world to see . I found myself cheering him on a he collected victim and taunted his perfect brother . But maybe I 'm just a sicko . Questionable taste in men aside , I highly recommend this film to vampire enthusiast . It 's original , it 's fun , and Radu is one of the best vampire I 've seen in a long time ... much more fun than the stiff , tragic , whining Undead brat that endlessly grace the horror screen these day . Radu enjoys his sadism and never apologizes . He 's what a vampire should be .

Let me first off say that I am a believer of ghost , and I do indeed know they exist . I have had enough experience with them to know they are there . What I hate is the people who bring the Bible and Religion into all of this . People forget there is more than one `` Bible '' , thousand of religion and belief , and different way to interpret what is said in the Bible . Not everyone belief in God , and not everyone belief in stereo-typical religion . Religion doe not make everything fact , one of the thing I should mention in the Bible that many do not know is that even the most rampant Bible thumper is breaking the very rule written within .... you are supposed to never wear more than one fabric at one time , slavery is OK , and you may murder your neighbor under certain circumstance . None of this , `` Oh that wa the Old testament , and now we have the New Testament . '' If the Bible is the word of God , and can not be changed .. there should be no change , or version . Religion is full of misinterpretation , mixed fact , and people who so blindly follow it that there , `` Is no other way . '' The excuse these said blind follower use are either pathetic , or they themselves can not explain the discrepancy properly , and instead use excuse handed down to them from either their Pastor or teacher . But anyhow , onto the review . I am a decent fan of `` Ghost Hunters '' and when I heard this show wa coming soon , I wa pretty excited and thought it had some potential . As much a I like watching `` Ghost Hunters '' , I do not like some of their member , and I do not like the way they can dismiss a place a being haunted , yet can not explain anything that is going on . Just because your investigation equipment doe not pick it up , doe not mean the camera filming the show did not . I am glad they are skeptical , but it 's like they do not understand that just because you did not get anything on your recorder and film doe not make the place haunted or not . If Ghosts were that easy to capture , it would be known a a fact , not a belief . It 's more of a `` right place at the right time '' kind of thing , a well a if there is something there , what make you think it 's going to `` perform '' for you ? This show is kind of silly . It 's usually boring , and there is lot of talk , lot of psychic , yet hardly anything happens . The main guy 's filtered narration is usually either boring to listen to , or is basically not needed . Also , the reliance on psychic is too abundant , a I believe VERY few of them are actually gifted . Silvia Brown is one I definitely believe in , but most are sometimes hard to believe . I really wanted to like this show , but of the few I have seen I have yet to be terribly impressed .

For a long time , 'The Menagerie ' wa my favorite 'Star Trek ' episode though in recent year it ha been eclipsed by 'City on the Edge of Forever . ' What I used to prefer about 'Menagerie ' wa that it 's more hard-core Star Trek with this fascinating back-story to the then-current Trek storyline . I still think it 's fairly ingenious the way Gene Roddenberry incorporated the original pilot into a two-part episode . Though the 'new ' part of the story is largely an excuse for Kirk and a few others ( and u ) to watch the pilot , the idea of Spock being court-martialed is a clever one . You can poke hole in the plot if you want . For instance , given the Talosians ' mind-control ability and Captain Pike 's condition , why is it even necessary to physically bring Pike back to their planet ? And there are other confusing question about Pike and Commodore Mendez ... best to not think too hard about the detail and just enjoy ST 's only two-parter .

Coen Brothers-wannabe from writer-director Paul Chart relies far too much on idea lifted from other ( better ) movie , yet doe manage to create a creepy atmosphere that keep one watching . Robert Forster cut loose a never before playing a psychopathic psychiatrist ( ha ha ) who go on a killing spree in the desert . The film is unusual , but in it attempt to keep one step ahead of the audience , it becomes alienating and off-putting ( with a role for Amanda Plummer that is downright humiliating ) . An admittedly bravura finale , many quirky bit of business -- and Forster looking great in the nude -- make this a curiosity item , nothing more . Veteran movie-director Irvin Kershner produced , and maybe should directed a well ( could Paul Chart be a pseudonym ? ) . * 1/2 from * * * *

When it wa released this film caused a sensation . I watched it and wa thrilled . Beautiful , usually young , naked woman filmed in the classy style we knew so well from director Hamiltons photography . His photograph never become porn and the same is true for this movie . Today I saw it again and wa bitterly disappointed . The soft core in extremely slow paced scene , all filmed with some Vaseline on the lens , actually is all there is . There is no real story , the character remain beautiful and beautifully filmed body , but they are not real creature with a soul . Actually nothing happens . It is like Hamilton is photographing using moving picture rather than still . And this get so boring after a while . I even did n't watch the whole thing the second time , for I fell vast asleep . That is all that remains of this masterpiece : it is a very good sleeping pill . And you will never become addicted to it ! Back then 7 out of 10 , now 3 out of 10

Largely forgettable tale in which mercenary Kerman & employer Agren travel into the jungle in search of Agren 's missing sister . Despite it connection to the cannibal movie family , this film is more of an extreme version of Rene Cardona 's `` Guyana - Crime of the Century '' . Lenzi clearly aim to exploit the ( at that time ) topical Jonestown massacre , by depicting a rogue , self righteous zealot with a penchant for bigamy and just a hint of megalomania ( played with ruthless intensity by Ivan Rassimov ) leading his motley crew flock into self inflicted oblivion . With sister in toe , Kerman & Agren attempt to stop the rot , but after several failed coup , they end up fleeing into the `` Green Inferno '' , only to run afoul the local and their notorious appetite . One in a string of excessive gore fests that emerged in the late seventies/early eighty , where every new addition seemed to engage in a one-upmanship contest with it predecessor , by attempting to contrive the most gory and graphic display ever brought to motion picture . This inferior instalment employ all the motif and gimmick of the others , but with much le success . Was it the so called `` Amazonian native '' who looked like they were Bollywood reject ( this film wa made on location in Sri Lanka ) , or the inept `` decapitation '' and `` castration '' scene that seriously diminished the authenticity that wa apparent in `` Cannibal Holocaust '' ? You can decide . Without spoiling the conclusion , it appeared a though Lenzi put more emphasis in his shock and awe climax than in the basic requirement for a cohesive ending , where all loose end are resolved . Most unsatisfying . As with the others , where the extent of the graphic depiction of violence toward human is limited ( thankfully ) , the filmmaker have spared no extreme in inflicting the worst possible cruelty on hapless animal in their pursuit of the most sadistic shock . Unfortunately , the only thing shocking about this film is that it rate a mention among others of the ilk , that deal with the subject matter more convincingly . If there are any redeemable feature at all , Kerman is an affable if somewhat one-dimensional leading man , and his bevy of scantily clad co-star ( Agren , Lai and Senatore ) provide some visual respite from the relentless slaying .

Get Smart should be titled Get Stupid . There is not one funny line or gag in the entire film . This film is so bad it make the Austin Powers film look Shakespearean . A few more film like this and Steve Carell can kiss his career goodbye . As for Anne Hathaway , what is she doing in this film ? She 's a good actress but is just plain terrible . The writing is pathetically lame . There is not one funny , clever , or witty line . There is not one good sight gag . The directing is terrible . Comedy relies on timing . Someone should tell the director that . Every line that is supposed to be funny ( and is n't ) is delivered with absolutely the worst sense of comic timing I 've ever seen . 0 star

Herculis Puaro is , in general , a well established 'hero ' we know well from book and movie . This movie or this story do n't work and i felt it not Agatha 's mistake . The cast is n't good , the actor are over exaggerating and making foolish gesture , the costume are so clean and tidy that everything ( even Arab clothes ) look fake and for the serious spectator who think twice this movie can be seen a a comedy instead of mystery drama . The actor playing Herculis Puaro is doing a nice job but nothing fantastic . The scene are , a said before , perfect and looking fake . The story is not very enchanting although a mystery of murder but who care about the death of a loony and vicious blond 45+ woman in the iraqi desert ? ! The 'victim ' is not likable .

How can so many blundering decision can be made . All that waste of resource ! Its an idiotic story to begin with but there no need to make it worse.A loose interpretation ? Are you kidding ! it diminishes my regard for Voight and Coburn.I hope they were paid well .

This wa by far the worst movie I 've ever seen . And thats compared to Alexander , Fortress 2 and The new world . I 'm blaming the Mrs for this one a she picked it , thanks babe . Be warned ....... A true shocker all round ! ! ! ! ! !

If you 've read Mother Night and enjoyed it so much ( a I did ) that you just have to see the movie , understand that you have to understand a fundamental element of Vonngut 's writing - that beyond his story lie Vonnegut himself , and that you ca n't put a human mind on the screen . His whit and humor just can not be transcribed by a screenplay or even the best acting performance . I believe that this movie exceeds in asking the key question that Vonnegut pose in his book , but those frequent cynical moment of satire found on the page are not found on the screen . Does this mean that the movie miss the mark ? Of course not . In my opinion , the movie succeeds because it doe not try to recreate the experience of reading the book ( this is not a medium for those too lazy to turn a page ) . It succeeds because it take the fundamental element of a story created by one of America 's true artistic treasure and present it in a a framework without pretense . I 've seen other movie version of Vonnegut book where the director obviously try to channel Vonnegut 's genius and loses grip on his own craft . I would not place this movie a one of the best I 've seen , but it stand on it own leg a one well worth watching . By taking Vonnegut 's `` voice '' out of the movie 's narration or trying to insert it however it can , Mother Night tell his story brilliantly , and preserve the story 's fundamental lesson without confusion , distraction , or disappointment .

This is one of the worst movie , I 've ever seen . Not only , that it is a comedy , which is n't funny , but it 's also very badly made with an over the top direction full of unnecessary split screen and other effect . The two `` hero '' with their fantasy language are just annoying and it confused me quite a lot , that they touched each others genitals all the time . But the worst of all that nonsense is the cheap attempt to give that movie some appeal , by referring to German history and to show sensitive aspect of the `` hero '' , which find it climax in showing how Erkan and Stefan cure a mentally ill woman with their `` joyful '' lifestyle ( ! ) . But I had n't expect anything better by director Michael `` Bully '' Herbig , who also made two not funny TV-shows , a not funny western movie and a nearly not funny SF-comedy movie . But Erkan and Stefan had been- just a little- better in some of their stand-up program . For me the only good thing about the movie is Alexandra Neldel , who is very beautiful to me .

I sat through this on TV hoping because of the name in it that it would be worth the time ... but dear Gussie , whoever thought this script wa worth producing ? The basic idea is excellent but the execution is appallingly bad , with a constantly illogical sequence of scene , an ending that is almost laughably melodramatic and poor Rock Hudson wanders through this with an understandably confused look on his slightly sagging face . Looks like a bad B movie from the 40 's ...

A number of contributor have mentioned the age difference between Stewart and Novak . She wa 25 and he wa 50 when this movie wa released . I think that the difference did n't matter for a suspense drama like Vertigo , but it doe matter for a romantic comedy . We can easily understand , that is , why his character would be attracted to hers , but it 's le clear why hers would be attracted to his . Still , the movie work a a light romantic fantasy . The scene where she stare at him across the cat 's head , with her dark painted-on eyebrow flaring and the sound of her humming and the cat purring , is true magic . It 's a little jarring , therefore , when the scene shift to the top of the Flatiron Building , and we see the age difference very sharply . As he embrace her , she reach up to run her finger through his hair , but stop that motion and just brush her fingertip lightly against his toupee .

Family problem abound in real life and that is what this movie is about . Love can hold the member together through out the ordeal and trial and that is what this movie is about . One man , Daddy , ha the maturity and fortitude to sustain the family in the face of adversity . The kid grow up , one all be it , in the hard way , to realize that no matter how old they or a parent is , the parent still love their child and are willing to provide them a cushion when they fall . ALL the actor portraying their character did outstanding performance . Yes , I shed a tear along the way knowing I had had similar experience both a a young adult and later a a parent . This true to life is one which every young adult , and parent , would do well to see , although some will not realize it until they too are parent . A must see for those who care about their family .

The only conceivable flaw of this film is it 's title ! ! Please stop comparing it to the first ! I did in my previous review only to separate it from the first . If you have n't seen the movie and are curious , TOTALLY forget about the first and invent a different name for this . There is nothing alike and ha a mood all it own . This is a great exponent of screwy mid-80s comedy . I seriously doubt such big name in this cast did the movie because they were broke or even wanted to remake the first . Anybody who ever wanted to give a kick to the snobbish aristocracy should love this little opus . I maintain , the only reason this is in the IMDB bottom 100 is because of it title . I usually hate movie like these ( i.e . adam sandler , will farrell , farrelly bros .... ) , but this movie just keep me laughing hysterically . I dunno , maybe it 's like a bad relationship I ca n't get out of or just a ridiculous guilty pleasure . Either way , this is the single most underrated movie of the 80 behind 'The Stunt Man . ' Robert Stack- WE LOVE YOU ! ! ! ( 1919-2003 )

Salva and his pal Bigardo have been at the margin of the law during most of their life . We see them panhandling in a car of the underground , where their pitch to get donation is so lame , no one give them anything ! Salva , who is a hardened petty criminal doe n't even have any redeeming quality , that is , until he discovers a reality show on television that give him the idea of what to do next . Religion and show business prove to be a winning combination , something that Salva capitalizes on . He and Bigardo have been in jail after the accidental death of a priest that wa critical of the duo . Salva show he is a natural for the reality show . He transforms himself into a Christ-like figure who is an instant success in the program . Espe , who is a no-nonsense woman who is show 's producer , ca n't escape from the way Salva pay her unusual attention . Ultimately , Salva is the victim of his own success in the end . Jordi Molla , whose first directorial job this movie is , had some success in the way the film satirizes the role of television . Spain , which wa vulnerable to these type of program , ha seen it share of the bizarre , which is what the director felt is an assault on the viewing public and wanted to set his story from the point of view of the people that are making a fortune out of the naive audience . The ensemble cast ha some good moment in the film . Mr. Molla , like any actor who decides to direct his first feature , would have been more effective concentrating on the picture in front of the camera . Candela Pena , a good actress , is one of the best reason for watching the movie . Juan Carlos Villedo , David Gimenez Cacho , Franco Francescoantonio , Florinda Chico and the rest responded well to the new director .

These kinda movie just do n't get the credit they deserve . This is my 2nd all time favorite movie , ( Stand By Me being 1st . ) The reason I watched this movie wa because Wil Wheaton wa in it and he is my most favorite person in the whole world and I think he done an amazing job in this movie and so did Sean Astin . I just watched it last night actually and it just amazed me . Everything in the movie is very exceptional . The script , the acting , the screenplay . I wa on the edge of my seat 80 % of the time , and if my mom wa n't in the room I would have absolutely balled whenever Joey Trotta ( Wil Wheaton ) died . I did not see that coming ! ! At all ! ! I wa real surprised when I heard that it wa n't real popular back in the 90 's . I wa born a few year after it came out so , of course , I did n't go see it in the theater , but im sure I would have if I would have been alive . If any of my friend watched this , they would be like , `` uhh okay ? '' but thats just cause their not cool enough to appreciate work like this . If you have n't seen this movie , or are wanting to watch something that is the bomb , this is the movie for you to watch .

As a big-time Prince fan of the last three to four year , I really ca n't believe I 've only just got round to watching `` Purple Rain '' . The brand new 2-disc anniversary Special Edition led me to buy it . Wow , I wa really looking forward to watching it , but I wa n't prepared for just how electric it actually is . Prince 's musical performance throughout the movie are nothing short of astounding - he REALLY ha the move in this one . I am very familiar ( from repeated listens ) with the classic `` Purple Rain '' album and all it song , but to see them in the context of the movie completely alters your perception of the tune and lyric - like COMPUTER BLUE , THE BEAUTIFUL ONES , WHEN DOVES CRY and PURPLE RAIN itself . There is something indescribably hypnotising about the scene where Prince and The Revolution perform . The closing song BABY I 'M A STAR and I WOULD DIE FOR U show how much energy and sheer talent Prince wa brimming with in his mid-20s ( he 's overflowing ! ) , it blew me away . It even make Michael Jackson seem inanimate even in his peak year . Prince show you how to win the girl of your dream - drive her to a lake , make her jump in , then drive off - absolutely hilarious stuff in hindsight . Some of the scene are very 1980s and unintentionally hilarious but this add to the film 's overall charm . Morris Day is the coolest cat on the block ( and hilarious ) , and when his group The Time perform THE BIRD you get to see Morris Day and Jerome Benton light up the stage Minneapolis funk style - I love their dancing in this bit , and how Benton provides Morris with a mirror mid-performance . I already ca n't wait to watch it again , I really ca n't ! Extras are terrific - particularly seeing a young Eddie Murphy pre-Beverly Hills Cop admit he is a `` Prince groupie '' .

A good ol ' boy film is almost required to have moonshine , car chase , a storyline that ha a vague resemblance to `` plot '' and at least one very pretty country gal , barefoot with short short and a low top . The pretty gal is here ( dressed in designer jean ) -- but the redneck prerequisite stop there . Jimmy Dean is a natural a a sausage spokesman but a a tough guy former sheriff , he come up way short . Big John is big , but he is n't convincing with the `` bad '' part of his moniker . Bug-eyed Jack Elam is a hoot a always and Bo Hopkins ha been playing this same part for decade ; Ned Beatty also doe his part in a small role ... but there is no STORY . It smell more like an episode of In The Heat Of The Night than a feature film . Cornball cornpone with easily predictable sentiment . Perhaps the most glaring problem with this movie is Charlie Daniels singing the theme . You know the one ; it wa made famous by ... Jimmy Dean .

After several extremely well rating to the point of SUPERB , I wa extremely pleased with the film . The film wa dark , moving , the anger , the pain , the guilt and a very extremely convincing demon . I had initially expected to see many special effect , and like a lover 's caress , it blew me away with the subtlety and the rightness of it . Brian , I am again blown away with your artistry with the telling of the story and your care of the special effect . You will go a long way , my friend . I will definitely be the president of your fan club . Eric Etebari , the best actor award , wa the number one choice . You made Jr. Lopez look like a child compared to Kasadya . : ) Overall , the acting , story line , the high quality filming and awesome effect , it wa fantastic . I just wish it were longer . I am looking forward to The Dreamless with extremely high expectation .

But it is kinda hilarious , at least if you grew up on Weird Al , like I did . It 's a mockumentary about his life and career , beginning with superstardom and going back to trace the origin . It 's uneven in place , but some of the segment are still very funny , particularly when he go to Japan . Although it 's not quite a emotionally textured a Lost in Translation , and he doe n't find love however fleeting , he doe capture in a bottle the absolutely bizarre cultural melange that is Tokyo street life . Perhaps Weird Al is n't recognized a the insightful cultural commentator that he is ; perhaps a rose by any other name would smell just a sweet . Still , this is a funny movie .

One of the two Best Films of the year . A well filmed , well written , well put together film with an outstanding cast . Lau Ching Wan and his friend ( Dayo Wong Chi Wa , Anthony Wong Chau Sun , Francis Ng Chun Yu , Jordan Chan Siu Chun , Cheung Man Tat ) had great chemistry before the film and their friendship show in their performance . Theresa Lee play her comedic role well ( Though much like a female version of Michael Wong , her gag seems to be the foreign born Chinese surrounded by native HKers . ) , and I found myself cheering for innovative explosive scene , something I have n't done since 1. the fan boy took over alt.asian-movies and 2 . John woo 's Hardboiled . Sure the ending wa expected , but I feel better cheering for cop than a bunch of young gang member . Highly enjoyable .

I managed to see this at the New York International Film Festival in November 2005 with my boyfriend . We were both quite impressed with the complexity of the plot and found it to be emotionally moving . It wa very well directed with strong imagery . The visual effect were amazing - especially for a short . It had an original fantasy approach to a very real and serious topic : This film is about a young girl who is visited by a demon offering to help her situation with her abusive father . There is also a surprise twist at the end which caught me off guard . This lean towards the Gothic feel . I would love to see this a a full feature film . -- Carrie

Why else would he do this to me ? Not that I expect Dean Cain to produce hit movie . Or even decent movie . I saw Lois and Clark , I am aware of just how ... `` good '' Dean Cain is . Obviously this is gon na be a cheesey flick , and each cheesey flick ha it own special way to make you scratch your head . I will not call these spoiler a you ca n't really spoil this movie any more than it already is . To begin with ... why is that a fake helicopter ? I mean ... why ? How come that one scientist is from Chicago and that other scientist is from LA and neither one could be any more eastern european if they tried ? How hard would it have been to get either an american actor , or just change that lame state sheet the movie provides u with to say those people are n't american ? To be honest , who cared about it even when they mentioned it , but I guess that 's beside the point . Does a movie really get better if you are able to view it through multiple split screen ? The answer is no . That dragon sure can walk down that hall .. over .. and over ... and over .... and over ... Who on earth wa responsible for one of the worst ending in film history ? Minimal script , minimal character development , minimal steady camera . Maximum stretched scene , maximum headache inducing jerky zoom , maximum character walking around in the wood doing nothing . Up until the time flash on the screen of 12:01pm , you can fast forward and miss nothing , since there are three hunter who we know nothing about doing nothing . To be fair , the movie doe have some string music that wa interesting , so perhaps a music video would have been the way to go with this . Unfortunately that wa not to be , and what should have been a twenty minute short is stretched beyond belief . Forget about `` Trigger Man '' , I know I am trying to . - MERK

A wonderful film ahead of it time , I think so , In the eighty 's it wa all about winning , Greed is Good ? Remember that one ? I have seen this film more that 20 time , To me this is a real desert island film , I keep watching because there is always something more to learn about these flawed character that I just love , Jessica Tandy , and Hume Cronin , are simply wonderful , Also Beverly D'angelo , Beau Bridges come in at a close second , do n't get me wrong there are many more great performance 's in this film , and it is also the way it is written that made it for me , and I hope you , a film that you will want to see over and over , I think TV show like `` Northen Exposure '' , and now `` Earl '' owe a lot to this film . but remember it is not a Tom Cruise film .

it got switched off before the opening credit had even finished appearing . The first joke wa just so appallingly lame and dreadfully acted that it had to go . This is one of the more unromantic movie I have ever seen . Casting : Richard Gere is just too old looking for romantic lead role anymore . Diane look a bit eager to please and frowning a usual but she seems unconvinced by the romance herself . Supporting cast not too memorable . Story : The medical drama he ha to deal with is unconvincing and is not interesting . The story is weak - not enough happens to make a movie about . There is nothing new to say or no new way to say it here . The setting is a little bleak and the house it is set in is unattractive . NOT destined to be a great one to remember .

( Only light spoiler in here ) Stealing Sinatra is a half-slapstick comedy about dimwit kidnapper , dimwit victim , and a few other side-stories thrown in to eat up some time . You will see some poor performance all around in this movie . The drama is forced , and the humor make no sense . Whether you 're watching the kidnapper threaten the victim who wo n't shut up , or a victim 's father responding to the criminal 's death threat with `` Care for some tea ? `` , none of it is believable . This quite comfortably fit into the `` wannabe movie '' category . You will also be listening to a repetitive goofy music track throughout pretty much the entire movie . It 's quite unprofessional , and add nothing . It 's really just a sad attempt at making an achingly unfunny movie seem somewhat witty . However , if you 're able to look past all of this and suspend a lot of disbelief , you might be entertained by the adequate storyline . I voted 4/10 .

Yes , this is one of THOSE movie , so terrible , so insipid , so trite , that you will not be able to stop laughing . I have watched comedy , good comedy , and laughed le than my wife and I laughed at this movie . The other comment give the idea well enough . The character are so unpleasant you cheer the rat on , the effect are so poorly done you wonder whose elementary school art class wa in charge , the acting -- oh the acting -- talk about tired dialogue and embarrassing pause . But the rat , yes , the big rat . Why we did n't get to see the rat until the end rather surprised me . Often the 'big one ' is n't shown until the end because the budget is limited and good effect chew up so much money . I surmise , however , that in this case the big rat wa hidden until the end because the filmmaker were ashamed that the best they had wa a guy running around dressed up like a woodchuck with third-world dentistry . The most sublime part of the whole movie is the elevator scene . After figuring out that the rat could n't stand loud noise ( migraine from the bad acting ? ) , the main dude rig up a fire alarm to send the rat into a frenzy . If you 've ever wanting to see a pair of rat waltz while blood squirt out of their head like a geyser , this film is for you . Really , you need to rent it and see for yourself . But not for more than 99¢ , OK ?
