Even some of the scene seemed like they should have been made much quicker ... like they dragged on for no particular reason . Very poor editing . All in all this movie wa a giant waste of time and money . Boo .

This is one of my favorite . Betty White and Leslie Neilson sparkle in this romantic comedy . One is a business executive who re-evaluates life based on the expectation of her death within a year . The other is a playboy who ha tired of gold-digging young woman and seek a relationship with a vital , mature woman . If you 've got silver in your hair and/or romance in your heart , microwave the popcorn , curl up with your honey , and prepare yourself for a treat .

Following directly from where the story left off in part one , the second half which set about telling the inevitable downfall and much more grim side of the man 's legacy is exactly a such . In direct contrast to the first feature , part two represents a shift from Che the pride and glory of a revolutionised country , to Chestruggling liberator of a country to which he ha no previous tie . The change of setting is n't just aesthetic ; from the autumn and spring grey of the woodland come a change of tone and heart to the feature , replacing the optimism of the predecessor with a cynical , battered and bruised reality aligned to an all new struggle . Yet , a Che would go on to say himselfsuch a struggle is best told exactly a thata struggle . While Part One certainly helped document that initial surge to power that the revolutionary guerrilla acquired through just that , Part Two take a much more refined , callous and bleak segment of Che 's life and ambition , and give it an assertive portrayal that is both poignant and tragic in a tangible , easy to grasp manner . While the movie 's tone in some regard doe stray off and differ quite drastically from Part One however , there still remains that same documented approach taken a month ago that avoids melodrama and fabrication a much a possible . This somewhat distant , cold approach to telling Che 's story and struggle will no doubt turn some viewer off ; indeed , I still remain reserved about whether or not the feature itself should have been named after one manif anything , the entirety of Che , taken a a whole , delivers a tale that go beyond mere biography and instead document a man 's struggle alongside those who helped carry him along the way . By no mean doe Soderbergh try to paint a humanistic portrait here akin to what Hirschbiegel did with Der Untergang half a decade ago ( excuse the ironic contrast ) ; Che is a slow moving , reserved and meditative approach to telling a history lesson that just happens to be narrated by the one man who arguably- conducted the whole thing . Yet by moving from the lush green landscape of Cuba and retreating to the bleak , decaying backdrop of Bolivia for Part Two , the story doe inevitably take on a distinctly contrasting tone that doe n't feel too disjointed from it predecessor , but doe enough to give it it own reference point . Here , the basic structure of Part One is echoed backthere 's the initial struggle , the battle , the fallen comrade and the recruiting of those to replace them , all the while we see some glimpse of the man behind the movement . Yet , a anyone with the vaguest idea of the actual history behind the feature will know , Part Two is destined to end on a much more underwhelming , and disquieting note . This difference , in combination with the similarity to Part One , make a compelling and memorable whole ; by all mean , both could be digested one their own ( and kudos to Soderbergh for achieving a such ) and enjoyed a they are , but taken a one statement , Che delivers exactly what it set out to achieve . Indeed , everything that made Part One the treat that it wa one month prior is still evident here from the subtle yet engrossing performance from the central cast to the slow building , realistically structured combat scenesthe drama inherent to the character on screen is just a vague and indiscernible , but with a feature such a this , Part Two once again prof that avoiding such element do n't necessarily hurt a film when there is enough plot and reflection on other element to keep the viewer engaged . In fact , upon writing this review I wa at odds a to whether or not to simply add a paragraph or two to my initial review for Part One , and title the review a a whole , yet I felt that to do so would only serve to disillusion those who may sit down to watch the entirety of both film consecutively . With that said , I can not rightfully decree whether or not Che hold up to the task of engaging an audience for it sprawling four hour plus runtime , but upon viewing both segment I can at least attest to each part 's ability to do just that . With a reflective , intricate screenplay combined with endlessly mesmerising photography and nuanced performance that do justice to the movie 's character without drawing attention to themselves , Che Part Two is every bit a compelling and rewarding a it predecessor , but this time with a tragic but uplifting , reaffirming conclusion fit for the history page of film . - A review by Jamie Robert Ward ( http : //www.invocus.net )

Sometimes it 's hard to be a pirate ............... but by golly Miss Jean Peters ha a lot of fun trying - and it show , particularly during her first spot of friendly swordplay with Blackbeard ( Mr Thomas Gomez - eminently hissable ) when the sheer joy of performing is plain on her face . With fifty year of hindsight Feminists seem intent on grabbing this movie a some sort of an anthem for the empowerment of woman in a male - dominated society but I have serious doubt that either M.Tourneur or Miss Peters had any such concept in their head at the time . It wa an exciting , entertaining family film with absolutely no pretension , hidden meaning or alternative agenda.It wa fun . M.Louis Jourdan is both winsome and treacherous a her love interest . Mr Herbert Chapman is wise and philosophical a the wise and philosophical doctor.Mr James Robertson Justice is just a tad unbelievable a the bosun . But it is Miss Peters who stay in the memory.Wilfully adolescent , illiterate , tough but vulnerable , wonderfully agile , and ultimately , courageous , she is everybody 's idea of a lady pirate . There wa a definite window of opportunity for her in feisty costume role - that she did not choose to seize it is a matter of some regret .

I had never seen a film by John Cassavetes up until two year ago , when I first saw THE KILLING OF A Chinese BOOKIE in a Berlin cinema , which I found interesting , to put it diplomatically , but not so special , I instantly wanted to see more of his work . Since then , I tried - with an emphasis on tried - watching his other work , SHADOWS in particular . I must admit , it took me a a while before I actually enjoyed the film . At first the unpolished , raw and improvised way Cassavetes it wa shot , put me off somewhat and I thought of it a an original - absolutely - but flawed and dated experiment . But now , upon reviewing , these little imperfection make it look so fresh , even today . Shot on a minimal budget of $ 40,000 with a skeleton six person crew , SHADOWS offer an observation of the tension and life of three sibling in an African-American family in which two of the three sibling , Ben ( Ben Carruthers ) and Lelia ( Lelia Goldoni ) , are light-skinned and able to pas for white . Cassavetes demanded that the actor retain their real name to reflect the actual conflict within the group but saw the film a being concerned with human problem a opposed imply to racial one . Cassavetes shot the film in ten minute take and jagged editing , a reaction against 'seamless ' Hollywood production value . Cassavetes main inspiration - at least in the cinematic style the film wa shot - were the Italian neo-realists whilst also professing admiration for Welles ' pioneering spirit . The use of amateur and improvisation might resemble some of the Italian neo-realist director , but with his bebop score by Charles Mingus an Shafi Hadi , the film feel very different , very American , unlike anything made before really . The song with the feathered girl , `` I feel like a lolly-pop '' ( or something ) feel like light year back to me , ancient history . But no matter how dated it might look , it still make a delightful time capsule of late Fifties New York today . I think it 's this is one of the first film made aspiring filmmaker realize they could shoot an independent film , without Hollywood , improvised and without a real budget . Seymour Cassel , who acted and wa involved in SHADOWS , claim it wa Jules Dassin 's THE NAKED CITY ( 1948 ) that wa the first and inspired them all , but I think this wa the one that really opened the eye of aspiring independent American filmmaker . Camera Obscura -- - 8/10

Based on an actual story , John Boorman show the struggle of an American doctor , whose husband and son were murdered and she wa continually plagued with her loss . A holiday to Burma with her sister seemed like a good idea to get away from it all , but when her passport wa stolen in Rangoon , she could not leave the country with her sister , and wa forced to stay back until she could get I.D . paper from the American embassy . To fill in a day before she could fly out , she took a trip into the countryside with a tour guide . `` I tried finding something in those stone statue , but nothing stirred in me . I wa stone myself . '' Suddenly all hell broke loose and she wa caught in a political revolt . Just when it looked like she had escaped and safely boarded a train , she saw her tour guide get beaten and shot . In a split second she decided to jump from the moving train and try to rescue him , with no thought of herself . Continually her life wa in danger . Here is a woman who demonstrated spontaneous , selfless charity , risking her life to save another . Patricia Arquette is beautiful , and not just to look at ; she ha a beautiful heart . This is an unforgettable story . `` We are taught that suffering is the one promise that life always keep . ''

This PM Entertainment production is laced with enough bullet to make John Woo say , `` Enough already ! '' Of course , it is n't nearly a beautiful a Woo can deliver but it get the exploitive job done in 90 minute . Eric Phillips ( Don Wilson ) is an undercover cop in the near future . When his wife is framed for murdering the Governor by a team using a look-a-like cyborg , it is up to Eric to clear her name . Wilson get to pull Van Damme duty a he play the heroic lead and his evil cyborg doppelganger . Why the Academy failed to take notice is beyond me . Being a PM production , there are ton of car chase , exploding car ( 4 in the first 5 minute ! ) and shoot out . I particularly liked the van that flip in midair before it even come close to touching an exploding truck . My other favorite bit involved a neighborhood girl coming over to perfect her karate in Don 's simulator . It is merely a chance to show off some cheapo LAWNMOWER MAN effect circa 1995 .

SHALLOW GRAVE begin with either a tribute or a rip off of the shower scene in PSYCHO . ( I 'm leaning toward rip off . ) After that it get worse and then surprisingly get better , almost to the point of being original . Bad acting and amateurish directing bog down a fairly interesting little story , but the film already surpasses many in the `` Yankee come down South to get killed by a bunch of redneck '' genre because it is actually shot in the South . A group of college girl head to Ft. Lauderdale for summer vacation and are waylaid in Georgia by a flat tire after getting off the main road . ( Note to Yankees : stay on the highway when you go to Florida . ) Sue Ellen ( Lisa Stahl ) ha to pee so she head into the wood . When she finally find a good spot to do her business she witness the local sheriff ( Tony March ) strangle his mistress ( Merry Rozelle ) to death . ( Note to Yankees : do not wander off into the wood when in the South ; not because you might witness a murder , but you may run across a marijuana plantation . ) This is the point where the story , not the movie , actually come close to being good . While Tony March will never have to practice his Oscar speech , his Sheriff Dean becomes a creepy facsimile of a normal guy torn by what he ha done and what he must do . Tom Law is likable a Deputy Scott and is a authentic a Southern deputy a I 've seen since Walton Goggins ( Deputy Steve Naish ) in HOUSE OF 1000 CORPSES . A few scene in the movie are worth the mention . The girl stop at a BBQ in South Carolina and display their racism when a big black guy check them out . Sue Ellen run into a barn to hide behind some hay bale and in a shockingly realistic moment a large snake is hiding in the hay with her . And in the strangest scene , Sheriff Dean make like he 's about to rape Patty ( Carol Cadby ) and tell her to take off her clothes . Dean ha turned the radio up to drown out the noise of what he 's about to do . The preacher on the radio need to go back and read his Bible . His sermon is about how Jezebel is saved by the blood of Jesus Christ . I feel sorry for this preacher 's flock . Jezebel wa in the Old Testament a few thousand year before Christ wa born and by no mean is she one of the five people you are going to meet in Heaven .

Although this film ha had a lot of praise , I personally found it boring . There are some nice Brasilian sunset and the character are believable , but the story of how they interrelate , even if very unusual by our standard , is not interesting enough to sustain a movie this long . The central woman take up with one man after another in a close knit way and putting the interest of her child first . As the tolerance of the various men is stretched , we see their character develop . The story unfolds with dignity and aided by excellent acting . It is a rare glimpse into the Brasilian hinterland , far from the city , but hardly exciting enough to keep one 's eye open for .

No mention if Ann Rivers Siddons adapted the material for `` The House Next Door '' from her 1970s novel of the same title , or someone else did it . This Lifetime-like movie wa directed by Canadian director Jeff Woolnough . Having read the book a long time ago , we decided to take a chance when the film showed on a cable version of what wa clearly a movie made for television . You know that when the critical moment precede the commercial , which of course , one ca n't find in this version we watched . The film 's star is Lara Flynn Boyle who sport a new look that threw this viewer a curve because of the cosmetic transformation this actress ha gone through . From the new eyebrow to other part of her body , Ms. Boyle is hardly recognizable a Col Kennedy , the character at the center of the mystery . This wa not one of the actress better moment in front of the camera . That go for the rest of the mainly Canadian actor that deserved better . The film ha a feeling of a cross between `` Desperate Houswives '' with `` The Stepford Wives '' and other better known feature , combined with a mild dose of creepiness . The best thing about the movie wa the house which serf a the setting .

Meticulously constructed and perfectly played , To The Ends Of The Earth is a simply astonishing voyage out of our reality and into another age . Based on William Golding 's trilogy , these three 90-minute film chronicle the journey towards both Australia and experience of youthful aristocrat Edmund Talbot ( Benedict Cumberbatch ) aboard an aging man o ' war in the early 19th century a he head for a Government position Down Under . Among the crew and hopeful emigrant sharing his passage are a tempestuous , bullying captain ( Jared Harris ) , a politically radical philosopher ( Sam Neill ) , a canny 1st lieutenant who 's worked his way up from the bottom ( Jamie Sives ) and , fleetingly , the first brush of love in the form of a beautiful young woman ( Joanne Page ) whose ship literally pass in the night . Quite aside from the astonishing degree of physical historic accuracy , director David Attwood and screenwriter Tony Basgallop and Leigh Jackson have a canny eye and ear for the manner and stiff etiquette of an earlier time , crafting a totally convincing microcosm of the Napoleonic era . Shipboard life is one brutal , monotonous round of seasickness , squalor and danger after another and a Edmund becomes entangled in the love , hope and misery of his fellow passenger he experience a delirious whirl of life 's hardship , Man 's inhumanity and his noblest sentiment . Those who enjoyed Master And Commander : The Far Side Of The World or Patrick O'Brian 's series of novel on which it wa based will love this  for everyone else , it 's a whole new world to discover .

Wow . This is really not that good . I would like to agree with the others in that at least the acting is good ... it is , but it is nothing special . The movie is so precictable and i for one am sick of receiving culture info through movie . * / * * * *

I have to point out , before you read this review , that in no way , is this a statement against Iranian people ... if you really want to read something into it , than hopefully you see , that I 'm against politician in general ... but if you 're looking to be offended ... I ca n't help you ! Not in Iran a this movie is banned there ( see IMDb trivia for this movie ) . Which is a shame , because the movie is great . Would it not be for `` Grbavica '' , this movie would have won at the International Film Festival in Berlin . Rightfully so ( it wa the runner-up , or second place if you will ) . Why ? Because it is a movie about oppression . It 's not even that this is a complete woman issue . It is about the government trying to keep the people down . An analogy so clear that the government felt the need to ban the movie . But by banning it nothing is resolved and/or can they make this movie disappear ! Another reviewer had a great summary line : `` Comedy about a tragedy '' , that sum it up pretty well !

I know little or nothing about astronomy , but nevertheless ; I wa , at first , a little sceptical about the plot of this movie . It follows three child that were all born during a solar eclipse and so have no emotion , and thus ( naturally ) become ruthless serial killer . The plot doe sound ridiculous at first , but once you realise that a solar eclipse block out Saturn and , a you know , Saturn is the emotion planet , it all fall into place ; make complete sense and it 's then that you know you are n't simply watching another silly 80 's slasher with a pea brain plot . Thank god for that ! Seriously , though , Bloody Birthday is based on a ridiculous premise , but it more than make up for that with it 's originality . Having a bunch of kid going round slaughtering people may not be the most ingenious masterstroke ever seen in cinema , but when given the choice between this and another dull Friday the 13th clone - I know what I 'd choose . Also helping the film out of the hole that some people would think it 's silly plot dug it into is the fact that it 's extremely entertaining . Many slasher become formulaic far too quickly and the audience end up watching simply to see some gore . This film , however , keep itself going with some great creepy performance from the kid ( which harks back to creepy kid classic such a Village of the Damned ) , a constant stream of sick humour and a small , but impressive for the type of film , dose of suspense and tension . One thing that I liked a lot about this movie wa the vast array of weaponry . There 's nothing worse than a slasher where the killer us the same weapon over and over again ( cough Halloween cough ) , but that 's not the case here a Bloody Birthday find room for everything from skipping rope to bow and arrow . There wa n't any room for a chainsaw , which is a huge shame , but I suppose not every film can have a chainsaw in it .

After many , many year I saw again this beautiful love story , thinking about how would I , half a century after , react to a film which made so many girl cry and sigh at that time , when I wa just an male adolescent trying to understand woman 's behavior , in a small city in Brazil . This time , however , what caught my attention in the film wa something very different , namely the insistence with which the physician Dr. Han Suyin ( Jennifer Jones ) make clear to the journalist Mark Elliott ( William Holden ) her special ethically condition a an Eurasian . In fact , she is constantly putting emphasis on this point in their relationship , repeating she is willing to assume her love for him and carry it on in a `` occidental way '' , provided that , by doing so , she is not betraying her Chinese side . Its seems to the spectator that Suyin is eagerly making effort to establish a very subtle conciliation between those two unstable and opposite aspect of her culture , for they will immediately engage in overt conflict in her mind at a minimum failure in her attempt to control them . Therefore , Suyin 's attitude always leave poor Elliott  a determined , brave and extremely practical man  anxious and perplexed , without knowing how much importance to give to her word . For him , whose love for her is plain and simple , the situation is totally clear : if we love each other , let u make a couple and begin immediately a life together . `` Not so fast '' , is what she seems , verbally and non-verbally , to answer him all the time . In fact , Suyin 's Chinese portion would never allow her such a level of pragmatism . And , a she go on and on reinforcing this much aimed equilibrium between those two world inside herself , she also frequently signal to him that also a very peculiar trait of Chinese culture is deeply rooted in her mind , namely the constant `` raid '' on the real world by invisible being from an spiritual or non-physical world . For Suyin is always alerting Elliott about how dangerous is life , not because of any objective and concrete threat ( a would be the perpetuation of the English colonialism or the eminence of a Japanese invasion ) , but due to the threat of plenty of cruel and harmful god and other mystical and mythical being over the poor , fearful and vulnerable human being . In fact , it look like a whole bunch of Chinese deity are permanently on the watch to make people 's life totally miserable . Because of that , mother must dress their precious male baby in girl clothes , so that they are not taken away by jealous god ; everyone should always be ready to make loud noise to send the cloud away , in order to avoid their covering the sight of the moon ; peasant are advised that they should shout loudly `` The rice is bad ! The rice is bad ! '' to protect their crop from being stolen by deity ; and , in a funeral , it is recommended that the dead 's family be isolated from the other people by curtain , so that the god do n't take advantage of their sorrow and fragility . In other word , Suyin introduces u to a culture in which the supernatural ha a real existence , a if a rather disturbing pantheon of malign and sadistic god are always on the verge of negatively interfering with the most banal act in anyone 's daily life . As the story take place in Hong Kong in 1949 , it should be clear that China really wa , at that time , almost a semi-feudal society , while the country from which Elliott had come from wa not yet dominated by the fierce capitalism that , launched by the USA after the first oil shock in 1973 , took charge of the whole world . Therefore , at least in one aspect , both side of Suyin 's Eurasian personality were still much more innocent than they would be today . A lot of History came into being since those old day . As to China , the main fact is that , after several phase of a communist regime , the country finally reached , in the last two decade , the condition of a very aggressive economy much more properly described a State capitalism . And , what happened to that old spirituality that so much enthralled Suyin in Hong Kong , in 1949 , and with which she used to impress so much an impassioned Elliott , under that tree on the hill behind the hospital ? It is gone , completely gone ! In brief , if that story took place today , Elliott would not find it necessary to go to China to propose to Suyin in the presence of the Third Uncle and her entire family . In fact , both men would now be incomparably closer to one another , in their huge pragmatism , talking business a usual !

First and foremost I would like to say , that before i watched this film i considered myself an accepting individual . Someone that cared about others , appreciated others , found no/barely any judgment against other people , and this film ha ( i think ) changed my life or viewpoint dramatically . When i watched it , I did n't know particularly what it wa about , i knew it wa about some type of forbidden relationship , but other then that I wa clueless , and a I began to see what wa taking place between these two wonderfully depicted character , i wa in shock , disbelief , confusion and surprise . The first time i watched it , i wa blind . Blind to their love , to their intimacy , to their connection , to their pureness a human being , to their relationship . I watched it a second time , because i finally figured out how hypocritical I wa being , saying to myself and others , `` Oh i accept all type of people , and try not to judge them '' while still judging this wonderful and amazingly insightful story , because of my fear I suppose . The second time I watched this film , I opened those eye of mine that had stayed closed the first time , and really looked , not at the type of taboo relationship part that I 'd heard about all my life , but simply at two human being in love . And I loved it , i loved the storyline , i loved the slightly broken yet strong individual people in the film , i loved the sharing of feeling , and i loved the strong bond created . It is a really eye opening , beautifully done film that made me cry at time , and I hope that people who read this and are going to watch the film eventually , remember that everyone deserves love , no matter what shape or form it is presented in ....

`` ZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZ '' ! If IMDb would allow one-word review , that 's what mine would be . This film wa originally intended only for kid and it would seem to be very tough going for adult or older kid to watch the film . The singing , the story , everything is dull and washed out -- just like this public domain print . Like other comedy team film with root in traditional kid story ( such a the awful SNOW WHITE AND THE THREE STOOGES and the overrated BABES IN TOYLAND ) , this movie ha limited appeal and just doe n't age well . Now that I think about it , I seriously doubt that many kid nowadays would even find this film enjoyable ! So my advice is DO N'T watch this film . If you MUST watch an Abbott and Costello film , almost any other one of their film ( except for A & C GO TO MARS ) would be an improvement .

Once in a while , a movie will sweep along that stuns you , draw you in , awe you , and , in the end , leaf you with a renewed belief in the human race from the artistry form . This is not it . This is an action movie that lack convincing action . It stink . Rent something else .

Hard to imagine this film is based on a true story , and how Christy managed to accomplish the miracle is so heart-stirring . Daniel Day-Lewis is a chameleon , really hard to imagine how much effort he had done to create this disabled character . Watching him on screen is a shocking and breathtaking experience . The movie is not so pessimistic a I thought before , the story is kinda bright and intriguing . Christy is not despised by the normal , his life is also colorful and delightful , although we can be aware of the loneliness and the painful fetter through his eye . One important factor of Christy 's success is his mother 's support which seems to be more touching , and the unknown actress Brenda Fricker also deserves her Oscar award for this role , this fat little middle-aged woman us her all to make Christy 's dream come true . So lucky for Christy ! And Hugh O'Conor is also excellent a young Christy , what a performance for a child ! The love story of Christy is very well-done , trustful . Christy want love and nothing can derive him of the right to love , his crush on the beautiful Dr. Eileen Cole ( surprisingly played by Fiona Shaw , I am deeply impressed with her role in Harry Potter series , the loathsome Aunt Petunia , so her appearance in this role is really beyond my mind , but anyway , any woman ha her own youth ... ) is paranoiac and offensive , I do have sympathy for him , love is a two-edged sword , happiness and agony are just next to each other . Btw , Jim Sheridan 's work are all good ( IN America , THE BOXER etc . ) except GET RICH OR DIE Trying ' , god know why he chose to direct that crap ! Really a career taint for him , what a pity !

I 'm stunned that the reviewer @ IMDb gave this TV film a a high a rating a they did . It 's an innocuous , sweet , uncomplicated cliché ' of a film that had two big name from the past in it ( both of whom did a decent job ) , but this film reek of the low budget work we can see any day of week on the lesser cable channel . I like a good romance a well a anyone , but a my wife and I were watching this -- and before we saw the rating-we said , `` There are people who are going to rate this film too highly simply because there 's nothing in it to challenge their brain , their faith , their comfort level or their cultural preference . It 's possible to make a good film like that ( and Away from Her is an example ) , but this wa amateur hour . There are some quite good film rated much lower than this one . Truly , another in a long line of woefully inadequate holiday film . Watch The Family Stone . It 's mile ahead of this schlock .

Do a title search on Randolph Scott and TRAIL STREET is the one film missing from the list you 've seen . One of 4 film Scott made at RKO during his prime ( 1947 ) the others are always easy to get . Liberal , Kansas is just southwest of Dodge City and is a powder-keg about to explode between the trail-riders who drive the longhorn into Trail Street , the town 's main street , and the sod-busters who feed our belly . It 'll take a strong man like Bat Masterson to step between the two group and bring the town to order . More I wo n't say , except that Scott movie usually have just one pretty girl and this one ha three . RANDOLPH SCOTT always played men you could look up to for their sense of honor , courage , level-headedness and willingness to do the right thing . Fifty year ago parent could send their kid to a Scott movie with confidence they 'd learn positive value . ROBERT RYAN co-star in this film , playing a good guy for a change . In real life , RYAN wa one of the many WORLD WAR II HEROS who starred in America 's movie . How sad what we get these day . George Clooney teach our young that we ought sympathize with suicide bomber , while Steven Spielberg teach there is no moral difference between the Olympic athlete murdered in 1972 in Munich and the Palestinian terrorist who killed them . Hollywood 2005 derives their moral compass from too much cocaine and too much commitment to the wacky left . I wonder how all this play out in Liberal , Kansas . Liberal , after all , wa not a dirty word 150 year ago when the city wa named .

I went to see this one with much expectation . Quite unfortunately the dialogue is utterly stupid and overall the movie is far from inspiring awe or interest . Even a child can see the missing logic to character 's behavior . Today 's kid need creative story which would inspire them , which would make them 'daydream ' about the event . That 's precisely what happened with movie like E.T . and Star Wars a decade ago . ( How many kid imagined about becoming Jedi Knights and igniting their own lightsabers ? ) Seriously do n't waste your time & money on this one .

* Sigh * Leave it to u Finns to take a stupid idea , blow it out of proportion and try to market it a cool . Lordi is a mediocre band at best , and a single gimmick will get you only so far . To all you marketing idiot out there : this is the reason for the inherent minority complex that is often encountered when Finland try to export something . Lordi is n't scary . Lordi is lame . Lordi is OVER . I want to apologize to the rest of the world for this plastic-faced idiocy . Sure , they won the Eurovision . No , wait - they won the Eurovision . That 's it . I rest my case .

I saw this movie in a theater while on vacation in Pablo CO . I had just quit my biomedical engineering job at a hospital . The film 's design seems to be the alpha and omega of some of the major issue in this country ( U.S. ) . We see relationship all over at the university setting for the film . Befittingly , the obvious of student v.s . teacher is present . But what the film add to it value is it other relationship : male v.s . female , white v.s . black , and the individual v.s . society . But most important of all and in direct relation to all of the other relationship is the individual v.s . himself . I wa amazed at how bilateral a point of view the director gave to showing the race relation on campus . Most film typically show the injustice of one side while showing the suffering of the other . This film showed the injustice and suffering of both side . It did not attempt to show how either wa right , although I would say the skin head were shown a much crueler and vindictive ( quite obvious towards the end ) . The film also discus sex and rape . It is ironically this injustice that in some way brings the two race together , for a time . Lawrence Fishburne doe an over-the-top performance a the sagacious Profesor Phipps . He crumbles the idea of race favortism and instead show the parallelism of the lazy and down-trodden with the industrious and positive . Other star that make this film are Omar Epps , Ice Cube , and Jennifer Connelly . Michael Rapaport give an excellent portrayal of a confused youth with misplaced anger who is looking for acceptance . Tyra Banks make her film debut and prof supermodel can act . Higher Learning get it name in showing college a more than going to class and getting a piece of paper . In fact , I would say the film is almost a satire in showing student interaction with each other , rather than some dry book , a the real education at a university . It is a life-learning process , not a textual one . I think you 'll find `` Higher Learning '' is apropos to the important issue at many university and even life in general . 8/10

Is rich , ailing Elizabeth Taylor courting the Angel of Death on her island fortress in the Mediterranean , or is she just overreacting -- or more precisely , overacting -- a usual ? Actually , both are applicable in director Joseph Losey 's wandering , meandering mess called `` Boom '' , appropriately titled since temper in the lush , luxurious setting are nearly ready to explode . Richard Burton climb Taylor 's mountain uninvited ; she dress him in a samurai 's robe complete with saber . Though great-looking in widescreen , the picture is otherwise quite deadly , a failure even Liz 'n Dick-philes should shun ( the star ' collective `` what the hell ! '' attitude to their late-'60s film career reached an ego-mad nadir here ) . Pointless , confused , and maddening , `` Boom '' is a catastrophe -- although screenwriter Tennessee Williams , who adapted his own unsuccessful play `` The Milk Train Does n't Stop Here Anymore '' , wa said to be quite fond of it ! * from * * * *

The screenplay is the worst part of this film , a it lurch from one premise to the next , missing all the important bit that would have made a number of different story possible . ( This film is confusing , because the audience doe n't know what the story is . ) I had no problem with the low-production value and the acting wa n't great , but this is telly , so it wa fine . I do n't mind if some scene looked like they were done in one take . But having such a non-sensical screenplay is completely unnecessary . Did any executive actually read it before forking out the cash ? Avoid this at all cost . The prologue in particular wa so poorly written , it needed a voice-over to fill in all the detail that had been left out . The prologue wa rushed , it wa n't clear what wa happening , ie . The Russian Revolution wa reduced to `` Some riot are happening in Petersburg '' , with the next scene being soldier arresting them . I know the basic history of the Revolution , so I could fill in the detail , `` those pesky Communists '' . The prologue is best ignored . This could have been a thoughtful study of a person who is confused about who she is . It set up this premise in the asylum . It could then have her struggling to identify herself for the rest of the film . No . Gone . The film assumes she is who she say she is ( even though there is still no empirical evidence . ) It set up a melodramatic romance , a love so strong , it 'll believe anything she say . Okay , a soppy romance . No , because it make no sense . The love interest seems like a crazed ( and incidentally , sleazy ) lunatic , bursting out in wild gesture . This also doe n't work , because the film stupidly decides to tell the truth in the monologue at the end . They never got married and she returned to America . The love story collapse . Despite there being plenty of love scene , I wa never convinced of the reason that they were in love . I find rom-com romance more convincing , despite there only being one or two scene which establish that they 've even spent any time with each other . It could have been a thriller-type thing where the film assumes she is who she say she is , and she struggle to prove her identity . No , the court case is summed up rather than dealt with . The bizarre voice over come back , again to fill in the detail of a better film . The funniest thing to consider is what really happened . Anna Anderson wa a loony who went to America and married another loony and they did crazy thing together . Throughout her life , she had bout of lunatic behaviour . None of this in the film either . There 's a really annoying character in the asylum who crop up from nowhere and announces herself a a 'One Flew Over the Cuckoo 's Next/'Twelve Monkeys'-type informant . Thankfully , she vanishes , having brought nothing to the story .

Wow , what 's this on the video rental store 's shelf in front of me ? Nothing other than a questionable `` sequel '' to 8MM . It wa n't a very good sequel to a movie that had a very definitive end and an abundance of emotional depth far greater than this movie . Basically , from the plot outline verbatim , an American diplomat , David Huxley , and his fiancée , Tish Harrington , venture into the sordid underworld of sex and pornography in Budapest , Hungary to find out who is blackmailing them with a porno video taken of them with a prostitute , Risa . The entire story is based around the various character who make up these various sex club and strip joint throughout the city . The mystery is solved when , in the end , Tish find out that the ransom money for the video and ( essentially later on in the story ) her fiancée which came out of her trust fund money is basically going back to her future husband a the story unfolds til the bitter end . I did n't like how this had nothing to do with the original 8MM at all . The only thing close to the original is the type of thriller that it wa , the fact that David end up with some kind of bondage contraption over him to keep him prisoner look like the kinky world of the first film , and the fact that the entire movie ha sex emblazoned throughout almost every key scene . Otherwise , it a totally different movie . It made for a lousy love story , even before the end is known , which make the ending more of a possibility because I did n't believe the word coming out of David 's mouth the whole time . But we were warned that he wa a liar about most thing that might get him in trouble . There were ridiculous nude scene in most of the `` shocking '' moment of the film , which were trying to stir emotion in the audience to cheer for Tish to figure out the plot so she can leave this `` hellish '' sex debauchery . I counted at least 11 ridiculously filmed sequence when there wa nothing but sex to be shown . Even the menu screen on the DVD is nothing but film with naked woman on it to make the DVD seem totally provocative . David wa no heroic person throughout the film . You could guess he wa the main problem long before the end . The actor who played each role were all new to me , which might explain how they got so many of them to strip down to gain acting `` respect . '' There were plot hole ( How did David and Richard finally impress Tish 's father by getting the lease they wanted when David wa so wrapped up in this damn investigation to try and find a prostitute ? ) There were cheesy technology moment ( like the talking email program dressed up like a bondage queen ) , and a gay brother character which did nothing but show how the director wa trying to get a Joaquin Phoenix knockoff to play this character . The tag line featured on this profile for this video is complete BS , too , because it wa n't even about a last breath . Nobody really dy . But they did have a good car crash sequence that came out of nowhere ... but that wa a good 10 second long out of an hour and 3/4 long movie . Go rent ( and maybe buy ) the original . It 's one of Joel Schumacher 's better and more original film . It ha everything better about it from this film . I would n't recommend seeing this unless you want to compare apple to orange .

This episode had potential . The basic premise of a woman living next door to an empty apartment ( but a phone that constantly ring ) is somewhat interesting . And when she explores the noise , there is genuine tension and fear . But stupid script writing ruin any promise the episode had . First of all , the woman readily admits to seeing thing that would send most of u running in the other direction ( e.g . `` It 's funny that the door slammed shut even though there is no wind ; '' `` This door ha serious damage to it that wa n't here a minute ago ; '' `` The door opened by itself , without me touching it ; '' etc. ) . Given these supernatural phenomenon , plus the fact that a woman committed suicide in the room , would n't she take some precaution before entering it ? Maybe she could investigate in the day time . Or maybe she could investigate the apartment with somebody else . Or maybe she could TURN ON THE LIGHTS ! ! ! Also , while in the haunted apartment , she decides to make numerous phone call to the operator and get into an argument over who ha the power to disconnect the phone , and then they begin discussing the detail of the suicide . JUST UNPLUG THE PHONE ! The phone company doe n't need to be involved . Walk up to the phone and unplug it . Case closed . Finally , showing the phone scamper across the floor like it 's alive wa just comical . If the director wanted the woman to get strangled by the phone card , he could 've done it in a way that did n't look cartoony . Brave Little Toaster anyone ?

The quality of this movie is simply unmatched by any baseball title of it time . Pam Dixon branch out in the film industry to recruit blue-chip prospect and make this work of art a must-see . Academy Award winner Brenda Fricker ( Home Alone : Lost in New York , A Time to Kill ) , Ben Johnson ( The Last Picture Show , Red Dawn ) , and Adrien Brody ( The Pianist , The Village ) amplify the atmosphere of the movie , drawing in an anxious audience . However , the dramatic performance are neutralized by quirky radio broadcaster Jay O. Sanders ( JFK , The Day After Tomorrow ) . The story is centralized around a foster child , up-and-coming actor Joseph Gordon-Levitt ( Brick , The Lookout ) . Sidekick Milton Davis Jr. delivers a tear-jerking performance a the longtime friend who never knew his parent . The two do n't have much , but what they do have : Angels ' baseball , and what they are seeking : identity . That 's when 4-time Emmy Nominee Danny Glover ( Lethal Weapon , Predator 2 ) come in to save the day a frustrated Angels Manager , George Knox . In relation , all character in the story seem to have the same mission : search within themselves to find out who they really are . Depressed over the fact that Roger ( JGL ) is separated from his father , he wish to God for reunification if the Angels can take the pennant . Odds are astronomical , but 3-time Emmy winner Christopher Lloyd ( Back to the Future , My Favorite Martian ) come in a the omniscient overseer to work a little magic ( pun ) . Before you know it , Al ( Lloyd ) is sitting with Roger in the stand , snacking on cracker jack , and causing some of baseball 's biggest boner ! Dorothy Kingsley and George Wells ' ( DK Oscar Nominee GW Oscar Winner ) 1951 screenplay is done justice under the finger of mastermind William Dear ( nominated in Directors Guild of America ) . He includes a touching side story centered around pitcher Mel Clark , played by Tony Danza ( 4-time Golden Globe nominee , Emmy nominee ) , who in relation to all other cast member is just trying to find his place in a confused Anaheim . Clark ha been dubbed a wash-up , a once big-name in Cinci , but he ha something to prove to Manager Knox . Spoiling this nail-biting plot would simply be the equivalent to committing adultery in the 18th century . This one is a diamond in the rough , and it will keep you on the edge of the seat until all come to peace . Did I mention a cameo by Matthew McConaughey ( A Time to Kill , We Are Marshall ) for all you lady out there ?

If somebody want to make a really , REALLY bad movie , `` Wizards of the Lost Kingdom '' really set a yardstick by which to measure the depth of badness . Some poor schmuck in a baggy white `` furry '' costume that look a if it wa stitched together from discarded piece of carpeting . A film for mature , educated audience ... I saw `` Random Hearts '' in an advance screening shortly before it North American release . This romantic drama wa quite a treat . I 'm sure this story will not be everyone 's cup of tea , especially considering the film 's darkly downbeat premise . But the pic ha some very uplifting strong point in it favor . All-time Box Office Draw Harrison Ford ( `` Star Wars , '' `` Raiders of the Lost Ark , '' `` The Fugitive , '' `` Air Force One , '' `` Patriot Games '' ) is at the top of his game a the harried and desperate Internal Affairs officer , Dutch . Ford 's very subdued , nuanced performance show quite the range he can achieve with class and determination in bringing the audience into his world of loss & betrayal . This is the perfect complex role and very different type of film for Harrison Ford to grace the screen with between his action blockbuster . Next year Harrison Ford return to action , first for director Robert Zemeckis ( `` Forrest Gump , '' `` Back To The Future '' ) in his summer 2000 thriller , `` What Lies Beneath , '' and reportedly later in the year in the film adaptation of Tom Clancy 's `` The Sum Of All Fears . '' 'Fears ' will be Harrison Ford 's third outing a CIA operative Jack Ryan . Director Sydney Pollack ( `` Out of Africa , '' `` The Firm , '' `` Tootsie '' ) ha a supporting role in this feature a a political advisor to Scott-Thomas ' congresswoman . It 's a very sharp & energetic portrayal for Pollack . Not only is Sydney Pollack a gifted director , he is also one of the most believable , natural and charming actor around ( see `` Eyes Wide Shut '' a well ) . Kristin Scott-Thomas ( `` The English Patient , '' `` The Horse Whisperer '' ) show that you do n't necessarily have to be eccentric or worldly to be considered sexy . This is one of her better film , and she give a tremendously crafted and mellowed performance that work well opposite Ford 's quiet-man toughness . The subplots work wonderfully , especially the subplot involving Ford 's character 's investigation into police corruption . Look for a chilling & effective turn by `` Heat '' actor , Dennis Haysbert , who play Detective George Beaufort , the obstacle to overcome in Dutch 's investigation into police corruption . The rest of the supporting cast is a wonderful delight . Charles S. Dutton ( whose long overdue for a film leading role ) go to show that he is one of the best character-actors around , and Bonnie Hunt , who I find extremely solid in this production , steal most of her scene with that wonderful , charming smile a Wendy Judd . The technical side of Pollack 's thriller is top notched . From Dave Grusin 's ( Pollack 's `` The Firm '' ) perfectly surreal-feeling jazzy score , to Philippe Rousselot ( `` A River Runs Through It '' ) crisp photography , to the sharp editing that keep the film feeling fresh , despite the film 's unfortunate downer premise . I highly recommend this film to anyone who enjoys a good yarn of mystery , well-paced plot , character-driven story , and romance all rolled into one . This is a terrific story about betrayal & forgiveness . It also feature one of the most surprising , yet poignant , and certain to be controversial ending for a Harrison Ford film in recent time . `` Random Hearts '' is definitely one of the better film of the year . ( * * * 1/2 out of * * * * ) or ( 8.5 out of 10.0 )

For all of the Has-Beens or Never Was 's or for the curious , this film is for you .... Ever played a sport , or wondered what it felt like after the light went down and the crowd left .. this film explores that and more . Robin Williams ( Jack Dundee ) is a small town assistant banker in Taft CA. , whose life ha been plagued , by a miscue in a BIG rival high school football game 13 year ago , when he dropped the pas that would have won over Bakersfield , their Arch-Rival , that take great pleasure in pounding the Taft Rockets , season after season . Kurt Russell ( Reno Hightower ) wa the Quarterback in that famous game , and is the local legend , that now is a van repair specialist , whose life is fading into lethargy , like the town of Taft itself . Williams get an idea to remake history , by replaying the GAME ! He meet with skeptical resistance , so he go on a one man terror spree , and literally paint the town , orange , yellow and black , to raise the ire of the resident to recreate THE game . After succeeding , the player from that 1972 team reunite , and try to get in shape to practice , which is hysterical . The game is on , Bakesfield is loaded with all of the high tech gadget , game strategy , and sophisticated training routine . Taft is drawing play in the mud , with stick , stone , and bottle cap , what a riot ! Does Taft overcome the odds , doe Robin Willians purge the demon from his bowel , doe Kurt Russell rise from lethargy , watch `` The Best of Times '' for one of the BEST viewing experience ever ! One of Robin Williams best UNDERSTATED performance , the chemistry between Robin and Russell is magic . And who is Kid Lester ? ? ? Holly Palance and Pamela Reed give memorable performance a the wife of Williams and Russell . Succeeds on Many Levels . A 10 !

I first remember bumping into this zaniness from the Zucker brother and Jim Abrahams , back in the early day at Comedy Central . Back in those day ( the 90 's ) their programming consisted of Benny Hill rerun and the original MST3k , complete with bearded host . Capt . Frank Drebin ( played by the stone-faced , dead-pan filibuster , Leslie Nielson ) is a process created first from the amalgamation of various stereotypical police television show protagonist ( think Dragnet meet Starsky & Hutch the Show ) , boiled in a flask full of well-known police television show plot and scenario . This is distilled , 3 time to produce the most pure policeman every made . Forget about Simon Pegg in Hot Fuzz ( for now . save it for later ) . Frank Drebin is clueless at most time , a terrible driver , a terrible shot , macho yet sensitive and vulnerable . He is a master of the police investigative methodology ( a.k.a - ask Johnny the Leathery Old Shoe-Shine Boy ) . This doe not make him a bad cop . Cops get lucky also . Capt Drebin ( notice he 's a Captain here ) ha perfected it . Along with his partner , Nordberg , and the rest of force , perfectly parody the police drama over the course of 6 golden episode . The show is a treasure trove of hilarious dialog and quotable quote-ables . Most of the sight gag are a bit dated and silly . The magic never came from the sight gag , however . At it core wa a nonsensical and straight-faced conversation and activity in the foreground , with crazy thing occurring in the background . The movie can best be described a 90 minute compilation of the best gag from this series . Think of Monty Python 's And Now For Something Completely Different ..... If you liked Airplane 1 & 2 , Naked Gun 1,2,3 , or Top Secret , then you will definitely enjoy this . I always liked the series better than the movie , even though I saw the movie first . Why ? 2 word : No O.J .

A guy desperate for action attempt to hit on a gorgeous girl in a bus . She refuse him , but when he run after someone who try to steal her purse they get together anyway . And there it start - a relation that is slightly tainted by the fact that she is a jealous and neurotic superhero . It ca n't be a secret that thing between them are going to be problematic . In short , a story that could promise to grow out into a cool film . And IMO , it succeeds at being a nice film . It 's no masterpiece , but it had me in tear from laughing on more than one occasion - the two lead character twirl around each other in a crazy love fest that is , even with the superhero thing going , believable . So . Thin story , but worked out really funny and thus worthy of cinema time . 7 out of 10 broken heart

The film someone had to make . Waco : The Rules of Engagement dissects the evidence behind the standoff in Waco , Texas that led to the destruction of the Branch Davidian homestead and the alleged government cover-up . The first thing you need to know about this film : you will see brief but disturbing photo of the victim body . This is not done for shock value , but to illustrate point about the way they died , a if you were present at the coroner 's inquest . The second thing you should know about this film : at two and a quarter hour , it 's pretty ponderous - especially if you already followed the event closely at the time . If you are unaware of any of the event other than what wa reported in the mass medium , or if the only side of the story you are familiar with is the official government report , this may be essential viewing . If , on the other hand you want a more concise ( albeit unapologetically one sided ) version of event , you should see `` Waco : The Big Lie '' . In summary , this is pretty much the definitive documentary about this tragic event , and is very sobering , but a a work of film-making , could test your patience , especially if you have a short attention span . And it 's at time superfluous for those who watched the CSPAN hearing and the 60 Minutes report . Perhaps someday someone will make a documentary that cover some of the stranger aspect of this story , such a the bizarre chain of event that led up to the ATF raid or the psychological warfare tactic the FBI used blasting rock music at the sect , and their charismatic leader ( all rock musician themselves ) picking up their instrument and turning their massive amplifier outward to blast their own music right back at them .

What a good movie ! At last a picture revealing a unknown side of rock : illusion of fame . Well-known Rockers are getting old and forgotten , not the music . And with a good sense of humour . Have you ever danced on Bill Haley 's Rock Around the Clock ? Anyway , Still Crazy is probably the best movie about rock n'roll I have ever seen . Far much better than Spinal Tap for instance . Why ? Because in Still Crazy , people are mature . They have a different point of view about rock , about love and about life . They want to catch up with their crazy youth they miss so much . Beyond the story itself , we see character with their own personality , weakness and dream . Like anyone of u . Spend a good time watching this ( listen to the awesome soundtrack ! ) and finally thinking of your own future . Bye !

Had it with the one who raised you since when you were young ? You just want her gone from your life ? That woman is your mother . You should respect her , you should honor her , whether she 's in sick or well . But that in time , it can be aggravating . Especially when she becomes very overbearing . That 's how Owen ( Danny DeVito ) had to deal with in `` Throw Momma Fron The Train '' . His Momma ( Anne Ramsey , 1929-88 ) , is one of the worst . He trying his best to be a writer , and she is everything but grateful . Calls him a `` clumsy poop '' , a `` larda $ $ '' , and `` fat '' and `` stupid '' . For his friend , Larry Donner ( Billy Crystal ) he ha his own woman problem , his ex-wife . She trying to discredit him . So what did Owen do ? Push her overboard . What doe he do ? Help return the favor , get rid of Mrs . Lift ! In the kitchen scene , I liked it where Owen called Larry , `` Cousin Patty '' . And Momma said , `` You do n't have a Cousin Patty ! '' and Owen shout `` You Lied To Me ! '' and El Cabongs Larry with the frying pan . Then come the fun part when they where on the train and try to kill Momma Lift . That is thwarted , and she kick Larry off the train . Well , everything back to normal , the ex-wife life , but Momma kicked the bucket on her own . Maybe she should have seen the error of her domineering way . A fun movie it is , and the cast is great . A classic ! 5 star !

Yes , it is a bit cheesy . It 's interesting to see David Soul in a 'bad guy ' role ; I thought he wa quite believable -- and rather chilling -- a the ever-more-paranoid CO. Robert Conrad is a long-time favorite -- I think he brings his character to life very well ; and Sam Waterston ha been star quality in everything of his I 've watched -- movie or TV . I watch this movie every so often but our tape ( a VHS TV copy I got ) is such poor quality it 's difficult to fully enjoy it . This is a movie I think they should put out on DVD ; maybe it would n't be universally sought after , but I 'm sure there are lot of people like me out there who like this sort of film so there WOULD be a market for a DVD version . I 'll keep hoping !

So it is n't an epic , but for people experiencing anything similar ( sibling suicide ) it might be an interesting way of therapy . An imaginative narrative and some fine acting make it time well spent . For some reason , it ha n't really caught on in the audience , something I do believe is a result of the main theme . Why did she commit suicide ? Clearly , this is hardly something that US moviegoer will flock to , had it been an European production it probably would have reached it audience in a much greater extent . It is however , a movie that although the realism tainted by a shimmering romanticized glow , give the viewer a whole hearted impression .

I absolutely loved this film ! I wa hesitant to watch it at first because I thought it would be too painful . I remember how hard it wa when John wa shot . However , watching the `` Two of Us '' took me back to a happier time when he wa still alive and there wa hope and possibility . I think that the writer did an amazing job depicting what `` might have been . '' Aidan Quinn wa adorable a Paul and met the challenge head on . I wa impressed with his accent and mannerism . Jared Harris is also very talented and wa quite believable a John . My favorite part were the scene in the park and the rooftop scene - which wa so poignant . The film left me with both sadness and satisfaction , both of which I feel are appropriate , given the circumstance .

Previous reviewer Claudio Carvalho gave a much better recap of the film 's plot detail than I could . What I recall mostly is that it wa just so beautiful , in every sense - emotionally , visually , editorially - just gorgeous . If you like movie that are wonderful to look at , and also have emotional content to which that beauty is relevant , I think you will be glad to have seen this extraordinary and unusual work of art . On a scale of 1 to 10 , I 'd give it about an 8.75 . The only reason I shy away from 9 is that it is a mood piece . If you are in the mood for a really artistic , very romantic film , then it 's a 10 . I definitely think it 's a must-see , but none of u can be in that mood all the time , so , overall , 8.75 .

I had two reason for watching this swashbuckler when it aired on Danish television yesterday . First of all , I wanted to see Gina Lollobrigida - and here I wa n't disappointed . She looked gorgeous . Second of all , through reading about the film I had gotten the impression that it featured absurd humor not unlike that which can be found in Philippe de Broca 's film . On this account , however , I wa sadly disappointed . I found the joke predictable ( apart from a few witty remark on the topic of war ) and the character completely one-dimensional . Also , the action scene were done in a strangely mechanical and uninspired fashion , with no sense of drama at all . I kept watching until the end , but I got bored very quickly and just sat there , waiting for the scene with Lollobrigida .

This wa my first Gaspar Noe movie I 've watched and I have to say I wa shocked . I do n't mind gore in generally , but this is n't even gore , it 's real butchering . For some of you a couple of scene may be impossible to see and I mean really disgusting . Leaving aside these aspect , the main idea revealed here and the dialog are quite brilliant . When you are given a strong argument against bringing a new life into the world and the manner in which it is given , you ca n't stop and take a minute to think about it . The actor did their job well , representing general mask of a handpick few people found at the bottom of a diseased society . The movie is full of metaphor , but I 'll let you figure them out . Do n't watch it if you want to have a lite , relaxing time . I recommend this movie to all those of you who want something to think about or simply watch something different of what you find in your average cinema .

I agree with BigAlC - this movie actually prepared me for a lot of the cultural difference and practice before I went to live in Japan for a year in 1993 . Tom Selleck doe a fantastic job here , a always , and the movie is greatly humorous and educational . I 'm a big fan of Tom Selleck 's , and he blesses this part with his usual charm and charisma to this part , bringing the film to life in a way I ca n't imagine any other actor being able to pull off . This film featured some first-rate Japanese actor , and it wa highly entertaining to watch them a they interacted with Selleck - I can imagine the fun he had during the actual filming of the movie - Japan 's an awesome place to go , whether you want to party , sight-see or just try to take everything in .

I laughed so hard during this movie my face hurt . Ben Affleck wa hilarious and reminded me of a pretty boy Jack Black in this role . Gandolfini give his typical A performance . The entire cast is funny , the story pretty good and the comic moment awesome . I went into this movie not expecting much so perhaps that is why I wa so surprised to come out of the flick thoroughly pleased and facially exhausted . I would recommend this movie to anyone who enjoys comedy , can identify with loneliness during the holiday and/or putting up with the relative . The best part to this film ( to me anyway ) were the subtle bit of humor that caught me completely off guard and had me laughing long after the rest of the audience had stopped . Namely , the scene involving the lighting of the Christmas tree . Go see it and have a good laugh !

Although I lived in Australia in 1975 , I moved overseas not long after , fed up with constant industrial unrest , the general worship of mediocrity - unless one is a sportsman ! - and the complacency of so many Australians who chose to ignore the breakneck pace of change taking place in country to their north . Consequently I missed The Dismissal , along with many other Australian-made TV drama of the '80s and '90s , such a the superb Janus and Phoenix series , which I have since seen , along with Wildside . To me the filmed story of The Dismissal is fair and , a far a I am aware , accurate . However , a to public `` outrage '' it only show one side of the picture , not how family were riven by the controversy . I know , a my two brother would not speak to me for month afterward . But the commentary is , in my view , very one-sided throughout . The inescapable fact is that , notwithstanding fiery expression of rage from a substantial proportion of the community , the Australian electorate chose - and chose decisively - in favour of Fraser , a they did again two year later . This apart , a historically accurate and superbly well acted docudrama .

If I could ask him one question , it would be , '' If you were a hot-dog , would you eat yourself ? '' Will Orhan be doing a reunion tour ? Take note from the great like Gordon Lightfoot , true music from the heart never fade away . Vive La John Denver . Gracias my friend , O.F.F.L . ( Orhan Fan For Life )

The problem is the role of the character in the film . Man to Man show a British anthropologist kidnapping two pygmy and taking them to Scotland and then realising that they are not animal or subhumans but actually equal to himself . The problem is the role of the pygmy in the film - two people who are kidnapped , treated like animal , and yet given such a shallow , stereotypical role within the film ... The kidnapper ( british anthropologist ) end up being the hero of the film because he 'manages ' to relate to the pygmy ... No notion of how the two hostage feel , of their point of view , of their ordeal ... I find it is a shallow film , with a one sided fundamentally racist view ... it never manages to move away from the 'white man ' view

Life Begins - and end - in a typical 1930 's maternity / recovery ward , where we view 48 hour in the life of several high risk pregnant woman , played by Loretta Young , Glenda Farrell , Clara Blandick ( Aunty Em ? ? ? ) , Vivienne Osborne , Dorothy Tree , and Gloria Shea , a they await to give birth . While the film feature plot device which seem far fetched today when maternity ward are much more controlled and restricted , it doe offer u a look back in time to see what giving birth in a typical city hospital in 1932 wa like for our grandmother and great-grandmothers . I found the film fascinating and exceptionally moving . Oddly enough , the most outstanding performance in this film come from a male cast member , young Eric Linden a Jed Sutton , Grace 's ( Loretta Young ) husband . What an actor ! As a first time father , Jed is distraught and uneasy with hospital staff who seem to brush off his concern about his wife a they might brush crumb off a cafeteria table . I felt his every concern keenly . I 'd like to see more of this actor 's work . He had a very emotional voice , which wa used to unforgettable effect in Gone With The Wind . In that film Eric played the young soldier whose leg wa amputated without anesthesia , who screamed `` Do n't cut ! Do n't cut ! '' a Scarlett fled the hospital in horror . Chilling ! Another great performance is from Aline MacMahon , who play Miss Bowers , the nurse . Her character is a salt of the earth type , the kind of nurse we all hope to get for our hospital stay , who break the hospital rule constantly in order to show a more humane side of the medical profession . Loretta Young did another superb acting job here a well , a very authentic and deeply felt performance a Grace . My , she is great in these precodes , I 've really grown to appreciate her more a an actress the last few month . Glenda Farrell played her role of a shrill unwed mother a little over the top for my taste ( did n't anyone know back in 1932 that swigging brandy from a hot water bottle might be hazardous to unborn baby ' health ? ) but her character redeems herself in the end . Also in the cast wa an uncredited Gilbert Roland , silent movie star , a a grieving Italian husband . His screen time wa brief , but notable . Life Begins is a must-see precode , try to catch it sometime on TCM , but remember to bring a few hanky to cry into . 9 out of 10 .
This is a great film . Touching and strong . The direction is without question breathless . Good work to the team . I feel so sorry for Marlene , By the grace of God go you or I

I think the manuscript of this movie wa written on the piece of toilet-paper . No respect whatsoever to many important detail which intrinsically make the movie . For example , the name of some Serbian terrorist ( that I remember ) are Caradan Maldic , Ivanic Loyvek and Leo Hasse . What kind of name are that ? Certainly not Serbian ! By the way , Caradan Maldic ! ! ! What a name , I laughed for day thinking about it . Probably an implication on Karadzic and Mladic . Secondly , there have never been any case of terrorism done by Serbians . A journalist like the main character ought to have known that . Thirdly , the actor playing Serbian terrorist are not even Serbs nor do they speak Serbo-croatian . All this aside , this movie is solidly acted but the story is paper-thin and full of hole . At time it make no sense whatsoever ! ! !

* Criticism doe mention spoiler * I rarely make user comment , but this is one movie I have no problem slandering . This movie stink , and it mediocre of rating of 6 and a half star is probably too high for such pulp . The Bone Collector is not at all the same calibre of film that Silence of the Lambs or Seven were , despite what it ad claim . This is a perfect example of how not to make a thriller . The pace of this movie wa extremely slow- I actually left for about 10 minute half-way through and came back at the exact scene with the exact same character with absolutely no progression ( I refer to you the part where Angelina Jolie 's character debate Denzel about cutting off a corpse ' hand ) . The movie is not at all scary , but try to compensate this with a love-subplot albeit sexy Angelina Jolie 's character and Denzel Washington 's . Of course , what you get is something comparable to that of the mentor-student relationship a seen in the brillian epic Silence of the Lambs with Hannibal Lecter and Starling , however , even this lack all effectiveness and I wa personally routing for the villain to kill Denzel off so a to avoid hackneyed giggle between the two . With such a crappy movie , I wa half-expecting a plot-twist or some sort of spectacular situation to occur at the end to give the movie some credit- thing that mediocre movie like Arlington Road and Scream pulled off . Anybody with a 4th grade education can see the ending how will be resolved ( a situation which mimicks Alfred Hitchcock 's Rear Window ) . The cliche of having the killer explain his motif wa uninspired enough , but the reason wa so ridiculous and stupid it had me spewing latte over the screen . Esoterically speaking , I even think the murderer 's intention wa completely lost a Denzel happily recovers from his loss over the proverbial 'chess game ' and get with his pet project , Angelina . If you are a fan of movie with original idea and genuinely dynamic concept ( like I am ) , you will not appreciate this film . If you have not attended a single movie in your life and would like to catch-up on every single Hollywood cliche ever borne ( the late-night knock on the window from somebody else but the murderer , the ridiculous serial-killer to prime investigator relationship , the horrible 'woman trying to get by in an all-male dominated workforce aka SOTL ) , see this movie .... but even then it too slow-paced and you 'd be bored .

Possible Spoilers , Perhaps . I must say that `` Cinderella II : Dreams Come True '' is one of the worst movie ever made . First of all , the movie wa made during the height of Disney 's sequel rampage . It wa created around the same time a `` The Little Mermaid II , '' `` The Jungle Book II , '' and `` Peter Pan II , '' all of which were disservice to their original film classic . ( Disney also made `` The Hunchback of Notre Dame II '' and `` Atlantis II , '' but I 'm going to drop that topic because their original movie were never really classic in the first place . '' ) Let me go ahead and say that I am an avid supporter of good Disney film , and I absolutely adore the original Disney `` Cinderella . '' The sequel to `` Cinderella , '' however , wa a waste of time . The character of Cinderella in the sequel wa so very unlike the original girl that I grew up watching . In the original , Cinderella wa kind and loving . The new Cinderella had very out-of-character moment with current-era phrasing like , `` I 'm going to do this banquet my way ! '' Let me also tell you that new Cinderella ( a I have affectionately named her ) say , `` Ewww ! '' That is the anti-Cinderella . I try to find the best in people , but in the sequel , Anastasia , one of the stepsister , is good ! What the heck ? Why ? They made it all out to be like Lady Tremaine and Drizella are just horrible family member for poor little Anastasia . My question to the world : did the people at Disney watch the original `` Cinderella '' when making this sequel ? Well , it surely doe n't seem so . If I remember correctly , Anastasia wa just a abusive to Cinderella a Drizella and Lady Tremaine . I am all for redemption and forgiveness , but there wa no point of redemption for Anastasia in this movie . In the first one , Anastasia wa evil . In the second one , she is good . One just ca n't leave a story like this . I hope Disney realizes that this movie , among other movie , is shaming Walt Disney 's name . Perhaps now that Michael Eisner is gone , thing will start shaping up around the House of Mouse .

Hopefully the score ha changed by now due to my brilliant and stunning review which persuades all of you to go and watch the film thereby creating an instant chorus of `` 8 '' s , this movie 's true score . As mentioned before Chris Rock is The King ! This wa that in going into this film I did n't realise that it wa actually a remake of `` Heaven Can Wait '' another quite good movie made in 1971 with Warren Beatty . As such I wa quite surprised when I watched this movie and suddenly the plot began to unravel to be distinctly similar to an older movie I had watched on TV a few week ago .. Regardless this movie is in my opinion the better version out of the two of them simply because of the different area it cover and the fact that Chris Rock is funnier than Warren Beatty any second of any day of any week of any year of any ... you get the picture . Well to the actual plot of the film . Do n't spoil the experience for yourself ! Do n't read the plot ! Just go and watch a movie because there have been two review on IMDb so far that have raved mad about it , go see it because it is the funniest thing you would have seen in a long time , go and see it because it 's a cinema experience that doe n't leave you grumbling ad nauseum at the cost of cinema ticket . Go see it because it is a good movie !
