Whatever rating I give BOOM is only because of the superb location photography of Sardinia and Rome . Otherwise , this is only for hardcore addict of ELIZABETH TAYLOR ( her downward phase ) , and RICHARD BURTON ( his miscasting phase ) . Tennessee Williams wrote `` The Milk Train Does n't Stop Here Anymore '' and is supposed to be very fond of this adaptation of his play -- but apparently , he wa the only one . Taylor reportedly hated it and Burton needed the money . Whatever , it amount to a hill of bean with Taylor posturing and fuming in her shrill manner , exploding at the servant and exchanging bad baby-talk with no le than NOEL COWARD who seems to be a visitor from another film when he finally appears . It 's so campy that among Taylor fan it 's probably considered a `` must see '' kind of thing . But if you can sit through this one without a drink in your hand , you 're way ahead of me . Sadly , this is the film that signified the end of Taylor being taken seriously a a film actress , even after winning two Oscars . For Burton , it wa equally disastrous and the critic called it a BOMB . Judge for yourself if you dare .

VIVA LA BAM This `` Jackass '' spin off focus on the ( obviously scripted ) adventure of Bam Margera and his pal ( Johnny Knoxville , Brandon Dicamillo , etc ) . This show , while it ha it fair share of gross-out comedy and crazy stunt , focus mainly on Bam 's torturing of his parent . I 'm sorry to say this , Bam , but ... you 're in no way a cool a you think you are . This ego tripped show is not only painfully unfunny ( and yes , I liked Jackass ) , but also narcissistic beyond belief . The overly stylized intro end with Bam coolly explaining that he 's going to do `` whatever the f * * * '' he want to . How about you do something that is actually funny ? I liked `` Jackass '' for what it wa worth . The camera-work wa horrible - any idiot could have made a better show with a camcorder in their parent ' garage - but at least the show moved at a steady pace and never felt boring between the crazy , dangerous or simply disgusting stunt the pal performed . Not so with `` Viva la Bam '' . We follow our hero around a he play prank on his friend and torture his relative , but never doe it feel like anything else than really lame and scripted comedy . The stunt and prank are mildly entertaining , but presented in such a tedious and dull fashion that they can barely make you smile . `` Viva la Bam '' is a poor spin-off of that doe little good but feed Margera 's already too big ego . I do n't recommend this lame and unimaginative show to anyone .

I had never heard of Larry Fessenden before but judging by this effort into writing and directing , he should keep his day job a a journeyman actor . Like many others on here , I do n't know how to categorize this film , it wa n't scary or spooky so ca n't be called a horror , the plot wa so wafer thin it ca n't be a drama , there wa no suspense so it ca n't be a thriller , it just a bad film that you should only see if you were a fan of the Blair witch project . People who liked this film used word , like `` ambiguity '' and complex and subtle but they were reading into something that wa n't there . Like the Blair witch , people got scared because people assumed they should be scared and bought into some guff that it wa terrifying . This movie actually started off well with the family `` meeting '' the local after hitting a deer . It looked like being a modern day deliverance but then for the next 45 minute , ( well over half the film ) , nothing happened , the family potted about their holiday home which wa all very nice and dandy but not the slightest bit entertaining . It wa obvious the local would be involved in some way at some stage but Essendon clearly ha no idea how to build suspense in a movie . Finally , when something doe happen , it not even clear how the father wa shot , how he dy , ( the nurse said his liver wa only grazed ) , and all the time this wendigo spirit apparently track down the apparent shooter in a very clumsy way with 3rd grade special effect . The film is called Wendigo but no attempt is made to explain it in any clear way , the film end all muddled and leaf you very unsatisfied , i would have bailed out with 15 minute to go but I wanted to see if this movie could redeem itself . It did n't .

Schlocky '70s horror film ... ya got ta love 'em . In contrast to today 's boring slasher flick , these K-tel special actually do something scary and do not resort to a tired formula . This is a B movie about the making of a B movie ... that went horribly wrong . Faith Domergue ( This Island Earth ) star a an over-the-hill , B movie queen making a movie about a series of grisly murder that befell a family in their home . Her boyfriend/director , who look and act like Gordon Jump with an attitude , is filming on location and on a tight schedule . The Ken doll co-star discovers a book of Tibetian chant that they work into the script to add `` realism '' . Unfortunately , `` realism '' is something they could have done without . John Carradine , having long since given up looking for the 17th gland ( The Unearthly ) , now eeks out a humble existence a the caretaker for the estate . He go about his daily work , but always seems to run afoul of the director . The horror build slowly ; a dead cat here , John Carradine entering a grave there , finally culminating in seven , yes seven murder . ( At least there 's truth in advertising . ) It 's just sad that the ghoul did n't understand that there wa a movie being made above him . How wa poor Faith to know that those darn Tibetian chant would actually work ? Face it , you just ca n't go around tugging on Satan 's coat and expect him to take it lying down . Sterno say perform an autopsy on The House of Seven Corpses .

I suppose for 1961 this film wa supposed to be `` cool `` , but looking back now ( 45 year ) it 's charm wa just a silly a it 's entertainment value ! Granted , the special effect do well on T.V . with the Series that started in 1964 , but for the BIG screen ? ? I once had a fish tank that wa equally a exciting ! I must agree about the Octopus scene near the end where it attached itself to the Seaview . Obviously not well staged ... or trained ! Overall , it 's pretty bad acting with shoddy special effect and I still do recommend it - for fun laugh sake . This wa probably one of Irwin Allen 's Biggest film and I think he thought a lot of it . Barabara Eden went on to play `` Genie `` on T.V . Micheal Ansara wa her Husband . Now that is a cool part about this film ! I always enjoyed seeing real life Husband and Wife team star in the same movie . Neat !

This is one of the finest film to come out of Hong Kong 's 'New Wave ' that began with Tsui Hark 's `` ZU : Warriors of Magic Mountain '' . Tsui set a tone for the New Wave 's approach to the martial art film that pretty much all the director of the New Wave ( Jackie Chan , Sammo Hung , Wong Jing , Ching Siu Tung , etc . ) accepted from then on a a given ; namely , the approach to such film thenceforth would need more than a touch of irony , if not outright comedy . `` Burning Paradise '' put a stop to all that , and with a vengeance . It 's not that there is n't humor here ; but it is a purely human humor , a with the aged Buddhist priest at the beginning who somehow manages a quick feel of the nubile young prostitute while hiding in a bundle of straw . But this is just a human are , not even Buddhist priest can be saint all the time . When irony is at last introduced into the film , it is the nastiest possible , emanating from the 'abbot ' of Red Lotus Temple , who is a study in pure nihilism such a ha never been recorded on film before . He is the very incarnation of Milton 's Satan from `` Paradise Lost '' : `` Better to rule in Hell than serve in heaven ! '' And if he ca n't get to Satan 's hell soon enough , he 'll turn the world around him into a living hell he can rule . That 's the motif underscoring the brutal violence of much of the imagery here : It 's not that the Abbot just want to kill people ; he want them to despair , to feel utterly hopeless , to accept his nihilism a all-encompassing reality . Thus there 's a definite sense pervading the Red Temple scene that there just might not be any other reality outside of the Temple itself - it ha become all there is to the universe , and the Abbot , claiming mastery of infinite power , is in charge . Of course , fortunately , the film doe n't end there . Though there are loss , the human will to be just ordinarily human at last prevails . ( If you want to know how , see the film ! ) Yet there is no doubt that , in viewing this film , we visit hell . Hopefully , we do not witness our own afterlives ; but we certainly feel chastened by the experience - and somehow better for it over all .

Now I do n't hate cheap movie . I just do n't see why you should waste any money for a movie you could shoot with your dad 's camcorder . If I rent a movie , I want it to be a MOVIE , not a bunch of people thinking it would be a good idea to waste some MiniDV - Tapes . Maybe I hate this one so much because the guy in the video store said it wa great , and it wa n't . Maybe I hate it because it 's cheap , ha the dumbest plot EVER , the most unrealistic character EVER and the really , really , really WORST SHOWDOWN in the history of film EVER . Even Tom Savini ca n't save this . Seriously , this one is a complete waste of time .

The '' film '' version , and I use the term film very loosely , is more of a god awful pastiche of American heist movie particularly the Oceans movie . They they even have George clooney a Mr fox to to add to the insult and manage to miss the point of the story quite completely . So kudos to them .They 'll make lot of money and destroy another classic Roald Dahl child book .

As soon a it hit a screen , it destroys all intelligent life form around ! But on behalf of it producer I must say it doe n't fall into any known movie category , it deserves a brand new denomination of it own ! It 's a `` Neurological drama '' ! It saddens and depresses every single neuron inside a person 's brain . It 's the closest thing one will ever get to a stroke without actually suffering one . It drive you speechless , all you member go numb , your mouth fall open and remains so , and the most strange symptom of all is that you get yourself wishing to go blind and deaf . No small feat for such a sort of a `` movie '' . The only word that come to my mind just having finished my ordeal is OUTRAGE ! ! ! ! ! !

For a film made in Senegal , based , I guess loosely on Carmen , the book , by Prosper Merimee , this film doe n't achieve a mere resemblance of the story that ha been made famous a an opera and a other film . This is a Karmen that aim to please to all gender , but a real Carmen , she is not ! We would like to see Ms. Gai in other film in which her talent is better used than here .

This is a very noir kind of episode . It begin with Jim returning from a weekend trip with a new girlfriend , the recently divorced Karen Mills ( Pat Delaney -- daughter in law of John Huston , who knew a few thing about noir film ) and her daughter . When they arrive , Karen go in the house while Jim pick up her daughter from the back seat and carry her up to her room . He then discovers Karen ha disappeared without a trace . Of course he call Dennis and when the police arrive , they see no sign of Karen , but find her next door neighbor murdered in the bush . So of course that make Jim an immediate suspect . This is a great little mystery and the first half of the story is shown by Rocky asking Jim to go over the story once again . Rocky suggests that by Jim telling him the story he might remember a little detail that he did n't think wa important at the time , but now might lead to a clue a to what happened . It 's a really well written scene and completes the transition of the Rocky character from a grifter to a concerned parent . It also go a long way to show that Rocky is n't just some clueless old man either . As he say `` You come to me because I 'm your father . And I 'm smarter than you ! '' This is one of those time where we see where Jim got his smart . This episode also feature an appearance by hottie Lara Parker , who played Angelique in the `` Dark Shadows '' series and went on to play Laura Banner , Bruce 's wife in the `` Incredible Hulk '' series a few year later . She look terrific here . This episode also mark the first mention of the Minette crime family , a name that would keep popping up on the Rockford Files almost whenever they needed a mob family . This time , it Vincent Minette who Rockford help apprehend . Lt. Diehl ( Tom Atkins ) make his first appearance on the series and Dennis is quietly demoted from a police lieutenant that he wa on the earlier season one episode to a police Sargent . I guess they figured it would be better to have Dennis le powerful and add some conflict between Jim and the police . Frankly , they were right , though I prefer the later Lt. Chapman to Lt. Diehl . Not a lot of the typical `` Rockford '' humor in this episode , but a good mystery with a lot of heart .

The Royal Rumble ha traditionally been one of my favourite event , and i 've been a wrestling fan for a good few year now . The other show may have better match , but i 've always found the actual rumble match to be full of excitement . I 'm not going to reveal the winner of any match a i do n't see it a fair to ruin the result on a review . I will comment on the quality of them though . We have the standard 4 match , and then the big rumble event . Two from Smackdown and two from Raw . Shawn Michaels and Edge open up for Raw . This prof to be a good match from two talented guy . This is a match i 'd recommend watching . It 's hard to sum up without giving away the winner . Next we have the usual Undertaker against some big nasty monster , be whoever it is . Giant Gonzales , Yokozuna , Kamala ... well this time it 's Heidenreich . Its also a casket match . Typical Undertaker fare . Watch if you 're a fan . I have to admit i am , purely for the entertainment factor . It can hardly be regarded a a classic wrestling match . The next two match are the title match . For once Smackdown manages to upstage Raw . Their title match is pretty thrilling and enjoyable , but with a anti-climax and let down to end it . Raw 's match is a pretty dull and boring affair , which is a pity a i 'm a fan of both guy involved . Now to the main reason i love the event , the rumble . It 's a pretty good one this year . Coming up to the event we all had a pretty good idea of who might win , and it may not prove a big surprise , but hey , it very enjoyable . There are the usual diverse way of people being eliminated . There is the token guy who doe n't make it to the ring , the entrant who is ridiculous and we all want to see vanquished , and someone get eliminated by a previously eliminated combatant . It ha it usual high and low , and i loved the ending , in particular the Vince McMahon entrance . I 'd recommend this show . Not the WWE on top form , but it still good . Add it to your collection .

We called one of our mate `` Zipmole Watkins '' after the brilliant episode in which Daniel Peacock ha a bit of 'restyling ' on his nose by the Back Street Abortionist . Lots of great line `` Remember at 5:30 in the morning you can only get white bread from a brown man . Take it easy guy ! '' - Gandhi a a local shopkeeper . Tony woodcock wa definitely on there in the episode they were teaching Ralph ( Daniel Peacock ) to be a barman `` It 's no good Amanda I 'll never make it a a bar man '' Helen Lederer teach him to ask people about the match `` See the match last night ? I thought Woodcock played well '' After a string of failed conversation the curly haired Arsenal star wa sitting at the bar : `` See the match last night ? '' `` Yeah . I thought I played well '' We still do odd stupid line now - `` Reg and Ralph ..... or ....... Ralph and Reg . Reg , Reg ... Reg Reg Reg Reg '' Lots of very surreal silly moment and very surreal song from the Flatlets - The Back Street Abortionist a personal favourite with the great ending line - `` And he 'll mark your package 'Return To Sender '' Good old Danny Peacock - you added a lot to some young drinker ' evening sir . * * Update - I found a couple of episode on tape - I 'm going to upload the Gandhi sketch to Youtube * *

Destined to be a classic before it wa even conceptualized . This game deserves all the recognition it deserves . At a time when first-person shooter like Quake III Arena and Unreal Tournament are garnering all the attention of computer gamers , graphic adventure are a dying breed . With great pun and humour , The Curse of Monkey Island is a game that people of all age group would enjoy . Life can only improve after playing The Curse of Monkey Island . * prediction * the sequel Escape from Monkey Island is already destined to be a classic too . I guarantee it .

Stephane Audran is the eponymous heroine of this beautifully measured study of a small Danish community towards the end of the last century . Two beautiful and musically talented sister give-up their own prospect of happiness and marriage in order to look-after their ageing father . One day , a French woman , Babette , come to work for them . After some year she win the lottery and is determined to do something for the sister who have taken her in . Her solution is to prepare an exquisite and sumptuous feast , which change the life of all those invited . This is a film about human and cultural interaction , reflected in the changing language of the dialogue from Danish to French , and especially between the dutiful sobriety of Protestant northern Europe and the sensuousness of the Catholic south . It is also about human need , and how warmth and kindness can be expressed and stimulated through the cultivation of the sens . A profoundly uplifting film .

This movie wa way over-hyped . A lot of the viewer , who thought this wa `` amazing '' must have been into the old school movie , cause the whole movie is set in the past . At first I thought the movie wa just showing something from the past , so I wa expecting that faded dreamy like lighting on the character to pas , but it just going . Basically this wa a movie trying to mix the future with the past , and the 2 do n't mix very well in this movie , even with special effect . You could actually see the blue screen the actor were working with . There are too many movie out there that do exactly what this movie did , so there is no reason for critic to hype this movie up saying `` it 's the greatest movie ever done '' . It 's just crap on a stick . It also did n't help that the story line wa sooo crappy . I do n't understand why Hollywood agreed to have this movie produced , and I also do n't understand how actors/actresses in this movie are willing to be in a movie like this . It 's almost a though everybody read the script and forgot to read the fine print ... '' It will all be done on a computer '' . This wa a movie that should have been on a movie network , because nothing about this movie wa revolutionary . I 'm very upset with myself for paying money to see this . Whatever you do , do n't waste your time and money on this movie today or tomorrow .

It is incredible that there were two film with the same story released in 2005 . This one came out a day before that other one with Tom Cruise . Did n't they do that with Truman Capote the same year , and the Zodiac killer last year ? Interesting . Writer/Director David Michael Latt did n't have Steven Spielberg 's budget and C. Thomas Howell is not Tom Cruise . This is a pale imitation of the blockbuster that grossed $ 588 million worldwide . The action wa minimal and most of the time we were treated to the whining of Rhett Giles , who played a pastor that wa giving up on his god . Gary Busey wa creepy a an army LT .

I dunno sometimes ... you try and try and try to be charitable towards all the B thru Z grade movie out there , but once in a while a particular movie just test your patience until you want to slap everyone involved . `` Bat People '' ( which I saw under the title `` It Lives By Night '' ) is just such a movie . You ca n't watch this without thinking that it really should have been an episode on `` Night Gallery '' , and not one of the better one , either . The movie ha something to do with a doctor who get bitten by a bat and consequently start to morph into a Were-Bat who drink human blood . ( Actually , you 'd think if he wa turning into a real bat , he 'd be eating mosquito by the gallon bucket , but because this is a cheap , lurid horror movie , blood 's the word . ) In spite of the fact that he ha grand-mal seizure at the drop of a hat , and black-out episode almost every night , his friend and fellow physician , Dr. Mustache Aspen-Extreme , insists that he 's just having an 'allergic reaction ' to the rabies shot . Meanwhile , the world 's most obnoxious and stereotyped county sheriff suspect the doc of being responsible for the brutal murder and exsanguination of several local girl ( and one wino ) . Also meanwhile , the doctor 's wife decides that denial IS a river in Egypt and alternately patronizes him and nag him to distraction . It 's not so much that the acting is bad - you can tell that the actor are making professional level choice , and are trying to bring some juice and life to the script , even the guy who play the sheriff . ( Okay , it IS pretty bad , but it 's bad in a clichéd , wooden , professional way ) . It 's just that everything about the acting , the way the scene are paced , the costume , the dialog , the script and the story line in general set your teeth on edge and make you want to , well , slap everyone involved . I think the movie had an outside chance at being a spooky , unsettling little cult favorite , BUT : 1 ) The director needed to beat Michael Pataki , an experienced character actor , with a chair until Pataki agreed to ACT , and not just channel Dennis Weaver . 2 ) He also needed to find a script that made a little more sense with regard to the whole `` Bat Bites Human , Who Then Turns Into A Bat '' scenario . 3 ) He also needed the actor who played the doctor to find a little more physically believable bit of stage business for his 'episodes ' , instead of resorting to `` Man Has A Seizure '' page from the Little Golden Book of Clichéd Acting Mannerisms . 4 ) He needed to rework the whole 'wife ' character , make her both more intelligent , le shrill and waaaaay more observant . I would never voluntarily watch this film again , except with the help of Mike and the Bots . It 's bad , but it is n't bad in a silly , humorous or interesting way . Still better than `` Battlefield Earth '' or `` Waterworld '' , though .

Big Fat Liar is what you get when you combine terrific writing , great production , and an emphasis on clever idea over adolescent pap . The two star work great together , and -- what can I say ? Amanda Bynes shine . Putting `` Irkel '' and Lee Majors in the film were brilliant touch . Watch this film with your kid . If you do n't laugh throughout it , you must not have been paying attention .

Tim Robbins and John Cusack are two actor I have appreciated throughout their career , and that wa the only reason for choosing to watch this movie . Well , all I can say is I totally regretted it ! These two great actor humiliate themselves all the way through by performing a number of irrelevant , unimaginative and kitch to the extreme ( not that this is bad on it own ) sketch that are supposed to make people laugh , but fail to do so . The only reason I can think is that the director wa their friend , and they decided to support his movie by starring in it-I ca n't think of anything else because this movie is SO cheap ! Fortunately Tim Robbins and John Cusack have n't disappointed me ever since . I would recommend you to avoid this film , unless you want your opinion about the two actor spoiled .

On watching this film , I wa amazed at how medium perception can mould a person opinion of a celebrity . Karen Carpenter wa a carefree , but very unconfident young lady , whose wonderful voice helped her and her brother Richard to soar the chart with wonderful song . As with all celebrity of today , they were often criticised about their music a well a their look , style , etc . THis had a huge effect on Karen who raged a battle against her eating and drastically lost weight , which eventually caused her death . This heart felt film wa not initially something which I would have thought of watching . But on starting to view it , then I wa hooked . In the same way that the Tina Turner story doe , then this film enlightens you and allows you to see into the young performer life . The acting wa superb and even after nearly 20 year after it wa made , then the directional and the dialogue are still entertaining . I would recommend this to anyone who ha n't yet watched it . It is amazingly accurate and emotionally charged .

Nothing is sacred . Just ask Ernie Fosselius . These day , everybody ha a video camera , and a movie is hardly out before the spoof start flying , quickly written and shot , and often posted directly to the internet . Spoofs are hot these day , and we go out of our way to make sure filmmaker do n't get off on their own self-importance . 25 year ago , when the first Star Wars wa made , it wa a different world . Filmmaking wa the playground of a select few and spoof were very rare . Then God gave u Hardware Wars . It wa shot to look cheap ( or wa it just cheap ? ) and the audio wa obviously recorded after the fact . Does that take away from the experience ? HECK NO ! That 's what make it so great ! It wa raw and unpolished , and hit relentlessly on some of the more pretentious moment of the original movie . From Fluke Starbucker waving around a flashlight instead of a lightsaber ( I did that when I wa young ! ) to Chewchilla the Wookie Monster , to Auggie Ben Doggie 's `` nah , just a little headache '' remark , this film short is a much a part of the phenomenon a any of the actual Star Wars film . Rent it . Buy it . Borrow it from a friend . And may the Farce be with you . Always .

I hated it . I hate self-aware pretentious inanity that masquerade a art . This film is either stupidly inane or inanely stupid . I became angered that I had spent hard-earned money for sophomoric clap-trap . Tinting drivel in sepia or blue doe not make something a movie , let alone art .

I usually try to be professional and constructive when I criticize movie , but my GOD ! ! ! This wa THE worst movie I have ever seen . Bad acting , bad effect , bad script , bad everything ! The plot follows a group of teen cliche 's on their way to a rave ( that take place in broad daylight ) at a remote island . However , when the group arrives , all they find is an empty dance floor and bloody clothes . Determined to find out what happened to the rest of the party-goers , the clan set 's off on a mission through a zombie-infested forest . During this crusade , they are aided by a police chick and a sea captain that just happens to have the right number of weapon to give to each of the kid . They also meet up with Jonathan Cherry and some other survivor . Basically the rest of the movie is a collection of poorly directed action sequence including a far too long shootout outside of the `` house of the dead . '' This fight came complete with cheesy Hollywood violence , redundant clip from the HOTD video game , and sloppy matrix-esque camera rotation . One of the character 's even volunteer to sacrifice himself to save the others . Why ? Not because he wa noble and brave , but because part of his face got scarred by acid a zombie spat on him after he continued to beat the creature long after it had been disabled ! I 'm supposed to feel sorry for this guy ? ! ? To sum it all up , there is absolutely no point in seeing this movie unless you want to see for yourself just how terrible it is . The theater I wa in wa more dead than the zombie on the screen , and I 'm sure the money I wasted seeing this piece of sh * t could easily cover the cost it took to make it . GRADE : F

If you like me is going to see this in a film history class or something like that at your school , try to convince your teacher to see something else . believe me , anything is better than this movie . it is slow paced , confusing , boring , poorly constructed , gory , gringy , do I need to go on ? Why would anyone want to watch a girl describe a threesome for 10 minute , than watch them drive through a traffic jam for 20 minute , listen to a hippie who can make sheep appear , witness a sort of rape , than see the female lead role eat her husband . Honestly this movie deserves nothing but a 1/10 . And if your not happy with my preview , seriously I 'm an open minded guy and I like movie that protest through symbolism , but this movie wa just awful . make any excuse you can , to avoid this film .

This is like a zoology textbook , given that it depiction of animal is so accurate . However , here are a few detail that appear to have been slightly modified during the transition to film : - Handgun bullet never hit giant Komodo dragon . It doe n't matter how many time you shoot at the Komodo , bullet just wo n't go near it . - The best way to avoid being eaten by a giant Cobra , or a giant Komodo dragon , is just to stand there . The exception to this rule is if you 've been told to stay very still , in which case you should run off , until the Komodo is right next to you , and then you should stand there , expecting defeat . - Minutes of choppy slow motion footage behind the credit really make for enjoyable watching . - $ 5,000 is a memory enhancement tool , and an ample substitute for losing your boating license/getting arrested . - Members of elite army unit do n't see giant Komodo dragon coming until they are within one metre of the over-sized being . Maybe the computer-generated nature of these dragon ha something to do with it . - When filming a news story aiming on exposing illegal animal testing , a reporter and a cameraman with one camera is all the gear and personnel you will need ; sound gear , a second camera , microphone etc are all superfluous . - When you hear a loud animal scream , and one person ha a gun , he should take it out and point it at the nearest person . - When you take a gun out , the sound of the safety being taken off will be made , even if your finger is nowhere near the safety - Reporters agree to go half-way around the world in order to expose something - without having the faintest idea what they 're exposing . Background research and vague knowledge are out of fashion in modern journalism . - Handguns hold at least 52 bullet in one clip , and then more than that in the next clip . Despite that , those with gun claim that they will need more ammo . - Expensive camera ( also , remember that the reporter only ha one camera ) are regularly left behind without even a moment 's hesitation or regret . These camera amazingly manage to make their way back to the reporter all by themselves . - The blonde girl really is the stupid one . - The same girl that say not to go into a house because a Komodo dragon can easily run right through it , thus making it unsafe , take a team into a building made of the same material for protection - and nobody say a word about it . - High-tech facility look like simple office with high school chemistry set . - Genetically-modified snake grow from normal size to 100 foot long in a matter of a day , but do n't grow at all in the week either side . - The military routinely destroys entire island when people do n't meet contact deadline . - Men with gun do n't necessarily change the direction they 're shooting when their target is no longer right in front of them . Instead , they just keep shooting into the air . - The better looking you are , the greater your chance of surviving giant creature . - Women 's intuition is reliable enough to change even the most stubborn of mind . - Any time you 're being hunted by giant creature is a great time to hit on girl half your age . - Animal noise are an appropriate masking noise for 'swearing ' at the same volume . - Old Israeli and Russian plane are regularly used by the US Military .

Why do movie maker always go against the author 's work ? I mean , yes , thing have to be condensed for the sake of viewer interest , but look at Anne of Green Gables . They did a wonderful job of combining important event into a cohesive whole that wa simply delightful . I ca n't believe that they chose to combine three novel together for Anne of Avonlea into such a dreadful mess . Look at all they missed out on by doing that . . . Paul Irving , little Elizabeth , the widow , Windy Poplars . . . and Anne 's college year , for heaven 's sake ! ! ! Would n't it have been delightful to meet Priscilla and all the rest of the Redmond gang ? Kevin Sullivan should have taken thing one movie at a time , instead of jumbling them all together and combining character and event the way he did . This movie wa good , if you leave the novel out of it ! ! But L.M . Montgomery 's beautiful work is something that should not be denied . This movie wa a let down after seeing the successful way he brough Anne of Green Gables to life .

I ca n't believe that those praising this movie herein are n't thinking of some other film . Ben G fan should stick with just about any other movie he 's been in . Dorothy S fan should stick to Galaxina . Peter B fan should stick to Last Picture Show and Target . Fans of cheap laugh at the expense of those who seem to be asking for it should stick to Peter B 's amazingly awful book , Killing of the Unicorn .

This film really used it location well with some amazing shot , dark and disturbing the film move very slowly , but constantly keep you watching . Modern Love worked well in the Gold Coast Film Fantastic program this year offering audience a glimpse at an Australian Cinema that is usually neglected . Most importantly it is refreshing to see Australian cinema not taking on the cliché Aussie character and story line we have seen done to death over the year . This film would compliment any festival and will open debate after it screening . The performance and character are well developed , and the cinematography is fantastic . An interesting exploration into family relationship , and environment .

Strangely enough this movie never made it to the big screen in Denmark , so I had to wait for the video release . My expectation where high but they where in no way disappointed . As always with Ang Lee there is fantastic acting , an intelligent and thrilling plot that ha you guessing right till the end and superb filming . Along with Unforgiven this is easily one of the two best western of the 90 ` s . People who expect something along the line of Mel Gibson in The Patriot ( corny ) or Braveheart ( acceptable ) will be sourly disappointed , all others who appreciate the above mentioned quality will have a fantastic time watching it . 9 out of 10 .

This film is so bad - dialogue , story , actor and actress - everything ! - that it 's hard to imagine that we 'll see a worse movie this year or in the following year . `` Love 's Brother '' ( set in Australia among Italian immigrant ) ha nothing but shallow clichés about Italian culture to offer , and it is quite telling that even the Italians from and in Italy speak ENGLISH in the film . The message of the film - ugly people have to marry ugly people , beautiful people have to marry beautiful people - is truly discomforting . Giovanni Ribisi is quite good in film like 'Suburbia ' or 'Lost in Translation ' , but here his pseudo-Italian accent is hard to bear . See this film at your own risk . Trash a trash can !

If you watch this film , you will find yourself realising you 'll never be able to get back the time you 've just wasted .

In Nordestina , a village in the middle of nowhere in Pernambuco , Antônio ( Gustavo Falcão ) is the youngest son of his mother , who had uninterruptedly cried for five year . When he is a young man , he fall in love for Karina ( Mariana Ximenes ) , a seventeen year old teenager that dream to see the world and becomes an actress . Antônio promise Karina to bring the world to Nordestina , and once in Rio de Janeiro , he participates of a sensationalist television show and promise to travel to the fifty year ahead in the future or die for love with a deadly machine he had invented . Fifty year later , Antônio ( Paulo Autran ) try to fix what wa wrong in his travel . `` A Máquina '' is one of the best Brazilian movie I have recently seen . The refreshing and original story is a poetic and magic fable of love that will certainly thrill the most skeptical and tough viewer , in a unique romance . The direction is excellent ; the screenplay is awesome ; the cinematography and color are magnificent ; the cast leaded by Gustavo Falcão , the icon Paulo Autran and Mariana Ximenes is fantastic , with marvelous line ; the soundtrack ha some beautiful Brazilian song highlighting Geraldo Azevedo and Rento Rocha 's `` Dia Branco '' . If this movie is distributed overseas , please thrust me and rent it or buy the DVD because I bet you will love the story that will bring you into tear . My vote is nine . Title ( Brazil ) : `` A Máquina  O Combustível é o Amor '' ( `` The Machine  The Fuel is Love '' )

`` I like cheap perfume better ; it doe n't last a long ... '' - Ralph Meeker 's convict character ( Lawson ) tell this to Barbara Stanwyck 's Helen character , after he get a whiff of the perfume that she picked out w/her husband in Tijuana ... ! This line cracked me up , and also seemed like a metaphor for this film - that cheap is better than expensive , because a cheap perfume-loving man who ha a way with a 2 x 4 is a better man to have around in the long run ! I agree with some of the other comment posted about Helen 's attraction to Lawson . Even though her narration state that she want Lawson to be put away , she did seem attracted to his fiery nature , and that passion he stirred up in her would n't likely wash away with the tide !

I am a huge fan of Harald Zwart , and I just knew that I had to see this movie , even though I ca n't say I 'm a soccer fan . But watching this just filled my heart with joy , and I had a great time in the movie watching it . Bjørn Fast Nagell doe a tremendous job directing this movie , and even though you notice the main character are new at acting , they grow with the movie and make it what it is . Even though it is supposed to be a soccer movie , there is surprisingly little soccer in it . The whole idea is to show the six guy making up the word N O R W A Y on their trip to the World Cup in soccer playing in Germany this year . If you 're only gon na see one Norwegian movie this year , this is the one ..

Based on the best-selling novel `` The Dismissal '' , The Missing Star , the latest film by acclaimed Italian director Gianni Amelio , is the story of the growing friendship between an older Italian maintenance man and a young interpreter he hire in Shanghai to be his guide through China . Vincenzo Buonovolonta is the Maintenance Manager at a steel mill in Italy that ha been shut down and the blast furnace sold to China . When Vincenzo ( Sergio Castellitto ) discovers that a control unit in the furnace is defective and potentially dangerous , he travel to China to find the steel mill where the part ha been sold in hope of preventing a fatal accident . The film , of course , is about the journey not the destination to use a familiar cliché and , on that journey , we are privy to an engaging look at China with all it immense beauty and complexity , via the outstanding cinematography by Luca Bigazzi . The film take u to Shanghai , Wuhan , Chongquing , Baotou , and a trip along the Yangstze River showing u coastal area that are scheduled to be flooded when the Three Gorges Dam is fully operative , a Chinese mega-project that ha resulted in the displacement of 1.2 million people . The trip brings the traveler face to face with poverty , overcrowded housing , and child left to fend for themselves . The film revolves around the relationship between Vincenzo and translator Liu Hua ( Tai Ling ) who first meet in Italy where his impatience with her translation at a dinner meeting cause her to lose her job . When he track her down in Shanghai she is working at a library and resistant to Vincenzo 's approach . Looking at his offer to help him in his travel in China a little more than a well paying job , she reluctantly agrees to accompany him . Their relationship , however , grows a they move from city to city , her interpretive skill much in evidence to help the bewildered Vincenzo who doe not own a cell phone . As they slowly open up to each other , they expose each other 's vulnerability and the film delf into their past and present life and how they arrived at their present situation . We meet Liu 's son ( Lin Wang ) at the home of her grandmother . In China 's one child policy , he is one of the unwanted child who have been `` hidden '' since the father of the boy abandoned the family . Although the meeting between Vincenzo and the boy is casual , their relationship becomes central to how the story play out . Castellitto is an excellent actor ( though one longs for a younger Enrico Lo Verso in this role ) . However , he is emotionally distant throughout the film , his expression rarely changing from a far away hangdog expression . Though Tai Ling brings a great deal of presence to the role , her relationship with the much older Vincenzo never seemed real to me and the ending seemed to exist only in a reality known a the movie . Though Amelio is one of my favorite director , coming on the heel of the brilliant Keys to the House , Missing Star is a disappointment .

This movie is a real low budget production , yet I will not say anything more on that a it already ha been covered . I give this movie a low rating for the story alone , but I met the director the night I saw the film and he gave me an additional reason to dislike the movie . He asked me how I enjoyed it and I told him that it wa not easy to like . My main objection wa the lack of foundation for the relationship between the two main character , I wa never convinced that they were close . I also told him that the scene where the main character were presented a child becoming friend wa too late in the film . He told me that the flashback scene were not in the original script . That they were added because he felt like I did that the two main character did not appear close . He went on to explain that these scene were not filmed to his satisfaction a they were out of money . I agree that they did not do much for the film . Another fact about the movie , that I wa not aware of , is the actor who had the lead wrote the script based on his own personal experience . This is usually a bad move a some writer do not take into consideration the emotional reaction the viewer . The story is so close to home that the writer make too many assumption a to the audience 's reaction to his own tragedy . And the story is tragic . However , it did not work for me a I never cared for any of the character , least of all the lead . What wa presented were two evil people out to make a buck by any mean , regardless who get hurt . When Ms. Young 's character decides to give up he evil way , it appears that she doe so because she is ineffective , not because she know she is doing wrong . If the movie ha a message then I suspect that only the writer is aware of it .

Jackass Number Two is easily the most hilarious film of 2006 , beating the also hilarious Clerks II . It is one of the best sequel in recent memory , beating Jackass The Movie in every way . Now , this film may be the funniest , but it is also the most offensive , appalling , and utterly disgusting . You will find yourself feeling sick several time throughout the film . I 'm completely serious when I say do n't eat anything before watching or during this film , because chance are that it will literally come back to haunt you . Keep the drinking to a minimum a well . You 've been warned , because , just like the tagline say , it will make you beg for mercy . Jackass Number Two follows the crazy men from the hit show Jackass , Johnny Knoxville , Bam Margera , Ryan Dunn , Steve-O , Chris 'Party Boy ' Pontius , Preston Lacy , Ehren McGhehey , Dave England , Brandon DiCamillo , and Jason 'Wee Man ' Acuna ( Chris 'Raab Himself ' Raab is absent ) a they perform the most outrageous , life-threatening , and revolting stunt imaginable . I 'm not going to tell what the stunt are , but I will warn you that any scene with an animal will be sickening or psychologically frightening , and that one cast member ( once again , not telling ) will flirt with death several time in the film . What make Jackass Number Two so entertaining is not the stunt themselves , but how the cast reacts to them and to doing them . To put it simple , if they loved doing it and had a blast , you will too ( this go for 99 % of the stunt ) . All the stunt are very original , and 90 % of them are never-before-seen . You will witness a few recycled one , but they 're amped up . You would n't think directing really factor into a movie like this , but it doe ; Jeff Tremaine 's direction make the movie so much funnier , because he provides guidance for the gang in their comedic timing , which is simply brilliant on his part . He could have just sat back and slept throughout filming ( actually , you 'll see in the film that he did sleep through some filming ) , but he went out there and helped these crazy guy make the stunt a funny a he could . I give Mr. Tremaine two thumb up for that . Another great thing about Jackass is it bonanza of celebrity cameo , and this time they include BMX legend Mat Hoffman , skateboard god Tony Hawk , director/actor Jay Chandrasekhar ( Super Troopers & Beerfest ) , actor Luke Wilson , Miami Dolphins star Jason Taylor , and director/actor Mike Judge ( Office Space ) . The scene with Hoffman , Taylor , and Chandrasekhar are among the funniest in the film , a it 's even funnier to see these men a a part of the film . Jackass Number Two is one of the most politically incorrect , morally degrading , and just plain wrong movie of all time , if not the most . Despite this , it is so original and so hilarious that you wo n't care about that . You 'll be gasping for air , laughing so hard you 'll be cry , and jumping out of your seat laughing throughout the entire film . Due to the explicit and potentially disturbing graphic content of this film , no one under 18 should watch this film . You 've been warned . I hope you enjoy Jackass Number Two a much a I did . 10/10 -- spy

Turn your back away or you 're gon na get in big trouble out of MY BOYFRIEND 'S BACK ! Only a happy ending can bloom your innocence that is full of gloom and doom at the very moment you 're watching this . It 's safe to say that the entire movie fall apart , with a sarcastic approach and tribute to zombie show that defy nonsense to the max . We get a name like `` Johnny '' every so often , and this `` Johnny '' ha nowhere to go . There is n't a specific reason to why our `` dead corpse '' crawl out of his grave just to survive until prom night , so that render the movie totally useless . Without a feeling of sorrow , his mother is convinced to tell the doctor that he 's dead . Johnny take a bite out of Eddie 's arm afterwards . The viewer is asked a tough question : Why doe the movie have to be this cornball ? There is an answer . Any resemblance to all person living or dead is purely coincidental . `` Living '' is a coincidence . `` Dead '' ha nothing in common with the movie . Show this one to your girlfriend and she 'll skip the senior prom , turning your life into a deserted ruin . Blah ! ! !

I remember the event of this movie , the ill fated cruise of Donald Crowhurst in 1968 , in the Golden Globe single handed around the world yacht race . I wa a 13 year old , living in England . The previous year Francis Chichester ( later Sir Francis ; he wa knighted for his exploit ) had completed the first solo circumnavigation of the globe . I remember it mostly because we were given time off school to watch his return ( on a grainy black and white TV ! ) and then his knighting by the Queen . It provoked a huge outpouring of patriotic fervor in the UK . It all seems so quaint now . Chichester became a national hero , but he had stopped half way , in Australia , to re-fit his yacht , so the next logical step for yachtsman wa to attempt the journey without stopping . It 's important to remember that this wa a world pre-GPS , when communication on land were still pretty erratic , never mind in the middle of the ocean . Now with GPS receiver that fit on a key chain and calculate a position within a metre anywhere on earth , it 's hard to recall a time when you could go to sea and quite literally , vanish . As Donald Crowhurst did . A number of yachtsman signed up ( all men back then ) , including mystery man , Crowhurst . Essentially a weekend sailor , Crowhurst had not been a spectacular success in any previous enterprise , including career in the British Army , the Air Force and a an electronics entrepreneur selling navigation aid . He wanted to do something big with his life , and he saw the five thousand pound first prize ( well over $ 100,000 in today 's money ) and the ensuing publicity a a mean of kick starting his business . He signed a deal with a sponsor that proved more watertight than his boat , and which meant failure would bankrupt him , and soon found himself a popular figure with journalist a he prepared for the race . Now the Brits always love the idea of the gutsy amateur taking on the 'pros ' . ( Think Eddie the Eagle losing endless Olympic ski jump competition , and the amateur rider who regularly start the Grand National horse race . ) The public queued up to see him set off , but his boat wa n't really ready , and even a he started ( the last competitor to leave the UK ) Crowhurst must have known he did n't seriously have a chance . But too much wa riding on him to quit . In the wonderful archive footage we see doubt written all over his poor wife 's face . Left behind with their 4 child , she is interviewed movingly throughout the film , together with one of Crowhurst 's son . She wa in a no-win situation . Had she attempted to stop him , she would have been considered a spoiler , but afterward she wa riven with doubt , a to whether she could have saved his life by stopping him . Faced with the certain truth that his boat wa leaking and would never make it through the southern ocean , and unable to turn around and face ridicule , bankruptcy and ignominy , Crowhurst devised a plan to cheat . Laid up offshore Argentina and Brazil , out of radio contact , he waited for the leader to round Cape Horn and start back up the Atlantic , thinking he could sneak in at the end of the line and pretend he had sailed all the way around the globe . He elaborately falsified his log , and made 16mm film and audio recording to back up his plan . But a one after another the other competitor dropped out , he realized that in fact he would come in 2nd and his log would be scrutinized . Unable to face certain detection , his journal suggests he lost his grip on reality and eventually committed suicide . His yacht wa found . He never wa . This beautifully edited film also follows the journey of Bernard Moitessier , an experienced and enigmatic French sailor , who wa in second place and certain of the fastest journey prize , when he abruptly left the race , unable to deal with the clamour and publicity he knew he would face , and sailed into the wide blue yonder , eventually pulling up some 10 month later in Tahiti . Having spent some seven year working at sea myself , ( albeit on very different ship to these ) I well understand the pull of the ocean . Standing on deck , seeing water in every direction to the horizon , knowing there 's a couple of mile of water below you , nothing between you and oblivion but a thin metal hull , without easy access to TV or radio ( even nowadays on most working ship , you feel pretty isolated ) , it 's possible to truly escape from the responsibility of everyday life for a while . There is some thoughtful analysis of what drive people to attempt this kind of very long , lonely journey and the effect it ha on the human mind . Most people would think that attempting to raise 4 child is adventure enough , but much is made of the need for self discovery in the hardship at sea , the search for self . I strongly suspect that Robin Knox Johnston , the ex navy guy who won the race ( and many since ) probably knew pretty well who he wa before he set off , which wa why he succeeded not just in winning the race but also retaining his sanity en route . Those who went searching for something profound within themselves , may not have entirely liked what they found . The marvelous archive footage of Britain in the late 60 is almost reason enough to watch this , ( did it really look quite that bad ? I do n't remember it looking quite so dowdy , but perhaps we blot out the worst aspect of the past ? ) but overall , it is an excellently well made and engrossing movie . Highly recommended .

`` Ally McBeal '' wa a decent enough show , but it wa very overrated . The character become boring after a while and the joke begin to fall short . I think it chose an appropriate point in time to leave - it wa starting to outstay it welcome .

Bad , ambient sound . Lots of shuffling . Loooong pointless scene . Eg : guy see interesting woman in lobby . Manages to stay there and watch her under the guise of waiting for the building supervisor to get a package . Says nothing . Stares creepily . More shuffling and other irritating ambient noise . Wait . Wait . Wait . Guy say nothing . Woman look frightened or at least slightly disturbed about it and rightly so . Manager come back with package . Guy go up to the apartment with the package . Another example : the guy and his host sit around watching bad TV . More ambient noise and shuffling . Wait wait wait wait . Guy wanders off to bed . If you can stand to sit through any more of this movie , you get to watch them watch TV again later . If you want a story , any dialogue , entertainment , or a well crafted film , look elsewhere .

As other viewer have said , this wa a movie I stumbled upon on cable and got so into it I did n't want it to end . Take one Cuban American Navy Ofc . ( Quinn ) who is an upright , uptight soldier and family man . Add a crazed agent ( Donald Sutherland ) who is looking for the world most notorious terrorist and add a Ben Kingsley and you have `` The Assignment '' . Sutherland is a witness of the most notorious terrorist Carlos action in a cafe on a lovely day where he is so profoundly rocked at this man evil that his sole reason to live is to get this man a long a he draw breath . Take one soldier on a pas in Israel who is a dead ringer for this man and is beaten and held by Kingsley until they realize they have a plan . By taking on Carlos by being him , or being forever responsible for never helping rid the world of him , make for a very heavy assignment and guilt trip . By not helping his country he is bound a a man and his military duty to chose wisely . So the training begin . Lets say Carlos training is right up there with the academy of art and holocaust . When I say this intense and wonderfully casted , scripted and executed film rate the best , I am not understating it . All three actor could save almost any script .. together this is a movie to be seen from frame one to credit . I am not into terrorism or movie about it but I got hooked ! Bravo again to Aidan Quinn who for once play a heavy that could hold up to any actor including Gary Oldman . Thats a compliment . Rent it and get lot of popcorn . Oh did I mention the sex ? ? It work better than `` Last Tango ! `` and it educational .

I saw SEA OF DUST a part of a NYC screening audience several year ago . I enjoyed the film at that time , so I wa a little confused by some of the amendment that had been made since . Perhaps it 's my memory , but there seemed to be chunk of exposition missing from the version that wa shown at the Rhode Island Film Festival . I 'm really not sure which version I prefer , but I can honestly say that I found something to appreciate it both . Let me begin by warning everyone that this is not a popcorn movie . Although it 's been promoted a a Hammer Films tribute , people expecting a showdown between Van Helsing and Dracula are going to be sorely disappointed . There 's some cleavage , but no nudity ( a staple of the British production house 's later movie ) . And while SEA OF DUST is filled with gorgeous eye candy ( it really is shot like a sixty film ) , and feature Hammer starlet Ingrid Pitt , it 's not like any of the company 's picture in tone or execution . This film is very dark , very confusing , and ( at time ) very funny . I do n't remember the earlier version being quite a nutty a this one , but that 's not a bad thing ( especially the showdown in the Black Forest that play like a Three Stooges short ) . And some of Ms Pitt 's ranting are quite entertaining . It 's like somebody wound her up and turned her loose . The uniqueness of this film doe n't lie with the borrowed detail , though . It 's in the idea . As an occasional Sci Fi Channel viewer , I 've regularly taken the network to task for it one-note variation on a theme ( CGI monster kill , then get destroyed ) . SEA OF DUST is so full of idea that you start to trip over them after a while . But do n't get me wrong . I 'm not complaining . If anything , I applaud these guy for making such an enterprising low-budget picture and for having the courage to pack it with so many concept . It 's not going to be a picnic for people who hate to think at the movie ( you know who you are ) . But for the rest of u , those of u who are tired of the formula of modern horror film , the predictability , the lack of respect for the audience , this may just be your ticket .

I do n't claim for my money back , just for my time and the time of person I invited to watch this thing ... oh God !

I 'm a Christian . I have always been skeptical about movie made by Christians , however . As a rule , they are `` know-nothings '' when it come to movie production . I admire TBN for trying to present God and Jesus in a positive and honest way on the screen . However , they did a hideous job of it . The acting wa horrible , and unless one is familiar with the Bible in some fashion , one COULD NOT have understood what the movie wa trying to get across . Not only wa the movie terribly made , but the people who made it even had some fact wrong . However , in this `` critique '' , those fact are irrelevent and too deep to delve into . In short , the Omega Code is the absolute worst movie I have ever seen , and I would not recommend it to anyone , except for comic relief from the every day grind .

Having finally caught up with this `` masterpiece , '' it strike me that it must have seemed terribly clever , in it day . It 's French , arty , under-played to the point of agony , and ultimately downbeat . But viewed from the vantage of 37 year in the future , it 's also just a bit vacuous , pretentious and unsatisfying . Others have summarized the story , but I do n't think anyone ha pointed out the dramatic flaw at the heart of this film : the lead character , Corey and Vogel , really do n't deserve what they get . They play square within their code , never harm anyone who did n't ask for it , and show great courage and initiative . Moreover , Corey in particular is victimized by his former gangland 'friend , ' who stole his girl and who repeatedly try to have him killed , apparently just because he ( Corey ) dared to 'borrow ' a few thousand franc . These are guy who really ought to be due for a break ! Instead , thing go far worse for them than they really need to , within the logic of the story . One might contend that this is the whole point : that the real villain never get caught ; that they collude with the police a needed , sell out their friend , and always come out on top . But that 's not shown either . Corey 's old gangster friend is not shown colluding with the police . Nor is he shown gloating over his victory . In fact , after materializing several time when he 's needed , he 's nowhere to be seen at the conclusion , leaving a dramatic tension ( his feud with Corey ) entirely unresolved ! Nonetheless , I 'd say this film is well worth seeing for it beautiful photography , it slow , deliberate pacing , it great deadpan performance , it elaborate heist sequence , and it encapsulation of the art-film style of the late 1960s .

Thoughtless , ignorant , ill-conceived , career-killing ( where is the talented Angela Jones now ? ) , deeply unfunny garbage . It 's no wonder Reb Braddock ha n't directed anything else since - anyone who ha a chance to make his first film on his own rule , based on his own script , with the help of Quentin Tarantino himself , and creates something like THIS , anyone who feel that THIS wa a story worth telling to the world , doe n't deserve a second break . Under the circumstance , the performance are good - the actor do what they 're told to do , and they do it well . It 's just that they should n't have done it in the first place . 0 out of 4 .

Jim Carrey is one of the funniest and most gifted comedian in film today . With his hyperactive spontaneity and his rubber face he can just go crazy , and we love him for it . He ha the ability to make mediocre comedy ( ala Ace Ventura ) , and turn them into decent comedic outing . Or , in the case of 'Liar Liar ' , make them some of the most hilarious contemporary comedy around . Carrey ha also proven himself capable of tackling drama . He wa excellent in both 'Man on the Moon ' and 'The Truman Show . ' The guy is remarkable . Then come 'Bruce Almighty , ' an ideal vehicle for Carrey , and a premise that should have worked ; Carrey , after complaining about God and how his life stink , is enabled with God 's power . However , the script is pure recycled garbage . Now , no matter how bad a script is , Carrey 's improvisation alone sometimes make an unfunny scene funny . The problem is that there are very few opportunity for Carrey to be unleashed because so much of the comedy relies on silly special effect , only some of which are amusing . Carrey is rarely able to improvise because he ha to work around the special effect . The writer apparently thought that all these special effect and superpower sequence were funny , because the rest of the movie is simply filler giving Carrey nothing else to work with besides a whiny character who is absolutely humorless . He seems more like a 5-year yearning for our attention , wanting the viewer to find what he is doing funny , when it 's really just annoying . I have always enjoyed Jennifer Aniston on 'Friends ' and she wa superb in last year 's 'The Good Girl . ' She too ha a gift for comedy , but with the script a linear a it is , she is simply given the part of the bitter girlfriend . She come across a nagging , grumpy , and there is no chemistry between the two star . 'Bruce Almighty ' should have been a comedy that work . But it doe n't even have the gut to tackle the subject matter that it 's making fun of ; religion . A few minor giggle ( his internet is Yehweh ) , but instead it 's just turned into a comedic superpower comedy . Not to mention that it 's tone shift from silly to heavy-handed , and even black comedy at time . The movie fails on nearly every level . That 's not to see it is entirely devoid of laugh , but it 's close . Any movie that feel the need to incorporate scene of a dog peeing to get it 's laugh ha problem . But hey , if you find pee joke funny , go for it .

Shameless Screen Entertainment is a relatively new and British ( I think ) DVD-label , specializing in smutty and excessively violent cult movie  mostly Italian one - from the glorious era when everything wa possible , namely from the late 60 's up until the mid-80 's . The label 's selection feel like a crossover between the oeuvre of `` Mondo Macabro '' and `` No Shame '' ( they probably even borrowed the name of the latter ) and they already released some really rare sick Italian puppy like `` Ratman '' , `` My Dear Killer '' , `` Killer Nun '' , `` Phantom of Death '' and `` Torso '' . `` The Frightened Woman '' wa completely unknown to me , but since fellow reviewer from around here , whose opinion I hugely value , described it a one of the greatest and most mesmerizing psychedelic euro-sexploitation movie of it era , I did n't hesitate to pick it up . This is a very weird film and probably not suitable for about 99 % of the average cinema-loving audience . If you 're part of that remaining 1 % , however , you 're in for a really unique treat . The style , atmosphere and content are similar to Jess Franco 's `` Succubus '' and Massimo Dallamano 's `` Venus in Furs '' , yet they 're both widely considered a classic whereas `` The Frightened Woman '' is virtually unknown . It 's all a matter of profiling and good marketing , I guess . The story revolves on a literally filthy rich doctor ( he life in a gigantic secluded mansion , owns multiple old-timer car and ha a very impressive collection of artsy relic including a life-size mannequin doll replica of himself ) with a bizarre and slightly offbeat attitude towards woman . He considers them a threat for the survival of the male race and thus spends his day kidnapping , humiliating and sexually abusing random he pick up from the street . Dr. Sayer then abducts the ambitious journalist Maria with the intention to completely crush her female spirit , but he slowly fall for her . Just he start to believe in actual love , she strike back with a vengeance . This really is n't for everyone , but if you can appreciate moody & sinisterly sexy ambiance , bizarre scenery toy and psychedelic touch that seem utterly implausible and surreal , you can consider this one a top recommendation . It 's slow , stylishly sleazy and totally bonkers Shameless Entertainment , all right !

The key scene in Rodrigo Garcia 's `` Nine Lives '' come when Sissy Spacek , hidden away in a hotel room where she is carrying on an affair with Aiden Quinn , find a nature documentary on television , at which point Quinn note the contrivance of such thing -- disparate footage is edited into one scene , predator and prey are thrown together in order to capture the moment -- all to force connection where none actually exist . Characters in the nine short that make up this film occasionally spill over into each others story , but none of them ever seem to really connect . A woman preparing for a violent confrontation with her abusive father is later seen working in a hospital room where another woman is preparing for a mastectomy . A man who run into an old girlfriend in a supermarket and see how his life should have been later host , with his current wife , a dinner party for an unhappy couple . Garcia arranges some of his character in front of each other , but none of the subsequent story ever really build on what came before . Garcia 's first film , the wonderful , overlooked `` Things You Can Tell Just By Looking At Her , '' also had a short-story structure and overlapping character , but there were fewer of them and they had a lot more room to breathe and grow . The gimmicky premise of `` Nine Lives , '' that each of it nine story is told in a single , unbroken take in real time , never allows the film to build up any real dramatic tension or momentum . It 's also a fairly visually ugly movie . Interior shot are often murky and hard to watch , while other scene -- particularly one where a girl walk back and forth between room to talk to her uncommunicative parent -- are rendered annoying by the camera-work . Given that this is Garcia 's third film and that he ha a respectable history of directing for television , the direction in this film is rather surprisingly amateurish . Like fellow filmmaker-child-of-a-great-writer Rebecca Miller , Garcia ( son of Gabriel Garcia Marquez ) is focused on the writing and character aspect of his film often to the detriment of the film-making one . Individual scene are touching and even affecting . I did like Jason Issacs kissing Robin Wright Penn 's pregnant belly . And Joe Mantegna whispering lovingly to his wife a she slip into pre-surgery sedation . And Sissy Spacek stealing a few happy moment away from her life with Aiden Quinn before brought back to it with a phone call from her daughter . But the film ( unlike `` Things You Can Tell Just By Looking At Her '' ) feel more like an exercise than actual drama . We are just watching people act .

MINOR PLOT SPOILERS AHEAD ! ! ! How did such talented actor get involved in such mindless retreaded drivel ? Robert DeNiro play a Dumb Hollywood version of the standard violence prone tough cop ( i.e. , he beat up the bad guy and roll his eye at cop who prefer to stick by the book ) , and Eddie Murphy play a not so tough cop who would rather be an actor ( i.e. , he scream out , `` Freeze , police ! '' and ha his `` tough look '' down pat ) . Naturally , they are partnered when Bobby 's loose cannon tactic get him in hot water with the medium and he is essentially blackmailed into starring in a `` Cops '' -like reality show . Take a breath , cuz that 's a funny a it get . No energy wa put into the script - it feel like a pale retread of every copy buddy movie tossed into a blender with `` 15 Minutes '' starring , yes , DeNiro himself a , pretty much the character he is playing here . The joke fall flat , the action feel listless , and no one seems to be having a good time . It 's dead on the screen . Please do n't waste your time . Even if you have an overwheming affinity for one of the actor - avoid it and do them a favor . Becauze if this make money , these kinda of script will be deeemed perfectly acceptable for actor of their quality . And to Mr. DeNiro . You used to make serious film . I remember them - they were good . You were nominated for award for them - remember how much fun that wa ? Now after `` Analyze This '' ( which wa good ) , `` Meet the Parents '' ( which wa also good ) , and `` The Adventures of Rocky and Bullwinkle '' ( which wa NOT good ) , I think we need to see you parodying yourself le , and BEING yourself more . `` Casino '' feel like a long time ago . And no , I do n't count `` 15 Minutes '' a serious Bobby . Anyone who took that medium satire seriously must get their weekly world news

I ca n't really see how anyone can have any interest whatsoever in seeing this movie . A woman meet a man , he want to play game , she too , but only until she realise what she 's missing . She leaf , and that 's it really . It took 9 1/2 week before Elizabeth ( Kim Basinger ) left John ( Mickey Rourke ) . She should have left him after 30 minute and ended our misery .

A major disappointment . This wa one of the best UK crime drama / detective show from the 90 's which developed the fascinating title character played by Scotland 's Robbie Coltrane . However this one-off ha little to add and perhaps suffers from an inevitable let down due to raised expectation when a favored show return after a long hiatus . Coltrane is n't really given much to do , much more attention is spent on the uninteresting killer , and in what he ha to act in , he seems uninvolved , almost bored . The ex-soldier 's story is written by the book and the attempt to update u on Coltrane 's family life seems lightweight . Perhaps if the writer had a whole series in front of them instead of just this one two-hour show they would have written this with much more depth . As is , skip this and watch the old Cracker from the 90 's which is far far superior .

Almost all cast do n't play their character well , exception for Sophie and Frederic . The plot could give a rise a better movie if the right piece wa in the right place . OK , how 's this for original- this mean , rich old geezer leaf his estate to his adult child , all of them ungrateful loser , and two creepy servant , provided they spend the week in his spooky old house . What happens that night will surprise only those who have n't seen a movie or television show before . After a string of murder in which the victim look like they 're bleeding restaurant ketchup , we have a painfully obvious twist ending . The cast is lead by some once respectable actor must have been desperate for their paycheck . There are also a few second-tier actor who were rising at the time but long forgotten now . As a result , the film generates all the drama and mystery of an episode of `` Matlock . '' I will give credit where it 's due- the closing scene is clever and amusing , if you 're still awake .

L'Auberge Espagnole is full of energy , and it 's honest , realistic , and refreshing . Not a comedy or drama but more a slice of life movie about this particular group of very interesting but still normal young people who share an apartment in Barcelona for one year . Beautifully photographed with a nice soundtrack . If you 're older , this movie should bring back a flood of good memory . If you 're young , learn by this example .

Make sure you make this delightful comedy part of your holiday season ! If you admire Dennis Morgan or Barbara Stanwyck , this film is a fun one to watch . Recommended !

`` Så som i himmelen `` .. a above so below .. that very special point where Divine and Human meet . I ADORE this film ! A gem . YES amazing grace ! I wa so deeply moved by it very HUMAN quality .
