At the height of the 'Celebrity Big Brother ' racism row in 2007 ( involving Shilpa Shetty and the late Jade Goody ) , I condemned on an internet forum those ' C.B.B . ' fan who praised the show , after year of bashing 'racist ' '70 's sitcom such a 'Curry & Chips ' & 'Love Thy Neighbour ' . I thought they were being hypocritical , and said so . 'It Ai n't Half Hot Mum ' wa then thrown into the argument , with some pointing out it had starred an English actor blacked-up . Well , yes , but Michael Bates had lived in India a a boy , and spoke Urdu fluently . The show 's detractor overlook the reality he brought to his performance a bearer 'Rangi Ram ' . The noted Indian character actor , Renu Setna , said in a 1995 documentary 'Perry & Croft : The Sitcoms ' that he wa upset when he heard Bates had landed the role , but added : `` No Indian actor could have played that role a well a Bates. '' . Indeed . 'Mum ' wa Perry and Croft 's companion show to 'Dad 's Army ' ; also set in wartime , the sedate English town of Walmington-On-Sea had been replaced by the hot , steamy jungle of India , in particularly a place called Deolali , where an army concert party put on show for the troop , among them Bombadier Solomons ( George Layton , his first sitcom role since 'Doctor In Charge ' ) , camp Gunner 'Gloria ' Beaumont ( Melvyn Hayes ) , diminutive Gunner 'Lofty ' Sugden , 'Lah de-dah ' Gunner Graham ( John Clegg ) , and Gunner Parkins ( the late Christopher Mitchell ) . Presiding over this gang of misfit wa the bellicose Sergeant-Major Williams ( the brilliant Windsor Davies ) , who regarded them all a 'poofs ' . His frustration at not being able to lead his men up the jungle to engage the enemy in combat made him bitter and bullying ( though he wa nice to Parkins , whom he thought wa his illegitimate son ! ) . Then there wa ever-so English Colonel Reynolds ( Donald Hewlett ) and dimwitted Captain Ashwood ( Michael Knowles ) . Rangi wa like a wise old sage , beginning each show by talking to the camera and closing them by quoting obscure Hindu proverb . He loved being bearer so much he came to regard himself a practically British . His friend were the tea-making Char Wallah ( the late Dino Shafeek , who went on to 'Mind Your Language ' ) and the rope pulling Punka Wallah ( Babar Bhatti ) . So real Indians featured in the show - another point it detractor ignore . Shafeek also provided what wa described on the credit a 'vocal interruption ' ( similar to the '40 's song used a incidental music on 'Dad 's Army ' ) . Each edition closed with him warbling 'Land Of Hope & Glory ' only to be silenced by a 'Shut Up ! ' from Williams . The excellent opening theme wa penned by Jimmy Perry and Derek Taverner . Though never quite equalling 'Dad 's Army ' in the public 's affection , 'Mum ' nevertheless wa popular enough to run for a total of eight season . In 1975 , Davies and Estelle topped the chart with a cover version of that old chestnut 'Whispering Grass ' . They then recorded an entire album of old chestnut , entitled ( what else ? ) 'Sing Lofty ! ' . The show hit crisis point three year later when Bates died of cancer . Rather than recast the role of 'Rangi ' , the writer just let him be quietly forgotten . When George Layton left , the character of 'Gloria ' took his place a 'Bombadier ' , providing another source of comedy . The last edition in 1981 saw the soldier leave India by boat for Blighty , the Char Wallah watching them go with great sadness ( a did viewer ) . Repeats have been few and far between ( mainly on U.K. Gold ) all because of it so-called 'dodgy ' reputation . This is strange . For one thing , the show wa not specifically about racism . If a white man blacked-up is so wrong , why doe David Lean 's 1984 film ' A Passage to India ' still get shown on television ? ( it featured Alec Guinness a an Indian , and won two Oscars ! ) . It wa derived from Jimmy Perry 's own experience . Some character were based on real people ( the Sergeant-Major really did refer to his men a 'poofs ' ) . I take the view that if you are going to put history on television , get it right . Sanitizing the past , no matter how unsavoury it might seem to modern audience , is fundamentally dishonest . 'Mum ' wa both funny and truthful , and viewer saw this . Thank heaven for D.V.D . 's I say . Time to stop this review . As Williams would say : `` I 'll have no gossiping in this jungle ! ''

I am from Texas , and live very close to Plano where the actual death occurred , so I might be a bit biased in saying that `` Wasted '' is a film that you just ca n't get out of your head . Stahl , Phoenix , and Paul all play their character very realistically . You truly believe that they are everyday high school student who just happen to be heroin addict . The drug content is handled very graphically a well - although everything that happens in the film serf a purpose , and each moment the character spiral further downward is heartbreaking . I definitely recommend this film to anyone . Once you watch it , it stick with you !

Mukhsin is a beautiful movie about a first love story . Everyone probably ha one , and this is writer-director Yasmin Ahmad 's story of hers , with a boy called Mukhsin . We know that her movie have been semi-autobiographical of sort , having scene drawn upon her personal experience , and it is indeed this sharing and translating of these emotion to the big screen , that ha her film always exude a warm sincerity and honesty . Mukhsin is no different , and probably the most polished ad confident work to date ( though I must add , a a personal bias , that Sepet still ha a special place in my heart ) . Our favourite family is back - Pak Atan , Mak Inom , Orked and Kak Yam , though this time , we go back to when Orked is age 10 . The character are all younger from the movie we 've journeyed with them , from Rabun to Gubra , and here , Sharifah Amani 's sister Sharifah Aryana and Sharifah Aleya take on the role of Orked and Mak Inom respectively , which perhaps accounted for their excellent chemistry together on screen , nevermind that their not playing sibling role . The only constant it seems is Kak Yam , played by Adibah Noor , and even Pak Atan ha hair on his head ! Through Mukshin the movie , we come full circle with the character , and the world that Yasmin ha introduced u to . We come to learn of and understand the family a little bit more , set in the day when they 're still living in their kampung ( revisited back in Rabun ) , where Orked attends a Chinese school , and pack some serious combination of punch ( and you wonder about that burst of energy in Gubra , well , she had it in her since young ! ) . The perennial tomboy and doted child of the family , she prefers playing with the boy in game , rather than mindless `` masak-masak '' with the girl , and favourite outing include going with the family to football match . The arrival of a boy called Mukhsin ( Mohd Syafie Naswip ) to the village provides a cool peer for Orked to hang out and do stuff with - cycling through the village , climbing tree , flying kite . And a what is desired to be explored , the crossing of that line between friendship and romance , both beautiful emotion . Mukhsin doe have it cheeky moment which liven up the story , and bring about laughter , because some of the incident , we would have experienced it ourselves , and sometimes serve a a throwback to our own recollection of childhood . In short , those scene screamed `` fun '' ! We observe the life in a typical kampung , where some neighbour are very nice , while others , the nosy parker and rumour monger , spreading ill gossip stemming from envy . There are 2 additional family dynamic seen , one from an immediate neighbour , and the other from Mukhsin 's own , both of which serve a adequate subplots , and contrast to Orked 's own . As always , Yasmin 's movie are filled with excellent music , and for Mukhsin , it ha something special , the song `` Hujan '' a penned by her father , a well a `` Ne Me Quitte Pas '' , aptly used in the movie Given that the Yasmin 's movie to date have been centred around the same character , the beauty of it is that you can watch them a stand alone , or when watched and pieced together , make a compelling family drama dealing with separate theme and universal issue like interracial romance , love , and forgiveness . Fans will definitely see the many link in Mukhsin back to the earlier movie , while new audience will surely be curious to find out certain why and significance of recurring character or event , like that pudgy boy who steal glance at Orked . And speaking of why , part of Mukhsin too is curiously open , which probably is distinctive of Yasmin 's style , or deliberately left a such . I thought that a a story about childhood , recollected from memory , then there are detail which will be left out for sure . And subtly , I felt that Mukhsin exhibited this perfectly , with not so detailed detail , and the focus on what can be remembered in significant episode between the two . Another highly recommended movie , and a rare one that I feel is suitable for all age - bring along your kid brother or sister !

The film is partly a thriller and partly a public-service announcement when seeing the event through the perspective of politician , terrorist and of course victim . In this smart drama lesson are given about contamination and surviving chaos while meantime the backstage look at the way crisis is managed prompt viewer to distrust guardian and to be scared by assailant . The film , originally aired on BBC , get to arouse effectively doubt on official prepareparedness . Performances are proper , understated though never terrific . The flick is just a beginning , a provocative start leading to a larger discussion but it get to work in my opinion , giving the right thrill and causing the audience to reason and to ask itself question .

This could have been great . The voice-overs are exactly right and fit the character to a T. One small problem though ; the look of the character , mostly the supporting or guest character look exactly the same . The same bored look on every face only with minor change such a hairline or weight size . It look kind of odd to see a really big guest star 's voice coming out of a lifeless form like the character here . If I am not mistaken Kathy Griffin did a voice-over for this show and it looked too odd to be funny . There is a few other problem , one being the family plot . The Simpsons did it much better where you could actually buy most of the situation the character got themselves into . Here we get too much annoying diversion , like someone having a weird fantasy and then we are supposed to find that funny but for some reason the delivery is a bit off . As you can probably tell it is hard for me to put a finger on exactly what is wrong with this show because it basically nothing more than a clone of the Simpsons or even more `` Married with Children '' . If I should point a finger on what is totally wrong with this it probably is it 's repetitiveness . Peter Griffin is not really a bright character but neither are any of the others . Lois should have been named Lois Lame because she is sort of one-dimensional . Seth Green a the kind of retarded son is the best thing about this show and that is the most stereotypical part on the show . So what more can I say . There is n't exactly anything wrong with this show but in the long run you have to admit that it take a lot of work to do what the Simpsons ha done for almost two decade .

A good documentary reviewing the background behind our society oil addiction , the problem concerning our present energy usage and finally discus the effect of the coming energy deficit originating from the peak oil production problem . This movie should be educated to all student a part of their education . Show it to your child , parent , relative and friend . They will thank you eventually . After reviewing the content of this documentary and comparing it mentioned source I would say that the fact in this movie are well scientifically supported .

Not the best plot in the world , but the comedy in this movie rule . Kelsey Grammar is wonderful in this movie . Another funny guy is Rob Schneider who will make you crack up with his segment with Ken Hudson Campbell who play Buckman . Lauren Holly play probably the more serious character in the cast a Lt. Lake . Bruce Dern is a great actor in this movie , playing probably the most serious character in the movie . The actor i liked the most wa Toby Huss a Nitro , all the electric shot his character take in the movie is hilarious . Plot is a little uneven , about Lt . Commander Tom Dodge , who for year ha wanted to Command his own sub . When he finally get the chance , instead of a brand new sub , he get a rusty WWII Diesel Sub , the Stingray . His crew is n't any better , misfit of the U.S. Navy . He is then put in a series of War Games , that show how an old Diesel Engine can handle itself against the current Nuclear Navy . Things still do n't get any better when he find out his dive officer is actually a female officer , to see how Women do on actual Subs . To get the commander position he want , he ha to win the War Games , and blow up a Dummy Ship . The movie fair quite well , in fact i laughed non-stop when i saw this movie in theater . I loved when they were in silence and Buckman fart , and everyones reaction to the smell is hilarious . Overall , 9 out of 10 , this movie is just plain fun to watch , it nice to have a movie like this , i hate movie that try to be 100 % serious .

What a surprise ; two outstanding performance by the lead actress in this film . This is the best work Busy Phillips ha ever done and the best from Erika Christensen since Traffic . This film certainly should be in Oscar contention . See this movie !

Felt it wa very balanced in showing what Jehovahs Witnesses have done in protecting American freedom . It also showed the strong faith of two family who were first generation witness . I also appreciated how it showed how by becoming a Jehovahs Witness affect non-witness family member and how hard it is for them to accept the fact that they do n't celebrate holiday , the sad part is that non-witness family do not think of having their witness family over for family dinners/visits or give them gift at any other time but for holiday or birthday . When it come to medical care the witness want and expect a high standard of medical care , what people forget is that blood transfusion allow for sloppy medical care and surgery whereas bloodless treatment cause the medical team to be highly skilled and trained , which would you prefer to treat your loved one ? I highly recommend this video !

A proof that it 's not necessary for a movie to have a deep many-layered story and other sophisticated element to be a good movie . Even if the story could be expanded in many direction , especially in more sociological way ( people lust for money ) it seems that it 's perfect just the way it is . Through many sudden change it take the spectator to the end without any unnecessary complication and without letting the spectator taking the eye of the screen . But the acting for me is n't so good . With the exception of Lindsey McKeon the others were average or even worst . In some scene they just empty-stared in front of themselves . For exception of Lindsey which wa more convincing . It 's a really simple movie for just laying back and enjoying . 7/10

I also saw this at the cinema in the 80 and have never forgotten it , even though I have never seen it again anywhere . I do n't know whether if I did see it now it would seem dated , but remembering the storyline and comparing it to some of the terrible modern film I 've seen on Zone Horror I should think it would stand up very well . I can still remember his coffin sliding out and opening up and all the dead body becoming reanimated , and the blue lightning . Having seen hundred of horror movie and still remembering this one , it must be good .

The film `` Chaos '' take it name from Gleick 's 1988 pop science explanation of chaos theory . What doe the book or anything related to the content of the book have to do with the plot of the movie `` Chaos '' ? Nothing . The film maker seem to have skimmed the book ( obviously without understanding a thing about it ) looking for a `` theme '' to united the series of mundane action sequence that overlie the flimsy string of event that act in place of a plot in the film . In this respect , the movie `` Choas '' resembles the Canadian effort `` Cube , '' in which prime number function a a device to mystify the audience so that the ridiculousness of the plot will not be noticed : in `` Cube '' a bunch of prime number are tossed in so that viewer will attribute their lack of understanding to lack of knowledge about prime : the same approach is taken in `` Chaos '' : disconnected extract from Gleick 's book are thrown in make the doings of the bad guy in the film seem fiendishly clever . This , of course , is an insultingly condescending treatment of the audience , and any literate viewer of `` Chaos '' who can stand to sit through the entire film will end up bewildered . How could a film so bad be made ? Rewritten a a novel , the story in `` Chaos '' would probably not even make it past a literary agent 's secretary 's desk . How could ( at least ) hundred of thousand ( and probably million ) of dollar have been thrown away on what can only be considered a waste of time for everyone except those who took home money from the film ? Regarding what 's in the movie , every performance is phoned in . Save for technical glitch , it would be astonishing if more than one take wa used for any one scene . The story is uniformly senseless : the last time I saw a story to disconnected it wa the production of a literal eight-year-old . Among other massive shortcoming are the following : The bad guy leaf hint for the police to follow . He ha no reason whatsoever for leaving such hint . Police officer do not carry or use radio . Dupes of the bad guy have no reason to act in concert with the bad guy . Let me strongly recommend that no one watch this film . If there is any other movie you like ( or even simply do not hate ) watch that instead .

I rented this movie with my friend for a good laugh . We actually got laughed at by the clerk at the video store because of our questionable movie taste . Unfortunately , I do n't remember the first half of the movie because all I did wa stare at the giant metal brace Jane wore . and I did n't hear anything either due to the incomprehensible lisp . The other thing that wa able to grasp my attention besides her metal mouth wa her questionable fashion sense . This movie wa made in 2005 but it seems like the wardrobe people jumped all the way back to 2000 for the clothes . If you remember the day when Aaron Carter wa considered a `` popstar '' and you like high waisted jean , ankle sock and knee length skirt , then this little trip down memory lane is perfect for you .

Silent historical drama based on the story of Anne Boleyn , newly arrived lady-in-waiting to the Queen who catch the lustful eye of Henry VIII , bad-tempered King of England who love to feast , drink , hunt , be entertained by his court jester , watch joust , and chase around after young beauty who jump out of cake and assorted attractive female around the castle . Well , he 's soon annulled his marriage , married Anne , and telling her it is her holy duty to produce a male heir . She fails on that score and he soon ha his eye on yet another lady-in-waiting . Meanwhile , Anne spends pretty much the entire film looking hesitant , perturbed , or downright ready to burst into tear . She just doe n't come across a a happy camper ( or is it just bad acting ? ! ) . This film is a solid piece of entertainment , with an absorbing story that held my interest for two hour - plus I enjoyed seeing the very lavish medieval costuming featured here on a gorgeous sepia tinted print . Emil Jannings is quite striking and memorable in his well-done portrayal of King Henry the Eighth - he really seemed like he WAS Henry the Eighth . I am not so sure about the performance given by the actress who play Anne , seemed a bit over the top . The DVD of this film feature an appropriate , nicely done piano score that perfectly suit this story . Quite a good film .

As a camera operator , I could n't help but admire the great look that this picture achieved . The performance were excellent , a wa the story . Just when I thought this film wa about to slow down , it did n't . Heart-pounding tension , great pacing through editing , and a score that know when to be quiet all come together here under competent and capable direction . The camera wa always in the right place . Love that .

I just saw this movie at a sneak preview and all I can say is ... '' What did I just watch ? ? ? ? '' And I mean that in a good and bad way . The plot is really simple . Stiller and Black play friends/neighbors . Stiller is the focused , hardworker while Black is a dreamer . Black invents this idea to create a spray that era poo . The idea becomes very popular , and Black becomes very rich . The extravagant lifestyle that Black gain and the fact that he still try to be best friend with Stiller cause Stiller to become crazy with envy . As I said , the plot is simple . Everything else is plain odd . The direction is odd , with a weird rotating opening shot to out-of-nowhere sped up sequence . The dialouge and the acting is very odd ; odd in a rambling sort of way . And the sound track is the oddest thing in the movie , from the weird `` Envy '' song that keep on reappearing to the scene where you think you 're going to hear a classic 80 's song but suddenly it 's in Japanese . So , the true question is this ... is odd funny ? That depends purely on the individual . I wa cracking up at the shear unwavering weirdness of the movie . After the screening I heard people call it horribly unfunny and glad that it wa free . Strangely , I understood their point . There are no joke whatsoever , so if you are n't hooked by the uniqueness of it all , you will hate this movie . Absolutely hate it . This movie is destined to lose a lot of money at the box office and become a DVD cult classic . If you can laugh at a movie with no real joke , like Cable Guy or Punch Drunk Love , then I suggest you see it . If you do n't , run away from this movie . It 'll only make you mad .

Duchess is a pretty white cat who life with her three kitten in her wealthy owner 's mansion in Paris . When the evil butler hears that the rich old lady is leaving everything in her will to the cat first , the butler is angered , because he want to get everything first . So he put them to sleep and abandon them off the side of the road . When the cat wake up , they start on a long trek home . A street wise cat named Thomas O'Malley meet up with them and offer to help them . When Edgar see them arriving home , he is furious , and start to mail them to Timbucktu . But Thomas ' friend arrive to help save the day . The wealthy lady decides to leave her home for every alley cat in Paris . This is a charming film . The song , including `` Everybody Wants to be a Cat '' , are lively and upbeat . The voice cast is excellent , with Eva Gabor ( who would later play Miss Bianca in Disney 's THE RESCUERS film ) a Duchess , Phil Harris ( Baloo in THE JUNGLE BOOK , Little John in ROBIN HOOD ) a Thomas , giving interesting personality to their character . Supposedly Walt Disney , before he died in 1966 , gave the go-ahead to this film . Recommended for Disney fan or cat lover everywhere ! 10/10 .

Slipknot is a hardcore rock band from Des Moines , Iowa . Nine band member who all wear customized boilersuit , and personalized , homemade mask ( eg . # 6 's clown mask , # 0 's various gasmask , # 8 's tattered + torn crashtest dummie mask with dreadlock ) . The music itself seems to walk the finelines between sane and otherwise , yet is performed so brilliantly and psychotic . `` Welcome To Our Neighborhood '' sound rather a generic title , but the footage itself is something else . Interviews with the band , soundbites from their latest , selftitled album , 2 live performance , and one banned-by-MTV music video ( a brilliant homage to the classic Kubrick film `` The Shining '' ) , the movie clock in at not even half-an-hour , but is certainly worth it . It is perfect for introducing any metal/hardcore fan to Slipknot .

The review on the main page admits that the movie is horrible but that you should forgive it because it is nicely violent . No you should n't . There are spoiler at the end of this review but how I can `` spoil '' this rotten movie I have no idea . Even if you are a die hard Alien/Pred fan like I am wait for the DVD . It is n't worth a 3.99 rental either but you 'll be much le inclined to truly hate this film if you pay that than 12 buck or better per person plus concession purchase at a theater . In the theater I watched AVPr there were exactly two laugh , both by a girl sitting next to me . Other than that there wa total silence throughout . No ooohs , or `` that wa bad as ! `` , nothing . Imagine being a patient on an operating table and just being given the anesthetic . Now you know what you 'll feel like in the theater after the opening scene of AVPr . What wa the budget on this movie ? Like War of the Worlds , MI 3 , and other f/x driven movie the director seems far more involved in what the CGI people can come up with than developing character or a plot . Spielberg ha tried and failed at this several time , usually with Tom Cruise . Sure the movie make money but should they ? War of the Worlds and Minority Report had the budget to pay for a decent script , Tom Cruise et al , and SS himself but were still awful . I 'm sure AVP wasted 90 % of their budget on CG and had no choice but to hire any actor that would say yes even though the casting agent would have done better by going to the supermarket and picking actor at random . There is no tension developed in any scene so we are never close to being surprised . Who care who get killed ? We did n't know any of them , we all know what happens when the lil alien make their corporeal exit , we all know the blood is acid . In Alien , Aliens , 3 , Resurrection , and even AVP the director make use of the fact that the Aliens can think , can hide and can lay trap . This director decided that the Ridley Scott , James Cameron , and others were idiot for developing character you actually want to see either live or get killed . In this installment you will never care who life or dy , not a kid , a parent , a pregnant woman . The character serve only one purpose in this movie , to die . The opening scene establish the fact that the movie is going to be a predictable joke . The character development scene mix clichés , bad humor , and bad acting and numb the viewer to the point where we really do n't care if they get killed so long a they die in never before seen way . But they do n't . The director tried to make something different from those who preceded him in the Alien franchise but only succeeded in discarding the good part of the first film , the human protagonist , and stealing the rest from other recent sci-fi film . There is not one original use of the either the Alien or Pred character . The Pred actually ha little trouble killing Aliens by the dozen even though the last movie led u to believe that Pred revered the Aliens a such a deadly foe that they used the killing of one a Rite of Passage . The AlienPred is never really developed a a fearsome creature . Its ability to inject parasite into a host is ripped from several different movie most recently probably wa Hellboy where Samiel 's dismembered tongue injected egg into Hellboy or Doom where the mutated creature would leave their tongue behind after they speared a victim 's throat . Simply put we are n't given reason to care about anything in this movie . There is violence but it doe n't shock or surprise and is nothing that ha n't been seen in any of a hundred slasher flick . The CG is OK and both specie of alien are made to look and move a they have in movie past . But since the character are never developed and the acting is so bad we kind of hope that they all die . The little girl wa probably the best actor of the bunch but sadly we are n't made to care whether or not kid , woman , or anyone else life or dy . We just want the movie to end . Eventually it doe but not before another stolen plot line from Resident Evil 2 ha a nuke aim Gunnison 's way to wipe out the `` infection '' . And not before yet another stupid scene that is supposed to open the door for further sequel but doe it ? In a movie filled with bad scene the worst may have been saved for last . Sorry for the repetition but everything bear repeating : bad script , no plot , unoriginal action scene , uninspired direction , abysmal acting , decent f/x that were wasted because of the many flaw . I do n't mind going to an indie film and being disappointed . The actor and director and crew are probably getting their career going and working on a shoestring budget . For a movie with this type of budget and hype I feel cheated along with disappointed . This movie is a painfully boring waste of time from the opening scene to closing credit . Sad to say that a preview of Hellboy 2 wa the best part of AVPr and HB2 did n't even look that good .

The movie plot seems to have been constructed from a disjointed dream . There is not enough realism to hold the viewer 's interest . The Vermont Farm scene wa a failed opportunity to show the way farm were set up and farm family lived which would have been interesting and entertaining . There wa little if no research into the whiskey bootlegging trade of the period . The costume of the Canadians looked like something from the French Revolution , totally unbelievable . The fiddle playing wa good and of the time period but Chris 's motion while supposedly playing were unbelievable . The owl 's appearance wa a never explained mystery and the train disappearing into thin air wa too much . I could n't understand how a live trout got frozen into the ice and why two men in the wilderness without food would release the trout , a good food source .

It 's 2005 , my friend ... a time of amazing special effect and an age of technology . So , why ca n't we see a movie that 's a little more thought out than this cheesy low-budget film . I 've seen a lot of low-budget movie that rock my sock off , but this one ... it 's almost a if it 's trying to be horrible . Just ... do n't ... watch it . I can look past lack of special effect and computer generated scene if the acting itself wa at least good . I feel like a small child produced this entire movie . There 's not even an original plot line . Vampire Assassins , in itself is one big plot hole with an attempt to mock itself . Can someone tell me if , perhaps , this wa designed a a comedy movie and I just did n't know it ? It make me wonder , what doe the sequel have in store for u who so loved the first installment ?

Even with a cast that boast such generally reliable name a Val Kilmer and Lisa Kudrow , Wonderland fails to yield any sense of depth to this film . It barely brush the surface of the incident that happened on that July night in 1981 . Kilmer just go through the motion a John Holmes and Kudrow and Kate Bosworth are both hopefully miscast in the other two lead role ; a Holmes 's wife and underage girlfriend , respectively . The rest of the cast ha such small role that it 's impossible to get any dimension from them . The film also star Carrie Fisher , Ted Levine , Franky G , MC Gainey , Dylan McDermott and a cameo from Paris Hilton .

In the colony we 're not all that familiar with Arthur Askey , so I nearly skipped this film ( which had it TCM preview recently ) on account of the negative comment here on his appearance in `` Ghost Train '' -- which I expected to be thoroughly annoying . Instead I wa pleasantly surprised to find myself laughing audibly . The physical aspect of Askey 's comedy and his timing when delivering a line suggest what you 'd get if Charlie Chaplin and Woody Allen had a baby . There is no comparing him to Bud Abbott or any of the other usual purveyor of comic relief who turn up in film of this genre . One can feel , moreover , the thread connecting Askey to British comedy 30 year later ; at least it is clear from an American point of view that he ha more in common with the Monty Python troupe than with any of his counterpart over here . As for the rest of the film -- the more movie you 've seen , the more likely you 'll guess at the ending , but it is still quite entertaining and atmospheric and worth waiting for it next appearance .

In this day and age in which just about every other news story involves discussion of waterboarding , image of Abu Ghraib , or tale of forced detention at Guantanamo Bay , Gavin Hood 's `` Rendition '' is about a up-to-the-minute and timely a movie a is ever likely to come out of the entertainment mill of mainstream Hollywood . It 's not , by any stretch of the imagination , a perfect film , but neither doe it merit the caterwauling opprobrium it ha received at the hand of critic from all across the ideological and political spectrum . The term `` rendition '' refers to the ability of the CIA to arrest any individual it suspect of terrorist dealing , then to whisk them away in secret to a foreign country to interrogate and torture them for an indefinite period of time , all without due process of law . Anwar El-Ibrahimi is an Egyptian man who ha been living for twenty year in the United States . He ha an American wife , a young son and a new baby on the way . He seems a very unlikely candidate for a terrorist , yet one day , without warning or explanation , Anwar is seized and taken to an undisclosed location where he is subjected to brutal torture until he admits his involvement with a terrorist organization that Anwar claim to know nothing about . On the negative side , `` Rendition '' falter occasionally in it storytelling ability , often biting off a little more than it can chew in term of both plot and character . The ostensible focal point is Douglas Freeman , a rookie CIA agent who is brought in to observe Anwar 's `` interrogation '' at the hand of Egyptian official . The problem is that , a conceived by writer Kelley Sane and enacted by Jake Gyllenhaal , Freeman seems too much of a naïve `` boy scout '' to make for a very plausible agent , and he is n't given the screen time he need to develop fully a a character . We know little about him at the beginning and even le , it seems , at the end . He `` go through the motion , '' but we learn precious little about the man within . Thus , without a strong center of gravity to hold it all together , the film occasionally feel a if it is coming apart at the seam , with story element flying off in all direction . A similar problem occurs with Anwar 's distraught wife , played by Reese Witherspoon , a woman we never get to know much about apart from what we can see on the surface . Gyllenhaal and Witherspoon have both proved themselves to be fine actor under other circumstance , but here they are hemmed in by a restrictive screenplay that rarely let them go beyond a single recurring note in their performance . What make `` Rendition '' an ultimately powerful film , however , is the extreme seriousness of the subject matter and the way in which two concurrently running plot line elegantly dovetail into one another in the movie 's closing stretch . It may make for a slightly more contrived story than perhaps we might have liked on this subject , but , hey , this is Hollywood after all , and the film ha to pay SOME deference to mass audience expectation if it is to get itself green lighted , let alone see the light of day a a completed project . Two of the supporting performance are particularly compelling in the film : Omar Metwally who make palpable the terror of a man caught in a real life Kafkaesque nightmare from which he can not awaken , and Yigal Naor who make a surprisingly complex character out of the chief interrogator/torturer . Meryl Streep , Alan Arkin and Peter Sarsgaard also make their mark in smaller role . Special mention should also be made of the warm and richly hued cinematography of Dion Beebe . Does the movie oversimplify the issue ? Probably . Does it stack the deck in favor of the torture victim and against the evil government force ? Most definitely . ( One wonder how the movie would have played if Anwar really WERE a terrorist ) . Yet , the movie ha the gut to tread on controversial ground . It is n't afraid to raise dicey question or risk the disapproval of some for the political stance it take . It openly ponders the issue of just how DOES a nation hold fast to it hard-won principle of `` civil liberty for all '' in the face of terrorism and fear . And just how much courage doe it take for people of good will to finally stand up and say `` enough is enough , '' even at the risk of being branded terrorist-appeasing and unpatriotic by those in power ? ( The movie also doe not , in any way , deny the reality of extreme Islamic terrorism ) . Thus , to reject `` Rendition '' out of hand would be to allow the perfect to be the enemy of the good . `` Rendition '' may not be perfect , but it IS good , and it ha something of importance to say about the world in which we now live . And that alone make it very much worth seeing .

In KPAX Softley brush on the subtlety of Eastern Religious Mores from the small archetype embedded all over the film to the actual purpose of Prot . Spacey ( Prot ) assumes a predominantly didactic role throughout the entire film - it is a if the statement he make embody general truth about a culture of peace which is strongly promulgated in Buddhism and Hinduism . It can be said that Prot is the eye of the storm - the world is in disarray and is 'bright ' and the false veil of reality is what everyone else see , but Prot see truth - he see the minute - and appreciates it and at some point fear it a he transcends his social construction of reality and becomes more humanly . The film is particularly detailed , therefore I would recommend that you watch it at least twice to see how Softley interjects nuance . Listen carefully to the narrative at the beginning and end a they truly touch on concept not commonly presented in western philosophy . 9 of out 10 rating - Superb - with nominal room for improvement .

I thought Rachel York wa fantastic a `` Lucy . '' I have seen her in `` Kiss Me , Kate '' and `` Victor/Victoria , '' a well , and in each of these performance she ha developed very different , and very real , characterization . She is a chameleon who can play ( and sing ) anything ! I am very surprised at how many negative review appear here regarding Rachel 's performance in `` Lucy . '' Even some bonafide TV and entertainment critic seem to have missed the point of her portrayal . So many people have focused on the fact that Rachel doe n't really look like Lucy . My response to that is , `` So what ? '' I wa n't looking for a superficial impersonation of Lucy . I wanted to know more about the real woman behind the clown . And Rachel certainly gave u that , in great depth . I also did n't want to see someone simply `` doing '' classic Lucy routine . Therefore I wa very pleased with the decision by the producer and director to have Rachel portray Lucy in rehearsal for the most memorable of these skit - Vitameatavegamin and The Candy Factory . ( It seems that some of the reviewer did n't realize that these two scene were meant to be rehearsal sequence and not the actual skit ) . This approach , I thought , gave an innovative twist to sketch that so many of u know by heart . I also thought Rachel wa terrifically fresh and funny in these scene . And she absolutely nailed the routine that were recreated - the Professor and the Grape Stomping , in particular . There wa one moment in the Grape scene where the corner of Rachel 's mouth had the exact little upturn that I remember Lucy having . I could n't believe she wa able to capture that - and so naturally . I wonder if many of the folk who criticized the performance were expecting to see the Lucille Ball of `` I Love Lucy '' throughout the entire movie . After all , those of u who came to know her only through TV would not have any idea what Lucy wa really like in her early movie year . I think Rachel showed a natural progression in the character that wa brilliant . She planted all the right seed for u to see the clown just waiting to emerge , given the right set of circumstance . Lucy did n't fit the mold of the old studio system . In her frustrated attempt to become the stereotypical movie star of that era , she kept repressing what would prove to be her ultimate gift . I believe that Rachel deftly captured the comedy , drama , wit , sadness , anger , passion , love , ambition , loyalty , sexiness , self absorption , childishness , and stoicism all rolled into one complex American icon . And she did it with an authenticity and freshness that wa totally endearing . `` Lucy '' wa a star turn for Rachel York . I hope it brings a flood of great role her way in the future . I also hope it brings her an Emmy .

Lovely Candace Bergen a the widow Perdicaris are kidnapped and held for ransom by the Sheik Raisuli played by one dashing Sean Connery . The incident come during 1904 a Theodore Roosevelt run for election to the presidency in his own right . Needing a good example to show off the muscular foreign policy of the United States , Brian Keith a Roosevelt issue a stunning declaration to the Sultan of Morocco , `` Perdicaris alive or Raisuli dead . '' But in this adaptation of that incident the famous declaration is the only true thing about this story . The Perdicaris in question wa in reality one Ion Perdicaris who wa a Greek immigrant and dilettante playboy . In fact Perdicaris gave up his American citizenship year ago and wa back a a Greek national . Never mind that though , his predicament wa serviceable enough at the time . The damsel in distress make better screen material though so it 's a widow woman and her two kid that are in harm 's way here . Of course a presented here the incident is also used by some of our European power to get their foothold into Morocco . The intrigue get far beyond one brigand 's demand for ransom . The Wind and the Lion is hardly history . But it is an enjoyable film and Sean Connery is always fun to watch . Brian Keith also fit my conception of Theodore Roosevelt and the scene in the Roosevelt White House do ring true to all the story told . John Huston play the ever patient Secretary of State John Hay who Roosevelt had inherited from his predecessor William McKinley . But kid do n't use this film to skip reading a history assignment on the Theodore Roosevelt era .

Sharky 's Machine is easily one of Burt Reynolds best effort . It also stand a one of the best contemporary crime drama . Erotic and violent , the movie distinguishes itself by setting the story in Atlanta , and delivering a chaotic detective case , to you ( the viewer ) , on a silver platter . Dedicated and determined , Sharky must stop the murder of Dominoe , a lovely lady of the night , who 's clientel is anything but ordinary . Before long , Sharky 's crimefighting Machine uncovers a conspiracy of the highest order , which threatens to corrupt the inner body of Atlanta . As a resident of Metro Atlanta , I recall the excitement in town during the movie 's production . Sharky 's Machine go to great length to give an accurate portrayal of Atlanta . Twenty year removed and 2,000,000-more people later , the film stand the test of time . Trust me , Atlanta ha not changed . One of the highlight of the picture is Dar Robinson 's daring stunt ( a classic , symbolic ending ) . It wa even featured on That 's Incredible , ABC 's reality show of the period . It 's just too bad that Hollywood doe not make enough film like this one . Kick back , each your popcorn , and watch sterling silver cinema action .

Winchester '73 is a great story , and that 's what I like about it . It 's important to note for those politically correct type -- they kill a lot of indian in this movie without remorse . By today 's standard , it 's still pretty violent . But it 's a great story and worth watching . Enjoy !

Peak Practice wa a British drama series about a GP surgery in Cardale  a small fictional town in the Derbyshire Peak District  and the doctor who worked there . It ran on ITV from 1993 to 2002 , and wa one of their most successful series at the time . It originally starred Kevin Whately a Dr Jack Kerruish , Amanda Burton a Dr Beth Glover , and Simon Shepherd a Dr Will Preston , though the roster of doctor would change many time over the course of the series . The series wa axed in 2002 and ended on a literal cliffhanger when two of the series main character plunged off a cliff . Viewers wrote to ITV in their thousand and a petition for one last episode wa set up by website Peak Practice Online . However , all plea were unsuccessful and ITV said they would not make any more episode . Peak Practice wa replaced by Sweet Medicine , another medical series set in Derbyshire . It lasted a few episode before it wa dropped from the schedule . Cardale wa based on the Derbyshire village of Crich , and the series wa filmed there and at other nearby Derbyshire town and village , most notably Matlock and Ashover . After the end of this programme , ITV attempted to launch a follow-up series called Sweet Medicine , which extended the story of different character from the original show .

Maria Braun is an extraordinary woman presented fully and very credibly , despite being so obtuse a to border on implausibility . She will do everything to make her marriage work , including shameless opportunism and sexual manipulation . And thus beneath the vicey exterior , she reveals a rather sweet value system . The film suffers from an abrupt and unexpected ending which afterwards feel wholly inadequate , with the convenience familiar from ending your school creative writing exercise with 'and then I woke up ' . It is also book-ended at the other end with the most eccentric title sequence I 've ever seen , but do n't let any of that put you off .

This quasi J-horror film followed a young woman a she return to her childhood village on the island of Shikoku to sell the family house and meet up with old friend . She and Fumiko ( another childhood friend ) then learn that Sayori 's mother is trying to bring her back to life with black magic . Already the bond between the dead and living are getting weak and the friend and villager are seeing ghost . Nothing wa exceptional or even very good about this movie . Unlike stellar J-horror film , the suspense doe n't really build , the result doe n't seem overly threatening and the ending border on the absurd . This movie is like plain white rice cooked a little too long so that it is bordering on mushy . Sometimes you get this at poor Asian restaurant or cook your own white rice a little too long . You end up eating it , because you need it with the meal , because what is Chinese or Japanese food without rice , but it almost ruin the meal because of the gluey , gooey tastelessness of it all . 3/10 http : //blog.myspace.com/locoformovies

`` Gypsy '' is possibly the greatest musical ever written , so it 's too bad that it 's film version wa such a disappointment . To make up for that , we have this re-make which , if not flawless , is an enjoyable and well done adaption of the musical . The script is completely accurate , all the song included , and the staging remains close to the original Jerome Robbins ' staging . Bette Midler is a deft choice for Rose , her singing and personality Merman-esquire , and her acting splendid . Peter Reigert is a fine Herby , if not a great singer , and Cynthia Gibb is a straight forward , natural Louise . In truth , a live taping of the 1989 revival with Tyne Daly might have been a better idea , if only because `` Gypsy '' is simply more exciting on stage , But this film is a fine translation of a great musical .
