Read Eric 's review again . He perfectly described my own feeling for this film so more eloquently than I ever could . I 'm only writing here to further encourage you to look for and see it . I saw it many year ago on TV , the IFC I think . It is such a unique film I hesitate to make comparison . It wa filmed in northern Mexico , somewhere in the relentless badlands of Coahuila/Zacatecas/San Luis Potosi . This is n't the Sedona-like Durango , Mexico ( of the John Wayne film ) but a truly stark and wild place . I have to find the novel now to check on the original location of the story . Like the location , this movie is strange and wild and wonderful and weird and absolutely not for everyone . It is the kind of production that almost motivates me to study film . I had n't actually forgotten this movie , it is indelible . Yet , over the year , I had forgotten of it existence . I know nobody who ha seen it , had never read of it , nor seen any reference to it . Erendira is such an unusual name , I 'd even forgotten the title . Well , I 'll be looking to buy a copy now . * * I have since the above posting become a huge fan of Gabriel Garcia Marquez and so regret not having read him before . Relative to MsMyth 's comment below ; the movie wa filmed in Mexico but the author is Colombian and wa not commenting on Mexico or Mexican history in any way , although Marquez now life in Mexico for `` political '' reason . This story is universal . I am still trying desperately to find a copy of this film for my library . Liked the movie ? You have to read the story and then everything else Garcia Marquz wrote . And , by the way , the original location in the story wa Colombia .

This is an immoral and reprehensible piece of garbage , that no doubt want to be a Friday the 13th ( 1980 ) clone . The poster for this movie make it look like there 's going to be some sort of a cross between Jason and Freddy , which is likely to attract movie-goers . There is NOTHING good or entertaining about this movie about this movie . It just make me sad , just thinking that some people are going to stumble upon Sleepaway Camp II : Unhappy Campers ( 1988 ) on video or DVD , and waste their time with this sad , cynical , depressing movie . Angela Baker ( Pamela Springsteen ) is a camp counselor at Camp Rolling Hills , who hope that the other camper are a nice a she is , and that they stay out of trouble . Meanwhile , the other camper are realizing that people are disappearing one by one , with Angela making up the excuse that she had to send them home . Could Angela be the killer , who wa once a man , who underwent a sex change operation year earlier ? Who know ? Who care ? The 1980s wa home to a lot of movie that made the cross between the Mad Slasher and Dead Teenager genre , in which a mad killer go berserk . Some have a plot , some do n't , but they 're all about a bad a this one . Sleepaway Camp II : Unhappy Campers is 80 minute of teenager being introduced and then being stabbed , strangled , impaled , chopped up , burned alive , and mutilated . That 's all this movie is . It is just mindless , bloody violence . Watching this movie , I wa reminded of the Friday the 13th movie , in which the message for it viewer wa that the primary function of teenager is to be hacked to death . The filmmaker of Sleepaway Camp II have every right to be ashamed of themselves . Imagine the sick message that this movie offer for it teen viewer : `` The world is a totally evil place , '' this movie tell you , `` and it 'll kill you . It doe n't matter what your dream or your hope are . It doe n't matter if you have a new boyfriend , or a new girlfriend . It doe n't matter what you think , what you do or what your plan for the future are . You can forget those plan , because you 're just going to wind up dead . '' And the sickest thing is -- and by not giving too much away -- the movie simply set up room for a sequel . Well , why not ? They 've probably and already taken the bucket to the cesspool by making three or four of these movie . I missed out on the original Sleepaway Camp ( 1983 ) , and , after watching it first sequel , I will hopefully stay away from the other sequel , a well a the original . And for parent , if you know kid who actually LIKE this movie , do not let them date your child .

This is the worst movie that I have ever seen . At first i thought that it wa going to be good because I 'm interested in the bermuda triangle , but instead it wa terrible . All it did wa offer a bunch of lame explinations that did n't make sense ( if time move differently there how come the woman did n't age , and her son aged rapidly ) , and have a horrible sappy ending . Next time the guy who made this go to Bermuda they should take all copy of this movie with them . Please everyone vote for this movie so it can get on the worst movie list .

Lame rip-off of THE QUATERMASS XPERIMENT ( 1955 ) : the first half is deadly dull , even dreary - but the latter stage improve considerably with the scene involving the rampaging 'monster ' . In the accompanying featurette ( a rather dry affair at a mere 9 minute , when compared to the one created for the other title in Criterion 's `` Monsters & Madmen '' set ) , director Day - who admits to not being a fan of the sci-fi genre - try to justify the film 's shortcoming by saying that he had a zero-budget to work with ( where all the outer space scene were composed of stock footage ! ) ... and I 'd have been inclined to be more lenient with the film had I not recently watched CALTIKI , THE IMMORTAL MONSTER ( 1959 ) - a similar ( and similarly threadbare ) but far more stylish venture from Italy ! Bill Edwards a the cocky but unlucky astronaut - obsessed with achieving the titular feat - is positively boring at first , but he eventually manages to garner audience sympathy when his physical feature are deformed and the character develops a taste for blood ! Marshall Thompson a his commanding officer and elder brother is O.K . a a leaner Glenn Ford type ; he had previously starred in FIEND WITHOUT A FACE ( 1958 ) , another ( and more successful ) Richard Gordon-produced sci-fi which , incidentally , is also available on DVD through Criterion . Italian starlet Marla Landi , struggling with the English language , make for an inadequate female lead ; even her input in the featurette prof to be of little lasting value ! The Audio Commentary is yet another enjoyable Tom Weaver/Richard Gordon track where , among many thing , the fact that FIRST MAN INTO SPACE wa intended a a double-feature with CORRIDORS OF BLOOD ( 1958 ) is brought up - but it wa eventually put out a a standalone release , so a to exploit the topical news value of the current space race ; it 's also mentioned that the monster dialogue wa actually dubbed by Bonar Colleano ( who , tragically , died in a traffic accident prior to the film 's release ! ) . Weaver even recall a couple of anecdote from the time when he wa involved in the production of the DVD featurette shot by , of all people , ex-cult-ish film-maker Norman J. Warren : Landi , who by then had become a lady of title , wa still ready to help out in carrying the equipment necessary to film the interview down several flight of stair ! ; Edwards wa supposed to have contributed to the featurette but , once in London , he proved reluctant to co-operate with Weaver - eventually , the latter learned that the actor had been recently diagnosed with cancer and , in fact , he died in 2002 !

( This ha been edited for space ) Chan-wook Park 's new film is a complex film that is not easy to classify . Nominally a horror movie , the central character is a vampire , the film actually ha element of comedy , theology , melodrama , cultural invasion ( and it analog of viral invasion of a body ) , romance and few other thing a well . It 's a film that ha almost too much on it mind . The film take it own matter and mix them with classic European literature , in this case Emile Zola 's `` Thérèse Raquin '' . It 's an odd mix that doe n't always gel , but none the le ha an incredible power . Here it is almost 24 hour since I saw the film at Lincoln Center ( with a post film discussion by the director ) and I find my cage is increasingly rattled . Its not so much what happens is bothersome , it more that it wide reaching story and it theme ring a lot of bell in retrospect . The plot of the film ha a will loved priest deciding that the best way to help mankind is to volunteer for a medical experiment to find a cure for a terrible disease . Infected with the disease he eventually succumbs and dy , but because of a transfusion of vampiric blood ( it not explained ) he actually survives . Hailed a a miracle worker the priest return to the hospital where he had been ministering to the sick . Unfortunately all is not well . The priest find that he need blood to survive . He also find that he ha all of the typical problem of a vampire , and it no not possible for him to go out during the day . Things become even more complicated when he becomes reacquainted with a childhood friend and his family . The priest , some of his animal passion awakened becomes taken with the wife of his friend . From there it all go sideways . An ever changing film , this is a story that spin through a variety of genre a it tell the very human story of a man who find that his life ha been radically altered by a chance event and find that he is no longer who he thought he wa . It 's a film that you have to stay with to the end because the film is forever evolving into something else . Its also a film that ha a great deal on it mind and the theme it playing with are constantly being explored in a variety of way The film ha enough going on that one could , and people probably will , write book discussing the film . The two of the strongest part of the film are it vampiric element and it romance The vampire part of the tale is brilliant . There is something about how it lay out the ground rule and the nature of the `` affliction '' that make such perfect sense that it kind of push the old vampire idea aside . Sitting in the theater last night I found myself amazed at how impressed how well it worked . I think the fact that it played more or le straight is what is so earth shaking . Here is a vampire who just want to have a normal life . It 's contrasted with what happens later , it make clear that living an existence of hunting human really is n't going to work . Its not the dark world of Twilight or Lost Boys , rather it something else . I personally think that the film change the playing field from a hip cool idea or dream into something more real and tangible . ( The sequence where the power kick in is just way cool ) The romance is also wonderfully handled . Sure the sex scene are steamy and well done , but it 's the other stuff , the look , the talk , the gesture outside of the sex that make this special . I love the look , the quiet stare a the forbidden couple look at each other hungering for each other and unable to act , the disappointment and heartbreak of betrayal both real and suspected , and the mad passion of possible consummation . This is one of the great screen romance of all time . It perfectly capture the feeling and emotion of deep passionate love ( and lust ) . If you 've ever loved deeply I 'm guessing you 'll find some part of your hear on screen , I know I did . The statement `` I just wanted to spend eternity with you '' ha a sad poignancy to it . It 's both a statement of what wa the intention a well a the depth of emotion . The tragic romance will break your heart . I wo n't lie to you and say that the film is perfect and great . Its not , a good a the piece are and almost all of them are great ( especially the actor who I have unjustly failed to hail a amazing ) the whole doe n't always come together . The various genre , thematic element and tone occasionally grate against each other . Frequently I wa wondering where the film wa going . I hung in there even though the film seemed to be wandering about aimlessly . I liked the film a great deal . I loved the piece more than the film a a whole . Its been pinging around in my head since I saw it , and I 'm guessing that it will do so for several day more . Like or love is irrelevant since this is a film that really should be seen since it ha so much going on that it will provide you with enough material to think and talk about for day afterward . One of the meatiest and most filling film of the year .

The idea behind this movie wa great . The story of a little girl facing abuse ( both emotional and physical ) and trying to deal with it and survive . What make the movie fall apart is the terrible use of voice over and the corny dialog . The actor have to point out the most obvious thing over and over again . Also , there is very tedious , almost funny , overuse of metaphor in the voice over . The high point is the acting of the little girl . Nice try , but this one 's a stinker .

I watch them all . It 's not better than the amazing one ( _Strictly Ballroom_ , _Shall we dance ? _ ( Japanese version ) , but it 's completely respectable and pleasingly different in part . I am an English teacher and I find some of the ignorance about language in some of these review rather upsetting . For example : the `` name should scream do n't watch . 'How she move . ' Since when can movie title ignore grammar ? '' There is nothing inherently incorrect about Caribbean English grammar . It 's just not Canadian standard English grammar . Comments about the dialogue seem off to me . I put on the subtitle because I 'm a Canadian standard English speaker , so I just AUTOMATICALLY assumed that I would have trouble understanding all of it . It wa n't all that difficult and it gave a distinctly different flavour a the other step movie I have seen were so American . I loved that this movie wa set in Toronto and , in fact , wish it wa even more clearly set there . I loved that the heroine wa so atypically cast . I enjoyed the stepping routine . I liked the driven Mum character . I felt that many of the issue in the movie were addressed more subtly than is characteristic of dance movie . In summary , if you tend to like dance movie , then this is a decent one . If you have superiority issue about the grammar of the English standard you grew up speaking , your narrow mind may have difficulty enjoying this movie .

Dear God ! I kept waiting for this movie to `` get started '' ... then I waited for it to redeem itself ... and when it did neither , I just sat there , dumbfounded that : 1 ) it could possibly be this bad , and 2 ) that I had just wasted a couple of hour on just sheer stupidity . I had faith that Drew could n't possibly have made this bad of a movie ... and boy , did I ever lose my faith ! Do n't bother with this one ! Drew tried , but the movie wa poorly written , poorly acted , and just poorly conceived ! I ca n't believe a script this bad ever got funded ! It had a million chance to actually do something with the idea , ( the word `` concept '' is too big for this movie to even qualify for ! ) and it STILL did n't go anyplace ! Its just pitiful ! Where the other reviewer got the idea that it wa n't the worst , baffle me ! Because believe me , if it got any worse I 'd have slit my wrist before finishing it !

First , let me start off by saying this film SOUNDED very interesting : A serial killer copycatting the work of Edgar Allan Poe ( who is one of my writer of all time ) . Sounds cool , right ? Yeah , definitely not . Probably the worst film I 've ever seen . Ever . And that 's not an exaggeration . I 've seen a lot of very , very bad movie . This one take the cake . And I wa even prepared for a bad movie before going into it . Perhaps the writer should 've studied some law enforcement procedure : If you have the name of the killer , his entire life 's history , a criminal record , and HIS ADDRESS , where is the first place you should look ? Hmm . . . possibly . . . his house ? What ? ! NO ! That 's a preposterous idea , Anthony ! How could you suggest something so obvious and level-headed rather than going to a bowling alley ? * spoiler end * Honestly , sometimes I can forgive a movie if the writing is good but the acting is bad , or vice versa . . . but this just had everything wrong with it you could possibly find . I think my biggest pet peeve wa how the police/FBI acted . For example : Black FBI Agent : `` Okay , endangered female , just sit here in this car in an empty parking lot while I go inside and look around the potential crime scene where a serial killer is supposed to be . Sound good to you ? '' Moronic Female FBI Agent : `` Yeah , sound a-okay to me . Go right ahead . I 'll be sure to not focus on my surroundings or at least check the perimeter . '' Black FBI Agent : `` Excellent , that 's what I would do ! '' Honestly , if you want to be in law enforcement , rent this movie so you can learn how not to act . . . or if you 're a human and want to learn the same . 0.5/10 : A half-point just for getting a film produced and in store . Congrats . -AP3-

Billy Crystal co-wrote , co-produced and star in this extremely safe and comfy comedy-drama about father and son , adult irresponsibility , and growing old . Billy play a heart surgeon who ha a heart attack ( ha ha ) which cause him to seek out his estranged father ( Alan King ) , a movie-extra who fancy himself a big star . The script is sub-Neil Simon nonsense with one-liner galore , a flat , inexpressive direction by Henry Winkler ( stuck in sitcom mode ) , and family-conflict at the ready . Crystal and King try their best , but King is over-eager and frequently over-the-top . JoBeth Williams ha another one of her thankless role , but manages to bring her innate , down-home class to the proverbial girlfriend character . It 's a comedy , I guess , but one that blink back the tear ... shamefully . * * from * * * *

I went to see this on the strength of Albert Finney alone . He 's one of my favorite actor and he rarely fails to deliver . I 'm not sure if the plot is interesting or just silly : it 's about a little boy who is about to be born , but a his mother go into labor , he refuse to come out ! This sends God and the whole human being factory into a crisis and Albert Finney is called out of purgatory to try and convince the boy to change his mind and decide to want to be born . So Finney take the unborn boy for an adventure in the Big Apple in hope of showing him all the reason he should want to live . Despite the ridiculousness of the plot , I could have accepted it if the director had not tried to turn this into your typical Hollywood sentimental moralistic message film . Directorially , the film wa rendered unbearable by a horrible soundtrack of the stock sentimental music that Hollywood director seem incapable of resisting . He further butchered the somewhat unconventional story by giving away it hand at every moment . Whatever twist and turn were in store in the plot were completely given away by the way the story unraveled . It wa a if the director assumed the audience is just a bunch of idiot who can not see the obvious hint coming from a mile away . Even Finney in his performance , though satisfactory , seemed a bit awkward and out of place ; and the little boy with curly lock , though he wa supposed to be cute , wa in fact rather dull . Bridget Fonda seemed intent on trying to duplicate Demi Moore 's performance in 'Ghost ' , shedding tear at a moment 's notice . I understand that the film ha been unsuccessful thus far at getting distribution in the U.S. , which surprise me a I think it ha the box office potential to be a modest hit , appealing to both kid and sentimental adult . As far a the quality go , it 's not an awful film , it 's just not very good . ( 4 out of 10 )

An astronaut get lost in deep space and find himself traveling through unknown territory on board of a living spaceship accompanied by a group of alien-outlaws . This incredible plotted and enjoyable TV-installment come along a a positive birth-fantasy . The individual character , in conflict at the beginning of the series , have to learn to get along with each other and evolve into a powerful group at last . Most of the action take place inside the womb of Moia , the living space-ship ( who even get pregnant and give birth to another ship ! ) . While science-fiction-stories are usually interested in negative birth-fantasies ( watch the 'Alien'-movies for example , especially the fourth part 'Resurrection ' ) this come a a surprise . Also enjoyable is the absence of military hierarchy on board of the ship and the positive attitude towards sex and the human ( and alien ) body . One of the female character who is actually a plant experience 'photogasms ' while being exposed to sunlight . The crew even ha to go to the toilet . Would n't that be impossible in 'Star Trek ' ?

This is a film that can make you want to see it again . I especially , liked the way it ended . I did not see the end coming , but when Laws wa not blown away the first time , one suspect he will be back again . The story is gripping and could have been more psychological , but I understand the story needed to capture the viewer and the action wa necessary for that . Hard to believe Michael Jr. could be so apparently unmoved a his younger brother and mother a blown away . But , I can appreciate the scene play could n't really take our attention there because it had a greater story to tell . Some have complained about Hanks a a gangster . I believe that is n't justified . If his character had been any harder , he would not have cared if his son pulled a trigger or not . Eight Stars for this one . Although it wa released in 2002 , I just saw it for the first time yesterday on DVD .

I have been wanting to see this since my French teacher recommend it to me over forty year ago . Perhaps the long wait wa worth it , since the Criterion Collection DVD restoration is impressive . In it outline this movie follows the time-worn script : a quartet of men diligently plot a difficult heist of a bank vault , the heist take place , a small seemingly insignificant event lead to the ultimate demise of all . Even though the heist footage is transfixing , it occurs rather early and is ultimately not at the core of the film . This film separate itself from the typical heist movie by giving u insight into the personality of the character and their motivation - it play a much a a drama a it doe a thriller . Relationships play a big role and a kidnapping is tacked on , giving u two movie for the price of one . John Servais play the idea man Tony le Stéphanois ( always referred to a `` le Stéphanois '' ) with such world-weariness that he could have just stepped out of a Camus novel . Tony ha just recently gotten out of jail and resists re-entering the life of crime until he ha a highly unpleasant interaction with his ex-lover ( who ha taken up with another man ) where , a punishment , he physically whip her with a belt . Thankfully that scene occurs off camera , but you are not likely to forget it . After that sobering event , since there seems little hope of reviving that relationship , Tony meet with two of his old partner in crime , Jo and Mario , and decides to join them in one last big heist . They enlist the service of Cesar , an Italian safe cracker - played by director Dassin himself - and we are off to the heist . The heist go off without a hitch . But Cesar 's womanizing bent is a personality trait that turn out to be fatal for all concerned . However , we can understand his attraction to the nightclub singer he ha fallen for , since there is a brilliant set piece where she performs a sexy and cinematically inspired nightclub act - it ha to be one of the most memorable scene from any noir film . It is established early on that Tony ha a close relationship with Jo and his family ; in fact Jo 's son refers to him a uncle . I think it is partly to help Jo 's family that Tony agrees to the heist . The ending scene , where Tony save the life of Jo 's kidnapped son , partially redeems his more brutal and amoral action . But only partially .

A CBS radio program entitled `` We the People '' assist in finding an American home for Vienna refugee Charles Coburn ( a Karl Braun ) , a skilled surgeon and pool hustler . He arrives with beautiful daughter Sigrid Gurie ( a Leni ) , who is `` studying '' to become a nurse . Relocated to a small , dusty Midwestern village , they are welcomed at the station by burly John Wayne ( a John Phillips ) and his uncle Spencer Charters ( a 'Nunk ' Atterbury ) , a veterinarian . Ms. Gurie is unhappy in the dustbowl , and want to leave . Immediately . But , the prospect of romance with Mr. Wayne might change her mind ... God answer the citizen ' many prayer for rain , but it may not be enough to save the farming town . The entire town is advised to relocate to Oregon . Wayne want to stay and tough it out . Coburn receives an invitation to work at a top clinic . And , Gurie learns her fiancé , presumed dead , will be arriving to claim her a his wife . She feel duty-bound to accept ; but , he ha a dark secret ... This film doe not flatter Wayne , who seems way out of his element . Being paired with Gurie , promoted a another Garbo , doe n't help . They do have a cute scene in Wayne 's car ( `` Jalopy , an Italian car '' ) . * * * * Three Faces West ( 7/3/40 ) Bernard Vorhaus ~ John Wayne , Sigrid Gurie , Charles Coburn , Spencer Charters

I have not read the book that this wa based upon/inspired by . This being some of ( the others are film role ) the last work of John Ritter ( RIP ) , one hope that it is hilarious . And it is . Almost every time he 's present in this , a a matter of fact . Most of the cast , supporting a well a regular , play off each other well , and the material tends to be great . He play Paul Hennessy , the father of three teenager : Rory , the typical guy of that age , Kerry , the depressive middle-child who fight for cause and awareness , and Bridget , the fashion-loving , popular ditz . Sagal make a return to being the female lead in a sit-com , and her character is far removed from Peggy Bundy . The show changed somewhat after Mr. Three 's Company passed on , and for a while , they could n't seem to make up their mind if they wanted to go for getting laugh , or being poignant and making sure to be respectful . One can wonder how or why it lasted for so long after that : It could still be quite good , some of the addition were fortunate ( if you like David Spade , most of his part consists of him doing his schtick ) and had stuff to say . My personal favorite episode is in the last season . The humor is a nice mix of `` dumb person '' joke ( mainly related to the high-schoolers ) , silliness , dark comedy and crude material . This dealt with sex and other adult topic , but never in a graphic manner . The language is mild , and , on occasion , moderately strong . I recommend this to any fan of those who made it . 8/10

Brilliant thriller , deserving far more fame , Mitchum and Ryan are awesome in their starring role , a is the entire supporting cast . A truly gripping film noir featuring some wonderfully image and some great dialogue , at the heart of it all is a strong message of tolerance and understanding . Based on a novel concerning homophobia , this movie attack post-war anti-emitism , and all intolerance and hatred , with considerable power . Though part may seem a little preachy to modern audience , it still ha the power to shock , and work very well a a thriller in it own right . A credit to all involved .

I saw this movie a few year ago and wa literally swept away by it . So charming and so very romantic . David Duchovny and Ms. Driver have chemistry that is so hot , you will need to take off a layer of clothing . The supporting cast is 100 % top notch . Just watching Caroll O'Connor and Robert Loggia play off one another is pure poetry . Bonnie Hunt and Jim Bellushi and a wonderful team and some of the film most charming moment are when they are on the screen . Like Jim Belushi screaming at his child to go to sleep `` FOREVER ! '' or him dancing in the kitchen . This film made we wish I knew people like that in my own life . Not to mention , what woman doe not want David Duchovny for a boyfriend ?

I just watched this movie on Bravo ! and it wa absolutely horrible . It ha the plot of a Shannon Tweed movie without the nudity . The premise wa interesting enough , a winning lottery ticket in a secluded area and people who have reason why they want the money . The character were trite a were the observation on human nature and greed . For a movie called Class Warfare it had very little to do with class difference other than the first 20 minute and the predictable ending . This movie could have done a lot better if there had been more character with motivation to get the ticket and wa a `` who done it ? '' The acting wa n't fantastic but it 's hard to seem believable with such a terrible script . Lindsey McKeon is very cute and I 'd like to see what she could do in a better production with a better script . She 's probably the only reason why I sat through the whole movie .

How nice to have a movie the entire family can watch together . Josie Bissett and Rob Estes ( who are married in real life ) play a couple who marry in Las Vegas on a whim and then not only have to break the news to their kid but then have to try to meld their respective household ( each ha two boy and two girl ) into a cohesive family unit . What transpires when the group , which includes four teenager , two preteen and two younger child , make one wonder at first if there can ever be true happiness for Carrie and Jim . The fight between the kid ( and one little love affair between two of them ) make one wonder if everyone will ever be able to get along . More interesting than the Brady Bunch , what this is a totally enjoyable way to spend a couple hour . Recommended a a feel good movie for all age .

As a fan of Henriksen ( I liked him in the `` Millennium '' series ) and of course Lorenzo `` Renegade '' Lamas , I had expected at least SOMETHING from this film . Sadly , the plot is predictable , the acting is bad and the computergraphics used for most stunt do n't work out . Sometimes it even look like they 've captured some shot from Microsoft Flight Simulator . The cinematography suck a well . Unnecessary funky camerawork in the beginning only detracts ( from the cheesy dialogue ) and give the film a cheap , made-for-video-look . It work in hiphop-movies and Jet Li movie , but seems out of place in this flick . I would have liked this film 10 year ago . I wa 11 then .

In theory , film should be a form of entertainment . While this excludes documentary and other experimental form of film-making ; most movie , specially genre film , must not only tell it 's story or message , they must entertain their target audience in some way . All this just to say that in my opinion a bad movie is not a movie with low production value or low-budget , a bad movie is one that is boring . `` Hellborn '' or `` Asylum of the Damned '' a is known in the U.S. , is a bad movie simply because it is just not involving , and irremediably boring and tiresome . While it ha a very good premise , it is just poorly developed and the mediocre acting doe n't make thing better . On another hand the film probably could had been a fine or even classic B-movie , but here it is just a bad attempt at film-making . Director Philip J. Jones tell the tale of James Bishop ( Matt Stasi ) , a young psychiatry resident , who just got his dream job at St. Andrew Mental Hospital ; but the old asylum seems to hide a secret . After the mysterious death of some patient and the constant rumor of satanic practice , James decides to find out what is going on ; only to find the incredulity of his bos , Dr. McCort ( Bruce Payne ) , who belief that Bishop is going a insane a his patient . While the premise is quite interesting , the execution of the film leaf a lot to be desired . In an attempt of making a supernatural psychological thriller , Jones go for the easy way out and make a movie filled with every cliché of the genre . Of course , there are lot of great movie that are also filled with clichés ; but in `` Hellborn '' every single one is wasted and turned into a cheap jump scare to keep thing moving , resulting in a boring and predictable storyline . The acting is quite mediocre for the most part , with one big exception : Bruce Payne give a top-notch performance that make the movie look unworthy of such good acting . Matt Stasi is very weak a the lead character and the rest of the cast make forgettable performance . Despite all this flaw , one thing ha to be written about `` Hellborn '' ; it ha a visual look very good for the budget and very similar to modern day big-budget Hollywod `` horror '' production . Also , the make-up and prosthetics are done very nicely and the design for the main antagonist are quite good . Sadly , the rest of the Special Effects are awful and outdated , making a huge contrast with the make-up & prosthetics . `` Hellborn '' is a movie with a few good thing outnumbered by it serious flaw with terrible result . Hardcore horror or b-movie fan may be interested by it premise but it is a boring and tiresome experience . 3/10

Bela Lugosi is an evil botanist who sends bride poisoned orchid on their wedding day , steal the body in his fake ambulance/hearse and take it home for his midget assistant to extract the glandular juice in order to keep Bela 's wife eternally young . Some second rate actor playing detective try to solve the terrible , terrible mystery . Bela Lugosi ham it up nicely , but you can tell he needed the money . This film is thoroughly awful , and most of the actor would have been better off sticking to waiting table , but the plot is wonderfully ridiculous . Tell anyone what happens in it and they tend to laugh quite a lot and demand to see the film . I got the DVD in a discount store 2 for £1 , which I think is a pretty accurate valuation , anyone paying more for this would be out of their mind .

What the hell wa this ? I 'll admit there were some scene that caught my eye such a the 23 bullshit where the protagonist see or calculates the number 23 everywhere he go , but that wa pretty much the movie in a nutshell ? ! For cry out loud this wa supposed to be a suspense movie and being labeled a a psychological thriller I would have expected it to have at least some catastrophic effect on the mind but instead what did we get ? We just got something a shitty a an animal control guy finding himself in the middle of a mid-life crisis and his journey to redemption . Kinda like an old-man flick if you ask me . I probably should have just rented Wild Hogs , it would n't have made a difference . I mean who are we kidding , they should have made someone else the killer of that girl . By juxtaposing Sparrow with the protagonist of that book The number 23 they were pretty much giving out the movie to the viewer by hinting that he wa the killer all along . How would that have shaken our head ? Shame on all of you voter who chose to show some generosity towards this wretched piece of work you call a movie and kudos to most of the critic who concurred with my reaction .

I have to say that this miniseries wa the best interpretation of the beloved novel `` Jane Eyre '' . Both Dalton and Clarke are very believable a Rochester and Jane . I 've seen other version , but none compare to this one . The best one for me . I could never imagine anyone else playing these character ever again . The last time I saw this one wa in 1984 when I wa only 13 . At that time , I wa a bookworm and I had just read Charlotte Bronte 's novel . I wa completely enchanted by this miniseries and I remember not missing any of the episode . I 'd like to see it again because it 's so good . : - )

doe n't mean this movie is good . i wa really frustrated by it on many level . it 's kind of the tip of the hat to bukowski . hey , i 've read that guy in college -- let 's see what matt dillon doe with him . and i like matt dillon . i thought he came close to looking a little like hank , but mostly just the ruddy cheek . i have to care about a character , though , and there just wa n't much here to care about . i think time might be cruel to bukowski , and that bother me a lot , because the writing wa solid in a sort of post counter culture time . hard to sit through , scene that went nowhere , and a soundtrack that made me want to vomit . i ask for very little , got le .

My roommate and I have another friend that work at a local Blockbuster Video . He find truly awful movie for u and tell u about them . One of them wa a `` Christmas Horror '' film starring former professional wrestler Bill Goldberg a a killer Satna Claus . We did n't watch it immediately , but we did n't think there could be anything worse . Apparently , we were wrong . We were shown this slasher film `` starring '' Ken Shamrock versus a murderous scarecrow . At first we thought Ken would actually BE the killer scarecrow , and that 's why we wanted to watch , but he wa n't , and that made the movie even worse . What absolutely RUINED the movie wa the teen drama . If you want to save your brain cell from trying to escape from your head , NEVER EVER WATCH THIS MOVIE .

This movie seemed like it wa put together very quickly in both plot and graphic . My two daughter were ready to go 30 minute before the end of the movie which rarely happens when we go to the theater . This wa a Nickelodeon Production and it would have been better if they had released it on the t.v . station . The animation itself in some part wa o.k . but the plot wa horrible . A classic tale of a son trying to fulfill a father expectation is used in a lot of kid movie , but the animation or graphic need to be really good to keep a child attention . This wa not the case with this film . There were also awkward element between the lead male character and the lead female character that the plot could have done without .

This review is for the extended cut of this movie . I first watched Dragon Lord when I bought it on DVD many year ago . I always liked this movie and you can read some of the more positive review of it to get the general idea . That being said . I 've always found the storyline a bit confusing . The movie is , after all , a love story . And it always seemed strange to me that a love story should end with a 20 minute fight scene . Well , in the extended version this is no longer so . The old `` original '' version begin off with a huge barrel-climb/rugby-like sequence which is the new ending sequence in the extended version . The opening sequence is Dragon ( Jackie Chan ) hanging around his house and pretending to be training and reciting whenever his father is around . Other sequenced have also been shift or prolonged in the extended cut and the story make a lot more sense when you watch it . The pacing is also better and overall it just work better . It feel more like a love story and doe n't leave you asking question about why it end so drastically and dramatically a the regular version doe . I suggest everyone who is a Hong-Kong cinema , or just plain Jackie Chan fanatic to get a hold of the extended version and watch the movie the way it wa originally intended . ( Or at least that 's how I think it wa intended . Why else would they make it and rearrange some of the scene ) When I wa done watching it , I felt like I had watched a completely new Jackie Chan movie although most of the sequence were the same .

Detective Tony Rome ( Frank Sinatra ) return to the screen after his self titled debut , this time it 's a film that 's played for erm laugh . While on a diving trip , Rome find the body of a blonde beauty at the bottom of the sea , her foot a you might expect , encased in cement . Rome immediately on the case after being hired by man mountain Waldo Gronsky . Rome find himself immediately at risk a he ha to investigate some mafia type , who turn the table on him and he is himself found to be the main suspect , he must now go on the run and hope to solve the case alone . The portly Sinatra try hard to sell u the lame joke and make u believe he is a good detective , oh and not to mention being sexually attractive to the foxy Raquel Welch , but he fails miserably , in this ham fisted vanity project . The frankly laughable denouement that surround every female is quite astounding , every woman in the film is a dither head , who like bending over is front of the camera , Director Douglas of course obliges in zooming in on the crack of their ass each time a they flex their posterior muscle . There 's even a ridiculously campy gay character that beggar belief , this wa a film made by `` real men '' for `` real men '' to reaffirm their own flagging sexuality , it 's a shameful shamble .

Having been interested in Akhenaton for many year I wa surprised to learn about this film via E-bay and bought a copy on DVD for 99p . I enjoyed the film , the twist and turn in the plot and that the file wa mainly about the main character Sinuhe make it more of a `` family saga '' rather than an action film . The costume and attention to detail wa remarkable for it time ( 1955 ) . The back projection during the chariot ride now look clumsy . My main interest wa in the character of Akhenaton and his monotheistic religion . In this film he wa portrayed a being `` Jesus '' like in his refusal to go to war with the Hittites even through they were invading Egypt and in his closing speech about the futility of materiality and political power . Initially one make a connection between Sinuhe , who wa cast adrift in the river Nile in a reed basket , and the Old Testament Moses . But this connection is not carried no doubt this will be fully explored in a new film wherein a Moses like character carry Akhenaton 's monotheistic religion out to the wider world , if such a film will ever be politically possible to make . It is universally accepted that were woman are concerned we man are stupid creature but the relationship or lack of one between Sinuhe and Merit , the character played by Jean Simmons is hard to accept . And that Sinuhe , an educated physician , would be so smitten by Nefer the Babylonian `` femme fatal '' to the extent of giving her his adopted parent house and Tomb is not really believable , neither that his parent would even have a tomb . In real life Nefer ( Nefertitti ) wa the wife of Akhenaton . And although Horemheb did become Pharaoh it wa after a few others including Tutankhamen , who wa the son of Akhenaton . But of course this is just nit picking and the film is enjoyable to watch and that it is about Akhenaton and his monotheistic religion is a big bonus . Maybe following `` The De Vinci Code '' book and film this film be re-made with the central secret being the foundation of our current monotheism ! I wait in great anticipation of such a film , there are already numerous book on the subject .

This is an hilarious movie . One of the very best thing about it is the quality of the performance by each actor . From the largest role to the smallest , each character is vivid , unforgettable and so understandable . It can also make you laugh so hard your health will improve .

Amicus made close to a good half dozen of these horror anthology in the 70 's , and this , from leading horror scribe Robert Bloch , is one of their best effort . There are four story , all worthwhile , but two -- `` Sweets For The Sweet '' and `` Method For Murder '' -- distinguish themselves a highly effective journey into fear . In `` Sweets '' , Christopher Lee play an impatient widower whose lovely daughter ( Chloe Franks ) becomes resentful of his neglect and brutish intolerance , so she sculpts a voodoo doll with which she express her distaste for his method . Franks is a beautiful figure of mischievous evil and delivers one of the greatest child performance in a horror film since Martin Stephens in `` The Innocents '' . This installment is directed with great subtlety and the final outrage , occurring off-screen , is a moment of purest horror . `` Method of Murder '' is about a horror novelist ( Denholm Elliott ) who is menaced by one of his own creation , the creepy Dominic . This episode is striking for it simplicity and stark terror . Dominic may or may not be real , so director Peter Duffell ha a great time playing with our expectation . The brief shot of Dominic reflected in a pond or seen a a fleeting phantasm in a meadow are truly haunting . The original poster art , featuring a skeletal figure clasping a tray holding Peter Cushing 's severed head , wa a rich enticement for punter fixed on fear .

Let 's start from this point : This is not a movie intended for the common audience . Utterly bizarre , somehow incomprehensible , totally unpredictable , it just keep you stoned watching at the screen trying to figure out what will happen next . If that by itself doe n't make you agree it is an excellent movie , then go back to your `` family '' movie and forget about MOTORAMA . It ha material to be considered a cult movie , it can be placed in the same category with movie that win award in Cannes or other intellectual film festival , but , sadly , Hollywood already let if fall in oblivion , simply because it is not commercial . The performance of young Jordan Christopher Michael may not be Oscar material , but he give the right touch to the story . Even the genre is difficult to describe ; it is not a comedy in the proper sense , you do n't know if you are supposed to laugh at the strange situation in which Gus get involved . It is more like an impossible adventure that some kid may wish to have , but do n't let them watch it either ... it is not a movie for kid . So , if you like Disney movie or are looking for a `` Home Alone '' style , this one is definitively not for you . But if you enjoy reading Edgar Alan Poe or the work of Tim Burton , then you will like Motorama . So , jump in your red Mustang , get a tattoo spelling `` Tora '' and cruise Strangeland with Gus . I 'd like that ...

This is the worst movie I have ever seen . The story line is a joke , the effect are terrible , the cinematography doe n't fit the tone of the movie , the dialogue is cheesy , and the actor do a good job at screwing up the rest . People just do n't act that way in real life situation . My question is : Who would fund such crap ? The movie start where some miner fall down a mine shaft after a fireman fails to save them . Next we join some bikers in a forest who ride around doing stunt on their bike . One guy fall and break his leg or something . The fireman arrives to help them . Meanwhile , somebody start a fire . Some more bike stunt . Bla bla bla . I wasted my time . Do not watch this movie .

The somewhat-belligerent brother of a suicide find that he and his mother grieve in much the same way ( by acting out ) but that Dad is morose and blaming himself . Writer-director Dan Harris give u a dysfunctional family torn at the seam , character with question mark hanging over them , and then lay all the story-points out in the most obvious term : Suicide ! Secrets ! Gay shame ! Family sickness ! Ultimately aiming to wrap thing up with a tidy bow , Harris want to make sure we do n't miss a trick , initially giving u thoughtful material to ponder but then spelling everything out in an elementary , sentimental fashion . Sigourney Weaver 's bemused performance a the family matriarch is dryly disengaged and she 's a joy -- that is , until Harris give her a make-over ( complete with sensible new hairstyle ) . It 's the cinematic equivalent of a condescending pat on the head . * * from * * * *

I have n't had a chance to view the previous film , but from what I 've read on other post it wa supposedly worse than this one , although I doubt that is possible . I 'm a huge fan of the `` Zombie '' genre , and I am fascinated by the psychological aspect of viewing creature , that for all intent and purpose are human , a an atrocity that is only worth shooting in the head . That said , HOTD 2 take the `` Zombie '' movie to an all new low . Without giving any big spoiler ( which I really should do just so you wo n't bother wasting your time actually watching this movie ) I would like to express my utter contempt for the way the writer of this film portray our country Special Forces . Gomer Pile could have probably survived longer than the `` Spec Ops '' soldier in this film . For cry out loud they should have called them the Special Education Forces instead . If you are going to write a script where you send in an elite team to deal with an outbreak of zombie , at least have the soldier be smarter than the walking corps . I understand that you have to kill off some or most of the team , but you can find better way to do it than having them set down their machine gun and walk over to lay a tender hand on the shoulder of the drooling crazy person rocking back and forth in the corner of the dark creepy basement . The writer actually try to take the whole zombie thing to a more high-tech level by making it a virus that they are searching for a vaccine for , and the idea ha merit , if it wa n't stuck in the middle of such a ridiculous display of wayward film making . I mean come on , zombie film are n't exactly `` high art '' , and the viewer expects some tongue-in-cheek cheesiness along with the gore and thrill , but HOTD 2 is the type of cheese that make you turn the channel in disgust and awe of the sheer stupidity of the character . If you are a zombie movie fan like me , please do yourself a favor and stay away from this one .

My husband and I just got done watching this movie . I wa not expecting it to be this good ! I wa really astonished at how great the story line wa . I 'm usually very good at figuring out twisty plot ... but this one had me . I loved it ! I 'm going to have to watch it again before I take it back . I might even have to buy it . : )

How did Mike Hammer live - in a penthouse with a GOLF BAG stashed in the corner next to a big screen cathode ray tube TV and a snazzy fireplace ? Nah , he 'd knock back a bottle of rye and twenty unfiltered Camels on the couch or floor of his fly-specked office or in the stink of a lousy downtown LA flop house , wiping the dried red crust and oil smeared mud off his face , that 's how . Spillane wrote trash paperback , for sure , but how do you make it worse ? Give some desperate scheming producer a blank check because he think any Film Noir titled crap will sell at the box office , add some over-the-hill hot tomato and just generally screw-up the story-line by some retard , drugged out screen writer , that 's how !

Last year , I fell in love with the Tim Burton 's version of Sweeney Todd so I wanted to check out the other version of this musical and I found this one at the library . Though I think Burton 's is best , probably because I like film a lot better than theater , this is still a great production of the story . I have n't seen any of the other version but I am trying to get my hand on them . After seeing Johnny Depp a Todd , it 's hard for me to imagine anyone else in the role , but George Hearn doe a fantastic job . Angela Lansbury is great , a always and all of the singing is fantastic . I found myself singing along . This is a play you wo n't want to miss , but try and see it before you see the film version so you wo n't have a biased view like me .

I wa very impressed with what Eddie Monroe wa able to accomplish in regard to it overall affect on me . I say this because I know this independent film had a limited budget/resources , but despite this , it come across a a convincing and well crafted piece of work . Enjoyable from start to finish with several relatively unknown actor which I ca n't help but believe will make a big noise in the industry in year to come , Eddie Monroe did n't fail to keep my interest engaged and my emotional meter dancing . It 's a well scripted story with a startling ending despite my effort to not be taken off guard . Many of the cast name listed for this film are name to look out for in the future . Someone told me that Paul Regina recently passed , and if this is true it 's a real tragedy since his stoic performance in Eddie Monroe is remarkable . Kudos to Fred Carpenter who ha truly pulled out a winner with this one !

This is a very unusual film in that the star with the top billing doe n't appear literally until half way in . Nevertheless I wa engaged by the hook of the Phantom Lady . Curtis , though competent a the falsely accused Scott Henderson , look a little tough to be be sympathetic towards ( perhaps he should have shaved his moustache ) and his behavior when he first come home should have convinced the cop at least to some degree of his innocence . While another commentator had a problem with Franchot Tone a Jack Marlowe I found his portrayal of the character to be impressively complex . He is no stock villain . Superb character actor Elisha Cook Jr. is again in top form a the 'little man with big ambition . ' His drumming in the musical number added a welcome touch of eroticism . This movie however is carried by the very capable and comely Ella Raines a the devoted would be lover of Henderson , Carol Richmond . She definitely ha talent and her screen presence is in the tradition of Lauren Bacall . This is the first of her work I have seen and I am definitely inclined to see her other role . The rest of the supporting cast is also more than competent . All in all a very satisfying film noir mystery which when viewed today fully conveys the dark and complex urban world it is intended to . Recommended , 8/10 .

Wasted is just that , a waste of time . MTV is churning out made for TV movie at quite a clip nowadays . A friend of mine recommended this and i rented it , needle to say i will not be pursuing anymore recomendations from her anytime soon . This movie show the rollercoaster of drug use . The problem is , you really do n't care about any of the character due to lack of believabilty and their own self discipline . This movie is in a word , annoying to watch , from the terrible camera angle to the quality of dialogue and pacing . The 'digital ' format try for realism , but come up distracting . If you want a true scope on drug use watch Requiem for a Dream .

I first saw Enchanted April about five year ago . I loved it so much that my husband surprised me with a copy the following Christmas . It 's about two woman who decide to rent a castle in Italy for the month of April , leaving their humdrum life behind them . They are very sad woman at the outset of the film , and you ca n't help but root them on a they plan this get-away with two other woman they invite along to share the expense . This is perhaps the most feel good movie I have ever seen . It ' pure and simple , with no car chase , no animosity and no death . It wa made with care and in very good taste . You can not help but smile all through it -- except when you 're cry happy tear !

I 'm a 53 year-old college professor . I went with my wife and 12 year old daughter . We all enjoyed the movie . The film is original , witty , fast-paced and totally charming . The plot wa easy enough for a 10 year old to follow , but twisty enough to keep an adult interested . I thought Emma Roberts did a superb job and the rest of the cast wa just fine . My only criticism is that the Los Angeles set were not a interesting a they should have been . They were functional , but nothing stood out . On the other hand , make-up , costume , lighting , cinematography , editing and directing were excellent . Altogether , I thought it wa a totally enjoyable experience . I am disappointed that the professional critic ( almost all adult male ) savagely attacked the film . Apparently , they have something against film that portray strong , intelligent and independent young woman . Their writing reveal more about their own sexist nature than anything about this wonderful family film . I recommend it strongly to every child and every parent .

In my Lit . class we 've just finished the book , Hatchet , and this movie is nothing like the book . ( 1 ) Brian never ate worm in the book . ( 2 ) He did n't know the pilot 's name . ( 3 ) His mom wa cheating on his father in a station wagon not in the wood where anyone could see . ( 4 ) The man the mother is cheating with doe n't have black hair , he ha blonde . Now for the unrealistic part of the movie : ( 1 ) A thirteen year old ca n't punch his fist through a window in one punch . And for the acting , the kid who played Brian wa a horrible actor . However , I do believe that the scenery wa impressive , though I highly doubt the director even read the book . This movie is good if you have not read the book Hatchet , by Gary Paulsen , but if you have , then begin a complaint letter to the director .

This show ha to be my favorite out of all the 80 's horror TV show . Like Tales from the Darkside , also from the same creator , this show is a rare gem . If you agree with me , PLEASE sign this petition I started , to get the word out for Monsters and get it out on DVD . Here is the petition address : www.petitiononline.com/19784444/petition.html Some of my favorite episode would have to be Glim glim , and Rain Dance . I also loved the opening intro with the monster family . That used to creep me out ! One of the thing I would have to ask the DVD creator to include would be the organ sound heard right before where the commercial break would be . I do n't know if any of you remember that part but that 's one of the main thing that brings back memory to me . I mean , come on ! War of the Worlds the TV series already ha been released on DVD , so I say Monsters , and also Tales from the Darkside , and Friday the 13th the series should be released too ! We the fan need to speak our mind ! We need this awesome show on DVD so PLEASE spread the word ! ! !

This is going to be the most useless comment I have ever put down , but yet I must do it to warn you about the atrocity to cinema that `` Freddy 's Dead '' is . It is not only the very worst chapter of the Nightmare series , but is right up there with the worst horror sequel of all time ! It wa boring , pointless , and nearly death free . The horrible 3-D ending and over-the-top CORNY kill are enough to drive this `` film '' into the ground . However , it doe n't stop there , just add bad acting , a terrible script , and a number of cheesy cameo and you 've got yourself this heaping pile of guano ! It 's no wonder why Freddy , a always played by Robert Englund , ha made two postmortem appearance . I would too if I went out like that . This is a strictly fan only movie , do n't stare at our shame .

This is one of the movie of Dev Anand who gave great yet distinct movie to Hindi movie industry such a Jewel thief and guide . The story is short ( if you ask me what is the story ) , plot is simple- a brother seek for his lost sister . Sister ha joined the hippy who smoke from pot and chant Hare Rama hare Krishna . Yet the movie portrays few of the significant event that the world experienced in 70's.Hippie culture , their submission to drug , freedom , escaping duty , family , and adopting anything new such a eastern ( which wa new for white ) religion . They have been handled perfectly . Zeenat gave her best and Dev a usual wa remarkable . Songs are the best used ( unlike they are abused for the sake of having song ) in this movie . They have not been spoiled.One perfect example is 'Dekho o deewano ... Ram ka naam badnam na karo ' . Each word in the song is very philosophical and meaningful . The end is tragic but that is not the essence of the movie . Overall Devji who doe believe in making different movie ha been successful in showing what he wanted to show here . A must see to experience hippie culture and beautiful Nepal of 70 's .

As an aging rocker , this movie mention Heep and Quo - my 2 favourite band ever - but with the incredible cast ( everyone ) - and the fantastic storyline - I just love this piece of creative genius . I can not recommend it more highly - and Mick Jones added so much ( Foreigner lead and primary songwriter along with the greatest rock singer ever - Lou Gramm ) - I have watched this great work more than 10 times- Bill Nighy - what a voice - and Jimmy Nail - talent ooze from every pore - then Astrid .... and Karen ..... what more could an aging rocker ask for ! ! 10/10 - bloody brilliant . Alastair , Perth , Western Oz , Originally from Windsor , England .

Winchester 73 get credit from many critic for bringing back the western after WWII . Director Anthony Mann must get a lot of credit for his excellent direction . Jimmy Stewart doe an excellent job , but I think Stephen McNalley and John McIntire steal the movie with their portrayal of two bad guy involved in a high stake poker game with the treasured Winchester 73 going to the winner . This is a good script with several story going on at the same time . Look for the first appearance of Rock Hudson a Young Bull . Thank God , with in a few year , we would begin to let Indians play themselves in western film . The film is in black and white and wa shot in Tucson Arizona . I would not put Winchester 73 in the category of Stagecoach , High Noon or Shane , but it get an above average recommendation from me . .

I am sad to say that I disagree with other people on this Columbo episode . Death Lends a Hand is frankly kind of a boring Columbo to me . After a few time , I get bored and changed the channel . I still love Robert Culp and Patricia Crowley and Ray Milland in their role but the story wa weaker in this episode than in the others . First , Robert Culp play an investigator for Ray Milland 's character . He hire him to investigate his young pretty wife played by Patricia Crowley to see if she is having an affair . In return , Culp 's character blackmail the cheating wife who plan to expose his scheme to her husband ruining his career . Out of anger , Culp kill her by striking her in the face and setting the up the body elsewhere . I do n't know . Maybe I just did n't care for this one at all . Of course , Columbo get him in the end . It 's just the question of how .

Prison is not often brought up during conversation about the best eighty horror film , and there 's a good reason for that because it 's not one of the best ... but a you delve past the classic film that the decade had to offer , this is certainly among the best of the lesser known/smaller film . The film doe have some connection to blockbuster ; for a start it 's an early directorial effort for Renny Harlin ; the capable director behind a number of action film including Die Hard 2 , Cliffhanger and Deep Blue Sea ; and secondly we have an early role for Lord of the Rings star Viggo Mortensen . The film is not exactly original but the plot line is interesting . We focus on a prison that ha been reopened after a number of year . This wa the prison where a man named Charles Forsyth wa sent to the electric chair after being framed by the prison 's governor . Naturally , the spirit of the dead man is not resting in peace ; and when the old execution room is reopened , the spirit of the dead convict escape for vengeance . The film is not exactly The Shawshank Redemption , but it doe take care to build up it various character and while the main point of the film is always the horror , the prison drama behind it all doe make for an interesting base . This is a good job too because other than the basic premise , the film doe n't really have a 'plot ' to go from and we solely rely on the interaction between the character to keep thing interesting . The horror featured in the film is at time grotesque but it 's never over the top , which might actually be the reason why this film is seldom remembered , being released in a decade of excess . The murder themselves are rather good and imaginative , however , and provide some major highlight . As the film go on , we start to delve more into the back-story of the vengeful convict 's ghost and while it 's fairly interesting , some thing about it do n't make sense and it drag the film down a little . Still , everything boil down to an exciting climax and overall I have to say that Prison is a film well worth tracking down .

Butch the peacemaker ? Evidently . After the violent beginning with Spike , Tom and Jerry all swinging away at each other , Butch call a halt and want to know why . It 's a good question . `` Cats can get along with dog , ca n't they ? '' he asks Tom , who nod his head in agreement . `` Mice can get along with cat , right ? '' Jerry nod `` no , '' and then see that is n't the right answer . They go inside and Butch draw up a `` Peace Treaty '' ( complete with professional artwork ! ) . Most of the rest , and the bulk of the cartoon , is the three of them being extremely nice to one another What a refreshing change-of-pace . I found it fun to watch . I can a million of these cartoon in which every beat each other over the head . Anyway , you knew the peace wa n't going to last . A big piece of steak spell the death of the `` peace treaty '' but en route it wa nice change and still had some of usual Tom & Jerry clever humor .

like in so many movie of the past , you would think Hollywood would learn this by now , make for a very disappointing movie , not to mention , make sure the kidnapped victim is alive first before paying the ransom . Maybe this film want to remind of these basic fact in case it should ever happen to one of u . Why the long walk in the wood and can a city guy really go through the wood without getting lost ? Just an opportunity for some sentimental dialog that wa meaningless in the end . I had to listen to part of the director 's comment in the special feature section , from the great move that Redford ha made in the past , ( Sneakers for one ) surprised he agreed to star in such a film . The director 's comment and reason were weak . The best part of this movie wa the scenery , ca n't wait for spring to come .

I really wanted to write a title for this review that did n't come off a corny or gushing but still described my feeling for this show . I can see now that it is not possible . `` American Family '' is one of the best show I have ever had the pleasure of watching on television . Several reviewer here on IMDb have mentioned the word `` beautiful '' when describing this show . Never ha a word been more fitting . The cinematography for this show is stunning . Every scene and shot look like a masterpiece . The lighting , camera move , scene composition and color ... I have to keep reminding myself that I 'm watching a TV Show and not a Motion Picture masterpiece . The score by Lee Holdridge and Nathan Wang brings tear to my eye . And most importantly , the acting by the all around amazing cast is honest and sincere . I do not feel like I am watching performance ... I feel like I 'm watching real life . If only real life could be this beautiful . `` American Family '' ha indeed raised the bar for quality entertainment on Television . I highly recommend this show to anyone who is willing to watch it . I could easily chide CBS for passing on this show , but I have to say that it doe n't matter to me who air it . I 'm just glad it 's out there for everyone to see . So I do thank PBS for not allowing this show to disappear into nothingness . I have to give special recognition to the way each season 's finale ended . The first one wa pure creative brilliance and it moved me to tear . I wa waiting to see if season two would also end in a creative way , and sure enough it did . Again , tear . My thanks to all of those involved . You really have made a special piece of art with this show , and I sincerely mean that . It is a shame that we only got two season , but a miracle we got anything at all .

I saw this film at a special screening . At first I thought the movie would be like a typical Amanda Bynes movie , but I wa wrong . The movie is based on the Shakespeares book `` The Twelth Night '' This movie tell the story of a girl who life to play soccer . Well when the girl team is cut she ha to go to great length to get on the guy team at a different school to get revenge on the egotistical guy team at her old school . On her way she get caught up in a long tangled web of love , lie , and deception . This movie is this year Mean Girls . I think it show some great new actor ability and there are defiantly some big star to be featured in this movie .
