It lost NONE of it 's original kung fu coolness ! If you are a fan of kung fu/karate movie , this is a must see ... the DVD is available . I believe this movie is also called `` Pick Your Poison '' . Watch it soon !

... And there were quite a few of these . I do not like this cartoon a much a many others , partly because it wa made in it period . I much prefer cartoon with Daffy and Bugs which are fifteen or so year before-hand . Many people will like this , particularly people who always find violence funny , cartoon or not . The basic plot is a pretty well known one for Looney Tunes : Elmer go out hunting , Daffy lead him to Bugs and Daffy end up being shot instead . Also inserted are quite clever and highly entertaining joke ( some do not enhance the episode ) , ugly shooting and animation which is slightly mediocre . The plot is mainly geared by joke - each joke keep the episode going . This way of plot-going is not all that unusual in Looney Tunes ( of course if you are pretty much a Looney Tunes boffin - or an eager one - like me , then you 'll know this already ) . For people who love everything about Looney Tunes and Daffy Duck and like the sound of what I have said about it , enjoy `` Rabbit Seasoning '' ! 7 and a half out of ten .

Others have commented on the somewhat strange video arrangement . I think they were trying to capture what you 'd be looking at when attending a live performance . The foot , the face , the overall view . Unfortunately , it fall a bit short . But , having said that , watching Colin Dunne is nevertheless gratifying . It 's an interesting contrast to Michael Flatley in the original video . The progression of the show is evident , change from the original Dublin production are evident . `` Trading Taps '' is the highlight of the video , in my opinion . Tarik Winston is unbelievable , a is his partner in the piece . I think the audio wa better in this version than the original video production ( 1995 ) . In Dolby 5.1 on DVD it 's excellent . Despite the flawed videography , it 's a must-own for Riverdance fan .

When I saw this in the cinema , I remember wincing at the bad acting about a minute or two into the first scene , then immediately telling myself `` no , this ha to get better '' . It did n't . The performance are pretty uniformly teak 'n pine and no , there is NO sexual chemistry in this film whatsoever , just the awkward posturing of a reasonably comely , discreetly talentless actress who seems born to grace the cover of `` Interviú '' and not much else besides . If the scriptwriter thought that making Mérimée a character wa a stunningly original creative ploy he perhaps ought to get out more . And Aranda , if he 'd given the matter a bit more thought , would have realised that the story of Carmen is just CRYING OUT for a thoughtful , iconoclastic , parodic deconstruction , not this leave-your-brains-at-the-turnstile affair of ersatz passion and comic-book dialogue . This is contemporary Spanish cinema at it worst .

De Palma 's technique had hit it high maturity by the time of this film , which is a wonderful showcase of his classic technique , though unfortunately , a with many of the film written by De Palma himself , the story serf the meta more than the interest of putting forth an emotionally compelling tale . The story open with a CRAZY scene in which Angie Dickinson masturbates in a shower while she look at her husband . She is then grabbed and raped while he husband stand obliviously near-and the whole thing is revealed to be Angie 's fantasy a he husband is pumping mindlessly away at her in bed . She ha a short scene with her son , a dead ringer for Harry Potter , which concludes with a joke that `` she 'll tell grandma that he is playing with his peter . '' She then go to her therapy session , where she complains about her dead marriage , before attempting to seduce her therapist , Michael Caine . He refuse , and she is hurt and feeling unattractive and unfulfilled . Then begin a bravura 22-minute nearly wordless sequence that is perhaps the highlight of the film . Among the many thing De Palma gleaned from Hitchcock is the understanding of film a a purely visual medium of telling story and in typical De Palma fashion , he turn this into a way to show off his formidable skill . The problem , for me , is that in this instance one begin to feel that scene are being needlessly protracted simply to further show off the director 's skill . The sequence begin with Angie at an art museum . She watch stranger , all involved in sexual or family activity , then begin to get turned on to a man sitting next to her . De Palma very skillfully tell an extremely complicated narrative without a single word about Angie 's attraction , embarrassment , retreating , and finally finding and submitting to the stranger in the back of a taxi cab , all set to a wonderfully lush score by Pino Donaggio , who also scored Carrie . In the second part of the sequence Angie ha slept with the guy , and get up to return to her husband . Again De Palma crams a ton of narrative in without a word of dialogue uttered , a Angie realizes that she doe n't have her panty , that her husband is already home and no doubt wondering where she is , that she ha probably contracted a venereal disease , and that she ha lost her engagement ring somewhere in the shuffle . It 's all very admirable , but one begin to feel a little strung along a we are forced to do thing like take a long elevator ride down from the seventh floor , then up again , almost in real time . ... Spoilers from here on out ! When Angie reach the seventh floor again , she is killed by a big woman with blond hair . The woman hack away at her until she reach the ground floor , when the door open and Nancy Allen see her there . There is a wonderful slow-motion sequence a Nancy reach into the elevator , Angie reach up toward her , and the killer 's blade is held poised to slash Nancy 's hand . Then follow some electrifying shot a Nancy look up and see the killer in the elevator convex mirror . It 's all good , and by the time we have some dialogue again , you think ; `` Woah , that wa just 22 straight minute of purely visual narrative ! '' Or maybe you do n't , but I do . A younger Dennis Franz ha a great part a a sleazy and tough New York detective who would rather that everyone else do his work for him . He Interviews Michael Caine , making the outrageous implication ( though it pass a commonplace ) that Angie WANTED to be killed . Angie 's son is there a well , and he hook up with Nancy , and they set about to spy on Caine 's therapist and find out who the killer is . Once again there is a strong tie to a Hitchcock film , in this case Psycho ( just a Obsession is a re-working of Vertigo ) . You have a woman who we are supposed to understand is secretly a slut , who get killed in the first 30 minute in an enclosed space , in this case an elevator rather than a shower . Then the relative of the deceased conduct an investigation , which reveals that the killer is a man who dress a a woman to kill . De Palma even throw in a doctor at the end who explains the psychology of the whole thing . It is very interesting , but at the same time a viewer can begin to feel a bit jerked around , and that is my primary reservation about this film . It is definitely essential viewing and showcase some of De Palma 's greatest setpieces , but that feeling that the story is running a solid third behind the need for De Palma to show off and his somewhat unseemly sexual fantasy make it hard to look back on this one with whole-hearted affection . -- - Check out other review on my website of bad and cheesy movie , Cinema de Merde , cinemademerde.com

Having read many of the comment here , I 'm surprised that no one ha recognized this a basically an overlong remake of a Twilight Zone episode from 1960 called `` Mirror Image , '' starring Vera Miles . Rod Serling did a much better job of creating an effective spooky tale in 24 minute than Sean Ellis did in 88 minute with this tedious snooze . A short piece can be effective with a mysterious and unexplained ending , but in a feature film , there should be a bit more substance and the story should make sense . Sadly , substance and sense are two thing missing from `` The Broken . '' Yes , it ha some moment , but they are not enough to justify your time . Some further observation : although this is clearly a contemporary story , not one character in the movie ha a cellphone ! And even though a car accident is the event that get the story going , there is never any reference to an insurance company , to the person who wa driving the other car , or to the police who would have been required to do a report . My advice : skip this bore and watch the original instead !

Just got around to seeing Monster Man yesterday . It had been a long wait and after lot of anticipation and build up , I 'm glad to say that it came through and met my expectation on every level . True , you really ca n't expect too much from hearing the plot rundown , but after reading some of the review for it , I wa ecstatic . I mean , what trash fan would n't want to see a gore flick about a deranged inbred hick mowing people down with his make-shift monster truck ? I went in expecting a cross between Road Trip and The Hills Have Eyes and got so much more . This wa a horror comedy that actually worked . The film maker got it right when it came to making you squirm and making you howl with laughter at the same time . Kudos to Michael Davis for going all out with the gore and pushing the envelope with the sickass humor . Let me list just a few reason why I love this movie so much : First off is the story . It 's been done to death in so many other flick . A college guy get wind that his childhood crush is getting married . He , being the 25 year old virgin that he is , hop in his Vista Cruiser and decides to take the road trip to confess his love , hoping that she will fall head over hill and all that good jive . Hidden in the backseat of his station wagon , is good buddy Harley . Harley is the loudmouth , former friend , who laugh and talk just like Jack Black in High Fidelity . You ca n't help but like the guy , but if he wa your friend in real life , you 'd have to keep a whiffle ball bat handy ( laugh all you want , but have you ever been hit with one ? ) to keep him in check . So , he 's a little on the obnoxious side , to say the least , but you can tell that he 's a loyal friend , deep down ... Anyway , they 're on the road and when they stop in a bar , they aggravate the local . Now they 're being stalked by a leatherface clone in a monster truck . That 's it . Yeah , along the way they pick up a gorgeous hitchhiker but I 'm too lazy and hungover to go into that right now ... so just watch the damn movie . Second thing I love wa the humor . This one had some of the sickest laugh of any movie since Cabin Fever . Just how messed up is it ? Well , I wo n't even go into the whole cat scene and a for the `` corpse burrito '' thing , I 'll leave that to your virgin eye a well . The bar full of amputee wa somewhat disturbing and that guy who looked like John Turturro bothered me too . Harley , although a totally obnoxious frat-boy type , can really sling off the one liner . Love the clog , by the way . I need a new pair .. The GORE . This one pours it on heavy . While the first hour play out a a demented road comedy , the last third is all about blood and gut . If the movie had n't kept such a light tone throughout , it would have been a little disturbing , but seeing how it wa all played for laugh , there is no way possible that you will be bothered by it . If you 're still in your seat by the time it come , you 'll probably see the humor in it too , but seriously , there were bucket and bucket of the red stuff . There wa a big plot turn that I DID N'T see coming and when the credit rolled , I wa completely satisfied . I had gotten exactly what I came for and I 'm really glad that I bought it . Much like Cabin Fever , it 's going to get a lot of replay . The Look of the movie wa outstanding . There wa this deliberately cheap look that made the whole thing scream late 80 and I loved the exaggerated color . It 's obvious that Monster Man wa done on a relatively low budget , but much like Cabin Fever ( sorry I keep comparing the two ) it actually work in the movie 's favor . Cabin Fever wa an ode to the 70 great , this wa the 80 answer to that . So take that for what it 's worth . No CGI here . This is what we all needed . I 'm not exactly sure why it did n't get a theatrical release because this is everything that Jeepers Creepers SHOULD have been . Thank god for Lions Gate .

I wa very moved by the story and because I am going through something similar with my own parent , I really connected . It is so easy to forget that someone whose body is failing wa once vibrant and passionate . And then there 's the mistake they made and have to live with . I loved Ellen Burstyn 's performance and who is Christine Horne ? She 's fantastic ! A real find . There is probably the most erotic scene I 've ever seen in a film , yet nothing wa shown - it wa just so beautifully done . Overall the look and feel of the film wa stunning , a real emotional journey . Cole Hauser is very very good in this picture , he humanizes a man spiraling downwards . I liked the way the filmmaker approached this woman 's life , never sentimental , never too much - just enough to hook u in , but not enough to bog down .

What great location . A visual challenge to all those who put their eye behind the lens.This little jewel is an amazing account of what you can shoot in just 16 day . Good going folk ! . I can not wait to see what your next feature will be . I 'll be with you all the way .

The Earth is destined to be no more thanks to Father Pergado and a bunch of Nuns . Christopher Lee ( who ha since said that he wa duped in to appearing in this by his producer who told him load of great actor were involved ) is Father Pergado and get to do his usual serious and scary routine . The cast are not too bad , though most have now retired from acting . The film ha terrible sound effect ( mainly created from pressing key on an old computer it seems ) and it ridiculously pondering at time - showing a scene of the sky , for instance , for what feel like hour at a time . Despite this the story is pretty humorous in a world-is-doomed sort of way and the production is adequate . Interestingly one scene feature Albert Band and wife Jackie ; Meda Band ; Writer Frank Ray Perilli and Charles Band 's assistant Bennah Burton . Despite it plodding nature I genuinely wanted to see how it all worked out and thus quite liked it .

Well , where do I start ... As one of the other reviewer said , you know you 're in for a real treat when you see the opening shot - minute and minute of film time spent on a guy standing on a travelator . I wo n't repeat Rubin 's excellent summary of the story . What I would like to say , though , is that this film gripped me more than any film I can remember . I sat open-mouthed , and on the edge of my seat all the way through . The camera work , sound track and * fantastic * performance ( particularly that of Tony Servillo ) draw you to the screen and wo n't let you look away . It 's Italian , so of course everyone look fantastic , but it is by no mean merely an exercise in cool style . This is a film with lot to say about luck , loss and love . Go and see it .

Begotten is one of the most unique film I 've ever seen . It is more , to me , a study of sound , light and dark , and movement than a real story . The type of thing you see a a video instillation at the museum of modern art than a film enjoyed at the local theater . I 'm not going to try to interpret the image of the mother nature , the beast in cloak , the twisted and tortured body of her `` child '' . Some thing just defy interpretation .

Although this wa a low budget film and clearly last minute , it hold a certain charm that is difficult to pinpoint . I tend to believe it is the scriptwriter- Grant Morris ( see Dead Dog ) , who , despite the warped plot line injected a fantastic slice of humour , sorely missing in many of today 's box office hit . Definitely a must see for a Sunday afternoon laughfest . Speaking a a true single girl , and very sceptical this film did not inspire me particularly , but did ignite a small flame of hope for a lovelife . Not my lovelife , so much a my slightly crazy neighbour 's lovelife who let her hamster sleep in her bed with her . She may find someone .

Darr is a great movie ! Shahrukh play an obsessed lover who will do almost anything to win over his lady which in this case is Juhi Chawla . Little doe Juhi know in the film that Shahrukh ha a MAJOR crush on her and is constantly stalking her . I have to admit , some of the thing he did in this movie were pretty creepy ... like the threatening phone call . Never in my life will I forget the line , `` I love you K .. k .. k .. Kiran ! '' It 's just too bad that Shahrukh and Juhi were n't exactly `` together '' in the film . But Juhi and Sunny do make a fairly good couple in the movie . Though Shahrukh 's role wa pretty psychotic , I still think he did a great job of playing it and ca n't possibly imagine anyone else doing that role . No wonder he got an award for Darr in 94 ' ! Juhi ... what can I say ? ? ? She look especially amazing in this film ! It 's not that she doe n't always look amazing in her other film , but Darr did give the public a wonderful image of her ! As for the music ... it wa excellent ! Especially `` Jaadu Teri Nazar , '' one of my all time favorite song . I also thought `` Tu Mere Samne '' wa quite nice also . A must see for everyone ! Overall Darr deserves a 9/10 !

It would be a shame if Tommy Lee Jones and Robert Duval ever see this movie a they will probably be associated with it in year to come . `` Oh yeah '' , the public will say , `` 'Comanche Moon ' , that 's the mini series about the Texas Rangers and the Comanche Indians that starred Tommy Lee Jones and Robert Duval . It wa a real stinker and probably the worst movie they were ever in . I think it wa a comedy but a not very funny comedy . I really do n't understand why they agreed to be in it '' . That would be such an injustice a the original `` Lonesome Dove '' wa a true western classic and this turkey is a real bomb and Jones and Duval will be remembered for it .

I love this movie . The cast were all terrific in the portrayal of their various character . Judith Ivey did so well portraying a weak , fearful , dependent , who wa passive aggressive in her complaining and self-involved character , that it wa a relief to see the character 's metamorphosis . Blythe Danner wa equally appealing in her role a a somewhat judgmental Jewish mother , devoted wife , and loving sister . Jonathon Silmerman , Bob Dishy , Stacey Glick , and Lisa Walz performed their role equally well . If you enjoy movie that relate to going through challenging time without loosing your sense of humor and hope , you will love this movie .

This is one of the unusual case in which a movie and the novel on which it is based are both great . Maybe this is because Gorris ' take Nabokov 's initial idea and give them a different interpretation . The final consequence is a point of view over Luzhin which dignifies him more than the Nabokov 's one . The only thing in the movie which I do n't like is the influence of Valentinov 's on Luzhin 's destiny . I ca n't imagine Nabokov creating a person like Valentinov and giving him so great influence on novel 's argument .

Not to be confused with the Resse Witherspoon high school film of the same name , this is a stylised look at Hong Kong 's triad gang . Called election because a new leader or 'chairman ' is elected by ancient tradition every two year . Two candidate are up for the position and through ego , bribe and past track record the race is tense to say the least . Expertly directed to introduce you to an expansive cast without ever being confusing the story twist and turn before revealing itself in all it brutal glory . The Asian godfather this is not , but it is an enjoyable thriller in a gangster genre that will leave you on the edge of your seat and wincing at the violence . Subtitled volume 1 I think it safe to say there will other instalment a we go deeper into the murky world of the triad and all their feuding and underhand business deal . Either way this is a good start and if there are no sequel a great film in it own right .

A SHIRLEY TEMPLE Short Subject . It can get mighty rough at Buttermilk Pete 's Cafe when the local contingency of diaper-clad WAR BABIES come in for their midday milk break . This primitive little film - a spoof of military movie - provides a few chuckle , but little else : tiny tot talking tough can begin to pall in a short time . Shirley Temple , playing a duplicitous hip-swinging French miss , ha n't much to do in this pre-celebrity performance . Highlight : the real sign of toddler temper when a few of the infant unexpectedly get well & truly soaked with milk . Often overlooked or neglected today , the one and two-reel short subject were useful to the Studios a important training ground for new or burgeoning talent , both in front & behind the camera . The dynamic for creating a successful short subject wa completely different from that of a feature length film , something akin to writing a topnotch short story rather than a novel . Economical to produce in term of both budget & schedule and capable of portraying a wide range of material , short subject were the perfect complement to the Studios ' feature film .

I liked this movie a lot . It really intrigued me how Deanna and Alicia became friend over such a tragedy . Alicia wa just a troubled soul and Deanna wa so happy just to see someone after being shot . My only complaint wa that in the beginning it wa kind of slow and it took awhile to get to the basis of thing . Other than that it wa great .

I felt obliged to watch this movie all the way through , since I had found it in a bargain bin and bought it for my own , but I came close many time to turning it off and just writing off the money I had paid for it . If you are a fan of gore and sadism , this movie is OK . If there is one thing that the maker of this film know , it is the creative use of fake blood and body part for a sickening effect . If that doe n't thrill you , then stay away . This movie is shot on a home video camera , with grade school prop and terrible actor . It 's dubbed from German , but even allowing for that , the sound is awful . This film is about a budget a budget get , except for the aforementioned special effect . If they had spent a little more money on actor and a real script instead of blood and gut , the film might have been a little more enjoyable . The story is about three men that land on an island inhabited by an army of tin-masked sadist . They are captured , and the rest of the movie is about their attempt to escape . I call this a story in the loosest sense , since it is really a series of scene of torture and combat strung together by inane obscenity-filled dialog . There is nothing whatsoever redeeming about this movie , unless you like mindless gore . Consider yourself warned .

It 's pretty evident that many of your night were spent alone . If you watched 5 minute of the actual show instead of watching the commercial you would have seen one of the greatest television show in Canadian history being made . Too bad you would have been watching it alone . Probably the reason you hate it ... no game . Keys to the VIP is hilarious , light and funny . Guys are going to eat this show up . My game is tight and I can hardly wait to get on this show . The chick were HOOOOOT and the club kicked as . I 'll be watching every week . It make me wonder why more great show like this one are n't being made . Now it 's clear that the talent in Canada ha the ability to produce American quality television .

George Saunders is a forger who steal a rare copy of Hamlet , killing a guard in the process . Months later an associate of his is selling forgery of the book for great sum of money . One of the forgery is sold to a man working for the Nazi 's . Not happy at being taken the Nazi front man insists on getting his money back , at the same time an investigator working for one of the other swindled client show up . The middle woman in an effort to keep herself safe begin to play all side against each other and set up a meeting at the New York public library between various party , however a people begin to die , the library is locked down and more murder ( and perhaps some rare book larceny ) seem to be close to happening . Complex murder mystery is a good little thriller with a great cast ( Saunders is joined by Richard Denning and a cast of solid supporting player ) If there is a flaw the film is almost too complicated with plot with in plot and everyone pretty much out for themselves . The layer of theft , forgery , murder and war time intrigue ( this wa 1942 ) are almost too many for the brief 70 minute running time . Still it an enjoyable little film with a darkness and sense of inescapable doom for some of the character that clearly mark this a one of the first film noirs . Until Denning show up we 're down among some charming thief , whom we like , perhaps even more than the hero , but it clear from word and deed this is not going to have a completely happy ending , and they know it , even if they fight it . A good little film that 's worth searching out .

This is a movie about a black man buying a airline company and turning the company into a African-centric over the top airliner . They even portray the owner a not only being in control of the airline , but also controlling part of the air terminal at the airport . One day this guy win $ 100 million dollar a the next time you see him , he is walking all over the airport acting like the owner of the airport . Everyone call this movie a parody , but nothing about this movie shout parody ! This movie is a flop and will forever be in the $ 4.95 bin at Wal-Mart . I ca n't even come to term to why MGM would waste 16 million dollar on this movie . This movie doe n't even warrant straight-to-video status . The writer ( one black and one white ) should be blackballed from Hollywood forever . Not only do they over-stereotype black , they portray them a ignorant human being . I would be ashamed of going to a movie that constantly humiliates me . Do n't waste your time at the video store , wal-mart , pay-per-view , or on a Sunday afternoon when the movie is shown on TBS .

I 've noticed how all the other review of this film mention how `` wholesome '' and `` entertaining '' it is . These people need to get out of the house more often . I do n't know why they 're shilling for this vapid , insipid , brainless piece of fluff . Pat Boone ha absolutely no acting talent whatsoever , and his ineptness is exceeded only by that of his co-star Pamela Austin , a former model ( yet one more reason to outlaw the insidious practice of inflicting talentless model on an unsuspecting moveiegoing public , a foul habit that unfortunately persists to this day ) . A good supporting cast ( Terry-Thomas , Edward Everett Hortyon , among others ) try hard to make some sense out of this , but to no avail . I noticed that two director shared credit , although `` credit '' is n't the word I would use ( neither is `` director '' ) . As for `` wholesome entertainment , '' there are plenty of those type of movie available without torturing your loved one by forcing them to sit through this . Find one of those film , and skip this one .

This movie wa an excellent acted , excellent directed and overall had an excellent story . Ive had real life experiance with a boy like 'Radio ' . At the football program in my town , weve had a mentally challenged boy every year practice , travel , and have fun with the football team . This movie is really true and i can identify with it 100 % . A boy like 'Radio ' just need to feel like they belong to something ; they need to feel like their life is worth living . Thats how 'Radio ' feel and thats why that type of program is set up at my high school . This is a very touching movie that im glad ha been brought to the big screen . My dad and I loved it and i will always remember this for being a movie that tell a riveting story of the goodness and kindness of man !
Cheap , amateurish , unimaginative , exploitative ... but do n't think it 'll have redeeming amusement value . About a unentertaining , uninstructive and just plain dull a a film can be .

The car in this movie are awesome . The acting in this movie is awful . The plot and driving scene do n't make much sense and are equally bad . If you get really bothered by movie where someone shift and suddenly go ridiculously faster , save yourself the trouble and money . Good movie for racing fan ? Well , there is a part where they make the mistake of referring to a NASCAR driver a a rally car driver . If you ca n't tell the difference , go watch it , you 'll have a blast . It really come down to this , there are really really really nice car in this movie , they are driven horribly and are completely unrealistic . The acting is horrible mainly because of the extremely bad plot . If you want to see hot girl , turn on mtv or vh1 instead . I am disappointed that such nice car would be represented in such a bad movie . If the class of the car were to match that of the movie , they should be racing with rusted bicycle .

Who doe n't have unresolved issue with parent ? And which parent do n't have unresolved issue with each other ? I know , that sound heavy . But this is played for laugh in the movie , making both the comedy better and the drama better . I 've always like Paul Reiser and Peter Falk , and although I wa a bit concerned that their star quality might be too big for a small movie , I wa enchanted from the very first scene . Especially entertaining were the discovery that the son make about his father a a person . And Peter Falk 's monologue about being a hard-working , sacrificing father and husband wa the perfect balancing point . Without that scene being acted so well , the movie would have seemed far le nuanced , and the character far le interesting . Nicely done , Paul and Peter !

Good animation , nice character design , and a light-hearted story make Suzumiya Haruhi no Yuutsu enjoyable to watch . After my first viewing , I thought that this anime wa pretty good , but but wa much better on for a second watch . This is because it is done out of chronological order , and once you re watch it in correct order you notice connection you did n't see before . ( OR it may be that you see a second meaning to some event you did n't notice before ) You may want to read the original novel ( not manga ) by Tanigawa Nagaru before/after seeing this . The anime is very good at visualizing every detail in the story it show . However , there are some short story from the book that are not animated , but are referenced to . ( bamboo w/ wish attached shown in episode 14 ) Overall , this anime is actually very good once after brief analyzation of the plot ( reading the book improves upon it a well ) . It is a nice break from the shounen-jump anime that seem to be taking over .

A film like Crossfire put another film that spread around it social consciousness- i.e . the recent film Crash- almost to shame . Not necessarily because either one put forth it message of intolerance-is-rotten more significantly ( although I 'd wager Crash throw the hammer down much more thickly in comparison with this ) , but because of how the storytelling and contrivance never get much in the way like with Crash . Maybe it 's not really necessary to compare the two , a Crossfire is in it core all deep into the film-noir vein like it going out of style . It wa interesting actually to see what the director Edward Dmytryk said on the DVD interview , where he mentioned that the budget for the photography wa significantly lower ( on purpose ) so that more could be spent on the actor , and the schedule went through at a very brisk , quick pace . But then what come off then a being incredible about the picture is that you would think looking at many of the lighting set-ups that it took a lot to do . Just for a small scene , like when Robert Mitchum 's Keeely first go in for questioning under the Captain Robert Young- the contrast of shadow seamlessly in the room is exquisite . That there are many other lighting set-ups that go even further with so little mark this a something essential in the realm of just the look of the noir period . Just take a look at a shot of character on a stairwell , the bar silhouetted against them , and see what I mean . But back to the substance part of the film- it 's really a story that consists of a murder mystery , but one that we a the audience do n't take long to figure on the answer . It 's then more about something else then in the mind and soul of a killer that would n't be found in a common crime picture then , a there are really no 'criminals ' for the most part in the film . There 's a very calculated risk with this then that character could be too thin just to prop up the ( worthwhile ) message against anti-semitism . But Dmytryk 's direction of his top-shelf cast , along with a really terrific script by John Paxton flesh out the character , least of which for what they should have to not seem too thin alongside the message . And what would a noir be then without some attitude to go along with it ? Mitchum help that along , even in scene like between him and Young where it very much based in the situation of the story 's moment ( i.e . a detail in the plot ) , by injecting a little sly wit into some of the dialog . It may already be there in the line , but he help make the character with a good edge for his scene . Then there 's also Robert Ryan , who excels at Montgomery a a man who you know you do n't like much at first , just through his b.s . demeanor , but you 're not totally sure about either . Then once it start to come clearer- ironically through a subjective view-point of the suspect Mitchell ( George Cooper ) at the apartment of the soon-to-be-deceased Samuels- his performance becomes a great balancing act of being full of crap and also rather frightening in his blind-way . It 's a good performance when also countered with Cooper , who ha actual personal issue that he face and come forward with regret and humility . It 's really after the film end that one think about a lot of this , however , and while you 're watching the film it 's more about getting into the dialog and the flow of the scene , and in the sometimes stark , overpowering camera move on the actor , so the message is in a way secondary . Not that it is n't an important one , especially for the time period ( coming right off of WW2 ) , but year later it seeing the actor , even the one that do n't get the big marquee status like Gloria Grahame a Ginny ( the femme fatale of the picture , if it could 've had time for one which it doe n't ) and William Phipps a Leroy ( the `` hick '' ) , working off one another that stick much strongly in the compacted screenplay . Dmytryk is also very wise in choosing to limit the musical score is powerful too , a for very long stretch we hear nothing , and mostly when it doe come up it 's incidental to the character 's surroundings . He could 've just a easily gone with added musical note on some dramatic scene for emphasis , most specifically the opening audience-grabber into the film . By sticking clear of that , and getting the right attitude and nuance in camera and cast , it uplift standard in genre material to a very fine , memorable level . My favorite scene would probably go to Finley 's story about an Irish immigrant he tell to Leroy , where all such element come into place well . It might not come in very high at the top of my favorite noirs- and I 'd still throw-down Murder My Sweet a the director 's masterpiece in this kind of picture- but it 's assuredly higher in quality than something of the B-level too .

Warning Spoilers following . Superb recreation of the base in Antarctica where the real event of the film took place . Other than that , libelous ! , scandalous ! Filmed in Canada ; presumably by a largely Canadian crew and cast . I caught the last half of this film recently on Global television here in Canada . Nothing much to say other than how thoroughly appalled I wa at what a blatant piece of American historical revisionist propaganda it is ; and starring Susan Sarandon of all people ! I can only assume that Canadian born director Roger Spottiswoode wa coerced to make the USAF the hero of the film when in fact the real rescuer where a small private airline based in Calgary ; Kenn Borek Air .

The club scene in this film are extremely believable , Tim Curry is in his most venal mode , and there are enough drug and violence here for two movie , maybe even three . What more do you require from an evening 's entertainment ? Pump up the volume .

This movie make me think the others I 've seen with Combs were an accident . The plot had more hole than I think I 've ever seen in a movie purporting to be something more than a `` b '' movie . The acting wa so laughable that not even the memory of Combs ' past campy triumph were enough to save it . Considering the script I have to imagine that there wa not enough money in the budget for thing like continuity and original idea . I am thoroughly upset that I paid Blockbuster price for this trash . The fact that it wa made for television wa something that would have helped me avoid this atrocity and frankly something that movie this poor should be required to warn you of . Avoid this movie no matter what .

I saw this film purely based on the fact that it wa on the DPP Video Nasty list , and while I 'm glad I saw it because it 's now 'another Video Nasty down ' - on it own merit , Andy Milligan 's film really is n't worth bothering with . There are , of course , far worse film on the infamous list ; but that doe n't make the pain of viewing this one any easier . The film wa obviously shot on an extremely low budget , and that ha translated into the script ; a Blood Rites work on an idea often seen in horror cinema , and doe n't do anything new with it . Basically , the plot centre on three couple who find themselves at a house awaiting the result of a will . It 's not long before they start getting picked off ... blah blah blah . For most of the film , nothing happens ; and then when we finally get down to the scene that justify the movie being banned , they 're so amateurish and silly that they 're impossible to take seriously on any level . It 's a very good thing that this movie doe n't have a very long running time a otherwise it could have been used a a particularly nasty method of torture . It all boil down to a fittingly tedious ending , which also succeeds in being a non-event of epic proportion . Apparently , this movie is still banned here in the UK ; but somehow I doubt it 's because of it shock value . Basically , Blood Rites is n't worth seeing and I personally can see no reason to recommend it . Unless , of course , you 've made it your business to see everything on the Video Nasty list ...

15 Park Avenue , well the name mystifies initially being an address from New York and film being set in Kolkata . However a the story unfolds , one realize the thin line that director try to walk between Relationships , Social Cause and of course the world of Schizophrenia . I would say Aparna Sen is one director who ha so much more to say and ha so le time at disposal . Well no doubt she ha managed to make a good movie . In a way she make u realize that probably each one of u is looking for our own '15 Park Avenue ' . Its an unending search within each of one of u ... The powerhouse performance from Shabana Azmi is a treat to watch . Her screen presence brings whole lot of life into the scene . Indeed it wa surprising to see her in such a powerful act after long because I expected it to be all the way Konkona Sen 's terrain . Shabana make you feel skin deep of an elder sister who is running the whole show for a rather unfortunate family and during this time she almost forgets to live her own life . She burden all her ambition and desire with ailing 18 year younger sister ( who is more like a daughter to her ) and an aging mother played by veteran Waheeda Rehman . As for the leading actress from Guide ( that 's how I can recall her instantly ) there is hardly anything to say except few line and tear drop here and there . Ever dependable Rahul Bose play another pivotal role in the film , he show the emotion of a middle age man with repent on his face to near perfection . This man really amazes me with the variety of work he ha done . From a musician in Jhankar Beats to a liberal Muslim in Mr. & Mrs. Iyer and so many others . He is one versatile I really wish if he had some more shot in the first part of the movie a well . The cameo in the movie is by Shefali Shah ( remember Satya and Monsoon Wedding ) . She look really beautiful and depicts the role of a mother of 2 kid with real ease . She give you a glimpse of today 's Indian woman who is modern in approach but still conventional when it come to her husband 's prior relationship . The focus of camera ha been Meethi , portrayed by Konkona . She and her schizophrenic world constitute the nucleus of 15 Park Avenue . She ha really worked hard for the character but there are time when she is not able to relate with the audience . The fateful accident of her life try to rope in sympathy and it ha been only partially successful . The movie try to address quite a few thing in one go starting from the unique world of a disabled person to the unequal status of a female even in today 's modern India and also the twisted relationship in a tattered family . And I believe Aparna ha succeeded to certain extent . The helplessness of Meethi while she work a a journalist in a rural eastern state really give u all a naked picture of the country we are so proud of . Well after I finished 15 Park Avenue , there wa a sense of unquenched thirst within me . I wanted more out of this movie to drench me emotionally . It ha been a commendable effort on the part of director except few hiccup . Must watch for all those who like to see a different cinema , something with a strong purpose .

I wa Stan in the movie `` Dreams Come True '' . Stan wa the friend that worked at the factory with the main character and ended getting his arm smashed in the machinery and got carried out screaming ( where wa the ambulance ? ) The acting in this movie wa for the most part pretty poor with mostly local actor from the Fox Valley , Wisconsin . I saw the movie on the big screen . It played 2 night in 3 theater and wa something special to see yourself on the big screen . I may be bias , but overall , I enjoyed it . Also the soundtrack wa the band Spooner , who later became Garbage . My brother , Steve Charlton wa also in the movie . He played Swenson the man who come to the door on crutch to talk with the police .

The movie start good , it ha a thing going for it . About 1/3 into the movie thing go downhill . Carrey start obsessing about the number 23 because he see it everywhere . So what ? Thats no reason to go nut and start writing stuff all over your body and on wall . The acting by whoever is playing his son is bad . From the get-go , a soon a he hears of his father obsession , he jump on the bandwagon and is hysterical about it . Totally unbelievable . I hope I never see this kid in another movie again . Its a waste of time watching this movie . Grab another . Boring piece of ... well . The number is killing him ? Give me a break . I wo n't spoil the ending for you , but let 's just say it is equally disappointing . 3 / 10 .

Lion King 1 1/2 is a very fun and addictive sequel . Do n't expect the production value of a theatrical release , but do expect the highest quality of direct to video release . It is set up a Timon & Pumba begin watching the original Lion King in a darkened theater and abruptly switch track and begin narrating their own story . This is done with frequent comedic interruption . For example , during one particular tense moment a home shopping commercial pop on and a chagrined Pumba realizes he ha sat on the remote . These little moment pepper the movie , and whether you find them entertaining or not will greatly depend on your sense of humor . If you are particularly bothered by movie that deliberately remind the viewer is watching a movie , than this may not be your cup of tea . Animation is the best they 've invested in the Disney DTV line , and is integrated almost seamlessly with the original material . The newer , independent material us a lot of the artistic style of the original . The voice talent are all well performed , though I could n't help thinking of Marge Simpson every time I heard Julie Kavner . Many of the joke in the movie will be well recognized by viewer a recycled over the generation , but are presented more with the familiarity of comfortable quirk of old friend than annoyingly repetitive . The music ha made me realize how much I enjoyed and miss a good musical integrated with a Disney feature . The toe-tapping opening feature of 'Dig A Tunnel ' is well choreographed and hilarious . Timon and Pumba 's take on the Lion King 's opening sequence and their introduction to paradise are also amusing . The only problem wa the reprise of the 'Dig A Tunnel ' at the end of the movie , switching it lyric and tune from defeatist to uplifting . Story line is pretty well done , and the integration of new plot element is done almost perfectly , though the final bit during the hyena chased stretched the storyline credibility a little . The new story doe n't seem to handle saccharine or emotionally charged moment to well , and doe better when it is resorting to full comedy . Overall , worth purchasing . If you like all the bonus feature that come with a typical 2-disc set , then go for it . For the penny pincher who still is willing to invest on a good flick , wait until it drop four or more dollar and go rent it right away . Damion Crowley .

When this wa released , I thought this wa one of the most profane film ever made . However , thanks to Martin Scorcese and a few other filmmaker like him , there have been mainline film worse , language-wise , than this .... but this is a pretty brutal assault on one 's ear . Hey , I can take a lot of it , but this got ridiculous . In the first six minute alone , I heard a half-dozen usage 's of the Lord 's name in vain plus an untold number of f-words . I wonder how many people walked out of the theater watching this in 1990 ? I could n't have been the only one . Not surprisingly , some of the feature actor included Jennifer Jason-Leigh , Burt Young , Jerry Orbach and Rikki Lake . Since this film , Stephen Lang seems to have improved his image , at least playing the Godly `` Stonewall '' Jackson in `` Gods and Generals . '' Lang 's role here is just the opposite : perhaps the worst trashy person in the film and a character who fall in love with a transvestite by the end of the film . Depressing , gloomy , semi-pornographic , repulsive : these are just a few of the adjective people used - even some Liberal critic - in describing this story , which is painted even worse in the novel . Of course , some of the better-known critic , all extreme Libs , praised the movie . However , they were the only one . Most critic were disgusted , a well almost all of the paying public . It 's unbelievable that anyone could praise filth and garbage like this . Trust me on this : there are no good , likable character in this entire movie . This is a mean , sick film : one of the worst of the `` modern era . '' That is , unless you enjoy seeing child abuse , drug abuse , teen prostitute , on and on - two straight hour of nothing but atrocity and just plain evil people . No thanks .

I 'd give this film a 1/10 . This film is devoid of common cinematic substance and concentrate way too much upon the current `` skin trend '' in Bollywood movie . I 'd definitely not recommend teenager to watch this movie . What really make me feel dejected is how could such an impressive banner like Yash Chopra Films ever succumb to such an awful production ? They have perhaps forgotten to keep in view that there is a larger audience than `` adult '' audience too , which when exposed to these sort of gross movie , may wreck their growing mind set and succumb to thing devoid of sense and recognition . On the whole , film must not only be entertaining , but also must comprise of some sense a well . Certainly , this film is an immense disappointment to Yash Chopra fan , especially me myself . I am really disappointed over the plot , acting and everything else . Why ca n't people put in some substance that can be cherished after confronted with in the film , at least for once throughout the film ? The point is clear . I 'd like to put my opinion in short : `` Horrible - Disappointment - Lot of Adult Material - Lack of sensible `` substance '' - Lack of normal psyche - Worthless - Could grab a Cornetto or a Temptations chocolate instead ''

I wa so surprised when I saw this film so much underrated ... I understand why some of you dislike this movie . Its pace is slow , a characteristic of Japanese film . Nevertheless , if you are absorbed in the film like me , you will find this not a problem at all . I must say this is the best comedy I have ever seen . `` Shall We Dansu ? '' is often considered a masterpiece of Japanese comedy . It is very different from Hollywood one , e.g . Austin Powers or Scary Movies , in which a gag is guaranteed in every couple of minute . Rather , it is light-hearted , a movie that make you feel good . I love the movie because it make me feel `` real '' . The plot is straightforward yet pleasing . I wa so delighted seeing that Sugiyama ( the main role ) ha found the meaning of life in dancing . Before I watched the film I wa slightly depressed due to heavy schoolwork . I felt lost . However , this film made me think of the bright side of life . I believed I wa in the same boat of Sugiyama ; if he could find himself in his hobby , why could n't I ? It reminded me of `` exploring my own future '' and discovering the happiness in my daily life . It is important to note that the actor are not professional dancer . While some of you may find the dancing scene not a perfect a you expect , I kinda like it a it make me feel that the character are really `` alive '' , learning to dance a the film go on . Over all , this film is encouraging and heart-warming . As a comedy , it doe it job perfectly . It definitely deserves 10 star . And yes Aoki is funny : -D

I wa greatly disappointed by the quality of this documentary . The content is poorly produced , very poor quality video and , especially awful audio . There 's extremely little about how Bruce Haack produced his music and virtually no example of direct connection to later and contemporary electronic music . The interview of people who knew Bruce Haack are ad-hoc mostly inarticulate mumbo-jumbo . Too much yak and not enough Haack . Although I have a serious personal interest in electronic music and have a higher than average attention span , even for slow and/or difficult subject matter , I fell asleep while watching this documentary and had to review it to see the part I slept through . If you watch this , make sure that you are set up , before viewing , like Alex in A Clockwork Orange . Bruce Haack deserves much better than this . Shame on the producer and director .

I 've tried to reconcile why so many bad review of this film , while the vast majority of review are given a rating of between 7 and 10 . The reason may be this film is kind of hard to describe in a positive review , although a few have done that quite nicely already . This film is confusing , depressing , and doe n't have a happy ending . I still gave Pola X a rating of 10 , because it is basically for me literature and art combined on film . That is really my favorite kind of filmmaking . I 've only seen two of Carax 's film : this one and Mauvis Sang . As with this film , I 'm being somewhat pretentious when I call this one of Carax 's best films- but I am . Carax ha a minimalist style . If that type of film doe not appeal to you and is boring , then it would be best not to watch this . But Pola X wa le minimalist than Mauvis Sang , so it had quite a lot of intensity for a thriller- at least for my taste . I found it quite interesting and absorbing . The two lead role did an excellent job acting . ( I mean the lead and the young woman he thought wa his half sister . ) Catherine D. is always great , but her role wa not very large or significant in the story . But everyone did a fine job . I thought the cult stuff wa great . It may have not been very believable , but that is due to it being rather abstract . There is a lot going on between the line in this film . This is a very Freudian psycho-thriller .

WARNING : SPOILER , SPOILER , SPOILER ! ! ! ! This is written for filmgoers who may have walked away from `` Mood for Love '' perplexed and confused about path the main character choose in life . From reading other comment and review it seems that many viewer and critic missed some very important detail which may have prevented them from enjoying this delightful tease of a movie . We are so use to seeing blatant SEX in narration that we forget that there wa a time when filmakers would suggest the `` dirty deed '' by simply showing the slack-mouthed couple ride off in a sleigh or haywagon only to return into the next scene with a bulging gut or a fat toddler stuck to the hip ... '' Meet your child '' . The director chose the same nostalgic approach in telling the story of Mr Chow and Mrs Chan . Last warning ... SPOILER SPOILER SPOILER Mr Chow fool Mrs Chan into showing her real emotion when they rehearse his departure forever . Next scene : Mrs Chan lean her head on Mr Chow in the taxi and say `` I do not want to go home tonight '' . Translation : `` Let 's Do It '' Why then did the couple just not do the modern thing of dumping their cheating spouse , get a divorce , raise their love child and live happily ever after ? The answer is that this whole story take place in Hong Kong during the Sixties . A bastard would live in a bleak life of shame if he were the child of an adulteress ; whereas , a `` legitimate '' child could live a tragic but noble/honest life if his mother chose to raise him away from his cheating `` father '' -the invisible Mr Chan . In short , Mr Chow and Mrs Chan sacrifice their relationship for the future of their child . That is why Mr Chow , upon learning that Mrs Chan life alone with a little boy give a knowing smile and end his dream of making Mrs Chan his Mrs Chow . He then , also realizes why Mrs Chan went to all the way to Singapore to be with him , only to reconsiders at the last momment and leave .. , choosing to never see him again . ( But not before taking some unnamed keepsake ) Mr Chow life with this wonderful secret with no one to tell . No one , except for a crumbling temple wall and of course we the viewer , ... but only if we listen carefuly .

This is a great film with an amazing cast . Crispen Glover is at his freakiest . His guitar solo is amazing . Also watch out for a cameo by William Burroughs . Truly a cult classic . This is on my top ten list . Do n't miss this twisted film .

My recommendation : Do n't watch it .

You are not missing anything and will only waste two hour of your life watching this drivel .I have seen bad movie before and even enjoyed them due to their fault . This one is just a waste of time .

putting aside the `` i 'm so sure '' s and `` totally gnarly '' s this is one of the sweetest and lifelike romance portrayed on film . deborah foreman ( where is she now ? ) a julie and nicolas cage a randy are a classic a romeo and juliet , tony and maria , jake and samantha ... you ca n't help but fall in love with them . plus the soundtrack - the plimsouls , spark , the fur , the flirt , and of course , modern english - is also outstanding . for fan of film about young love , i 'd equally recommend the recent film all the real girl by david gordon green .

It started out with an interesting premise . I always like Civil War stuff and ancient secret society . The more the film progressed , the more I realized that this wa a B movie at best . In the latter half , it quickly became a C movie , then D , then F , then `` I wish that this wa n't a rental so that I could put it in the microwave ! '' I ca n't say that the acting in all case wa awful , just most . The writing , however ... I never read the book . Maybe the book is well written . The screenplay wa written by a 10 year old . It wa ridiculously shallow , the dialog drab and uninteresting , the character about a interesting a a 5 pound bag of fertilizer . I really hated this movie , a did my wife . I am a Christian and I have no problem with movie that promote or support Christianity . This movie did a great disservice to the cause . Awful , terrible , worthless . If you liked it , I strongly recommend Superman 4 .

A film that is so much a 30 's Warners film in an era when each studio had a particular look and style to their output , unlike today where simply getting audience is the object . Curitz wa one of the quintessential Warners house director working with tight economy and great efficiency whilst creating quality , working method that were very much the requirement of a director at Warners , a studio that wa one of the `` big five '' major in this era producing quality film for their large chain of theatre . Even though we have a setting of the upper class on Long Island there is the generic Warners style embedded here with a narrative that could have been `` torn from the headline '' . Another example is the when the photographer comment on the girl leg early in the film and she comment that `` They 're not the trophy '' give the film a more working man , down to earth feel , for these were the audience that Warners were targeting in the great depression . ( ironically Columbia and Universal were the two minor under these five major until the 50 's when their involvement in television changed their fortune - they would have made something like this very cheaply and without the polish and great talent ) Curtiz ha created from an excellent script a film that move along at a rapid pace whilst keeping the viewer with great camera angle and swift editing . Thank heaven there is no soppy love interest sub-plot so the fun can just keep rolling along .

I got this DVD well over 2 year ago and only decided to watch it yesterday . I do n't know why it took me so long a I do like the Inspector Gadget show and even the new Gadget and the Gadgetinis . While it may have a bright color pallet and all the technical sophistication of a modern animated movie , there are some old thing missing that bog this Gadget right down the toilet . First of all the classic Inspector Gadget theme song and music is completely absent . The composer try to compromise by doing a score that sound similar but it 's still just no good enough . The Gadget-mobile is now a talking car , not a car that can turn into a van . Plus it look a lot cuter and rounder instead of being plain cool . Penny no longer ha her computer book and she and Brain hardly make an appearance at all . The plot is non-existent . There 's something about a transformation formula and Doctor Claw using for some never revealed evil but that 's all I got . What the deal wa with the short/giant Italian guy I will never know . It had nothing to do with anything . And if the title is anything to go by , his last case is wrapped up in no way whatsoever . And he stay on the force so why it 's called 'last case ' is a mystery also . I wa n't impressed at all . This is an affront to a great animated show that is strangely absent on DVD , but do n't let that prompt you into buying whatever Inspector Gadget DVDs you can . I sold this mere second after finally watching it . No kid will like or appreciate this and no fan of the old show with tolerate it .

This episode of Buffy wa one of my personal favorite . Also number three of Joss ' personal favorite a well . The episode featured very little dialogue and despite that the good folk at the Emmy 's decided it merited a nomination . Unfortunately it did n't win . When Hush first premiered it received about 6 million viewer , which wa the highest rated episode of season four . That should tell you something . Even though there wa very little talking it managed to intrigue people enough to tune in . Those gentleman character ( who were played my mime ) were some of the scariest creature the show ha produced ( or any network TV show I 've seen ) . Nothing is creepier then a bunch of silver teethed men coming at you with a scalpel while smiling away . I think that despite the lack of dialogue the actor did a fantastic job on the episode .

Bulletproof is quite clearly a disposable film . The kind where bullet riddled good guy and bad guy are splatted everywhere , so much so that you really are n't supposed to see them a human . The yawn between the line from Wayans and Sandler are extensive indeed . They try hard but , ala and alack , persona itself doe not a good film make . Jimmy Caan play a nifty villain but he 's always had that redneck edge at the ready . My favorite 's scene is the repeated clip of a TV ad in which Caan reveals the virtue of America can be shown to the world by having 2 car in every garage . Aside from that it 's a buddy movie with gun for brain . Pass on this one .

I think this movie wa made a good a it could have been . With only 4 month and a 52000 $ budget - I 'm surprised this wa n't worse . If you are not to care about the CG or special effect , this movie is great . Okay , the movie is not that well made ( I 'm sure it could have been but , you try to do better in only 4 month ) but the story is good and the movie is rather exciting . DO n't trust me when I say that this movie is good , cause I also find the 1933 King Kong to be good . I must confess that I did n't watch the complete movie either ... I might have fast forwarded some minute here and there ...

I gave this 4 star because it ha a lot of interesting theme many here have already mentioned . From the domestic violence , to sexuality and many of the taboo therein . Outside of the gore I really would not call this horror so much a I would science fiction . It 's bleak , depressing and hopeless . While I do n't mind a le than cheery ending , I 'm really very tired of the `` human suck '' cliché that 's central to every movie . I know you ca n't get a liberal art degree today without bowing to the alter of self-hatred a a member of the human race , but how 's 'bout a a writer/director we pretend we are different than everyone else in the pack and notice that the ALIENS KILLING THE HUMAN RACE are evil ! Right now , if you are reading this and believe that humanity deserves to die , just go out , find a lake and swim 'til your arm are tired . This way you wo n't be around to direct the next film or write the next book telling me I deserve to die for being alive . It 's silly , not thoughtful , and boring .

One of my all time favourite film , ever . Just beautiful , full of human emotion , wit , humour , intelligence . The story grows , a doe the lesson of life , just a wonderful film in so many way . The cast are also fantasic ..... a great selection of the finest British talent around . I loved them all for every diverse element brought into the film . Italy ha to be one of the most romantic place to form a story such a this , - everything about this film work . I love it : )

This is a really mediocre film in the vein of `` Buckaroo Banzai . '' The cast run around like `` Mad Max '' wannabe , and they seem to be sharing a joke that they do not want to share with the audience . Wheeler-Nicholson is one of the those guilty pleasure actress you are delighted to stumble across in film , but she is n't worth the price of rental . Space Maggot start an electrical fire , and burn a vote of 4 .

being a high school student , i have to take a health class . this year , the topic is drug . we learn about the harm they can cause a person . from what we talk about , i still believe and know that drug can really mess a person up . anyway , my teacher wanted u to watch this . naturally , we groan and start to sleep , but like the rest of my class , i actually did enjoy this movie . it wa totally real , and not sugar coated at all . the character were amazing and believable . even the plot wa outstandingly realistic and believable . what i liked about this movie mainly wa how it got the point of the effect 's drug can take on an abuser , and the consequence the person ha to deal with . everyone reassures themselves that nothing bad will happen to them . well let get serious . anything can happen in a small town , even to your best friend , like Sam and Chris . this movie show it . a person can really learn a lot from watching this . it wa pretty effective .

This movie is good for entertainment purpose , but it is not historically reliable . If you are looking for a movie and thinking to yourself ` Oh I want to learn more about Custer 's life and his last stand ' , do not rent ` They Died with Their Boots On ' . But , if you would like to watch a movie for the enjoyment of an older western film , with a little bit of romance and just for a good story , this is a fun movie to watch . The story start out with Custer 's ( Errol Flynn ) first day at West Point . Everyone love his charming personality which allows him to get away with most everything . The movie follows his career from West Point and his many battle , including his battle in the Civil War . The movie end with his last stand at Little Big Horn . In between the battle scene , he find love and marriage with Libby ( Olivia De Havilland ) . Errol Flynn portrays the arrogant , but suave George Armstrong Custer well . Olivia De Havilland play the cute , sweet Libby very well , especially in the flirting scene that Custer and Libby first meet . Their chemistry on screen made you believe in their romance . The acting in general wa impressive , especially the comedic role ( although stereotypical ) of Callie played by Hattie McDaniel . Her character will definitely make you laugh . The heroic war music brought out the excitement of the battle scene . The beautiful costume set the tone of the era . The script , at time , wa corny , although the movie wa still enjoyable to watch . The director 's portrayal of Custer wa a a hero and history show this is debatable . Some will watch this movie and see Custer a a hero . Others will watch this movie and learn hate him . I give it a thumb up for this 1942 western film .

Well , I though that this movie would be a lot like that ! But much to my suprise wa nothing like the book ! Insted it is more like young adult humor movie . I think in short this mean adult humor . I wish I could return this movie ! wal-mart said they would n't because the movie ha been opened . If you are thinking about buying this I suggest that maybe rent before you buy .

Mickey Rourke hunt Diane Lane in Elmore Leonard 's Killshot It is not like Mickey Rourke ever really disappeared . He ha had a steady string of appearance before he burst back on the scene . He wa memorable in : Domino , Sin City , Man on Fire , Once Upon a Time in Mexico , and Get Carter . But in his powerful dramatic performance in The Wrestler ( 2008 ) , we see a full blown presentation of the character only hinted at in Get Carter . Whenever we get to know him , Rourke remains a cool , but sleazy , muscle bound slim ball . This is an Elmore Leonard story , and production . Leonard wrote such notable movie a taunt western thriller 3:10 to Yuma , Be Cool , Jackie Brown , Get Shorty , 52 Pick-Up , and Joe Kidd . This mean that we get tough guy , some good , some not so good . It also mean we get tight , realistic plot with character doing what is best for them in each situation , weaving complication into violent conclusion . Killshot is no different . Tough , slim ball killer Rourke stalk unhappily married witness Lane . Think History of Violence meet No Country for Old Men . It is not a intense , bloody or gory a those two , but it is almost a good . If you like those two , including David Croneberg 's equally wonderful Eastern Promises , you will like Killshot also . Director John Madden ha not done a lot of movie . His last few were enjoyable , if not successful : Proof , Captain Corelli 's Mandolin and Shakespeare in Love . Diana Lane ha n't had a powerful movie role since she and Richard Gere gave incredible performance in Unfaithful . Lately she is charming and appealing in romantic story such a Nights in Rodanthe , Must Love Dogs , and Under the Tuscan Sun . Here she is right on mark , balancing her sexy appeal with reserved tension . This is a small part for Rosario Dawson . Yet Dawson doe a good job with it . You see a lot more of Lane , including an underwear scene to rival Sigourney Weaver in Aliens and Nicole Kidman in Eyes Wide Shut . While you are in the crime drama section , also pick up Kiss , Kiss , Bang , Bang , and Gone Baby Gone , and Before the Devil Knows Your Dead . The last ha wonderful performance by Phillip Seymour Hoffman , Ethan Hawke , Marisa Tomei and Albert Finney . Killshot flopped at the box office . More is our luck . It is certainly worth a 3-4 dollar rental , if you like this genre . 6/20/2009

`` Müllers Büro '' is a movie which many will watch and enjoy until the end , while others will stop watching it within five minute . It is a parody of detective movie with all the twist and turn ; the action take place only at night in the dark corner of a city which resembles Batman 's Gotham City ( look carefully at the street , building , the police car chasing the criminal , etc. ) . It is also a parody of musical with it really funny character such a Müller 's secretary and Vitasek 's ( the actor playing Müller 's assistant ) lover who do their best to sing , albeit not very successfully . The space occupied by the character have their own presence in the film such a the decadent Blue Box ( there is a real club with this name in Vienna ) where one can see a sailor hitting on a girl in the background , Müller 's apartment with the black paint smeared on the wall and the dirty kitchen , Müller 's bureau with the sweet picture of his assistant , etc . The humorous moment in the movie are many and include `` flat in the face '' type of humor such a Müller farting in his assistant 's face , the prostitute charging Müller extra for orgasm , the ridiculous outfit of the female thug of Montana , etc . A legendary film from the 80 's especially for those interested in Austrian or German-speaking cinema .

Peter Sollett ha created an endearing portrait about real people living in poverty in the Lower East Side of New York , or Loisaida , a it 's known by the local . Mr. Sollett 's heart is in the right place a he examines this dysfunctional family , that is typical of the different 'inner city ' of the country . Mr. Sollett accentuates the positive in the story he present . These are basically good kid , the child of parent that have left them and whose grandmother ha taken under her wing . Instead of presenting his character a loser , Mr. Sollett show a positive side they all have . These kid are not into drug , or are stealing because they are poor . Had this story been done by Hollywood we would have seen a parade of stereotype , instead of child that are struggling , but deep down inside , they are not defeated . Victor Rasuk , a Victor Vargas , wa a revelation . He is a natural . So is July Marte . Her character show u a no nonsense girl who will not be fooled or driven to do anything she doe n't want to do . Altagracia Guzman , a the grandmother is excellent . She conveys her frustration at not being able to steer her grandchild into the thing she belief in and that are so important to her . All in all , this wa an excellent picture thanks to Peter Sollett .

The long list of `` big '' name in this flick ( including the ubiquitous John Mills ) did n't bowl me over to the extent that I could n't judge the film on it actual merit . I can not say that this picture ha any of the ingredient which make a film great . I found it maudlin , mawkish and minor .

Wild Rebels is fun in a bad way , but also frustrating due to the actual good , or at least workable , element in the story . It deal with a race car driver ( Steve Alaimo ) who get mixed up in a group of bikers called Satan 's Angels , who hang around a lot until they decide to rob a bank . Meanwhile Alaimo also get recruited by the cop to report back to them what the Angels are up to and where they 'll rob next . It 's not even that the film is really too 'dated ' , though it doe of course carry the significantly crude and stupid music in the film ( from the band on stage in one scene , to Alaimo `` performing '' if you could call that drek that , to the regular generic score ) . It 's just that there 's not more care taken by the filmmaker into putting a little more logic , direction , and better actor for the part . As it is I did n't have a major disliking towards the film , a I did with the Hellcats , but it almost left me a little indifferent to it all , too . What could come through a being unpredictable only come through with stupid thing like the name of the Florida town ( 'Citrusville ' ho-ho ) . So it 's not completely un-worthy then of it Mystery Science Theater 3000 status a of late . The commentary is good on the movie , even if once or twice I almost wanted to hear what the character on screen were saying in case it might have some worth . Wild Rebels might be more of a good time if you 've got a six-pack and low expectation , but a it is I would n't watch it again .

If this is someone 's `` favorite '' movie , they need some serious help . There is nothing funny or clever about this crapfest . I have n't seen the original movie this is the remake of ( some 1950s film ) , but it simply ha to be better than this newer bastardization . A major get kicked out of the military for being a fringe element , and wind up teaching child at an ROTC school . Unfortunately , the major is Daman Wayans ... so the child are in for a world of annoying , humorless asininity . Can Wayans whip these loser into shape ? Can they get him to become a little more human ? The film bomb a most Wayans film do , with only a few sparkling moment . William Hickey get about one minute of screen time , fair too little . This charming old man ( known best to me a a `` Tales from the Crypt '' actor , known best to you a Uncle Louis from `` Christmas Vacation '' ) shine every moment he 's on screen , which is n't much here . Bam Bam Bigelow also make an appearance a a biker , which fit him perfectly . I would n't mind slightly more Bam Bam , but I think he carried the role of `` biker '' about a far a it could be carried for a military film . And then there 's the attractive teacher , who someone fall for Major Payne even though he treat the kid poorly , ha no social skill and is simply impossible to convert into someone you would want to spend time with . She must either be incredibly stupid or incredibly desperate . I 'm not sure which ( though it would seem `` stupid '' since the movie make it clear she get out of the house often enough ) . Wayans had one shining moment : a dance sequence where he performs a series of move ( including a very nice `` robot '' ) , and with the help of music from 2 Live Crew . This scene wa enjoyable but hardly made up for anything else that made this film dog spittle . Seriously , avoid this film . If you want to see a film a bout a loser who help loser kid become hero , rent or buy `` Ernest Goes to Camp '' . At least he 's a lovable loser , and actually funny . Maybe if Major Payne had fought a badger I 'd feel better , but he did n't . Forget Payne , forget Wayans ... you can do so much better .
