I have just recently purchased collection one of this awesome series and even after just watching three episode , I still am mesmerized by sleek styling of the animation and the slow , yet thoughtful action of the story-telling . I am still a fan ..... with some minor pain . Though this installment into the Gundam saga is very cool and ha what the previous series had-a stylish satiric way of telling about the wrong of war and not letting go of the need to have control or power over everything ( sound familiar ? ) , I have to say that this one get a bit too mellow-dramatic on continuing to explain the life of the main character and their incessant need to belly-ache about every thing that happens and what they need to do to stop the OZ group from succeeding in their plan ( especially the character called Wufei ... I mean he whine more than an American character on a soap opera . Get a counselor , will ya ? ) Besides for the over-exaggerated drama ( I think that mostly come from the dubbing of the English voice actor ) , this series is still very exciting and will still captivate me once again . I mean it can always be worse . It could be like the recent installment , SEED ...... eeeewwww , talk about mellow-dramatic .... I 'll chat about that one later .

I 've seen my share of Woody Allen 's movie , and while they 're not always great , you can usually be sure you 're going to be entertained . Probably the last really good one were Bullets Over Broadway ( '94 ) and Mighty Aphrodite ( '95 ) - since then the one I 've seen have been patchy but watchable . And so when I wa invited to see the new Woody Allen movie Melinda and Melinda , which I wa n't even aware had been released yet , I went along happily . I had n't really heard much about it so I hoped I would be pleasantly surprised . What I got wa definitely the worst Woody Allen movie I 've seen . The premise is over-explained , the cast is terrible , the script is slow and lifeless . Too many scene said nothing and yet were stretched out , I assume to fill out what would have otherwise become a 15 minute short film . I do n't mind the concept behind this film - two director discus how a simple situation could be interpreted a a comedy or a tragedy , and obviously the film proceeds to show u that , by playing out both scenario . The problem is neither of these 'two film ' are any good at all . The comedy is n't funny and the tragedy is n't very tragic . It seems like Allen came up with a good idea but then ran out of steam , or time , to actually complete the film . The general level of acting is notably bad also - Will Ferrell is the only one who brings anything to the table , and it 's basically a Woody Allen impression . Previously good actor like Chloe Sevigny just come off a annoying , and the worst of the bunch is Radha Mitchell a Melinda ( which is a shame , because her character is in nearly every scene ! ) . To be fair to the actor , the script they are working with is lacking if not non-existent . Definitely a long way from the Allen we know and love from classic like Manhattan or Annie Hall .

Although the premise of the movie involves a major `` coincidence , '' the actor all do a creditable job and look great bringing the story to life . I found myself rooting for the character played by Mary Tyler Moore and Christine Lahti , empathizing with both , and wanting them to reconcile . Sam Waterston and Ted Danson are fine in their role a well , doing a decent job with the stereotypical buddy relationship . While the story tends to leap through time , occasionally leaving the audience perhaps a little hungry for missing detail , it still flow and avoids any real confusion . This interesting storyline ha all the element for a good `` chick flick . ''

I saw this movie , and the play , and I have to add that this wa the most touching story that I had ever seen . Until I saw this movie I wa unaware of how awful life wa and probably still is for the South African child and adult that were and are living in that era . It brought tear to my eye and much sadness to my heart that any human being should have to struggle like that just to stay alive , And to bring the child right out of that area and teach them to act and preform and turn them loose to tell their own story is simply amazing . This simply surpass a five star , I rate it a ten . Thank You Mr. Mbongeni Ngema for such a astonishing story . Although it ha been 12 year since this story ha been told , it is still one that lay heavy in my heart.If there is a VHS , or DVD out there on the play , Please notify me ASAP.Thank You . PS There wa nothing wrong with the kid wanting to bring awareness of their problem and condition to the attention of other country in hope that some one would have a heart and offer assistance .

I 'm not sure this film could ever match the first one , even if it starred the original seven ( notwithstanding the fact that four were killed ) . It just doe n't have the spark and chemistry . All the actor seem tired and look a if they are just going through the motion to get their paycheck . It 's interesting how Yul Brynner is `` magnificent '' in the original film but stiff and unconvincing in this sequel . Yet when he star in Westworld and Futureworld in the 1970s his character ( in the same matching black pant , shirt and hat ) evokes the same mystery and presence of the 1960 film 's Chris Adams . There 's nothing in this 1966 flick to make it worth watching , even on cable .

Beautiful film , pure Cassavetes style . Gena Rowland give a stunning performance of a declining actress , dealing with success , aging , loneliness ... and alcoholism . She try to escape her own subconscious ghost , embodied by the death spectre of a young girl . Acceptance of oneself , of human condition , though it overall difficulty , is the real purpose of the film . The parallel between the theatrical sequence and the film itself are puzzling : it 's like if the stage became a way out for the Heroin . If all american movie could only be that top-quality , dealing with human relation on an adult level , not trying to infantilize and standardize feeling ... One of the best drama ever . 10/10 .

The 20th animated Disney classic is often criticized by many people a `` mediocre '' or poor in quality , but it is a great movie . Too bad that `` The Aristocats '' doe n't get the deserved credit . I personally see it a one of my favorite Disney classic . Despite being extremely underrated , it is one of the funniest Disney classic . It is full of hilarious ( some of them , hysterical ) moment . Edgar , the greedy butler , is the villain of the movie but he is a perfect comic relief . He 's one of my favorite Disney villain because he is so funny . Every scene with Edgar and the hound dog Napoleon and Lafayette chasing him are among the most hilarious you 'll ever see , especially the one when Edgar drive his motorcycle into the river and around the bridge , with the dog chasing him . That is hysterical ! But the classic humor doe n't just come from Edgar or the hound dog . Other character have their moment a well . About the quality subject , it is n't perfect , but remains on a high level . Even after Walt Disney 's death those artist knew how to keep faithful to Walt 's spirit and `` The Aristocats '' is one of those example . They do n't make them like this nowadays ! As usual , legendary Disney actor voice the character . In this case , we have Phil Harris , Sterling Holloway , Paul Winchell , Eva Gabor and Pat Buttram . The character are cool in general : Thomas O'Malley , Duchess and her 3 kitten , the mouse Roquefort , the alley cat , the English goose , the hound dog and the horse . The human character are included a well : the eccentric and kind retired Opera singer Madame Adelaide Bonfamille , the comic Madame 's old lawyer Georges Hautecourt and Edgar himself ! About the soundtrack , it ha some nice and catchy song such a Thomas O'Malley 's theme ( but I ca n't remember it name ) , `` Everybody Wants to be a Cat '' and `` The Aristocats '' ( sung by Maurice Chevalier ) , for example . This movie take place in Paris ( France ) , in the year of 1910 . Above all , this is a joyful , nice and very pleasant movie . A timeless classic which is often underestimated and forgotten , but very worthy . This should definitely be on Top 250 .

I 'm not going to say that this movie is horrible , because I have seen worse , but it 's not even halfway decent . The plot is very confusing . I could n't really figure out what wa happening and where thing were going . When the movie wa over , I wa left scratching my head . I watched through to the end of the credit to see if they had something after them that may clear thing up , but once the credit were over , that wa it . I felt like I wa jarred from one weak plot point to another throughout the whole movie , with little or no transition between the two . Character development is very shallow . I could n't figure out when somebody wa angry or had a grudge against someone . I could n't tell if half of the character were just supposed to be drunk , stoned , mentally challenged or they just had a bad actor to portray them . This film seems to be based around stereotype ( to it 's credit , they are hard to avoid using when you are making a film about a singer in a rock band ) , which SHOULD make character development easier , since so many other film have already illustrated the suffering of an abused child , or the trial of a heroin addict trying to come clean . Stereotypes are easy to depict , which would explain why so many bad film tend to overuse stereotypical character . This film , on the other hand , us stereotypical character left and right , but then try to keep them a incomprehensible a possible . Another problem with the character is that they seemed to be dismissed with no explanation . I guess that 's OK because so little time wa spent developing the character that I really did n't get a chance to know any of them , so I never really missed any of them . And last but not least wa Sadie 's singing . It 's awful . The music backing her up is not prize winner , but it is usually drowned out by the screech that are released from Sadie 's vocal cord . I swear that there 's one point in the movie where she sings a song for at least 10 minute . I seriously thought I wa going to have to turn it off during this howl-a-thon . As a whole , this movie is confusing . Characters are ill-developed , Georgia 's acting is wooden and stiff , Sadie 's character is yanked from one bad situation to another , with no back story or explanation . The music wa unbearable , and I can think of no good reason to see this film unless you have a thirst for cinematic pain .

Appalling , shallow , materialistic nonsense . How woman ( and gay men ? ) can enjoy this rubbish is beyond me . No self-respecting man would ever want to be with one of these neurotic gold digger . What is even more concerning is that so many reviewer say they relate to the woman on the show . If that is the future of woman , Lord help u all . Showing your independence and being respected a equal with men should not be about spreading your leg every three second with a different man . I think this demeans woman and doe not do them justice . But this review is no rant against woman . Fans of this show say it is `` hilarious '' and `` rivoting '' but every time I have watched this show I have just struggled to stay awake . Despite the narrative of the reporter woman , at no point in this show is there even anything close to something that could be considered a rational thought . So , it 's not entertaining , and it 's not informative , so why would you bother watching it ? One out of ten star .

A throwback to the `` old fashioned '' Westerns of the 30 and 40 ( such a DODGE CITY ) , DALLAS ha a number of thing going for it : Gary Cooper at his coolest , blazing Technicolor photography by Ernest Haller ( GONE WITH THE WIND ) and a pulse-pounding Max Steiner ( KING KONG , GWTW , DODGE CITY et al . ) score . In addition , there is a masquerade , mistaken identity , a faked death and more hair-breath escape than a Republic serial . As always , Cooper defines what it is to be a man under pressure . Forget the 50 angst Western ... this is pure entertainment !

We sat through this movie thinking why is this or that scene in the movie , what doe this have to do with the plot ? We hoped that by the end everything would be slightly more clear . It wa not to be . I think the director in a fit of pique threw the script up in the air and then some minor ( and vengeful ) underling reassembled it randomly with no regard to the scene being filmed ( possibly with scissors and glue-stick ) . The film 's motif include : Communism bad ? Nihilism bad ? Poor parenting bad ? Threesomes bad ? TV bad ? Coherent scripting bad ? Deconstructionism good ? It 's really not clear . Finally , no German water taxi would EVER have an unchained staircase that would let passenger fall in to the water . The abundant quantity of `` achtung '' sign everywhere is testament to this fact .

On the back burner for year ( so it wa reported ) this television reunion of two of the most beloved character in sitcom history started off badly - and went straight downhill from there . Mary Richards ( Mary Tyler Moore ) and her best friend Rhoda Morgenstern ( Valerie Harper ) meet in New York after a long estrangement and catch up on each other 's life . What a novel concept ! But , sad to relate , nothing worth talking about ( let alone making a movie about ) ha happened to either of them in the intervening year . So , instead , the script content itself with throwing out one hoary old plot device after another ( most having to do with older woman in the workplace ) , while completely missing the quirky charm and sophistication that made the original show a winner . The supporting cast is instantly forgettable , the humor is nonexistent , and the chemistry which Moore and Harper once had together is gone . Moore allegedly stalled this project for year , waiting for `` just the right script '' before committing herself . If this wa the one she considered `` right '' , what on earth were the one she turned down like ? It 's not the age of the character that doe this in ( for time inevitably march on ) , but the almost complete lack of imagination coupled with a blatant disregard for the element that made the series work . At one time this wa intended a a pilot but , all to obviously , it failed to generate any interest among potential sponsor . Or for that matter , among potential audience . Quickly and mercifully forgotten , the film is a travesty and an insult to a classic .

* * Could be considered some mild spoiler , but no more than in anyone else 's review of this film . * * I knew that nothing could conceivably live up to the absolute brilliance of the original `` Carrie , '' which wa more of a film about social criticism than it wa about setting the gym on fire . Carrie White wa `` victim '' epitomized , and her story conveyed the helplessness that the truly exploited must feel . Whoever conceived the `` Rachel '' character for `` The Rage '' must have completely missed the subtlety of `` Carrie . '' For the audience to genuinely share the victim 's rage , s/he must be a sympathetic character -- a true outcast who is more a victim of circumstance than of his/her own vice . Rachel is entirely too unpleasant to convey any sort of the emotional depth and connection of Sissy Spacek 's `` Carrie . '' And she look and act like she should be right along-side the 'attractive and popular brigade ' that she end up torching . She , like the rest of them , ha a soul that is every bit a corrupt , whereas Carrie wa a complete innocent . It just doe n't work . There 's no satisfaction in seeing the pretty child -- not even the `` Home Improvement '' boy -- getting offed in this movie 's climactic scene . And it 's so unnecessarily gory ! There wa no actual bloodshed seen in the burning gym ! And there is one person in particular that this movie should NOT have had the audacity to kill off ... but I wo n't say who it is . If you 've seen the original `` Carrie , '' it 's the sort of character who dy unjustly . At least they DID create the connection to Carrie appropriately ; it 's explained a it should have been . But that , and the arm tattoo , which wa done rather nicely , is just about the only thing this movie ha going for it . Yet another hideous `` Scream '' knock-off , and it taint the reputation of one of the most compelling film ever made . Rating : 1 out of 10 . I wa n't expecting much , but I wa still horribly disappointed . An unsympathetic character , a series of irritating pop-culture reference thrown in for no good reason , and an ending scene that pale in comparison to `` Carrie '' 's gravestone shocker .

Better than average World War II-era `` who-dun-it '' featuring Warner Baxter a a former gangster who suffered amnesia and ha been reborn a a psychiatrist now known a Robert Ordway who help both the police and criminal who want to go straight . Crime Doctor 's Courage is the fourth in the series of ten and also involves a victim who might have some mental problem . The link to `` courage '' is not particularly clear . This entry revolves around the death of fortune hunter Gordon Carson whose two previous wife have under mysterious circumstance and who in turn dy in a locked room under condition that resemble suicide but Dr. Ordway label murder . Hillary Brooke play the part of widow Kathleen Carson who is involved with Anthony Caruso - a mysterious Spanish dancer whose act includes his sister that disappears on stage . As a mystery novelist , Jerome Cowan is a good supporting actor a is Lloyd Corrigan a an aficionado in crime . Spooky house with creaking door , casket in the cellar , and suspect that are never seen in daylight add to the air of suspense . The set for the dance sequence is quite elaborate and the ballet music very good . Direction , production design , and photography stand out . The exterior shot and costume suggest more affluence rather than normally found in the average `` B '' detective thriller . Strongly recommended .

I had high hope for this movie . The theater monologue is great and Nic Balthazar is a very interesting man , with a lot of experience and knowledge when it come to movie . I am a fan of a lot of Belgian movie , but this movie is bad . It 's completely unbelievable that actor who are 34 are suddenly playing the role of teenager . The `` linguistic game '' were hideous and over the top . Nothing about the film seemed real to me . The ending wa way too deus ex machina for me . I am very disappointed and think I wasted an hour and a half of my life .

I am not a big fan of Rajnikant in the first place , but Baba wa a huge disappointment . In between an awful storyline , the action and song were only mediocre . The storyline becomes very preachy . Instead of running for office like NTR or MGR , Rajni almost appeared to be running a Tamil Nadu 's next big guru . My wife tell me that since this film came out , Rajni swore off doing any more movie ! We were lucky initially to have bought Babu ( an oldie by Sivajiganeshan ) online by accident when trying to buy this one .... that wa a great film , which made up for having bought this dud ... except it make Baba look even worse by comparison ! Bryan

Truly a disgusting , vile film , with only a small amount of real humour . The character of the father in particular is vulgar in the extreme ( intentionally so , obviously ) , and portrayed in the most pathetic , seedy manner . My wife and I found this film horribly upsetting , with absolutely no redeeming feature at all . Frankly , I wish I had never seen it . I consider this British effort to be a sick and gross embarrassment . Those who enjoyed this film have an ability I totally lack : that of rejoicing in a display of deep depravity and squalor . The producer should be ashamed of themselves .

Obabakoak is a bunch of short story with an only common point : the little Vasque town of Obaba . In this film , the director try to explain some of these story by using a young reporter a a continuum . The result is a strange film , a it ha any main character ( the movie spends about 20 min . to each tale ) other than the town of Obaba . Any story is really well explained and the fact is that they result very boring . It wa by far the best film of the year in Spain , but , well , that 's not saying too much . The only good thing of the film is the precious scenario . It is filmed in a very precious valley and it is more enjoyable to spend the time watching the scenario rather than being aware of the story .

The entire civilized world by now know that this is where Emil Sitka say his immortal `` Hold hand , you lovebird . '' But Shemp Howard , Professor of Music , steal the show . Watch him tutoring Dee Green a she fracture the `` Voices of Spring . '' Watch Shemp a he shave by a mirror suspended from the ceiling by a string . Watch him a he get walloped by Christine McIntyre . Watch him , and you will laugh and learn . Moe is no slouch either . Watch him a he attempt to induce a woman to sit on a bear trap . Larry , a usual , is the Zen master of reaction . All in all , one of the very best Stooge short . You wo n't find one weak moment .

I 'm a huge fan of war movie , and , a a Vietnam combat vet , have some experience with the technical detail . I worked with the bomb guy more than once and have nothing but respect for them . Other vet , and Iraq vet in particular , have summarized the inaccuracy in this movie very well . Poetic license is one thing , but this movie is a complete fantasy , and fails badly because of it . No bomb disposal unit , or any unit , would ever have tolerated this rogue operator for more than 5 minute . Military unit prize conformity and discipline for a reason ; it save life . The opening scene particularly annoyed me . The guy with the cell phone would have been shot immediately . Yelling , `` Stop dialing '' is not an effective deterrent . It got worse from there . The scene with the sniper were particularly egregious . As others have noted , your average EOD guy doe n't know jack about being a sniper , and to think any Arab sniper is that good really stretch the imagination . Kidnapping an Arab businessman for some form of personal revenge just would n't happen . Somebody might shoot him , but this kind of risk-taking is limited to the movie . I could go on , but , a I said , others have pointed these thing out in detail . This is not a good movie , and if it win any award at all , it 's a further reflection of why `` La La land '' is so named .

All right , here 's the deal : if you 're easily offended then you might want to stay far , far away from this one . There are some painfully funny moment in the movie , but I probably blushed about a much a I laughed . Actually , I probably blushed MORE than I laughed . And if I wa n't literally blushing on the outside , then I wa blushing on the inside . If there is absolutely nothing in this movie that embarrasses you then you simply have no shame . Whether that 's a badge of honor or not is in the eye of the beholder I suppose . I will not deny that I laughed quite a bit , but this is a movie that I simply can not give a blanket recommendation due to it subject matter . If I were to say , `` This movie is hilarious , go check it out ! '' and some sweet , little old church-going lady head to the theater and ha a heart-attack during one of the graphically explicit sex situation , well , that 's just something I do n't need on my conscience . So how raunchy is it ? Hmm , try about 100 time worse than The Wedding Crashers . Honestly . My mom would 've walked out during the first scene . I feel it 's my duty to at least warn you of what to expect . There is some cleverly intelligent comedy here , but that 's what I come to expect from the man ( Judd Apatow ) who had a hand in both Freaks and Geeks and Undeclared . I 'm all for making fun of Michael McDonald ; the only man whose hair and beard are white enough to give Kenny Rogers a run for his money . Paul Rudd proclaiming , `` If I hear Ya Mo Be There one more time I 'll Ya Mo burn this place down , '' is hilarious , but it 's one of those thing that the majority of the audience wo n't appreciate . And when we see a quick 3-second flashback of Steve Carrell singing along to Cameo 's Word Up , I laughed for a good two minute after the joke wa over , whereas most everybody chuckled and then forgot about it . Strangely enough , despite the raunch , there 's an admirable moral to the story . The movie doe n't portray Carrell a some freaky loser just because he 's a virgin . He 's really portrayed a a likable , admirable character . Sure , he 's a little weird . After all , he ha a framed Asia poster , `` more videogames than an Asian kid , '' and a toy collection that feature the Million Dollar Man 's BOSS , but we 're never led to believe that there 's actually anything wrong with the fact that he 's a virgin . As odd a it may seem , there 's a bit of an `` it 's OK to wait '' message . But man , oh man , please be warned that this push it R rating about a far a it can go . That wa certainly Apatow 's intention . According to him , he just let some of the guy ( particularly Rogen and Malco ) improv and talk the way they normally talk , all in an effort to find lot of new way to be dirty . If you can handle that or talk that way yourself , then you 'll love the movie . I 'm not a big fan of excessive profanity and sex joke . I find that subtle , clever humor is much more entertaining than about 200 us of the f-word or fratboy sex discussion . But that 's me . Like I said , there are some absolutely hysterical moment here , but you have to ask yourself if they 're worth sitting through one of the most vulgar movie you 're likely to ever see at the theater . I just do n't know how interested most woman will be in what 's discussed by men while playing poker . Honestly lady , you might not want to know . If you 've ever been curious why some girl think guy are gross , well , this give you a good idea . There you go - my humble , honest take on what to expect . Be that your guide . It definitely should not be seen with your Sunday School class , mama , grandmama , any family member of the opposite sex , child of any age , or anybody who is easily offended by excessive profanity or explicit sex discussion . If you 'd see it with any of the above then you apparently do not have any concept of what it mean to be uncomfortable .

Saw this a couple time on the Sundance Channel several year ago and received a nice cinematic jolt to the system . A semi-surreal yet hard edged take on modern medium culture ( or the lack of it ) , focusing on some seriously wacked , way-beyond-the-Hollywood-fringe dweller . It had an amusing early performance from Mark Ruffalo , and some memorable cinematography from the DP who did the Polish Brothers movie . There wa a savage umcompromising humor and a weirdly original feel to it that definitely set it apart . This film had cult classic written all over it , and I 'm surprised it 's not yet out on DVD . Hopefully soon .

If you liked the first two film , then I 'm sorry to say you 're not going to like this one . This is the really rubbish and unnecessary straight to video , probably TV made sequel . The still idiotic but nice scientist Wayne Szalinski ( Rick Moranis ) is still living with his family and he ha his own company , Szalinski Inc . Unfortunately his wife want to get rid of a statue , Wayne is so stupid he shrink his statue and himself with his brother . Then he shrink his wife and sister-in-law too . Now the adult have to find a way to get the kid of the house to get them bigger . Pretty much a repeat of the other two with only one or two new thing , e.g . a toy car roller coaster , swimming in dip , etc . Pretty poor !

There wa nothing remotely funny about this movie . It make fun of various sport movie and clichés but nothing about it is remotely funny . Most of the movie they parody doe n't even fit in with the film and are really only their so they can be in it . Non The main actor wa well cast in it but that 's really the only good thing about this film . Also the various cameo in it were kind of cool to see but i have no idea why they would waste their time being in this piece of garbage . Thank goodness I only spent $ 4 on it a this is not something worth spending money on . ONly watch if you have absolutely nothing to do or just want to waste an hour and 30 minute .

Darling Lili is a mixture of Perfection and Magic ! The Stars ; Julie Andrews & Rock Hudson could not have done a better attempt if they tried . It 's full of all the magic that a young lady wish for and it make it seem a if it can all really happen to you . The brilliance of the Director ; Blake Edwards is shown to be at his best . He wa truly capturing the woman he loved on screen ! The blend of each song , went perfectly with the moment in the film . The Film opened with Julie Andrews singing Whistling Away In The Dark and closed with the same Song by Andrews . For A Film Of This Excellence To Have Been Such A Failure When It Was Released , Is A Total Shock ... As It Is : `` Inspirational ... Purely .... Inspirational ! '' ~One Of Andrews Most Memorable Lines In This Film !

Good grief ! While I still maintain that Manos : The Hands of Fate is the worst piece of mental torture available , Hobgoblins came awfully close . This ... this ... thing insult the audience at every opportunity . At least film like Space Mutiny and Future War can be enjoyed on mst3k , this one wa a struggle to get through . I wa literally writhing on the couch in anguish . This thing managed to embarrass me - alone ! Even if you are a die-hard MST3K fan and have made it your mission to see every single experiment , think twice about seeing this one . It 's that bad .

If you have n't figured out what is going to happen in this film in the first five minute then give it a couple more minute . Lilia is a widow . She ha been left on the shelf for too long and she want to burst out . She ha a teenage daughter which only highlight that she is not getting any younger . While checking up on her daughter she discovers a world she never dared ... the cabaret , where she can belly dance in skimpy sequined outfit while men throw money at her . The film is very misogamist . It 's portrayal of men is dismal . Which is rather odd a Lilia stoop to jiggle around for them , not for money , but just for the hell of it . When she succeeds in arousing them it make her feel like a woman again . She doe not wish to connect with them but she is addicted to the attention . The other dancer all are mostly aging woman who look like men in drag and realize their time in the spotlight is short-lived . Not short enough I say . She doe find romance , however brief , with you guessed it .... No surprise here we did n't see coming . Though the ending is good you realize that it could have ended no other way . Maybe this film just is n't targeting my demographic- 30 Male

First of all . I do not look down on Americans . I know lot of people that are intelligent people from the USA . But this Movie is so utterly bad , that i just had to comment on it . First of all ... Movies are mostly far from the truth . This movie is no exception . Lots of scene 's are so incredibly false . For example the departure of the 2 space ship . You see them drop off the full tank in space . Just a small distance from each other . Remember what caused the space shuttle to explode in the past ? Just a tinsy winsy part that came off . In here it is just common to drop fuel tank that are a big if not bigger then the whole ship . What idiot would let 2 spaceship lift up and do that at the same time ? ? ? Second of it is that the Russian station is a piece of ( s ) crap . I hate to bring this up to you , but astronaut nowadays go to Russia . Since their equipment is much more reliable then NASA 's . The Space Shuttle is retired . And NASA us it just to pay off the bill . And there is no better alternative for it . And the list of whopper go on and on . This is truly an insult to people that do take space travel serious . And i know half a much a these guy do . But the most annoying part ( read : the whole movie ) is the Propaganda and patriot crap that u get choked with . MY GOD ! ! ! ! I thought i wa looking at a CNN business commercial for like an hour . The actor solve their petty problem by shooting at each other , giving the middle finger to everyone they come face to face with , start up fight , ignore the police , etc , etc ... But when it come to their love for their country and sacrificing their life , suddenly everyone stand in line to commit suicide for it ( bomb detonator ) ? ? Maybe i lack the feeling of being a true `` Patriot '' , that can sing the national anthem backwards in Swahili . Whilst riding with George Bush behind the steering wheel of a golf cart , driving in circle until the battery is empty . But this movie wa too much for me too handle . And when i finally got hold and pulled the flag pole and fabric of the American flag out of my hiney . I realised that i wa glad this movie wa finally done . I do not know why so much good actor participated in this narrow minded , stereotyping , propaganda movie . But i pity them . This represents a country where you can get away with murder if you have money or power . As long a `` Uncle Sam '' think you are a good patriot . Where everyone is happy a long a it is another country that ha been devastated , no one care .

The sort of `` little '' film which studio used to excel at but seldom make anymore . Sort of a `` soul '' version of the more well-known `` The Last Of The Blonde Bombshells '' . Ian McShane is excellent a a DJ and aficionado of soul music who becomes obsessed with the idea of re-uniting the member of a classic soul group , and the film follows his exploit a well a those of the group member ; a cast which includes such genuine musical talent a Isaac Hayes , a well a acting stalwart Taurean Blacque , Derrick O'Connor and Antonio Fargas . Not meant to be an epic by any mean , this is nonetheless a chunk of solid gold .

I do not like Himesh Reshamiya . I do not like his singing too . But his song are a craze in India , especially among commoner . Now when he ventured to become an actor  that wa a big joke ! What gut he ha to reap a much a he can in his prime time . I did never want to see this movie . But one thing changed it . The movie becoming a super-duper hit ! After 2 week , Aap Ka Saroor ha raked box office collection of 14 crore  compared to Apne that ha collected 7 crore in the same 2 week . If I can sit through Apne and Rajnikant 's absurd Sivaji  I should give this movie also a try to understand what stuff this movie ha got that made it such a big hit ? The story is about the real life singer Himesh Reshamiya ( HR ) who ha gone to Germany for a concert and fall in love with Riya ( Hansika Motwani ) . A German lawyer Ruby ( Mallika Sherawat ) love Himesh . Now Himesh is arrested for a murder . The mission of Himesh ( in last 40 minute ) after he run away from jail is to prove himself innocent and find the real murderer . Let me say that Himesh ha nothing in him to become a hero . He try hard but fails miserably . He is pathetic . I wa thinking what could have made the movie click so much ? Let me find something positive . First , the saving grace of the movie is the script till the point Himesh run away from the jail . ( But after that the movie nose dive into unbearable stupid limit ) Second , the song of the movie are good , catchy , crowd puller number . Third , Mallika Sherawat  she look gorgeous and act well too , a the second lady . I can imagine fan of Mallika coming to see the movie just for her . Fourth , the cinematography of the movie is pleasing  especially the German locale , are a treat to watch for the eye . Fifth , the major portion of the story is a love story between Himesh and Riya  with clichéd dialogue that would probably connect to young crowd . Sixth , the Director Prashant Chadha ha done a decent job in covering the pathetic acting skill of Himesh a much a possible with shot that do n't need Himesh to act much . The heroine Hansika Motwani look like a small budget film heroine . Raj Babbar is wasted in a small role . Overall the movie is a below average . I wa thinking throughout the movie  what if the same movie script wa done with Salmaan a the main lead . I think it would have had been a much better affair . May be then I would have given the movie 6 out of 10 . But now ( Stars 4.5 out of 10 )

Even for a tired movie model a the nature vs. man cycle that prevailed so predominantly in the 1970s , ant fall miserably short of being even somewhat effective ( though entertaining for reason it wa not intending ) . It is sooooo preposterous . Apparently these ant that are bulldozed near an inn have been eating poisonous waste for decade and have now adapted by emitting poisonous bite - hundred of these bite being fatal . Watching actor of some notoriety clumsily fall amidst tiny black speck is painfully funny in a not-so-good-but very-bad way . So many scene just look ludicrous : a boy trying to fall in a dumpster whilst being attacked , Suzanne Sommers cry out in horror while lounging in bed , Robert Foxworth and Lynda George breathing through piece of wallpaper , Bernie Casey faking a gam leg , and the list go on and on . The peril shown range from ant crawling from a drain to black line of ant all over the wall . The cast for the film is not bad on paper , but none of these actor seem to believe in the material . Poor Myrna Loy ha to sit in a wheelchair through this horror . I hope she found a good use for the money , for it is obvious that wa the ONLY reason a woman of her pedigree would be in this nonsense . Although it is quite a bad film , it is watchable - once for me , and doe have many of those seventy bad film quality - start-studded actor embarrassing themselves , that made-for-TV feel , and the dreaded creature of nature reeking vengeance on man . This time man must push his hand into a pile of ant to be affected . Really quite dreadful .

Ghillie a remake of the Telugu `` okkadu ' is thankfully a clarified version of the original . It pack the same punch and Dharani true to his cinematic brilliance delivers it with style and panache . A flagging Vijay 's career with the entry of the like of Surya and Vikram on the fray , got the much needed uplift with this movie . This might well prove to be the best movie Vijay ha ever been on , considering the choice he ha been making since then . The hard-working actor seems to have lost his bearing what with talented new entrant being accepted both by the industry and public alike . The tightly snug script , which run at , a neck-break speed revolves around Velu , a willful youngster aspiring to make a mark in the game of Kabaddi ( a popular game among boy in India ) . The event following the chance encounter with Muthupandi , his rescue of the girl in distress and how he juggle with the aspiration of his friend and his own form the fulcrum and end of the movie . Vijay fit a a 'T ' into the role and essay a subdued and believable portrayal of the boy next door . Trisha ha more than a stereotyped Tamil heroine mantle to play . The role is far more complex than just a girl in trouble . With limited dialog 's , Trisha exploit her occasional muted expression and subtle vulnerability to add color to the role . This is a classic case of a cover page girl coming-of-age to become a professional actress . Trisha became my personal favorite after this movie . The movie end on predictable line , although one ha to credit the Director for keeping the audience guessing on many thing including Trisha 's change in decision to leave the country . Prakash Raj deserves a word of praise for providing the perfect counter-weight for Vijay 's role . His almost indomitable stature in the role of a villain and the apparent chink in the hero 's armor form a perfect ploy for keeping the audience guessing . Overall this is a great movie that deserves at least a single viewing . I give it a clear 8 out of 10 .

The only reason I give it a 2 is that filmography is so stylized these day such that it ha at least something to comment on . This film is asinine . It 's like so many other 21st century grind house fodder . The gore is gratuitous and simply revolting . I did n't care about any of the character , but I did care that some cretin bothered to pen this crap : I 'd complain about the money I spent , but my date and I wisely left after 40 minute and went to an adjoining theater to watch the adventurous and entertaining `` Live Free or Die Hard , '' which probably got a much higher rating from me simply because I endured the utter poop of `` Captivity '' for 40 minute .

This is a big step down after the surprisingly enjoyable original . This sequel is n't nearly a fun a part one , and it instead spends too much time on plot development . Tim Thomerson is still the best thing about this series , but his wisecracking is toned down in this entry . The performance are all adequate , but this time the script let u down . The action is merely routine and the plot is only mildly interesting , so I need lot of silly laugh in order to stay entertained during a `` Trancers '' movie . Unfortunately , the laugh are few and far between , and so , this film is watchable at best .

A Vow to Cherish is a wonderful movie . It 's based on a novel of the same title , which wa equally good , though different from the film . Really made you think about how you 'd respond if you were in the shoe of the character . Recommended for anyone who ha ever loved a parent , spouse , or family member -- in other word , EVERYONE ! Though the production is n't quite Hollywood quality -- no big special effect -- still , the value and ideal portrayed more than make up for it . And the cast did a wonderful job of capturing the emotional connection between family member , and the devastation that occurs when one of them becomes ill. You do n't want to miss this !

The title suggests that this movie is a sequel to `` An American werewolf in London '' . None of the character from the previous movie return and are n't even mentioned in this movie by name . So a a sequel , AAwiP fails , one would say . I dare to say the opposite . An American werewolf in Paris is a charming , effective horror movie . It 's one of the better werewolf film I have seen in a long time too . And I have seen quite my share , such a An American werewolf in London , The Howling , Wolfen , The Wolfman and the Underworld trilogy . The story tell of three Americans visiting Paris on a vacation . At the top of the Eifel Tower one of them save a woman trying to commit suicide . What start out a a romantic relationship slowly turn into a nightmare when the dark secret that lurk in the city are revealed ... I really liked the acting in this film . Especially the two star of the movie : the woman who tried to commit suicide and the guy who save her . They have good chemistry together . But the other two Americans also play their role nicely . I did n't really find anything annoying about the acting , so thumb up for that ! The effect on the werewolf are nice . It doe n't look too cheap or fake to me . Of course , the opinion are divided about this subject . But let 's just say that I wa n't disappointed . There 's also a good amount of humor in this movie . There are some really funny scene you will probably remember for a long time . So , to sum it up , An American werewolf in Paris might not be a direct sequel to it 's predecessor , but it 's still an enjoyable movie . Perfect for fan of werewolf ! 7 out of 10 star !

please , future writer , producer , director - learn from this movie ! never before have i seen such a bold and original tale created for the big movie screen . bold , because the script constantly made a step so many fantasy movie safely avoided - a step to something new , creative and daring . just when you think 'oh , i 've seen this before ' or ' i am sure this is what will happen now ' - StarDust would make an unexpected twist and involve you more and more into the story . the actor are great - even the smallest part is performed with such talent it fill me with awe for the creator of this movie . Robert De Niro is gorgeous and performs with such energy that he simply steal the show in each scene he 's in . Michelle Pfeiffer is the perfect witch , and Claire Danes a wonderful choice for the innocent and loving 'star ' , Yvaine . Other big name make outstanding role . I had the filling everyone is trying to give his best for this movie . But once again , the story by Neil Gaiman , all the little thing he 'invented ' for this universe - simply outstanding . I watched this movie at a pre-screening today , a day before the official release , and do hope it will have huge success . There is so much humor , but also tense moment a well a lovely tender scene . The look in the eye of Yvaine , the 'frivolities ' of Captain Shakespeare , the passion of Lamia the witch - impressive , unforgettable For me this is the number one entertaining movie of 2007 , watch it and enjoy it 11/10 - Outstanding peace and love

Once again , we are fortunate to see a gorgeous opening scene where the artist ' work ha been fully restored and we see this old-time grocery store on a street corner with the snow gently falling . Inside are the rich color of all the merchandise , from produce to canned and boxed good to medicine to candy , etc . In essence , this is a story of those good `` coming to life , '' such a the animal on the label of item , or a pie , or even a pack of cigarette . The whole `` show '' is narrated by `` Jack Bunny , '' a Jack Benny impersonator , with music from conductor Leopold Stokowski , who wa in so many Looney Tunes animated short I have lost count . A lot of the humor is topical , so it pay to know who `` Little Egypt '' and other character . The Busby Berkeley-type `` aqua '' number with bathing suited-sardines coming out of the can , and the tomato can-can dance were both clever ! All of the above , and more , wa in the first half of this slightly longer-than-normal length cartoon . The second half wa about a King Kong-type which escape from the `` Animal Crackers '' box and terrorizes everyone . That part wa not much , and ended on a somewhat stupid note . So ..... an `` A '' for the first half , a `` D '' for the second , making it about a C-plus or B-minus overall .

Henry Fool surprised me . I did n't expect it to entertain and amuse a well , or a strongly , a it did . Fay Grim continues to surprise in that it provides solid continuation to a story that seems not to need it . Once the viewer watch the first 20 minute of the movie , however , it becomes blindingly aware that this is one of the BEST sequel to brilliant indie film . At least a good a Ginger Snaps Back , if not better . I am a little disappointed that Jeff Goldblum 's part is so small , but I 'm happy he is a part of this short run . He is convincing and delightful a Agent Fulbright . Also a delight is Liam Aiken who quite aptly portrays Ned Grim , the son of Fay and Henry . This movie is a pleasure for so many reason . I am pleased , for example , to discover that Henry is n't really the loser he seems ( by the end of Fool ) , and to further discover that he is , in fact , a genius ... well , that really is a lovely stroke of the pen . I am hoping they do a third ... like the end of the trilogy . It seems to be missing . They should entitle it Ned Fool Grim and it should be Liam looking for his father , to validate the awesome change in his mother , and the sense of near-genius he himself feel welling inside him . Assuming , of course , that Fay continues withholding many of the most important fact from her son , concerning his father . It feel like it need to be done . I 'd buy it . Even with more action , this is still not an action flick . It is more drama and intrigue ... a mystery , of sort . I 'll watch it often . It rate an 8.3/10 from ... the Fiend : .

So tell me - what serious boozer drink Budweiser ? How many suicidally-obsessed drinker house a fully stocked and barely touched range of drink in their lonely motel room that a millionaire playboy 's bachelor-pad bar would be proud to boast ? And what kind of an alcoholic tends to drink with the bottle held about 8 inch from his hungry mouth so that the content generally spill all over his face ? Not to mention wasting good whisky by dousing your girlfriend 's tit with it , just so the cinema audience can get a good eyeful of Elisabeth Shue 's asset . Cage seems to be portraying the most attention-seeking look-at-me alcoholic ever to have graced the screen while Shue look more like a Berkely preppy slumming it for a summer than some seasoned street-walker . She is humiliated and subjugated a often a possible in this revolting movie with beating , skin laceration , anal rape and graphic verbal abuse - all of it completely implausible and included apparently only to convey a sense of her horribly demeaned state and offer the male viewer an astonishingly clichéd sentimental sexual fantasy of the 'tart-with-a-heart ' . Still - I did watch it to the end , by which time I wa actually laughing out loud a Shue 's tough street hooker chopped carrot in the kitchen wanly , pathetically smiling while Cage - all eye popping and shaking like like a man operating a road drill in an earthquake - grimaced and mugged his way through the final half-hour ...

at first I had the reaction a lot of people left with after seeing this : that shot of fat people sunbathing , etc were cheap shot in a way . OK so he 's doing diane arbus meet . . . whatever . . . but it wa n't long before I realized that this wa n't being done in a dehumanizing way , a the image unfold I felt that the problem wa entirely the audience 's : we are conditioned by Hollywood and also movie from just about everywhere actually to feel that to watch people above a certain age behave in a sexual way is something unseemly , something that ought not to be shown . if this were all the film offered it would be a great deal . however , the story of the woman with the abusive boyfriend and his drunk friend really hit like a ton of brick : very eloquent storytelling , incredible performance , and to think the scene wa improvised . that blonde guy is a genius actor . finally I want to contradict those who say this film is all about how pathetic all these people are . the old man who is on the make with the woman who finally dance for him is completely an a OK character that break that mold , so do n't oversimplify the film by overlooking him . yes his dog get killed . this ai n't a rosy picture of the world but it 's not . . . completely hopeless . anyway I felt really grateful to the filmmaker for making such a beautiful film all in all . I would n't say each of the thread were a strong a the strongest , but I say this movie basically kick as and would highly recommend it . . .

One of my absolute favorite childhood film . The Chipmunk adventure pack incredible fun geared for young and old alike . The animation is lively and colorful and the film itself boast some of the best song ever put in an animated feature . Who could forget the dynamic `` Boys/Girls of Rock n ' Roll '' , the exciting `` Diamond Dolls '' , and the heartrending `` My Mother '' ? This should be considered a nostalgic classic animated gem from the eighty . It 's too bad they do n't make them like this anymore . Most animated film today resort to violence , crude humor , or sentimental mush ... except of course the folk from Pixar . BOTTOM LINE : An amazing and unforgettable adventure for all age .

A lot of people give this movie a lot of crap , and all of it 's really undeserved . People give this movie a hard time either because it 's such a sick subject or they harp on some technical aspect of the movie no one else observes when they watch it . If , just by looking at the cover , you think this movie will make you uncomfortable ... DO N'T WATCH IT ! However , you 'd be missing out on one of the better cinematic experience of the late 1990 's , despite what anyone else say . Dee Snider is wonderful here a Captain Howdy , the depth of insanity he plumb to play this character ha to be beyond word , and is much farther than any one of u would have to be willing to go . The acting here is wonderful . The film itself beautifully shot . The subject may be a bit too much for many to swallow , but it 's still well worth your time . If you have n't seen this movie , check it out .

Today I found `` They All Laughed '' on VHS on sale in a rental . It wa a really old and very used VHS , I had no information about this movie , but I liked the reference listed on it cover : the name of Peter Bogdanovich , Audrey Hepburn , John Ritter and specially Dorothy Stratten attracted me , the price wa very low and I decided to risk and buy it . I searched IMDb , and the User Rating of 6.0 wa an excellent reference . I looked in `` Mick Martin & Marsha Porter Video & DVD Guide 2003 '' and  wow  four star ! So , I decided that I could not waste more time and immediately see it . Indeed , I have just finished watching `` They All Laughed '' and I found it a very boring overrated movie . The character are badly developed , and I spent lot of minute to understand their role in the story . The plot is supposed to be funny ( private eye who fall in love for the woman they are chasing ) , but I have not laughed along the whole story . The coincidence , in a huge city like New York , are ridiculous . Ben Gazarra a an attractive and very seductive man , with the woman falling for him a if her were a Brad Pitt , Antonio Banderas or George Clooney , is quite ridiculous . In the end , the greater attraction certainly are the presence of the Playboy centerfold and playmate of the year Dorothy Stratten , murdered by her husband pretty after the release of this movie , and whose life wa showed in `` Star 80 '' and `` Death of a Centerfold : The Dorothy Stratten Story '' ; the amazing beauty of the sexy Patti Hansen , the future Mrs. Keith Richards ; the always wonderful , even being fifty-two year old , Audrey Hepburn ; and the song `` Amigo '' , from Roberto Carlos . Although I do not like him , Roberto Carlos ha been the most popular Brazilian singer since the end of the 60 's and is called by his fan a `` The King '' . I will keep this movie in my collection only because of these attraction ( manly Dorothy Stratten ) . My vote is four . Title ( Brazil ) : `` Muito Riso e Muita Alegria '' ( `` Many Laughs and Lots of Happiness '' )

It amazes me that someone would actually consider spending some money on a movie like this . Really . Let 's forget for a second that the plot doe n't even give a single hint of originality ... Most of the movie today are based on other movie ' story , so a `` simple '' lack of originality is not that big a deal . But I can hardly believe that none of the guy involved in the movie had never even got on a plane before shooting this . Because , let 's be honest , that would be the only excuse to come up with something so ridiculous . To be sincere I think a 6-years-old child with a fake camera could have come up with something technically much more believable . Some example following . The scene that really drove me crazy is when the engine turn off when they regain control of the plane . When they have to turn them on again the guy on the radio say something like `` Ok , push the 1 and 2 button on the dashboard '' . Now , those are not button . They should not be pushed , they should actually be pulled up and toward the pilot . That 's something only plane-addicted would know , you say ? Wrong . The next scene you can see their finger pushing the `` button '' ... And of course the so called `` button '' do n't move at all ! Not even a single millimeter ! ( And note that I have n't even mentioned the fact that aircraft engine are not like car engine , that you just turn the key and the magic happens ... You have to do quite a complicated procedure to turn them on ... ) Come on guy ! You could have faked the movement at least ! ! Not to mention the hilarious final impact , where the plane crash against every single thing along the runway ( Light pole along the runway ? What where they thinking ? ! ) ... And the wing do n't even get ripped off ! It happened to me too , once ... Except the plane wa made of Lego ! What about the flight attendant ? She 's actually so skilled that she perfectly know where the `` aux 1 '' and `` aux 2 '' fuse are , in the middle of the wire behind the cockpit . Should we mention , then , the guy that can drive an ambulance _and_ fly a plane behind the ambulance using his computer ? And how did he turn the other airplane engine on ? Really , I could go on hour with this stuff . This is the dumbest movie I 've ever come across , and I 'm including garbage like Alone In The Dark and other stuff in the list . Want to do yourself a favor ? Do n't watch it .

Cedric Klapisch 's movie L'AUBERGE ESPAGNOLE is easy , breezy charm wrapped in nostalgia for our younger year and attractive youth . At it core , it 's the feature-length presentation of the long-running MTV reality soap opera known a `` The Real World '' in which , a it motto go : `` This is the 'true story ' of seven stranger picked to live in a house and have their life taped ... so watch what happens when people stop being polite and start getting real . '' This is exactly what happens -- minus the camera planted at every minuscule corner of the house in Barcelona , Spain , where Xavier ( Romain Duris ) come to stay , having to learn Spanish to fill into his job 's requirement . An outsider in many way , he slowly form a camaraderie with his house-mates who come from all corner of Europe except America ... this is a movie in which the only American shown is an unlikable character with whom Wendy ( the adorable Kelly Reilly ) is having an affair with ( `` Only for sex , '' she confesses , since she ha her own boyfriend who make a late but dazed appearance. ) . Throughout his stay there , he try to maintain a long-distance relationship with his girlfriend played by Audrey Tautou while he begin a tentative flirtation with the wife of the owner of the Spanish house where he is staying at and get some advice from a lesbian house-mate ( Cecile de France ) a to how to seduce a woman . A sweet little feature that present a moment in time that twenty-somethings will never see again , L'AUBERGE ESPAGNOLE is forgettable fun containing within itself the threshold into the `` real world '' experienced through Xavier 's eye .

Hitchcock would be proud of this movie . Even when nothing happens , it is suspenseful . Director David Lynch overuse a few cheap thrill trick here and there , but he intersperses them with other cinematographic technique to keep it from becoming obtuse . Altogether surreal , this movie is like waking up and remembering most of a dream but not enough to make it sensible . I am still trying to figure it all out and will probably have to see it again to catch thing I missed and which may help me understand it better . It is a very detailed plot that very slowly come together , so you must be patient and pay attention . Get your bathroom trip out of the way before it start . And yet , the plot is overshadowed by the theme , the mood , the character development , and the filming technique . The dual role of the main actress , Naomi Watts , showcase her enormous talent . That is , when I could get my eye off of her co-star . What an acting pair . Lynch surprise throughout the movie with unusual camera angle , the length/timing of editing cut , jumping back and forth between scene . Combined with smart use of music and sound , it all help to build suspense in our mind , doubtless a major objective of the director . Well , he kept me on the edge of my seat , even had me talking to the actor to be careful here , and not be so naive there . You know , the kind of stuff you want to smack your kid for doing at the movie .

i am working at a video store so i got to see this one for free- thank god , had i paid for it my review would be le forgiving . well , the major idea of the film ( geeky girl take bloody revenge ) is n't all that original , there are several parallel to `` carrie '' ( playing a mean practical joke on a loser , except for one nice girl that is actually sorry for her , tamaras and carry bad family background ) . i still think it 's a fun idea for trashy teen horror flick unfortunately they did n't take much advantage of the potential that are here and rather put an emphasis on all the wrong thing . what worked : i liked the actress that played tamara . she looked great ( when she wa hot ) and her catty line were fun ( `` Sean ca n't come to the phone . he 's f * * king patrick ! '' ) . what did n't work : the whole wicca thing wa silly . i generally prefer rational explanation ( she could have ploted the whole thing with her teacher or one of the boy to get her revenge ) . there were a lot of logical whole and the gore looked really bad ( when the boy is cutting of his ear and his tongue- please ! ! ! ) the whole idea wa n't bound for Oscar buzz , but i just think they wasted the comedic and the suspenseful potential they had . it wa bearable but far from good !

Yes , this bizarre feature wa written by John Sayles . Shot in Toronto , it 's yet another '80s era feature about the danger of the urban jungle , where the police fear to go and the homeless and the criminal class are the only inhabitant . Into this mix come the myth of Wild Thing , a feral young man raised by a bag lady after his parent were murdered by a dirty cop on the take ( Maury Chaykin ) and Chopper , the local crime lord ( Robert Davi ) . Stir in the local do-gooder ( priest Sean Hewitt and clueless social worker Kathleen Quinlan ) , and you have a recipe for some rather unexciting action sequence . Davi is the standout amongst the cast , and cinematographer Rene Verzier doe a pretty good job . Otherwise this is a rather lumpen action pic that wo n't satisfy action fan and will leaf Sayles ' admirer slack-jawed .

Absolutely one of the worst movie I have ever seen ! The acting , the dialog , the manuscript , the sound , the lighting , the plot line . I actually ca n't say anything positive about this , although I enjoy Swedish movie . The fighting scene are so ridiculous that it 's impossible to take it seriously . And when the lead character just happens to loose his shirt , while dodging bullet in a strip bar , I 'm not sure if it 's supposed to be a joke , or if someone really think these are ingredient in a good film ? ! Regina Lund is the only half descent actor , but she disappears in a flood of laughable pronunciation and unbelievable reaction . It leaf you horrified that someone actually spent time and money on something like this ...

`` Plots With A View '' of 2002 is a delightful little comedy like only the British could do it . The film 's sense of humor is both mildly morbid and black and yet very lovable and sometimes very slapstick-ish . It 's the only film by director Nick Hurran I 've seen so far , and while I am not intending to watch any of his other film at the moment ( I 'm not a big fan of romantic comedy ) , this one is highly enjoyable and very funny . The film take place in a little town in Wales , where Betty Rhys-Jones ( Brenda Blethyn ) is married to the town 's drunken and adulterous major ( Robert Pugh ) . The local mortician Boris ( Alfred Molina ) ha been desperately in love with Betty since their childhood , but ha always been too shy to confess his love to her . Apart from being desperately in love , Boris ha some other problem , a the eccentric American mortician Frank Featherbed ( Christopher Walken ) ha opened a funeral flourishing business in the same town ... The film 's odd , very British wit should amuse everybody with a sense of humor , and the story sometimes becomes quite bizarre . Also , `` Plots With A View '' profit from a wonderful cast . Brenda Bethlyn , who ha already proved herself to be a funny lady in 2000 's `` Saving Grace '' , play the lead , and she is once again very funny , and very lovable in her role . Alfred Molina , who play her shy admirer , delivers a great performance a always , and Robert Pugh fit perfectly in the role of Betty 's sleazy husband . Beautiful Naomi Watts is also great a the husband 's 'secretary ' , I 'm becoming a bigger fan with every film I see her in . The greatest role , however , is played by the incomparable Christopher Walken ( one of my favorite actor ) . Walken is brilliant a he always is in the role of the eccentric Mortician who arranges funeral that are quite unorthodox . Overall , `` Plots With A View '' is a vastly entertaining little British Comedy that I highly recommend !

Its incredible to me that the best rendition of this amazing story remains a cartoon made by Walt Disney in the 1940s , but it true . Here another clumsy attempt sputter confuses and alienates would be viewer with admirable effectiveness while successfully antagonizing those of u who have actually read the story . Irving 's original work is short by any measure and making a feature length film is bound to be a challenge . One can either completely rewrite the story a la Tim Burton which is a discussion for another time , or pad the bust-line of the old girl with unintended detail . The latter is what is attempted here , and if I may say , pitifully so . Unimaginative and thoroughly modern new facet to character personality such a religious zealotry in Crane or wanderlust in good old Bram Bones ruin the story 's intent and betray a severe lack of talent by the filmmaker . By the time the tale 's famous climax approached , I had completely lost interest . Its the kind of film where you expect to see a stagehand smoking in the background .

I waited for this movie to play in great anticipation . Assuming it would be more accurately portrayed like the movie , `` The Christmas Box '' based on the book by Richard Paul Evans . I sent out many email to friend and family asking them to please watch this show , hoping they would better understand a tiny amount of my `` new '' life . After seeing this movie I wa so disappointed . As a mother who lost her only child in November 2003 and REALLY knowing the pain , I had hoped that this movie would shed light to parent who `` think '' they understand the grief a parent go through who ha lost a child . This movie wa a very light hearted movie and the silliness of Diane Keaton wa a slap in the face to parent who have buried a child . It wa VERY unrealistic from start to stop . I had a few call after the movie , each call the same , `` That wa so off the mark and made it appear that in a short time you are back on the road and listening to song on the radio and life is back '' What a bunch of bull ! It is clear that the director and Keaton have never lost a child because neither would have EVER made the movie to be so off the mark . I guess that 's Hollywood .

Have you ever wondered what would happen if a couple of character from Beverly Hills 90210 were thrown into a Thai jail ? If so , this is your movie . This is Midnight Express for the MTV crowd . That would be ok , but the story wa poorly executed . Contrived plot twist , poor dialogue and unresolved issue abound . This slight film did not earn the right to be a cryptic a it end up being . Potential spoiler and impossibly preposterous plot line-the faux tension filled moment when the hotel employee discovers the girl do not have a room there and is about to kick them out . ( This moment is innappropriately played with the same solemnity and gravity a the moment when they are arrested at gunpoint ) . Later the same hotel employee is somehow found-and Bangkok is a big city , mind you , Ive been there- and testifies against the girl , a if a couple of free Mai Tais warrant 40 year in prison . C'mon . Rent Another Day in Paradise instead .

Since there have been so many review of this fine film I will write in a list form and attempt to address issue that have not been discussed . 1 . Dana Andrews wa 38 during the filming of this movie . His character according to the screenplay wa in his mid 20 . Andrews , a highly underrated actor , did brilliantly play a character who wa supposed to be much younger . 2 . Fredric March like all GREAT actor need at time to be restrained by the director to avoid over-the-top acting . He wa mugging for the camera when he wa drunk on the night after his arrival and also the next morning when he wa checking out his hang over in his mirror . 3 . Dana Andrews wa superb a he wa in `` Laura , '' `` The Ox-Bowl Incident , '' `` A Walk in the Sun , '' `` The Purple Heart '' and many other film . Why did Fredric March win the Academy Award and why wa Dana Andrews not even nominated for his outstanding performance ? 4 . Harold Russell gave the best performance I have ever seen by a non actor . 5 . I realize this wa the 1940s but Dana Andrews seemed to have no romantic interest in his exceptionally attractive wife ( Virginia Mayo ) . 6 . Ray Teal , who played the right wing bigot , year later became famous for portraying the sheriff on `` Bonanza . '' 7 . The professor from the south wrote that the film wa slow moving , boring and poorly acted . The professor more than likely is uninformed about classic film . The beauty and significance of these ageless classic is that they are slow moving character study that avoid profanity , excessive violence and gratuitous sex . * * * I wa surprised that zero out of 3 people found my review useful .

OK , this doe n't compare to the explosive tempo of the first part 's opening sequence ; nor to it visual shock value ; nor , for that matter , to the melancholic suspense of the second installment . No , it 's surprisingly and refreshingly different ( apart , of course , from the two main actor ) . The tongue-in-cheek futuristic scenario drive the character towards each other across genre and language with an almost gravitational force . The moment of impact-conclusion is your choice of : a ) Shakespearean metaphor of life and humanity in a cartoon costume ; b ) sublimation of violence into homo-erotics ; c ) humorous detonation of an impossible buildup . Everything up to then is even le unequivocal . Highly recommended to indiscriminate movie buff who do n't mind following foie gras with a hot dog ; caution to those with more refined palate .

This movie wa a masterpiece of human emotion and experience . I think that a lot of people get caught up in Leland 's apparent mental illness a the storyline , but I wa drawn into the relationship of many of the character and what they reveal about the force of human emotion . Much of the message of the movie is that we never know the good without the bad , which is a little cliché , but what make this movie so good and so original is that it very eloquently portrays the crushing and devastating force that the bad can have , whether you see the bad everywhere like Leland , or are experiencing the utter helplessness of unrequited love or a relationship that just is n't going to work no matter how bad you want it to . This movie capture how helpless relationship and emotion can make you feel better than any movie I 've seen , and it is a depressing a movie a it is good .

The man who gave u Splash , Cocoon and Parenthood gave u this incoherent muddle of cliched character , poor plotting , you've-got-to-be-kidding dialogue and melodramatic acting ? I guess everybody ha a bad day at the office now and then . He 's allowed .

There 's hardly anything at all to recommend this movie . Chase Masterson is always nice to look at and actually can act , though her role in this clunker is a waste . Unfortunately the rest of the cast range from bad to mediocre . In a lot of film like this someone will shine through the material and you make a note of them for future reference . No such luck here . Creature Unknown '' a clichéd monster-on-the-loose flick with the kid getting knocked off one after the other . The monster is a man in a rubber suit which hearkens back to the day of Paul Blaisdell . So bad it 's good ! The rest of the show is just so bad it 's bad . A little humor might have made this more palatable , but everyone play the deadly dull material straight up . There is a twist or two at the end , but by then you wo n't care anymore .

Now here is a film that if made in Australia would have easily been a comedy . Sadly and annoyingly , here it is , flaccid and cheesy and overbaked from Lala land . How did the di-erector get it so wrong ? Well , mainly by being serious about a job so hilariously startling that nobody in their right mind could take seriously . Unless of course they were a nerdy lonely gay cliché ( but somehow cute ) ... or is that cliché piled upon cliché . No value in the story that almost seems like a prequel to Gus Van Sant 's GERRY ..... and with a title like THE FLUFFER how is it all such a lead weight ? Well this auteur must have soooooo mad that he did n't get to Burt and BOOGIE first that he had to make his own . Convoluted and undeveloped apart from the 'unrequited love 's a bore ' theme left over from a faded Streisand lyric , we have only moody beefcake and TV serial level storyline left . The un necessary fourth act of this overlong turgid drama is truly terrible a the film wanders off like the Gerries into to desert and get stuck there . In Oz in the late 90 some 20 somethings made a similar but actually hilarious film called MONEYSHOT . Originally filmed a THE VENUS FACTORY it too suffered from an auteur more awful than Orson so they re-filmed half of it , got a ruthless TV editor to chop it up and down down to 72 minute and hey-presto .. comedy , tonight ! A lesson there in when bad film turn good by lightening up . I guess THE FLUFFER stiffed on release and after seeing it not perform , I can understand why .

My interest in Dorothy Stratten caused me to purchase this video . Although it had great actors/actresses , there were just too many subplots going on to retain interest . Plus it just wa n't that interesting . Dialogue wa stiff and confusing and the story just flipped around too much to be believable . I wa pretty disappointed in what I believe wa one of Audrey Hepburn 's last movie . I 'll always love John Ritter best in slapstick . He wa just too pathetic here .

The first hour or so of the movie wa mostly boring to say the least . However it improved afterwards a the Valentine Party commenced . Apart from the twist a to the identity of the killer in the very end , the hot bath murder scene wa one of the few relatively memorable aspect of this movie . The scene at the garden with Kate wa well shot and so wa the very last scene ( the 'twist ' ) . In those scene , there wa some genuine suspense and thrill and the hot bath murder scene had a nasty ( the way slasher should be ) edge to it . The earlier murder are frustratingly devoid of gore .

I feel a though I know these people and have known people similar to them . These day , though , people are discouraged from showing such passion about anything especially love and loneliness . If you love romantic comedy , but would like to see one that had some basis in reality for a change { or at least did have back in the 70 's } , then you should see this movie !

Like a twisty country road , `` Tough Luck '' take the viewer for a ride . There is nothing wrong with plot curve , a long a believability doe n't fly out the window . Unfortunately in the end the film doe challenge an audience 's belief tolerance . Nevertheless , it is easy to forgive this fault due to the superior acting , character development , and wonderful carnival atmosphere . Do not expect to like any of the character . Armand Asante , Norman Redus , and Dagmara Dominczyk , play shady con-artists , not exactly the type of person easily admired . The double cross come fast and furious , and the final cross is a bit of a stretch . Recommended . - MERK

Has aged really well - still thrilling and suspenseful today . Certainly one of Hitch 's best movie . Beautifully shot , with a great premise for suspense , sex-appeal provided by beautiful Ruth Roman . Because of the great premise , you feel like you have to watch it to the end . If you find yourself losing faith in Hitch and doubting his title a the Master of Suspense , i recommend this nice little movie a an antidote . 5 out of 5 .
