This movie , which I just discovered at the video store , ha apparently sit around for a couple of year without a distributor . It 's easy to see why . The story of two friend living in New York searching for their pal from high school who is now living homeless under the boardwalk at Coney Island , ha flash of being a very good film , but ultimately is weighted down by the story focusing on Stan and Daniel , rather than on their homeless friend Richie . Cryer is a usual very good and the film ha a nice stark look to it , with the ghostly image of Coney Island . However , writer Cryer and director Richard Schenkman are too busy dealing with the fairly uninteresting life of Stan and Daniel rather than focusing on Richie . One flashback in a music store , where Richie ha a crush on an employee stand out and really show the viewer where this film could have gone . But in the end , not much . Two many drawn out scene of annoyance , such a inside the Skeeball building . RATING 4 out of 10 .

How viewer react to this new `` adaption '' of Shirley Jackson 's book , which wa promoted a NOT being a remake of the original 1963 movie ( true enough ) , will be based , I suspect , on the following : those who were big fan of either the book or original movie are not going to think much of this one ... and those who have never been exposed to either , and who are big fan of Hollywood 's current trend towards `` special effect '' being the first and last word in how `` good '' a film is , are going to love it . Things I did not like about this adaption : 1 . It wa NOT a true adaption of the book . From the article I had read , this movie wa supposed to cover other aspect in the book that the first one never got around to . And , that seemed reasonable , no film can cover a book word for word unless it is the length of THE STAND ! ( And not even then ) But , there were thing in this movie that were never by any mean ever mentioned or even hinted at , in the movie . Reminded me of the way they decided to kill off the black man in the original movie version of THE SHINING . I did n't like that , either . What the movie 's press release SHOULD have said is ... '' We got the basic , very basic , idea from Shirley Jackson 's book , we kept the same name of the house and several ( though not all ) of the leading character 's name , but then we decided to write our own story , and , what the heck , we watched THE CHANGELING and THE SHINING and GHOST first , and decided to throw in a bit of them , too . '' 2 . They completely lost the theme of a parapyschologist inviting carefully picked guest who had all had brush with the paranormal in their past , to investigate a house that truly seemed to have been `` born bad '' . No , instead , this `` doctor '' got everyone to the house under the false pretense of studying their `` insomnia '' ( he really invited them there to scare them to death and then see how they reacted to their fear ... like lab rat , who he mentioned never got told they are part of an experiment ... nice guy ) . This doctor , who did not have the same name , by the way , wa a different from the dedicated professional of the original movie a night from day . 3 . In direct contrast to the statement that wa used to promote both movie `` some house are just born bad '' , this house wa not born bad but rather became bad because of what happened there ... and , this time around , Nel get to unravel the mystery ( shade of THE CHANGELING ) . The only problem wa , the so-called mystery wa so incoherently told that I 'm sure it remained a mystery to most of the audience ... but , then there wa no mystery in the first place ( not in the book ) , because the house wa bad TO BEGIN WITH . It 's first `` victim '' died before ever setting eye on it . 4 . The way the character of Luke wa portrayed wa absolutely ridiculous . He wa supposed to be a debonair playboy who wa someday to inherit the house ( and wa a true skeptic of it 's `` history '' ) ... and in this one he wa just a winey-voiced , bumbling nerd who could n't sleep ( insomnia remember ) and wa a compulsive liar . 5 . I wa also annoyed with the way the movie jumped from almost trying to recreate original scene word for word ( the scene with Nel 's sister 's family , and Mrs. Dudley 's little opening speech ... ) to going off into flight of fancy that made me think more of these other movie than THE HAUNTING . It 's like it could n't make up it mind what it wanted to do . 6 . I missed Nel 's narrative through the whole movie . The original wa so like a gothic novel in the way that the story wa mostly told in the first person , through Nel 's eye , and we always were privy to her thought . That totally unique touch wa completely lost in the new version . They also tried to make Nel much more of a heroine . The original Nel wa not a bad person , but she wa a bitter person ( could she be otherwise after sacrificing 11 year of her life to a selfish old woman and a spiteful sister ? ) and she liked to moan , and she lost her temper ... This one wa almost too good to be true . This wa never more apparent than in the climax of the movie where the writer 's had obviously been watching GHOST one too many time . 7 . They changed the history of the house and it 's occupents too much . There wa no Abigail Crain ( the daughter of Hugh whose legend loomed large in the original version ) , there wa no `` companion '' , and there wa no nursery . There wa also no `` Grace '' ( wife of the original doctor ) and Hugh Crain 's wife died in totally different way . These change , changed the story WAY too much . I do n't know whether the producer of this movie should be glad Shirley Jackson no longer walk this earth or whether they should ... BE SORRY ( if ya get my drift ! ! ! The hauntings she could envision are not something to be trifled with ! ! ! ) . In conclusion , let me just leave you with some word from the original Luke ( appropriate substitution of the word `` house '' for `` movie '' ! ) : `` This 'movie ' should be burnt to the ground , and the ground sprinkled with salt ! '' My favorite movie of all time remains so . No competition from this one .

As a fan of Wm . Faulkner since college , I wa especially pleased to see Intruder In the Dust and for other reason . My grandfather , also named Clarence Brown a wa the director , grew up in the Oxford area having been born near there in 1888 . We attended a week long family reunion at Oxford in July , 1964 a mere 15 year after filming the movie . It still looked mostly like it doe in the film but wa going thru a period of civil right upheaval then a the site of Ole Miss . My recollection is of it being a nice little college town that summer but I wa just an 18 year old college sophomore and white . I wa just then beginning to see the injustice of segregation and prejudice but still had a long way to go . Anyhow , the movie is well worth watching but the filmmaker must have had to walk a tight rope to get it done there and I would love to know more about that story . Now day , Oxford is a larger , more modern college town with all the ill that go along with such thing and I hope to return again to see how it must have changed socially in the last 40 plus year . Juano Hernandez should certainly have been nominated for an Oscar that year but Hollywood wa still to bigoted itself to let that happen . Other Faulkner story have been filmed so look for them and compare . One of the best wa a PBS treatment of The Barn Burner from about 1985 or so starring Tommy Lee Jones . It really captured the intensity of rural Southern white that Faulkner wrote so incisively about so often .

I just caught `` Farewell to the King '' on cable , and maybe it 's just because I 'm a girl , but I thought this wa on the craptastic side . The script and direction are pretentious ( once I found out John Milius wa responsible , it all became clear ) . The supporting actor actually were n't bad - James Fox wa outstanding . The biggest disappointment wa Nick Nolte , who I usually enjoy . Once he go native , he start speaking a very stiff , stilted English , and half the time , he seems kind of distracted , a if he 'd just smoked some of the bounty of Borneo 's rain forest . And then the end -- what the ? ? ? Learoyd just happens to be on the same boat a The Botanist ( by the way , had the Botanist dumped the girlfriend , or what ? ) ? ? ? The boat just happens to run aground conveniently close to an island ripe takeover by a crazy Anglo ex-headhunting Army deserter ? ?

A great suspense movie with terrific slow camera-work adding to the dramatics make this a treat to watch and enjoy . Director-writer Brian de Palma doe a super Hitchcock-imitation ( many called it a `` ripoff '' ) with this film and the 2.35:1 widescreen DVD is a must to fully appreciate the camera-work ( and several scene with people hiding on each side which are lost on formatted-for-TV tape ) . The downside of the movie , at least to anyone that ha some kind of moral standard , is the general sleaziness of all the character , including the policeman played by a pre-NYPD Dennis Franz ( who ha hair here ! ) . The opening scene is still shocking with a fairly long shower scene of Angie Dickinson that is quite explicit , even 25 year after it release . The film ha several erotic scene in it a Dickinson ( if that is really her on the closeup ) and Nancy Allen are not shy about showing their body . There is not much dialog in the first 20 minute and no bad language until Franz enters the picture after the murder . The first 36 minute are riveting and even though it 's apparent who the killer is , it 's still very good suspense and fun to watch all the way through , particularly for male ogling the naked woman .

Choose your fate : The terrible tyke of the fourth form , playing practical joke that involve ax , or the ... ummm ... well-developed girl of the sixth form , who discovered some time ago cigarette , gin , sex and how easily men can be led astray . The problem is that one set come with the other . They are all there at St. Trinian 's , that remarkably easy-going English school for girl led by headmistress Millicent Fritton ( Alastair Sim ) . As Miss Fritton is fond of pointing out , `` In other school girl are sent out quite unprepared into a merciless world , but when our girl leave here , it is the merciless world which ha to be prepared . '' Miss Fritton sound something like a melding of Julia Child and Eleanor Roosevelt , and definitely ha Sim 's droll and deadpan comic gene . In The Belles of St. Trinian 's , a sly , chaotic comedy from the team of Frank Launder and Sidney Gilliat , St. Trinian 's is , a usual , on the brink of financial disaster . Salvation may be at hand , however , when a rich sheik sends his daughter to join the fourth form and receive a proper English education . The sheik also is a horse owner and one of his prize racer , Arab Boy , is being trained near the school for a race . It 's only a matter of time before the fourth- form girl form a racing pool and bet heavily on Arab Boy , with Miss Fritton adding to the pool what fund the school ha left . ( Much of the fourth-form girl 's money come from the gin they make in chemistry , then bottle and lower by rope to Flash Harry ( George Cole ) , a Cockney fixer , for distribution . `` It 's got something ... I do n't know quite what , '' say Miss Fritton on sampling the stuff , `` but send a few bottle up to my room . '' ) Miss Fritton , however , ha a brother , Clarence Fritton ( who , by some coincidence of casting , also is Alastair Sim ) , a bookmaker who not only ha placed a bundle on another horse , but who also ha a daughter . And he ha placed the precocious Arabella in the sixth form to keep him informed . Soon the sixth form ha kidnapped Arab Boy , the fourth form ha taken the horse back , Flash Harry ha joined force with Miss Fritton , the sixth-form girl are determined that Arab Boy will not leave the second floor of St. Trinian 's , Clarence and his Homburg-wearing gang have arrived , parent are driving up for Parent 's Day and the Ministry of Education ha arrived in the person of a very proper inspector . Total war break out at St. Trinian 's . It 's hard to say which is more dangerous , the African spear or the flour bomb . Alastair Sim a Millicent Fritton turn in a tour de force performance . Miss Fritton is a tall woman with a stately bosom , fond of long gown with embroidered lace and Edwardian hat with lot of feather . She take everything in stride , even a fourth-former pounding at something in chemistry class and , after hearing an explosion a few minute later , the result . `` Oh dear . I told Bessie to be careful with that nitro-glycerine ! '' She is firm in believing that St. Trinian 's is `` a gay arcadia of happy girl . '' Sim wa one of Britain 's great eccentric actor . Other than the sheer chaos of all the little ( and not so little ) girl doing terrible thing , he delivers much of the film 's pleasure .

This movie wa absolutely wonderful . The pre-partition time and culture ha been recreated beautifully . Urmila ha given yet another brilliant performance . What I truly admire about this movie is that it doe n't resort to Pakistan-bashing that is running rampant in movie like Gadar and LOC . With the partition a a backdrop , the movie doe not divert to political issue or focus on violence or what is right and wrong . The movie always center around the tragic story of Urmila 's life . Her fragile relationship with Manoj Bajpai ha been depicted excellently . The movie actually show how the people , both Hindus and Muslims , have suffered from this partition . The theme that there is only one religion is truly prevalent in this film .

A terrible amateur movie director ( no , not Todd Sheets ) , his new friend and sister explore a cave . The friend and sister fall in and get rescued . Meanwhile a gang of horribly acted girl are defending their 'turf ' . Whatever the heck that mean . This film and I use the term VERY loosely is so bad that it 's .. well bad . The humor is painfully unfunny , the `` action '' merely sad . Now I 've seen some atrociously awful 'horror ' film in my time & failed to grow jaded in my approach to watching low-budget film , yet I still weep openly for anyone who choose to sit through this . ONLY for the most hardened maschocists amongst you . but the rest run away FAST ! ! My Grade : F

This movie could have been a lot better than it wa , if had n't been a Disney Film . I thought that the young girl playing Shirley wa all right , you could tell that she wa really trying to do the job right . The teenage Shirley Temple wa n't right at all . I think that they should have spent last time on her childhood , the first hour should have been about the young Shirley , then the last hour should have been about the older Shirley . This wa a boring movie , and not a good Shirley Temple story .

I 'm surprised that no one yet ha mentioned that there are two version of this same film . The lion 's share of the footage in both is identical , but here is where they differ : In one version ( the version I have seen most often on broadcast TV ) , the group of cleric guarding the gateway consists of the `` Brotherhood of the Protectors '' , a ( fictional ) splinter group of priest and brother `` excommunicated '' by the Church . In the other version , which I 've seen only once on TV , the cleric guarding the gateway are depicted a priest of the official Church , meaning the Archdiocese of New York ( or perhaps Brooklyn ) . Also , in the former version , in most of the pertinent scene , the cleric are referred to a `` brother '' ( and in some scene , you can see where the lip say `` Father '' so-and-so but the dubbed audio say `` Brother '' so-and-so . In the latter version , I believe everyone is referred to a `` Father '' . In any event , it seems that one of these two version is more or le a partial re-shooting of the other , with all `` Brotherhood of the Protector '' scene re-shot a `` Archdiocese '' scene , or vice versa . ( Kind of reminds me of the Raymond Burr cutaway scene in `` Godzilla '' ) . I have videotaped both version off broadcast TV , so no , I 'm not imagining this . Can anyone shed some more light on the story behind these two version of the film ?

There is a DVD published in the UK in 2002 Code HRGD002 on the cover , no ASIN , VFC 19796 on the disk , no IFPI code in the inner rim . Probably a straight transfer from VHS . There is no much point is commenting an adult film . But this one contains a minimal plot , and the character are believable . It wa shown in the United States in normal cinema . I 've seen it In Pensylvannia way back in 1975 . As such it deserves a place in an Encyclopedia of Movies . The DVD ha no special feature and no subtitle , and wa probably made using a VHS tape a source

Do n't watch this film while , or soon after , eating . Having said that , Begotten will stick with you for the rest of your life , like it or not . Based on the nihilistic philosophy that life is nothing more than man spasming above ground ( to paraphrase the title sequence/introduction ) , this will more than likely contain the most intense and grisly imagery you 'll ever see in a film . There is no dialogue , only image after image describing the cycle of life . The film 's combination of stark black and white photography compounded with some truly creepy background sound work to drive home the maker 's message . The movie begin with God ( portrayed a a bandaged and obviously insane man ) slicing open his torso with a straight razor and subsequently dying in his own filth . After his death , Mother Nature emerges from his corpse to impregnate herself with his blood and semen and give birth to Man , represented by a maggot of a human convulsing on the earth . The landscape is a barren waste , populated by hulking shrouded humanoid who eventually happen upon Mother Nature and Man . After a slew of violent scene depicting the rape of Nature and destruction of Man , these humanoid proceed to pound the remains of the corps back into the ground , and the cycle of life begin anew . I actually rented this from Blockbuster one night , based on the cover art and hype content , but this is definitely not a Blockbuster-type film . Do n't expect narrative , dialogue or any pulled punch . This is intense imagery based on a dark subject . I give this movie some high mark for the filmwork and audio , but I do n't think I 'll be watching it too often , if again . I like my movie dark and unique , but this one is exponentially more than I expected .

This cheapo exploitation flick is some genuinely insipid stuff , courtesy of spaghetti land director Lamberto Bava , who wisely left his name off this junk . The basic crux of this outing concern the discovery of some brutally mutilated individual being washed-up on shore in the Caribbean . Authorities initially believe them to be victim of shark attack , but a the investigation unravels , turn out to be something much more sinister . All of this ultimately amount to very little however , we have here - poor dubbing complimented by similarly weak script , which often consists of nonsensical jabbering , and is really of little consequence for the most part . Acting can only be described a sub-par , which is par for the course in this instance . Truly lax direction doe n't help thing either . Special effect mainly is for numerous close-ups of various gory body missing limb , and so forth . Of course , there is the obligatory creature which periodically emerges at feeding time , which look something like a big monster octopus thing , where it animation only consists of it pointed teeth ascending and descending in rhythmic articulation . Overall , the end result is none too convincing , sure , but admittedly is almost entertaining in a cheesy kind of fashion . It seems what the film maker were going for wa a sort of low-rent hybrid of Jaws and Piranha , but the final product is just a bloody shamble , much like the corps incessantly shown throughout this picture . I find it difficult to think of any redeeming attribute to warrant viewing this , so moreover , strictly for incurable monster movie addict .

Walt Disney 's 20th animated feature wa the last one to be greenlighted by the great man himself ( he died in late 1966 ) and is not generally considered to be among their very best output . The main problem is that , on the surface , the film seems merely to be the feline version of either LADY AND THE TRAMP ( 1955 ) or 101 DALMATIONS ( 1961 ) both of which are certainly more beloved by fan Even so , being both an animation and cat lover , I dug this reasonably bouncy concoction in which a pampered female cat ( voiced by Eva Gabor ) and her three little kitten are thrown out onto the street of Paris by a wealthy lady ( Hermione Baddeley ) 's greedy butler . Luckily , they meet a streetwise alley cat ( Phil Harris ) who guide them on the journey back and are further aided along the way by a feline jazz band ( led by Scatman Crothers ) and two helpful and amiably dopey dog ; meanwhile at home , Edgar the butler celebrates his supposed inheritance and the mouse and the horse do their bit to help their fellow feline pet . Legendary entertainer Maurice Chevalier wa whisked back from retirement to sing the title song ( which includes a verse in French ) and Scatman 's band indulge in a breezy number `` Ev'rybody Wants To Be A Cat '' .

I first saw this movie at a video store and , being the Bam Margera fan I am , had to rent it to see what it wa all about . Since I have a huge and stupid ( note the word stupid ) sense of humor , I found this movie absolutely hilarious . Some of the part are pointless and random , but that 's what make them so amusing . You 'll need to think thing like getting slapped in the face and bashed on the head with a watermelon are funny in order to appreciate this movie . I wa really impressed . I wa also surprised at the acting . These people actually did a good job . Nothing Oscar worthy , but well enough to get past the amateur level . Teens and young adult would probably find this more entertaining because of the modern slang and situation used . I would n't suggest watching this with your parent and vice versa . All in all , the acting wa great , the script wa hilarious , and the story is really something you can relate to .

Citizen Kane .... The Godfather Part II .... D'Urville Martin 's Dolemite . This is the single greatest piece of celluloid ever created and unleashed upon humanity . Rudy Ray Moore , in a role that transcends Academy Awards star a Dolemite , the baddest cat in the universe . He clearly doe not take any jive from no turkey ( I myself am unfortunately a turkey ) and prof it with his power of rapping , pimping , and karate chopping . This is blaxploitation at it absolute finest , a shining example of the genre with it low budget , continuity error , and hatred for rat-soup eating honkey expletive expletive . The true Godfather of Rap ( not this new Ali nonsense ) Moore is something of a juxtaposition of acting technique ; somehow managing to be the most charismatic awful actor of the 1970 's , and thats saying something . This one is HIGHLY recommended folk , if not for the one-liner alone .

OK. On the whole , this three part documentary will bring most interested people up to date with going 's on in the world of physic , and the last 300 year of discovery of our universe . If you have read Stephen Hawkings brilliant book `` A Brief History of Time '' and understood it then you might benefit from the visual description of certain concept .. which i did to a certain extent . Greene is bearable , but obviously for the sake of the mass , tends to explain thing in a slighty patronising way . This is of course deliberate and will be perfect for almost everyone who watch this series . The guest scientist were good . ( no Hawking , but i suppose he ha his own DVD ( s ) ) I kept waiting for him to appear but they rotate through the same one for almost 3 part ... ( very American weighted here , with a few Brits and one antipodean ) I bought the Nova 2 Disc edition ( NTSC ) and there were a few inclusion that really detracted from the overall experience . 1 . The `` this is brought to you by .. '' at the start of EACH part wa a necessary evil for the first part , but seeing it 2 more time before It wa over wa very ordinary . 2 . Ca n't be helped I suppose but there is quite a bit of overlap at the start of 2 and 3 which had me reaching for the FFW button a few time . 3 . This disc set wa straight from TV .. ( ie ad , what happen last show for those that missed it , and frequent `` goto pbs.org for more .... '' ) appearing throughout the presentation . ( quite unlike BBC material which is unmatched for presentation .. Planets , The Blue Planet , etc ) My 7/10 is based on content alone . The niggles were there but I got over them . If this had have been done with that classic British accented presenter ( you know the one ) it would be a perfect Disc set in my opinion . If you have seen this and want more ... then I highly recommend Hawkings book `` a Brief History of Time '' ... I wish it wa a movie too . Happy viewing .

Some unsuspecting film carry a message that resonates in the hour and day after viewing . Such is the case for CAROL 'S JOURNEY ( EL VIAJE DE CAROL ) , a beautifully crafted 2002 film from Spain based on the novel ' A boca de noche ' by Ángel García Roldán who also adapted the book a a screenplay . War and it consequence are not new subject matter for film , but when that war theme play in the background a a subtle driving force to develop character ( especially child ) who must face adult life influenced by the game of adult , the result is a different and more tender examination of the coming of age film genre . Carol ( Clara Lago ) is a 12-year-old Spanish American youngster from New York who with her critically ill mother Aurora ( María Barranco ) return to her Aurora 's home in 1938 at the height of the Spanish Civil War , a home that ha been left deserted by her father Don Amalio ( Álvaro de Luna ) since his wife 's death . Carol 's father Robert ( Ben Temple ) is a fighter pilot who ha sided with the Republicans against Franco and is rarely with his family . Aurora ha a past : she left her lover Alfonso ( Alberto Jiménez ) to marry Robert , and Alfonso in turn married Aurora 's cold sister Dolores ( Lucina Gil ) . Carol is an independent girl who remains aloof to all but her grandfather Don Amalio until she meet others her age but not of her 'class ' : Tomiche ( Juan José Ballesta ) and his two friend at first resent Carol , but a event develop Carol and Tomiche are bonded by what feel like the first awakening of love . When Aurora dy of her illness , Carol must live with Alfonso and Dolores and their daughter Blanca ( Luna McGill ) , yet turn to her grandfather for support and to her mother 's best friend and teacher Maruja ( the always radiant Rosa Maria Sardà ) to understand the disparity between class and the senseless war that keep her beloved father from her side . Through a series of incident Carol and Tomiche learn the rigor of becoming adult , facing more trauma in a brief period of the war than most of u experience in a lifetime . The ending , though sad , is uplifting a Carol 's journey to maturity is complete . The film is shot in Galicia and Portugal and contains some extraordinarily beautiful setting captured with gentle sensitive lighting by cinematographer Gonzalo F. Berridi and enhanced by the musical score by Bingen Mendizábal . Director Imanol Uribe understands the fine line separating pathos from bathos , and in electing to concentrate the story on the child involved , he make an even stronger statement about the futility and cruelty of war . The cast is exceptional : the star clearly are young Clara Lago and Juan José Ballesta , but they are supported by the fine veteran actor in the adult role . This is a visually stunning work with a lasting message and should find a much larger audience than it ha to this date . Grady Harp

ROAD TO PERDITION can be summed up by Thomas Newman 's score . It 's haunting and beautiful but you 're aware that this music is similar to Newman 's other work and while listening to the soundtrack you 're reminded of SCENT OF A WOMAN , MEETING JOE BLACK and THE SHAWSHANK REDEMPTION you 're reminded of other film a the story unfolds on screen . As the Sullivans drive round America trying to escape from a psychotic hit man you think of THE GETAWAY , Irish gangster is MILLER 'S CROSSING whilst the subtext of guilt and redemption can be summed up by Coppola and Leone 's gangster epic . Despite having a seen it all before feel this should n't be taken a a heavy criticism of Sam Mendes film which I repeat is haunting and beautiful and the only flaw that work against it is a very slow opening twenty minute and I wa slightly confused a the event that caused Michael Sullivan to be betrayed . But if you stop to consider how much of a sentimental mess Spielberg might have made with the story that revolves around a father and his twelve year old son running for their life you ca n't help thinking what a superb director Mendes is ROAD TO PERDITION is a film where the entire cast give flawless performance . I 've never been all that keen on Tom Hanks but he 's every bit a good here a he ha been in any starring role , probably better . Paul Newman play a character with an Irish accent but at no point did I believe I wa watching an American screen legend putting on a false accent - Newman 's performance work due to the subtle body language , his character is torn up by guilt but Newman never milk it or go over the top . While never upstaging Newman who give the best performance in the movie the two Brit supporting actor Craig and Law are also very memorable a American gangster and while Law will still have a long career a a leading actor one wonder how Daniel Craig might have progressed a a character actor if he had n't decided to become James Bond , a role which herald the end of an actor career

The most important thing about this movie is the brilliant performance by Daniel Day-Lewis and Hugh O'Conor a Christy Brown , guinea artist and fighter who despite of her physical condition overcame all the odds . As a person who did work with patient with cerebral palsy , I can assure you that their performance were shockingly convincing . The enormous support that Christy got form his family , low-income , working class Dubliners , encouraged him to do the impossible and this picture depicted this support brilliantly have not read the book , but the dialog were written wisely to capture Christy Brown 's witty arrogant personality . I do recommend this movie to everyone , especially to classic movie-lovers .

I buy or at least watch every Seagall movie . He came out with a handful of good movie then descending into poor story , bad camera work and a walk-thru persona , he nearly lost me . A few movie ago he remembered how to make a decent movie . Now he 's forgotten again . This film is seriously dark ( on any level you care to name ) . There is a lot of slash & gash going on here with no discernible purpose unless it 's meant a a warning against the military . Seagall may have had a stand-in for many of his scene a it wa often too dark to tell and someone else 's voice wa used most of the time . Sadly the only interesting character wa the bad guy who killed his guard to escape custody & then proceeded to raise havoc all over the place . Okay since when do we place an armed guard in the holding room with a prisoner ? Anyway this bad guy wa at least colorful , and very focused . There 's lot of gore if you like that king of thing . It looked to me like the bad guy tore the same gash every time . I 'm just glad they did n't suck the blood from their hapless victim . I harken you back to my summary . Basically it is a horror movie disguised a an action film.Dec 6,2006

I recently saw this film at a 3-D film festival in Hollywood . It wa in polarized 3-D ( Gray glass not red & blue ) It wa so much fun to watch this film with an audience , the print wa excellent and the 3-D perfect . The performance were over the top and that added to the fun , the surprise ending ( that we are n't supposed to share with fellow movie go'ers , at least according to the movie trailer and poster ) had people howling with laughter . By today 's standard this is probably more comedy than horror but with the added dimension of 3-D ( complete with cobweb and bat coming out of the screen ) this film wa an entertaining romp into 50 's horror .

Michael Stearns play Mike , a sexually frustrated individual with an interesting moral attitude towards sexuality . He ha no problem ogling naked dancer but when woman start having sex with men that 's when he loses it . He belief that when woman actually have sex that 's when they lose any sense of `` innocence '' and/or `` beauty '' . So he stroll through the Hollywood Hills stalking lovemaking couple at a distance , ultimately shooting the men dead with a high-powered rifle with a scope . The seeming primary reason for this movie 's existence is to indulge in sexual activity over and over again . The `` story '' come off a more of an afterthought . This is bound to make many a happily heterosexual male quite pleased a we 're treated to enough protracted scene of nudity ( the lady here look awfully good sans clothes ) and sex to serve a a major dose of titillation . Of course , seeing a fair deal of it through a scope ups the creepiness factor considerably and illustrates the compulsion towards voyeurism . ( For one thing , Mike eye the couple through the scope for minute at a time before finally pulling the trigger . ) This is all underscored by awfully intrusive if somewhat atmospheric music on the soundtrack . Those with a penchant for lurid trash are bound to enjoy this to one degree or another . It even includes one lesbian tryst that confounds Mike and render him uncertain * how * to react . It unfolds at a very slow pace , but wrap up with a most amusing ironic twist . It 's a kinky and twisted rarity that if nothing else is going to definitely keep some viewer glued to the screen . 7/10

I saw this film a a kid about 30 year ago , and I have n't forgotten it to this day . I could n't say whether it 's a good picture . But in those day I instantly fell in love with Jean Simmons . The memory concentrate on the very erotic feel of the movie , but I still remember the plot . Simmons wa very young then , and there is another film that gave me the same feeling : David Lean 's GREAT EXPECTATIONS . And again it wa the young Jean Simmons . It 's a pity that BLUE LAGOON is not available on video ; I 'd like to correct my memory ...

Feels like an impressionistic film ; if there is such a thing . The story is well told , very poetic . the character well developed and well acted by the interpreter ( or interpreted by the actor : ) ) . The film delight in it own sumptuous emotion at time and work well , unless you hate such emotion in movie - not so in my case . It 's a very humanistic film . The landscape and even the extraordinary situation of the displaced cook are very poetic in their own right . Well done . A good classic for any good film collection .

Oh , how I laughed during those first couple of scene . This silly little film about an 11 year-old who carry a gun , steal car , robs store , burglar house , extorts money from other kid , burn house , shoot rat , buy drug , distributes drug to his mother and his friend , and then kill a guy . What a great comedy ! But it wa n't intended to be a comedy . It wa intended a a social drama . How can this be ? The event in this film are absurd and ridiculous . The character are all stereotype right out of a 4 year-old 's comic-strip-induced immature imagination . The dialog is laughable ; people talk like moron . It 's a very dumb film . The first scene are indeed very funny , for all the wrong reason . But the unintentional hilarity of the idiotic premise run out after a short while , and after that the laugh come only rarely ; by that time the viewer ca n't believe what he is seeing and is alternately amazed and bored by what follows ( if he ha at least half a brain cell ) . A short film , but feel like an eternity . The film actually IS a seriously-intended attempt to show the world of a young degenerate , while imitating movie vastly superior to it , like `` Fun '' . There is just such an air of phoniness about everything ; the kid , the adult , everyone lack credibility both in their action and dialog . The kid in the lead mug his way through the film a though he had seen all the Jimmy Cagney movie at least a hundred time . And , typically enough , the kid is n't portrayed a a reservoir of evil , but , instead , a a misunderstood little artistic talent . But of course . Every young hooligan is misunderstood - society made him bad . Poor child . The film is embarrassing ; a collection of stale , occasionally hilarious clichés put together to make a movie that lack intelligence and meaning . The intellectual level of the film is zero .

Lackawanna Blues is a drama through and through . It detail the life of a strong woman by the name of Rachel Crosby ( S. Epatha Merkerson ) . Rachel is referred to a Nanny by all who know her , but she could have just a easily been called Wonder Woman . She epitomized strength , will power , confidence and resolve . She owned a home that she used to house just about every type of person that society would reject . Her tenant consisted of a lesbian , a psychotic war veteran , an amputee , and a host of other vagrant that made the home mile away from ordinary . Each successive event Rachel took in stride and handled flawlessly . She wa n't a dictator devoid of compassion , but in fact she wa quite the opposite . She displayed compassion almost to a fault by giving shelter and refuge to so many that she seemed to over-extend herself . Merkerson did a good job , but I believe this role wa right up her alley anyway . The movie had an even keel never straying from Rachel . There were of course dramatic moment but they were to be expected . Nothing wa ever to shocking or profound other than Rachel herself .

San Francisco is a big city with great acting credit . In this one , the filmmaker made no attempt to use the city . They did n't even manage the most basic of realistic detail . So I would not recommend it to anyone on the basis of being a San Francisco movie . You will not be thinking `` oh , I 've been there , '' you will be thinking `` how did a two story firetrap/stinky armpit turn into a quiet hotel lobby ? '' Some of the lead used East Coast speech style and affectation . It detracts , but the acting wa always competent . The story seemed to be shot in three distinct style , at least in the beginning . The Chinatown story wa the most effective and interesting . The plot is weak , ripped scene for scene from classy Hong Kong action movie . The original had a lot more tension and emotional resonance , they were framed and paced better . But the acting is fun and we get to see James Hong and other luminary . The white boy intro wa pointless . I think the filmmaker did n't know what to do with it , so they left it loosely structured and cut it down . The father is an odd attempt at a Berkeley liberal - really , folk , everyone know it 's not `` groovy '' to live in the ghetto - but his segment are the most humorous . They threw away some good opportunity . Educated and embittered on the West Coast , a yuppie jerk here is a different kind of yuppie jerk than they make in New York . They are equally intolerable but always distinguishable . That would have been interesting ; this wa not . The Hunter 's Point intro wa the most disappointing . It wa the most derivative of the three , and stylistically the most distant from San Francisco . You 've seen it done before and you 've seen it done better . Even the video game wa better ! Despite the generic non-locality and aimless script , these character have potential , the actor have talent , and something interesting start to force it way around the clumsy direction ... about ten minute before the ending . Good concept placed in the wrong hand . PS , there is a missing minority here , see if you can guess which one .

No Holds Barred is that movie that when you were nine or ten wa the coolest movie this side of arnold schwarzenegger . But then when you grow up and watch it you feel embarrassed that you were so gullible to have liked it . You feel cheated , embarrassed , and stupid . If you have a little brother and you show him this and he tell you it 's gay , give him a high five and take him to the strip bar for his eleventh birthday .

This movie stink majorly . The only reason I gave it a 3 wa because the graphic were semi charming . It 's total disregard for a plot and the lack of even insubstantial surface character development made it seem like just a bunch of nice drawing . This is by far THE worse anime that came out of Japan . I ca n't believe they actually put their name on this garbage . What a rip off selling this thing for $ 20 . If you have n't seen this do n't bother . If you have , I pity you .

This is probably one of the best Portuguese movie I ever saw ... I absolutely enjoyed the plot , because by the way the story wa developing , you would get more involved on how their world wa really upside-down ... There is just only one part that doe n't really seem to fit in the movie , which is the girl ' strip ... It doe not add anything important to the story , it look like it 's just there for a men entertaining purpose . The ending is a bit unexpected , though , at the same time , somewhat expected . If you do n't understand , then follow me : after so many strange occurrence , the viewer is so used to oddity , that ending the movie with totally unexpected relationship ( Like Mimoso and Susana ) sound totally natural after seeing the rest of the movie . But , most of all , Sorte Nula is a movie that make you think hard trying to solve the mysterious occourings , laugh your head off with their unlucky life and mess with your perception of what can happen in just a few minute , when you turn your back away from something ... for all that , I rate it 8/10

Considering the big name cast and lavish production I expected a lot more of this film . The acting for the most part is great , although the story they have to work with is mediocre at best . However the film still warrant watching because of the acting and the star and some and up and coming young talent .
Hated it with all my being . Worst movie ever . Mentally- scarred . Help me . It wa that bad.TRUST ME ! ! !

There are two kind of 1950s musical . First you have the glossy MGM production with big name and great music . And then you have the minor league with a le famous cast , le famous music and second rate director . 'The Girl Ca n't Help It ' belongs to the latter category . Neither Tom Ewell or Edmond O'Brien became famous and Jayne Mansfield wa famous for her ... well , never mind . Seems like every decade ha it share of Bo Dereks or Pamela Andersons . The plot itself is thin a a razorblade and one ca n't help suspect that it is mostly an attempt to sell record for Fats Domino , Little Richard or others of the 1950s rock act that appear in the movie . If that music appeal to you this is worth watching . If not , do n't bother .

This show is wonderful . It ha some of the best writing I ever seen . It ha brilliant directing by Dvid Trainer who also directed another smart television series called BOY MEETS WORLD . This show is with out a dought one of the greatest . Like THREE 'S COMPANY , ROSEANNE , and the famous COSBY SHOW this will be on television for a long time to come . From it 's perfectly crafted joke to the great performance you would only dream of this is a wonderful show for people who lived in the seventy and the people who did n't . This show appeal to the young and the young at heart . A perfect show .

Okay people , I have to agree with almost everyone else 's review here . The character . Are . Stupid . They 're ALL stereotypical , and yet have nice clothes and are always skinny . Do n't even get me started on Jamie Lynn 's role a ZOEY . Zoey is a pretty , popular , tan , blonde young teen who everyone just LOVES ! She ha a `` rebellious '' , great , personality that everyone agrees with no matter how dumb or extreme it is . Most annoying of all : her voice is so darn bubbly and obnoxious . `` OMG ! '' Take for example the first episode . The moment she step onto the huge PCA campus , everyone seems to love her . The boy want to ask her out , the girl want to be her friend , etc . Thinking she 's all that , the episode play out with Zoey always being the center of attention ; she is the so-called best player of the unofficial girl basketball team , confident , and ha everyone pity her when she weakly get hit in the face . Oh boo-hoo . My favorite character by far is this whole series is a girl that appears much later into the show , Lauren or something , who is the ONLY person ever introduced in the show to hate Zoey . And Zoey doe n't even seem to be very loyal to her friend sometimes . In one episode she even call her friend a freak without EVER apologizing and doe n't show the least bit regret in doing so . Zoey is ALWAYS the best : -Desiging professional T-shirts and backpack ( which become a big hit ) -coming up with VERY elaborate scheme BY HERSELF to teach a single person a lesson . -Flawless grade -Taking the blame for stuff that wa n't even related to her just so everyone else could be happy . -Coming up with a commercial that wa so good it wa put on TV . The list go on and on ... Ugh . She ha no acting talent . She 's always the perfect person . She act snotty and rebellious and preppy and ... UGH ! Ca n't stand her . Not only that , but everyone in the show always ha great clothes . EVEN THE NERD ! Her wardrobe is better than mine , and mine is pretty freaking decent . No one care if everyone at PCA love you , Zoey , and would do anything for you , even if it meant giving their right arm . BUT regardless of these cardboard character , the plot are creative . Not everyday thing . They 're interesting and amusing . The humor is usually good-natured and fun , but the character are so paper flat that it 's hard to enjoy it . This show would be really good if Dan Schnieder put a bit more time thinking of the type of character he wanted , because they are so typical , so boring that 's it 's lame and stupid . Point : No one 's the least bit overweight , everyone ha stylish clothes , Zoey is the definition of Mary-sue , the story line are well-thought out , and the humor is laughable . But again , I want to emphasize that the character taint the show . Watch the show if you must , but do n't say I did n't warn you if your eye start to bleed .

If Alien , Jurassic Park and countless other sci fi horror movie are your cup of tea , add a lot of sugar and you 'll get this one down . The film begin in jolly old England around 1100ad and then jump to present day California . Our hero Carver ( Dean Cain ) is the new Security Chief and Military Advisor for a Science Lab 400 foot underground . He arrives ( Carver is also a helicopter pilot ) with the lead Scientist and we soon find out it 's a cloning lab and they have something newly found to clone . Is it a Dinosaur or what ? As with the above movie , all hell break loose and our character start getting picked off . The special effect on the Monster are pretty good for a `` direct to video '' movie and Dean Cain doe what he get paid for . But forget the rest of the group a we find out why we have never seen them before . Again , do n't go in with high expectation and you 'll be ok .

I 'd like to think myself a a fairly open minded guy and it take a lot ( ! ) for me to dislike a movie but this one is without a doubt one of the suckiest , crappiest movie I 've ever seen ! I have no idea what 's wrong with the people who gave it such a good rating here ( imdb is usually pretty reliable when it come to rating ) ... the only thing I can imagine is that people must 've voted during one or more condition : 1 . While being shitfaced / stoned out of their mind 2 . They 've received hard cash for the vote 3 . Under gunpoint I ca n't believe I wasted a good 1 h 45 min of my life for this pathetic excuse for a movie .

If you want to watch a movie and feel good about watching it , then Tigerland is the film for you . I love this movie from top to bottom . This movie 's picture-perfect scene look so real ; it 's almost like a documentary of something that happened in real life but with drama . Boy , I tell you ... REAL drama they actually real `` fought '' in one of the scene ( get the DVD listen to the commentary it not obvious ) . I see this film a a bunch of desperate young men trying to escape an ill-fated destiny , after watching Saving Private Ryan I have an a appreciation of what an `` ill-fated destiny '' is and know exactly how the men in the film feel . I see this movie a a crossbreed between `` Stand By Me '' and `` Saving Private Ryan . '' What do men do when they are with a situation that 's `` hard pressed '' in real life ? Some men go crazy , some men cry , some men through fist , others do drug , some randomly sleep with hooker ruthlessly trying to eradicate the meaning of love from their life , some try drink the pain away , some jump off building or bridge , some feel guilty and others feel so much agony it make them so sick they collapse - physically . This movie ha all those desperate emotion rolled into one ball . But do n't get me wrong it not depressing movie , it realistic , it a very very humorous movie , the cocky and funny Bozz ( Collin 's Character ) light it all up , and on top of that there are about 5 female actress in the movie ; I 'll let you figure out what their in there for ! With dialogue , war/action sequence , picture perfect scene along with appropriate music ; this movie ha it all , like I said : from top to bottom . I do n't why Tigerland is heavily under-credited . The best thing about owning the movie is that on the cover it say in big bold writing `` The best film of the year , '' and it absolutely fall nothing short of that . Keep the rare gem coming Hollywood , 10/10 .

This is one particular Stooge short that actually us satire in conjunction with slapstick , a rarity . As mentioned , the title and concept for this short wa `` borrowed '' from a feature film from the same year with Clark Gable called `` Men In White '' . It 's basically about the trial and tribulation of intern and their sacred cause for `` duty and humanity '' . I saw this recently and almost treated it like the Stooge version because it doe take itself a little too seriously . In any case , `` Men In Black '' is so well written , directed and not to mention original , it did n't borrow a thing from Chaplin or any of the others , that the Motion Picture Academy nominated it for an award a the best short comedy of 1934 . Some stinky short called `` La Cucaracha '' outdid it though and stole the award . Some producer 's brother in law must have been on the Academy 's voting board . `` Men In Black '' poke fun at the whole concept of the medical profession much in the same way that the Marx Bros. always did at this time . May not be a fair comparison but I can see the Marx Bros. in this short . In fact in their feature `` A Day At The Races '' , there is a scene where there 's `` medical thing '' going on and they cause anarchy a usual . My guess that this particular short wa judged along those line and hence why it wa nominated in the first place . Try this in fact : watch this short first and then watch `` Duck Soup '' or `` Day at the Races '' with the Marxes and then see if there is n't the same great quality of comedy .

I can name only a few movie that I have seen which were this bad . This movie ha terrible everything : The dialog is corny and cliché ' , the acting is poor for the most part with a few exception , the cinematography is nothing to cheer about , and the plot is silly ( A fat woman stalk a suburban family because her daughter did n't make the soccer team ) . There is a scene in this film at about the 42 minute mark that is among the worst I have seen in some time . As F. Scott Fitzgerald ( Gregory Peck ) and Sheilah Graham ( Deborah Kerr ) are lounging on the beach , suddenly thing become tense and Sheilah begin to cry -- at which point she tell her lover about her sordid past . This `` dramatic scene '' becomes so terribly overdone and histrionic I could n't help but turn to my wife and exclaim how stupid it all wa ... a dramatic music swelled on the television a it all came to a phony crescendo . NO ONE experience moment like this -- no one . Now how much of the rest of the film is true , I can not say , but this particular moment wa laughably bad and a fake a an $ 8 Rolex -- and lead me to assume that some of the other reviewer were correct -- the film is a lot of bunk . However , I am not an expert on the life of these two people and the internet did n't seem to clear this up , either . Just who were F. Scott Fitzgerald and Sheilah Graham and what wa their relationship really like ? What I do know about Fitzgerald , however , doe seem different from what I saw in the film . Was he the suave and decent man we initially see in the film ? Well , considering he wa married at the same time he wa carrying on with Graham and drank like a fish , I 'd assume he wa n't . Was he a obnoxious and boorish a we later see in the film ? Perhaps , but if he wa this bad AND yet Ms. Graham stayed with him , then this make her out to be a complete dummy -- and not someone you 'd like to see featured in a film . And , if he wa n't , then the film doe a poor disservice to his memory . Either way , it made for a painful and not particularly pleasant viewing experience . The sum total of this film appears to be a tale of two not particularly likable or healthy people . In a dark and salacious way , some might find this all very entertaining , but most are sure to see this a a train wreck with no surprise along the way ! Unpleasant but with glossy production value ( especially the music , which wa lovely but way over the top ) it begs the question `` why did they even choose to make this in the first place ? '' . The bottom line -- it 's a pretty bad film all around and probably not worth your time -- even if , like me , you are big Gregory Peck fan .

This type of plot really doe have a lot of potential , but it wa butchered here . Honestly , I sensed the cheese element in the beginning , but I thought it would get better after the grotesque birthing . Whoa , I wa wrong ! So mad scientist make a monster , want to brag to his old crony before he kill them , but of course they escape . After that , it 's really bad . I should 've counted the time the rubber shark mask peeked out from behind some foliage , but I most likely would have lost count . Pan down to the blood-dripping-from-severed-leg to show u how the shark-man find the folk . I hate being spoon-fed every aspect of a horror film . Oh , and after being nearly killed by a mutated shark-man and trudging around a jungle-esqe island , there 's nothing more cheerful than a middle-aged man reciting Shakespeare ... This is one where you 'll find yourself rooting for the monster ... if you can bear to watch this poor excuse for a flick .

At the end of my review of Cache , I wrote that I wa intrigued with Haneke a a film maker . This is what led me to get the DVD for La Pianiste , which I just finished watching about a half hour ago . It 's all been expressed , here at IMDb and in many of the external review - the gruesomely twisted pathology that would 'create ' an individual like Huppert 's Erika , who is still trying , after year and year , to please her mother , at the expense of everyone and everything else in her life , beginning with her self . She 's repressed everything that would free her from her self-imposed bondage , including , of course , her sexuality , which ha literally imploded , to the point of madness , to where she can no longer even begin to comprehend what a genuine loving impulse would feel like . This is a graphic portrait of a severe emotional cripple , one who never found the strength to get out of her childhood situation and become a functioning adult . I think this subject relates to all of u - we 're all striving for autonomy , but there are need , so many conflicting need , most of which are not even on the conscious level . It also deal brilliantly with the contrast between what one fantasizes about , sexually , and the reality of those fantasy , a well a the consequence of choosing to share one 's sexual fantasy with another human being . Huppert 's character get what she asks for in the course of the film , and it is hardly the emancipating experience she had imagined it to be . Regarding the much-discussed scene in the bathroom : I really appreciated how this sequence had all the possible erotic charge ( for the viewer , I mean ) sucked out of it because of the prior scene , where she put the glass in the girl 's pocket . By the time she 's acting out her let's-see-if-this-guy-is-worthy scenario in the bathroom , we 've already found out that she 's dangerously disturbed and so it 's not a turn on , her little domination session with our poor unsuspecting dupe . I think another incredible achievement of this movie is how , about halfway through it , I completely forgot that it wa not in English and that I wa reading sub-titles . That ha never happened before , in any foreign movie , and I 've seen quite a few . In this film , like Cache , the ending is not all wrapped up in a nice little tidy bow , but unlike Cache , we do at least get some sense of finality , despite the fact that we do not even know for sure whether Huppert 's character is alive or dead . After experiencing La Pianiste , when it come to Michael Haneke , I am , needle to say , more than a trifle intrigued .

The only kudos here is to the art dept and set dresser , they created an interesting look , too bad the writer and director lacked the foresight to do something interesting with that element

Despite all the hoopla about THE TROUBLE WITH TRIBBLES episode , THE BALANCE OF TERROR might just be the best episode of the series . And , while I have always loved A PIECE OF THE ACTION because it is so much fun , I really do have to cast my vote a this Romulan episode a being the very best . The movie , interestingly enough , is really like a WWII submarine movie in that it bounce back and forth between the cloaked Romulan ship and the Enterprise a it seek to destroy the Romulans before they sneak back across the Neutral Zone after a raid on Federation outpost . In so many way , the show is much like the film THE ENEMY BELOW -- where the American Captain ( Robert Mitchum ) and the German Captain ( Curt Jurgens ) are shown in counter-point a they both try to outwit the other -- and in the process develop a grudging respect for their foe . Interestingly enough , only a short bit of the beginning of the episode take place on a planet -- and this is amazing because an episode on board ship could easily have been static and dull . But , because the writing wa so fantastic and the main character written and acted so well ( Shatner and Mark Leonard a the Romulan leader ) . Oddly , for the die-hard Trekkers out there , they 'll recognize Leonard a the same actor who later played Spock 's father . The bottom line is this is simply a great and extremely engaging episode that will keep you on the edge of your seat .

I have to confess that I know some of those involved , I wa in the forerunner to The Planet , Evil Unleased , however this wa more than 10 year ago and I had since lost contact with them . I happened to be watching BBC Scotland News and a piece regarding Scottish Cinema , this mentioned and showed clip from The Planet and comment from it 's director Mark Stirton , this prompted me to order a copy of the film on DVD . Now to the film , the level of acting , writing , directing and sfx is up there with some of the best around , OK it 's not Star Wars but I 've seen many a Hollywood product that is far inferior . It is very strange watching a film spoken in my local North East Scotland accent but that soon passed . ^Mild Spoilers^ The Planet draw on several sci-fi classic ; Star Wars , Alien , Pitch Black , Forbidden Planet and Predator , a handful of the merchant crew of a deep space transport ship survive their craft being attacked and destroyed by unknown ship , they escape onto a deserted desert planet , one by one they are killed by invisible attacker , the ship only passenger , a mysterious prisoner also make it to the planet , a battle ensues a the crew fight to survive . The Planet is a brilliant piece of sci-fi film making that certainly hide it 's limited budget , well done to Mark , Mike and all those involved , I look forward to your next work .

I purchased a DVD of this film for a dollar at the big dept store . That 's probably the best and kindest comment I have to offer on it . At least it did n't cheat me out of the cost of lunch . The problem with `` Chiller '' is Craven 's problem a a director . The man ha his apologist who claim his traveling paper prove he 's a really smart guy and all-around sharp conceptualist . But it 's no secret that , a a director , he ha never possessed one iota of the visual and story-telling sense of a Hitchcock . As vigorously attested by `` Chiller '' , he 's much closer to that legendary flat-foot Hershel Gordon Lewis . What Craven lack a a director is the main ingredient that would lift him from director for hire to a higher plane of film- making . Let 's be specific . The transitional moment of this film are sleek . The establishing shot give it the feel of a quality production . The film look professionally put together , in the way a film shot by a TV commercial director would . ( A thought : The film only visual distinction , these transition that at least look professionally handled may very well be the work of some second unit director . ) It 's the part between the bridge and smooth transition -- the drama -- that fall flat . The core of the proceeding are invariably perfunctorily handled . The critical shot ( after , say , the departing car drive into the well-positioned camera , then we cut to the night exterior of a hospital , then to the waiting area and hallway , then to the phone booth in the corner that will figure in the next bit of action ) are quickly dispensed so we can hurry up and get to the next part . Craven never come anywhere close to exploding the dramatic or visual possibility of any moment . The net result of all this misplaced attention to the least important part , and the fumbling rush to keep thing moving , is a film that feel like the work of the fledgling art student who sharpens all his pencil , fussily adjusts his easel and lighting set-up , grind all his pigment , stretch and prime his canvas ... and then ha nothing to say . Craven , like the art student , never get to the meat of the exercise . For Craven apologist who will point out that this film wa made for TV , I will point to Spielberg 's `` Duel '' and say no more .

Excellent . Gritty and true portrayal of pioneer ranch life on the Western plain with an emphasis on the woman 's role and place . A moving film , lovingly made , and based on real people and their actual experience . Low budget , independent film ; never made any money . Definitely not the romanticized , unrealistic Hollywood version of pioneer life .

I wa taken to this film by a friend and wa sceptical about a Swedish film with subtitle . However , I thoroughly enjoyed every minute of this beautiful film . The unnecessary cruelty that man is capable of wa portrayed confidently without overwhelming image - although animal lover may have to shield their eye for a brief couple of second somewhere during the first 10 minute . A traditional story of humility versus brutality and hope versus tragedy wa illustrated from a satisfyingly fresh angle using a spectrum of character with very natural flaw and feature . I particularly liked how the film managed to address multiple aspect of hypocritical human behaviour that concern bias , discrimination and sanctimonious pretence . An absolute gem of a film that I will promote to all who will listen .

`` Homeward Bound : The Incredible Journey '' is one of those wonderful old movie about house pet . Deserves a place among the great movie of it genre and even the cinema world in general , together with other animal movie like `` Old Yeller '' , `` Napoleon '' , `` Fluke '' and `` Air Bud '' . This mean it is more than just a movie about pet . Can this possibly be just a `` remake '' ? It is too good to be a `` remake '' ! I know this one by heart , since my early teen year ( when I wa 12 ) . It 's a family movie to treasure . It 's emotional , thrilling , adventurous , exciting , entertaining , humorous , charming , sweet , nostalgic , beautiful , heartwarming and sometimes dramatic . It 's one of those movie to put a smile on the face of those who appreciate this kind of film . This movie doe not lack quality . It ha a well thought story , enjoyable character , excellent and relaxing instrumental soundtrack , dazzling sceneries/landscapes of the magnificent Sierra mountain ( in Oregon ) . Speaking of the vista , it 's not all mountain : forest , tree , river , waterfall , sunset ... in conclusion , all of pure nature 's wonder - truly a full panorama . The main human character are nice , well developed and well portrayed by respective actor . Robert Hays is awesome a the kind-hearted dad , Bob Seaver . Kim Greist is good a Laura Burnford . Veronica Lauren is equally good a Hope . Kevin Chevalia is conventional a the youngest and cute brother Jamie ( his appearance actually reminds me very much of Kevin Corcoran in `` Old Yeller '' ) . Benj Thall is great a Peter Burnford . When it come to our quadruped pal , Shadow is my favorite . Shadow is the loyal , wise , mature , beautiful , caring and loving old Golden Retriever ( brilliantly voiced by Don Ameche ) . Chance , the American Bulldog , is the opposite of Shadow . He is carefree , silly , impatient , anxious , clumsy , hilarious and love to play ( voiced by the talented Michael J . Fox ) . Chance just ca n't stand still . Sassy is the epitome of cat 's image : elegant , independent , very confident and self-proud , with a typical cat attitude but with a certain feline charm . Sassy is a Seal Point Himalayan cat , one of the most beautiful cat breed . Sassy is voiced by Sally Field , who also doe a good job . Our four-legged friend are , themselves , great `` actor '' by nature : Ben a Shadow , Rattler a Chance and Tiki a Sassy . It 's an underrated movie , but a classic by it own right . Its sequel is clearly inferior . This should definitely be on Top 250 .

To review this movie , I without any doubt would have to quote that memorable scene in Tarantino 's `` Pulp Fiction '' ( 1994 ) when Jules and Vincent are talking about Mia Wallace and what she doe for a living . Jules tell Vincent that the `` Only thing she did worthwhile wa pilot '' . Vincent asks `` What the hell is a pilot ? '' and Jules go into a very well description of what a TV pilot is : `` Well , the way they make show is , they make one show . That show 's called a 'pilot ' . Then they show that show to the people who make show , and on the strength of that one show they decide if they 're going to make more show . Some pilot get picked and become television program . Some do n't , become nothing . She starred in one of the one that became nothing . '' Now to stretch on what Jules wa talking about , there are BILLIONS of television shows/pilots that were never aired because they simply were not ... well , good . Probably the most notorious pilot that come to mind is `` W * A * L * T * E * R '' , a spin-off to `` M * A * S * H '' with Gary `` Radar '' Burghoff a the lead . Hmmm , would somebody really want to be watching Radar for a half-hour trying to solve crime ? Hence , the show wa never picked up . What many people do n't know ( or what they thought they knew ) is that pilot are hardly ever shown on the air , for they are made strictly for the Television network for them to decide . Some have made they 're way past and got onto the air ( The pilot for the animated series `` American Dad '' come to mind , a the show 's serial itself did n't begin until nearly four month later . However , there are time were we should all be glad pilot never make it to air , and this here is why . `` Black Bart '' , a supposed tie-in with the Mel Brooks comedy classic , `` Blazing Saddles '' , is a stale and bland `` sitcom '' with little heart and no soul . `` Saddles '' wa a controversial comedy , nevertheless , with it 's racist humor and vulgar comedy , which come to mind `` what idiot decided this would make a great television show FOR PRIME TIME TV ? ! ? '' I say `` supposed '' , because none of the memorable character from the movie , aside from Bart , on in this mess of a TV show . Mel Brooks wa n't even involved with the production of the serial and this wa the first mistake in a long line ( In a related story , I recently found out about an unaired TV pilot for a series based on the movie `` Clerks . '' that Kevin Smith wa no involved in .... you see what happens ? ! ? ) . Set somewhere around the same time a the movie ( or at all ) , the story circle around the only Black sheriff in the wild west , named appropriately 'Black ' Bart , who is this time played by future Academy Award winner Louis Gossett Jr. , obviously before his stint in `` real '' acting , whereas in this he is playing a `` G-rated '' Richard Pryor . Most of the other character are carbon ( if not , really bad ) copy of the character in the movie : Jim , The Waco Kid is replaced by a similar looking character named Reb Jordan , a former Confederate soldier who is quick with the gun . Lilian Von Schtupp is now Belle Buzzer , a more of a ripoff of the character being that she 's a show dancer and a German with a Marlene Dietrich-type accent and personality . While that 's pretty much the end in similarity , The lead `` bad guy '' in the story is Fern Malaga , played by Noble Willingham , who I assumed would 've been Hedley Lamar if Warner Bros. secured the right to the name ( See trivia for `` Blazing Saddles '' ) and his son Curley ... I dunno , Taggart I suppose ? The story is a poor excuse for a sitcom , much le a pilot . Bart deal with the mayor 's drunk son and he 's out-of-control behavior which ha caused the town to spin . Really , it 's a story that try to introduce all the character in the `` series '' and doe n't focus on the variety and context that would make this an `` alright '' show . I ca n't really call it a sitcom ( and even if I wanted to ) and that 's primarily the fact it wa shot on the backlot at Warner Bros. Studios and later added a laugh track , so the show is set up almost exactly like `` M * A * S * H '' ( complete with a bland and dull `` laughing '' that is identical to the series ) . The acting is so-so , but there 's one part that always make me laugh , and that 's when the actor playing Reb Jordan almost seems to forget his line and try really hard to remember them while trying to sputter out a piece of dialogue . HA ! The script is rather dull and is attempt to make racism more humorous than it wa in the movie ( Surprisingly , they use the word `` N * * * er '' numerous amount of time through a 22-minute episode , rather touchy for it 's time period and even for today ) and it get repetitive . If you ever get your hand on this unseen piece of sss ... surly interesting novelty item , watch it just for the sake of the feeling for watching pilot ( It 's on the collector 's edition of `` Blazing Saddles '' , God know why ) . There , yourself get a first hand chance for the reason why many movie tie-in pilot never air .

Oy vey ... Jurrasic Park got Corman-ized . As usual the plot is wafer thin , from 1 foot tall dinosaur that weigh 150 pound and leave track bigger than they are , to inexplicable science which us laser to keep the dinosaur in check and poultry truck which have chicken loose in cage large enough for big dog ( I 've seen chicken truck they are all in cage the size of shoe box ) . And all that is in the first 15 minute of this disaster of a film . All the male actor are imbecile ( thinking a grizzly might be loose in the desert , constantly dropping item to give the raptor an easy kill ) and the female actor all look like they just came from a modeling shoot for Fredrick 's of Hollywood . The raptor itself is the worst thing since the Hobgoblins ( from the movie of the same name ) , it look like they had a hand puppet version and a plastic model for the `` motion '' shot . If you want a good movie to sit around and heckle MST3K style , this is gold . If you want competent film making and good acting ... do n't watch a Roger Corman film . Acting get a 4 out 10 , some of the player upon this stage did try . Story get a 2 out of 10 , it read like a drunken storytelling session gone bad . Special effect get a 2 out of 10 , I 've seen worse , but not many .
