In his first go a a Hollywood director , Henry Brommell whip an enthralling yarn that is all of penetrating relatable marital issue with melancholic authenticity , and lacing such with an equally absorbing subplot of a father-son hit-man business . The film is directed astutely and consists of a wonderfully put together cast a well a a swift , family-conscious screenplay ( also by Brommell ) that brings life to an otherwise fatigued genre . As a bonus , 'Panic ' delivers subtle , acerbic humoran unexpected , undeniably charming , and very welcome surprisethrough it bumbling , unsure-of-himself , low-key star , whose ever-cool state is enticing , especially given his line of work . The forever-great William H. Macy again capture our heart a Alex , a unhappy , torn , middle-aged husband and father who find solace in the most dubious of person : a young , attractive , equally-messed-up 23-year-old named Sarah ( Neve Campbell ) , whom he meet in the waiting-room at a psychologist 's office , where he awaits the therapy of Dr. Josh Parks ( John Ritter ) to discus his growing eagerness to quit the family business that his father ( Donald Sutherland ) built . Alex , whose lust to lead a new life is obstructed by the fear of disappointing his dictating father , strike an unwise fancy for Sarah , which ultimately lead him to understand the essence and irrefutable responsibility of being a husband to his wife and , more importantly to him , a good father to his six-year-old son , Sammy ( played enthusiastically by the endearing David Dorfman ) . Henry Brommell 's brilliant 'Panic ' is something of a rarity in Hollywood seldom seen ( with the exception of 2002 's 'Road to Perdition ' ) since it conception in 2000it weave two conflicting genre ( organized-crime , family drama ) into a fascinating , warm hunk of movie-viewing that is evenly strong in either directionand it 's one that will maintain it exceptional , infrequent caliber and gleaming sincerity for age to come .

After perusing the large amount of comment on this movie it is clear that there are two kind of science fiction movie-goers . There are the one who are well read , extremely literate , and intelligent . They know the history of the genre and more importantly they know to what height it can reach in the hand of a gifted author . For many year science fiction languished in the basement of literature . Considered my most critic to be little more than story of ray gun and alien meant for pre-pubescent teenager . Today 's well read fan know well this history , and know the great author Asimov , Heinlein , Bradbury , and Ellison , who helped bring science fiction out of that basement . In doing so they created thought provoking , intelligent story that stretched the boundary and redefined the human condition . This well informed fan are critical of anything Hollywood throw at them . They are not critical for it 's own sake , but look upon each offering with a skeptical eye . ( As they should a Hollywood 's record ha been le than stellar . ) To these fan the story must take supreme importance . They can not be fooled by flashy computer graphic , and non stop action sequence . When the emperor ha no clothes they scream it the loudest . The second type of science fiction movie goer ha little knowledge about the written aspect of the genre . ( Look at many of the above comment that state `` Well I have n't read the book or anything by this author ... ) Their total exposure to science fiction is from movie or the Scifi channel . They are extremely uncritical , willing to overlook huge plot hole , weak premise , and thin story line if they are given a healthy dose of wiz bang action and awesome special effect . They are , in effect , willing to turn off their critical thinking skill ( or maybe they never had them ! ) for the duration of the movie . Case in point , I Robot . While supposedly based on Asimov 's short story and named after one of his novel , it contains little of what Asimov wrote and even le of what he tried to tell u about humanity and our robotic creation . ( Those of you that will run out and buy I , Robot will be very much surprised-this movie is n't even based on that story at all ! ) The film ha enormous plot hole , that at some point are stretched to the limit of credulity . I wo n't point them out . I wo n't spoon feed you . You need to practice you thinking skill and discover them for yourself . The character , which are named after many of Asimov 's character , do not posse the critical intelligence that wa a hallmark of his story . The plot itself with all it 's action sequence go against everything that the author stood for . His belief that humanity posse the capacity to solve problem using their mind , not their fist , is vital to understanding his vision of the future . In short , other than the name , their is very little of Isaac in anything about this movie . There will always be those uncritical ( i.e . unthinking ) who will state : `` The movie doe n't have to be like the book . Due to the medium , movie sometimes require that change be made . '' But what about a case where the movie never even tried to stay close to the book ( or book ) from the start ? What if all they took from the written work wa the title ? This begs the question : Why tarnish a great body of work by slapping it 's title on your vacuous piece of crap ? Save money and do n't buy the right to the work . Title it something else . Do n't use the character 's name . Believe me no one will accuse you of plagiarism . In fact it wo n't matter what you title it to the unread moviegoer who accepts everything you throw at him . But it will upset those who read , who think , who are unwilling to simply let you give them a pretty light show . I , Robot , like much of Hollywood 's take on the genre , push Science fiction back down into that basement it lived in year ago . Hollywood could not do this alone . It take an uncritical mindless audience that will accept puerile dredge like this .

This movie is incredibly realistic and I feel doe a great justice to the crime that many people do not understand because of a lack of experience . The many people who think they could fathom what go through a victim 's mind are arrogant . As a victim , I feel that Dawson did a fantastic job in her role of Maya . I agree that this is an incredibly brave film . This look at rape from a different , more realistic standpoint than any other movie I 've ever seen on the subject . The end did drag on a bit long , but I know that many victim imagine this kind of justice , since the chance of an attacker being sent to jail for their crime is around 1 % . It 's good to see a movie that stick closer to reality than most would dare to .

'What I Like About You ' is definitely a show that I could n't wait to see each day . Amanda Bynes is such an excellent actress and I grew up watching her show : 'The Amanda Show . I especially loved the show when the character 'Vince ' came along . Nick Zano is very HOT and funny , a well a 'Gary ' , Wesley Jonathan . The whole cast wa great , each character had their own personality and charm . Jennie Garth , Allison Munn , and Leslie Grossman were all very interesting . I especially loved 'Lauren ' ; she 's the best ! She helped make the show extra funny and you never know what she 's gon na do or say next ! Overall the show is really nice but the reason I did n't give it a 10 wa because there 's no more new episode and because the episode could 've been longer and more deep .

The turning point in `` The Matador '' come about half through the movie when Danny , an unsophisticated man from Denver , is sitting in the balcony of his Mexico City hotel , enjoying a quiet moment . Someone knock on his door , and knowing it 's Julian , the paid assassin , he refuse to answer . But did he really ? Richard Shephard , the director of `` The Matador '' , present u with a character , Julian Noble , who show no redeemable quality . In fact , we have already seen him in action , doing what he doe best . When Julian meet Danny at the bar of the Camino Real in Mexico City , he spill the bean and tell his new acquaintance what he really doe for a living . Danny , who ha come to sell his program to a Mexican company , but it seems he is competing against a local outfit that appears to be in the front for getting the contract . Danny is a naive person who fall prey of the charisma and charm doled out by the smarter Julian . It 's not until some time later , on a cold winter night that the killer appears at Danny 's door asking his friend to repay a favor and accompany him on a trip to Tucson . It 's at this point that the secret that bind them together is revealed in an unexpected way . Pierce Brosnan , acting against type , make a great contribution with his irreverent Julian Noble . Just to watch him walking through the hotel lobby in his Speedo and boot give the right impression about his character . Greg Kinnear , on the other hand , play the straight part of this odd couple . Hope Davis appears only in a couple of scene leaving u to lament why did n't she stay longer . Philip Baker Hall put an appearance a the liaison between Julian and his assignment . Richard Shephard directs with style working with his own material . The musical score is by Rolfe Kent and the crisp cinematography of David Tattersall enhances everything .

Those who only remember the late Sir Peter Ustinov a Hercule Poirot or a professional raconteur would do well to seek out this charming piece of late '60s satire . Ustinov star a a convicted embezzler ( we first see him during his last day in gaol where he is preparing the prison governor 's tax return ) who , sensing that the future is in computer , pose ( by mean of a deft piece of identity theft ) a a computer expert and set out to infiltrate an American multinational . Ustinov ( who co-wrote the script ) is on top form , a is the delightful Maggie Smith , here unusually cast a an accident-prone cockney-sparrow dolly bird . Bob Newhart also put in an amusing performance a a suspicious executive who ha design on Maggie Smith . In addition , Karl Malden is satisfyingly sleazy a Ustinov and Newhart 's womanising bos . What do I particularly like about this film ? Not only is it a well-thought-out 'caper movie ' but it 's also a touching little love story ; Ustinov and Smith are very convincing a the two misfit stumbling into love ( the whole scene involving the deck of card is particularly effective . ) So , what is there not to like ? Well , the script is no more computer-literate than most film ( that is , hardly at all ) even though it capture the feel of late '60s 'big iron ' business computing quite well . Also there are a couple of small plot glitch that you 're not likely to notice until the second or third viewing , but I consider these to be minor niggles . As I said , this is a film which is well worth seeking out , and after you 've seen it once you 'll want to see it again at regular interval .

The influence of Hal Hartley in Adrienne Shelly 's `` I 'll Take You There '' is not overt , but clearly ha tie to his work ( Shelly ha acted in two of Hartley 's film ) . Not only doe her film exhibit a very tight narrative , but the hyper-stylized and extreme character strangely render human emotion in a very real light . Though this film is not ironic on the whole ( thank God ) , the small and subtle irony that pepper the piece allude to the bitter truth in love and loss . With beautiful cinematography and a soundtrack straight from the seventy , `` I 'll See You There '' is a great indie-film that doe n't stoop to postmodern irony when dealing with the woe of love and the reality of human emotion . The film begin with Bill 's life falling to piece . Not only ha he sold his best friend Ray a beautiful country home , but his wife Rose ha left him in order to join Ray in the retreat . All washed up , Bill wallow in his own gloom and doom until his sister Lucy ( played by the director Adrienne Shelly ) brings him all kind of surprise : a self-help book and a `` date '' for her traumatized brother . The unwilling Bill try to refuse , but the sudden appearance of Bernice at his door leaf him no choice . No doubt Bernice 's initially superficial demeanor and ridiculous hairstyle detract from his ability to `` rebound '' with her . However , her pseudo-hippie quality annoy him so much that he lash at her on their first date . And Bernice is so traumatized by his derogatory remark that she attache herself to him , forcing herself upon him . To what end , we are not aware ... except for maybe the fact that she is psycho . ( And who better to play the psycho than Ally Sheedy ? ) Aware that Bill desperately want to see Rose , Bernice offer her car , but on the condition that he take her somewhere first . On the way , she proceeds to hold Bill prisoner with his own gun ( a Pinkerton Detective , no le ) . An imbroglio of angst , resentment , redemption , passion and violence ensue a Bill and Bernice find themselves on their way to the country home of Ray and Rose ... of course , with a few stop along the way .

When in 1982 , `` The Thing '' came out to theater everywhere , it had a cold reception and very poor box-office result , becoming almost a failure in John Carpenter 's career a a horror director ; however , time ha proved that `` The Thing '' wa definitely not a failed project and that the disappointing commercial result were not the film 's fault . Nowadays , John Carpenter 's `` The Thing '' ha gained the appreciation it rightfully deserves and is considered by many horror fan a a horror classic , and not without a reason , a this new version of John W. Campbell , Jr. 's story `` Who Goes There ? '' ( previously adapted a `` The Thing From Another World '' ) is closer to the original tale and keep a pessimistic feeling of dread and high dos of suspense in a masterfully crafted study about paranoia . The plot of `` The Thing '' , begin in the winter of 1982 in a U.S. research station located in the remote territory of Antarctica , when the member of the crew notice a Norwegian helicopter coming their way . The two apparently insane pilot of the helicopter are trying to kill a Husky dog who make it way into the American base . After the Norwegians are killed accidentally , the Americans try to figure out what made them to be insane . Soon they 'll discover that the Husky dog the Norwegians were hunting wa not a normal dog , but a creature able to mimic every living creature , and not only that , it ha a tremendous hunger . Director John Carpenter earned a place in history when in 1978 he directed the seminal slasher `` Halloween '' , where suspense and atmosphere were above gore and shock . `` The Thing '' could be seen a an evolution of that style , a even when Carpenter make great use of Rob Bottin 's special effect ( which were labeled by critic a `` repulsive '' on it day ) , the film still focus more on atmosphere and suspense rather than in the violent ( and very well-done ) display of gore . The feeling of loneliness , a well a the `` bad karma '' between the member of the crew increase the feeling of paranoia a anyone could be the Thing , even our main character , R. J. MacReady ( Kurt Russell ) , ending in a situation where nobody can be trusted . This plot element wa more faithful to the concept of the source novel , and wa blatantly ignored by the previous version ( not completely a bad thing , just a big difference ) , making this version feel le like a remake and more a a new conception of the source novel . Bill Lancaster 's script handle the character with brilliant domain , giving u enough to distinguish them , but not too much to completely trust them , making them an essential factor in the film 's haunting feeling of dread that keep running through the movie . The mystery and the suspense are at the max , a never one can tell who is the Thing and who is normal , enhancing the paranoia and unpredictability of the plot with excellent result . The cast is very effective , and their performance a a whole so effective that one can almost feel the bad feeling between their character a real . Carpenter 's regular collaborator Kurt Russell a MacReady carry the film , and through his eye we witness the madness and the horror the research station becomes a the situation go worse . Definitely one of his best performance . Wilford Brimley is also terrific a Dr. Blair , a scientist that go insane after discovering the Thing 's purpose . `` The Thing '' is a film so wonderfully crafted that it flaw tend to go unnoticed , although they exist . The most notorious being the very low-key and at time unappropriated score by Ennio Morricone . It 's not exactly bad , but it just feel out of place at some scene and it 's not one of the best work by the legendary composer . Also , due to some misshapes with the special effect , some scene were left out that actually fill some small plot hole , although nothing of big importance or actually annoying . When talking about John Carpenter 's film , most people will almost instantly name `` Halloween '' a his favorite film , but personally , I would go with `` The Thing '' , a I consider it Carpenter 's greatest achievement so far , and one of the most interesting and actually scary horror film ever made . I would go a far a to call it one of the finest film ever made . 10/10

Here 's one you can watch with a straight face , with a script so bad , even Will Ferrell would n't be in it . There are two laugh in HOT ROD . 1 . The Punch-Dance . Rod `` need to go to his quiet place '' and before anyone can say Kevin Bacon , he is footloosing a passionate , overwrought bodyswerve to the strain of a band who wish they had the big-hair faux-metal chop of Europe . 2 . John Farnham 's You 're The Voice . In one of those epic sequence where the star and his cohort do The Slomo Walk down Main Street and the townfolk follow on their heel in support , the soundtrack is the gag . How did the film-makers even come across this Aussie recording artist ? A major Australian vocalist ( and a genuine talent ) who shot to fame in the early '70s covering Raindrops Keep Fallin ' On My Head , then disappeared until 1986 for The Big Comeback with You 're The Voice , John Farnham 's anthem is so bewitchingly cheesy , it leveled mountain in Switzerland . Besides these two high point in the film - both ruined anyway with the slipshod writing - the rest of the film is like choking on someone else 's vomit . Andy Samberg is Rod , a failed stunt jumper who ha never made a jump . Maybe it 's got something to do with the fact he 's driving a moped into the heart of darkness . Or his fake mustache . Yeh , someone actually thought that wa funny . Without one jump under his starry belt , he plan for a 15-bus extravaganza - which would surely kill a lesser bad comedian , like Jason Biggs or Rob Schneider - to win the day and save his stepfather and simultaneously wipe out cancer and whatever ... who watch these movie for plot anyway ? Along the way ( a usual for moronic lead in these comedy ) , he score a salubrious chick ( Isla Fisher ) , who must surely be retarded to consider swapping chromosome with this loser . Sissy Spacek ( CARRIE , 1976 ) ha so little to do she almost phoned in her performance - then changed her mind and just hung up . Ian McShane must 've lost a bet to be here .

If you liked Lock , Stock and Two Smoking Barrels , the chance are you 'll like this , too . Although I guess a few of the British in-joke ( like calling two London character Dixon and Winterburn , after Arsenal soccer player ) may be lost on some , this is still cracking entertainment , which veritably pump with vitality . Carlyle , Miller and Tyler are all excellent , bringing depth to their character , and the interplay between the two protagonist is always well-judged . In fact Scott 's direction is very assured , considering that this is his first feature film , and prof that he ha his father 's talent for putting u at ease in unfamiliar surroundings . Hell , I 've convinced myself . I 'm gon na see it again !

do n't expect much from this film . In many way this film resembles a film that Doris Day starred in in 1956 , title , Julie . I know a little about 747 aircraft , i use to be a flight attendant myself . Like i said , do not expect much from this film , it wa done on a cheap budget . PROM NIGHT ( 2008 ) directed by : Nelson McCormick starring : Brittany Snow , Scott Porter , Jessica Stroup , and Dana Davis plot : Three year ago , Donna ( Brittany Snow ) witnessed the death of her entire family at the hand of her teacher ( Jonathan Schaech ) who ha a bit of a crush on her . Now , she is preparing for her senior prom with her stupid annoying friend . Once there , they start dying one by one because the killer escaped from prison and no one bothered to warn Donna because apparently her prom is too important to interrupt . pro : I got a few good laugh out of the film due to the terrible dialog and the dumb character move . An example : Everyone decides not to tell Donna that the man who is oddly obsessed with her ( she doe n't seem that great ) ha escaped from prison . Their reason : They do n't want to embarrass her in front of all her friend . LOL con : Let me start off by saying I 'm a huge slasher fan . Usually I can have fun with even the bad one . I even like some PG-13 horror film . TOURIST TRAP ( 1979 ) , one of my favorite , wa originally rated PG . I also enjoy POLTERGEIST ( 1982 ) and THE GRUDGE ( 2004 ) . So the fact that this is a dumb slasher film that is rated PG-13 doe not have anything to do with me not enjoying the movie . First of all , I had a big problem with the story . I like slasher film that do n't even have story . At least they can be entertaining . This is about a teacher who fall in love with his student , so he kill her entire family . A few year later , he try to make it up to her by ruining her prom and killing all of her friend ... ? Then there were subplots that I doubt anyone cared about . Claire ( Jessica Stroup ) is fighting with her boyfriend , she ha cramp , and I could n't care le . This should have been a Lifetime feature , not a remake of PROM NIGHT . And then ... this is a slasher film with terrible death scene . I do n't even care that it 's not that gory , some of my favorite slasher ( HALLOWEEN , CURTAINS , the original PROM NIGHT ) were not that gory but they still had effective murder . Here , we have half the character dying in the same hotel room off screen , a woman being stabbed several time with no stab wound , and a closeup on a bad actor 's face a he scream in agony . I 'm sure that 10 year-old girl were terrified , but not me . I also hated the character . There wa Donna 's unrealistically sensitive boyfriend Bobby ( Scott Porter ) and I can almost guarantee you will never meet a boyfriend that sensitive in your life , unless you are a gay male . Then we had Donna 's annoying friend Claire ( Stroup ) and Lisa ( Dana Davis ) , and the token mean girl Chrissy ( Brianne Davis ) . If you thought the character in DEATH PROOF were annoying , try watching this movie . And do n't get me started on Ronnie ( Collins Pennie ) and the DJ ( Jay Phillips ) who gave me flashback to Usher 's performance in SHE 'S ALL THAT . Add to all that predictable plot turn , a terrible soundtrack and a big lack of respect to the original material , and you have quite a stinker .

The is one of the worst spoof I have ever seen . For one main reason : IT IS N'T FUNNY ! I laughed a handful of time . The acting is bad , the script is worse . And why those guy had baby pacfiers in their hair I will never know . And you can tell this did n't have much of a budget to work with and it openly hurt the film . They had a good idea going in some part but it never really came to past . And what wa the point about the lead being older than his Dad ? 3 out of 10

A convict serving time come forward to give the Cold Case unit information about the murder of a policeman , committed year before . The murder of Sean Cooper , a good cop , wa never solved . Naturally , the detective believe the new evidence will help them put together all the piece of the puzzle that frustrated their colleague . In flashback we are taken to the baptism of James Bruno 's baby . Sean and Jimmy were partner . There is tension a Sean , who is the godfather , arrives disheveled and late for the rite . Eileen Bruno doe n't appear to be happy being there . The real mystery is revealed by her . She caught Sean , who wa drinking with Jimmy in the backyard , kiss her husband , and more shocking yet , Jimmy responding willingly . Somehow at the station the partner become the center of gossip . Sean ha not endeared himself to his superior because he discovered the involvement with a criminal in his area who controlled the drug business . Sean realizes this man is in with the drug strong man because he always make an excuse to free the scum bag Sean and Jimmy haul into the station all the time . The pressure is too much on Jimmy . Sean is comfortable in his homosexuality and want to be honest about it . Cooper 's own father doe n't want anything to do with a queer son . Even his superior McCree want him out of his jurisdiction , but the case is complicated because Cooper come from a long line of Irish men serving in the police force . Sean is killed because his homosexual condition , and for knowing too much on his peer ' involvement in taking dirty money . Tom Petit wrote this honest portrayal of the life of a police officer in the closet and his secret love with another fellow cop . We thought it wa a frank account of a serious matter no one talked about in those day . Sometimes the people involved with the show , fearing reprisal from sponsor , or the network , do n't dare to present these real situation . Jeannot Szwarc , show a sensitive approach to this thorny issue , which is dealt without the sensationalism the case might have been shown with a different team . There is a rare Chad Everett appearance a the older Jimmy Bruno . His take is right on target with a touch of sentimentality that doe n't get out of hand . Shane Johnson make an excellent contribution to the show a Sean Cooper . The cast is marvelous and it includes good all around performance from everyone under Mr. Szwarc 's direction . In this episode , Nick Vera , get closer to his neighbor , the mother of the basketball player the detective took his ball away . Nick is heading for romance with the woman !

36 . THE HOSPITAL ( comedy , 1971 ) A series of emergency ha gripped Manhattan Hospital . Patients are dying left and right due to overcrowded condition , and a ineptitude staff . When a resident doctor is caught up in the death count the chief medical examiner , Dr. Bock ( George C. Scott ) , is called in to investigate . Having worked a a doctor for too many year , and going through a mid-life crisis of his own , Dr. Bock find the going tough . He decides to commit suicide . But then he meet Barbara ( Diana Rigg ) , a young-hippie beauty . Whose keen insight on life help the depressed Bock . Critique : Black comedy feature a 'tour-de-force ' performance from veteran actor George C. Scott . He 's good at playing high-strung , serious character whose strict moral are severely tested . First half of the film unfolds like a melodrama , giving a pretty good account of hospital life , and the shamble they sometimes are . But then , a thing look set for a dramatic climax it skews into slapstick comedy . If Paddy Chayefsky 's script had maintained it dramatic feel I wonder if Scott would 've walked out with another best Actor Oscar ( he had previously won it , 'in-absentia ' , the year before ) . His breakdown ( suicide ) scene is one of the most gut-wrenchingly real in cinema history . QUOTE : Dr. Bock : `` . . .last night I sat in my hotel room reviewing the shamble of my life and contemplating suicide . I said 'no Bock do n't do it . You 're a doctor , a healer , you 're a necessary person , you 're life is meaningful ' . Then . . .I find out that one of my doctor wa killed by a couple of nurse . . .how am I to sustain my feeling of meaningfulness in the face of this ? ''

Our story : Two U.S. Navy deep sea diver search for silver coin hidden beneath the ocean off the Filipino coast . Our proof : Extremely dull entertainment at it best , with no plot in sight . Jim Brown is completely wasted , provided his help in producing this 70 war turkey . Richard Jaeckel is in his usual form . Don Cornelius and Richard Pryor are among those who gave special thanks in their contribution ! BOMBS AWAY ! ! !

Definitely a movie for people who ask only to be entertained and who do not over-think their movie . Lots of action , lot of great dialogue ( e.g . fun to quote ) , a little intrigue , and stuff blowing up all over the place . Samuel L Jackson and Geena Davis had great chemistry . Violent , but not gory . The fact that the female part wa the competent action lead is a pleasant turn-about . Have seen the movie more than a dozen time and still enjoy it enough to put it back in my favorite film rotation every 3 or 4 month . I initially rented the movie because Samuel L Jackson wa in the film , but wa caught up in the event surrounding Samantha 's quest to regain her memory and have never looked back . All you cerebral folk out there -- suspend disbelief for once , take yourself a little le seriously -- you might actually enjoy yourselves !

Beethoven 's hearing during the movie get 's better by the minute , but that must be because of some vague divine thing . Samuel Fuller is hardly one of America 's great director . I 'm not sure he qualifies a one of Hollywood 's great craftsman . But he certainly rank up there with the best of Hollywood 's true professional who were willing to march to their own music . During the time he worked for Hollywood studio , he knew how to take an assignment , shape the middling material handed to him and then turn it quickly and efficiently into something usually better than it part ... on time and on budget . Pickup on South Street is a case in point . On the surface it 's one more of Hollywood 's early Fifties ' anti-Commie movie , complete with appeal to patriotism , a hard-boiled hero and a slimy ( and copiously perspiring ) bad guy . Fuller turn this bag of Hollywood clichés into a taut , exciting drama with any number of off-kilter twist . The hero , Skip McCoy , is a three-time loser , a petty crook with soft finger who doe n't change his stripe until the very end . The girl in the caper , Candy , ha a level of virtue that would be easy to step over if you 're so inclined . One of the most appealing character , Moe Williams , is a stoolie . And in an unusual approach to Hollywood 's battle against Commies , the appeal to patriotism fall on deaf ear ; the hero is n't motivated by anything so ennobling . He just want payback for a personal reason , and wind up becoming ... at least for now ... a good guy . Plus , all the actor were mostly assigned to Fuller by the studio . He had to make do . Richard Widmark by now had established his presence a an actor and star , but Jean Peters is a surprise . She give a fine portrait of a woman sexy and dumb , and no better than her boy friend ... or her client ... want her to be . And Richard Kiley , who later would become a two- time Tony award winning star on Broadway , is convincingly slippery and cowardly . It 's hard to remember that he wa the actor who inflicted on u , I mean introduced to u , `` The Impossible Dream '' from Man of La Mancha , More than anything else , this tale of a pickpocket who pick a purse in a subway car and find himself with microfilmed secret instead of cash , pursued by the Feds and the Commies , move straight ahead with great economy . The whole enterprise , with a classic noir look , only take 80 minute to tell . The dialogue , with Fuller a screenwriter , ha that party corny , partly pungent hard-boiled pulp fiction style . `` That muffin you grifted ... she 's okay , '' one character say to Skip about Candy . Fuller move u just fast enough from scene to scene to keep u hanging on what will come next . Then Fuller throw in the character of Moe Williams . All of a sudden the story ratchet up to a whole new level of interest , part comedy relief and part sad inevitability . The thing I like best about the movie is how the opening exemplifies Fuller 's talent and strength . In 2 minute and 15 second , starting right after the credit , Fuller is able to instantly power up the movie , to establish for u what the story is about , and to show u what kind of character -- Skip and Candy -- we 're going to be involved with . And he doe this with so much enticing curiosity in that hot , packed subway car that we can just about feel Fuller setting the hook to catch u . Says Glenn Erickson , in my opinion one of the best of movie critic , `` In what should be an inconsequential story , Sam Fuller defines his peculiar view of Americanism from the bottom up : stiff-necked , aggressive self-interest that when fully expressed recognizes what 's wrong and what 's right and is n't afraid to fight for it . As always in his work , the individual who fight the hardest for their country are the one least likely to benefit from the effort . '' He 's right , and it make for a movie still vivid after 55 year .

Last weekend I bought this 'zombie movie ' from the bargain bin and watched it with some friend thinking it wa going to be a budget version of `` Land of the Dead '' . Boy , wa I wrong . It seems a if they spent a good portion of their budget on the cover-art , which is very misleading to fan of the zombie genre . We watched up to the point where the zombie chick come alive and get in the car with some yuppie who is out in the middle of nowhere talking business on a cell-phone . They actually speak to the guy before one of the girl kill him ; but once they started driving the car , I could n't suspend my disbelief anymore . Some people actually consider this a `` so bad , it 's good '' movie , they are liar . I did n't finish the movie , but one of the other review mention that they actually somehow become police officer at the end of the movie , which make me glad to not have watched it all the way through . This is even worse than `` Zombiez '' DO NOT WATCH !

I often feel like Scrooge , slamming movie that others are raving about - or , I write the review to balance unwarranted raf . I found this movie almost unwatchable , and , unusual for me , wa fast-forwarding not only through dull , clichéd dialog but even dull , clichéd musical number . Whatever originality exists in this film -- unusual domestic setting for a musical , lot of fantasy , some animation -- is more than offset by a script that ha not an ounce of wit or thought-provoking plot development . Individually , June Haver and Dan Dailey appear to be nice people , but ca n't carry a movie a a team . Neither is really charismatic or ha much sex appeal . They 're both bland . I like Billy Gray , but his character is pretty one-note . The best part of the film , to me , are June Haver 's beautiful costume and great body .

Recap : Full moon . A creature , a huge werewolf , is on the hunt . Not for flesh , not for blood ( not that it seem to mind to take a bite on the way though ) , but for a mate . He is on the hunt for a girl . Not any girl though . The Girl . The girl that is pure ( and also a werewolf , although she doe n't know it yet ) . Three , well check that , two cop ( after the first scene ) and an old bag lady is all that can stop it , or even know that the thing killing and eating a lot of folk around full moon is a werewolf . This particular powerful werewolf , Darkwolf , is closing in on the girl . If he get her , mankind is doomed . Now the cop ha to find the girl , convince her not only that there is someone , a werewolf nonetheless , that want to rape her , and perhaps kill her , but that she is a werewolf herself . And then they got to stop him ... Comments : This is one for the boy , the teenage boy . A lot of scene with semi-nude girl more or le important for the plot . Mostly le . Well I guess you need something to fill some time because the plot is ( expectedly ) thin . And unfortunately there is little besides the girl to help the plot from breaking . One usually turn to two main theme . Nudity . Check . And then special effect . Hmm ... Well there are some thing that you might call effect . They 're not very special though . In fact , to be blunt , they are very bad . The movie seems to be suffering of a lack of fund . They could n't afford clothes for some of the girl ; ) , and the effect are cheap . Some of the transformation between werewolf and human form , obviously done by computer , are really bad . You might overlook such thing . But the Darkwolf in itself is very crude too , and you never get to see any killing . Just some mutilated corps afterwards . And there is surprisingly little blood about , in a movie that honestly should be drenched in blood . I 'm not sure what to say about actor and character . Most of the time they do well , but unfortunately there are lapse were the character ( or actor ) just loos it . A few of these lapse could be connected with the problem mentioned above . Like the poor effect , or the poor budget ( ? ) . That could explain why there is precious little shooting , even if the character are armed like a small army and the target is in plain sight ( and not moving ) . But hey , when you 're in real danger , there nothing that will save your life like a good one-liner ... Unfortunately that ca n't explain moment when the Cop , Steve , the only one who know how to maybe deal with the problem , the werewolf that is , run away , when the only thing he can be sure of , is that the werewolf is coming for the girl , who is just beside him now , and that he can not let it have her . But sure , it let the maker stretch the ending a little more ... But I would n't mind seeing none of the lead actors/actresses get another try in another movie . Well . To give a small conclusion : Not a movie that I recommend . 3/10

I first heard about The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya from a reviewer on Youtube . He literally slapped the show with a big bad rant , condemning it rubbish and confusing . Curious , I decided to watch the show ( once I got the order of the episode right , thanks to those who made the list ) , and I found it absolutely brilliant and enjoyable to watch . Great memorable character who are full of life and are absolutely lovable and hilarious ; a unique and not over blowing plot that make sense now that I 've watched the show ; and two of the best anime moment in history , in my opinion . Plus the opening and ending theme are great . The anime , based on a collection of successful manga novel , follows a simple plot , once you understand it . While the show 's focus is on the main character , Haruhi Suzumiya , the point of view is from her friend Kyon . Kyon is a regular high school student who doe n't really believe in supernatural stuff ( e.g . Santa Clause , alien , time traveller , ghost , espers ) but he soon end up talking to Haruhi , who is the most oddest girl in the school and would prefer to date an alien , considering all men worthless . She even joined every club in the school to find something interesting , but quit a quickly a she joined . Upon `` advice '' from Kyon , Haruhi decides to form her own club with Kyon 's club . Setting up in the literary club room , Haruhi form the SOS Brigade - it mission to investigate supernatural case ( think Scooby-Doo minus the dog , the masked man and the Mystery Machine ) . Haruhi `` recruit '' three extra member . The first is Yuki Nagato , a bookworm of sort who speaks very little and spends most of her time reading and sitting . The second is Mikuru Asahina , a shy girl who is forced into the club by Haruhi who think they need a cute mascot to get some thing done . She is often forced into costume by Haruhi to further her cuteness . The third is Itsuki Koizumi , a friendly and sociable transfer student who is always smiling . While Haruhi think her group is filled with normal people she could n't be more wrong . While Kyon is a normal a you can get , the other three on the other hand are rather unique - Yuki is an alien , Mikuru is a time traveller from the future , and Itsuki is an esper ( a person who ha ESP ) . All three have come to watch over Haruhi who may just have the power of a god , and if she becomes bored , she may be able to discover her power and create a whole new world , and Kyon is involved somehow . The show is worth watching with great character , music and some hilarious and wonderful moment . However , for parent , there is some sexual reference including Mikuru 's cleavage being exposed or touched several time , and several swear word used a well . Apart from that , the show is one of the great .

He ha the 1940 's leading man look and screen presence . It 's this hack opinion he could carry his own movie right now ! ! S~

I waited until the 4th of July to write this because . . . well . . . because it just feel right to be doing it on this day . In 1924 D.W. Griffith needed a hit , he had not had a big one since ORPHANS OF THE STORM ( 1921 ) . He 'd been working steadily since then but his movie had been smaller in scope and had failed to hit the right chord with audience . He wa planning a film about Patrick Henry when he wa contacted by member of the Daughters of the American Revolution ( DAR ) who asked if he might expand his idea to encompass more of the American Revolution . This movie is the result . By the time he had finished he had a 14 reel history lesson and there wa n't a trace of Patrick Henry anywhere . We all know the story of the Revolutionary War but Griffith threw in a love story with Patriot farmer Nathan ( Neil Hamilton ) falling in love with Tory aristocrat Nancy Montague ( Carol Dempster , a leading lady for Griffith for many year ) . Complicating matter is the fact that Nancy 's father hate Nathan . . . well not just Nathan , he hate all rebel . It doe not help matter when , during a skirmish on the street of Lexington someone jostle Nathan 's arm causing him to discharge his gun and accidentally wound Nancy 's dad ! Paralelling the love story is the ( mostly true but partially embellished ) story of Capt . Walter Butler ( Lionel Barrymore ) a renegade British officer who feel he owes allegiance to no one . With Thousands of Indians form the Six Nations on his side he hope to crush the colonial and become monarch of his own empire . Comparisons with BIRTH OF A NATION ( 1915 ) are inevitable . The Montague family might just a well be the Cameron 's from the earlier film while Nathan could be a part of the Stoneman family . The sequence of the Battle of Bunker Hill is staged very similarly to a scene in BIRTH OF A NATION with the attacking army , in this case the Redcoats , storming a trench packed with Patriots . The only thing missing is Henry Walthall charging across No Man 's Land to stuff a flag into the muzzle of a cannon . Amazingly enough the battle scene in America seem to lack the energy of the battle scene in BIRTH and fail to draw the audience in . Something is clearly missing . It is n't scope , G.W . `` Billy '' Bitzer 's camera work is quite good . Maybe what is missing is . . . dare I say it . . . sincerity ? The brutality of Capt . Butler and his men is well underscored although much of it happens in long shot or offscreen . Do n't expect any head to be lopped off in closeup like we saw in INTOLERANCE ( 1916 ) . In one scene Butler 's second in command , Capt . Hare ( Louis Wolhiem ) gouge out the eye of a captive colonist . We see only the beginning of the deed , for the remainder the camera focus on Hare 's face a he obviously ha a good time doing this . Lionel had been working with Griffith on and off since 1912 . A story go that he approached Griffith for work and D.W. , knowing the reputation of his famous family , said `` I am not hiring stage actor . '' to which Lionel replied `` And I am nothing of the kind , sir ! '' He make a very good and quite believable villain . Louis Wolhiem appeared with Lionel 's older brother John three time ; in SHERLOCK HOLMES and DR. JEKYLL AND MR. HYDE ( both 1920 ) and later in THE TEMPEST ( 1927 ) . As Capt . Hare his wild staring eye and disheveled hair not only mark him a a villain but make you think he is quite mad also . Neil Hamilton later remarked that America wa his first time on horseback and `` I wa scared to death. '' . He hide his displeasure very well though and we can believe he wa quite the equestrian by the time shooting wa over . Mr. Griffith wa very much in love with Carol Dempster and at one point asked her to marry him . She refused and soon left his stock company , after which her star status gradually waned . Speaking of horse , one accidentally amusing moment which had to be unscripted came during the depiction of Paul Revere 's ride . He ride his horse right up on the front porch of a family to announce `` To arm ! The Regulars are coming ! '' but a he try to leave the horse can not negotiate the step backwards and stumble spilling his rider on the ground ! I am amazed Griffith did not do another take . So is America a classic ? YES ! Do n't wait for July 4th to see it , it is enjoyable anytime .

This is a tongue in cheek movie from the very outset with a voice-over that poke fun at everything French and then produce a rather naif but very brave hero in Fanfan La Tulipe . Portrayed by the splendid Gerard Philippe , the dashing young man belief utterly in the fate curvaceous Lollobrigida foretells - notably that he will marry King Louis XV 's daughter ! Problem is , La Lollo soon find out she too is in love with Fanfan ... Propelled by good sword fight , cavalcade , and other spirited action sequence the film move at a brisk pace and with many comic moment . The direction is perhaps the weakest aspect but the film is so light and take itself so un-seriously that I could not give those shortcoming a second thought . Look out for Noel Roquevert , a traditional heavy in French film , trying to steal La Lollo , making himself a nuisance , and feeding the script to the fortune teller that read La Lollo 's hand ! And what a gem Marcel Herrand is a the megalomanous and lust-driven King Louis XV ! That is not all : So many beautiful woman in one film make me wish I were in France and on the set back in 1952 ! The film may have come out that year but it verve , cheek , superb narration , immaculate photography and the memorable Gerard Philippe ensure that it remains modern and a pleasure to watch . I would not hesitate to recommend it to my grandchild let alone to anyone who love movie in general and swashbuckler in particular ! Do see it !

Really , truly , abysmally , garishly , awful . But actor Clayton Moore ( the movie Lone Ranger ) acquits himself competently a an actor . He 's the only one . A rare treat , for five minute , if you want to plumb the depth of grotesquely transparent special effect , southern California a `` the moon '' ( again and again and again ) , and acting so woodenly inept that it may be a spoof . . . except that it 's clear that it is n't -- no humor here , except unintentionally . The dialogue may be worse than any of these other aspect , and the costume . . . well , enough said . Plot ? What plot ? Bad guy ( well , head bad guy ) and his henchman , including his earthly agent called Krog ( listen carefully or you 'll suspect it 's a spoof on the name of McDonald 's founder Ray Kroc ) and his unbelievably inept gunsels ( who , however , have handgun that never need reloading ; a doe Commando Cody , so there are numerous firefight standoff ) . Enjoy .

Is there anything that happens in this movie that is NOT predictable ? I think not . Basically the movie is cliché after cliché and really nothing ever come a a surprise . It make the movie extremely predictable and because of that the movie is also seriously lacking in tension . So for a thriller it is not tense and unpredictable enough but also a a drama it 's a failure . This is because the movie it story is highly unlikely . I mean , no way this could ever happen in real life , a in the same way a the event occur in this movie . So the movie ha a real suspense and credibility problem . But it truly are the clichés that killed the movie . It wa cringing stuff at time . Everything is so formulaic in this movie . The predator is portrayed a a cool heartless , almost psychopath like sexual frustrated boy and the victim a a naive young woman , who act like she did n't see any of this coming . Everything that happened in the movie wa so obvious and all seemed to happen for a reason . Such a the sequence in which the 'predator ' fix the 'victims ' broken car . That ha got to be one of the oldest clichés out of the book . I knew what the movie tried to achieve after that point . I tried to look a if the teacher and the student were really growing toward each other trough the eye of the other person around them . It wa so incredibly obvious and cheap that I almost wanted to stop watching the movie after that point . The movie is filled with moment like these . The title might suggest that this is a cheap porn movie but this in fact is a sappy made for TV movie . Which mean that everything is slowly happening and the movie spends halve it time on character development and unnecessary sub-plots to make the movie even more drama like . I 'll admit that Elizabeth Berkley is pretty good acting in this movie . She make some of the clichés and event look even almost realistic at time . Her Hollywood career is a good a over after appearing in the Paul Verhoeven movie `` Showgirls '' , so unfortunately she will probably only still appear in movies- and television series like this one . It 's a waste of her talent and she surely deserves better . All of the other character are a disappointment . Corey Sevier play the cliché pretty 'untouchable ' rich boy and the way the husband of the main character is portrayed is even worse . He look more like a sexual frustrated predator than the true predator of the movie . He basically try to have sex with his wife in every sequence . He wake up , he want sex . Before he go to sleep , he want sex . He get home , he want sex . It might be a realistic thing but I do n't know , it just did n't feel right for a movie like this one and the story in general . A cliché filled movie and I ca n't think of any reason why anyone should ever watch this movie . It 's predictable and therefor also lack in suspense and credibility . Not an 'horrible ' movie and it certainly is a watchable one at time but all the weak and cliché element in the movie also make this far from a recommendable one . 4/10

Quirky , independent , theatrical , Christian Slater -- these are all teaser that made me look forward to spending an hour or so `` discovering '' a jewel of a film . Boy , wa I disappointed . Julian Po never get over itself . The film is relentlessly self-conscious . I found myself unable to suspend disbelief for even a moment . The overdone , obviously theatrical set , the overdone , obviously theatrical acting , the overdone , obviously theatrical directing -- well , you get the idea . Allegories do not need to be delivered sledge hammer style . And it 's hard to feel much of anything for Julian Po because we never know much about him . The ridiculous girlfriend , the annoying townsfolk , the idiotic clergyman , the bratty kid -- why would anyone , particularly anyone with a life long ambition to get to the seaside ( Slater 's character ) , decide to stay in such a dismal place ?

Zoey 101 is basically about a girl named Zoey who transfer into an all boy boarding school during the first year that they integrate girl into it . That raw plot line is , I 'll admit , a pretty good idea . Although this show wa meant for child , a five year old could probably point out it fatal flaw . First , Zoey is a cliché character , her being super popular , super attractive , super smart , and there ; s nothing wrong with her ; no girl is like that . It feel like the show wa put the spotlight on Jamie Lynn Spears and increase her fame . Dana , who appeared at the beginning of the first season , is just plain mean . However , in my opinion , she wa probably the most realistic character of them all , which is sad seeing that Dana is never nice . Nicole is too peppy and act like a complete airhead , but mysteriously get straight A 's . Lola seems to be able to fool anything with her Emmy-deserving acting skill . Quinn is supposed to be super smart , and although she is able to create the most unrealistic thing , she is also made out to be weird , and she never get any guy although she is both beautiful and smart , while Zoey , Lola , and Nicole get guy and they 're all beauty and no personality . Chase and Michael are very similar , and I even sometimes get them confused . Logan is unrealistically rich , and hand out million like they 're dollar . Nobody 's that rich . I 've also noticed that every character on the show is mean to that Stacy girl , who doe nothing but act nice to them . That 's not funny ! That 's mean and it just influence young girl to act mean to totally nice people . Finally , the school itself add the frosting to the unreal cake by providing the student with 5-star amenity such a a scenic location , sushi bar , hot lounge equipped with free soda machine , pool & jacuzzi , movie theater , and the allowance for boy and girl to freely go into the other sex 's dorm room . At most boarding school , if a boy were to go into a girl 's dorm or vice versa they would be expelled . In conclusion , Zoey 101 wa poorly written and should have spent a few more year in the drafting process .

This movie is terrible , it wa so difficult to believe that Katie became a heartfelt teenager with the power to save the pity Chinese people , the movie did n't show any convincing argument to prove that . And the rest of the plot did n't make any effort to show u more than a cheap common sense ... The plot is ridiculous and the only thing we can extract from it is that it demonstrate how arrogant a human can be . Katie must have inherited her arrogance from her mother , the most annoying character I have seen for a long time . The acting and scenery were OK , but the plot ruin everything , full of cheap clichés and hypocritical scene , I expect not to see this movie again in my life . Skip this one !
The only thing serious about this movie is the humor . Well worth the rental price . I 'll bet you watch it twice . It 's obvious that Sutherland enjoyed his role .

2005 wa one of the best year for movie . We had so many wonderful movie , like Batman Begins , Sin City , Corpse Bride , A History of Violence ..... Coming up we also got Brokeback Mountain , King Kong .... But if this year the only great movie that came out wa Everything Is Illuminated , then we would n't miss all this year ha brought . The first movie a a director of the talented Liev Schreiber is a delightful , heart-warming , touching drama that also brings one of Elijah Wood 's best role . He is perfect a Jonathan , a curious man that head for Ukraine to find the woman who saved his Grandfather in World War II . Liev Schreiber , who also writes the movie , conduct a masterpiece , with memorable scene and ( a lot of ) funny quote . This here is a genuine mixture of Comedy with Drama , bringing a movie that will be commented year from now . A serious Oscar contender , Everything is Illuminated is a powerful , original , and , why not say , illuminated movie . But there 's one thing you should remember while entering the movie : leave normal behind . This is special. -- -- -- 9/10

According to John Ford 's lyrically shot , fictional biopic of Abraham Lincoln 's life his greatest fault may have been an obtuseness with woman and an ability to dance in `` the worst way . '' Ford 's camera ha only praising view to reveal of Mr. Lincoln 's early life . But for what the film lack in character complexity it make up for in beauty and depth of vision . Uncharacteristically beautiful composition of early film , what could have been a series of gorgeous still frame , Ford ha a unique eye for telling a story . The film sings of the life of a hopeful young man . Henry Fonda play the contemplative and spontaneously clever Lincoln to a tee , one of his best role . The film concern two young men , brother , on trial for a murder that both claim to have committed . In classic angry mob style , the town decides to take justice into their own hand and lynch the pair of them , until honest Abe step into the fray . He charm them with his humor , telling them not to rob him of his first big case , and that they are a good a lynched with him a the boy lawyer . What follows seems to become the outline for all courtroom- murder-dramas thereafter , a Abe cunningly interrogates witness to the delight and humor of the judge , jury and town before he stumble upon the missing link . The film play out like many John Ford movie do : a tablespoon of Americana , a dash of moderate predictability , a hint of sarcasm that you are n't sure if you put in the recipe or if Ford did it himself . Despite the overtly 'Hollywood ' feel of the film , and overly patriotic banter alluding to Lincoln 's future presidency , the film is entirely enjoyable and enjoyably well constructed , if you can take your drama with a grain of salt .

Where to start ... If this movie had been a dark comedy , I would say it wa FANNN-TASTIC ! Unfortunately for me , and anyone else with free time and a buck to spare ( mind you that wa the price I paid , got it from Wal-Mart ) , this movie wa meant to be a thriller . The only THRILL I got wa watching Kirkland 's lousy rendition of Anne Wilkes from Misery sans snowy woodland area . If you want a good laugh , on a rainy Friday night with some friend , then I highly recommend this movie . But if you want to watch something at least half way decent , then do n't even bother . I for one enjoy crappy film , the worse the better in most case . But Wow ... I Meant WOW ! ! The only person in the entire film that did n't stink it up wa the little boy , played by Vincent Berry . The only reason why I even give it 3 star is because it gave me something to do .

Oh dear god . This wa horrible . There is bad , then there wa this . This movie make no sense at all . It run all over the map and is n't clear about what it saying at all . The music seemed like it wa trying to be like Batman . The fact that 'Edison ' is n't a real city , take away . Since I live in Vancouver , watching this movie and recognizing all these place made it unbearable . Why did n't they make it a real city ? The only writing that wa decent was'Tilman ' in which John Heard did a fantastic job . He wa the only actor who played his role realistically and not over the top and campy . It wa actually a shame to see John Heard play such a great bad guy with a lot of screen time , and the movie be a washout . Too bad . Hopefully someone important will see it , and at least give John Heard credit where credit is due , and hire him a lead bad guy again , which is where he should be . on the A List .

Yes , bad acting is n't only one thing to mention . Bad script , not so bad music . Unfortunately .
