I do n't think that many film ( especially comedy ) have added memorable , quotable dialog like MOONSTRUCK . I wo n't illustrate it - you can see a remarkably long list of quote on this thread - but any film that can make subject like the defense of using expensive copper piping rather than brass for plumbing purpose into memorable dialog is amazing to me . It is not the only line that pop up and make an imprint on our memory . How about a restaurant waiter who regret a planned marriage proposal because it will mean the loss of an old bachelor client ? Or a nice , elderly dog fancier encouraging his pack to howl at he moon ? Or Perry ( John Mahoney 's ) description of a female student 's youthful promise a `` moonlight in a martini '' ( my favorite line ) . MOONSTRUCK is a wonderful example of brilliant script , first rate direction , and a good ensemble cast that fit perfectly . There are other example ( the drama THE OX-BOW INCIDENT is another example , but a grimmer one ) . Cher , Olympia Dukakis , Vincent Gardenia , Nicholas Cage , John Mahoney , and Danny Aiello are all involved in plot and cross purpose that examine the nature of love , and how to handle it . Is it a good thing to be totally in love ? Cher and Cage , at the end , seem to think so , but Dukakis know that real love drive the individual crazy ( and Cage get a glimmer of realization of this too , when he and Cher argue outside his home after they return from the opera La Boheme ) . Is infidelity by men a way of avoiding thought of death . Dukakis belief so , and ( oddly enough - although he is not totally convinced ) Aiello . Chance reveals infidelity - Dukakis realizes early that Gardenia 's odd behavior is tied to unfaithfulness , and Cher literally stumble onto Gardenia and his girlfriend at the opera ( but Gardenia also stumble onto Cher 's similar unfaithfulness to Aiello ) . But chance also cause misunderstanding : Fyodor Chaliapin stumble on Dukakis walking with John Mahoney and think that she is having an affair . There are lovely little moment in the film too . Cher 's observation about flower leading to receiving one . Her hearing the argument in the liquor shop and it 's resolution . But best is the sequence of Louis Guss and Julie Bovasso a Cher 's uncle and aunt Raymond and Rita Cappomaggi and Rita 's charming and kind comment to Raymond about the effect of the moonlight on him . It is the sweetest moment of the entire film . It is close to a flawless film . After seeing it over a dozen time in a many year I can only find two point that do not seem a smooth a they should be . When Cher is at Cage 's bakery , his assistant Chrissy ( Nada Despotovich ) mention how she is secretly in love with Cage , but ha been afraid to tell him . Earlier she wa slightly snippy towards Cher , who put her in her place quickly . Yet nothing seems done with this potential rivalry . At the same time , the fact that Cher forgets to deposit her uncle and aunt 's daily business profit is brought in momentarily in the concluding seven minute of the film - but just a quickly dropped . Was there supposed to be some plot line that were dropped , besides one about Cher and Vincent Gardenia working at a homeless man 's shelter a penance ? It is a small annoyance , but I think it is just based on a desire to see more of this film because it is so very good .

One ha to wonder if at any point in the production of this film a script existed that made any sense . Was the rough cut 3 hour long and wa it trimmed into the incoherent mess that survives ? Why would anyone finance this mess ? I will say that Tom Wlaschiha is a good looking young man and he doe what he can with the dialogue and dramatic ( ? ) situation he is given . But character come and go for no apparent reason , continuity is non-existent , and the acting , cinematography , and direction are ( to put it politely ) amateurish . Not One Sleeps is an unfortunate choice of title a it will probably prove untrue should anyone actually attempt to actually watch this film .

This time around , Blackadder is no longer royal ( or even particularly close to being any such thing ) ... instead , rather a butler to the Prince Regent , portrayed by Hugh Laurie ( who replaces Tim McInnerny , who presence is sorely missed , and that hole is never filled ... his character had an innocent charm ... while he wa a bumbling and complete moron , we ca n't help but care for him , which is n't at all true of his replacement ) a being intolerably daft ( which he apparently wa , according to the Trivia page ) , not to mention loud-mouthed and utterly non-threatening . Edmund can now do just about what he plea , and doe so . Why is he so frustrated and angry ( honestly , it get depressing at time ) ? Yes , his master is a buffoon , they always are . He doe n't seem to lack money , nor is he in any danger . In the second series , the Queen wa mischievous and childish , and would cut off someone 's head - or marry them - on a whim . Here there is simply never enough at stake for any of the conflict to be exciting and interesting . There is still commentary and even a little satire . Too often , it seems a if they thought that the history wa funny enough on it own , so they merely restate it , not bothering to actually turn the fact into joke or gag . And I ca n't tell you how many of them I figured out before they were done , literally more than a minute away . It 's not usually a positive when you know the punchline before it is delivered . Baldrick doe n't change from last season ... he 's still rather pathetic and stupid , leading to `` silly '' humor . Frankly , the amount go through the roof . Do n't get me started on the gross-out stuff . The sarcastic , verbal wit can still be great , though much le of it is than before . I 'd say about half of the episode were rather amusing and downright funny , while the other three did n't really get me into them at all . I wa disappointed in how predictable some of the plot and development thereof were ... I could see many of such coming a mile away . Some of the material try way too hard to be funny and wind up coming across a incredibly forced . This continues with the tradition started by `` II '' of letting the plan work out occasionally . The theme is the worst of the bunch , the credit sequence the least creative . All in all , this is , by far , my least favorite of the four . I recommend it to fan of the franchise and of British comedy in general . 7/10

An awful B movie at best with video quality similar to Dead Alive . I challenge anyone who is a `` Aliens ( James Cameron 1986 ) '' Movie fan to count how many time either line or almost entire sequence were ripped off from the first two Alien movie to make this classic piece of garbage . Cast member such a R. Lee Ermey and Ray Wise were the only two actor with any talent and the lead `` Jack Scalia '' wa really absolutely horrible . I think they cast him for his massive cleft chin . I wa also annoyed with the stereotyping of the only black male on the set John Toles-Bey who must look at this movie and just wonder . Look him up sometime a he ha done a lot of interesting movie . But on this movie : The script a I said earlier wa a rip-off of Aliens tweaked and turned into a submarine `` thriller '' . It included such line a `` I got a bad feeling about this '' and `` Kill me '' a one crew member is infected by one of the mutant and his belly start doing the `` alien hop '' just before it pop out of his stomach . There is also a rip-off of the classic `` get some ! '' via Bill Paxton . We also have a bunch of navy grunt running through cave with creepy crawlies popping out of wall . Even the explosion of the mutated creature is very similar to the popping of alien a they charge marine in the movie `` Aliens '' . And the kicker is that some of the mutant spit acid ( a opposed to having acid for blood ) . There are many more major example . So if you want to see this script done well watch the first two classic Alien and Aliens ( With Sigourney Weaver ) . You 'll have a more enjoyable time . The plot could have been interesting and done better if not for confusing sequence in the start of the movie and generally poor editing . Camera shot were pretty dull and honestly it wa n't very hard to stop watching it and walk around the room to get a snack or check email . Many of the interaction between character made little or no sense and went nowhere more often than not . The whole command structure between crew and Capt . wa poorly done . I 'm not even sure if there are Captains in the military that have full control over nuclear sub . In general this just show that there wa little research done for background information to make the movie seem at least a little respectable and there are many other similar example ( like dive depth etc .. ) . If you like horrible movie or are a big fan of Alien and Aliens and want something to just laugh and shake your head at then this movie may be for you . As for me this one is going back on the shelf ... permanently .

Now this is what I 'd call a good horror . With occult/supernatural undertone , this nice low-budget French movie caught my attention from the very first scene . This prof you do n't need wild FX or lot of gore to make an effective horror movie . The plot revolves around 4 cellmates in a prison , and each of these character ( and their motif ) become gradually more interesting , a the movie build up tension to the finale . Most of the action we see through the eye of Carrere , who ha just entered prison and ha to get used to living with these 3 other inmate . I wo n't say much because this movie really deserves to be more widely seen . There a few flaw though : the FX are not that good , but they 're used effectively ; the plot leaf some mystery open ; and thing get very confusing towards the end , but Malefique redeems itself by the time it 's over . I thought his wa a very good movie , 8/10

This is a voice of a person , who just finished watching the second season of Rome , almost at one go , and grabbed the opportunity to see `` what happened next '' - this film conveniently take off where Rome end . If you find Rome an abomination , a foul mouthed screw-fest of little historical accuracy , then you might enjoy Imperium : Augustus . But , if you feel Rome is a good thing , if you enjoy the complicated intrigue , the ambiance of decadence and the work of the actor , then Imperium will obviously appear to you a an overly timid , superfluous and tedious soap opera with not many redeeming factor . There are some actor who for my taste look somewhat better than these in Rome . I especially disliked Rome 's image of Cleopatra a a drug-soaked sex addict . There must have been a great deal of strength and dignity in that woman , and the actress in Imperium suit the part much better . O'Toole and Rampling are good , and so are some others . But then ... If you have come to know - and love - Atia a the super cool bitch , you 'll find the depiction of her in Imperium - a a tear-jerking mother goose in an apron - absolutely ridiculous . There are supposed to be some bitchy character in Imperium , but these actress rely heavily upon staring at the men and nothing much more . You 'll find no interesting female character in this epic . There 's also the painfully comic Maecenas , whom we see a a screeching drag queen , even though there is little historical evidence that he wa such ( he 's once referred to a `` being effeminate in his pleasure '' in the annals ) . The interior are rather meager and rely on clichés upon clichés . Cleopatra 's big hall look like something out of a computer game or a child 's play room in an Egyptian theme park . There 's a looooooooot of really poor 3D graphic , not up to 2003 standard . The action is presented a a series of flashback the aged Augustus is reliving . So we get a quick look at some historical event , some of which are presented well , whereas some are not . An disproportional amount of time is wasted to show Livia a the `` eternal flame '' of Augustus . This affair doe n't sizzle for even a moment , the dialog is superlame and everything is seasoned with tacky tear-inducing musical score . Whatever amount of reality the show aim to capture , every last shred of it is destroyed by the dry synchronized dubbing ( most of the actor are non English speaker ) . Everything is lukewarm in this epic . True , there are more historical accuracy than in Rome , but dramatically speaking , it 's plain boring . The character lack depth and the dialog sharpness . Camera-work is often reduced to static shot , and lighting offer nothing to please your eye . There 's really no-one to love and no-one to hate in Imperium . Regardless of whether you liked or disliked Rome , there are much better film and miniseries around . Ancient Rome : The Rise and Fall of an Empire would be one thing I recommend .

This review is dedicated to the late Keith Moon and John Entwistle . The Original Drum and Bass . There seems to be very little early Who footage around these day , if there is more then let be 'aving it , now-a-days it tends to be of a very different kind of Who altogether , a parody , a shadow of their ( much ) better year . To be fair , not one of them ha to prove anything to anyone anymore , they 've earned their respect and with overtime . This concert footage for me is one of their best . To command an audience of around a 400,000 plus strong crowed take skill , charisma , wit and a whole lot of bloody good music . We all know of the other act on the bill , The Doors ( their last ever show week before Jim Morrison died ) , Moody Blues , Hendrix , Taste , Free and many more . The point being that whoever were there it wa The Who that the majority had come to see . This show wa one year after the Great Hippie Fest of the 1960 's ; Woodstock . The film and record had come out and so had The Who 's greatest work to date , Tommy . The ever hungry crowd wanted a taste , to be able to experience their own unique event , to be able to `` Grove and Love '' in the knowledge that this gig wa their own . To do this you needed the best of what Rock 'n Roll had to throw at the hungrily baited crowd . At two ' o clock in the morning in late August 1970 the M.C . announces , `` Ladies and Gentlemen , a small Rock 'n Roll band from Shepherds Bush London , the 'OO '' . John Entwistle 's body suit is of black leather , on the front is the out line of a human skeleton from neck to toe , Roger dressed in his traditional stage outfit of long tassel 's and long flowing hair , Keith in a white t-shirt and jean , a Pete had his white boiler suit and Doc Martins that he 'd preferred to wear . The Who never stopped their onslaught of High Energy Rock for over two hour , performing theirs and other artist ' greatest track such a Young Man Blues , Shaking ' all Over , and then a on queue , Keith baiting the crowed to `` Shut up , it 's a bleeding Opera '' with Tommy , the Rock Opera . The crowed went wild . This is what they had come to hear , and the Who did n't disappoint , straight into Overture and never coming up for air until the final note of `` Tommy can you Hear me ? '' Amazing . To capture a show of this magnitude of a band of this stature at their peak at a Festival that wa to be the last of it kind anywhere in the World wa a fantastic piece of Cinematic History . The English DVD only come in a soundtrack of English/Linear PCM Stereo , were a in the States , I think , you can get it with 5.1 at least , `` Check local press for detail '' on that , okay . The duration of the DVD is 85 minute with no extra , which is a disappointment . Yes , for a slice of Rock and Festival History this DVD would send you in a nostalgia trip down memory lane the moment you press play , for some of the best Who concert footage a it wa meant to be , Live , Raw and in your Face ! I would have given this DVD ten if it wa n't for the lack of 5.1 , and some extra would have been nice . Thanks Roger , Pete , John and Keith .

This film ha some pretty gorey part like a boob getting bit off and a other big bite . Castle Freak himself is a good monster . I would be scared to piece if he wa coming after me . However , the movie had some dumb part about it . A husband go drunk driving and kill his 3 year old son and blind his teenage daughter . I suppose death is a greater damage than blindness , but you 'd never know that the parent actually feel bad about their daughter being blind . All they care about is that `` J.J. 's dead ! '' While their teenage daughter walk around running into thing and talking about how she 'll never be able to drive a car . The parent are like - `` honey , stop walking around without a guide , you know better than that , '' and then they cry and do n't ever stop being depressed because JJ 's dead . Sounds like favortism to me . The line of dialogue are not very realistic or well done . For example , when a giant crash is heard in the castle , everybody run down into the basement to see what it wa . It wa a huge mirror that crashed to the ground and shattered . The husband run to the broken mirror in horror and plainly say , `` The mirror broke . '' I do n't know , I would say a little more than that if a giant mirror mysteriously crashed to the ground in my castle . The husband and wife have some major relationship problem and it 's funny to watch how dumb they are with each other . No one ever belief the blind girl . Advice : If a blind girl say she hears thing , believe her and do n't tell her to shut up . I think this is the moral of the story . Listen to people when they tell you thing or else you might end up killing yourself to prove your point . Lastly , I thought the best character wa the main police officer . He wa the best actor and character . Everyone else ( besides Castle Freak ) wa pretty run of the mill . 3/10

From the first scene , I wa really excited . `` I can tell this is going to be awesome ! '' I thought . The acting wa so good , I felt a though I wa eaves-dropping on these people ' life . The music too wa exquisitely unsettling . The plot started with a sudden event and then drifted forward ( one could sense ) toward some irrevocable fate . The build wa slow , but I personally love that kind of thing , a long a the quiet tension stay on track and doe n't get derailed before it 's ready to pay off . So everything 's going fine , and then the firework begin , and before you know it , the credit are rolling . `` WHAT ? ! ! ! '' wa all I and my movie-night companion could say . If you understand the director 's intention , the blunt ending doe make sense ( for those of you who have seen the movie already , check out the very fascinating and hilarious interview with Larry Fessenden at filmcritic.com ) , but I ca n't help saying it wa not pulled off quite right . This probably could have been resolved with a little a ten more minute of material before the climax . In any case , it 's too bad . Those ten minute could have made all the difference in the world . ( But for those of you who do n't write or make film , you should know that crafting a story arc with the proper timing is a HUGE pain in the butt , and I am certainly not making this critique from any kind of pedestal ! ) Wendigo feel to me like a masterpiece that wa given up on before it wa finished . But hay , I 'd take a blunted masterpiece any day over an over-produced piece of dog-poo over-compensated with too many digital effect ( like most horror movie these day ) . One other comment . Some of the monster scene left me confused a to whether I should be scared or laughing . I do n't know how to explain it , but there wa a distinctively Monty Python feel about this monster in his more blatent `` monster '' form . Although this may sound like a terrible criticism for a horror movie -- I do n't know , it still worked for me in some crooked way . I will never look at deer antler in the same way again ! : )

What if a platoon of G.I . 's from the Japanese army were to be send back in time 400 year right in the middle of the feudal war that led to the formation of the Tokugawa Shogunate ? Great pitch right ? The movie doe exactly what it say on the tin . Thankfully the writer did n't bother to explain the , usually ridiculous in sci-fi movie , scientific mumbo jumbo of time transport . No how 's or why 's . They just did . However the time transport sequence itself is trippy a hell and quite beautiful , if not a bit dated . Not a silly a one would imagine . The rest of the movie follows the premise to a T. But while it loses a bit of steam with the various subplots that follow the G.I.s arrival to medieval Japan , it pick up with a devastating battle sequence . Undoubtedly it 's the main order of the day . The whole concept and by extension the movie itself , wa probably originated from this simple pitch : what if G.I . 's equipped with the latest in modern warfare were to fight samurai ? And boy doe it deliver . The main battle sequence that span more than half an hour is probably one of THE best of it kind in 70 's action/war movie . Not only is it relentless and exhausting in pace and length , it 's also a terrific mish-mash of style and technique that only unique premise like G.I . Samurai can deliver . I mean , where else would you get the chance to feature tank , ninja complete with shuriikens , a helicopter and samurai in the same shot ? The G.I . platoon led by lieutenant Iba tear literally through hundred of extra , gunning them down with machine gun , mortar , grenade and tank . This mish-mash of style is with one foot firmly rooted in the sprawling jidai-geki epic of Kurosawa 's Kagemusha or Hiroshi Inagaki 's Samurai Banners , while the other is in western action and war movie . There are stylistic touch ( like the wonderful slow-motion shot and bloody violence ) that bring Sam Peckinpah or Enzo G. Castellari circa Keoma to mind . Japanese cinema ha always been influenced by western and other Hollywood work and vice versa , and G.I . Samurai effortlessly turn this east-meets-west melting pot into an exciting film . The film-makers thankfully take the whole thing seriously and the movie benefit immensely from it . Not that tongue-in-cheek mentality is completely absent , it 's just that it doe n't try to pander to so-bad-it's-good audience that enjoy laughing at their movie . The budget wa probably hefty , a it is evident in the hundred of extra , elaborate costume ( very decent for a production that is not a traditional jidai-geki ) and special effect . The camera-work and editing are all top notch , almost better than a movie with no higher artistic ambition deserves . It 's not withouts it flaw either of course . There are many `` song '' scene , where all sort of 70 's Japanese rock , disco and country song play over montage ( there 's a bonding scene , a love-interest scene , a `` war is hell '' scene etc ) . The song themselves are pretty lame and corny and detract from the whole thing . Although it clock at a whooping 140 minute , it fly like a bullet for the most part . Still some scene , flashback and subplots in the first half could have been clipped for a tighter effect . The cast also deserves a mention , featuring such prominent name a Sonny Chiba , Isao Natsuyagi ( Goyokin , Samurai Wolf ) , Tsunehiko Watase ( The Yakuza Papers ) and Hiroyuki Sanada , all of them hitting the right note .

Manipulative drama about a glamorous model ( Margaux Hemingway ) who is raped by a geeky but unbalanced musician ( Chris Sarandon ) – to whom she had been introduced by her younger sister ( played by real-life sibling Mariel ) , whose music teacher he is . While the central courtroom action hold the attention – thanks largely to a commanding performance by Anne Bancroft a Hemingway ’ s lawyer – the film is too often merely glossy , but also dramatically unconvincing : the jury ostensibly take the musician ’ s side because a ) the girl invited assault due to the sensuous nature of her profession and b ) she wa offering no resistance to her presumed aggressor when her sister arrived at the apartment and inadvertently saw the couple in bed together . What the f * * * ? ! ; she wa clearly tied up – what resistance could she realistically offer ? The second half of the film – involving Sarandon ’ s rape of the sister , which curiously anticipates IRREVERSIBLE ( 2002 ) by occurring in a tunnel – is rather contrived : Mariel ’ s character should have known better than to trust Sarandon after what he did to her sister , but Margaux herself foolishly reprises the line of work which had indirectly led to her humiliating experience almost immediately ! The climax – in which Sarandon get his just dessert , with Margaux turning suddenly into a fearless and resourceful vigilante – is , however , a crowd-pleaser in the style of DEATH WISH ( 1974 ) ; incidentally , ubiquitous Italian movie mogul Dino De Laurentiis wa behind both film . It ’ s worth noting how the two Hemingway sister ’ life took wildly different turn ( this wa the film debut of both ) : Margaux ’ s career never took off ( despite her undeniable good look and commendable participation here ) – while Mariel would soon receive an Oscar nomination for Woody Allen ’ s MANHATTAN ( 1979 ) and , interestingly , would herself play a glamorous victim of raging violence when essaying the role of real-life “ Playboy ” centerfold Dorothy Stratten in Bob Fosse ’ s STAR 80 ( 1983 ) . With the added pressure of a couple of failed marriage , Margaux took refuge in alcohol and would eventually die of a drug overdose in 1996 ; chillingly , the Hemingway family had a history of suicide – notably the sister ’ grandfather , celebrated author Ernest , who died of a self-inflicted gunshot wound in 1961 .

This all-but-ignored masterpiece is about the Monkees becoming aware that they are fictional character in a movie ( Head ) , and that everything they do or say had already been written in an ( unseen ) script they seem to be following . Head wa written by Jack Nicholson , Rafelson , and Peter Tork during a three-day LSD trip in a suite at an expensive Hollywood hotel . The other three Monkees only acted in it . They fight this every way they can by doing thing not in the script . They deliberately flub their line , walk off set , tear up scenery , punch other actor for no reason ; and ultimately , commit suicide by jumping off a bridge . For instance , in the rapid flash of a psychedelic party scene , if you watch frame-by-frame , you can see Rafelson sitting next to the camera and cameraman , very deliberately shooting into a mirror . He is revealing that the party is actually fake and is being shot in a studio with actor who suddenly drop out of character and walk away in the middle of a conversation when the Director yell `` cut ! '' The Monkees , however , never drop out of character because those character are also who they really are . That end up being the core of the Revelation soon to come . At every turn , they realize their increasingly-bizarre action were exactly what they were supposed to do in the scripted film they ca n't escape being in . You say they went crazy and walked through the sky ( which turn out to be painted on paper and hung from the ceiling a the set 's background ) ? No problem ! Hey , hey , they 're the Monkees , and those wacky guy just keep monkeying around ! In the end , even their death did not set them free . That wa how the movie wa supposed to end , and their motionless , waterlogged body are fished out of the river , put in another box , and stacked in a film studio warehouse until the character are needed again for another studio production . This is made all the more poignant by the fact that the Monkees really ARE fictional character who forced themselves into the real world . They did it through the power of their music . Ironically , near the end , Peter Tork ha what he rightly see a a hugely profound revelation that solves their problem , but unfortunately , no one listens . Peter realizes : `` It doe n't MATTER if we 're in the box ( the film ) '' . He mean that it doe n't matter if will is free or illusory , and that `` the only important thing is that you just let the present moment occur and occur ... You need to just let 'now ' HAPPEN , a it happens '' , without analyzing or evaluating or judging whether the experience is `` valid '' by some abstract definition . When you ca n't even tell the difference , will being free or not doe n't matter -- tying to figure out if you are the `` real '' you is just a pointless waste of time . I saw this film at a very important time in my life . I wa trying to figure out how to escape being just `` that geeky , creepy nerd girl '' by thinking about it intensely instead of just having fun ( i.e. , sex ) like everyone else did . But the revelation in Head broke my self-imposed recursive trap and helped me more than Rafelson or Nicholson or Tork will ever know . For decade , I 've watched `` Head '' and wished I could thank Pete . Was this a good movie ? Uhh , how about , like ... == < YES > ==

I thought the movie wa a poor documentary . Nothing of substance wa discussed . It seemed to cheapen the idea and did not provide anything new . The film lacked wonder or romance or anything that would really drive one to science . Most scientist appeared `` stereotyped '' and sometimes weird . A woman said that her award did n't matter a whole lot , only child that were helped . She said that after a 10 minute scene where she explained all her award . Playing `` humble scientist '' , are we ? `` I have equation dancing in my head , '' another said . I do n't see how that explains anything to u . It ha n't covered significant effect of science on our culture . Politics of science were barely touched . Not a bad flick for a 10-14 year-olds . Other than that , I felt it wa boring and unrevealing . 4/10

This movie is yet another in the long line of no budget , no effort , no talent movie shot on video and given a slick cover to dupe unsuspecting renter at the video store . If you want to know what watching this movie is like , grab a video camera and some red food dye and film yourself and your friend wandering around the neighborhood at night growling and `` attacking '' people . Congratulations , you 've just made `` Hood of the Living Dead '' ! Now see if a distribution company will buy it from you . I have seen some low budget , shot on video film that displayed talent from the filmmaker and actor or at the very least effort , but this ha neither . Avoid unless you are a true masochist or are amused by poorly made horror movie .

Do n't bother trying to watch this terrible mini series . It is a six hour bore , an unbelievable love triangle between three people who have absolutely no chemistry for each other . There is no heat in this story , no real passion , no real romance . It is a dry , boring , drawn out , and uninspired a they come . And it doe n't even meet the expected level of technical proficiency . Take those six hour of your life and use them for something more worthwhile .

There is a bit of a spoiler below , which could ruin the surprise of the ONE unexpected and truly funny scene in this film . There is also information about the first film in this series . I caught this film on DVD , which someone gave a a gift to my roommate . It came a a set together with the first film in the `` Blind Dead '' series . This movie wa certainly much worse than the first , `` La Noche del Terror Ciego '' . In addition , many of the feature of the first movie were changed significantly . To boot , the movie wa dubbed in English ( the first wa subtitled ) , which I tend to find distracting . The concept behind the series is that in the distant past a local branch of the Knights Templar wa involved in heinous and secret ritual . Upon discovery of these crime , the local peasantry put the Templars to death in such a manner that their eye can no longer be used , thus preventing them from returning from Hell to exact their revenge . We then jump to modern time where because of some event , the Templars arise from the dead to exact their revenge upon the villager whose ancestor messed them up in the first place . Of course , since the undead knight have no eye , they can only find their victim when they make some sort of noise . The Templars were a secretive order , from about the 12th century , coming out of the Crusades . They were only around for about 150 year , before they were suppressed in the early 1300s by the Pope and others . Because they were secretive , there were always rumor about their ceremony , particularly for initiation . Also , because of the way the society wa organized , you did n't necessarily have church official overseeing thing , which meant they did n't have an inside man when thing heated up . And , because of the nature of their trial , they were tortured into confession . The order wa strongest in France , but did exist in Portugal and Spain , where the movie take place . Where the first movie had a virgin sacrifice and knight drinking the blood directly from the body of the virgin ( breast shot here , of course , this is a horror film after all ) , and then , once the knight come back to life , they attack their victim by eating them alive and sucking their blood ; in this sequel , this all disappears . You still have the same scene ( redone , not the same footage ) of them sacrificing the virgin , but they drain the blood into a bowl and drink it from that . Thus , when they come back , they just hack people up with their sword or claw people to death , which I have to say is a much le effective mean of disturbing your audience . There 's also a time problem : in the first film the dating is much closer to the Templars , where here they are now saying it is the 500 anniversary of the peasant burning these guy at the stake , which would date it around 1473 . And the way that the Templars lose their eye is much le interesting a well . In the first , they have them pecked out by crow . Now they are simply burned out , and in quite a ridiculous manner . Oh yeah , and maybe it wa just me , but there seemed to be a lot of people from the first movie reappearing in this film ( despite having died ) . Not really a problem , since the movie is completely different and not a sequel in the sense of a continuation , but odd none-the-less . The highlight of this movie is the rich fellow who us a child to distract the undead while he make a break for the jeep . The child 's father had already been suckered by this rich man into making an attempt to get the jeep , so he walk out and tell her to find her father . It come somewhat out of the blue , and is easily the funniest scene in the film . Of course , why the child doe n't die at this point is beyond me , and disappointed for horror fan . I could n't possibly recommend this film to anyone . It is n't so bad that it becomes funny , so it just end up being a mediocre horror film . The bulk of the film ha several people holed up in a church , each making various attempt to go it alone in order to escape the blind dead who have them surrounded . When the film end , you are not surprised at the outcome at all ; in fact , quite disappointed . If you are into the novelty of seeing a Spanish horror film , see the first movie , which at least ha some innovative idea and not so expected outcome .

The film had many fundamental value of family and love . It expressed human emotion and wa an inspiring story . The script wa clear ( it wa very easy to understand making it perfect for child ) and wa enjoyable and humorous at time . There were a few charged symbol to look for . The cinematography wa acceptable . There wa no sense of experimentation that a lot of cinematographer have been doing today ( which quiet frankly is getting a little warn out ) . It wa plainly filmed but had a nice soft quality to it . Although editing could have been done better I thought it wa a nice movie for a family to enjoy . And the organization of information wa just thrown at you which wa something I did n't like either but in all it wa a good movie .

An ear-splitting movie , a quasi-old-fashioned screwball romp designed to showcase singing star Madonna 's comedic attribute . She doe indeed go far out on the proverbial limb here playing a beyond-vivacious parolee attempting to prove she wa framed for murder ( a body wa found in the trunk of her car after she ran a red light ... big laugh ) . After an energetic animated credit sequence -- which is much more fun than the rest of the picture -- we have nothing to look at but Madonna 's black mascara and red lip set off by her platinum hair and pale complexion . What else is there ? Griffin Dunne seems defeated playing Maddy 's keeper , while the poor-choice supporting cast struggle to get laugh with lousy dialogue . It 's an unfortunate set-back to the talent of director James Foley , who unwisely allows his star to run rampant in the spirit of the nutty slapstick film from the 1930s ( but even Katharine Hepburn in `` Bringing Up Baby '' had a human side ) . Wretched . * from * * * *

A Murder investigation go on back stage while The Vanities , on it opening night , play on to an unknowing audience . Odd combination of musical and murder mystery is worth a look for it cast , it production number , and the sheer novelty of the film . Gertrude Michael ha the showy role of a bitchy actress intent on stopping the marriage between the show 's star , Kitty Carlisle and Carl Brisson , a well a starring in the infamous `` Sweet Marijuana '' number ( which wa also on a 70 Bette Midler album ) . So while the chorus girl shuffle around backstage , bumbling detective Victor McLaglen ogles the girl while he try to solve the backstage murder of an unknown woman . We quickly learn that the maid ( Dorothy Stickney ) love Brisson from afar , that the wardrobe lady ( Jessie Ralph ) is Brisson 's mother , and that the stage manager ( Jack Oakie ) butt into everything . Lots of plot twist among the musical number . The show 's best-known song is `` Cocktails for Two . '' Kitty Carlisle also sings the haunting `` Where Do They Come From ? '' And there 's a weird rhapsody that erupts into a Harlem specialty number featuring Duke Ellington ! Quite the cast . Some terrific acting here , especially Gertrude Michael and Dorothy Stickney . Kitty Carlisle is quite good a well . Brisson is a total zero though . Charles Middleton play Homer , Toby Wing play Nancy , Donald Meek play the doctor , and also see if you can spot Ann Sheridan and Lucille Ball among the show girl .

Daft potboiler do n't come much dafter than this , but it 's a Douglas Sirk movie which make everything alright . Except in this case it doe n't . Based on a sanctimonious novel by the sanctimonious Lloyd C Douglas , ( he wrote `` The Robe '' ) , and already filmed in 1935 with Irene Dunne and Robert Taylor , it 's got more uplift than a cantilever bra . Rock Hudson is the arrogant playboy who not only feel responsible for making Jane Wyman a widow but later is directly responsible for the accident in which she loses her sight . To make amends he take up medicine , becomes a great eye surgeon and restores it . ( No , it si n't quite that daft ; he had planned to become a doctor before becoming an arrogant playboy ) . In between time , they fall in love . Try a I might I ca n't quite find the redeeming social commentary and critique of American more that are supposed to lie just below the surface of Sirk 's film , ( this one is n't too deep ) . On the plus side Rock Hudson is n't half bad , ( I think I am rediscovering him ) , and , of course , it look great , ( in Sirk 's film people live in room the size of cathedral ) . Nothing in this film match the best of his later work and even in soap-opera term this is definitely daytime TV .

If you do n't mind having your emotion toyed with , then you wo n't mind this movie . On the other hand , if you enjoy British crime mystery , following clue and seeing how they all logically fall into place at the end , you 'll be very disappointed . Here are some of the logical inconsistency that lead to that disappointment : * While the police utilize the CCTV camera early on to gather clue about the mystery , the huge truck that stopped and blocked the child 's view just before her disappearance doe n't get caught on camera . This is a critical piece of the mystery . It 's inconsistent to have the car the child were in caught on camera and not the big truck that is so critical to the mystery . * The movie go to great length to show the sophistication of the equipment in tracking down the child 's movement but miss the opportunity to utilize the same sophisticated equipment is tracking down vehicle that may have entered the crime scene from camera-visible location adjacent to the crime scene a part of developing clue . * In England , driving is on the left . The director go out of his way to have the car at the crime scene park on the right , several meter away from the flower kiosk , when it could have easily parked immediately behind , or even on the side ; a the huge truck did . * The police forensics team is so meticulous a to find a discarded cell phone in a sewer drain several mile from the scene of the crime , but ca n't find any blood evidence from the head injury right at the crime scene , even though they secured the scene just hour after the disappearance and with no intervening rainfall . * Search dog were not used at all to find the missing child ; this from the country that is well known for developing the hound dog for search and hunting . * It is illogical that such a highly publicized news story would not turn up the presumably innocent truck driver that stopped at the flower kiosk . * It is illogical that the mother would go to such extreme and expend so much effort to leave carpet fiber clue under her fingernail for her eventual murder investigator even coaxing her daughter to do the same -- while she simply could not have crawled out of the unguarded mobile home . If she had enough sense about her to ask her daughter to get carpet fiber under her nail , she could of just a easily asked her daughter to call out for help or even leave the mobile home that wa in a crowded residential park . * The suspect that abducted the little girl wa portrayed a mentally slow/dimwitted -- justifying his unknowingly drowning of the mother but , he wa smart enough not to cooperate with the police and also fully exercise his right not to self-incriminate . There are more inconsistency like this that will lead to a true sleuth aficionado 's disappointment . 'Five Days ' is a very weak British crime story .

Tashan - the title itself explains the nature of the movie . This type of movie are actually made for flop . What a shame that Yash Raj Films produce such movie those are worthless than C-grade movie . Or even some C-grade movie have better and pleasing story than Tashan . The much hyped and over-confidently promoted Tashan poorly bombed at the box-office which it certainly deserved . In my view , this is the worst movie ever made from honourable Yash Raj Films ' banner . How come they handled such a heavy project to new Vijay Krishna Acharya who ha no actual sense of making action flick ? He tried to imitate Sanjay Gadhvi 's way of making like Dhoom but he suffered at last . The action scene are more like than comic or cartoon movie made for exhausting the audience . The story also loses in it meaning and substance to tenderly win the audience ' heart . In most scene Anil Kapoor reminds me of southern Tamil star Rajnikant in his body language and wordly expression . I am not a fan of neither Saif nor Akshay , but the award of Kareena should have finally gone to Saif '' s hand instead of Akshay . Just from the starting point I expected of it , but at the end it displeased me with the climax truth . Saif is the main behind the whole adventure , while Akshay join in the midst . In any movie , the final should be judged with the whole character of the entire story and the award or say reward should be given to the one who deserves credit . And Tashan loses in this way , and unexpectedly failed to become a hit . Akshay 's ha nothing new to show off his comedian talent here but still reminds of his previous movie . He seriously need to form a new image to his fan that would impress them again and again . In between Saif did a great job in Race , and now he returned again in his hilarious nature through this movie . But he ha fully developed himself in the acting field . And last but not the least about Kareena . She look really hot with bikini dress of which some complain a she became too lean . But I myself do n't think so , instead she became slim . Yes slim ! ! ! it is a good factor for a female to attract the major people ( or say , male ) . Beside them it is nice that Saif 's son Ibrahim appears in the beginning & last a young Saif . I hope now he too will lean forward in target of making acting a his career . Those who like this Tashan they are either mentally immatured or still want to go back to childhood , or say want to be admitted in an asylum . Thumbs down to debutante director Vijay Krishna Acharya who mishandled the project offered by Yash Raj Films . In future he should experiment and study the script minimum of 5 year before going into practical direction . Sorry , I do n't like to rate good star to this type of junk movie .

I wa so happy to learn that Hari Om will finally be theatrically released in 2007 . I saw this film three year ago at the Vancouver International film Festival and have been waiting for it 's release ever since so I could send everyone I know to see it . It 's like taking a trip to India .... colorful , magical , thought provoking . Aside from one rather strange Hollywood style auto rickshaw chase scene this movie is very realistic . This is not a Bollywood style song and dance movie but it doe have drama and romance and humor . The interaction between the Indian taxi driver and the french tourist are a good reflection on the fundamental difference between Eastern and Western life style and philosophy . The character are a little broadly drawn but the acting wa very good . Visually this movie is a treat a you really do get a sense of what driving through Rajasthan is like ... dreamlike . Sometimes it 's hard to believe everything you are seeing and experiencing is real ... the movie ha that same quality . Great soundtrack too !

I still ca n't believe that Wes Craven wa responsible for this piece of crap.This movie is worse than `` Deadly Friend '' .The plot is stupid , the acting is mediocre and the film is deadly dull.I do n't know why Wes Craven hate his debut `` Last House on the Left '' -an absolute masterpiece of the genre and like ( probably ) this turkey.Do n't get me wrong , I really like some of his movie , but it wa a real torture sitting and watching this .

I had my doubt about another love story wherein disabled individual find meaning and redemption through honest communication . And it 's still not at the top of my list . But the performance from Helena Bonham Carter and Kenneth Branagh and exemplary , almost stunning , and rescue this from being just another tear-jerker . Carter 's depiction of an ALS victim is strong , perhaps even overdone at time ( sometimes her dialog dissolve into undistinguishable muttering ) . But the overall effect is commendable and rewarding . Branagh may be the perfect compliment to her performance .

Warning : Does contain spoiler . Open Your Eyes If you have not seen this film and plan on doing so , just stop reading here and take my word for it . You have to see this film . I have seen it four time so far and I still have n't made up my mind a to what exactly happened in the film . That is all I am going to say because if you have not seen this film , then stop reading right now . If you are still reading then I am going to pose some question to you and maybe if anyone ha any answer you can email me and let me know what you think . I remember my Grade 11 English teacher quite well . His name wa Mr. Krisak . To me , he wa wise beyond his year and he always had this circuitous way of teaching you thing that perhaps you were n't all too keen on . If we did n't like Shakespeare , then he turned the story into a modern day romance with modern day language so we could understand it . Our class room wa never a room , it wa a cottage and we were on the lake reading a book at our own leisure time . This wa his own indelible way of branding something into our sponge-like mind . I begin this review of Vanilla Sky with a description of this brilliant man because he once gave u an assignment that ha been firmly etched in my mind , like the phone number of a long lost best friend , and it finally made some sense to me after watching The Matrix . Now if I did n't know better , I would have thought that the Wachowski brother were really just an alias for my teacher Mr. Krisak . But giving them the benefit of the doubt , we 'll assume it wa n't him . But that wa the first time this assignment wa anything more than impalpable . He had asked u to prove to him and to ourselves that were real . Show me how you can tell that you are real . This got the class spouting off all of the usual idea that I 'm sure you can imagine . Everything from pain , to sense of touch to sense of loss to sense of hunger were spouted off to our teacher to prove to him that we were real . After every scenario that we gave him , he would come back with the one answer that would leave u speechless . `` What if you are nothing but someone else 's dream ? '' What if you were someone else 's dream ? What a messed up question that is . This wa a question/scenario posed to u about 15 year ago , before the astronomical use of the Internet and rapid advancement of computer . How possible could it seem back then ? But if you look at today 's technology , now ask yourself , what it you were a part of someone else 's dream . Another brilliant but surreal film this year , David Lynch 's Mulholland Drive explored similar area . But Vanilla Sky go deeper than any other film could hope to . In short this is one film that will literally ( if you let it ) blow your mind from all of the possibility that surround you . Open your Eyes . Tom Cruise play David Aames , a young , hot shot , righteous , full of himself publisher and owner of several magazine . He inherited this from his father and although he ha talent and business savvy , his board of governers , the Seven Dwarfs , think he is a rich dink born with a silver spoon in his mouth . They feel he ha done nothing to deserve the pinnacle of success that each and every one of them belief should go to them . Early in the film we meet one of David 's gorgeous toy named Julie Gianni , played with pernicious but bombastic perfection by Cameron Diaz . David and Julie play a good game , both claiming they are just there to use each other and are not the slightest bit interested in a monogamous , committed relationship . This is the type of relationship commensurate with David 's other fling he 's had in the sexual prime of his life . And although both talk a good game , we can tell that only one is really telling the truth . Next we meet Brian Shelby , played with a stroke of genius by Kevin Smith 's good buddy Jason Lee . Brian is writing a book that David is going to publish but they are also very good friend . This is something that David ha very little of in his life and you can sense a real caring for one another early on in the film . Brian ha one famous line that he keep telling David over and over again . And that is `` the sweet ai n't so sweet without the bitter . '' He go on to tell him that one day he will find true love and not just this part time lover status that he seems to perpetrate with all of the floozy who inhabit his bed for a night or two . At David 's huge birthday bash , ( so huge that the like of Steven Spielberg wish him a happy birthday ) Brian enters with his date , Sofia Sorrano , played of course by Penelope Cruz with what ha to be the best performance of this year by an actress . This is a bash by invite only and at first David and Sofia seem intrigued with one another . And in typical David fashion , despite his best friend being there , he begin to flirt with Sofia . To complicate thing , Julie show up uninvited and begin spying on David . David then spends the night with Sofia , but they only talk and draw caricature of one another . There is no hanky panky . The next day , a David is leaving Sofia 's apartment , he is greeted by Julie , who offer him a ride and from there ....... well , I think we have all seen the commercial . That is all I will really say about the plot , because from here the film tease u with what is reality and what is blurred perception . We are introduced to a character played by Kurt Russel and a few other shady character that all play a part in this labyrinth like haze . There is a subtext of death and possible panacea-like cure-all that may or not be able to create the possibility of eternal life . This is just one of the intriguing possibility the movie offer u , but it doe n't end there . Like many movie seem to thrive on today , this film ha a secret . Sixth Sense may have began this craze , but look even further back and you can maybe thank Angel Heart for starting the craze . Regardless of how it originated , Vanilla Sky ha one of it 's own surreptitious gut buster . And what make this one so much fun is that the film give you many obvious clue along the way but not enough to give you an apodictic solution to the gauntlet of truth and lie you have just put yourself through . I have seen this film four time and every time it ha been because I want to see if there is something more I can pick up , something more I can understand . To be able to work your mind in the theater , to enable it to open up to new possibility is something rare in a film . All of the ersatz so called `` Best Pictures of the year '' have been good but nothing spectacular . They lack substance . A Beautiful Mind wa intriguing but flat , The Royal Tenenbaums wa interesting but uneven . Vanilla Sky is a rarity because it is a film that leaf you yearning for more yet guarantee your satisfaction because the film and those that made it care about it . I know this film ha received mixed review but I just think that those who do n't like it do n't quite understand it . This is what film making is supposed to be like . This is what a film is supposed to do to you . It is supposed to make you feel something . Most of the other film this year have been just empty space . This one is n't . 10 out of 10 The best film of the year . I would love to see this get nominated for best picture and I would love to see Cruz up for best Actress , Diaz for best supporting , Cruise for best actor and Jason Mewes should be a shoe in for best supporting actor . Cameron Crowe should there a well . None of this may come to pas , and that is a shame . This is one film that should not be missed . And on a final note , I am quite sure Mr. Krisak would like this film and maybe this is the one film that may answer his question . Can you prove you are real ? Or are we just a figment of someone 's imagination ? Are we artificially transplanted for someone else 's bemusement ? This is a film that spawn more question than it doe answer . And I 'm sure that is just fine with him . Open Your Eyes

I would reccomend this film to everyone . Not only to the fan of the rocker Luciano Ligabue , but to all film-buffs . Because it 's sincere , moving , funny and true . Because Ligabue is a born storyteller and a film lover , and every frame of his film is made with love and care . Because his character are loved and ask to be loved . Because most of the Italian debut film are lousy and this one , done by an outsider , is a real joy to watch and to listen at . Because Stefano Accorsi is gorgeous and reminds me of Andrea Pazienza , who wa , like Freccia , beautiful and talented and good and lost his life because of the heroin , that Ligabue show a it is , unglamorous and ugly , without indulging in easy moralism . Because it 's a film that speaks to our heart , our ear , our soul . And because I lived the experience of the FM radio and it wa exactly like that . Thanks , Luciano !

Recognizing the picture of the diner on the cover of the DVD made me realize that this wa a local movie . The word Detroit in the title furthered my suspecions and I did some looking up of thing and yes , a local movie it wa . So I picked it up . Someone I knew actually knew some of the producers/director ( dont remember which ) and said the producers/directors got people to PAY to be in this movie . Brilliant ! What a great idea . The movie maker get some capital to do the movie with , thanks to their cast and crew . Then the investor ( cast , crew , others ) get some of the profit , I 'm imagining . Profits ! Um anyways . This film totally underwhelmed me . The special effect were special a in special child who ride the small bus to school . The acting wa very amusing , not intentionally however . There 's a great line where a guy say `` well ? this bone aint gon na smoke itself ! '' a a pickup line . Unfortunately that is the only fun part of the whole film . The story ? Well , I sort of followed it about 3/5 of the way in , then everything stopped making sense and a we were sitting there watching it , it suddenly ended . I mean a in , .. no resolution of anything .. like they ran out of time . `` Sorry folk , out of time , goodnight ! '' We sat there baffled and booing , and threw in another film . Then about 20 minute later a neighbor of mine showed up .. with one of the guy from the movie ! We threw it back in and he ( the actor ) gave u a running commentary , which wa awesome because he totally ripped on the movie ! What more could you ask for ? ? The most absurd scene for me wa a motorbike chase scene were it wa so dark that it could have literally been a guy running past with a flashlight and not a motorbike at all . That and the jaw droppingly in your face sudden ending is enough to make you howl . In pain ! The zombie looked le like zombie than my coworkers do . And I dont work at the morgue either . So , I recommend seeing this if you can get someone from the movie to come over and give you a running commentary a to all the thing that went on behind the scene and make sure this person hate the movie because that just add to the fun . Otherwise , give this one a pas . Rent something like Feeders if you want a jaw droppingly bad in a funny way movie ...

One hour , eight minute and twelve second into this flick and I decided it wa pretty lame . That wa right after Hopalong ( Chris Lybbert ) drop on his horse from a tree to rejoin the good guy posse . I wa pretty mystified by the whole Hopalong Cassidy/Great Bar 20 gimmick which did n't translate into anything at all . Obviously , the name Coppola in the credit could n't do anything to guarantee success here , even with more than one listed . If you make it to the end of the film , you 'll probably wind up asking yourself the same question I did . What exactly wa the hook with the glove ? What 's up with the rodeo scenario ? Who wa The Stranger supposed to represent ? Why did they make this film ? I could probably go on but my energy 's been drained . Look , there 's already a Western called `` The Gunfighter '' from 1950 with a guy named Gregory Peck a the title character . Watching it will make you feel a good a watching this one make you feel bad . That one I can recommend .

Caddyshack II is NOTHING compared to the original Caddyshack . But , there are legitimate reason for it . ( 1 ) Rodney Dangerfield wa supposed to be the ace of this film BUT he did n't like the script , wanted to change it , his request wa denied , so he did n't do the film . ( 2 ) It wa low budget , Bill Murray had grown to superstar status . Ted Knight passed away in 1986 , and Chevy Chase the `` so called ace '' of the first movie ( although it wa Rodney all the way ) couldn't't be on more than 5 minute , because it would cost too much to pay him . BUT you had Dan Aykroyd , Robert Stack , Randy Quaid and Jackie Mason , all serviceable substitute , who none had their best performance .

The youthful group in `` St. Elmo 's Fire '' who just graduated from college barely seem able to make it through high school much le four year at any prominent university . For the most part , these kid are irresponsible , selfish , greedy and stupid , yet co-writer and director Joel Schumacher appears to hold them up a touchstone for a generation . With a now-outdated cast of `` up and comer '' , a background score that sound awfully similar to that of `` Terms Of Endearment '' , and writing which lord the smugness of this circle over u , `` Fire '' is a paltry blaze , one that get even more embarrassing a the year pas on . * 1/2 from * * * *

The plot of The Thinner is decidedly thin . And gross . An obese lawyer drive over the Gypsy woman , and the Gypsy curse cause him to lose and lose weight ... to the bone . OK , Gypsy curse should be entertaining , but the weight-losing gone bad ? Nope . Except Stephen King think so . And Michael McDowell , other horror author and the screenwriter of this abysmal film , doe so , too . The lawyer is not only criminally irresponsible , he is fat too , haha ! The Thinner is like an immature piece of crap for a person who moan how he/she ha never seen anything so disgusting than fatness . Hey , I can only say : Well , look at the mirror .

American Pie ha gone a long distance from the first . At first i believe the actor do n't have a clue what their doing and instead it 's just a remake of a college party gone nut . Story set out a two freshman college guy ( featuring the young stifler ) setting out the dream of attending college just to experience the late night party , sex and of course the booze . The plot is stupid and come along way away from the original pie . In fact they did n't once again feature an apple pie somewhere in the film . Luckily i work in a video store and can rent for free . But please remember it is a waste of time unless you enjoy brainless sex film with absolute nudity and insane drinking . I 'm a teen myself and i believe even Evan almighty would 've been a better choice instead .

The best movie about friendship ! Especially between an AIDs infected person and a `` normal `` person . This is a great movie for everyone to see even though there is strong language used . I have seen it 25 time .

Revolt of the Zombies ha no redeeming feature . I 'm tired of people arguing that it 's not that bad , and that the effect must have packed more of a punch in 1936 . I suspect this is n't true : it 's not like IQ 's have risen sharply in the last 7 decade . The average viewer in 1936 wa probably just a bored by this rubbish a the average viewer today . Why ? Just try watching the first scene , and count the pause between thing happening , the awful choice of when to cut to close-up , the slapdash editing that seems to include an extra two second on every shot to pad out the running time . Pay attention to the utterly redundant dialogue : `` I 'm going to make some tea/go outside/read my book now . '' `` Are you ? '' `` Yes , I am . '' That sort of exchange happens several time . Normally I would love that , being a HUGE fan of bad movie , but watch the listless actor mumbling their trite and tedious line , and all desire to laugh at the movie slowly fade away . This sort of disinterested , pot-boiling time-waster is far worse than energetic , imaginative mind-blowers like Plan Nine From Outer Space or Santa Claus Conquers The Martians . Those who claim that this is `` better '' than those more interesting movie have a backwards idea of entertainment . This movie is not bad in the sense that your jaw hang open in astonishment : it 's bad in the sense that your eye slowly close in boredom . Which is far worse .

Hilariously inept - like `` She Wore A Yellow Ribbon '' remade by five-year-olds . Spoilers ahead : Despite it title , and the high bodycount , `` Slaughter Trail '' is in fact a musical with Injun battle instead of dance number . If you ever wondered what Ed Wood might have done with a B-movie budget , this film should answer your question . Some decision may have been bad only in retrospect , such a filming in the short-lived Cinecolor process , which resulted in face changing hue within the same shot . But there wa definitely some ill-advised skimping on the film 's main set , a cavalry fort that seems to be partly a Norman castle . Terry Gilkyson , who later wrote the 'The Bare Necessities ' for Disney 's `` The Jungle Book '' , supply a score full of original ditty which would have been wonderful for a cartoon but which fit Western action like a fuzzy slipper stuck in a stirrup . One song tell how `` horse hoof pound , and their melody sound , like the hoofbeat serenade '' ... during a dead-serious scene of a cavalry patrol . Other song literally narrate the story shot by shot , introducing character , describing their mood and gesture - a they happen on screen - and even stop to advertise the Cinecolor process ( ! ) The script sends ferocious Navajos on the warpath to avenge the killing of two of their band by an outlaw trio . By the end of the film , what look like a hundred Navajos and cavalryman have bitten the dust ( thanks to repeated footage of the same character dying over and over . ) But the chief is satisfied once he see the trio of badguys have been slain . As the singer helpfully informs those of u who were n't paying attention , the Navajos ride away , their battle called off . The cavalry captain , surrounded by the corps of his fallen comrade , cheerily wave his appreciation . The direction could most charitably be described a wooden , or more to the point , Wood-en . Navajos are consistently shot off their horse in pair -- never just one . Virtually every red man on foot dy by throwing his hand in the air and keeling over . The film also employ the most cautious stuntmen in Hollywood , who crouch before dropping off a one-story roof ( and still fail to stick the landing ) or turn to look behind them a they slide , `` dead '' , down a rocky slope . The star is Brian Donlevy , who surely deserves an Oscar for not blushing . After the endless final battle scene -- `` climax '' is scarcely the word -- he scan a list of the dozen of his trooper killed , and shrug , `` It could 've been a LOT worse . '' Trooper Andy Devine get to sing and robber/murderer Gig Young laugh at Andy 's antic ... which lead a character who had been held up by masked bandit to rat Gig out : `` I 'd know that laugh anywhere ! '' And lest anyone forget just what a nasty piece of work Howard Hughes could be , recall that a head of RKO , Hughes wa first in line to blacklist original star Howard Da Silva when HUAC denounced him . It would take Hughes another six year to finish running that once-celebrated studio into the ground , but it did n't help thing when he insisted on reshooting Da Silva 's every scene for this film , substituting Donlevy . It wa nearly a decade before Da Silva wa able to work in Hollywood again . But all thing considered , for getting him out of `` Slaughter Trail '' , he should have sent Hughes a thank-you note .

Oh man . If you want to give your internal Crow T. Robot a real workout , this is the movie to pop into the ol ' VCR . The potential for cut-up line in this film is just endless . ( Minor spoiler ahead . Hey , do you really care if a film of this quality is `` spoiled ? '' ) Traci is a girl with a problem . Psychology ha developed name for it when a child develops a sexual crush on the opposite-sex parent . But this girl seems to have one for her same-sex one , and I do n't think there 's a term for that . It might be because her mother Dana is played by Rosanna Arquette , whose cute overbite , neo-flowerchild sexuality and luscious figure make me forgive her any number of bad movie or unsympathetic character . Here Dana is not only clueless to her daughter 's conduct ; she seems to be competing for the gold medal in the Olympic Indulgent Mother competition . It 's possible that Dana miss Traci 's murderous streak because truth be told , Traci seems to have the criminal skill of a hamster . It 's only because the script dictate so that she manages to pull off any kind of a body count . A particularly hilarious note in this movie is the character of Carmen , a Mexican maid who is described by Dana a around so long she 's like one of the family although she dress in what the director thought would say , `` I just fell off the tomato truck from Guadalajara . '' Carmen is so wise to Traci 's scheming , she might also wear a sign saying , `` Hey , I 'm the Next Victim ! '' Sure enough , Traci confronts Carmen a Carmen is making her way back from Mass , and bop her with one of those slightly angled lug wrench that car manufacturer put next to your spare a a bad joke . I rather suspect than in real life those thing are a useless a a murder weapon a they are for changing a tire . In another sequence , Arquette wear a flimsy dress to a vineyard , under cloudy sky , talking to the owner . Cut to her in another flimsy dress under sunny sky , talking to the owner 's brother . Then cut to her wearing the first dress , in the first location , under cloudy sky - but it 's supposed to be later . You get the picture . We 're talking really bad directing . As for skin , do n't expect much , although Traci doe own a nice couple of bikini . For those looking for a trash wallow , 8 . For anybody else , 1/2 .

This is an excellent , suspenseful , murder-mystery movie . Not only wa the plot full of suspense and intrigue but you get to see gorgeous Ryan Gosling for a couple hour , what 's not to love ! Also , Sandra Bullock is good in this movie - I 've always been a fan of hers , ( I just wish she had n't decided to be in `` The Lake House '' which wa horrible , but that 's another story altogether ) . Obviously since there are thousand of other murder/horror movie out there , there are bound to be similarity between them , no need to bash this movie for having some similarity to at least a few that have already been made . Anyway , this is a great movie for those of you that actually enjoy `` scary '' movie , it 's a little dark and twisted but overall a great movie ! ! !

Brides are dying at the altar , and their corps are disappearing . Everybody is concerned , but nobody seems to be able to figure out why and how this is happening , nor can they prevent it from happening . Bear with me . Bela Lugosi is responsible for this , a he is extracting spinal fluid from these young woman to transfuse his ancient wife and keep her alive . Continue to bear with me . Finally , the authority figure out that somebody must be engineering the death and disappearance , but of course , they ca n't figure out the improbable motive . Let 's just ignore the ludicrous pseudoscience and move on ... If you can get through the first twenty minute of this mess , you will be treated to Lugosi whipping his lab assistant for disrespecting one of the bride he ha murdered , explaining that he find sleeping in a coffin much more comfortable than a bed , and other vague parody of real horror film ( the kind with budget and plot ) . Anyhoo - a female journalist follows her nose to the culprit ( and remarkably the inept police are nowhere to be seen ! ) , and then the fun really start . The cinematography and acting are OK . There are a lot of well dressed , very good looking people in this film . The directing is fair , and the script is a little better than the material deserved . Nevertheless , this film fails to sustain the interest of all but the most hardened b-film fan . The best thing about it .... It doe eventually end , but not soon enough .

Dean Cain 's performance wa an usual excellent . He get better with every film he doe . My only question at the end of the film wa what happened to Bob , Camilla and the baby . It wa left for the viewer to decide

Wow , this is in my opinion the best sitcom since Friends . If you have had a crap day just sit yourself down with a beer ( if you are old enough that is.if not a root beer will have to do . ) and watch a couple of episode , it 's the perfect recipe for happiness . The thing I like most is that everybody in the show is very funny and they all have fantastic comedy timing . After a while you become attached to the character and really care about them . I think the secret to the show success is that they have an enviable life . Doug is fat but still happy with it , he love his wife his job and his friend . The father in law is the fly in the ointment but hey nothing perfect .

`` Ah Ritchie 's made another gangster film with Statham '' thought the average fan , expecting another Snatch/Lock Stock ; expecting perhaps a couple of temporal shift , but none too hard for `` me and the lad '' to swallow after a few beer . No laugh other than those you may make yourself from the considerable violence ( and if that float your boat , so be it ) but sharp solid direction , excellent dialogue , and great performance . My favourite - Big Pussy from The Sopranos , always a reliable hood .

I saw The Glacier Fox in the theatre when I wa nine year old - I bugged my parent to take me back three time . I began looking for it on video about five year ago , finally uncovering a copy on an online auction site , but I would love to see it either picked up by a new distributor and rereleased ( I understand the original video run wa small ) , or have the right purchased by The Family Channel , Disney , etc . and shown regularly . It is a fascinating film that draw you into the story of the life struggle of a family of fox in northern Japan , narrated by a wise old tree . The excellent soundtrack compliment the film well . It would be a good seller today , better than many of the weak offering to child 's movie today .

Would you be surprised if I told you this movie deal with a conspiracy ? No ? How about if I told you the ringleader wa a shadow puppet . What ? You do n't believe me ? ... OK . Yes , I made that up . It 's too bad , this movie could have used a sense of humor . I understand Charlie Sheen doing this at the time - another movie equaled more money - a for Donald Sutherland and Linda Hamilton ... why ? Do n't even get me started on Stephen Lang . He wa so much fun a the Party Crasher in 'The Hard Way ' and now this junk . Ah no matter . Everyone involved should feel ashamed . If you aim to make a bad movie and succeed - it 's twisted - but I seriously doubt that wa what they were aiming for here . Flat out , the story stink and we 're actually supposed to take this yak seriously . Makes you wonder if this movie even had a glimmer of hope . Seriously , I doubt it and in an industry so tight with the purse string how this got green lit in the first place is beyond me . Maybe even more scary is how this dog pile made it 's way to theater ! ? Oh ... Sam Waterson , how great you are in Law & Order . Why are you here ? Demoting yourself to the role of the President of the United States who might I add get to be shot at by a remote control biplane controlled by the gonzo assassin . Then again this is a masterpiece of work from George P. Cosmatos who 's `` directing '' credit include Rambo : First Blood Part II amongst other gem . Hmm .... case in point ?

In the 2nd of his Historical Martial Arts film , Chiba portrays his real life sensei Mas Oyama . The film even recreates Oyama 's incredible feat of killing a raging bull with his bare hand ( Oyama did this feat over 50 time in real life ) . Dynamic fight choreography featuring authentic Kyokushinkai technique . Ironically this is one of the rare Sonny Chiba film in which he DOES N'T tear out or rip off body part of opponent . A must see for Sonny Chiba fan definitely one of his top 5 film

Sure , we all like bad movie at one time or another , and we in fact enjoy them , This however , wa n't even a guilty pleasure , it wa just crap . He then proceeded to show his script to equally high/drunk individual . Overall , this movie wa so bad , predictable , and unoriginal I could n't get through 20 minute of it before I turned it off .
