Almost a good a calling him Fat Man , and having a fat guy walk around in a superhero outfit .

A comedy that worked surprisingly well wa the little British effort `` The Divorce Of Lady X ( 1938 ) '' . It mark the first pairing of Laurence Olivier and Merle Oberon , before that little film about uncontrollable passion on the 19th century English moor . And while Olivier and Oberon are not particularly well-suited to screwball comedy , it all flow along nicely . Oberon is Leslie , a young woman who end up in priggish divorce lawyer Logan 's ( Olivier ) hotel suite by way of a nasty English fog preventing travel . She doe everything possible to irritate him -- but , in the crazy way film go , he fall for her . And she fall for him . But a serious case of mistaken identity occurs when Oberon 's `` Lady X '' ( that 's all she leaf Oliver in a note ) is thought by Olivier to be a married woman . To make matter worse , and more amusing , Lord Mere ( Ralph Richardson ) go to Olivier wanting a divorce from his wife whom dear Larry think must be Oberon ! There is some nice battle-of-the-sexes dialogue , and fun exploration of sexual politics . You can see that Olivier is not too confident with the comedy , but in true Olivier he 's a consummate professional , and delivers . And he handle the screwball twist and turn , maybe not with ease , but with gusto . Oberon wa no great shake a an actress , but she wa usually competent enough , and despite their reputed off-screen dislike of her , worked well with Olivier . This wa filmed in early Technicolour that look very primitive today ( everyone look even whiter than Michael Jackson ) , but perhaps the print need cleaning up .

This movie is one of the most provocative Jesus movie I have ever seen . It doe not seek to tell the whole story , but only to portray an interpretive expression of the last day of Jesus Christ . It is darkly witty , playful and seriously faithful to element of the Jewish tradition and to modern scriptural interpretation . Judas is much more ordinary than other portrayal , not the dark and sinister evil that we sometimes imagine , but a grossly mistaken man , horribly misguided in his zeal . Chris Saranden 's Jesus is playful and serious , faithful and committed -- very human while also divine . The final dialog is thoughtfully done and serf a the kind of small talk that two powerful men might do when they have just committed an atrocity . I would watch this movie again and recommend it to others .

This is one of the most ridiculous western that Hollywood ever made . Gary Cooper play 'Reb Hollister ' , a former confederate officer wanted by the law . He meet up with a moron named Weatherby , played by Leif Erickson , who is a U.S . Marshal with no knowledge of firearm . Weatherby is on his way to Dallas to see his fiancee , Tonia Robles , played by Ruth Roman . Senor Robles , Tonia 's father , ha plenty of men , but they ca n't seem to be able to keep an eye on his cattle , which are regularly rustled by the Marlow brother . Will Marlow , played by Raymond Massey , ha financed the loan on the Robles estate , making thing completely absurd . He even ha the power to call for mortgage payment before they 're due , simply because he feel like it . Since Weatherby is a Boston boy who ca n't fight , since he only became a Marshal so he could visit his fiancee , Tonia , ( Just another instance of more plot nonsense . Are we to assume that you only have to pas a written test to get this job ? Wait a minute , this guy could n't pas the written test either . ) he switch identity with Reb Hollister , who of course is an expert gunman . Reb take the liberty of greeting Weatherby 's girl with a passionate kiss , while Weatherby look on like an idiot . Gary Cooper , Hollywood 's number one stud , is in fine form here a Reb . Before the movie 's done , not only doe he take Weatherby 's job , he steal his fiancee also , and Ruth Roman a Tonia , fall for him so hard and so fast that she give chump Leif Erickson the brush-off before the film little more than half over . There is n't a shred of plot credibility in the whole film , so despite the good cast and lush photography , the film is a dud . And Cooper 's character is a complete heel to boot . The film also star Barbara Payton a Brant Marlow 's girl , a beautiful and talented actress who squandered away her chance , unfortunately , by making too many headline for the wrong reason . I strongly suggest you pas this one up .

This kind of `` inspirational '' saccharine is enough to make you sick . It telegraph it sentiment like the biggest semaphore on earth . It remove from the audience it own interpretation and feeling by making the choice for it . The big finish is swimming in weeping orchestration that must supposed to work like jumper cable on a dead car ; I guess you 'd need such prompting to feel if you 're stupid enough to watch a film a simple-minded and sappy a this . Streep glow and you wonder if she really ha the depth of feeling on display or if it 's just that -- -a display , switched on and off like a light . Because I ca n't for the life of me see how she could possibly find life in such a dud of film . Even though it 's based on a true story , and an inspirational one at that I 'm sure , the set-up , execution and performance play like a third-rate TV movie or half-witted high school drama .

I had watched snippet from this a a kid but , while I purchased Blue Underground 's set immediately due to it being a Limited Edition , only now did I fit it in my viewing schedule - and that 's mainly because Bakshi 's American POP ( 1981 ) just turned up on late-night Italian TV ( see my review of that film below ) ! Anyway , I found the film to be a quite good sword-and-sorcery animated epic with especially impressive-looking backdrop ( the rather awkward rotoscoped character were , admittedly , le so ) with a rousing if derivative score . The plot , again , wa n't exactly original , but proved undeniably engaging on a juvenile level and the leading character well enough developed - especially interesting is the villainous Ice-lord Nekron and the enigmatic warrior Darkwolf ; the hero and heroine , however , are rather bland stereotype - but one can hardly complain when Bakshi and Frazetta depict the girl a well-endowed ( her bra could be torn off any second ) and half-naked to boot ( her tiny panty are forever disappearing up her as ) ! Still , it 's clearly an action-oriented piece and it certainly delivers on this front ( that involving Darkwolf being particularly savage ) ; the final showdown though brief , is also nicely handled and see our hero astride pterodactyl assaulting the villain ' lair inside a cave . In the long run , apart from the afore-mentioned Frazetta backdrop , the main appeal of this movie for me now is it nostalgia factor a it transported me back to my childhood day of watching not just film like CONAN THE BARBARIAN ( 1982 ) and THE BEASTMASTER ( 1982 ) but also animated TV series such a BLACKSTAR ( 1981-82 ) and HE-MAN AND THE MASTERS OF THE UNIVERSE ( 1983-85 ) . As for the accompanying THE MAKING OF `` FIRE AND ICE '' ( TV ) ( Mark Bakshi , 1982 ) * * 1/2 : Vintage featurette on the sword-and-sorcery animated film which is only available via the washed-out VHS print owned by Ralph Bakshi himself ! It go into some detail about the rotoscope technique and also show several instance of live-action 'performances ' ( in a studio ) of segment from the script - which would then be traced , blended in with the background and filmed . Still , having watched several such behind-the-scenes featurettes on the art of animation ( on the Disney Tins and the Looney Tunes set , for instance ) , it 's doe n't make for a very compelling piece ...

If you are under 13 or above 13 and pretty intoxicated , you 'll enjoy D-war . If you are a seriously dedicated fan of all kind of brainless action film , you 'll enjoy D-war . Otherwise , do n't bother ! I saw the movie today with my nephew and 3 of their friend . They really loved it and that made me feel good . After the movie wa over , all the kid ( my nephew and their friend ) could not stop thanking me for taking them to the theater . The CG is good . Acting and directing are horrible . Storyline is extremely simple . But , since the half of the audience wa kid , they were screaming , shouting and cheering every time the dragon appeared on the screen . This made the viewing experience far more exciting than it should have been . It 's a good movie to take your kid to , but except for the final battle sequence , D-War is disappointing . I give this film 7 out of 10 mainly because the kid loved it so much .

No wonder Pamela Springsteen gave up acting to become a full-time photographer ; it 's a much better idea to have her behind a camera than in front of one . While this movie is not without it interesting element ( mullet from hell , etc . ) , it is outweighed by flaw . For one thing , Angela , the murderous counselor , appears to be about the same age a the camper . Having an older , more threatening camp director would have done a lot for the film . And then you have the murder scene . The budget wa apparently too low to execute most of them properly ( no pun intended ) , although drowning someone in an outhouse toilet is certainly original . But overall , there are a ton of movie out there that are scarier/more fun to spend an hour and a half of your life watching .

This ha to be , by far , the absolute worst movie I have seen in the last 20 year . When I saw that Michael Madsen wa in it I figured it could n't be too bad a movie since he ha been in some pretty decent film , and he wa a pretty fair actor . WRONG ! No one should waste their time on this film . I fast forwarded through 80 percent of it and I do n't feel that I missed a thing .

'Had Ned Kelly been born later he probably would have won a Victoria Cross at Gallipolli ' . such wa Ned 's Bravery . In Australia and especially country Victoria the name Ned Kelly can be said and immediately recognised . In Greta he is still a Hero , the life Blood of the Town of Jerilderie depends on the tourism he created , but in Mansfield they still have n't forgotten that the three policeman that he 'murdered ' were from there . Many of the building he visited in his life are still standing . From the Old Melbourne Gaol where he wa hanged , to the Post office he held up in Jerilderie . A cell he wa once held in in Greta is on display in Benella and the site of Ann Jones ' Hotel , the station and even the log where he wa captured in Glenrowan can be visited . Evidence of all the event in the movie ( except for his love interest ) can be found all over Victoria , in police record and even in the Sash that Ned wa awarded with for rescuing Dick Shelton from drowning . None of this is wrong , and whats left out would further justify Neds action . The Horse that Ned 'stole ' wa actually stolen by Wild Wright ( the man who Ned box with after getting out of jail ) . Ned wa already in prison when the horse wa reported stolen so he could n't have stolen it . The Jerilderie Letter is more than what ha been stated before . It is not self justification it is Ned 's biography , an outline of what he stood for and who he wa protecting . So go ahead and read it , watch the movie and then make up your mind about what Ned stood for .

`` Feast of All Saints ? '' Where ... ? When ... ? Was the Feast of All Saints storyline and theme edited out ? What a waste of a wonderful title ! There is never anything in the story that ha the remotest connection to the `` Feast of All Saints . '' Nor is there anything in the story about `` All Souls Day '' which the term is referencing . Why bother to use this title if you never intend to including any kind of storyline or theme about `` All Souls Day '' or the `` Feast of All Saints '' ? Embarrassly Bad Script & Amateur Writing How did they attract such great talent to this clunker ? The writing is so amateur -- character that have known each other all their life go into big long speech about their life history for the sake of the audience . Not at all the way people talk to each other . What wa the Director Thinking ? The directing is equally bad ! The forced and overly deliberate style feel amateurish . In one scene , a character is yelling `` Take your hand off of me '' and NO ONE is touching him ! The most badly directed scene however , is the incredibly over-the-top battle scene at the beginning of the film . Excessive Gore in a Very Fake , Silly Battle Scene There are so many dead people in the most fake battle scene . It look like a Saturday Night Live skit ! ! You can see extra waiting for their cue to walk across camera . Everyone play their death scene like 4th grade boy -- exaggerating every little gasp and twitch . The blood on battle victim is so excessive and carelessly applied it look like someone used a ketchup dispenser and just squirted straight line of red on the costume . This whole battle scene come off a the spoof of a really cheesy war movie . You almost expect someone like Will Ferrell and Mike Myers to ride up on a horse and deliver the punchline . Who in Real Life Would Ever Behave this Way ? ! The most ridiculous bit of writing , directing and casting is actually the focus of the scene : A little girl is standing under the dead body of her hanging father -- who is terribly mutilated , and literally dripping blood form his gaping wound . Even a totally idiot would know he is dead ! Yet she is -- very monotonously -- repeating over and over `` Daddy , daddy ... '' while looking at someone off-screen . She delivered it with about a much believability and passion a you could expect from an non-actor kid that had been repeating the line for the camera all day . Even if the poor kid had any acting skill , the scene is completely unbelievable . The little girl would n't even BE in the middle of the battlefield after hour of carnage -- surrounded by hundred of dead body , while she calmly stand there ! ! Natural instinct would had the kid screaming and terrified , running AWAY from the bloody carnage ! Are we Suppose to be Horrified or Laugh ... ? ! One particularly goofy detail , that give the scene an SNL satire tone , is the father hanging , with a huge hook through his mouth and cheek . He look like a fish on a hook ! The unintentionally funny detail , make the whole scene come across a fake and silly . In Fantasy La-La-Land , Mothers and Daughters are the Same Age ! Another funny detail , is that you see a central character -- the little girl 's mother -- at the end of the scene and in the next scene , that occurs 20+ year later , she look exactly the same ! She is still young and beautiful , and now the same age a her daughter ! I almost turned the movie off right there because the direction and writing were obviously awful -- but I tried to stick it out because I wanted to see the Louisiana setting and I like all the actor . I do n't know what these fine actor were thinking when they accepted these role ! Who wa the Targeted Audience ? The excessive amount of blood and badly acted violence in the opening scene are weirdly out of place with the soap opera storytelling tone that follows . It is also a strange way to start a movie that , for the rest of the time , seems targeted to romance novel reading female . Weird inconsistency in tone !

Okay . I really tried to tap into the ( so called ) silly & surreal humor that this film set out to be . I 'm told that the Japanese version of this film is much shorter than the one shipped to America ( go figure ! ) , and ha le political reference . Apart from all that , I found this sexual/political farce just a boring and pointless a standard porn . The central female lead is easy on the eye , and could actually act . I would love to see her in a non pink film where she could actually flex her acting muscle ( and no , not the one you 're thinking of ) . It 's obvious that Japan can ( and doe ) produce just a much crap a other country . I could n't recommend this to anyone , with the distant possibility of someone who ha a Jones for Asian porn . Australian Fred Schepisi ( A Cry in the Dark ) directs this comedy/ romance that is fun , relaxing , and set in the spring . You will laugh while watching this movie . Tim Robbins ( Shawshank Redemption , Dead Man Walking ) is an auto mechanic , Ed Walters , with a high IQ , which get higher with the help of Albert Einstein , Walter Matthau ( Grumpy Old Men ) and his academic friend Nathan , Kurt and Boris . You can tell them by their preppie shoe . Meg Ryan ( Sleepless in Seattle , You 've Got Mail ) is Catherine Boyd , Einstein 's niece who is a competent , but not so confident mathematician . Perhaps it is because she is surrounded by all that genius . She think that if she marries someone with a high I.Q . her kid will have a high I.Q . a well , but she doe not know what she want . Between Tim Robbins cute smile and Meg 's cuteness this is a refreshing movie . I love sweet story . People all age should enjoy this movie . Catherine is engaged to the jerk James Moreland , who work in animal behavior , but is very stuffy . This is a love a first sight type situation , between the mechanic and the mathematician . Witty line and subliminal line ! The cinematography is nice . Princeton , New Jersey is beautiful in the Spring . With much help from all those brilliant men Catherine fall for Ed , without knowing that he is an automobile mechanic . Favorite Scenes : Ed taking a multiple choice test in front of a crowd with the help of Einstein , Nathan , Kurt , and Boris . Ed and Einstein riding on the motorcycle . Nathan , Kurt and Boris letting all the research animal free ! Favorite Quotes : Albert Einstein : `` Do n't let your brain interfere with your heart '' . Ed Walters : `` When wa the last time he said `` Wahoo '' '' ? Catherine Boyd : `` Well I 'm sure I do n't know '' . This is a refreshing movie , I recommend it . I have the tape and every once and awhile I will watch it again .

This one is a great one ! Robert De Niro and Cuba Gooding have teamed up to make a powerful and very influential film . This is the true story of the first black US Navy diver and the obstacle he faced in attaining his certification at the hand of a racist Master diver . Along the way , he must also face plain old bigotry from all of his classmate , none of whom want him in their class . They move out of the barrack when he arrives . Ultimately , he becomes certified and go on to have a great career a a US Navy diver . Watch this one ! It 's a great tale of courage and honor . As the story unfolds , we get to watch racism slowly dissipate and everyone begin to respect men one at a time .

I do n't really consider myself a conservative , so I wa n't personally offended by this film , but it wa pretty clear that the plot and the characterization in this film were secondary to the message . And the message is that all conservative are either evil or stupid ( or both ) . The character are one-dimensional -- either good , freedom-loving Americans , or brainless , greedy , evil conservative . There 's nothing clever or creative , just anti-conservative . I do n't really mind the political bias itself , but it should n't be the only purpose behind the movie . And clearly it is . On the positive side , the cast is wonderful and Chris Cooper 's impression of W is funny the first two or three time , but after that it 's just the same old joke being told over and over again . So if you really hate the conservative , you 'll probably enjoy this film , but if you 're looking for something with realistic character and a story that 's le black-and-white , then you 'd be better off watching something else .

This is really good . Original idea in the film and a great terrorist action film . Only second to die hard and die hard with a vengeance , this film ha suspense and a good plot . I would recommend it to anyone with a taste in film like mine ; Action , terrorism and gangster/mafia .

Rajkumar Santoshi Without Any Doubt Has Directed The Greatest Movies And Biggest Box Office Hits Of Indian Cinema . This Movie Falls Short Of All Expectations As This Movie Stars Two Great Actors Mr. Amitabh Bachchan And Akshay Kumar And When You Have These Two Actors In The Same Movie You Have To Make A Magnum Opus . In The Later Part Of The Movie You Can Make Out That Amitabh Bachchan 's Voice Has Been Dubbed By Some Other Person Which Was Due To His Illness . Still The Movie Did'nt Had Proper Character Development Plus Cinematography Was'nt Good Too And One Thing That Bollywood Should Learn Is That They Should Use Visual Effects Only When It Is Needed And When Applied Should Be Done With A High Budget.The Script Had So Many Flaws Which Gives The Viewer Excuses To Attend His Phone Calls Rather Than Watching The Movie . The New Comer Shakes The Leg Well But Could Not Act Well But Where The Movie Loses Big Time Is The Storyline Screenplay And Cinematography . A Talented Actor Like Bhoomika Chawla Has Been Wasted In The Movie As Well As Sushant Singh . But Every Director Once In A While In His Career Makes A Bad Film . So Watch It Only If You Are A Fan Of Multi-Starrer Flop Movies .

A poetic examination of the human condition performed without dialogue . The anti-hero , The Man build a contraption to escape a band of marauder , out of the wastland of what wa once a civilization , to the ruin of the city to scavenge for his survival . There he cross pathes with The Brute , brilliantly played by Jean Reno , of `` The Professional '' and `` Mission : Impossible '' fame . The Man is rescued by a crazy old genius who life in a fortress of his own design . By using their wit , The Man and the old genius are able to keep the Brute and his ilk at bay , but they realise it is only a matter of time before their defense are compromised , so they make a break for it . This is a strongly understated tale of the desparate struggle for life , with excellent action scene and clever humor . Of all of the movie of it kind , like `` Road Warrior '' , `` Omega Man '' , and even `` Ultimate Warrior '' ( featuring Yul Brenner a a buff knife-fighter ) , `` Le Dernier Combat '' is the most artfully crafted . Copies of the video are hard-to-find , I would give my left eye ball for one . If your local art house ever ha a revival of this film , I heartily recommend that you break any engagement to able to be able to see it big .

It 's true that you always remember what you were doing at a point when disaster or tragedy strike . And none more so that September 11 , 2001 , a date which changed the entire global landscape in it fight against terrorism . No , this documentary did n't set out to be dwelling on the event leading to 9/11 . Rather , the filmmaker , brother Gédéon and Jules Naudet , set out to do a documentary on the trial and tribulation of a rookie New York firefighter . They had gone to the academy and done some shoot of training , and had handpicked their `` proby '' ( probation firefighter ) to join them in an NY firehouse , home to Ladder 1 and Engine 7 . But their production wa to develop and contain at that time , believed to be the only shot of the first plane slamming into the World Trace Center . I wa traveling back with a friend on the train from a night of LAN gaming , and received a call at about 850pm local time from my Dad , who informed me of the above . Few minute later , he told me there wa another , and that the WTC wa under attack . By the time I arrived home , the upper floor of the twin tower were ablaze and in smoke , and to my horror , they collapsed , under an hour . The filmmaker had two camera running that day , one who had followed a team out on a routine call , and which immediately raced to the WTC upon hearing and seeing the plane crash into it . We follow what is possible the only filmed sequence of event in the lobby of WTC1 where the first responder of firefighter , paramedic , and police had to make sense of what happened , and to quickly develop a plan of action . The other camera , held by the other brother , wa making his way to WTC to look for his sibling , and along the journey , captured the many expression of New Yorkers , a well a the sense of chaos in and around Manhatten . Peppered throughout the documentary are numerous interview with the men from Ladder 1 and Engine 7 , which miraculously , did not suffer any casualty . But being survivor also brought about it own set of psychological turmoil , a they struggle to come to term with the event . Through the event that unfold , we learn of the strong camaraderie amongst these men who risk live and limb each day on their job , to save life . We began with what the documentary wa supposed to be , before event of the day totally swung in and became the focus , right up to the rescue phase where hope of finding survivor under the rubble were kept alive by the men who work round the clock in making sense of the collapsed steel structure . It 's not a film that is fabricated , and what you see here can not be recreated in any other documentary ( and heaven , not sound stage for Hollywood blockbuster ) . It 's a close a you can get to that day , witnessing the event up close , from safety . Code 1 DVD contains a separate extra hour of 4 set of interview with the men of Ladder 1 and Engine 7 .

Oh , my . Oh , this is a * really * bad movie . The acting is absolutely atrocious , the script is god-awful , and the photography is simply dreadful . What doe make this movie stand out , however , is that you never once care about a single soul -- good guy or bad guy , living , dying or dead -- in the entire 87 minute . `` Oh , s/he died ? Huh ... Figured they would '' wa the best reaction I could muster after each murder . Characters are so black-or-white that with the volume turned off , you could still figure out who wa who . While the cast 's voice had an odd monotone quality throughout , their face give the impression that you 're looking at an old silent movie with a lot of eyebrow waggling , exaggerated frown and `` pensive look '' . Each character is a humorless , passionless , one-dimensional one-trick pony ; once they fulfill whatever their particular role in this fiasco demanded their creation , they are summarily dismissed . It vaguely made me think of what would happen if Thomas Borch Nielsen ( director/writer of `` Skyggen '' , American title : `` Webmaster '' ) decided to do a low-budget version of `` American Psycho '' and got kind of distracted along the way . This is n't a particularly gruesome movie ; the cold , passionless cast ensures that . It is n't an offensive movie ; the director play it so safe that no one could possibly find it so . It is , simply and after all , a bad movie . Avoid it . We were not so fortunate and actually paid to watch this bomb on Pay-per-View . As part of my penance , I 'm writing this review . Enough said .

I wa in my mid teen when I saw this movie , and I wa struck by the beauty of the young star a well a the loving cinematography and the simple sweetness of the story . It amazes me to learn that Alvina ha recently died , that Bury apparently ha not worked in the film business for almost 30 year , and that both would be in their 50 . The Elton John soundtrack is amazingly beautiful and support the air of protected innocence the character experience in seclusion . I have seen the movie poster , billing it a `` Deux Enfants Quis'Aiment , '' which apparently mean something like `` Two Children Who Like Each Other '' -- the English language distributor were wise to abbreviate the title ! Paul , the ignored 15-year-old son of an English businessman living in Paris , meet Michelle , an orphan , at the zoo . The two take what they intend a a day-long holiday to Michelle 's late father 's rural cottage , but end up staying there for a year , isolated from the outside world . They fall in love , Michelle get pregnant , and they have the baby alone at home . After the baby 's birth , the police come to Paul 's work place and take him away . `` Blue Lagoon '' come to mind a another film that almost capture the theme of innocence protected in an isolated paradise . So sad that `` Friends '' ha never been released on DVD .

When Braveheart first came out , I wa enthralled , and wa admittedly one of the most rabid fan of the film . When Rob Roy came out , I wa intrigued , and although I enjoyed the film I did not think it wa a great film . However , a time ha gone by , my appreciation for Rob Roy ha grown , and my enthusiasm for Braveheart ha diminished . Braveheart is great entertainment , to be sure , but there are flaw a well . The most significant , in my view , is the unflattering portrayal of Robert the Bruce , who wa without a doubt Scotland 's greatest king . Another is the historical inaccuracy of the film , which tarnish the film in proportion to the many historical distortion . I think I am also bothered by the fact that it wa in this film , seen only ( at least by me ) in retrospect , that the beginning of Mel Gibson 's egomania can be seen clearly for the first time . In contrast , Rob Roy ha grown on me over the year . Partly because it largely avoids the fault I mind most in Braveheart . But also because Rob Roy is like fine wine , growing more mature and complex with each viewing .

The French either make pro-Marxist film or anti-Marxist film - with a few in between . `` Merci pour le chocolat '' is the latter of this genre . From the opening credit telling the viewer what music is going to be played and by whom it wa who composed you know that you are going to be swathed in middle class pretension . It is an old man 's film with an excess of 40 's plus people . It is also directed by an old man along with an old crew who have nothing to say about life to the viewer . The plot is not only banal but preposterous . How many film reveal the plot through dialogue only to repeat the same message via flashback some five minute later ? Maybe the director and actor had a low retentive capacity ? In truth their is no tenable plot at all . It is riddle with hole like a good piece of French cheese . Whether intentional or not , it is a film about the bourgeoisie . At least a third of the film focus on the piano and the pretentious twaddle espoused in each scene . I concede it ha some well framed shot though they could n't have used a steady-cam in this film - it would have woke them all up ! Other than it being a nonsense story , the film allows the upper middle class to parade their value and vanity in a very comfortable Swiss location . A telling line of the film is when Rodolphe Pauly tell Anna Mouglalis that she need not lock her car while in the resort ! Oh dear me . On the DVD , Miss Huppert make a comment about shedding a false tear for a scene . Smirking she say : `` Like they do in the American Actor 's Studio ! '' I think Miss Huppert and the rest of the cast could learn well from the Actor 's Studio . If there is one statement that stand out in my mind it is when Huppert remark 'we are having friend for the weekend and all the servant are away ' . No doubt they had all escaped from the mind numbing set lest they be associated with such an appalling film . Safety Medical Note . In the film they show a hot water scald being covered with ointment and a bandage . This should never be done . Only cold water should be used . Minus 10 mark .

A gem of a British caper-comedy . Poor American schlub Pinky Green ( Richard Jordan , playing another bad guy but this time an adorable one ) get out of a British jail and try to go straight , but his maintenance man job in a bank is too attractive for his never-reformed criminal friend , headed up by a really nasty Ivan ( David Niven in one of his last role ) . Pinky resists , but the lure of all that money is just too much for him . Things unravel and reravel and it 's all joyous to watch . Jordan must have played 20 bad guy in his career , but he never played the same one twice - this one is just too lovable to hate . Niven never played a slicker bad guy , oil all over . Two fine actor we 've lost that I wish we had back .

How this ha not become a cult film I do not know . I think it ha been sadly overlooked a a truly ingenious comedy ! `` Runaway Car '' attempt to pas itself off a a fast-paced thriller , but taking the quality of acting ( good God it 's bad ) , the storyline , the practicality of the car 's demonic possession and the baby evacuation scene into account there is nothing you can really do but laugh . And laugh you will . Films are made to entertain u , and the degree to which they do this can be an indication of a film 's worth . This film is the pinnacle in entertainment , I laughed from beginning to end . At one point I got short of breath and nearly choked , it really is that funny at some point . When the baby wa airlifted out of the sunroof in a holdall by a helicopter with a robot pilot who managed to maintain a constant velocity identical to the car and a perfectly flat flight plain that meant the grapple hook did n't rip the car roof to piece , I wa laughing hysterically . But when the baby starting swinging around in the air , nearly hit a bridge and almost got tangled up in a tree , tear were running down my face . It also occurred to me that the black cop wa the guy who played Jesus in Madonna 's `` Like A Prayer '' video . He seems to get everywhere .

Skullduggery is a strange , strange film based on the novel `` Ye Shall Know Them '' by Vercors . To unleash criticism at the film feel really unkind , since it is a movie that deal with earnest theme like humanity , and plea for upright moral standard and tolerance . But in spite of it honourable intention and it well-meaning tone , Skullduggery simply is n't a very good film . For me , the main problem is the terribly disjointed narrative which ca n't make it mind up how best to convey it message . The first half of the movie is like watching a standard jungle expedition flick of the Tarzan ilk ; later it teeter into sci-fi fable ; by the end it slip into courtroom melodramatics . The difference in tone between each section of the movie are too great , too jarring , to overlook . They stick out like a sore thumb and remind you constantly that you 're watching a muddled , disorganised movie . An archaeological expedition into the jungle of New Guinea is led by adventurer Douglas Temple ( Burt Reynolds ) . One of the main archaeologist involved in the excursion is attractive lady scientist Dr Sybil Greame ( Susan Clark ) . After an arduous trek they stumble upon a tribe of strange ape-like creature . These primitive , long-lost people are covered in hair and have survived for century without being in any way touched or influenced by the development of modern man . There is some evidence that they may the ancestor of early man  the `` missing link '' in the evolution of ape into human . Or perhaps a race of human who simply look and behave differently from usual ? Or even a race of animal that have begun to develop human characteristic ? The archaeologist call the tribe `` the Tropi '' and are initially thrilled by the implication of their discovery . But thing take a devastating turn when nasty opportunist Vancruysen ( Paul Hubschmid ) declares his intention to exploit the tribe and their idyll on behalf of developer . He question whether the Tropi are truly `` human '' and take his argument to the court , where he hope to be granted legal backing so that his own greedy ambition can be continued . This wa a very early film in Reynolds ' career , and he actually unbalance this movie by acting like he 's in a comedy while the rest of the cast take it all very seriously . Not that Reynolds can be blamed  he ha an impossible role , asked to play a charming adventurer who really belongs in a Tarzan flick . His character and the film are not relevant to each other . Clark fare much better a the earnest lady archaeologist , and there are nice supporting role for British actor Edward Fox , Alexander Knox and Wilfrid Hyde-White . A major shortcoming in Skullduggery is the lame and ineffective make-up used to give the Tropi their strange hairy appearance . Rather than making the actor look like believable hominoid , the stuck-on hair merely make them look unintentionally comical . and that 's just not the right idea . We 're meant to feel great sympathy for these creature , but that 's awfully hard when they look so unconvincing . Skullduggery is a failed attempt to tell a story that could have been poignant , philosophical and stimulating . The honourable intention are there for all to see , but the end result doe n't do them justice . A worthy failure it might be but a failure nonetheless .

Why is it that in the '50s and '60s , Italians made so of the best movie , and then during the '70s and '80s , made nothing but zombie and cannibal movie ? Probably because art film did n't make any money . , The Cannibal Movie , unlike the Zombie Movie , which wa created by Americans and ` exploited ' by Italians , is a purely Italian creation , designed a a mondo exploitation showcase , and to make a much money a possible ( no artistic integrity getting in the way here ) . Eaten Alive came during the Cannibal Movie heyday . The director , Umberto Lenzi , had n't even hit his stride yet ; his genre classic , Cannibal Ferox , wa still a year away . In plotting similar to ( read : ripped off from ) Ruggero Deodato 's seminal cannibal classic , Cannibal Holocaust , a woman ( Janet Agren ) receives word from the police that they 've received a 8mm film from her sister . She 's gone missing in Africa , and it 's suspected that the tribal ritual depicted on the film may have something to do with it . Mel Ferrer , a a Professor of Somethingoranother , tell her that a man named Jonas ( Ivan Rassimov ) ha started a Jonestown-like cult in New Guinea , and that 's where the sister is . The woman hire a guide ( Robert Kerman ) to take her through the jungle to find the cult and her sister . And , would n't you know it , the jungle is full of cannibal . One sentence should sum it up : if you 've seen on Cannibal Movie , you 've seen them all , mostly because these film steal shamelessly from each other ( Lenzi copied Cannibal Holocaust to make this film , and retooled this to make Cannibal Ferox ; Deodato copied part of this for Hit and Run ) . And because they all share the same material , they all feature the same trait : awful photography , boring scenery , terrible dubbing , overacting , and exploitation , exploitation , exploitation . Genre fan will have a ball since everyone in it is a genre veteran . Rassimov and Kerman have a scenery eating contest . Agren exists solely to be naked , raped , or in peril . Plenty o ' gore for all the sickos out there . The cannibal , who do actually appear to be native cannibal , eat lunch met disguised a human flesh . And , in the grand tradition of Cannibal Movies , any live animal shown onscreen is usually killed shortly thereafter . Overall , really not a good experience , but I 'm sure there are psychopath out there who find this excrement entertaining . I know I did .

One of the most magnificent movie ever made . The acting of Charles Buchinski ( later known a Bronson ) is simply outstanding . This is the crown on the career of director Winner , who himself wa often quoted saying this wa his masterpiece . The plot ha been copied many time , but it 's never been topped . Wildey J. Moore , the gun manufacturer , many time claimed his brand 's growth since the mid 80 can be fully credited to DW3 , and rightly so . This is not just a movie , this is art that many generation will admire and appreciate . Although this movie ha never been fully appreciated in the USA , it ha found a huge following in Europe and Asia , where the movie is regularly shown at film school and it is still a popular hit in student cinema all across Europe . All in all , a true classic .

I just caught `` Wild Rebels '' on one of the `` Mystery Science Theatre 3000 '' archive compilation , and this movie wa so bad even the MST3K crew could n't make it entertaining . There are some MST3K `` target '' that were film whose concept were so dippy they could n't possibly have been good movie ( like `` The Green Slime '' ) , and others whose basic premise could have been made into genuinely entertaining film if their filmmaker had n't bobbled them in the execution . `` Wild Rebels '' is a film whose basic premise DID make a good movie three year earlier , when Don Siegel directed his remake of `` The Killers '' at Universal . Both film are about a failed racing driver who 's seduced by a femme fatale into driving the getaway car in a robbery masterminded by the woman 's boyfriend -- only in `` The Killers '' the driver wa John Cassavetes , the woman wa Angie Dickinson and the criminal mastermind ( cast wildly but successfully against type in what turned out to be his final film ) wa Ronald Reagan . Steve Alaimo , Bobbie Byers and Willie Pastrano are quite a comedown ! But what REALLY make `` Wild Rebels '' an awful movie is the direction by William Grefé ( note the accent over the final `` e , '' present in his on-screen credit ) , which ha absolutely no sense of pace whatsoever and seems to let every shot run at least half again a long a it need to to make it dramatic point . It 's only a pity that someone did n't do a mocking commentary on this movie now ( in 2009 ) ; the comparison between Steve Alaimo 's hairdo and Rod Blagojevich 's would have been irresistible !

Thirty per cent of this movie appears to be the prototype for the Map Channel . You see a giant map for about ten minute , then they unleash the stock footage big time while droning ( droning , get it ? ) on about radar . Apparently there 's a lot of radar station in the far north , protecting North America 's border from attack by deadly polar bear . The bear never show up , but a giant Mantis doe . It wa frozen in the ice for over a million year or so , until it wa released by an earthquake somewhere else in the world ( yeah , right . For my money , it wa released by global warming ) . It is a huge prehistoric insect , and it need lot of food . Since there are n't any cow in the frozen north , it decides to feast on the most bovine-like creature it can find up there . I.E. , human being . It start attacking radar station , probably because the humming from the radar dish wa getting on it nerve . Enter Col. Joe Parkman , the resident smarmy guy of the film . He 's investigating a plane that went down , and is puzzled why there are no body in the wreckage . The only thing he find is one of the claw of the Mantis . Apparently it decided to trim it nail while it wa snacking on the plane 's crew . Parkman take the claw tip back with him to be analyzed by a thousand year old scientist . Grandpa scientist ca n't make head or tail of the claw , mostly because he 's missed his nap so his mind is n't functioning too well . So he call in a smug paleontologist played by the guy who wa the P.I . in Perry Mason . He and his friend , a transvestite photographer , fly north because he 's decided that the claw must have come from a Praying Mantis . Just one the size of a commuter train . It 's Luke warm love at first sight when Col.Parkman first set eye on the she-male photographer . The men at the base , obviously having been deprived for many year , think she 's the hottest thing to come along since Granny Clampett . Smug science guy and smarmy soldier guy start working together to track the path of the Mantis , which ha devastated some stock footage of an Eskimo village . It come to the base looking for an after dinner snack , and crush some cheap set quite effectively . Then it fly south and disappears . Now come the tense hour when the civilian ground observer core are called on to sweep the sky looking for anything large flying overhead . I doubt that in reality they would have been told that they were looking for a giant flying mantis that eats human being , since that would haver caused a panic . Probably they were told to look for a giant 727 that wa painted green and hummed because it engine wa out of tune . Col. Parkman go up in a plane to try to shoot the Mantis down , and botch the mission . The Mantis land in New York City , probably because it wanted to take in a show on Broadway or visit Sex World in Times Square . The army corner it in the Tunnel , and Parkman and his men don stupid suit that they borrowed from the Orkin Man to go in and try to blow the Mantis up . Success ! Well , almost , since the Mantis is still twitching enough that it almost kill the mannish Eve Arden photographer lady . There 's a tepid love scene at the end , and the paleontologist take a picture of the dead mantis because Colonel Hair Grease and Ms . Gender Unspecified are busy smooching . So kind of a nauseating ending .

The Dereks did seem to struggle to find roll for Bo after `` 10 '' . I used to work for a marine park in the Florida Keys . There wa one scene where a -dolphin- supposedly proposition Bo ( or Bo the dolphin ) , asking to `` go make egg . '' Reading the script , we -lauuughed- ... We did not end up doing any portion of this movie at our facility , although our dolphin -were- in `` The Big Blue ! '' This must have been very close to the end of Anthony Quinn 's life . I hope he had fun in this film , a it certainly did n't do anything for his legacy .

Uncompromising look at a suburb in 21st century Vienna mixing the story of six group of character by former documentary maker U.Seidl is a provocative , minimalistic and intense piece of observation cinema . After the world-wide spread of Big Brother reality show , Hundstage take modern voyeurism to an unsettling , profound level . Hard to like but unignorable piece of European art-cinema might seem cruel and seedy , yet manages to convey the nihilistic alienated feeling of modern society in a praiseworthy manner . A must for lover of world cinema .

This is not a GREAT movie a tho the cast ( especially the kid ) admirably help to carry along this very sad yet contrived plot it is filled with cliché upon cliché . Poor family in 50 's mid America , dying mother , alcoholic father , 10 child ( 1 of whom ha epilepsy ) and an awful decision to be made . Its very easy to watch and some of the kid performance are moving without being sickly or naff . And little Frank and Warrnen steal the show for me with the last scene leaving me bawling no matter how many time I see it . A great rainy afternoon movie i recommend to all . Only those with the hardest of heart could fail to be moved by it . Not on a par to Sophies Choice but a good TV movie equivalent ! ! !

It seems like they just used the name of Stephen King to make a crappy , too long movie with nothing exciting at all . I give this movie `` 1 ( awful ) '' . If they had like -5 , I would probably take that instead . It wa a total waste of time .

This is indeed the film that popularized kung fu in the 1970s . However , if it ever had any kind of excitement or even halfway interesting plot , it doe n't seem to have aged very well . Long story short : extremely drawn out , slow-moving , confusing plot with run-of-the-mill choreography , typically annoying and exaggerated whiplash sound with every punch and kick , and constant `` plot twist '' that never come to an end . By the time the film reach it emotional climax , I had long had all the wind knocked out of me to actually care . Watch it for it historical value a a milestone of Chinese kung fu cinema -- just leave your expectation at the door , or you 'll be bitterly disappointed . For hardcore fan only .

The unflappable William Powell . He is a joy to watch on the screen a he make his way through situation without a care in the world . He always seems on top of his game and show little care for anyone who doubt him . The murder are project , barely human being . I have noticed this is a staple of the whodunnit . Other than an occasional weeping widow , the victim fulfill the function of being the reason the movie exists . Nothing more . There are enough twist and turn to keep thing interesting along the way and Powell is a master at this . There is a lot of political incorrectness , especially a it relates to the Asian performer . This is a little hard to take . The cast is great , and Curtiz 's direction is also a consistent asset .

What we have here is a downright brilliant piece of early 80 's incompetence that will render even the biggest connoisseur of trash- cinema completely speechless ! `` Wizards of the Lost Kingdom '' is a very cheap and cheesy fantasy/Sword-and-Sorcery adventure that doe n't have an actual plot but doe eagerly & shamelessly borrows element from other film . Writer Ed Naha and Hector Olivera ( who ? ) watched enough similar type of movie to know that they needed a handful of essential character , but probably figured that all the rest would follow automatically . In order to make a fantasy-adventure you need : one super- evil villain ( preferably with a black cape ) , one young hero in training , one lone warrior , one amiable type of furry pet , one wise midget living in the wood ( optional ) and a whole colorful collection of hideous demon , enslaved dwarf , and winged gargoyle to serve a filler . The story is phenomenal and so original , with Simon the young son of a wizard having to flee from his beloved kingdom after the evil magician Shurka take over the power and killed the king . Simon want to go back and save the people , but therefore he need his powerful ring which he lost during his escape . Simon befriends lone warrior Kor ( the usually cool dude Bo Svenson who clearly needed the pay check ) , who assist Simon during the long and devastating journey full of ordeal , dangerous encounter and magical showdown . Admittedly it doe n't even sound too bad thus far , but that 's merely just because I excluded all the deliciously inept little detail . Simon ha a best friend named Gulfax , for example . Gulfax is an albino version of Chewbacca and evokes incontrollable chuckle whenever he open his poodle-snout to yelp something incomprehensible . The obstacle during journey back home are hilariously irrelevant to the `` plot '' and simply serve a padding footage to cover up the lack of actual content . Simon ha nightmarish vision inside the tent of a suspicious forest nymph , Kor settle an old score with the pig-faced nemesis whose sister he refused to marry and there 's the supposedly horrible 'suicide cave ' where you can only sing your way out of . But the absolute most unequally brilliant sequence  not just of this film alone but in the history of cinema  involves the resurrection of four zombie warrior . Simon awakes the legendary courageous warrior , hoping they will assist them in their battle , but the rotting corps only take a few step , complain about how tired they are and return back to their graf . That 's it ! So much for the zombie sub plot ! Best sequence ever ! I could go on listing unintentionally hilarious little detail for several more paragraph , but you get the idea . `` Wizards of the Lost Kingdom '' is a tremendously messed-up `` so-bad-it's-good '' film . Word of advice : do not watch this joyful piece of junk alone . Invite friend , preferably the dope-headed type with a wicked sense of humor , and watch it in group . It will be a night to remember

This is one of my favourite film , dating back to my childhood . Set in the remote wilderness of Siberia at the turn of the century , a small community is stirred when an extremely cold winter force two tiger to come down from the mountain in search of food , preying on outlying farm . In this atmosphere we are introduced to Avakum , a hermit fur trapper , who life out in the wild , a he come to the village to sell his annual catch to Boris , his close , and rather only , friend in the village , who run a store . At Boris ' request , Avakum accompanies his friend 's arrogant son , Ivan , on the hunt for the menacing tiger . Personalities crash and temper flare a the older , more experienced Avakum criticises Ivan 's amateur method , an encounter noticed also by the other member of the hunt . On the second day , the hunter sight their prey and give chase . In a thick wood , Ivan wound one of the tiger , which then attack the hapless man . Avakum , seeing Ivan tangling with the enraged beast , fire , but accidently hit Ivan . He kill the tiger a it flees . The other hunter arrive on the scene , suspicious . Back in the village , the doctor work to save the wounded Ivan . Avakum attempt to leave the village , but is confronted by Ivan 's friend . The trapper brush them off however , and speed off with his dog-drawn sled . The young villager swear after him that they 'll come for him if Ivan dy , which he later doe , but before dying explains to his father that it wa an accident . Old Boris , upon learning of his close friend being run out of the village , straightens out the gathering `` lynch mob '' and go out after Avakum , to find him and set thing right . And so the main story begin . A simple film , it raise the conflict of man and civilisation versus nature , mainly Avakum 's struggle to survive alone out in the wilderness . The winter landscape is very well filmed . Perhaps the strongest element in the film is the soundtrack by Jimmie Haskell . Very sentimental and evocative , the main theme reminiscent of Albinoni 's Adagio . Other movement reflect Russian style , a well a a couple of folk music type tune . Unfortunately , this film is not available to buy , to my knowledge , which is rather a shame . The copy I own , recorded off TV nearly twenty year ago is slowly deteriorating . This film is a must see for those who can appreciate it , if they can find it . 8/10

I have a feeling that the Warners Bros Depression-era musical are going to become a lot more pertinent in the next couple of year . Yes , we are in the economic doldrums ( or have you been living under a rock ) and time look bleak . But we always have the movie a a way to escape our trouble . In the 30 's , film-going wa hugely popular even at the height of economic gloom . `` Footlight Parade ( 1933 ) '' wa one such film that audience flocked to . While this Lloyd Bacon-directed musical doe n't quite capture the social issue of the time a `` Gold Diggers of 1933 ( 1933 ) '' doe , it 's still a wonderful showcase of talent . We have to wait until the end of the film for the three centrepiece Busby Berkely extravaganza number , but boy , are they worth waiting for me . Yes , little Ruby Keeler is a terrible singer and actress , and her tapping is so-so , but Busby 's magical `` By A Waterfall '' whisk her , and what seems to be a hundred other chorus girl , into a dizzying water wonderland . Of course Busby 's number could never really be performed on a stage ( they defy limit of gravity , for one thing ) , and they contrast terrifically with the realism of the tough , wisecracking non-musical scene . And `` Footlight '' also ha James Cagney in at the one of his all-too-few musical ( really , what could n't this man do ? ) . He even get to take over from the leading man , don sailor garb and fawn over sexpot Shanghai Lil ( who is really little Ruby in China-girl wig ! ) .He co-star with Joan Blondell , his adorable , adoring secretary who Cagney somehow overlook in favour of other woman ( until the final reel , that is ) . Apparently Blondell wa the only other woman who Cagney loved apart from his wife . And you can see the mutual adoration in every scene .

First of all this is one of the worst soft-core straight to cable `` erotic thriller '' I 've ever seen in my life . This , of course , make the softcore simulated sex that pop up every other 10 minute seem `` in context . '' Whatever . Forget for one moment that this wa never meant to win any award . The actor are terrible and their line reading made me cringe . The woman who play the female cop is so bad it 's beyond description . She must be a really REALLY good friend of the guy who put up the movie for this terrible adventure , if you know what I mean . The production value are only slightly higher than porn . Other than that ? I suppose if you 're really drunk and you need something to laugh at , this would be a perfect film . And if that 's the case , I recommend fast forwarding to all the scene with the female cop . What 's that accent , Brooklyn ? Hilarious !

Beforehand Notification : I 'm sure someone is going to accuse me of playing the race card here , but when I saw the preview for this movie , I wa thinking `` Finally ! '' I have yet to see one movie about popular African-influenced dance ( be it popular hip hop move , breaking , or stepping ) where the main character wa a Black woman . I 've seen an excessive amount of movie where a non-Black woman who knew nothing about hip hop come fresh to the hood and doe a mediocre job of it ( Breakin , Breakin 2 , Save the Last Dance , Step Up ) , but the Black woman in the film are almost nonexistent . That always bothered me considering so much of hip hop , African-influenced dance , and breaking wa with Blacks and Latinos in massive amount in these particular set and it wa n't always men who performed it , so I felt this movie ha been a long time coming . However , the race doe not make the film , so I also wanted it to carry a believable plot ; the dancing be entertaining ; and interesting to watch . Pros : I really enjoyed this film bringing Jamaican culture . I ca n't recall ever seeing a popular , mainstream film where all the main character were Jamaican ; had believable accent ; and were n't stereotypical with the beany . The stepper , family , friend , and even the `` thug '' were all really intelligent , realistic people who were trying to love , live , and survive in the neighborhood they lived in by doing something positive . Even when the audience wa made aware that the main character 's sister chose an alternate lifestyle , it still did n't make the plot stereotypical . I wa satisfied with the way it wa portrayed . I LOVED the stepping ; the romantic flirty relationship going on between two stepper ; the trial that the main character 's parent were going through ; and how she dealt with coming back to her old neighborhood and dealing with Crabs in a Barrel . I respected that she wa so intelligent and active at the same time , and so many other sistas in the film were handling themselves in the step world . They were all just a excellent a the fella . I do n't see that in too many movie nowadays , at least not those that would be considered Black film . Cons : I 'm not quite sure why the director or whoever put the movie together did this , but I question whether they 've been to real step show . Whenever the stepper got ready to perform , some hip hop song would play in place of the stepper ' hand/feet beat . At a real step show , there is zero need for music , other than to maybe entertain the crowd in between group . And then when hip hop song were played , sometimes the beat to the song wa off to the beat of the stepper ' hand and foot . It wa awkward . I wa more impressed with the stepping in this movie versus `` Stomp the Yard '' ( another great stepping movie ) because the woman got to represent a fierce a the guy ( in `` Stomp the Yard , '' Meagan Good got all of a few second of some prissy twirl and hair flip and the ( Deltas ? ) let out a chant and a few step and were cut immediately ) . Even when there were very small scene , the lady tore it up , especially in the auto shop , and it wa without all that music to drown out their physical music . I know soundtrack have to be sold , but the movie folk could 've played the music in other part of the film . I 'm not a Keyshia Cole fan , so every time I saw her , all I kept thinking wa `` Is it written in the script for her to constantly put her hand on her hip when she talk ? '' She looked uncomfortable on screen to me . I thought they should 've used a host like Free or Rocsi instead . Deray Davis wa funny a usual though . Also , I groaned when I found out that the movie wa supposed to be in the ghetto , like stepping could n't possibly happen anywhere else . Hollywood , a usual . However , only a couple of people were portrayed a excessively ignorant due to their neighborhood and loser , which mainstream movie tend to do . I would 've given this movie five star , but the music playing killed it for me . I definitely plan to buy it when it come out and hopefully the bonus scene will include the actual step show without all the song .

It 's the worst movie I 've ever seen . The action is so unclear , work of camera is so poor , actor are so affected ... and this lamentable 5 minute of Arnie on the screen . My advice from the bottom of my heart - do n't watch it unless you like such a low class torture .

Excellent writing and wild cast . The tech is poor but it 's obviously very low budget . Looks like they did n't cut the negative but had to release on a video output . In any case one of the most inventive comedy I 've seen lately . The screenwriter in particular is fine .

Contains Major Spoilers , on the off chance you would actually care about the story line . OK , we have storm that destroy a city and a computer hacker who clobber the power grid . Predictable schlock from the start , and if that were n't enough , the 5 second action bump between the movie and the commercial kill what little suspense there might have been . For example : will they make it to the airport in time ? Things look dim a we go to a commercial and the action shot before the ad show them bouncing around inside the plane ! Well , I guess they 're gon na make it after all but then again , they had to because they 're good guy . The acting wa n't any too impressive ( exception and welcome relief : Randy Quaid a Tornado Tommy ) , the effect were kinda lame , the bad guy got it , and the good guy came through . The real disaster of this movie wa the script , especially the ending . Not only did they wrap thing up happily a quickly a a soap opera given 24 hour notice of a cancellation , but they glorified the hacker a well-intentioned . So he caused a bazillion death he meant well . And , of course , an uplifting final TV report about people coming together . Barf . It wa everything I expected from the commercial , and I 'm glad I wasted my time watching it . It will make great conversation at the lunch table tomorrow . Is CBS insulting u by making this ? Sure but we watched it , did n't we ? Did you count many ad there were for home backup generator during this pig ? Here 's hoping for the next Plan 9 from Outer Space ( which get better with each viewing ) . This is n't it . 1 star .

Another Indian legend you never heard of before is let loose . As the name implies , this is a vengeful wraith who like to absorb the skeleton of people while they 're still using them . As usual , ancient burial ground ( can you say , `` Poltergeist ? '' ) have been disturbed by clichéd greedy land developer building stuff . The CGI , if it had been better , might have made the effect more treacherous looking , but they skimped on the budget , and it show -- to comical effect . The unleashed creature probably should have been kept off stage during it first several killings-that might have added some mystery or impending doom atmosphere-but the inept director decided to show u in the first five minute what it look like , and it wa n't impressive . The death are just poorly done , again with shoddy CGI . I guess ancient spirit always kill by using cheap special effect . As for the `` victim , '' they look they 're going to laugh any moment while they do goofy scream . It 's always obvious who 's going to get it : a character with only a few line show up , strange noise are heard , CGI dot fly , exit character . Repeat ( several time ) . Still , there 's a few chase scene featuring the monster that actually made this thing watchable . Unfortunately , the director seems to be using these a a device to fall back on ( so it 's used too often ) when he ca n't think of anything else for his character to do . Overall , it 's pretty silly , but I 've seen worse . This flick is cheap , but it 's oddly fun to watch .

When I really began to be interested in movie , at the age of eleven , I had a big list of 'must see ' film and I would go to Blockbuster and rent two or three per weekend ; some of them were not for all audience and my mother would go nut . I remember one of the film on that list wa `` A Chorus Line '' and could never get it ; so now to see it is a dream come true . Of course , I lost the list and I would do anything to get it back because I think there were some really interesting thing to watch there . I mean , take `` A Chorus Line '' , a stage play turned into film . I know it 's something we see a lot nowadays , but back then it wa a little different , apparently ; and this film ha something special . Most of the musical made movie today , take the chance the camera give them for free , to create different scenery and take the character to different place ; `` A Chorus Line '' wa born on a theater stage a a play and it dy in the same place a a movie . Following a big audition held by recognized choreographer Zach ( Michael Douglas ) , Richard Atenborough directs a big number of dancer a they try to get the job . Everything happens on the same day : the tension of not knowing , the stress of having to learn the number , the silent competition between the dancer And it all occurs on the stage , where Douglas put each dancer on the spotlight and make them talk about their personal life and their most horrible experience . There are hundred of dancer and they are all fantastic , but they list shortens a the hour go by . Like a movie I saw recently , `` A Prairie Home Companion '' , the broadcast of a radio show , Atenborough here deal with the problem of continuity . On or behind the stage , thing are going on , and time doe n't seem to stop . Again , I do n't if Atenborough cut a lot to shoot this , but it sure doe n't look like it ; and anyway it 's a great directing and editing ( John Bloom ) work . But in that little stage , what you wonder is what to do with the camera With only one setting , Ronnie Taylor 's cinematography find the way , making close-ups to certain character , zooming in and out , showing the stage from different perspective and also giving u a beautiful view of New York . In one crucial moment , Douglas tell the one that are left : `` Before we start eliminating : you 're all terrific and I 'd like to hire you all ; but I ca n't '' . This made me think about reality show today , where the only thing that count is the singing or dancing talent and where the jury always say that exact word to the contestant before some of them are leaving ( even when they are not good ) . It 's hard , you must imagine ; at least here , where all of them really are terrific . To tell some of the story , the character use song and , in one second , the stage take a new life and it literally is ' a dream come true ' . The music by Marvin Hamlisch and the lyric by Edward Kleban make the theater to film transition without flaw , showing these dancer ' feeling and letting them do those wonderful choreography by Michael Bennett . The book in the theater also becomes a flawless and very short screenplay by Arnold Schulman ; which is very touching at time . So if it 's not with a song it will be with a word ; but in `` A Chorus Line '' , it 's impossible not to be moved . During one of the rehearsal break in the audition , Cassie , a special dancer played by Alyson Reed , take the stage to convince Douglas character that she can do it . The word `` let me dance for you '' never sounded more honest and more beautifully put in music and lyric .

The movie follows the event of the novel `` Cel mai iubit dintre pamanteni '' ( could be translated a `` The most beloved among human '' ) , written by Marin Preda ( a very controversial book and movie ) , a novel which became something like The Bible or the story of Hamlet , very popular and hard to get , due to it satiric content over the Communist regime . It represents the drama of the intellectual man , the humanist , in a `` red '' world . A movie filled with passion , fear , sexuality , all the great ingredient for a great movie recipe.One of the greatest Romanian movie , despite it psychological charge ( after all , it is an European movie ) .

If it were n't for the editing out of curse word and a superimposed blur when one character give another the finger , it would be easy to mistake this low-budget snoozer for a Sci-Fi channel pilot . The plot about the government 's attempt to destroy a group of telekinetics it originally trained a military weapon end ambiguously enough with the hero , himself gifted , in pursuit of a telekinetic survivor bent on revenge . Alas , the movie is talky , boring , predictable and even devoid of interesting special effect . Top-billed Louis Gossett , Jr. ha a minor role a the evil government bureaucrat who originated the program and now want to eliminate all trace . He walk through the part and it is hard to understand why he bothered . Other member of the cast do a decent job with a script that demand little .

Whilst this is most definitely a well crafted piece of film-making , it 's thoroughly without any entertainment value whatsoever . If you 're depressed already , this film will send you over the edge . If you 're feeling somewhat depressed , this film will be just one more thing in your life to feel bitter about . You 'll feel that it 's just your luck to have chosen to watch a movie that turn out to be a complete waste of time . Otherwise you might be able to make it through this film unscathed ( I did n't , BTW ) , safe in the knowledge that your life is so much better than Jim 's . Then again you might consider that you have been fooling yourself , and that are in fact in a much worse situation than you 'd previously realized . You might feel a bit annoyed at Jim for bringing this to your attention . You may want to slap him around a bit with a wet fish . The sad truth is , much a I wanted to like this movie ... I hated it . It took rather a long miserable road down the path of oblivion and then suddenly , for no reason whatsoever , looked back at itself and then stopped . Jim doe not have an epiphany , at least not one that is conveyed on screen . Jim ha a miserable life and a miserable set of option . He discovers nothing that one can relate to and fails to make any significant progress on his journey of self-discovery . Of course no-one alive could write a happy ending to this movie . As others have said it 's no Hollywood tale , it 's gritty and it 's real . It 's well made . Life is quite a struggle at time . If anyone were to know `` the answer '' , they do well to shout it from the rooftop . Still , I feel cheated because this movie pretend to have something to say . You feel that it 's going to say something , that if you just suffer through a little more of it , it 'll have something to say . It 'll make you stop and think . It doe n't . Again , I do submit that this is a well crafted film . And therefore may be of value to a film student with a penchant for e.g . lighting technique of the use of colour palette . For the rest of u , it 's utterly miss-able .

There are hundred of zombie , and the Director look like Brendan Frazer ( he ha a cameo ) and it is just a wild trip .

During World War II , two Byelorussian ( Soviet Russian ) soldier try to avoid being captured by occupying Nazis , a they trudge through snowy terrain , searching for food and safety . If you happen not to like black-and-white `` foreign '' film , you may still enjoy `` Voskhozhdeniye '' ( retiled in English `` The Ascent '' ) . Director Larisa Shepitko pace the film extraordinarily well , despite it being a largely introspective piece of work . Her untimely death , in a car accident , made this Ms. Shepitko 's final film , unfortunately . After the opening mission is declared , there doe n't seem to be much that could happen in the snowy wood , but Shepitko and a changing setting make it unexpectedly exciting . Leading player Vladimir Gostyukhin ( a the spiritually wounded `` Rybak '' ) and Boris Plotnikov ( a the physically wounded 'Sotnikov '' ) successfully avoid being crushed by the ever increasing symbolism . Their allegorical performance , under Shepitko 's sharp direction , provide a memorable and thought-provoking take on a familiar story . * * * * * * * * Voskhozhdeniye ( 4/2/77 ) Larisa Shepitko ~ Vladimir Gostyukhin , Boris Plotnikov , Lyudmila Polyakova , Anatoli Solonitsyn

1904 . The North African nation of Morocco is hanging onto a tenuous Independence , a the various European power - France , Germany , Britain , Russia , Spain , and now the United States - are vying for influence in the region . The Sultan ( Marc Zuber ) is a weak puppet ; his uncle , the Bashaw ( Vladek Sheybal ) , who is being manipulated by the French and Germans , is the real power behind the throne . Enter Berber Chieftan Raisuli ( Sean Connery ) , the leader of the Rif tribe and `` the last of the Barbary Pirates '' , who kidnaps an American missionary , Eden Pedecaris ( Candice Bergen ) and her two child and take them hostage . Back in the US , President Theodore Roosevelt ( Brian Keith ) threatens to go to war over the issue : `` Pedecaris Alive or Raisuli Dead ! '' - seeing the issue a the perfect way to exercise his `` Big Stick '' diplomacy , though Secretary of State John Hay ( John Huston ) is not so confident . However , the Raisuli ha le sinister plan for the Pedecarises , who are more than capable of handling themselves in any event . John Milius 's great historical film , based VERY loosely off of a true story ( i.e . Pedecaris wa a middle-aged man ) , is a wonderful bit of escapism . It ha some amazing action scene , a witty , well-written script , a fine cast enjoying themselves with the material , and doe not overstay it welcome like , say , `` Pirates of the Caribbean '' or the `` Lord of the Rings '' movie . It 's not really an `` epic '' film in the strictest sense , but it 's one of the best pure action movie ever made . While the historical context is shaky , the storyline is interesting , and a some reviewer point out , it is even more pertinent today than it wa when made . As President Roosevelt say , `` America is like a grizzly bear '' - fierce , strong , but a little blind and reckless at time . At the time of the film 's setting , America ha just been propelled onto the world stage a superpower , following their resounding victory in the Spanish-American War - and Roosevelt seizes this incident a a way to prove America 's worth . In real life , it did n't quite work out that way , but allegorically it work well . While written from a right-wing perspective , Milius 's screenplay is pretty accurate in assessing America and it place in the world . He admires Roosevelt and his method of `` big stick '' diplomacy , and correctly recognizes ( in the word of Roosevelt ) that while America may be feared and respected , they 'll never be truly `` loved '' by the world , no matter what they do . And there are some scene - like Roosevelt 's target shooting of European leader and the almost-comic surprise attack by Marines on the Bashaw 's palace - which show America 's reckless and violent side , while others - the climactic showdown with the Germans - show their heroism . The historical/political context of the film is , of course , merely meat on the bone of what is essentially a rousing action/adventure film . There are some brilliantly done action scene , such a Raisuli 's rescue of the Pedecaris 's from double-crossing tribesman , which feature some of the best swordplay in any film . The opening entrance of the Raisuli and the aforementioned march and attack of the US Marines are brilliantly done bravura set piece . And the final battle , which combine element of `` Lawrence of Arabia '' and `` The Wild Bunch '' , while a major historical fantasy ( a three-way battle between Germans , Americans , and the Rifs ) , is a superbly staged , adrenaline-pumping sequence . The excellent cast give some wonderful performance . Everyone seems to be having a fun time with the film , and it show . Sean Connery is surprisingly convincing a a Berber with a Scottish accent , but manages to pull off his interesting , well-drawn and chivalrous character who come to respect his hostage and abhors modern , uncivil warfare . Candice Bergen , an actress whom I 've never been fond of , give a fine performance a the feisty Eden Pedecaris , who is every bit a tough a her captor . Brian Keith is an amazingly convincing TR - you really feel he must have been like this , an athletic , blustering , yet practical and intelligent man with an admirable sense of self . The scene of Roosevelt boxing and target-shooting while discussing foreign policy are some of the greatest `` bad as '' moment in movie history - and who can forget line like `` Why spoil the beauty of the thing with legality ? '' John Huston provides solid support a the weary , cautious Hay , acting a a perfect foil to the much more impetuous Roosevelt . Among the fine supporting cast , the best are Geoffrey Lewis a Samuel Gummere , the cynical Ambassador caught in the middle of the political intrigue , and Steve Kanaly , a the gung-ho Marine Captain who cheerfully advocate ( and carry out ) `` Military intervention ! '' a the blunt and simple solution to the whole complex situation . Other familiar face such a Vladek Sheybal , Nadim Sawalha , Roy Jenson , Larry Cross , Marc Zuber , and Darrell Fetty also do fine work , no matter how small their role . Spaghetti Western fan will recognize Antoine Saint-John ( `` A Fistful of Dynamite '' ) a the German general and Aldo Sambrell a one of Raisuli 's tribesman . `` The Wind and the Lion '' is , all around , a wonderfully done adventure film . It ha something for everyone : wonderful gun- and swordplay , a lot of humor , a tough , feisty heroine ( and her two cute child ) , a nice ( if unconsummated ) romance , and an interesting ( if fanciful ) political/historical context . It 's not a masterpiece , but hey , it wa n't trying to be . I give `` The Wind and the Lion '' a stirring nine star and my highest recommendation .

They are happy to give them the money , but in exchange , Rory ha to come have dinner with them every Friday night . I highly recommend this show . I love it !
