I ca n't say I enjoyed this a much a `` The Big Lebowski '' or `` Raising Arizona , '' and felt a little slighted , but `` O Brother '' is an enjoyable film worthy of some good laugh and a taste of the Coens ' brisk , twisted sense of creativity . The DVD edition contains the featurette , and I wa interested to find out that the Coens are pretty simple in their directorial technique . That surprised me ! Of course , this movie is not the best example ( and I 'm only saying this in comparison ) and it wa n't worthy of any Oscars ( many feel it wa robbed ) , but maybe it depends on the appeal . Though I enjoyed the Coens ' previous work , I 've never been a fan of old western or `` The Dukes of Hazzard '' or any of that stuff they show daily on TNN . I guess that 's why I did n't feel a enthusiastic about checking out this movie , seeing that it revolves around Southern folk . For all those from the South who are reading this , I do n't mean to offend ANY of your people ! I 'm sure you guy feel the same way when you watch movie about urban area like `` A Bronx Tale . '' When you live in the city all your life , it 's hard to get accustomed to film of this nature . But all apology aside , I found the character fun and quirky . I think John Turturro nailed the accent perfectly , and seeing the way he talk in real life I find that amazing . Tim Blake Nelson wa also good . Of course , George Clooney -- who I assume is not the best at feigning accent , judging by his decision to chuck the idea of working with a dialogue coach and developing a New England accent for `` The Perfect Storm '' -- naturally seems a little miscast and continually struggle with the accent . His performance wa good , though . You can also spot Coen regular like Holly Hunter ( in a short but sweet role ) and John Goodman ( also on screen for a short time , but steal every minute of it ) . Though I do n't normally dig country music , I liked the title song `` A Man of Constant Sorrow . '' The DVD also contains the music video for that song . Overall , I found the film entertaining and original , but it doe n't have that in-your-face quality that the Coens have shown to u in the past . It 's a slighter effort , but a good one . I still suggest you check it out . My score : 7 ( out of 10 )

First , let 's get it out of the way . . . yeah , this film steal a LOT from 'Darkness Falls ' ( 2003 ) . The plot for 'Darkness Falls ' go something like this : The Tooth Fairy , a murderous woman who hide her face due to disfigurement kill people who look at her out of revenge . In 'The Tooth Fairy ' ( 2006 ) , the disfigured Tooth Fairy ( who , yeah , hide her face ) unleashes her furious vengeance on just about anyone . A little too similar to be coincidence . But , what must be asked is this : If you 're going to directly steal the exact plot from a movie , why choose something a mediocre a 'Darkness Falls ' ? Sure it made a few buck at the box office , but that wa strictly for the fairly okay theatrical experience the film delivered . A low-budget , straight-to-video movie will not have that same effect . And it did n't . As I watched the opening 15-20 minute of the film , my expectation actually rose . There seemed to be at least SOME production value . The story did n't seem terrible , just blatantly ripped off . Past the first scene , we get an okay cast of character including an ex-doctor with secret ( played by that guy who look like a Busey ) and some hot veterinary student ( Jenifer from Argento 's 'Masters of Horror : Jenifer ' ) . After those few minute , however , the film just slowly go down the drain . It serf all the basic horrible clichés including , but not limited to : some crazy old person with an unheeded warning , the buff dumb jock , the psychic , and the stripper with the heart-of-gold . One of the biggest problem this film had wa it inability to stick with a target audience . It 's kind of like the filmmaker wanted to change the tone for whatever character wa on screen at the time . When the adult were on screen , it had a more mature feel . When Star ( the stripper ) and whatshisface ( the jock ) were on screen , the dialogue went down to a more stupid , err immature , level . When the kid wa on screen , it felt like an episode of 'Are You Afraid of the Dark ? ' . . . only le scary . Technically , the film is all over the place . The visuals range from fairly good to plain boring . The writing is subpar , a is the acting for the most part . On the plus side , there 's some excessive gore at part ( including a fairly cool ( yet painfully predictable ) ) woodchipper scene and a pretty vicious nailgun scene . Also , if you 're looking for a bit of the sexy stuff , there 's a brief topless scene ( but if you want to see this chick topless , there are better film to do that ) . Other than that , there 's not much to bother with when it come to this film . If you 're a huge fan of 'Darkness Falls ' ( do those exist ? ) , maybe you can check it out to see the story done in a different way . . . but , that 's about the only reason I can find to see this one . Final Verdict : 3/10 -AP3-

Like those who listened to radio report about the attack on Pearl Harbor , every one who ha ever seen PINK FLAMINGOS can tell you exactly where they were when they first saw it -- and some thirty year later the movie is still one of the most unspeakably vile , obnoxious , repulsive , and hilariously funny film ever put to celluloid , guaranteed to test the strongest stomach and the toughest funny bone . Filmed with a close-to-zero budget and some of the shakiest cinematography around , PINK FLAMINGOS tell the story of two family that compete for the tabloid title of `` The Filthiest People Alive . '' Just how filthy can they be ? Plenty : the film includes everything from sex with chicken to what I can only describe a a remarkable display of rectal control to a heaping helping of doggie doo , and I guarantee that you wo n't want to eat an egg for at least several week after seeing it . The cast is either wonderful , atrocious , or atrociously wonderful , depending on how you look at it . The star , of course , is Divine ... and to describe Divine a the BIGGEST drag queen on the planet would the understatement of the year . She is a mammoth creature given to BIG eye makeup , BIG orange hair , and BIG expression -- she is the Charleton Heston of drag , and whether she is almost running down a jogger , pausing to use the bathroom on some one 's front lawn , or startling real-life shopper by taking a stroll along a Baltimore sidewalk she is both unspeakable and unspeakably funny . Others in the cast include Mary Vivian Pearce , Danny Mills , and the ever-appalling Edith Massey a member of Divine 's family ; and Mink Stole and David Lochary a the white-slaving , baby-selling couple who challenge Divine 's status . It should be pretty obvious that PINK FLAMINGOS is not exactly a movie that will appeal to just every one , and viewer who know director John Waters only through such later film a HAIRSPRAY and CRYBABY will be in for a major jolt . But if you want to see something so completely different that even Monty Python could n't imagine it , this is the movie for you . Just make sure you eat before you see it , because you probably wo n't want to eat afterward -- and you might want to keep a barf bag handy just in case . Gary F. Taylor , aka GFT , Amazon Reviewer

I 've been working pretty hard lately , and this is guaranteed to be a hit with all these big name , right ? I 'm just gon na cruise along and let somebody else carry the can . Nice movie with a great soundtrack which span through the rock landscape of the 70 's and 80 's . Radiofreccia describes a generation , it describes life in a small village near Correggio ( hometown of Ligabue , the singer who wrote the book that inspired the movie ) , it describes life of young people and their problem relating to the world . It reminds of Trainspotting , with a bit of Italian touch .

I 'd waited for some year before this movie finally got released in England , but wa in many way very pleased when I finally saw it . There are a lot of great thing to the film , for a start the acting . Its not something I have all that much need for in a horror picture but the people in this film all put in fine work . This and the constantly gripping and interesting script , with a nice sorta Lovecraftian feel to it , give the film a real solid backbone . Add to this the dos of surreal nightmare imagery and occasional gruesome gore and the film a winner . It ha my favorite kind of gore too , supernatural and splattery . Also , the character of Marcus , the angry bodybuilding transsexual and Daisy , his mentally retarded lover/plaything are genuinely freakish and unnerving at time , and give a far out , anything go sense of morbid grown up craziness which work well with the frequent Freudian overtone . This is one of the most impressive recent horror movie , far more shocking or out there than anything Hollywood can produce . My only gripe wa that I wanted the ending to be darker in tone , but it still work , so on the whole I 'd really recommend this to serious horror buff .

This movie ha one or two slightly interesting gag but they are NOT worth the wait . After an unexplained argument between two guy picking up litter in a drive-in movie theatre we cut to a family leaving ! Hollywood and driving driving driving driving their camper van across the screen again and again a inane dialogue is voiced over . At least I think it 's inane , the terrible song that accompanies this montage is mixed so loud it render the dialogue at time almost inaudible . Finally the camper van arrives , at night , at a gas station where the family get out , have another inane conversation , before driving off . The camera then pan across to reveal the actor we have just seen drive away . He talk straight to camera and we realise he is the director of the movie we are watching which is about him , and how he came to make the movie . A nice idea which ALMOST ( but not quite ) make the previous sequence worth the pain . As the movie unfolds he encounter the two character we met picking litter at the start of the movie and they all form a motion picture company . All sort of not very funny and clumsy comedy ensues a they put together a crew and attempt to raise the cash needed to start filming . This movie wa obviously put together on a shoe string and a promise and there is a nice little idea in here struggling to get out but the execution is so inept that the idea get lost . Comedy is more than thing just falling over and everyone talking ( or shouting ) at once . So much of the dialogue here is shouted by several actor simultaneously - Robert Altman can do this sort of thing well because he ha a script , rehearsal , decent sound techie , and editing facility . Everyone shouting at the one mike which , by the sound of it , wa hidden in a dustbin in the next room , doe not make for clarity .

Well here come another , well , romantic comedy ... but unlike all others movie of this genre , this is by far the best I have seen in a long while .. I 'll admit , at first I wanted to watch this movie because of Megan Fox , and a little because of Simon Pegg ... First of all , if you have watched a decent amount of movie , you will know that Sidney and Alison would be together at the and of the movie , one way or another ... but from the beginning to the end of the movie you wo n't know how ... Okay , now this movie is just made for Simon Pegg.I ca n't see any other actor in the role of Sidney , and I 'm sure this would be a very weaker movie if not for Pegg 's great performance . There is a number of great gag and joke in this movie that kept me laughing really hard , courtesy of Simon Pegg 's character Sidney ... but I think everyone in this movie is good.For example , Kirsten Dunst is really solid in this movie ( I usually do n't think of her a any more than an average actress , but she wa really good in this one ) , then there 's Jeff Bridges , there 's Gillian Anderson , and of course Megan Fox who play spoiled bitchy star Sophie Maes ... great role for her ... All in all , while I usually do n't agree with rating her on IMDb , this time I would completely agree with them ... Go and see this movie , it is really light-hearted and positive , and I recommend it deeply ... My rating 7 out of 10 ... well 7.5 actually ...

With the advent of the IMDb , this overlooked movie can now find an interested audience . Why ? Because user here who do a search on two-time Academy Award winner Glenda Jackson can find 'The Return of The Soldier ' among her credit . So can those checking out Oscar winner Julie Christie . Fans of Ann-Margret can give the title a click , a will those looking into the career of the great Alan Bates . Not to mention the added bonus of a movie with supporting heavyweight Ian Holm and Frank Finlay . Any movie with so many notable in it is rewarded by the IMDb , given all the cross-referencing that go on here . So , why is n't this movie out on DVD ? Do n't the Producers realize the Internet Movie Database is a marketing gift for such a film ? And 'The Return of The Soldier ' is definitely a gem waiting to be discovered . Get with it , people .

[ WARNING : CONTAINS SPOILERS ] Written by husband and wife Wally Wolodarsky ( who also directed ) and Maya Forbes , this indie film is one of the better romantic comedy in recent memory . Jay Mohr take a break from playing smarmy weasel to be the nice guy faced with the fact his fiancée want to bed other people and he 's allowed to do so , too . Julianne Nicholson , who wa so good in `` Tully , '' play spunky and vulnerable with great gusto . Too bad she doe n't get the recognition she deserves . Good supporting performance help immensely , too . Lauren Graham , who made last year 's `` Bad Santa '' memorable , play the jaded , cynical sister to perfection , Bryan Cranston ( the dad on TV 's `` Malcolm in the Middle '' ) get a few funny , raunchy moment , and Andy Richter play a genial guy who fall for a single mother - Helen Slater in a credible , albeit familiar , role a a mousy woman . What surprised me most about `` Seeing Other People '' wa how funny it is . There are some genuine laugh here . Ed 's first attempt at meaningless sex get some great line , and there 's a ménage a trois that elicits one of the most truthful reaction from a man a the male fantasy get tweaked . The film 's premise is n't unusual , but I liked that it wa Alice ( Nicholson ) who thought of it , much to the chagrin of Ed ( Mohr ) . Given the genre , you know that no matter how good her intention are , Alice 's plan is doomed . We see how the couple work through this strange situation . Initially , Alice and Ed are turned on by the idea , but then the human element set it . I appreciated Forbes and Wolodarsky not turning this into a cheap sex romp . Yes , there 's sex and nudity , but there also are real emotion at work here . The `` other people '' Alice and Ed befriend do n't want to be the object of casual sex ; they have feeling , too . In one case , too many feeling . Granted , some scene run one joke too many , the Richter-Slater subplot is n't necessary and Alice doe something truly uncharacteristic . But that 's forgivable because Mohr and Nicholson generate such tremendous intimacy and honesty - check out the scene where Ed rummage through Alice 's underwear drawer or his reaction to her announcement about ending the experiment - that no matter how much we might enjoy their little game , we root for this couple to succeed . Unfortunately , this film got little , if any , publicity and a limited release . Hollywood studio , whose romantic comedy often veer on the unfunny , turgid and unsurprising , would do well to learn from this intelligent and funny film .

What a terrible movie ! It represents perfectly the state of degenerateness of French society , where the most elementary respect for wholesome value and tradition ha completely disappeared . The plot is nonsensical , the movie is not funny at all and the character are completely shallow and uninteresting . To say the least , the direction and the cinematography are very poor and uninspired . Catherine Deneuve is a bad an actress a she always wa , even when she wa directed by Bunuel in Belle De Jour . The rest of the usually good cast ( Vincent Lindon , Line Renaud , Jean Yanne ) seem completely lost in an ocean of vulgarity , platitude and restlessness . I can not help to draw a parallel with the wonderful James Ivory 's `` Le Divorce '' , with it thoughtful depiction of French and American more , it superlative cinematography and stellar cast put to good use . Having watched `` Le Divorce '' you can feel a kind of empathy with the French , regardless of their foible . `` Belle-Maman '' leaf you with only a nauseated contempt for it morally bankrupt and clueless protagonist .

This film 's kind of like Conan the Barabarian , but with more sex , rape and murder . There is a plot somewhere underneath all this debauchery but the filmmaker do n't do a good job showing it , which is a shame because it 'could ' be a decent story . Richard Hill give a solid performance in the lead role , a doe the villain - who sadly did n't appear in anything else of note . The fight scene are n't too bad either - I love the way Deathstalker let his sword 'drink ' the blood of his victim - and there 's plenty of nudity and sex to temper the general level of machismo throughout . All in all , not good - but not necessarily that bad either ...

The film had it moment , but wa disappointing in my eye anyway . It wa a reworking of Trespass ( Walter Hill ) and so The Treasure Of the Sierra Madre , with le tension , bite and human emotion . There wa some nice acting but the story wa limp and lacked any real depth . I watched the movie for Mr Reno and Mr Fishburn , neither were inspired and both had little to say or act out of their skin for . This movie ha been done to death in the past and did not have to be made , eats up money which could be used on better movie . For an action movie it wa sparse of action and a a thriller did not thrill . Better than watching snow fall , but not for me .

Even MST3K could n't make this painful , long , and ultimately mind-bending drek funny or entertaining . While most bad movie in and of themselves are hilariously bad , this one is one of those few video that us the word bad in it literal sense . The element that make this so PAINFUL to watch is not the lack of story , but the fact that SOOOO much background is crammed into the first half-hour that it is utterly ridiculous and harder to follow than a highway while driving with no headlight . The hero of the film , Ator , is no more than eye-candy for this literal energy-sucker of a film . Dressed in a loin-cloth and sporting `` pecs like melon , '' a Joel put it , he belongs more in a fitness magazine than here . I would recommend this ONLY to die-hard , and I mean die-hard follower of cheese . If you have an enemy , recommend them this film . If you make it through this , I commend you . You should be able to make it through anything .

Square really landed this one . They did n't try to please everyone and instead focused exclusively on Final Fantasy 7 fan . And boy , are those going to be happy fan when they see this movie ! The story might not be all that interesting or credible but it tie in neatly with the story of the game and ha several honest-to-god funny moment ! ! PS : I know my review sound like the raving of a teenage girl . It wa , like , totally what I intended .

Watching The Wagonmaster is not likely to result in deep thought , unlike many other great Ford film , like The Searchers , My Darling Clementine , The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance , and The Grapes of Wrath among others , but it is likely to produce a feeling of awe and deep satisfaction . The story is very simple : two cowboy decide to help a wagon train of Mormons get to California . Along the way , they run into a medicine man whose mule ran away , a group of bank robber , and some Navajos . There 's a lot of adventure and excitement on the trail , and the film is imbued with fun and beauty . The music is absolutely beautiful . The scenery , again from Monument Valley , is a beautiful a it ever wa . Plus , how can you go wrong with James Arness ? The Wagonmaster might not be one of John Ford 's better known film , but it is nonetheless a must-see if you get the chance . 9/10 .

This wa the most unrealistic movie I ever seen . I ca n't believe that the writer and director did n't see that almost all the movie look like a SF one . For example : 1 . It is impossible for the killer to stay on cold glaze and after 10 hour to get up so quickly . 2 . You ca n't get electrocuted trough a water pipe like in the movie . ( believe me , it 's my domain ) 3 . With a saw you can cut 10 pipe in 10 hour very easy . Let 's say that the chain wa made from steel but the water pipe wa rusty and it wa made from iron . 4 . If you try to cut your foot with a saw you faint ( in the best case , it 's more likely to die because your hart fails ) before to get to the bone ( shin ) . And there are more other example .

A very great movie . A big love story . Lots of sword fighting . Huge battle scene . Heros and villain . Real history . Few in the West know much Chinese history . Chin Zchaundi founded China . The country is in fact named after him . Some are familiar with the terra cotta army recently unearthed . This is a historical epic of how he ended the Period of Contending States and unified China . He founded a dynasty that only last 14 year but it wa immediately replaced by the Han dynasty that permanently defined Chinese civilization ever since . Chin ( or the King of Zheng a he wa known before he founded the empire ) wa roughly contemporaneous with Scipio , Hannibal , and Fabius in the West . The parallel Roman world dominance ( West and East world ) wa achieved without a single towering personality like Chin . It would not be for another century before the West produced Caesar - the nearest comparable Western figure . Chin is shown very sympathetically here in the beginning but he develops over the course of the film into a ruthless despot . History only record the ruthless despot part but the sympathetic beginning leaf room for real character development over the course of this long film . The famous story about the meeting with the assassin is a true a any two thousand year old anecdote can be . Gong Li is lovely . She is the emotional core of the story . It all make for great movie making .

I saw this `` movie '' partly because of the sheer number of good review at Netflix , and from it I leaned a valuable lesson . Not a lesson about ethnic diversity however ... the lesson I learned is `` Do n't trust review '' . Yes , racism suck and people are complicated , but the people who actually need to see this movie are going to be the one who are the least drawn to it and least affected by it if they DO see it . The only reason that I can think of for the number of good review is that it 's being reviewed by people who are n't used to thinking , or who 've seen their first thought-provoking movie and somehow think that Haggis invented the concept . In fact , he basically made this film , which should be called `` Racism For Dummies '' , a emotionally wrenching a possible , seemingly to give people who do n't spend a lot of time thinking the impression that they 've discovered some fundamental truth that 's never been covered in a film before . Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maintanence it 's not ... An after-school special for the unthinking mass , cut into bite-sized overwrought ham-fisted piece to make it easier to swallow without too much introspection . It 's a if they portrayed everyone a being the worst possible extreme , simply to make u happy that we 're such good people because we do n't identify with the character . Let 's face it people . NOBODY identifies with these character because they 're all cardboard cutout and stereotype ( or predictably reverse-stereotypes ) . It 's well acted ( even if the dialog is atrocious ) and cleverly executed , so much that you do n't think to ask `` where 's the beef ? '' until you can tell the film is winding down . The flaming car scene wa well executed , like much of the movie , but went nowhere in the end . The message are very heavy-handed , and from the `` behind the scene '' blurb , the producer were clearly watching a different movie , because there is very little to laugh about in this movie , even during the intended funny part . I have to stress that this is NOT entertainment , more like a high school diversity lesson ... call it the `` Blood on the Highway '' of racism . They could even show this in high school if it were n't for the `` side-nude '' shot of Jennifer Esposito . In this film , everyone 's a jerk and everyone learns a lesson ( except for Michael Pena who get the best role , but the most predictable storyline ) . This is a bad film , with bad writing , and good actor .... an ugly cartoon crafted by Paul Haggis for people who ca n't handle anything but the bold stroke in storytelling .... a picture painted with crayon . Crash is a depressing little nothing , that provokes emotion , but teach you nothing if you already know racism and prejudice are bad thing .

As a Westerner watching another culture 's view and tradition of marriag , I found Just Married mesmerizing and delightful . The idea of marrying a stranger through the mutual arrangement of parent is difficult , especially in this modern age . Yet this is the case in this Hindi film . Told with humor , and fresh perspective , we learn of Abhay and Ritika who have only met once and are now on their traditional five day honeymoon . As said , it is difficult to believe in this cell phone affluent age that such an archaic custom a an arranged marriage still take place . We see the awkwardness that this young couple feel a they come together on their first night , and how they try to forge a bond , even though they do not know one another . We see different view of marriage and commitment a presented by the other couple also on holiday , from a couple of forty year married to others still unsure of making marital commitment . There 's song , witty dialog , poignant moment , blending and comparison of new way and tradition . Watching the movie with subtitle definitely loses some of the trueness of the story , yet it is still a delight to watch . Granted some of the plot is a little trite and the bus incident a bit drawn out and contrived ; however the overall movie wa worth watching .

My nose is bent slightly out of shape a I write this . I had sent a previous comment on this film some week ago that ha not yet appeared , so I assume it wa rejected , even though it met all the usual guideline . I found this film interesting for the first thirty minute , particularly the performance of Jordi Mollà , a veteran actor who ha appeared in such major production a `` Blow '' and `` The Alamo . '' Leonor Watling is also quite good . Unfortunately , everything sink eventually under the weight of a truly awful , melodramatic script . There is also an abundance of gratuitous nudity that doe nothing to advance the narrative or lend even an impressionistic nuance to what is otherwise a beautifully filmed piece of art . An actual day trip to the beach at Valencia would be much le arduous than having to encounter these fictional character again anywhere , anytime .

This is an interesting movie . I think it 's very humorous , although the humor is very black . Fulci is good and funny acting himself , it 's a really funny and truly crazy `` self-portrait '' of an artist ( `` I make horror film . If I would make love film , no-one would buy ticket ... '' ) . And it 's really SEXY movie also : Almost all the time there is some `` action '' or tension going on ; and many sexy girls/women ... Maybe it go to the core of why anyone start to do movies/art in the first place ... It 's a real psychedelic trip , maybe best seen a little drunk or some similar state of mind . There is some really nasty gore scene also , of course , because it 's Lucio Fulci . As a matter of fact some of those scene are quite disgusting . Anyway it 's one of the three best and most complete Fulci film I 've seen ( the others are House By The Cemetery & Zombi.Have n't seen The Beyond ) . Actually , the script is overally , to my opinion , quite ingenious . You could see this movie a a portrait of an extreme neurotic , or a person who suffers from obsessive-compulsive disorder ( fashionable word ) : The character ha a compulsive need to confess `` crime '' or bad thought ; Especially crime he ha n't even DONE . And he question himself all the time : What if I HAVE done it ? What if I want to do it ? Have I done it ? Do I want to do it ? He overreacts and exaggerates his thought . I 'm sure Fulci ha been interested of psychology , and maybe even read something of the area ; in his `` House By The Cemetery '' -movie for example there is a character named Freudstein . This is maybe the most concentrated and straightly personal movie Fulci did . I also like the simplicity of the photography/pictures in this film . Only thing that disturbs me a little bit is the sadism , especially towards woman ; I do n't quite understand why ? Is it entertainment ? Is it art ? Is it horror ? Anyways and overall , this is really interesting and well made movie , definitely recommended classic film at least for fan or anyone interested of this genre . For the others it may be too much .

I could not watch more than 10 minute of this movie . It ha set the standard . I will never again give a movie a 1 , unless it wa a horrible a this one . I fully agree with the other comment about this film . But , since I 'm Dutch , I watched it with Dutch translation . Apparently , they did n't have money for a proper translation , so they decided to babelfish it . With sometimes hilarious result . Do n't smoke , do n't drink , do n't do drug , do n't watch Demon Summer . I wa surprised that the actor ( Wow , I ca n't believe I just said that . ) did n't hold the script ( Was there any ? ) in their hand while shooting . I think they also did a good job on ... Well ... Uhmm ... No , they did n't do a good job at all .

Okay , I had watched this movie when I wa very little and the day that we were cleaning out the closet I see this ! I thought , '' I have no idea of what this movie wa like , '' so I went ahead and put it in.OH MY GOD ! ! ! ! ! This film is so darn bad ! I never thought that this film could ever get a close to my least favorite film a it did , but I did laugh , because all the joke were so corny and ridiculous , not funny ! ! ! ! So much stuff in this movie wa funny , because it wa SO STUPID ! ! ! ! This film is not anywhere near good.I would have to say if you want to watch this movie you definitely better not expect anything big and if you 've already seen it , trust me , I feel your pain a well ! ! ! !

I had n't planned on seeing this movie , however I wa n't disappointed when a friend dragged me along . Although there are no real surprise here , the guy do reasonably well with their obviously modest budget . If you 've seen the trailer you probably know what to expect from this type of movie and there 's a pretty constant stream of joke here , with a couple of classic moment , with the highpoint probably being an excellent flashback to what the guy were like in the 1980 's . Also , I 've read elsewhere that the ending wa a disappointment , but I found it refreshingly different from what I had expected from this genre . Overall , this movie wont change your life , but it 's got enough laugh there to keep you entertained throughout .

Yeah , that about sum it up . This movie wa horrifying . Two minute in I wanted to gouge my eye out . This ha been praised a an `` innovative LDS comedy , '' but it 's not even good for member of that church ! I do n't think any human being should be so victimized a to watch a movie of this low quality . First of all , you can tell that absolutely no effort whatsoever went into this movie . It seems a if the horribly drab , glib , trite plot wa thrown together by two crazy weasel somehow imbued with the gift for coherent ( at least semi-coherent ) thought . Then , there 's the acting , which is dismal from * everybody * involved . Even the cameo fail to liven anything up . And let 's not forget the fact that our protagonist is a shallow jerk who we would like to believe can change , but that road is full of embarrassingly bad dialogue , appallingly hideous `` gag , '' and a lot of Mormon `` in-joke '' that anyone in their right mind , LDS or not , should consider purely * stupid * ! This ha to be one of the worst film I 've ever seen !

Infamous horror film seldom measure up the hype that surround them and I have yet to come across a worse offender than Wes Craven 's The Hills Have Eyes . Having held back from watching this for year , I wa really pleased when I got it for Christmas and waited for an evening when my girlfriend wa out to settle down and watch it - knowing her extreme dislike for anything genuinely horrifying . I need n't have bothered . After a promising - if familiar - start , that firmly set the film in the 'Desolution USA ' world of survival horror , thing rapidly go to piece when the protagonist and antagonist meet in the deserted wasteland . Looking like it wa shot on a budget of $ 5 , with the cannibal clan 's costume hired from a dodgy fancy dress shop that specialises in faux caveman and Red Indian attire , the story follows an annoying bunch of unsympathetic WASPs who take a detour on a road trip to California , to look for a silver mine in a nuclear testing zone ( ! ) . When they break down they are set upon by the local family of flesh-eaters and have to fight to survive . While hoping for another Deliverance , Texas Chainsaw Massacre , Wrong Turn or Devil 's Rejects , I actually realised I 'd stumbled across something that should have remained dusty and unwatched in a backstreet video store 's bargain bin . With gallon of tomato ketchup for blood and a couple of gruesome wound close-ups , I can kind of see how an 18 Certificate ( in the UK ) is justified , but with those close-ups trimmed this would n't have looked out of place a a Saturday afternoon thriller on ITV . The whole silver mine/nuclear test site subplot is just a McGuffin to justify pitching the 'civilised ' family against the primitive , but given how easily the savage get their ass whupped it stretch credibility to think that they had survived for a generation preying on passer-by . And then there 's the ending ... or lack thereof . The Hills Have Eyes seems to be missing either a third act or , at the very least , a satisfying denouement . Instead , I wa just left wondering : `` Yeah , and ... ? ''

Although at first glance this movie look like the story of your parent 's high school life ( and many people will try to tell you that this movie is WAY outdated ) ... and I admit that that wa MY first impression .... but honestly , the 'lessons ' that are learned by the heroes/heroines are def . NOT outdated . Who doe n't want to be famous ? And who doe n't want do be accepted my their peer ? And the homosexual guy-is n't there a whole controversy today about gay marriage , blah , blah ? This movie , though released in the 80 's still address some of the biggest issue in today 's world . This movie doe have a little too much profanity and nudity for my taste , though . ( thus the 8/10 rating )

There are not many film which I would describe a perfect , but Rififi definitely fit the bill . No other heist film ha come close to it , before or after . The plot is simple , but engrosses you . It never cease to amaze me how absolutely gripping the film is every time you view it . You care for all the character , even though they are bank robber , because they are presented a human being with all their problem and flaw . It 's hard to imagine any other actor besides Jean Servais in the role of Tony le Stéphanois . When the member of the crew are each talking about what they are going to do with their money and finally get to Tony , his answer and the expression on his face say it all . While the 30 minute heist sequence is the most famous part of the movie ( and rightfully so ) the film actually get better afterward.The director Jules Dassin knew what he wa doing when he decided to not have any music during the heist scene or the final shootout , but instead inserted a great climactic score during Tony 's final ride towards his destiny . To think that if Dassin , an American Director , had not been blacklisted in Hollywood and forced to work in France , this masterpiece of cinema would never have been made the way it wa . It certainly would n't have been a good if it wa made a an American film during that time . It wa absolutely horrible what Dassin had to go through , but he did achieve his greatest work because of it , to the benefit of all of u . I 'm just cringing at the thought of the upcoming Al Pacino remake . Most heist film since Rififi have already borrowed from it in some way or another . There 's no reason to remake this masterpiece other than money . Leave the classic alone !

Soul Calibur ha always been my favorite fighting game series of all time . And SCIII is my favorite one of the series . The graphic are very well done . Much bigger improvement over the choppy polygon in Soul Edge/Soul Blade . The character have facial expression , hair blow in the breeze and they even blink . Soul Calibur ha always been known for it 's interesting plot and character and SCIII is no exception . Each character ha his/her background story that is detailed and well done . My favorite character is Chai Xianghua . She 's cute , she 's funny and she 's a strong female character . Yeah , I know she wear pink and ha a boyfriend ( who she end up saving BTW ) , but there seems to be more to her than that . Xianghua , like all the other character , have flaw and upside to their personality , so no character is perfect , not even the good guy . The music is beautifully composed for a fighting game series . It doe n't sound kitchy ( the Vampire series ) nor doe it sound like old school porn film soundtrack ( Mortal Kombat ) . The character have their own theme and a lot of the theme are done to match the culture of that certain part of the world . I do n't think there is a song on this soundtrack I do n't like . Another cool thing about this game is to create your own anime-like character ( Create a Soul ) . You could make him/her look a cute or a sexy or even ugly if you like . However , if you found a character customization that you like , remember to take note , or else you wo n't remember how you created that character . I found myself being very addicted to CaS . Overall , I think Soul Calibur is my number one fighting game series of all time . It ha everything I asked for . What more could I want ?

Yes , I know that this movie is meant a a comedy ! And the humor is over the top ! But the theme about people getting le intelligent in future time might not be so far fetched ! I can not say that it will happen , but if we do n't take proper care of our educational system than this could be a possibility ! I have noticed that some school are n't teaching fact anymore ! ( Like history , geography , basic stuff ) . The focus is more on learning practical ability ! The theory behind most subject may be boring but is essential in understanding how thing work ! In the movie there is this ridiculous example of people growing crop with Gatorade in stead of water ! Well , we can laugh about it ! But if you never been taught that water contains mineral necessary for plant to grow so how would you know ! To me this is a scary notion ! So now you understand why this subject is n't funny anymore ! It could be that Mike Judge is making fun but at the same time is warning people for a real disaster if education doe n't improve fast ! Am I taking this movie too seriously ! Yes of course ! To each his own fun ! I loved Mike Judge 's work ( Beavis and Butthead and Office space ) ! In these he wa able to be critical and funny at the same time ! In `` Idiocracy '' I missed this ! Most of the event are too absurd and a I said earlier very scary ! I do think if you are in the mood you will like this movie !

The original animated Dark Knight return in this ace adventure movie that rival Mask of Phantasm in it coolness . There 's a lot of style and intelligence in Mystery of the Batwoman , so much more than Batman Forever or Batman and Robin . There 's a new crime-fighter on the street of Gotham . She dress like a bat but she 's not a grown-up Batgirl . And Batman is denying any affiliation with her . Meanwhile Bruce Wayne ha to deal with the usual romance and detective work . But the Penguin , Bain and the local Mob make thing little more complicated . I did n't have high hope for this 'un since being strongly let down but the weak Batman : Sub Zero ( Robin is n't featured so much here ! ) but I wa delighted with the imaginative and exciting set piece , the clever plot and a cheeky sense of humor . This is definitely a movie no fan of Batman should be without . Keep your ear open for a really catchy song called 'Betcha Neva ' which is featured prominently through-out . It 's a shame the DVD is n't so great . Do n't get me wrong there are some great feature ( the short 'Chase Me ' is awesome ) and a very cool Dolby 5.1 soundtrack but ... the movie is presented in Pan and Scan . Batman : Mystery of the Batwoman wa drawn and shot in 1.85:1 but this DVD is presented in 1.33:1 an in comparison to the widescreen clip shown on the feature there IS picture cut off on both side . I find this extremely annoying considering Mask of Phantasm wa presented in anamorphic widescreen . Warner have had to re-release literally dozen of movie on DVD because people have complained about the lack of Original Aspect Ratio available on some title . Why they chose to make that same mistake here again is beyond me . I would give this DVD 5/5 but the lack of OAR brings the overall score down to 4/5 . It 's a shame because widescreen would have completed a great DVD package .

If you asked me to pick the best acted movie ever made , this movie would be on a short list along with 1951 's Streetcar Named Desire . I imagine i 'll discover some others that qualify , but Kramer v Kramer is an outstanding exercise in naturalism . So it a very satisfying experience on that level : just watching the marvelous , probing performance of Dustin Hoffman , Meryl Streep and the child Justin Henry in particular . One of the best child performance ever . But I also find it very satisfying to watch , because it such a thoroughly involving story - it always make me forget my own problem . It ha such excellent narrative drive . Once you stick Kramer v Kramer on , and Alice Kramer leaf Ted to juggle work and their young son , telling him nothing more than she ha to discover herself - you keep watching to know that everything turn out okay for them . And even once you know how thing do turn out , each moment of the ride just ring so brilliantly true that it a joy to watch it happen again and again . Make no mistake - Kramer v Kramer is not light entertainment : it a very realistic portrayal of the effect of divorce on everyone involved . 10/10 . For one of the best script ( born out of conversation between Benton and Hoffman , who wa going through a divorce at the time ) ever written , executed and performed beautifully and faultlessly . Not to mention what a great , involving story it is . Put simply , a perfect film .

Let me say at the outset that I 'm not a very artistic person and that I do n't `` get '' new art . That being said , this film is absolutely crazy , and in my opinion not crazy in a good way . Filmed entirely in black and white with a series of very loosely connected story , Avida is a film for those who can look at modern art and say `` wow , I feel the energy and passion of this painting . '' The only reason I give this film a 3 out of 10 is because I actually did manage to laugh at some part , though mainly laughing at the sheer insanity of the film . Two of the character throwing chair on a lawn , a to do what these character were doing , I have no idea . I would n't recommend this film to anybody .
Wonderful film that mix documentary and fiction in a way that make the spectator question : what is the extent of truth in documentary film or is there such a thing a an objective documentary .

It ha been some year since I saw this , but remember it and would like to see it again . It kind of became a `` therapy '' for me with a personal experience of my own . A thirty-five year old man lament over a high-school baseball game in which he `` missed the ball '' and his team lost . He think about it 20 year later , `` if only I 'd hit that ball '' and how his life would be better because of it . Then , he get a chance to find out .... and get a little more than he bargained for . It reminds me so much of when I wa in high school , I twice tried out for our drill/dance team and did n't make it . This team wa the closest thing to a sorority in my school . If you were on it , you were `` all that . '' I did n't try out till my last two year of HS and after the second time , I took it really hard . I 'd hit and bruised my leg badly just before tryout and wore tights to cover the bruise , and that caused me to not make it . That wa in 1987 . Through the year , even now sometimes , I think `` If only I had n't hit my leg I would 've never worn those stupid tights . '' Now I do n't sit and think my life would be any better or even any different had I made it , but seeing this movie made me realize that we never really know how different thing may be by changing one little thing way back in the past . Who know , it could have changed the course of event to the point that I would n't have met my son 's father . I would recommend this movie to anyone who ha that one moment in the past they wish they could change . Be careful what you wish for ! ! !

Not really a big box office draw , but I wa pleasently surprised with this movie . James `` I did some thing to Farrah Fawcett '' Orr co-wrote and directed this movie about an ordinary , average guy named Larry Burrows who think his life would have been incredibly different if he hit a homerun at a key baseball game when he wa 15 . But thanks to mysterious and magical bartender Mike , Larry get his wish , yet soon realizes that his new life is n't exactly a he hoped it would be . I must say , this movie really impressed me . Critics have given it mixed , and I must say the concept is really interesting and pulled off well . Yes , it is a little standard , but pack enough funny moment , drama and excellent acting to make it really good . James Belushi ( I think ) wa Oscar worthy for his role . Jon Lovitz is perfect , and Linda Hamilton plus Renee Russo shine in their role . Michael Caine is perfect a the bartender . It 's just a good movie with a good lesson . If you 've never seen , I highly recommend you check

This is another Sci-Fi channel original movie staring Rhys Davies where it hard to decide whats worse , the acting , or the writing/directing/producing ( John Sheppherd helm all three . ) Basic story : obsessed exobiologist capture chubacabra monster , smuggles it in a cargo container aboard a cruise ship it escape and the blood bath begin . Clichéd sci fi cast of the sturdy captain with the beautiful daughter , handsome hero and mad scientist . Captian call in a terrorist alert for the ship ( since of course would n't believe a monster story . ) No dramatic Helicopter drop of the Navy Seals here . Budget only allowed for entire force force of eight seal to arrive in a fiberglass fishing boat and ride a ship wench aboard . Puleeze . Also cheesy computer animation of the ship you could do better on your computer . I also loved when the Seal commander looking thru standard binoculars from ten mile away wa able to see three people jump of the ship . If the Sci-Fi channel is going to continue original movie I hope they realize there audience is not kindergarten level and purchase better script and director . If this were direct to video you would find it in the 99 cent bin .

The rest of the cast ( Elpidia Carrillo , Magda Rivera , Jose Herredia , Luz Maria Randon , to mention a few ) turn in oh so fine role , in a film that will keep you wondering `` is there any respectable character here ? Rated ' R ' by the MPAA , this film contains outburst of vulgar language , brief flash of nudity , adult content & violence , some of which is quite lurid .

In a lot of way this film defines the essence of everything I love about cinema , in term of capturing those strange , elusive moment of unguarded truth . In other way , it is undeniably an amateurish , unfocused result of junky self-indulgently fooling around with a camera . Ultimately it come out somewhere between pure brilliance and unwatchability ( thankfully much more so the former than the latter ) . Part of me want to reward it solely for it 's absolute innovativeness and moment of pure sublimity , but at the same time I ca n't completely ignore the occasionally downright awful `` acting '' and overtly bad production value . At first the editing seems overwhelmingly sloppy and needlessly distracting ( or maybe just wrongheadedly `` innovative '' ) , but after a while I got used to it , which is , in the end , the true sign of whether a film succeeds on it 's own term or not . I guess that answer basically sum up my all-around feeling for the film . That is , despite it 's in-ignorable flaw , on a whole it doe work very well . And , if nothing else , a film like this really show how false and contrived the faux-documentary , shaky-cam style can sometimes be when it so obviously applied purely for effect ( such a in film like the otherwise admirable Roger Dodger ) . Here the aesthetic are plainly derived from the necessity of the filming situation , and are not just used arbitrarily to make it look `` cool '' .

I 'm not tired to say this is one of the best political thriller ever made . The story take place in a fictional state , but obviously it deal with the murder of Kennedy . A truthful and honest district attorney ( played by Yves Montand ) doe not believe that the murder wa planned and executed by the single man Daslow ( =Oswald ) and though all other official want to close the case he continuous to investigate with his team . The screenplay is written tight and fast and hold the tension till the end . Just the part dealing with the Milgram experiment about authority is ( though not uninteresting ) a bit out of place . The ending sequence - explaining who Icarus really is - partly shot in slow motion and intensified by a Morricone soundtrack is the most powerful sequence I have ever seen in a movie .

Elvira Mistress Of The Dark ( 1988 ) : Cassandra Peterson , Daniel Greene , William Morgan Sheppard , Susan Kellerman , Edie McClug , Jeff Conaway , Phil Rubenstein , Larry Flash Jenkins , Tress MacNeille , Damita Jo Freeman , Mario Celario , William Dance , Lee McLaughlin , Charles Woolf , Sharon Hays , Bill Cable , Joseph Arias , Scott Morris , Ira Heiden , Frank Collison , Lynne Marie Stewart , Marie Sullivan , Jack Fletcher , Robert Benedetti , Kate Brown , Hugh Gillin , Eve Smith , Raleigh Bond , Tony Burrier , Alan Dewames , Timm Hill , Read Scot , James Hogan , Derek Givens ... Director James Signorelli ... Screenplay Sam Egan , John Paragon . Elvira , Mistress of the Dark wa an 80 's TV icon who had her own late night show on cable . She hosted and presented classic American horror film , many of them campy , while providing her own quip and humorous remark . Actress Cassandra Peterson ha to this date ridden on that success . In 1988 , her first film wa released . Playing herself , she 's stuck hosting monster movie show but longs for her own show in Las Vegas and make big money . Her agent Manny prof a disappointment . It 's not long before she inherits a mansion from a deceased relative , a pet dog and a book of recipe . She come to claim her inheritance in a small Nevada town - she wa on her way to Vegas and became lost - and soon stir thing up in the sedate community . Outspoken conservative town council woman Chastity Pariah ( Edie McClurg ) soon see her a a threat to the decency and value of the small town . Her voluptuous figure and winning personality soon draw the youth of the town . She fall for Bob Redding ( Daniel Greene ) the town handyman/carpenter , but before any real relationship can bloom , she find herself in deep trouble . Vincent Talbot ( William Morgan Sheppard ) an eerie older man who is also set to inherit part of the fortune of Elvira 's relative is in fact an age-old sorcerer who ha a personal vendetta against Elvira 's aunt and Elvira herself . He is aware that the so-called `` recipe book '' is actually a book of powerful magic , a power he wish to claim for himself . He scheme to bring down Elvira by having the town burn her at the stake . How will Elvira get out of this one ? The movie wa no real success at the box office , drawing a crowd of mostly young audience familiar with the Elvira show on cable . Truth be told , this is a funny and feel-good movie . The script is chalk full of all kind of joke , some bad , some good , lot of sexual innuendo , visual joke and overall campiness i.e . the hilarious last scene in which Elvira ha finally got her own strip show in Vegas . This film is a cult classic of sort , catering to Elvira fan . You could n't enjoy this film otherwise . It 's also a look back at `` pop '' culture of the 80 's . Elvira wa a much an icon of the 80 's a wa Alf , Vicky the Robot , Hulk Hogan , Mr. T and Madonna .

Alexandr `` Sascha '' Luzhin ( John Turturro ) is a former leading chess player attempting a comeback at an Italy-hosted tournament . His brilliance is unquestioned but his obsession with chess ha stunted his growth in all other aspect of his life . Natalia ( Emily Watson ) is a beautiful heiress who ha come to the same resort with her mother , Vera ( Geraldine James ) to scope out possible marriage partner . Vera lean toward a handsome count but , astonishingly , Natalia is more fascinated by Sascha , whom she met on a walk . Sascha , too , is taken with Natalia and proposes marriage at their second meeting . But , with the concentration that Sascha must give to the chess match and , with other happening in his past still causing problem , will he win the heart of Natalia ? Oh , and can he become the chess champion , also ? This is a lovely film , based on a novel by Nabokov . The acting is amazing , with Watson very fine a the beautiful little rich girl and Turturro utter perfection a the shy , awkward chess enthusiast . James give quite a nice turn a the overbearing mother and the other cast member are wonderful a well . As for the look of the film , it could not be better . The scenery is of the put-your-eye-out variety , the vintage costume are gorgeous and the cinematography is deserving of much applause . Yes , the story is unusual and told with the use of flashback , at time , making it a film not everyone will appreciate . Then , too , the ending is bittersweet . However , if you love romance , period piece , great acting , knockout scenery , or the fine art of motion picture creation , do n't miss this one . You will be defenseless in resisting it multitude of charm .

In retrospect , the 1970s wa a golden era for the American cinema , a demonstrated and explored by this documentary directed by Ted Demme and Richard LaGravenese . This IFC effort serf to illustrate and clarify the main idea of what that time meant for the career of these illustrious people seen in the documentary . The amazing body of work that remains , is a legacy to all the people involved in the art of making movie in that period . The decade wa marked by the end of the Viet Nam war and the turbulent finale of those year of Jimmy Carter 's presidency . One thing come out clear , film today do n't measure against the movie that came out during that creative decade because the industry , a a whole , ha changed dramatically . The big studio nowadays want to go to tame picture that will be instant hit without any consideration to content , or integrity , a long a the bottom line show million of dollar in revenue . The other thing that emerges after hearing some of America 's best creative mind speak , is the importance of the independent film spirit because it is about the only thing that afford it creator great moral and artistic reward . This documentary is a must see for all movie fan .

The name ( Frau ) of the main character is the German word for `` Woman '' . But those were the only giggle the movie got . Not that it wa aiming for giggle , it 's a horrible movie for heaven 's sake ! A horrible movie in more than one meaning . It 's a shame that a premise like that wa wasted with horrible even unbearable moment for the viewer ( definetely not for the faint of Heart ! ! ) ! And it wa n't even necessary to show all the thing that are shown . I 'm not even going into a moral obligation ( because movie do n't really have that kind of task or function ) discussion of what is shown here , but this is a new low on the whole `` torture movement '' that ha grown in the last few year !

Yes , said title line doe actually appear in this movie . Why ? I 'm not sure . When the line wa actually being said , did n't somebody in the crew filming , at some point , laugh ? I would have liked to see the outtake from this movie , mostly because I think they would be more entertaining than the movie itself . Helmed by director Jim Gillespie , ( `` I Know What You Did Last Summer , '' ) come a teen slasher movie that seems to assume we have n't ever seen a teen slasher movie before . Of course , he 's not to be given all the blame . There are also three writer responsible , and this is somehow based on a video game that 's still in production . The title of said game is `` Backwater , '' but upon looking for information on it I came up with absolutely nothing . And so we begin the movie ... I would like to say before I continue that I wa n't expecting this to win an Oscar . When I am in the right mindset , I enjoy a fun horror movie to pas the time . I think there exists an opportunity for an effective , original , and smart slasher movie . `` Venom '' is not this movie . There is almost no character development at all . That 's fine . You do n't expect a whole lot . However , instead of a well-knit cast of a few , this movie decides to introduce u to the following many horror movie cliché character ... 1 . The Final Girl : She ha just broken up for her boyfriend . This mean that at some point in the movie when they are in peril , they will decide to get back together again . Which more than likely mean he will die and she will be the last remaining survivor of the movie . `` Eden '' is played by Agnes Bruckner , without much enthusiasm , I might add . 2 . The Boyfriend : He 's just around to co-exist with The Final Girl until his demise . Sure , he can save her , but he 's doomed and we know it . `` Eric '' is played by Jonathan Jackson . 3 . The Bimbos : Usually horror movie only feel the need for one of these , but here we have two . They shoplift , they steal , they might show their breast , ( not in this case , ) or they might possibly be alcoholic . A staple of the genre . They also wander around in dimly lit area all on their lonesome , usually saying thing like , `` Hello ? Is there anybody there ? '' `` Tammy '' and `` Patty , '' suitably named , are played by Bijou Phillips and Davetta Sherwood . 4 . The Jackass : Sure , he look pretty , but he 's the idiot in the movie that 's inserted purely to be an idiot . He say stupid thing , doe stupid thing , ha obviously never seen a horror movie , and is one of enjoyable kill you watch this kind of thing for . `` Sean '' is played by D.J . Cotrona . 5 . The Girlfriend : She love the Jackass even though pretty much nobody else doe , and she 's usually the one left alive for a while so she can scream and cry until she start tripping and get left behind . `` Rachel '' is played by Laura Ramsey . 6 . The Creepy Janitor : In this case , The Creepy Gas Station Attendant . Enough said . `` Ray '' is played by Rick Cramer . I could continue , but I think you get the picture . The remaining character are n't so much common a they are equally killable . There 's `` The Gay Guy , '' ( Pawel Szajda a `` Ricky , '' ) who definitely got robbed a far a screen time is concerned , and `` The One Who Knows What 's Going On . '' Of course none of that matter , because at first everyone always think that one 's crazy . `` Cece '' is played by Meagan Good . There are a couple other character , namely a deputy played by Method Man , but he and others are killed off pretty quickly and get even le character development than the following clichés . So , you 're probably thinking , `` why doe this movie require such a deep analysis ? It 's just a summer horror flick , for cryin ' out loud ! '' Based on that question , doe it deliver the good ? Yes , and no . The acting is n't particularly convincing , even given the amount of talent involved . Bijou Phillips wa hailed for her performance in Larry Clark 's Bully , and Agnes Bruckner ha been an up-and-coming talent for a while now . So , what about the gore ? There 's some . That 's really about it . A lot of the juiciest bit are cut-aways . Namely a scene involving somebody 's face and a sandblaster used to remove paint from car . To the filmmaker 's credit , there are a couple interesting scene . I liked the bit where part of a house wa literally ripped off so that the unstoppable villain could get to the character . If this had all been centered around a smarter screenplay in which the character did n't make the same dumb mistake literally hundred of horror movie character had made before them , it might have made for a more enjoyable experience . All of the most interesting character are immediately killed off in the first third of the movie and then it just becomes a not-particularly-interesting countdown until we know it 's just The Creepy Janitor and The Final Girl . I suppose I must be a little jaded , but a a horror film fan , I 'm left wondering why I should have bothered when I could easily have written a better screenplay myself . I wo n't even mention the numerous instance of terrible CGI .

The script wa VERY weak w/o enough character arc to make you care one bit about the character or what happens to them . The script is way too talky and not enough gore or action to even call it slow paced . The story get to the point that you just want everyone to shut up and die a quickly a possible so you do n't have to listen to them talk this very muted , stiff dialogue . On a technical note , the music mix is way to high and make it hard to understand what is being said most time . Then again , this could be called a blessing . Overall , this same story could have better been told in a short film w/ a running time under 30 minute . The obvious `` in your face '' homage to Sam Raimi and `` Evil Dead '' would have been good had they been more subtle , but here they seem more like a bald faced rip off . C'mon , this kind of 35mm budget and THIS is the best that could be done ? Still , the cinematography , lighting design and shot were very well done indeed .

Pathetic ... worse than a bad made-for-TV movie . I ca n't believe that Spacey and Freeman were in this flick . What the hell were the people behind this film thinking ? Franco prof , once again , that he is the prince of surreal & erotic cinema . True , much of his work can be viewed a entertaining sleaze but with Succubus ( Necronomicon ) he show what he is truly capable of when he let his warped creativity run riot and give u a film that is both hypnotic and enigmatic whilst still maintaining the delirious eroticism intrinsic in his work . Jerry Van Rooyen 's splendid score pulsates a the viewer is thrown from one bizarre scenario to another a we follow the trial of a striptease artist ( Reynaud ) who may be schizophrenic , or may indeed ( a one mysterious character state ) be a devil , attempt to come to term with the world she inhabits . A beautiful and enigmatic piece of cinema highly recommended to anybody with even a passing interest in alternative cinema .

Peter Cushing and Donald Pleasance are legendary actor , and director Kostas Karagiannis wa the man behind the successful Greek Giallo-esquire thriller Death Kiss in 1974 ; and yet when you combine the three talent , all you get is this complete load of drivel ! God only know what drove the like of Peter Cushing and Donald Pleasance to star in this cheapie devil worship flick , but I really do hope they were well paid a neither one deserves something a amateurish a this on their resume . The story focus on a group of devil worshipper that kidnap some kid , leading another group to go after them . The pace of the plot is very slow and this ensures that the film is very boring . The plot is also a long way from being original and anyone with even a passing interest in the horror genre will have seen something a bit like this , and no doubt done much better . The obvious lack of budget is felt throughout and the film doe n't manage to overcome this at any point . This really is a depressing and miserable watch and not even a slightly decent ending manages to up the ante enough to lift this film out of the very bottom of the barrel . Extremely poor stuff and definitely not recommended !

All would have deserved a better story .

Despite a small handful of nicely executed scene , this entry ( the fourth ) feel tired . Toshiharu Ikeda , who directed the superb MERMAID LEGEND and the seminal Japanese splatter film , EVIL DEAD TRAP , show little enthusiasm for the stale premise . A miscreant becomes obsessed with an outwardly conservative woman who reluctantly appeared in a porno photo shoot . Predictable stalking , harassing , assault and rape ensues . The staple of roman porno is sex . And sex mixed with violence . Both potentially exciting subject , to be sure , but not when so little effort is made to make them fresh . A masturbation scene in which a woman force pencil up her opening ( via condom ) is too little kink to late . The series ' rain motif continues and the film 's final scene brings relief .

( This review is based on the English language version ) Orson Welles ' legendary unfinished epic wa just that - unfinished . It should have been left a such , not thrown together in this clumsy , boring compilation of whatever material wa available . While I 'm sure it wa done with the best of intention , the filmmaker have not only failed to do justice to Welles ' vision , they 've also managed to discredit it by inflicting this version upon audience . The first thing that strike the viewer is the amateurish quality of the audio . Not only are the newly dubbed voice rather poor performance , they 're also inconsistent - Welles ' original recording ( using his own voice , a he often did ) have been retained in a handful of scene , & they do n't match at all . There ha n't been the slightest attempt at consistency . Add to that an extremely empty sound mix which ha only a bare minimum of sound effect & atmos - a long sequence during a huge festival ( including the running of the bull ) sound like it wa recorded in a deserted suburban street with about three people making the sound of a crowd that 's meant to be in the thousand . However , the real problem is the unavoidable fact that 'Don Quixote ' wa incomplete , & it 's glaringly obvious from watching this . The film consists of a handful of scene strung together & dragged out to ridiculous length just to make up the running time . Case in point - the sequence where Sancho search for Don Quixote in the city go on forever . It 's just Sancho approaching people in the crowd , asking them the same question over & over again - there is no way that Welles could ever have intended using every single take in it entirety , but that 's what appears here . It last over twelve minute , when , in fact , it would most likely have lasted about two minute absolute maximum in a proper finished version of the film . While the start of the film is relatively complete & rather well done , the rest ha massive hole which simply ca n't be filled with endless overlay of Spanish countryside & still more shot of Don Quixote & Sancho going back & forth . There 's also no ending . No resolution , no conclusion , no punchline , no point . Although there is material in private collection that wa unavailable to the filmmaker , that could n't possibly account for what would be required to make this into a complete , coherent work . Welles simply did n't complete shooting , largely due to the fact that his lead actor died before they could finish . However , putting aside the fact that it wa n't complete , & never could be , one would think that just seeing a collection of footage from this masterpiece that might have been would be enough . Unfortunately , by putting it all together in such a slipshod manner , one is left with a very negative impression of the film overall . In particular , what wa clearly a terrific performance from Akim Tamiroff a Sancho is utterly ruined with the new voice & with long , drawn out scene that eventually cause him to be simply irritating . Orson Welles ' vision for this film wa something far more ambitious & complex than a simple retelling of the story of Don Quixote , but that 's what ha been attempted here , & a such , the point is lost . The only person who could have assembled all the material into anything worthwhile would have been Welles himself , & he did n't . The footage could have been put to far better use in a documentary chronicling the whole saga of Welles trying to make the film . Welles himself even came up with the perfect title for such a doco : `` When Are You Going To Finish Don Quixote ? ''

Saw the move while in Paris in May 2006 ... I wa debating between that and mission impossible ... I am very glad I choose OSS 117 not only because it wa funny but might a well watch a FRench movie while in France . I had a great time ... would recommend it . It is important to have some understanding the French society of Today to really enjoy the humor of this movie ... can not wait for the DVD to come out ... I do n't know how some of the 'jeu De mot ' 'puns ' would be translated in English I 'll certainly buy it when it is out ! P.S . I saw on 'BRice de Nice ' which is a movie starring Dujardin that all kid were talking about in France . this movie is a comedy but sillier than one can imagine ... in comparing both movie I have to say that Dujardin did a good job in OSS 117 .

I saw this recently on a cable channel . The movie is great ; it 's one of the few musical I have seen that doe n't shy away from the light and dark . It portrays some of the splendour of the age along with a lot of the squalor . Some of the set piece dance sequence so much is going on , I did n't know where to look next . One day I shall go and see this on the big screen , just so that I see what 's happening . But what really lift this to another level is Oliver Reed 's performance a Bill Sykes . Not only is a thoroughly mean and menacing man but there is something else , some inner demon . He gave me the impression that if you pushed him into a corner , he wa capable of anything . It wa almost a if the Sykes character wa on the edge of madness , just awaiting the trigger . I have seen the Robert Newton 's Bill Sykes from the 1948 movie , and I thought he wa 'just ' a bad egg , but Oliver Reed 's performance intimidated me in my own living room .

LCDR Tom Dodge , despite having a reputation among submariner a a renegade and maverick ( * note to reader : Maverick doe not mean `` Tom Cruise '' . Maverick mean `` non-conformist '' . ) , is actually an intelligence operative for the Vice Admiral of his submarine fleet . The Vice-Admiral is concerned about our old friend the Russians hosting yard sale with their old diesel fleet . Countries like Lybia , North Korea or Iraq would love to get their hand on this baby and slip a nuclear warhead into Norfolk Harbour or Mayport , Florida . And this wa 6-7 year before 9/11 . The Admiral assigns Dodge to assume command of a moth-balled WWII diesel sub and mount an exercise against the surface fleet and the USS ORLANDO , a top of the line fast attack sub . Dodge take command and in no time whip up the bad news bear .. err I mean his lovable group of oddball submariner into warrior . Despite having `` welcome aboard '' tattooed on his penis , he is a competent and fair commander , he doe not choose favorite and he delegate authority in a responsible manner . The US NAVY could not have come up with a finer piece of recruitment propaganda than this handsomely made under-appreciated gem from the creator of `` Police Academy '' .

What an awful adaptation . The worst part wa the music . Saxophone muzak and synthesizer playing in a story set in the early 1800 's ? ? ? ? ? ? The only character that did n't bore me to sleep wa Robert Hardy . I had to fight to keep my eye open on this one , and I love Jane Austen movie usually . I did n't even rent it , I borrowed it from the library . They should have paid me to take it . I do n't quite understand how Catherine and Henry managed a passionate kiss at the end when throughout the movie they had no chemistry or indication whatsoever that they cared for one another . Isabella and her brother were way overdone ; it wa no secret to me immediately that she and her brother were the `` bad guy '' and part of the excitement of Jane Austen movie is the discovery that who you think is good , is n't . This is probably on my list of the ten worst movie I 've seen .

The movie with it single set , minimal cast , and straightforward photography ( except for a couple of brief special effect ) reminds me of one of those old 60 minute playhouse drama so popular during TV 's early year . Nonetheless , the suspense hang heavy over poor war widow Ida Lupino a she try to deal with her semi-psychotic handyman Robert Ryan before one of his mood-swings kill her . And who better to play the troubled part than that great actor Ryan . He wa n't very versatile -- watching him essay comedy is almost painful . But no one wa better at wounded idealism ( On Dangerous Ground ) or the psychic pain of this movie . Few actor could express a much with their eye a this lean and towering figure . Lupino 's problem is that she 's locked up in her house with a man who is kind and gentle one moment and raging the next . The suspense come from her various ploy to keep him happy while trying to escape . It 's a nail-biter all the way . This is not one of Lupino 's many fine `` soulful '' part that she wa so good at . Instead , it 's a role many lesser actress could have handled well enough . My favorite scene is with Ryan and bratty teenager Margaret Whiting . Ryan 's already having difficulty with his masculinity and what others are saying about him . Then when Whiting walk in and find the attractive-looking Ryan scrubbing the floor , she start getting coy , flirting with her budding sexuality . Sensing trouble , Ryan abruptly fends her off -- finesse is not his strong suit . Insulted , Whiting attack his masculinity by calling his work `` woman 's work '' . That doe it . Up to that point he 's been courteous and professional with Lupino , trying to set himself on a normal path . But Whiting ha hit his raw nerve . Now there 's heck to pay a Whiting bounce out the door , leaving Lupino to pay the price . It 's a riveting scene , expertly done . Anyway , this is one of the dozen or so film produced by Lupino and her husband at a time when audience were moving away from these little black-and-whites in favor of wide-screen spectacle . Too bad . What a hugely talented figure she wa both behind the camera and in front . She deserves at least an honorary Oscar from a movie industry to which she contributed so much .

This movie suffers from the fact that for year Hollywood had no clue a to how to package Jackie Chan for the mass . His low-budget Hong Kong movie were all fast-paced kinetic thriller that highlight his amazing gymnastic skill and talent for light comedy . His early Hollywood film stuck him in the same movie that were being packaged for Stallone or Chuck Norris . There is nothing about Chan 's character in this movie that requires the character to be Asian except for his being the star . In his Hong Kong film Chan is never dull , with the movie being one rapid-fire martial art sequence after another , but `` The Protector '' is lifeless throughout . Danny Aiello is n't given much to work with either and the lacking chemistry between the two probably is more a result of the script and direction than how the two actor got on together . Both have been better in worse movie . The best thing about the movie is the Hong Kong setting . The worst part is the appalling way that Jackie Chan come off so colorless and drab . It would n't be until the made-in-Canada `` Rumble in the Bronx '' that the west would finally figure out how to make a good Jackie Chan movie .

The premise sucked me in , but it wa clear about 30 second in that this wa either David Lynch or something seriously terrible . Interesting to watch just to run through the fundamentalist laundry list . I can be a sucker for a stirring spiritual piece ( Romero come to mind ) , but there wa nothing spiritual whatsoever about this one . The message seems to be that we must all pretend we have an iq of 80 ( or simply get a lobotomy - Jennifer what happened to ya ? ) and blindly follow the Bible without any sort of self-examination whatsoever or we 'll trigger the second coming . It 's the kind of attitude that make people fly jumbo jet into 110 story building ( I work around the corner from the site of the former WTC ) . I like to think that God is a little greater than that .

There wa some good build up of suspense throughout . The cinematography wa surprisingly good considering such minimal budget . We witness occasional spell of good acting , however , this is quickly deflated by some quite cheesy line . Understandably there would not be much of an intellectual conversation to be had , sitting up on tree while a crocodile is stalking you . Silence would have been golden here . There could have been a bigger play on suspense than dimly uttering , `` I sat in the cupboard for fear of my brother ... '' Something tell me there 's a slight difference in getting a beating from your brother than being eaten by a mighty 15ft croc . You decide . Throughout the film I ca n't seem to find a connection or for that matter , sympathy with the character , perhaps thats because they do n't develop one throughout the film , character that is . There are some occasional good scare when the crocodile sneak up on the character , overshadowed again by some questionable scene .
