Then take great plot line from AD ( son ha an ugly , boring girlfriend ) and dumb them down so the idiot who watch sitcom can understand them . If you watch this , I will have completely lost respect for you , a should your family . However , if you are a fan , you should love FOX 's new comedy 'Til Death . Looks like real funny , cutting-edge stuff . I mean , married couple not getting along ... brilliant .

Robert Mitchum star a Clint Tollinger in this short but tough western : Man With The Gun . Tollinger is a professional town tamer - a in , when a town need someone to save itself ; he is the one who is brought in to do it . Tollinger 's latest gig come by a an accident : strolling into town looking for his former fling , he stumble into a town being played like a puppet by a local western gangster . But many townspeople begin to rue the day they hired Tollinger , a his way of cleaning up the town becomes very taxing ( suddenly High Plains Drifter seems le original ) . Man With The Gun start off a an average western tough-guy film but begin to surprise you more and more a the film progress . What start off a forgettable and run-of-the-mill end up dark and character-centered . The entire film is very well shot and the cast is very enjoyable . Mitchum is his usual excellent self here in Man With The Gun - not one of his very best performance , Mitchum still ha his classic and effective tough-guy screen presence in high gear and he knock the action-packed , meaningful , and shocking scene of the film right out of the park . Man With The Gun is a nice Mitchum western and is easily worth one 's time .

My favorite film this year . Great character and plot , and the direction and editing wa smooth , visually beautiful , and interesting . Set in Barcelona , the film follows a year in the life of six foreign graduate student and assorted others . Cultures and language clash but heart and life intertwine . The leading role would never have been cast in Hollywood , but he carried the part perfectly . The character were nicely developed and their interplay wa honest and accurate . There were two especially noteworthy scene , the climax wa truly inspired . The film is sentimental , and the last ten minute could have been cut , but it wa wonderfully entertaining . I nearly did n't watch it , but did just to see Audrey Tautou . Her role although billed second or third wa minor , and wa outshined by several other character . I wish more film like this were made . It brought to mind The Big Chill or The Breakfast Club . Do n't start this movie late if you plan to go to bed 1/2 way through .

the film itself is absolutely brilliant , it that buzz , that rush that make you just want to go out , blow your wage and loose yourself . It 's what the weekend is all about , it our sanitation where we can come together a one and be ourselves without a care in the world . The film is layered in depth and the dialogue in place is just spot on , especially with Jip . The character themselves are instantly likable , one in particular is obviously dyer character and his view on what `` Star Wars '' is really about , genius . If ever you 've got an hour to kill before going out , stick on this , you 'll immediately feel yourself growing in confidence , definitely recommend it .

I did n't expect much when I first saw the DVD cover . I mean , Pierce Brosnan a Grey Owl ? ? Ah ... but then the story got underway , unfolded in a beautifully photographed and paced film . I wa surprised and delighted at this ( basically ) true story . Made me want to read more about this fascinating character , which mean , the director fulfilled his purpose , and the film wa a success !

this is more than a Sat . afternoon special . Exremely well written if very low key there is a lot here if you look for it . Catch the cat companion/scout for instance . It not only could have been a comic book it should have been a comic book . The comic industry ( a well a the film 's publicist ) missed the boat on this . One of the least know really great film . This one 's a keeper . I have never seen a DVD of this film but i used to own a VHS version . Good hunting

I have to say this is the worst movie that I have ever watched in my life , I can not believe that I wasted $ 10 at blockbuster ; this movie should be burned and who ever thought of it ha issue . Who ever actually spent money to make this movie wa insane =D This movie ha TERRIBLE actor and some of the scene make absolutely no sense . Well , the whole movie doe n't make sense . Also , what is up with those glass ? When the guy and girl are in the car and she `` drink '' water , you can totally tell that she is n't even drinking ! This is the best of Shelley Duvall 's high-quality `` Faerie Tale Theatre '' series . The ugly stepsister are broadway-quality comedy relief , and Eve Arden is the personification of wicked stepmotherhood . Jennifer Beals doe an excellent job a a straight Cinderella , especially in the garden scene with Matthew Broderick 's Prince Charming . Jean Stapleton play the fairy godmother well , although I 'm not sure I liked the `` southern lady '' characterization with some of the line . Steve Martin 's comedy relief a the Royal Orchestra Conductor is quintessential Martin , but a tiny bit misplaced in the show 's flow . As is customary with the series , there are several wry comment thrown in for the older child ( age 15 and up ) . With a couple of small bump , the show flow well , and they live happily ever after . Children up to age 8 will continue to watch it after the parent finally get tired of it -- I found 3 time in one day to be a little too much .

I am definitely a Burt Reynolds fan , but sorry , this one really stink . Most of the dialogue is laughable and the only interesting plot twist is in the last five minute of the movie . I ca n't believe he even made this one . Is he actually that hard up for money ?

Let me say from the outset I 'm not a particular fan of this kind of film , but Nightbreed hold a certain fascination for me with a message about perspective . Back in the old day , the folk who inhabit Midian would have been called Zombies , the undead . And according to what Clive Barker ha given u certain member of human kind , in this Craig Sheffer are born with the potential to become part of that world . Psychiatrist David Cronenberg at first looking like the mild mannered professional ha taken unto himself a fanatical mission to rid the world of the Nightbreed . He trick the police into killing Sheffer , but Sheffer go to a graveyard named Midian cemetery where the Nightbreed congregate and live underground . Sheffer ha also left a girl friend , Anne Bobby , who still ha feeling for him even after he 's been killed and is now one of the undead . She try in her own small way to be a bridge to humankind . Clive Barker 's creature are a pretty gruesome looking lot and are not particularly fond of human . But it 's plain to see that if human left them alone , the Nightbreed in turn not bother with them . Your sympathy are definitely with the Nightbreed especially after seeing a fanatic like Cronenberg and redneck police chief Charles Haid in action . Clive Barker 's been an out gay man for some time now and some have suggested to me that the Nightbreed is a metaphor for gay people . I can see where that would come in , especially since there are a whole lot of people who do n't even think of gay a anything human because they 're taught that way . Granted Nightbreed is pretty bloody with a lot of gratuitous violence , but it also doe make you think and I do like the way Clive Barker doe turn traditional theology on it head and make Craig Sheffer a kind of messiah for the Nightbreed creature .

I have never read the Bradbury novel that this movie is based on but from what I 've gathered , it will be interesting ( when I finally do read it and I will ) . My comment will be based purely on the film . As soon a I saw the trailer I knew I had to see it and wa so excited but when I finally did , I wa so disappointed it hurt . This is because the movie itself felt so amateurish . The actor were not well cast ( though Robards and Pryce are both good actor - just not here ) . The kid actor , it seemed , were merely asked to show up , get in the character ' clothes , say the line and make the face . The set and prop were cheap and unrealistic . The direction wa surprisingly bad . I wa so surprised at the awfulness of it that I had to go online and check who directed it , just to see the kind of work he had done . The editing wa cut and paste and the plot ( screenplay ) wa just that a well ( even though the author had been involved himself , irony ? ) . The building up of the tension , fear and suspense wa so mild it wa ineffective when the climax finally came . I 've read some of the comment on this movie and find it hard to believe people actually like it . What hurt the most is that the content is interesting and fun and intriguing . It had so much potential . Unfortunately , the film wa so technically bad it take away from the brilliance of the story .

This is a truly awful `` B '' movie . It is witless and often embarrassing . The plot , the basic `` making into show business '' routine , is almost nonexistent . In fact , the film is merely an excuse to push the war effort and highlight some popular music group of 1942 , including the Mills Brothers , Count Basie , Duke Ellington , Bob Crosby , and Freddy Slack . Each group get about the standard three minute , the exception being the Mills Brothers , who for some reason warranted two number . Ann Miller doe n't get to dance until the last couple of minute of the film , and she ha little to do but strut her stuff amid a barrage of patriotic propaganda . The most interesting moment in the film , in my view , occurred in the Duke Ellington segment . The band appears to be playing in a train , standing in awkward position . ( In the deep South at the time , the band wa segregated in railroad car when traveling . ) Johnny Hodges is seen next to Duke , and Harry Carney may also be identified . In the last moment of the film , trumpeter/violinist Ray Nance rush down the aisle to the camera and doe an `` uncle Tom , '' bugging his eye and wiggling his head the way Willy Best did in many film . For modern viewer , especially jazz fan , this homage to segregation is sad indeed . Some movie go best unseen .

I have to admit I am prejudiced about my vote on this film , but I have strong reason a I know some of the true history that wa given the Hollywood treatment here . Edna Ferber 's novel upon which this is based is from an era where real name ca n't be used . In a way , this film is all smoke & mirror . Even though it wa released in 1946 , it wa filmed shortly after Casablanca . Ingrid Bergman is at her most radiant in this movie a a brunette . She play a beautiful woman who is trying to trade on her beauty to get a rich husband . Today that is a gold digger , but in this social era , she is desirable & the kind of woman who make all the men want her , & all the old snooty society type talk of her & avoid her , while wishing they were her . Ingrid is at her best & play this role well . Some sympathy for Ingrids character is raised in the New Orleans section of this film a she manages to get a decent belated tomb for her scandalized mother a part of the settlement by her relative to get her to leave New Orleans . The snooty family of relative there are so scandalized by her that they will do almost anything she asks to get her to leave town . Gary Cooper is good in this film though he already appears to be aging a bit to play a dashing Texan Bachelor/Gambler . He pull it off well considering that handicap which he appeared older than he wa due to his real life chain smoking . Flora Robison a Ingrid 's Maid got nominated for an Oscar a supporting actress in this film . Jerry Austin a Cupidor wa over-looked in many way for his role but is the only comic relief in the film & doe it well . When the film move to Saratoga , it depicts accurately how important Saratoga wa in that era . I like the sequence when Bergman walk to the Saratoge Spring to get some of the `` sulfur '' water which everyone considered so healthy then . When she drink some she force herself not to make a face and comment how good it is & that she must have more . The real history is the railroad battle which really occurred on the rail line in Tunnel , New York- which is the actual Saratoga Trunk the film title is derived from . This battle actually happened in 1869 between agent for Andrew Carnagie & J. P. Morgan . The line wa the economic key to the country in 1869 connecting coal country & the east coast . The reference to it are throughout the film are very real . There is even some dialog describing Carnagie a a `` Scot '' though the reference is vague & unfamiliar to anyone not knowing the history around the battle . The railroad line & the railroad tunnel in Tunnel , New York ( zip code 13848 ) still exist although the film wa shot in California . The real tunnel is about 1 mile long . It is still part of a key freight line today , year after this occurred . I grew up there . Gary Cooper 's line in the film while he is riding the train into the tunnel is right , it is still `` mighty pretty country '' .

This movie is n't even good enough for the $ 1 bin at the grocery store . I only purchased it because Terrence Howard wa in it . Guess he could n't be too choosy about his role during this time . The movie in itself wa hard to sit through . It seemed they were grasping at straw with a storyline . The `` guy night out '' had to be the most boring I 've ever seen . One minute they are talking and the next reciting poetry ? Even the argument were hard to follow . Most of the acting lacked any depth . I have no idea what they were going for with this one but they certainly missed the mark .

This is a spectacular production ! I have seen the show live twice in Chicago and my only problem with the production wa the fact that I wa able to perceive only fragment of what wa going on . The stage consisted of three giant catwalk and the platform and a the action move from one part of the stage to the next sometime you loose track of what is going on no matter where you are located . As always , this is a thought-provoking sensory overload , skillfully captured in high definition with 15 camera ! The footage wa Masterfully edited , one of the best concert DVDs of all time in my opinion ! I only hope and wish that they will release this on Blu-Ray of HD-DVD so that we can re-live this extravaganza over and over again .

I 'm not going to bag this film for all the myriad technical f|u|c|k|u|p|s , it would take two day to outline how the whole thing is n't even remotely possible . Others have pointed out all the relevant stupidity already . Given all that , I still could have sort of enjoyed it , if only they had n't included all the maudlin , nauseating , infuriating , Disneyesque sentimental crap , which is so out of place anywhere , but nowhere more than out in space , where the tiniest mistake can mean instant death . The `` crew '' , a well a the `` real '' astronaut were equally guilty of putting all their fatuous nonsense ahead of everything else . It completely ruined any value the production may have had left . I 'm surprised NASA let this garbage out so that so many people would get so much misinformation about something so important to them . If you have n't seen this yet , save yourself the irritation . Watch Apollo 13 again . At least that tried to be sort of real .

This film wa adapted from the well known sutra on Journey to the West where a monk with his three student seek out to find a long lost book with regard to the teaching of Buddha . Though this movie is not a solemn a the previous film made according to the legend , it did however , managed to bring in romance and fun-filled humorous scene . This real objective of this movie revolves around more on the monk who were primarily saved from being eaten by demonic flying creature . One of his student , the Monkey God managed to get him out from the battle in the nick of time , but were in turn captured by the demon and cast into the deep throat of a dragon , locked up in that particular dungeon . The monk awoke in a small village where he found Mei Yan ( the so called ugly serpent daughter ) who fell in love over him at first sight . Though ugly , she did not let her appearance be casted aside from getting to him . However , a quest for rescuing his three student soon turn out to be filled with obstacle and each of which turned out to get worse with Mei Yan following the monk . Problems crept deeper and this is where conflict between the relationship get worse . The rest of the tale would be left at your own disposal , but suffice to say , this film doe not depict the typical storyline of the book , it is more for those who want to seek out for a funny and light picture of what Journey to the West and the love obstacle really mean . Towards the very end , the whole summary could be described with only one word , and that is love . The monk went to show the Heavenly Gates , the Celestial Palace and Buddha himself how love can overcome even the worst fear of all and deemed fit a the most powerful weapon that can be used against any enemy of superior power . A wonderfully created and funny act awaits those who buy this ticket . There would be of course , no regret , at least from my side and those who were with me at the cinema that day watching the same film .

Let me first state that I enjoy watching `` bad '' movie . It 's funny how some of these film leave more of a lasting impression than the truly superb one . This film is bad in a disturbingly malicious way . This vehicle for Sam Mraovich 's delusional ego doe n't just border on talentless ineptitude , it ha redefined the very meaning of the word . This should forever be the barometer for bad movie . Sort of the Mendoza line for film . Mr. Mraovich writes , directs , and star a blunt object Arthur Sailes battling scorned wife and the Christian force of evil a he and his partner Ben `` dead behind the eye '' Sheets struggle for marital equality . As a libertarian I believe gay should have a right to get married . Ben & Arthur do more harm to that cause than an army of homophobe . The portrayal of all thing Christian are so ugly and ham-fisted , trademark Mraovich , that you ca n't possibly take any of them seriously . Arthur 's brother Victor , the bible toting Jesus freak , is so horribly over-the-top evil/effeminately gay that you have to wonder how he wa cast in this role . That 's because Sam `` multitasking '' Mraovich wa also casting director . The worst of it all is Sam Mraovich himself . When you think leading man do the word pasty , balding , and chubby come to mind ? Sam also delivers line like domino 's pizza , cold and usually wrong . The final tally : you suck at writing , directing , acting and casting . That 's the Ed Wood quadruple crown . Congratulations you horrible little man .

Essentially a undistinguished B-movie that mysteriously is directed by one of the golden era 's major talent , Fritz Lang . Even with the stellar name of Lang , Walter Pidgeon , Joan Bennett and George Sanders , be prepared for a ludicrous storyline , bad acting , patently phony set and miscasting . For transparency sake , I have to admit I am an ardent non-admirer of Walter Pidgeon , who wa lucky to have found a niche at the artificial dream-factory of MGM , and somehow worked in secondary role , supporting Greer Garson and others . He is wildly miscast , acting in a chipper , '30s-Ray Milland madcap comedy tone , in a role where his life is in danger , and he is in hiding . Joan Bennett 's cockney accent is excessive , but her lacquered hair , perfect makeup and classy outfit belies a street-wise Cockney slum-girl . George Sanders is incapable of bad acting , but disappears after the preposterous opening find Pidgeon somehow pretending to shoot Adolph Hitler . Surprising for Fritz Lang is the unevenness of tone . I found the film wavered uneasily between occasional moment of suspense-thriller surrounded by light-hearted comedic interplay . Hitchcock totally reversed the ratio , using comic relief to occasionally pace the suspense . There is a reason this film is unknown . It did n't serve or propel anybody 's career or reputation , and is forgotten because it 's a surprisingly bad film from such a pedigreed group .

When , oh when , will Hollyweird write a decent movie based around computer ? I can not believe people actually consider this movie to be a credible story . No computer operating system could ever survive wit that sort of annoying scrolling interface . It may look good on a movie screen but if you actually tried using it for any length of time you would go nut . As for `` tracing '' people the way she did it simply can not be done that way . Network security alone would prevent that from happening . The key stroke logging wa laughable to say the least . Regarding the software that wa supposedly being installed , no system administrator would allow such a critical piece of software to be installed on a production system until it ha been tested , retested and tested again on a sandbagged system . But probably the worst possible part of the movie wa the `` virus '' . There is no way that a virus that work on one operating system will work on any other system . And a for a virus that could take out a mainframe is a couple of second , that just beggar belief . There is no way that an open remote connection would have the required superuser access that would allow deletion of system file . I could go on but I ca n't be bothered . A porno ha a better thought out plot that this pile of garbage .
This movie wa so incredibly boring , Michael J . Fox could 've done so much better . Sorry , but it 's true for all you people who liked the movie

This movie is so unreal . French movie like these are just waste of time . Why watch this movie ? Even , I did not know .. why . What ? The well known sex scene of half-siblings ? Although the sex scene is so real and explicit , but the story it is based upon is so unreal . What is the use of it , then ? Can you find easily in life , half sibling doing such thing ? Did I learn something from this movie ? Yeah : some people are just so fond of wasting time making such movie , such story , such non-sense . But for those who like nihilism , nothingness in life , or simply a life without hope , then there you are .. you 've got to see this movie . Only one worth adoring , though : CATHERINE DENEUVE . She 's such a strikingly beautiful woman .

The Nest is really just another 'nature run amock ' horror flick that fails because of the low budget . The acting is OK , and the setting is great , but somehow the whole film just seemed a bit dull to me . The gore effect are not the best I 've seen but are fun in a cheesy sort of way . The roach themselves are just regular cockroach that bite people . The Nest reminded me of a much better film called Slugs . If you liked The Nest then Slugs is a must-see a it 's ten time better . Also worth noting is that Lisa Langlois who play Elizabeth wa in another 'nature run amock ' type film called Deadly Eyes ( aka The Rats ) , which is about killer rat a you may have guessed . If you enjoy these type of horror film then you may want to give this a watch , but you 'd be far better off seeing Slugs which is far more interesting and gory .

Excellent endearing film with Peter Falk and Paul Reiser joining force a father and dad . Dad show up one evening to state that after over 40 year of marriage , mom ( Olympia Dukakis ) ha left him . The rest of the film depicts the father and son on a day trip to get dad 's thought off what ha occurred . With them away , the daughter can play detective . The story show the adventure of father and son in their discussion of life , what should have been , why mom wa complaining about dad a they discus their philosophy of life . We see an unexpected fishing trip and pool playing which lead to a near brawl . Both men seem to break out of their daily life . The end is a downer a we learn why mom suddenly left . It becomes a story of courage and the human spirit in the face of adversity . It 's never too late to change .

Beware , My Lovely is an experimental studio film from the early fifty and wa directed by a man , Harry Horner , better known for his set design . Robert Ryan play a handyman who is hired by Ida Lupino to do some housework for her . The problem is that he is a psychopathic murderer and doe n't know it . Miss Lupino is an empathetic soul and try to win Ryan over , to little avail . He is not the sort of man compassion could help or cure . Thus we have an interesting situation of two people who basically mean well , but one of them ca n't do well because there is something wrong with him . He suffers periodic blackout during which he commits act of violence , which he later forgets . Essentially the effect Ryan ha on Lupino is that of the hunter and his prey , or in another sense a sadist . The audience find out early on that Ryan is a mad killer , but it take Lupino much longer . Thus we must live with this knowledge a we watch poor Miss Lupino try everything in her power to 'win ' Ryan over in order to make thing work , get the job done , get on with life . But getting on with thing is n't in Ryan 's makeup , a he is incapable of any but the most rudimentary form of normality , and a soon a there is an opening his paranoia asserts itself . As a study in mental illness the movie is n't too impressive . What it 's superlative at is showing the effect of major mental illness , with dangerous psychopathology in the mix , and it effect on a normal person . In this regard the film is realistic and compassionate , though relentlessly logical in that we know Lupino ca n't 'fix ' Ryan , yet we want her to . The result is that , if one is willing , one can get extremely involved in this film emotionally if one can put aside , so to speak , it melodramatic structure . Horner show u , gradually , the layout the Lupino house , a forbidding gothic monstrosity that never feel like a home . We become familiar with staircase , kitchen and pantry ; and we come to know which window Miss Lupino can use for an escape and which one she ca n't .

Marie Dressler carry this Depression-era drama about a kindly bank owner , which recently aired on TCM during their April Fools comedy month . If you come with the expectation of big laugh courtesy the Dressler-Polly Moran team , you 'll be disappointed , a this is really a very downbeat film . It 's also very poorly made , surprisingly so considering it came from MGM . Leonard Smith 's bare bone cinematography is strictly from the 'set up the camera and do n't move it ' school , frequently to the detriment of the cast , who find themselves delivering line off screen ( it 's like a pan and scan print before such existed ! ) or having their head cut off . The film doe n't even have a credited director , underlying the apparent fly by night nature of the production . Overall , it 's an unsatisfying mess , with Dressler frequently over-emoting and only that bizarre , final reel dash to the bathroom to set it apart .

Cyclone is a piece of dreck with little redeeming value , even on the so bad it entertaining front . A friend of mine took the tape from an overflowing St. Vincent DePaul clothes bin . Okay , that may be a little bit dodgy but it wa meant to be a clothes bin , not a crappy old VHS bin , something the le fortunate member of our society do n't really need to make their life better . It could be considered a mercy . Watching a movie like Cyclone would really only add to their problem . Anyway the basic premise of a woman with a super-powerful motorcycle that it armed to the teeth with rocket and laser is n't even properly exploited . The two 'high speed ' chase sequence involve vehicle travelling at le than hair raising speed of around 40 KMPH and a super-fast motorcycle that is in danger of being overtaken by a crappy old station wagon is not that awe inspiring when you get down to it . There is only one scene where the bike goofy weaponry is used , at the film 's climax , and it is laughably ineffectual , or just laughable , when it is . This includes laser beam that look like they should be coming out of the hand of an evil wizard in a cheesy eighty sword and sorcery that produced large burst of flame which seem to have no noticeable effect on their target even when they hit directly . The rest of the movie is just tedious hard to watch filler . Lots of bad actor , yes even Combs and Landau suck in this , most of whom seem like they have been lifted from the set of a porno movie stand around exchanging really bad dialogue in a desperate attempt to pu forward the barely coherent plot . There are a few badly staged fight sequence and some excruciatingly unfunny comic relief scene with some cop and the owner of the motor cycle repair shop . Comedy of the sub Benny Hill horny old man ca n't stop staring at the female lead chest variety . Basically the 'money ' scene involving the bike actually doing stuff are few and lame and the rest is clunky filler material . Skip it .

`` Cinderella '' is one of the most beloved of all Disney classic . And it really deserves it status . Based on the classic fairy-tale a told by Charles Perrault , the film follows the trial and tribulation of Cinderella , a good girl who is mistreated by her evil stepmother and equally unlikable stepsister . When a royal ball is held and all eligible young woman are invited ( read : the King want to get the Prince to marry ) , Cinderella is left at home whilst her stepmother take her awful daughter with her . But there is a Fairy Godmother on hand ... The story of `` Cinderella '' on it own would n't be able to pad out a feature , so whilst generally staying true to the story otherwise , the fairly incidental character of the animal whom the Fairy Godmother us to help get the title character to the ball become Cinderella 's true sidekick . The mouse Jaq and Gus are the main sidekick , and their own nemesis being the stepmother 's cat Lucifer . Their antic intertwine generally with the main fairy-tale plot , and are for the most part wonderful . Admittedly , the film doe slow down a bit between the main introduction of the character and shortly before the stepsister depart for the ball , but after this slowdown , the film really get going again and surprisingly ( since `` Cinderella '' is the most worn down story of all time , probably ) end up a one of the most involving Disney story . The animation and art direction is lovely . All of the legendary Nine Old Men animated on this picture , and Mary Blair 's colour styling and concept art ( she also did concept art and colour styling for `` Alice in Wonderland '' , `` Peter Pan '' , `` The Three Caballeros '' and many many others ) manage to wiggle their way on screen . The colour and design are lovely , especially in the Fairy Godmother and ball scene , a well a in those pretty little moment here and there . Overall , `` Cinderella '' rank a one of the best Disney fairy-tales and come recommended to young and all that embodies the Disney philosophy that dream really can come true .

* * Might contain spoiler * * Ok , let conclude this movie in one word : bad . Two word ? Really bad . Now why do I think that ? Let me explain . Guttenberg lead a special-ops team consisting of four person that get assigned to retake an lethal virus after some arms-dealer stole it from a lab . They do this by attacking the arm-dealers in mid-flight and somehow get back the virus after some fighting . However , suspicion arise about Guttenberg because one of the terrorist knew his name . After debriefing the team-members get attacked by unknown person and everyone start to suspect everyone else is involved . After deciding they cant trust their boss , they decide to , once again , steal the virus and try to lure out the possible attacker . In theory this is a plot that could have worked in a low-budget movie that just aim to be aired on TV . However , the plot is compromised and the movie ruined in several account . Firstly , the plot is totally predictable and it is not fun to know how the movie is going to end after three minute . Second . The acting is really bad , or the actor are directed to act a dummy . There are n't many emotion , change of facial expression at all etc . I wa especially disappointed in Guttenberg that I believe can do so much more , but fails completely in an attempt to be a rough action-hero . In addition , though I am not by any mean any expert on the subject , I totally believe I could assemble a better covert-ops team by picking up five stranger and train them for a week . This seems to be a theme in the movie to do thing a stupid and unprofessionally a possible . This go for good guy , bad guy and bystander a well . Then I sincerely doubt the scientific and technical consultant , if any , of the film . For example , I have poured liquid nitrogen over my hand and I did n't break instantly . Do n't know how to conclude this really , but let say that this movie ha a predictable plot , bad acting and they seem to be amateur in whatever the do . Sorry , ca n't be any nicer than that . Do not watch this movie , it is not even so bad it is funny . 2/10

The premise of an African-American female Scrooge in the modern , struggling city wa inspired , but nothing else in this film is . Here , Ms. Scrooge is a miserly banker who take advantage of the employee and customer in the largely poor and black neighborhood it inhabits . There is no doubt about the good intention of the people involved . Part of the problem is that story 's root do n't translate well into the urban setting of this film , and the script fails to make the update work . Also , the constant message about sharing and giving is repeated so endlessly , the audience becomes tired of it well before the movie reach it familiar end . This is a message film that doe n't know when to quit . In the title role , the talented Cicely Tyson give an overly uptight performance , and at time line are difficult to understand . The Charles Dickens novel ha been adapted so many time , it 's a struggle to adapt it in a way that make it fresh and relevant , in spite of it very relevant message .

It wa evident until the final credit that this film wa made in 1989 , a all the element of it production were made to look 1960 's - the acting , the characterisation , the set and the prop all had an aesthetic from an earlier time . The film open to the moment prior to the dropping of the A-bomb on Hiroshima and how this tragic incident affect one family : a young woman , Yasuko , who life with her aunt and uncle . Even in black and white , and using special effect that are quite primitive by modern standard but emotive and effective nonetheless , the depiction of the immediate aftermath of the bomb are quite horrific . Family member become unrecognisable to each other , others resemble zombie a they wander the street bedraggled and in shock . The title refers to rainfall that fell soon after the bomb , which wa mixed with radioactive ash , and in which Yasuko is caught . Rumors of Yasuko 's being in Hiroshima at the time of the bombing affect her marriage prospect and it is later learnt that the black rain is indeed causing sickness . The film is concerned not just with the physical effect of the bomb on the Japanese , but on the social and psychological damage that wa wrought . I found the film compassionate and a fascinating journey into a unique culture . While the film is primarily concerned with the pain felt by one family , the film 's gentle political message is relevant today and probably for all time - war have horrific consequence , and should not be entered into unless absolutely necessary . It is said that history repeat itself , and the current leader of the 'Coalition of the Willing ' have learned nothing . While atomic warfare ha not resurfaced since 1945 , other deadly after-effects have . This film is compelling viewing .

I have very few to add to what all the other reviewer already made more than clear ! This movie is awful ! Beyond awful ... In fact , so insufferable that they have yet to come up with a term to describe the awfulness that is `` Skeleton Man '' . In case you expect your movie to feature a minimum of logic and plot , you should stay a far away from this a humanly possible . Sure , load of people are getting killed by this skeleton-puppet wearing a ridiculous cape , but nobody ever bother to properly explain what he is , where he come from or why he 's so angry with the world . He look like a crossover between Skeletor from `` Masters of the Universe '' and the horseman from `` Sleepy Hollow '' and run amok in some godforsaken wilderness . The setting of `` Skeleton Man '' is another totally retarded aspect ! For nearly half an hour , I assumed that the movie took place at a small isolated island , but it simply play at the mainland where fancy highway cross the forest and power plant are located at the end of the wood ! Huh ? Why doe everybody pretend to be trapped when there are like a million escape route ? Anyway , after a couple of totally random killing , a special commando squad , led by poor washed-up Michael Rooker , arrives to come and hunt a monster they do n't know anything about . Really hilarious is how every member of this squad introduces him/herself a the expert in a certain field ( we have a sniper-specialist , a tracking genius , a drill instructor ... ) , yet they ALL die before any of them is able to demonstrate their supposedly masterful skill ! The horror Gods must really hate Casper Van Dien , a he 's present again a well , portraying an heroic soldier who steal a truck for no apparent reason , crash on the highway , but somehow get catapulted back to the middle of the wood to die there . Right , that make sense ... Furthermore the character steal cool one-liner from `` Predator '' , the bonehead 's horse constantly change color , helicopter are brought down with bow & arrow , ordinary bullet cause tree to explode and completely pointless Vietnam flashback haunt Michael Rooker . I say we all combine force and vote this pathetic flick into the IMDb bottom top 100 ASAP !

This is a very funny movie , easy to watch , that entertains you almost all the time . The work of the Director is recognizable and the type of humor is his trademark . The movie is a typical police partner history like lethal weapon , but the joke and comedy are of Argentinian sort . The twist is that one of them is a psychologist played by Peretti and ha to go with detective Diaz ( played by Luque ) on his assignment while he also assist him ( Diaz is troubled because his wife cheated on him ) . Some of the dialog are hilarious worldwide : understandable and laughable anywhere . Is very good overall , it would deserved an 8 , but I rated 7 because it get a little down at the end . On a personal remark I must add that is a `` bravo '' for Argentinian Filmmakers , considering the little good is coming lately .

I 'll give writer/director William Gove credit for finding someone to finance this ill-conceived `` thriller . '' A good argument for not wasting money subscribing to HBO , let alone buying DVDs based on cover art and blurb . A pedestrian Dennis Hopper and a game Richard Grieco add nothing significant to their resume , although the art direction is not half bad . The dialogue will leave you grimacing with wonder at it conceit ; this is storytelling at it worst . No tension , no suspense , no dread , no fear , no empathy , no catharsis , no nothing . A few attractive and often nude female spice up the boredom , but this is definitely a film best seen a a trailer . I feel sorry for the guy who greenlighted this thing . Good for late-night , zoned-out viewing only . You have been warned .

I 'll give this movie two star because it teems with beautiful photography . Otherwise , it teems mainly with clichés and stereotype : mountain people are either dumb white trash of the fanatically religious or ragged racist kind , or wise white Indians . Indians are magical people who move around without a sound , can disappear in the blink of an eye , talk to animal , and read mind over large distance . And so on and so forth . Throughout the movie I kept wondering what the point of the film wa ( other than showing me pretty picture of mountain , log cabin , wood , an assortment of animal , free-spirited mountain-dwellers and freaky people in church ) . The plot touched a whole range of issue but explored none of them in depth . This wa neither a story about growing up during the depression , nor about about being an orphan , nor about a struggle for identity . It tried to be all of those thing and more , which made it superficial and unsatisfactory . Although the movie wa supposed to be about Little Tree 's education , we learn almost nothing about it . He wa given a brief summary of the history of his people ( who were brave and stoic ) and a distillery demonstration ; tried his hand at chopping wood ( at which he failed ) and whiskey running ( literally ) ; learned how to read ( and maybe to write ) with the help of grandma and her dictionary - and that wa it . Apparently he did n't learn much during his stint in boarding school because he wa locked up in the attic . However , grandma and grandpa and Graham Greene 's character made sure that in the end Little Tree became a very spiritual person whose main goal a an adult - after , and I 'm paraphrasing here , `` riding with the Navajos '' and `` getting caught up in a couple of war '' - wa to `` catch up '' with grandma and grandpa and Graham Greene 's character in heaven ( instead of , say , dating girl , getting married , having child or other such nonsense ) . Last but not least I must say that I found grandpa 's trade offensive . Why of all thing did it have to be a whiskey still ? To counteract the stereotype of the `` drunken Indian '' ?

`` Laugh , Clown Laugh '' released in 1928 , star the legendary Lon Chaney a a circus clown named Tito . Tito ha raised a foundling ( a young and beautiful Loretta Young ) to adulthood and name her Simonetta . Tito ha raised the girl in the circus life , and she ha become an accomplished ballerina . While Chaney give his usual great performance , I could not get past the fact that Tito , now well into middle age , ha the hots for the young Simonetta . Although he is not her biological father , he ha raised her like a daughter . That kind of `` ick '' factor permeates throughout the film . Tito competes for Simonetta 's affection with a young and handsome 'Count ' Luigi ( Nils Asther ) . Simonetta clearly fall for the young man , but feel guilt about abandoning Tito ( out of loyalty , not romantic love ) . The whole premise of the film is ridiculous , and I find it amazing that no one in the film tell Tito what a stupid old fool he is being ( until he reveals it himself at the end ) . The film is noteworthy only because of Loretta Young , who would go on to have a great career . While I adore Chaney 's brilliance a an actor , this whole film seems off to me and just downright creepy .

I 'm sorry guy , all who thought this film could be something great , I 'm afraid you would be disappointed . The standard , the movie wanted to set is completely ruined by some very simple plot . So simple , that the movie is not evolving until the end . I asked myself if the plot wa n't about the action but about the main character ( played by Mickey Rourke ) , but I found that the character wa inconsistent - either he is a professional killer or some guilt haunted brother . But both do n't go together , because the kid he try to guide pose him in dangerous situation where no professional killer would put himself . Now , Joseph Gordon-Levitt , is a good looking actor , but he played his character a little unnatural . I did n't believe his acting , it looked like the director tried to pull out of him some personality he could n't provide . And he did n't have to , because his le crazy behavior wa creepy enough . The only one whose acting wa great , wa Diane Lane . If not her , i would give this movie 1 star . In conclusion , I expected to see some well played movie and some interesting plot . And I completely blew it with my high expectation .

Musically speaking Irving Berlin gave Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers another pluperfect musical after Top Hat if that wa possible . Although in this case like that Jerome Kern confection Roberta that they were in , Follow the Fleet retained Randolph Scott with another singer , this time Harriet Hilliard . Randolph Scott is a career Navy CPO and Fred Astaire is an ex-vaudevillian who enlisted in the Navy to forget Ginger Rogers his former partner . But now the two are on shore leave . Fred and Ginger take up right where they left off , and Randy accidentally meet Ginger 's dowdy sister Harriet who blossom into a real beauty . But Randy 's a typical love 'em and leave 'em sailor . Again Irving Berlin wrote a hit filled score with him tightly supervising the production . Ginger get to do some really outstanding vocalizing with Let Yourself Go which she and Fred later dance to . But the real hit of the show is Let 's Face the Music and Dance which is a number done at a Navy show . Sung first by Astaire and later danced to by the pair , Let 's Face the Music and Dance is one of the great romantic number ever written for the screen . Their dancing on this one is absolute magic . I 'm sure that when I mention Harriet Hilliard a few younger people might ask who that wa . But they will know immediately when I mention her in conjunction with her famous husband Ozzie Nelson . That 's right Ozzie and Harriet . It 's something of a mystery to me why Harriet stopped singing when she just became David and Ricky 's mom on television . Then again she did n't even keep her own name . Neither Ozzie or Harriet sang on television . Ozzie wa a pale imitation of Rudy Vallee a a singer , but Harriet could really carry a tune . She sings Get Thee Behind Me Satan and The Moon and I Are Here , But Where Are You , both with real feeling and class . I recommend you see Follow the Fleet if for no other reason than to hear a dimension of Harriet Hilliard incredibly forgotten today .

I can never fathom why people take time to review movie that they have not understood fully . I know people will read scathing review on these page of this film , and it will keep them from seeking copy of this quite forgotten , late '20s style but 1932 movie , which should probably be referred to a `` Indecent , '' a that is the name on the main title . Myrna Loy , best known a a comic actress in countless genteel role , show herself to be miscast in all of them . She wa a true dramatic actress , something that I did not know before watching this film , which predates all of her famous role . She is exciting and moving here , two thing she never wa opposite the graceful and refined William Powell . I 'm still rather in shock over how good she wa . Becky Sharp ( 1935 ) , the first three-strip Technicolor feature , is more familiar but this one is far better artistically and an adaptation . It is also very poignant a an expression of a film style that wa about to die . You can not take my word for it , you must see it .

I 'm always surprised about how many time you 'll see something about World War 2 on the German national television . You would think they do n't like to open old wound , but there is n't a week that go by without a documentary or a movie about the horror and atrocity of this war . Perhaps it 's a way of dealing with their past , I do n't know , but you sure ca n't blame them of ignoring what happened . And it ha to be said : most of those documentary are really worth a watch because they never try to gloss over the truth and the same can be said about their movie ( think for instance about `` Der Untergang '' or `` The Downfall '' a you might now it ) which are also very realistic . One of those movie is `` Rosenstrasse '' . It tell a true story and deal with the subject of the mixed marriage during the war , even though the movie start with a family in the USA , at the present day . After Hannah 's father died , her mother all a sudden turned into an orthodox Jew even though she ha n't been very religious before . She doe n't know where the strange behavior of her mother come from , but a she start digging in her mother 's troubled childhood , Hannah understands how little she ha ever known about her mother 's past . The fact that this movie deal with the subject of the mixed marriage during the Nazi regime is already quite surprising . For a far a I know , there ha n't been another movie that deal with this subject . ( For those who did n't know this yet : Being married to a so-called pure Aryian man or woman meant for many Jews that they were n't immediately sent to one of the concentration camp , but that they had to work in a factory ) . But it doe not only tell something about the problem of the mixed marriage , it also give a good idea of how these people were often seen by their own parent and relative . How difficult it sometimes wa for them during the Nazi regime and how these people , most of the time woman , did everything within their power to free their men , once they were captured and locked away in for instance the Rosenstrasse ... The acting is really good and the story is very well written , although the way it wa presented in the beginning did n't really do it for me ( and that 's exactly the only part that you 'll get to see in the trailer ) . Perhaps it 's just me , but I would have left out a big part of what happens in the present day . At least of the part that is situated in the USA , because the part where Hannah go to Berlin and talk to someone who know more about her mother 's past , definitely work . If you are interested in everything that ha something to do with the Second World War , and if you are n't necessarily looking for a lot of action shot , than this is definitely a movie you should see . This is n't a movie in which you 'll see any battle or gunfight , but it certainly is an interesting movie , because it give you an idea about an aspect of the war only little is known of . I give it an 8/10 .

Christian Propaganda ... Lots of fear mongering ... This is not SciFi , this is ChriFi ( Christian fiction ) .The movie started out OK but took a sharp Christian right turn . From then on it wa all about god , jc , the holy bible and the devil . The ufo 's are really just demonic deception to fool people in to believing that there is other intelligent life in the universe . Satan 's idea is to trick you in to thinking that there could be more to life than what is in the bible . The abduction could be used to explain away the rapture . The people left behind would believe it wa a mass alien abduction , instead of god taking all the Christians to heaven . No reason to repent if it alien . The deeper message in the movie is that if you do n't believe in god and have jc in your life than you believe in nothing and your life ha no purpose .

This DVD is missing it calling a a Heineken coaster .... This is a great example of why no one should ever go see a sequel with a different director/writer than the original . Two hour of this turkey left me begging for Exorcist 2 rerun . NO legitimate laugh . NOT ONE decent scare . The script wa just a mess and I felt bad for the actor who had to perform it ( they must have had sick relative at home or monster coke habit or something ) . The original wa a makeup effect landmark . So naturally , the producer of the sequel thought it would be a great idea to to scrap makeup FX and do CG werewolf instead . These CG werewolf had me laughing a lot harder than any of the `` comedy '' . It wa just a total miss . If ya want a night 's entertainment , go rent the original again . Or go take a film class and make your own horror film . You 're bound to do better than these fool did .

This incredibly formulaic flick from the `` Walker , Texas Ranger '' squad contains some of the most unbelievable scene ever witnessed within a TV movie . In addition , one can pretty much predict the outcome from the get-go . However , it 's a fun little movie that get the job done : it entertains . That 's all it wa meant to do and it doe so . The stunt and explosion are fun and exciting and the plot is n't half bad . The acting is also decent , which is n't much of a surprise , because everyone know that Chuck Norris is no Steven Seagal . If you 're a fan of the genre ( and of `` Walker , Texas Ranger '' ) , you will definitely love this . If not , then do n't waste your time . 8/10

Karen ( Sarah Michelle Gellar ) , an exchange student in Japan who is just beginning to do some social work , is sent to aid an elderly semi-catatonic woman , Emma ( Grace Zabriskie ) , after her previous caretaker , Yoko ( Yoko Maki ) , disappears . Karen soon learns that something is not right in Emma 's home , and she attempt to `` see how deep the rabbit hole go '' . Maybe it 's a delayed influence from the success of M. Night Shyamalan 's film , but slower-paced , understated horror film are a recent trend . In some case , such a Hide and Seek ( 2005 ) , the approach work remarkably well , and in others , such a White Noise ( 2005 ) , the pacing tends to kill the film . I did n't like The Grudge quite a much a Hide and Seek , but this is still a very good film -- it earns a 9 out of 10 from me . The Grudge ha a couple significant difference from other recent example of that trend , however . One , it is well known that this is a remake based on the Japanese film series that began with Ju-On ( 2000 ) ( in particular , it 's extremely close to the first half of Ju-On : The Grudge , aka Ju-On 3 , from 2003 ) . Two , a with many Japanese horror film , the slower pacing here is n't so much in the realm of realist drama a with surrealism . As is also the case with a large percentage of European horror , The Grudge should be looked at more a a filmed nightmare . Director Takashi Shimizu , also the director of the five Japanese entry in the Ju-On series to date ( the fifth is currently in production ) , and writer Stephen Susco have largely dispensed with linearity and are not overly concerned with logic or plot hole when it come to the horror behind the story . The idea instead is to present a dreamlike sequence of scene , with dream logic , where the focus is atmosphere , creepiness , the uncanny , and for many viewer -- scare . How well the film work for you will largely depend on how well you can adapt yourself to , or are used to , this different approach to film-making ( although admittedly , some of the seeming gap are filled in by previous entry in the Ju-On series ) . Traditionally , American audience consider a flaw leaving plot thread hanging and abandoning `` rule '' for the `` monster '' . A more poetic , metaphorical , surreal approach to film is n't yet accepted by the mainstream in the U.S . However , even if you 're not used to it , it 's worth trying to suspend your normal preconception about film and give The Grudge a shot . This is a well written , well directed , well acted film , filled with unusual property , such a the story interweaving a large number of `` main character '' ( which is done better here than the more episodic Ju-On 3 ) , good cinematography , subtle production design touch ( check out Gellar 's clothes , which match the color and texture of the exterior of Emma 's house , when Gellar first approach ) , and beautifully effective horror material . Even though it is more slowly paced that your average horror film of the past , the pacing usually enhances the eeriness , and there is no shortage of bizarre event to keep horror fan entertained . The supernatural premise of the film is absorbing , and based on interview on the DVD with Shimizu , have prodded me to pay more attention to Japanese belief and folklore . Although the most interesting subtexts would probably arise with a more intimate knowledge of Japanese culture , it 's interesting to ponder why so many Japanese horror film feature scary child and adult who look like scary child . I subtracted one point for the film slightly veering into clichéd mystery/thriller territory with a `` here 's what really happened '' flashback , but even that wa fairly well done , and otherwise , this would have been a 10 out of 10 . Now that I 've said all of the above , let me finish with a mini-rant : It 's not that I 'm anti-remake , but it is ridiculous that U.S. distributor and studio feel that we need remake of foreign film to make them appropriate for consumption . The original version of these film should just be playing in U.S. theater in wide release . There is no need to present an almost identical film but just substituting white American actor for non-white or foreign actor . Yes , The Grudge is a fine film , but ultimately , I 'd rather see something original using this talent , and be treated to the latest foreign horror film -- not just Japanese , but also Indian , Spanish , Chinese , etc. -- at my multiplex . In the hope that someone with some pull at the studio read this , it is also more cost-effective to do this , a ( 1 ) you can completely avoid production cost , and simply make domestic distribution deal from which you receive profit , and ( 2 ) you can make money off of fan like myself who otherwise pick up the foreign film DVDs in foreign manufactured or even bootleg version .

This movie is pure guano . Mom always said if you ca n't say anything nice ... but even Mom would say I had to do my part to warn others of this movie . I can guarantee this is the film that Geoffrey Rush wish would just go away . I would hope that Greg Kinnear fired his agent .. from a cannon for giving him the script . A group of young filmmaker with virtually no budget set out to make something clever and original -- and while there is a bit of originality and some skilled drawing in this slacker puppet show take on `` Dante 's Inferno , '' there is nothing especially clever . Dante 's `` Divine Comedy '' wa a brilliant piece of social commentary . This film is a vaguely moralistic student film with pretension to High Art . I suspect those who loved this film were those readily amused by the sophomoric poke at some icon of the political and/or religious right , and that those who hated it took offense at seeing their favored icon poked . Be that a it may , few of those poke actually rose to the level of satire . The high point of the movie is a sudden outbreak of `` Schoolhouse Rock '' on the subject of lobbying and the `` revolving door . '' It 's really a shame that the entire film could n't have been a musical . That would have stripped away a great deal of the annoying film school pretentiousness and added a far stronger element of fun .

The Palestinian situation is fertile and as-yet largely fallow soil for film-making . 'Divine Intervention ' try hard , and give u an insightful peek into the almost surreal life of those caught up in the trouble , but the film amount to little more than a handful of ( admittedly lovely ) visual joke thrown onto celluloid , while the link between them become increasingly obscure a the film progress . A missed opportunity to say something more coherent about a very topical issue .

This film stand head and shoulder above the vast majority of cinematic romantic comedy . It is virtually flawless ! The writing , acting , production design , humor and pathos are all wonderful ! Even the music -- from Dean Martin to La Boheme -- is captivating and delightful ! Every character is peculiarly delightful and memorable , from the lead played by Cher and Nicolas Cage , to the many supporting role -- Olympia Dukakis , Vincent Gardenia , John Mahoney , Danny Aiello -- even grandpa with his dog pack ! Each of these performer , plus Norman Jewison a Director , performs above their normal quality in this ensemble work . For several of the actor , this wa an early major exposure in film , so the casting is also exceptional -- and we have many current acting powerhouse whose career were altered by their effectiveness in this film . I 've seen this film several time all the way through -- which can sometimes deflate the impact of a film substantially . More tellingly , I realized some year ago that whenever I channel-surfed my way into a scene from this film -- any scene -- the scene wa compelling and beautifully crafted . There are so many stunning and memorable scene the original meeting between the Cher and Nicolas Cage character , where Cage tell his tale of woe ; Vincent Gardenia discovered with his paramour at the opera , amidst the splendor generated by his gold-mine plumbing business ; Olympia Dukakis scolding John Mahoney for philandering with his student in the classic line about liaison with co-worker : `` Do n't sh-t where you eat ! `` ; Danny Aiello at his dying mother 's bedside ; Nicolas Cage `` taking '' Cher a the rapture of an aria soar in the background ! There are of course many great romantic comedy , among them Sabrina ( both version , but especially the Audrey Hepburn/Humphrey Bogart/William Holden original ) ; When Harry Met Sally ; The Apartment . None quite equal Moonstruck !

In many way , the filmic career of independent film-making legend John Cassavetes is the polar opposite of someone like Alfred Hitchcock , the consummate studio director . Where Hitchcock infamously treated his actor a cattle , Cassavetes sought to work with them improvisationally . Where every element in a Hitchcock shot is composed immaculately , Cassavetes cared le for the way a scene wa figuratively composed than in how it felt , or what it conveyed , emotionally . Hitchcock 's tale were always plot-first narrative , with the human element put in the background . Cassavetes put the human experience forefront in every one of his film . If some thing did not make much sense logically , so be it . One can see this even from his very first film , 1959 's Shadows , filmed with a 16mm hand-held camera , on a shoe string budget of about $ 40,000 , in Manhattan , with Cassavetes ' acting workshop repertory company , and touted a an improvisatory film . The story is rather simple , a it follows the life of three black sibling Manhattanites- Benny ( Ben Carruthers ) - a trumpeter and no account , Hugh ( Hugh Hurd ) - a washed up singer , and Lelia ( Lelia Goldoni ) - the younger sister of both . The film 's three main arc deal with Hugh 's failure a a nightclub crooner , and his friendship with his manager Rupert ( Rupert Crosse ) ; Benny 's perambulation in an about Manhattan with his two no account pal ; and Lelia 's lovelife- first with a white boy Tony ( Anthony Ray ) , who doe not realize light-skinned Lelia 's race , even after bedding her ; then with stiff and proper Davey ( Davey Jones ) , who may be a misogynist . In the first arc , nothing much happens , except dark-skinned Hugh get to pontificate on how degraded he feel to be singing in low class nightclub , and opening show for girly act . He dream of making it big in New York , or even Paris , but one can tell he is the type of man who will continue deluding himself of his meager skill , for the one time we actually get to hear him sing , he show he 's a marginal talent , at best . That Rupert keep encouraging him give u glimpse into how destructive friendship work . But , this is the least important of the three arc . While this film is better overall than , say , Martin Scorsese 's first film , a decade later , Who 's That Knocking At My Door ? - another tale of failed romance and frustrated New Yorkers , it ha none of the brilliant moments- acting-wise nor cinematographically- that that film ha . It also is not naturalistic , for naturalism in art is a very difficult thing to achieve , especially in film , although the 1950s era Manhattan exterior , at ground level , is a gem to relive . While Shadows may , indeed , be an important film in regard to the history of the independent film circuit , it certainly is nowhere near a great film . Parts of it are preachy , poorly acted , scene end willy-nilly , almost like blackout sketch , and sometimes are cut off seemingly in the middle . All in all it 's a very sloppy job- especially the atrocious jazz score that is often out of synch with the rest of the film , a Cassavetes proved that a a director , at least in his first film , he wa a good actor . The only reason for anyone to see Shadows is because Cassavetes ultimately got better with later film , and this give a clue a to his later working style . The National Film Registry ha rightly declared this film worthy of preservation a 'culturally significant ' . This is all in keeping with the credo of art Cassavetes long championed , a typified by this quote : ' I 've never seen an exploding helicopter . I 've never seen anybody go and blow somebody 's head off . So why should I make film about them ? But I have seen people destroy themselves in the smallest way . I 've seen people withdraw . I 've seen people hide behind political idea , behind dope , behind the sexual revolution , behind fascism , behind hypocrisy , and I 've myself done all these thing . So I can understand them . What we are saying is so gentle . It 's gentleness . We have problem , terrible problem , but our problem are human problem . ' That this film is 'culturally significant ' is true , but that truth is not synonymous with it being 'artistically significant ' . It is in the difference between these two definition where great art truly thrives .

`` This story is dedicated to woman , '' according to the introduction , `` who have been fighting for their right ever since Adam and Eve started the loose-leaf system . '' When `` Politics '' wa filmed , the Nineteenth Amendment , guaranteeing woman the right to vote , wa only a decade old . And , the film deal with the wielding of political power by woman a a voting group . Advocating prohibition , and shutting down speakeasy , wa a main concern for woman at the time . Good-natured Marie Dressler ( a Hattie Burns ) becomes politically active , after a young woman is shot and killed coming out of a speakeasy . She want the liquor-selling joint closed ; and , is drafted into a Mayoral run , after delivering a powerful speech at a woman 's rally . Ms. Dressler is supported by her tenant , best friend Polly Moran ( a Ivy Higgins ) and her stuttering husband Roscoe Ates ( a Peter Higgins ) . Dressler 's run for Mayor of Lake City draw opposition from men in town ; so , Dressler order the woman to go on strike , denying them , `` everything '' in the `` parlor , bedroom , and bath . '' The film sound much better than it turned out . The humor , frankly , is n't too good ; and , it feature some unfunny and moderately offensive situation ( `` You look like Madame Queen '' refers to an Amos and Andy character ) . And , the mixing of shooting and slapstick doe n't mix well , this time . Producers might have considered making the film more dramatic , focusing exclusively on Dressler and the character played by William Bakewell ( a Benny Emerson ) and Karen Morley ( a Myrtle Burns ) . * * * * Politics ( 7/25/31 ) Charles Reisner ~ Marie Dressler , Polly Moran , Roscoe Ates

At the beginning of the film , you might double-check the DVD cover and re-read the synopsis a couple of time , but no worry . It 's NOT `` Memoirs of a Geisha '' that you purchased ; just a movie with an intro that is much more classy and stylish than it ha any right to be . Still , the opening is by far the best thing about the entire movie , a it show how in the year 1840 a Samurai sword master catch his wife committing adultery . He decapitates the two lover before doing some hara-kiri ( ritual suicide through disembowelment ) . Cut to present day , when the American Ambassador in Japan welcome a befriended family and drive them up to the same house where the aforementioned slaughter took place nearly one and a half century ago . From then onwards , this becomes a seemingly routine haunted house flick yet the utterly retarded and implausible script still make it somewhat exceptional . Let 's start with the good aspect , namely the original Japanese setting and the presence of the delicious Susan George who is my all-time favorite British horror wench ( well , together with Britt Eckland , Linda Hayden and Ingrid Pitt ) . The bad aspect simply include that the screenplay is incoherent , imbecilic beyond repair and full of supposedly unsettling twist that only evoke laughter . The restless spirit of the house soon begin to entertain themselves by perpetrating into the body of the new tenant and causing them to do and say all sort of crazy stuff . The spirit of the massacred adulterous woman particularly enjoys squeezing into Susan 's ravishing booty and transforming her into a lewd seductress ! In this `` possessed '' state , she even lure the American ambassador outside to have sex in the garden of a high society diner party full of prominent guest . So , strictly spoken , it 's not really `` evil '' that dwells in the house ; just a trio of sleazy ghost with dirty mind and far too much free time on their long-dead hand ! Obviously these scene are more comical than frightening , especially since the light-blue and transparent shape remind you of the cute ghost effect that were later popularized in `` Ghostbusters '' . `` The House Where Evil Dwells '' is probably the least scary ghost movie ever . Throughout most of the running time , you 'll be wondering whether director Kevin Connor ( who nevertheless made the excellent horror film `` Motel Hell '' and `` From Beyond the Grave '' ) intentionally wanted to make his movie funny and over-the-top , like `` Motel Hell '' maybe . But then again , everyone in the cast continues to speak his/her line with a straight and sincere face , so I guess we are nevertheless supposed to take everything seriously and feel disturbed . `` The House Where Evil Dwells '' is never suspenseful or even remotely exciting and it doe n't even contain any grisly image apart from the massacre at the beginning . I am fully aware of how shallow it sound , but the two scene in which Susan George go topless are the only true highlight . Well , those and maybe also the invasion of cheesy and ridiculously over-sized spider ( or are they crab ? ) in the daughter 's bedroom . How totally random and irrelevant wa that ? If you ever decide to give this movie a chance notwithstanding it bad reputation , make sure you leave your common sense and reasoning at the doorstep . Trivia note for horror buff : keep an eye open for the demon-mask that wa also a pivot piece of scenery in the brilliant Japanese horror classic Onibaba .

If you want to see a movie about two utterly unsympathetic character , this is the one . The acting is superb , both from John Cassavetes a the insane paranoid whom , a the saying go , they REALLY ARE out to get , and from Peter Falk a his lifelong best friend to whom he turn for rescue . Big mistake , but since they 're both amoral mobster , and misogynistic bastard to boot , it 's hard to decide whom to root for LESS . Only writer/director Elaine May could have gotten away with this one . I thought it interesting that in a lengthy interview with producer Michael Hausman included on the DVD , he disclosed that the two star had `` very different idea '' about the script , that the director wa nearly impossible to work with , that the director of photography had impossible demand made of him , that the crew wa constantly angry about being made to sit around waiting , and so on . This mood of one big VERY dysfunctional family come across clearly on the screen .

Good , boring or bad ? It 's good . Worth your money ? If you can spare it for a ticket , sure . Better than the trailer make it seem ? Yes , oddly . There is n't much to the script - Guards working at armored truck company move vast amount of cash . Guards see opportunity to retire a millionaire , one of them is too honest to go along with it all , and a well-laid plan go to hell . This could have been a poorly-executed Reservoir Dogs ripoff , but the skill of the cast and the director 's ability to make just about anything tense pull it out of that realm and put it onto a solid footing .

My rating refers to the first 4 Seasons of Stargate SG-1 which are wonderfully fresh , creative and addicting . When the cast stepped through the gate , you never knew what lay on the other side ! Starting around Season 5 , the show took a different focus - still good , but different . The series follows the adventure of a team of human ( and one alien ) who regularly venture into a planetary transport device called the `` Stargate '' . The backstory of the series is based on the character and event of the movie `` Stargate '' in which the device is discovered during an archaeological dig in Egypt . The episode are light ( innocent and easy to watch ) and very creative . Many of the inventive story could easily have been made into great sci-fi movie of their own . What happens next wa always unpredictable . The character on which the show rest are also well-defined and brilliantly performed . Their tone is serious , but the dialog is flowered with incredible wit and humor . They are simply fun to watch . Starting somewhere around Season 5 , the series started to evolve into a continuing storyline based on fighting a single foe ( the Goa'uld , then the Ori ) . The plot become more complex ( a lot more political/strategic oriented ) and interdependent . The character were still a great a ever but the show wa different in nature . One thing that must be mentioned is to watch the episode that commemorated the 100th and 200th episode . They are simply can't-miss show . They exhibit the creative and wildly humorous genius that carried the series through 10 season . If you are a sci-fi fan , watch a few episode of the first 4 Seasons and you 'll likely be hooked . If you like evolving story line between two opposing side , you have 10 season of show to look forward to .

Late night on BBC1 , wa on my way to bed but curiosity piqued at a contemporary-set Irish film so I stayed to watch for a few minute and then stayed to the end . I have to admit that the main attraction wa the only English actress , Kelly Reilly , who is stunning to look at . This is billed a a black comedy , which is one of the hardest thing to pull off . It should be the perfect blend of horror and horrible laugh so that in the end you do n't know why you 're laughing - for me Martin Scorsese 's After Hours ( 1985 ) is the best example . Dead Bodies is more black than comedy but the plot rattle along and spiral down towards further blackness . I did n't spot the final twist in the tale a some other poster here did so I wa suitably surprised . As a snapshot of the Irish film industry in 2003 , it all seems rather worthy ; it doe n't look like they spent too much on the making of it so it had a chance to make it money back . The script could 've been a whole lot sharper but the acting wa on the whole pretty good . I 'm glad I watched it , flaw and all , tho I do n't think I learnt much about Ireland today , especially their policing method !

Wow , did this episode start on a STOOOOOPID premise ! The Enterprise is chugging along when all of the sudden , Abraham Lincoln is floating around in space and welcome the Enterprise ! ! ! ! ! ! ! Is it just me , or is this a really lame-brained idea ? ! Lincoln come aboard and they welcome them . Abe suggests they beam down to some barren planet , where they meet other famous dead folk -- both good and evil . It seems that a really cheesy-looking rock monster ha assembled a team of GOOD and EVIL people to battle it out for supremacy . The whole thing seems really daffy and inherently unfair , a the GOOD side is saddled with Surak -- a Vulcan who make Gandhi seem like Rambo ! ! Despite a totally AWFUL premise , the action is pretty good and it 's great to see overhead shot of obvious double fighting it out in this grudge match . But , do n't mistake this for high art or deep sci-fi . The bottom line is that the series wa on it last leg a a first-run series and this really looked like they dusted off this turkey and filmed it regardless of the absurdity of the premise .

Claire Denis 's movie seem to fall into one of two category : the violent and bloody or the quiet and intimate . `` L'Intrus '' definitely fall into the first category , but it 's not so awful a `` Trouble Every Day '' or `` J'ai pa sommeil . '' Now , ever since I saw `` Chocolat , '' I 've made it a point to see every new movie Denis make . And I have always been disappointed . `` L'Intrus '' wa no exception . She ha yet to make a movie a personal and a moving a her first one . You get a lot of the Denis regular : an older but still magnificent Béatrice Dalle who seems to be in the movie only to show off her full lip , the gap between her teeth , her ample cleavage , and a couple of nice coat ; the black guy from `` Trouble Every Day '' and `` J'ai pa sommeil , '' Grégoire Colin , and that Lithuanian or Russian girl . Michel Subor 's character wa interesting enough , but the camera lingered on him at such length that I got annoyed by that curly forelock of hair hanging over his forehead and wa relieved when , somewhere in Korea , I think , he finally got it cut . There wa certainly some action -- gruesome murder , a man 's search for a son -- and there may even have been a plot , but one viewing wa n't enough to figure it out , and two viewing are , I fear , out of the question . For one thing , the score wa jarring and obtrusive ( a in `` Beau Travail '' ) . For another , the season changed too abruptly , leaving you even more confused about what wa going on . Oh , there were a few pretty shot , and if you liked `` Friday Evening '' with it shot of the fold in heavy drape and bedsheets , you might appreciate the aesthetic of `` L'Intrus . '' Otherwise , steer clear . I saw this movie in French and it 's possible I missed something crucial . But the dialogue in a Denis movie rarely amount to more than five page , double spaced and with ample margin . In `` Chocolat '' the silence is sublime ; in `` L'Intrus , '' it 's just dull .
