I have had the opportunity to catch this independent film and wa impressed with it , despite the lack of excitement in the plot . The acting wa very good by everyone involved . Amy Madigan played the part of a guilt ridden mother who is tired , yet well intentioned and determined to make up for her younger daughter 's condition . Yet , in the process , she ha neglected her older sister , who is more interested in playing with her savant-syndrome sibling and living in a world of escapism . The men in the movie are very powerful in their secondary role . Christopher Lloyd , in a very understated role , show u why he ha such versatility . He play a teacher who is dedicated to his profession and literature research , yet starved for a meaningful relationship . He and Madigan connect very well in their scene together , yet both know nothing more can come from their friendship . Their wordless goodbye is nothing short of brilliant , an acting lesson for aspiring performer . And in a small role , Fred Savage is fun to watch . You can tell why this movie wa based on a play , it 's probably very good on stage . On screen , it 's not particularly exciting , but it 's nonetheless very thoughtful and powerful in it subtlety .

Still the definitive program about the Second World War , The World At War is n't just long , but also very informative . The series contains 26 episode ( each episode last for about 45 min . ) , and includes the event leading up to and following in the wake of the war . Most episode are about the war in Europe , and there are several episode about the war in the Pacific . Other episode include information about the war in Africa , Burma , the Atlantic and the home front of Germany , Great Britain , United States and Soviet Union . There is one episode that 's dedicated to the Holocaust . The series start off with the episode A New Germany ( 1933-1939 ) , and tell about the rise of the Nazis in Germany and German territorial gain prior to the outbreak of war . The series end with the episode Remember ; the war 's influence in a post-war world . Remember is a fitting episode to end this great program . Every episode begin with a short introduction and then with opening credit . The credit are accompanied by a powerful music theme . There are many fitting music piece throughout the series . Each episode is like a mini-film . The footage is fantastic , and so is the way it wa put together . In addition , some of the footage is in color . The information included also make the episode memorable and entertaining . The series wa produced by Jeremy Isaacs for Thames Television ( UK ) . Commissioned in 1969 , it took four year to produce , such wa the depth of it research . The series wa narrated by Laurence Olivier ( one of the most famous and revered actor of the 20th century ) . The series interviewed leading member of the Allied and Axis campaign , including eyewitness account by civilian , enlisted men , officer and politician , amongst them Albert Speer , Karl Donitz , Jimmy Stewart , Bill Mauldin , Curtis LeMay , Lord Mountbatten , Alger Hiss , Toshikazu Kase , Arthur Harris , Charles Sweeney , Paul Tibbets , Traudl Junge and historian Stephen Ambrose . Jeremy Isaacs say in `` The Making of The World at War '' that he sought to interview , not necessarily the surviving big name , but their aide and assistant . The most difficult subject to locate and persuade to be interviewed , according to Isaacs , wa Heinrich Himmler 's adjutant , Karl Wolff . The latter admitted to witnessing a large-scale execution in Himmler 's presence . The World At War is often considered to be the definitive television history of the Second World War . Some consider it the finest example of the documentary form . In a list of the 100 Greatest British Television Programmes drawn up by the British Film Institute in 2000 , voted for by industry professional , The World at War ranked 19th . The program ha everything that the viewer need to know about the war . After watching a few episode I liked the series so much that I tried to watch the remaining episode one after the other . I 've seen some of them several time . There are two other great documentary series that I know of that may be of interest to the viewer . One is called The Great War ( 1964 ) that 's about World War I . The other is called Cold War ( 1998 ) that 's about the Cold War obviously .

I have seen 'The Sea Within ' today and I loved it . The actor of the movie are wonderful ( specially Javier Bardem , of course ) , but I thought that Belén Rueda would have a better role . Lola Dueñas , Clara Segura and , specially , Mabel Rivera perform excellent interpretation . And I can not forget Celso Bugallo and Joan Dalmau ( brother and father of the protagonist ) . There are two technical aspect I loved very much : Aguirresarobe 's photography and the score by Amenábar himself . I liked the song , 'Negra sombra ' ( 'Dark Shadow ' ) , by Luz Casal with music of Carlos Núñez . In short , I think that the Spanish Academy should choose 'The Sea Within ' in order to compete in the Oscar Awards . I liked other Spanish production , such a Almodóvar 's 'Bad Education ' , but Amenábar 's film is much better than them . 'The Sea Within ' deserves all the award .

As someone who ha read the book , I can say that this is vastly inferior to the big American version starring Gwyneth Paltrow . There are various reason for this . Firstly , Emma is too unpleasant . Yes , she ha fault , and is n't the easiest person to like - but the viewer should n't downright start to despise her . Secondly , Mr Knightly is miscast . His brooding and melancholy in this version are better suited to a Bronte or Gaskell adaptation than Austen , and throw the mood of the whole affair `` off '' . Thirdly , Samantha Morton is too strong an actress to be relegated to the role of Harriet ; and why wa she made to look so sickly ? Harriet is supposed to be blonde and blooming - not to look a if she 's going to be carried off by consumption in the next scene . Fourthly , the structure ha been mucked up and scene cut . At the end , when Emma decides she love Mr Knightly , it come across a utterly baffling because this narrative ha n't been adequately shown and carried along throughout the film . Fifthly , what wa going on , exactly , with Mrs Elton 's accent ? She went from sounding like an American actress trying to suppress her own accent at the beginning , to all out American half-way through , and then back to English at the end . Finally , this dragged at the end . The book and the big film version end with the wedding of Emma and Mr Knightly . This version drag on confusingly after the announcement of the wedding without actually showing u the ceremony . All in all , a rather haphazard attempt . Read the book or rent the Paltrow version instead

I 'm not a huge fan of Lucio Fulci 's film . Most of his 80 gore film had their moment , but often came across a second-rate Dario Argento imitation . With the exception of the entertaining `` Zombi '' ( which wa a George Romero imitation ) , I did n't really enjoy them . I know Italian horror often disregard the plot , but the storyline and character in his film were just far too thread bare even by the standard . This is why `` Do n't Torture a Duckling '' surprised me . Its actually a very well made film with an engrossing murder mystery . Its possibly the best giallo ever made , only seriously rivaled by Dario Argento 's entry into the genre . And unlike Fulci 's previous giallo `` A Lizard in a Woman 's Skin '' , this never drag . Fulci 's direction here is quite good . He keep the story moving at a good pace and maintains the viewer 's interest throughout . Also , the conclusion to the mystery come a a complete surprise to the audience . Plus , he add some clever touch , such a the upbeat soul music during a particularly disturbing graveyard beating sequence . Overall , the violence here is restrained and only used when necessary for the story . The acting is good for the most part also , full of familiar face from 70 Italian exploitation cinema . Both Thomas Milian and Barbara Bouchet are super cool throughout . The only weak link is Florinda Bolkan , whose performance is just far too over-the-top . Its the only laughable aspect of the film . `` Do n't Torture a Duckling '' definitely come with my recommendation and may be a good introduction to the giallo subgenre a a whole . ( 8/10 )

This film stand a one of the most amazing example of compelling and artful film-making I 've every seen . Herzog seems to capture the almost transcendent tragedy and beauty of Dieter 's story , a well a his endearing personal character . By the end of the film , I wa left wishing that I 'd had the opportunity to meet Dieter before his passing . On a technical note , the cinematography is intimate and astoundingly beautiful . The narrative is intricately woven , with great awareness of the subject and his capacity for reliving and reenacting traumatic event . Few documentary director have so strong an ability to so thoroughly invest the audience in the character . This film is a must see ! ! !

A small town is attacked by a horde of bloodthirsty vampire . The only hope is a lone avenger and a group of ragtag survivor . Released in 1993 , `` Darkness '' garnered something of a cult following upon release . It 's easy to see why-it 's loaded ( and I mean freaking loaded ) with gore , and it 's energy and enthusiasm , like that found in other no-budget cult horror flick like `` The Dead Next Door '' and `` The Children of Ravensback '' , is actually rather infectious . While that may be true , that 's sadly not enough to save it . The film wa shot on a Super 8 , so the image is grainy and dark , making thing very difficult to see ( it would have been great if it had obscured the protagonist dreadful mullet . ) Also grating is the soundtrack , made up of annoying Casio Keyboard and even more annoying Death Metal ( seriously , what is it with these no budget horror flick and bad Death Metal ? ) While one is n't expecting Oscar worthy performance , the acting is still strictly amateur hour , a the actor sometimes seem almost confused instead of frightened or threatened . In the end , I 'm sure fan of no-budget gorefests will love this . Everyone else though , will wish there wa a little more meat on the rib .

I can understand after watching this again for the first time in many year how it is considered one of the worst Laurel & Hardy 's . For me , it is n't a close to a bad a `` Air Raid Wardens '' and `` The Bullfighters '' , but there are some definite huge flaw in it . The film is set up to show Laurel and Hardy a the owner and instructor of the dance studio . Hardy is funny a the prancing lead of a `` London Bridge '' dance , surrounded by 20th Century Fox starlet , while in the next room , Laurel teach the beginner ballet while wearing a ballerina outfit . A clumsy carpenter spill glue on the floor , leading to a predicable gag where Hardy end up the looser . Then , in come the racketeer , now selling insurance covering up their protection racket . One of them is a very young and handsome Robert Mitchum . But no sooner do they bully the boy into buying insurance , they are arrested . This is the end of the gangster and the last time we see the dance studio . The rest of the film is devoted to Laurel and Hardy 's support of wealthy patron Trudy Marshall and her inventor boyfriend , Robert Bailey . They first try to help them hide their relationship from her disapproving parent ( Matt Briggs and Margaret Dumont ) and hopeful suitor Allan Lane , whom we can tell right off is a no-good swine . This lead to Briggs ' hidden bar being revealed to tea-totaling Dumont , and a gag where a rug is literally pulled out from the wealthy patriarch which crash his bed into a pond below . When Bailey us the boy to help display his ray gun , pandemonium ensues . The dead-pan butler announces to Case and Dumont that their house is on fire . Later , Hardy want to use the insurance policy to gain money to pay their dance studio rent and hope to get Laurel to break a leg to do so . There is no reference to the fact that the insurance salesman were gangster and that the policy would probably be invalid . ( Even if they were to have become legitimate insurance salesman , after being arrested , their license would have been revoked ) . Laurel end up getting off a bus which had been abandoned by the driver over a supposedly rabid dog ( only a frosting covered , cake devouring Toto look-alike , or possibly the actual pooch ) , causing Oliver to end up on a huge beach roller-coaster that somehow the bus ha ended up on , perfectly fitting it wheel onto the track . Roller-coaster gag can be exciting , a evidenced in `` Abbott and Costello Go to Hollywood '' , and this one is amusing but anticlimactic . As the story wrap up , all of these gag seem to have no point , giving the impression that this wa simply a series of one-reelers put together to make a full-length feature , hopefully part of a double bill . L & H , a I 've mentioned in other review of their later film , had lost much of their luster after leaving Hal Roach 's employ , but surprisingly here , they do not come off a old and tired looking a they had in film made in the same year . Had the gag not been a amusing , a wa the case with some of their other film , this surely would have ranked a `` 2 '' a opposed to a `` 3 '' .

Sadly it wa misguided . This movie stunk from start to finish . It wa hard to watch because I used to watch Clarissa Explains It All every day on Nickelodeon . I LOVED her . Then the next thing I found she did a spread in Maxim and she wa gorgeous ! I have n't really heard anything about her until I watched this movie on accident . I could n't believe she would even let something like this be seen with her name all over it . Everything about it wa wrong but it still looked like someone somewhere in the team wa trying really really hard to save a sunk ship . Too bad .. I hope she continues to act and I would love to see her with a real cast in a real movie .

If you have beloved actor , Peter Falk , Rip Torn , George Segal , and Bill Cobbs , you do n't need Billy Burke , Coolio , or any other distraction . Massive talent is totally wasted in `` Three Days to Vegas '' , with the blame falling squarely on the script . My neighbor 's vacation film are about a interesting a this misguided road movie . If you want to see how to utilize a veteran cast with a good script , check out `` The Crew '' . There really are no redeeming factor here , and watching these wonderful actor struggling with such weak material is a crime . I wanted to like it , but the shallow script cheat the audience , by essentially giving the actor nothing to work with . - MERK

I just ca n't understand the negative comment about this film . Yes it is a typical boy-meets-girl romance but it is done with such flair and polish that the time just fly by . Henstridge ( talk about winning the gene-pool lottery ! ) is a magnetic and alluring a ever ( who say the golden age of cinema is dead ? ) and Vartan hold his own . There is simmering chemistry between the two lead ; the film is most alive when they share a scene - lot ! It is done so well that you find yourself willing them to get together ... Ignore the negative comment - if you are feeling a bit blue , watch this flick , you will feel so much better . If you are already happy , then you will be euphoric . ( PS : I am 33 , Male , from the UK and a hopeless romantic still searching for his Princess ... )

ROCK STAR / ( 2001 ) * * * ( out of four ) By Blake French : '' Rock Star '' is the story of a nobody who becomes propelled into fame , only to realize living his dream is not the way he imagined it . We have seen all this before ( in better movie ) , but this human story doe capture the world of rock and roll with a brutally honest and insightful edge . It garner a recommendation because of it visualization of the atmosphere . The script , by `` Crazy/Beautiful '' director John Stockwell , portrays the hard-core universe with memorable images-it doe n't explain what it is about , it show u . `` Rock Star , '' originally titled `` Metal God , '' star Mark Wahlberg a Chris `` Izzy '' Cole , a Pittsburgh office supply salesperson who dream of becoming Bobby Beers , the fiery lead singer for the heavy metal rock group , Steel Dragon . Although Chris already sings for his own tribute rock group called Blood Pollution , instead of writing his own song , he insists on performing only those by Steel Dragon , and only in the exact way they perform them . His group becomes irritated with Chris ' obsession and give him the boot . This devastates Chris , a well a his supportive parent and faithful girlfriend , Emily ( Jennifer Aniston from TV 's `` Friends '' ) . He then receives a phone call . It 's the Steel Dragon band . They have seen Chris ' tape and want him to replace the recently fired lead singer . In an instant , Chris rocket into the dizzying world of sudden stardom-from the biggest rock fan to the biggest rock star . Unfortunately , it 's not a rewarding a he expected . A true story inspired the `` Rock Star '' concept . An Ohio supply salesman , Tim `` Ripper '' Owens , really did replace Rob Halford , the lead singer in Judas Priest , after initially singing for a tribute band . The rest of the film is probably fiction , although most of what happens must represent the experience of many other band . The film detail the various ordeal of being a rock star . It explores the aspect of touring , personality difference , the danger of drug abuse and violence , struggling relationship , sexual freedom , dishonesty , and the extreme measure of the producer all to please the fan and keep popularity high . I have seen all of Mark Wahlberg 's movie , and this is the first that ha earned my affection . Wahlberg , a former singer/model , ha made movie like `` Fear , '' `` Boogie Nights '' `` Three Kings , '' and most recently Tim Burton 's lacking remake `` Planet of the Apes . '' I am starting to admire the young actor more and more . Although he ha not performed in many successful film , he ha taken many chance , and done a variety of role . `` Rock Star '' is his best film to date . I ca n't think of many actor who could have convincingly portrayed Chris Cole 's struggle and aspiration . Wahlberg truly make `` Rock Star '' rock . Jennifer Aniston light up the screen a well . She creates a chemistry-rich relationship with Chris that induces audience participation . It 's tragic of what happens to their relationship . We care about these character a great deal . During the film concert scene , director Stephen Herek ( who also directed `` Holy Man '' and the live action version of `` 101 Dalmatians '' ) creates a gripping atmosphere . He capture the scene with an intense urgency , and a raw , unmistakable energy . The musical number provide the film with the best , most involving scene . Unfortunately Herek can not sustain the energy and zest throughout . At the three-quarters mark , he loos the spark a the movie becomes dull and unpleasant . I understand where the story need to go in order to portray the negative side of fame , but this movie loses everything it previously had going for it . In `` Almost Famous , '' a much better film about rock and roll , there is a certain amount of interest and life in even the most sorrowful scene . Here , it feel a if the filmmaker lose their passion . The message come a bit too late and suddenly in the story . The film turn into a morality tale that want to provide u with a sappy destination . The filmmaker might a well stop everything , appear on screen and say : `` now audience , the moral of the story is '' We understand the theme , but it 's too instantaneous . The personal discovery for Chris ' must be gradual . Fortunately , all of this happens in the last twenty-five minute of the film , hardly enough to completely destroy an entire eighty-five minute of a reasonably good feature . `` Rock Star '' is not a great movie-see `` Almost Famous '' if you want a remarkable film about rock and roll-but for Marky Mark , it 's a turning point in his career .

I just found out before writing this review that `` Komodo vs. Cobra '' and another movie called `` Curse of the Komodo '' were both directed by the same guy , Jim Wynorski . That might explain why they are film of nearly identical premise . They both feature a military-governed island , a colonel whose concerned more about covering his track than the life of his employee , people racing to get to a chopper that is conveniently lying in a field somewhere on the island , and giant komodo dragon created through genetic experiment running amok . What difference are there ? Well , the intruder on the island are now capitalist wanting to expose the government secret and there 's a giant cobra on the island a well , hence the title `` Komodo vs. Cobra '' even though the conflict between the two monster is hardly relevant to the 'story . ' `` Komodo vs. Cobra '' is more or le what you 'd expect given it title and it channel origin : the Sci-Fi Channel . Although every now and again you will find one that for one reason or another may appeal to you ( I liked a movie called `` Komodo '' ) I hardly doubt this one will . `` Komodo vs. Cobra '' is not only a boring film , but it 's also one of the least enthusiastic sci-fi flick I 've seen in a long time . In some of these movie , there is an air to them that indicates the filmmaker were giving at least a certain level of effort , but I see very little here . That 's indicated again by it just being a rehash of `` Curse of the Komodo . '' The CGI for the monster look a if they came straight out of a second-rate video game , the cinematography and misc en scene is poor , the acting range from passable to poor , the action scene are dull , and then there are some part that are , frankly put , unforgivably bad . I see a lot movie where a person will shoot a gun many time without reloading and I can deal with this . But in this movie , where Michael Paré take a single thirty-eight handgun and fire it approximately fifty time nonstop without reloading once well , at first I laughed , but even then it just became tiring . That would be the 'action . ' A monster appears , people scream , Paré fire nonstop without reloading his gun once throughout the entire picture , and somebody get eaten . `` Komodo vs. Cobra '' is a very bad movie . The only thing in the movie that is worth mentioning in a charitable manner is an actress named Michelle Borth , who is not only very beautiful , but a surprisingly strong performer . Even with the trashy dialogue and lack of enthusiasm in the screenplay she wa given , Michelle Borth managed to pull off a surprisingly good performance and it just appalls me that an actress a good a her can get stuck in a film a junky a this . She obviously took it for the paycheck , but it wo n't boost her career any , I 'm afraid .

Yes , it feel , and for the most part play like an `` after school special '' , for a slightly more adult audience , alright maybe a teen audience . But add in Bill Murray ( already showing some dramatic a well a his usual comedic talent ) , a nice supporting cast , and an unexpected sweetness about growing up , and remembering those great , or not so great day at summer camp , and you get a heartwarming , funny , sleeper hit . It doe get a little too smarmy for it own good , but that is also one of it charm . When you hear the title `` Meatballs '' , and see the poster , you expect a teenage sex romp , but what you get is a sentamental , yet sometimes sexy look back at those formative year at summer camp . The sentamentality , and the remberances of simpler time reminds me of `` A Christmas Story '' , which I also love . The rememberances of summer camp were never so well stated . The only movie I 've seen that come close , is `` Indian Summer '' , which I like almost a much a `` Meatballs '' , and also star Matt Craven . Let 's hope he completes the trilogy . Maybe he could come back for `` Return of the Meatballs '' , and bring some dignity back to the franchise ( Meatballs 2 through 4 bare no resemblence to the original classic ) . `` Meatballs '' is easily on my Top 10 Guilty Pleasures of all time ( not really guilty either ) . It 's a wonderful little film , that always make me smile .

I think this show is screamingly funny ! It 's not for every taste , and I 'm not going to elevate or denigrate the folk that do n't get it . I 'm sure they 're wonderful bright people that operate at a different wavelength . But if you like it , you REALLY like it . Sarah play a self-infatuated loser named `` Sarah Silverman '' who often find her self in Homerian predicament ( that 's `` Homerian '' a in `` Homerian Simpsonian '' ) . I remember Sarah Silverman from her brief gig on Saturday Night Live in the early 90 's . I liked her immediately then and I go out of my way to check out anything she 's done . This show is choke-on-your-food-and-wet-your-pants funny . Therefore I always fast before watching it and wear adult diaper . Check it out !

Okay , so there is a front view of a Checker taxi , probably late 1930s model . It ha the great triangular shaped headlight . There also is a DeSoto cab in this black and white , character driven , almost a musical love gone wrong story . The real pleasure here is the look at 1940s room interior and fashion and hotel elevator . The hair style , male and female are gorgeous . If Dolly Parton had Victor Mature 's hair she could have made it big . There is an artist loft that would be the envy of every Andy Warhol wannabe . If you watch this expecting a great Casablanca storyline or Sound of Music oom-pah-pah , you will be disappointed . There is a nice little story beneath the runway model approach in this film . My copy on DVD with another movie for $ 1 wa very viewable . The title sequence wa cute but not up there with Mad , Mad , Mad , Mad World or The Pink Panther . This wa an RKO movie but it did not have the nice airplane logo that RKO used to use . I liked Victor Mature in One Million , B.C. , and Sampson and Delilah and especially in Violent Saturday . See if you can find that one . He wa wonderful in the comedy with Peter Sellers called Caccia Alla Volpe or After The Fox . Richard Carlson went on to do I Led Three Lives on TV in the early 1950s . Vic Mature wa offered the part of Sampson 's father in the remake of Sampson and Delilah . He supposedly wa asked if he would have any problem playing the part of the father since he wa so well known a Sampson . Victor replied , `` If the money is right , I 'll play Sampson 's mother . '' Tom Willett

The original Female Convict Scorpion is an all time masterpiece . The first sequel , Jailhouse 41 , wa not quite a good in my opinion , though it 's still notable for the fact that it took the idea from the original and created something in a completely different style . Director Shunya Ito ha managed to do the same thing again with this film ; the story is a bit different here , but still he 's managed to take what made the previous entry excellent and better than many film of this type and craft something fairly original around it . Again the action focus on Nami Matsushima ( a.k.a . `` Scorpion '' ) and this time she 's out of the jailhouse and not too keen on the idea of going back . After escaping from pursuing police officer , one thing lead to another and Scorpion find herself getting it together with a prostitute and her retarded brother . The prostitute end up getting impregnated by the retarded brother ( ... ) , while Scorpion is kidnapped and caged up by someone who she made an enemy out of in prison . But Scorpion doe n't like spending time behind bar and it 's not long before she 's back to doing what she doe best . The film get off to a great start a we see Scorpion hack the arm off a copper intent on taking her back to jail . From there , however , the film slows down a lot and Beast Stable end up being more of a drama than the previous two film . That 's not to say that there is n't still plenty of action - Scorpion still spends a lot of time in 'revenge mode ' and the film is n't exactly short on general sleaze . Meiko Kaji once again reprises her role a the sinister title character and it 's another understated , almost wordless performance . Her screen presence is great , however and she manages to have a menacing presence despite being only small physically . The plot structure for this film is similar to the other two in that it all build into a crescendo of revenge . There are more people who have angered Scorpion in this film than in the previous two so this section take up a fairly large part of the film . There 's a few surreal sequence , not a many a in the first film and nowhere near a in the second , but the film stay in with the rest of the series on that point . Overall , I would say this film is between the first two in term of quality - not a great a the original and slightly better than the second .

1 thing . this movie suck BIG TIME .. i wa into singaporean comedy when Chiken Rice war came along . But , this time , even Gurmit Singh ( well-done ) acting cant pull this one of . A total failure of following HK 's Shaolin Soccer . Next time : do ur own thing !

Everything is idyllic in Suburbia when the little family move in , a the father have got a new job in a computer company there . But no paradise would be complete without it snake . Strange thing happens a the family join the local country club without the husband , a it certainly hold secret . The father is not a joiner , but pressure is on him to join , a everyone who is anything in the neighborhood and at work are member . Robert Urich 's good guy part is a bit tepid , but Joanna Cassidy a good natured housewife turning nasty sizzle . Suspenseful and well-made chiller with a bitchy Susan Lucci a club chairperson . Look out for cult favorite Michael Berryman in a bit part a a valet . The movie capture the sense of paranoia and the special effect final is worth waiting for . I have seen this movie quite a few time .

Neil Simon 's THE ODD COUPLE set up a model for many of his later play . Felix Unger and Oscar Madison were the unsuitably paired roommate in the original , the former being picky and neat , the latter being slovenly and loose . Simon would rewrite ( le successfully ) the play in the 1990s a THE NEW ODD COUPLE , with female roommate . He made it a mixed couple ( a woman with her daughter , and a man ) in THE GOODBYE GIRLS . He also gave it an additional twist in 1973 with THE SUNSHINE BOYS , a Broadway hit starring Jack Alberson and Sam Levine a Al Lewis and Willie Clark , the aged , semi-retired Vaudevillians . Here the `` apartment '' problem is reduced to a teaming of two men who ca n't stand each other . The 1976 film starred Walter Matthau a Willie , and George Burns a Al . In actuality , Al probably doe not think totally badly of Willie - Willie is pathological on the subject of Al . First Al had little habit , such a accidentally spitting slightly when pronouncing word beginning with the letter `` t '' , and slightly jabbing Willie with his index finger , on stage . Secondly , Al retired when his wife died . Willie wa not ready to retire ( and ha been forcing his nephew and agent , Ben ( Richard Benjamin ) to try to get him job in commercial . But Willie ca n't remember line unless they are funny , and keep flubbing them . So he rarely is able to stay to the end of a rehearsal for a commercial . Ben is asked to get the two back together for a live scene of their most famous sketch on a television show about American Comedy . He doe bring Al to see Willie , and the spark begin flying , a neither can figure out what the other is doing ( and this is just in rehearsal . On top of that , Willie is insisting on change ( minor one , but they throw off Al ) such a saying `` ENTER ! ! ! '' when Al knock on the door . The initial rehearsal is a failure , but Ben manages to get them to the taping of the show . The question is if they will complete the scene in the finished program or will Willie wring Al 's neck ? The three lead , Matthau , Burns , and Benjamin , do very well with the one-liner , frequently reminiscent of vaudeville patter ( example : `` Chest pain ... I 'm getting chest pain Uncle Willie . Every Thursday I come here and get chest pain ! '' `` So , come on Fridays ! '' ) . Benjamin strives to prove his deep affection for his uncle , although Matthau 's rough outer shell make it difficult ( he only smooth down when he discus the glory day of vaudeville ) . Matthau ha a little better grasp on reality ( at first ) than Burns , who seems senile by his repeating himself - but in actuality Matthau 's sense of rejection by the world that once applauded him make him le willing to behave properly . Burns is not senile - he take thing slowly . But he seems far happier in accepting his retirement . I call this a final `` Voyage of Discovery '' for our modern Lewis and Clark . Al and Willie transcend their old skit , a they gradually end up realizing that they have more in common in their old age than they thought . Even the irascible Willie admits that Al may be ( to him ) a pain in the as , but he wa a funny man . Burns wa not the original choice for the part of `` Al Lewis '' ( supposedly Dale of the team Smith and Dale ) . Jack Benny wa . Benny probably would have done a good job , but ill-health forced him out ( he died in 1975 ) . Burns ( whose last involvement in any film wa in THE SOLID GOLD CADILLAC in 1956 a the narrator ) turned in such a fine performance that he got the `` Oscar '' for best supporting actor , and wa to have a career in movie in the next decade in such film a OH GOD ! ; OH GOD , YOU DEVIL ; and GOING IN STYLE . He died in 1996 age 100 , having proved that he wa more than just a brilliant straight man for his wife Gracie Allan .

This astonishing waste of production money is filmic proof that the rich and famous can be just a stupid and wasteful a politician . From a ( silly ) play by Tennessee Williams and directed ( with a dead hand ) by Joseph Losey and starring Taylor and Burton and Noel Coward - this project filmed in a spectacular cliff-top mountain island mansion in the Mediterranean must have seemed a sure fire winner when presented to Universal in 1967 . The result is so absurd and tedious that it almost defies belief . Visually the film is spectacular but that is the force of nature that ha allowed the setting and the fact that a real home is used instead of a set . The shrill antic of a screeching Taylor , Burton 's half asleep wandering , the loony dialog , Noel Coward laughing at himself , the ridiculous story and plot device and the absurd costuming simply irritate the viewer . BOOM is a disgrace , a waste of money and talent and clear proof that lauded famous people can be idiot just like the rest of the planet 's pleb . Not even fun . Just terrible and mad shocking waste .

This film is self indulgent rubbish . Watch this film if you merely want to hear spoken Gaelic or enjoy the pleasant soundtrack . Watch for any other reason and you will be disappointed . It should be charming but is n't - it 's just irritating . The character are difficult to care about and the acting is poor . The story within the film are also charmless and sinister . I wa expecting a heartwarming family film but this also held no appeal to my fourteen year old daughter . It is rarely that I can not see a film through to it conclusion but this one got the better of both of u . Although the film is set in current time it ha the look and feel of a cheap East European film made during the Cold War . There is n't even enough in the way of beautiful Scottish scenery and cinematography to redeem it . A real shame because a a film this is an embarrassment to Scotland .

A plot that is dumb beyond belief . However , that said , it must be admitted the lead actor go at their role a though it were Shakespeare . And that is a it should be . It is n't their fault the writer seems to be in a coma . Hats off to what is really a very cunning performance by Joanna Kerns . She prof that just because it is n't on the page doe n't mean a role ca n't be seized and dug into . And she doe so with gusto . Good for her . Ditto to Christine Elise who is called upon to be little more than confused and weepy , but go way beyond what is asked of her by the script . And to Grant Show a well . A graduate of daytime and prime time soap ( Ryan 's Hope , Melrose Place ) . He is always versatile and underrated . His primary drawback seems to be his impossible-to-ignore good look . He is a sturdy , well grounded actor capable of much more than he is generally given the opportunity to do . The rest of the cast is basically window dressing . The direction is adequate and the script , a I alluded to , is fairly idiotic . Watch this one to enjoy three good actor in the lead taking delight in performing some much needed scenery chewing . It 's fun .

Excellent movie in many aspect . Vicente Aranda ha succeeded in depicting the time ( 1830 ) with meticulous care . The light , the place , the feeling , are perfectly perceived from the very start of the movie . And along with it -in opposite to what happened to `` Mad Love '' ( Juana la Loca ) , a rather episodic historical movie- all of this beautiful photography/ music/ clothes is wrapping a very fluid screenplay that reach it climax in the only possible way . Concerning the actor , Paz Vega a Carmen is outstanding : liar , seductive , agressive , totally sexual , so beautiful Carmen . Sbaraglia is a little le convincing the audience about his instant mad love for Carmen , but he succeeds in conveying the proper tragic mood to the whole movie . I recommend it to everyone : the best spanish movie of the year .

As a premise , this backwoods version of the Dead Calm storyline had promise . However , director Eric Red 's inability to render a convincing hurricane lead to a deluge of continuity and lighting error . Ultimately , the viewer is more spellbound by the bizarre weather effect than the intended storyline . Intermittent spate of ham-fisted over-direction are similarly distracting . Charles Dance , doing an 'inbred backwoods hardass ' schtick , doe his best to save the movie . But ultimately , Undertow squeal like a pig ... and ha more ham to boot .

Mickey Rourke ( who wa once a famous movie star ) play Martin Fallon an IRA terrorist who accidentally blow up a school bus full of child who is so disgusted by his action decides to leave the IRA and go on the run in London ! ! ! ! MILD SPOILERS ! ! ! ! The movie 's opening is rather disturbing a the life of little child are ended in a fireball . Things like this happened throughout the 1970s and 1980s and into the 1990s in Northern Ireland which give A PRAYER FOR THE DYING a stark realism . However a soon a Fallon decides he 's going to give up violence ( What ? He 's a terrorist and he 's never blown up innocent passerby before ? ) realism disappears and clichés and ridiculous plot twist take place . Martin is employed by the London underworld ( Do n't they have their own hit men ? ) to commit a hit while he wear an IRA `` uniform `` ( Never knew the provo wore uniform ) at a cemetery in broad daylight ( Would n't an IRA man use a bomb placed under a car ? ) where he 's spotted by a priest who recognises him while he wa in the SAS . Hands up who think I 'm lying ? I 'm not and we 're half way through the running time and there 's still several clichés to come This all sound very silly and it is but what do you expect from a novel by Jack Higgins ? Everything is clichéd , contrived and stereotypical and the bit that are n't are just plain bizarre . The critic slaughtered this movie when it came out , most notably they stated that it might have some potential if the movie had Bob Hoskins playing gangster Jack Meehan and Alan Bates playing the SAS soldier turned priest and for once the critic would have been right . They should also noted the film might have been le dire if Fallon wa played by someone who wa capable of doing an Irish accent . Rourke might be hunky and macho ( Oh gawd another movie with an IRA uberhunk ) but accent are n't his strong point any more than character acting is . To give you an idea how disappointing PRAYER FOR THE DYING IS the director ended up disowning it which is always a bad sign As a footnote the original release of PRAYER FOR THE DYING in Britain wa delayed for several month because of `` The Enniskillen bombing `` . In November 1987 the Provisional IRA exploded a bomb in the centre of Enniskillen where a Remembrance Day parade which commemorates Britain 's war dead wa being held . Eleven ( 11 ) people were killed and score more injured . It wa n't an accident and no one left the IRA because of it

In the literal sense .... Reminds you of those `` cops-and-robber '' or cowboys-indians '' role-playing game you played with your 8 year old friend . Tedious and un-inspired , the storyline wa obviously written to make bad acting and dialogue seem a part of the plot , but all it doe is showcase it . I cant believe John Badham let his name be associated with this piece of crap . This could have been done better by a high school film buff who had been given the camera lighting , filmstock and editing Destined to be a time-filler on Sci-fi channel , when they 've overused everything else from their library , and barely better than the paid programming shill downstream .

Apparently , US Army boot camp , in the 80 's , involved several session of `` garden tool combat '' , including the pirouette spin of death . 5 . The folk at Aardman have done a cool , cute and wild adaptation of their short film of Wallace and Gromit to feature length , a the man and his dog , inventor who seem to have more of the intelligence ( or practicality ) for the latter . In this case they 've invented a machine that can capture all of the bunny that are eating up the crop all over a quiet English village . In particular for Mrs. Tottington ( or 'Totty ' for those who are 'intimate ' ) , much to the chagrin of Victor Quartermaine , who just want to kill all the rabbit with his trust rifle . Wallace and Gromit seem to have success with their machine , but Wallace ha a mix-up : a machine he 's made to make more food suddenly criss-crosses himself with a rabbit - the curse is on ! A lot of this is about a much light-hearted fun that a kid 's movie could ask for , but it also tip it hat to the oldest tradition in classic cartoon slapstick : Looney Tunes , which in turn is indebted to much silent comedy and vaudeville . Granted , the Aardman guy ( Nick Park and Steve Box ) have a bunch more gimmick and trick and ingenuity with their material . It 's never le than amazing to see how they put the stop motion to use , even when a joke or a gag might be a little on the funny `` ho-ho '' not funny `` ha-ha '' side ( a tired criticism but I 'll say it ) . Curse of the Were-Rabbit work so well on all front for the audience , in it warped story and sudden dip into exposition ( the Golden Bullet story is a doozy ) , Park and Box and company never lose sight of glee in the material . It 's fuzzy and warm-hearted and completely off-the-wall for the kid ( even the very youngest will love the adventure and strange gadget , such a the truck Wallace and Gromit drive around in ) , and for adult there 's little barb of funky , absurdist tone in the midst of a classic English farce . Only ( and I 'm probably a minority opinion here ) when compared to Chicken Run it 's almost a little slight a work- there 's le any plot than there is a series of running gag , and of course lot of pun involving bunny and monster and carnival and cheese ( and horrible men with ego in their gun like the Fiennes voiced Quartermaine ) . But when it strike best , it 's one of the most entertaining film of 2005 . It give me a big goofy smile anytime it 's on TV .

Another weak third-season entry , 'Is There In Truth No Beauty ? ' nonetheless ha at least one key plot element that is very different and a Spock would say , fascinating . The main character is an alien who must be carried around in a black box because his appearance is so horrendous that it drive human insane . It 's too bad the episode can not live up to this incredible premise . Obviously , I think , it wa a mistake to ever 'show ' the alien , a it actual visage in no way even approximates such a daunting build-up ; all we get is the standard Star Trek psychedelic light display used for any number of thing in different episode , usually when the ship is passing through a magnetic storm or something similar . In any event , Kollos ' appearance can at least be tolerated by Mr. Spock , and then only if Spock is wearing a special visor . ( For the longest time , I thought the alien 's name wa 'Carlos , ' which I found humorous , but I digress . ) Spock is required to mind-meld with Kollos at one point so that the alien can pilot the Enterprise back to safety . This is accomplished , but when Spock/Kollos go back to end the mind-meld , by golly , Spock forgets his visor . Uh oh . He go crazy but eventually recovers with the help of Kollos ' assistant , a blind woman with psychic power . This might have been a really bizarre , excellent episode but it is poorly directed and come across a yet one more badly executed show of the series ' last season .

A new guard in in the armored truck gig is recruited by his co-worker to steal 42 million from the truck . No bad guy , so no one will get hurt , right ? Of course thing go wrong and the new guard decides to have a conscience and make thing right by saving the life of a dying man . I 'll admit that I did n't really have any interest in this film , but I did n't have any interest in Fantastic Mr Fox either , and that film made my top ten of the year . Armored is even more of a disappointment then I thought it would be . As a heist film , it fails to deliver the good , it 's boring and full of plot hole and leap in logic that one will hurt themselves thinking about it . Despite this the film somehow ha a really great cast , but the film doe n't even use this to it 's advantage . Everyone seems wasted in wooden character that make stupid choice . Columbus Short is an uninteresting lead that is never charismatic and never make the audience want to give a crap . Matt Dillon is the mastermind behind the heist and he play Mr. Nice Guy at first , then when thing do n't go his way he quickly becomes the villain . The rest of the impressive cast include Lawrence Fisburn , Jean Reno , Skeet Ulrich , Fred Ward , Amaury Nolasco from Prison Break and Milo Ventimiglia from Heros . Non of them do much and when they actually do something , it 's without much reasoning behind it . The film is relatively short , but even with it 's running time under 90 minute , it felt dragged out . How long can you make a movie about a guy trapped somewhere ? Phonebooth did a decent job and it wa even more restricted . The leap of logic concerning the plot here are tragic . 42 million and all the security they have are check in every hour or so ? The entire plan from my understanding wa to drive the truck into an abandoned warehouse and hide the money . Pretend to get hit and burn the truck . They would then walk away with the money . Of course something go wrong , or there would be no movie right ? Through a series of unfortunate event out so called hero ha trapped himself inside the truck with an injured officer . The rest of the movie is Dillion and his crew banging on the door to get in . How very exciting . The script call for our hero to have financial problem , he might lose his house , which would in turn make him lose his brother . You see , both their parent died and it 's just the two of them looking out for each other . So now he ha a reason to join the heist . At first he did n't want in , but his money problem is just the right push to throw him in the thick of thing . How convenient . Armored 's whole spin on the heist genre is that it 's from an armored truck , from the guy who drive it . After that basic premise , the film fall flat on it 's face . I found myself wanting it to end sooner and sooner each time someone spoke . Speaking of the ending , it suck . Skip it .

For a really wonderful movie , you could also try seeing the movie about Saint Francis of Assisi - good for any audience . And what 's the point if you can belief anything in a TV story ? Talk about dumbing down , I thought this Hallmark-made movie wa pathetic , & I can see why others hate Hollywood . I do n't , just some of these corporate profit grubbers . You do n't have to be any kind of religious to benefit from `` Jesus of Nazareth '' , but for this waste of celluloid you need to be bored , with nothing to do , dumbed-down & religious . And for a real movie experience , try `` Short Cut to Nirvana '' , a very highly rated film .

This show wa not only great human drama but portrayed racism in this country in a raw , all too true to life manner . When one show can be so witty and entertaining and yet so poignant and educational all at once , this is television in it highest form . The acting wa phenomenal . The writing wa exceptional . Not only did the show portray race relation in a straightforward manner that seems unmatched by any other television series , but it ability to depict this subject matter a it existed in the 1960 's alongside how it exists in the beginning of the twenty-first century powerfully demonstrates the way we have changed , and sadly , the many more way we have not .

A young couple -- father Ben ( solid Charles Bateman ) , wife Nicky ( the lovely Ahna Capri ) and their daughter KT ( the cute Geri Reischl of `` I Dismember Mama '' fame ) -- find themselves trapped in a small California desert town populated by hysterical lunatic . Worse yet , there 's a pernicious Satanic cult that 's been abducting little child for their own diabolical purpose . Director Bernard McEveety , working from an offbeat and inspired script by William Welch and L.Q . Jones ( `` Devil Times Five '' director Sean MacGregor came up with the bizarre story ) , relates the compellingly oddball plot at a slow , yet steady pace and ably creates a creepy , edgy , mysterious ooga-booga atmosphere . Strother Martin delivers a wonderfully wicked and robust performance a Doc Duncan , who 's the gleefully sinister leader of the evil sect . The top-rate cast of excellent character actor qualifies a a substantial asset : Jones a gruff , no-nonsense Sheriff Hillsboro , Alvy Moore a friendly local Toby , and Charles Robinson a a shrewd , fiercely devout priest Jack . John Arthur Morrill 's bright , polished widescreen cinematography , Jamie Mendoza-Nava 's spooky score , and the wild , rousing climactic black mass ritual are all likewise up to speed . The idea of having toy come to murderous life is simply ingenious ( the opening scene with a toy tank coming real and crushing a family in their car is truly jolting ) . Nice eerily ambiguous ending , too . A pleasingly idiosyncratic and under-appreciated winner .

I wa at the same screenwriter conference and saw the movie . I thought the writer - Sue Smith - very clearly summarised what the film wa about . However , the movie really did n't need explanation . I thought the theme were abundantly clear , and inspiring . A movie which deal with the the ability to dare , to face fear - especially fear passed down from parental figure - and overcome it and , in doing so , embrace life 's possibility , is a film to be treasured and savoured . I enjoyed it much more than the much-hyped 'Somersault . ' I also think Mandy62 wa a bit unkind to Hugo Weaving . As a bloke about his vintage , I should look so good ! I agree that many Australian film have been lacklustre recently , but 'Peaches ' delivers the good . I 'm glad I saw it .

From the very opening scene you will notice just how hard they tried to mimic the very smart and powerful 'Cruel Intentions ' , and how flat it landed . You 'll also notice what a terrible choice they made by casting Robin Dunne a Valmont ... Then in the second scene , you meet the two best thing in this movie , Amy Adams and Mimi Rogers a Kathryn and her mother . That is , if you can get past the fact that Kathryn wa n't blonde in the first film ... Then the movie go on , you see the cheap romantic story from mile ago , and you notice Sebastian ha already met an Anette in the past , here called Danielle , and a Cecile , here called Cherie ... How original is that for a prequel . Then it turn into a low budget 'Wild Things ' type of film with lot and lot of oh-my `` twist '' . As I mentioned , Robin Dunne wa a very bad choice . Not that he is a bad actor , he 's good .. He just doe n't have the charisma Ryan did . Amy Adams , who is in my opinion one of the most talented young actress of our time , once again delivers . But with all the talent in the world , there is no way one could save this trash . As a whole , this `` movie '' feel like a 'Beverly Hills , 90210 ' episode . The score ha been stolen from 'Cruel Intentions ' and 'Jawbreaker ' ... Yes , they used the score from JAWBREAKER ... Could n't they at least leave that one alone ? ! You 'll want to pas this one . If you want more Cruel Intentions , watch Stephen Frears ' Dangerous Liaisons .

`` The Chipmunk Adventure '' is one of the greatest animated movie of the 1980 's . Alvin and the Chipmunks have always been of some interest to me , since they were what really got me into rock and roll . Neither one of the Chipmunks ha any bad trait . Alvin 's really the star and ha all the cool look . Theodore is the lovable sensitive one . Then there 's Simon ( my personal favorite ) , the smart one who is often a party pooper . I also like the Chipettes a lot . There 's Brittany , who , like Alvin , is one who is always trying to be so popular . Then there 's Eleanor , who , like Theodore , is sweet , sensitive , and love food . Janette is the only Chipette who is not much like her counterpart ; she 's very naive and really clumsy . In the Chipmunks ' very first full-length movie , David Seville is going on a business trip to Europe , and he 's leaving the boy with Miss Miller while he 's gone . While playing an arcade game , Alvin loses against Brittany and then say that if he had the money , he 'd race Brittany around the world for real . Unbeknownest to the kid , a man named Klaus Furschtien and his sister , Claudia , who have been trying to come up with a sneaky way to deliver diamond around the world in exchange for cash , overheard this conversation and said that they 'd let them race around the world for $ 100,000 . Alvin and Brittany accept it and go on the race . This adventurous movie ha a lot of great song . `` Off to See the World '' made for an appropriate theme song for the movie . Then there is `` Getting Lucky '' , one of my favorite song in the movie . `` My Mother '' is most likely the sappiest song in the movie , but it always make me cry . `` Wooly Bully '' is the only cover song used in the movie ( the rest were completely original ) . Then , of course , there 's `` The Boys and Girls of Rock and Roll '' , which , in my opinion , ha to be one of the greatest musical number in movie history . I used to watch this movie very often , until my recorded tape of it died . I still watch the movie , though . This is actually a fun movie for people who are about to go on a vacation to a foreign country for the first time . It 'll give you an idea of what kind of stuff you 'd expect out of world travel . Definitely one of my childhood movie , and one that I 'd recommend to 80 's fan and Alvin & the Chipmunks fan .

If you can watch a Bond film from 1983 that is n't a good a Octopussy and still enjoy it . If you can accept production value which are n't that much above the level of a TV movie . If you can look at Sean Connery with wrinkle on his forehead beneath an obvious toupée and still see James Bond . If you can get past an inexperienced Basinger , a weaker Largo and a jolly Q . If you can learn to love an idiosyncratic score , not up there with Barry on his worst day . If you do n't believe the hyperbolic review that it wa greeted with on release . If you can meet a poker battle and a video game face off and enjoy them both the same . Yours is Never Say Never Again and everything that 's in it . And , what is more , you 'll probably enjoy it , my son !

Clark fight to find the truth about his own personality and origin . `` Labyrinth '' is undoubtedly the most intriguing episode of `` Smallville '' . The writer wa very luck and original denying the whole existence of the powerful boy from Krypton . The annoying hum give the sensation of disturbance and the identity mysterious saver need to be clarified . My vote is nine . Title ( Brazil ) : `` Labirinto '' ( `` Labyrinth '' )

This wa allocated to the fan a the `` winner take all '' match occurred between two separate `` company '' ( the World Wrestling Federation and the `` Alliance '' : an amalgamation of former WCW and ECW superstar . The remaining match are just revolting : Edge versus Test : potent `` big boot '' by Test , but this did not display the true talent of both star Al Snow Versus Christian : good match but superflous to the pay-per-view Taji versus William Regal : the worst match of the night Immunity Battle Royal : This wa an outstandingly fun match to watch , but because the main star of both company were involved in the main event , only a wrestler who characteristically appears on `` Heat '' and is probably a WCW light-heavyweight reject ( i.e . the Hurricane who is merely hired a an entertainer ) Hardy Boyz Versus Dudley Boyz : The best match of the night : Jeff Hardy executed a `` Swanton Bomb '' from the summit of a cage and through a wooden table and Matt wa wedged into the cage , which appeared to be extremely painful . Because Stone Cold wa the WWF champion , Rob Van Dam wa the Hardcore Champion , and Kurt Angle wa a `` mole '' in the alliance , all fundamental star in the main event on the faction of `` the Alliance '' were granted work after the match 's outcome , except for Booker T. , who recently attacked a wrestler on `` Raw '' and will inevitably be given work . Shane McMahon will return to television somehow , and everyone desired to witness the downfall and demise of `` the Alliance '' to see Stone Cold out of work . The WWF ha done much better . A match in which all tiltes were brought to one faction would have been better , and what ever became of Casket and Iron Man match ?
