Che : Part One wa a fascinating experiment , which did not only tell a very interesting story , but it also tried to do something different with the `` biopic '' genre.Che : Part Two is the excellent culmination of this experiment . This movie offer all of the same attribute from the first one , from the extraordinary performance ( specially from Benicio del Toro ) to Steven Soderbergh 's brilliant direction , without forgetting it intention of breaking with the conventional rule from the biopics.That is what I admire from Soderbergh 's experiment ... they always try to do something different and unusual , and they succeed most of the time . The final message from this film is perfect , and it includes everything we have been told about Che Guervara 's life.The only fail I found on Che : Part Two is that a few part felt a bit irrelevant . In summary , I give Che : Part Two a very enthusiastic recommendation because , a the first one , it is a brave and fascinating experiment which challenge the spectator and leaf u thinking .

As much a I dislike saying 'me too ' in response to other comment - it 's completely true that the first 30 minute of this film have nothing whatsoever to do with the endless dirge that comprises the following 90 . Having been banned somewhere doe n't make a film watchable . Just because it doe n't resemble a Hollywood product doe not make it credible . Worse yet , in addition to no discernible plot ( other than there are lot of muddy place in Russia and many people , even very old woman , drink lot of vodka ) a number of visuals are so unnecessarily nauseating I 'm in to my second package of Rolaids . As for spoiler - well , the film is so devoid of any narrative thread I could n't write one if I tried . Do n't waste your time or money , and do n't confuse this with good Russian cinema .

Before seeing this , I wa merely expecting another mediocre soft core copy of the much imitated `` Emmanuelle '' series starring Sylvia Kristel . It wa really surprising how good this one turned out to be . It actually ha a story , and it is very romantic indeed . What make 'Yellow Emanuelle ' so good is it 's leading heroine , the beautiful and exotic Chai Lee . She play her character , Emy Wong so sweetly , that the viewer just ha to feel something for her when her dream crash down around her . Emy Wong is a much-respected doctor , statuesque , with a regal quality . She come from an important old family , where ancient custom are still practiced . Emy will remain a virgin until she is married , to a man she ha never met . The beautiful doctor seems OK with this arranged marriage . It is simply how it is done in her world . However she doe not plan on meeting and falling in love with the British pilot who end up under her care in the hospital where she work . Emy decides to do away with custom , and she give herself to her Western man . But only after a very long courtship , a Doctor Wong is anything but an easy woman . Her pilot , George , is a good guy , and promise to marry Emy , so that she doe n't lose her respectability and place in her rigid society . Neither one count on a third party , one Ilona Staller , who destroys their relationship through a series of vicious game . Emy is made to believe that she ha been abandoned by her man , that he only played a game with her in order to sleep with her . Her place in society is gone , she ha been debased . The film take a surprisingly dramatic and depressing turn a this proud , elegant woman give up her career , a well a a sweet relationship with her caring father , and succumbs to a life of drinking and prostitution . I wa surprised to find myself so engrossed in this operatically tragic tale . I wa on the edge of my seat when George blow back into town , and unknowingly walk into a hotel where his beautiful Emy is working a a prostitute ! Classic drama . I imagine many viewer were a bit frustrated by all this drama . One would expect lot of sex and nudity here , but there is not much . And when there is , it is totally non-exploitative , and very artsy and soft-core . If you are a fan of the first Emmanuelle , with Sylvia Kristel , than you most likely will appreciate this , lesser known classic . I wa especially impressed by the extra attention to detail . The whole segment where Emy take George to her father house on the island is really nice . Her father show George , and the viewer his impressive collection of Bonzai tree . He ha a whole miniature forest built out of these amazing tree . Totally unexpected . After catching it on late night cable TV year ago , I spent much time searching the internet for a copy of the film . When i finally got it i found that the video version wa longer . More sex ? No , more melodrama . For the DVD release there is a subplot about George suddenly keeling over with some unknown deadly disease ! I actually preferred the cable version better . I am glad that this rare gem ha been released finally on DVD . I must also mention the beautiful cinematography and the bizarre and catchy 70 's soundtrack . While watching this one you just get the feeling that you are watching something very rare , and quite special . I recommend it to thoughtful viewer who do n't need sex and violence to maintain their interest .

Wonderful romance comedy drama about an Italian widow ( Cher ) who 's planning to marry a man she 's comfortable with ( Danny Aiello ) until she fall for his headstrong , angry brother ( Nicholas Cage ) . The script is sharp with plenty of great line , the acting is wonderful , the accent ( I 've been told ) are letter perfect and the cinematography is beautiful . New York ha never looked so good on the screen . A must-see primarily for Cher and Olympia Dukakis -- they 're both fantastic and richly deserved the Oscars they got . A beautiful , funny film . A must see !

* * * SPOILERS * * * * * * SPOILERS * * * Released in 1956 , and considered quite racy at the time , Douglas Sirk 's over the top candy colored melodrama is still a wonderful thing . The plot concern the going on in an oil rich dysfunctional Texas family that includes big brother Kyle , who is insecure , weak , wounded & very alcoholic , played by Robert Stack in a very touching & vulneable performance and his sluty sister Marylee played in an extreme manner by Dorothy Malone . Ms. Malone 's performance is telegraphed to u via her eye , which she us to show u her emotion , which mostly consist of lust ( for Rock Hudson ) and jealousy ( for Lauren Bacall ) . Malone is the only actress I 've ever seen in movie who enters a room eye first . Now do n't get me wrong , her performance to say the least is an absolute hoot , and is one of the supreme camp acting job of the 1950 's . But it is also terrible , because a likeable and attractive a Malone is , she 's not a very good actress , and she 's not capable of subtly or shading . Her performace is of one note . She doe get to do a wicked Mambo , and in a great montage , a unloving daddy played by the always good Robert Keith fall to his death climbing a staircase , Sirk mix it up with an almost mad Malone doing a orgasmic dance a she undress . Stack , ( who should have won an Oscar ) & Malone , ( who won the award , but should n't have ) are the real star of the film , the one who set all the hysteria , both sexual & otherwise in motion , while the `` real star '' of the film , Hudson & Bacall fade to grey & brown , which are the color that they are mainly costumed in . Hudson who wa a better actor then given credit for play the childhood & best friend of Stack 's , and the stalked love interest of Malone 's who moan & groan over Rock through most of the film . But Hudson want no part of her , and instead is in love with Bacall who is married to Stack . No one is very happy & no one is happy for very long . The Stack-Bacall marriage fall apart big time after a year , and Stack pretty much drink himself into oblivion because he think he is sterile , and ca n't give Bacall a baby to prove that he 's a man . Sirk who wa a very intelligent man , and had a long & fascinating career both in film and theatre in Germany , ended his Hollywood career at Universal in the mid 1950 's with a series of intense vividly colored `` woman 's movie '' or melodrama . Although they were mainly adapted from medicore or trashy source material , in Sirk 's hand they became masterpiece of the genre . Sirk had a wonderful sense of color & design which he brought to play in these film filling his wide screen space with character who played out their emotional life among weird color combination & lighting , make believe shadow , and lot of mirroed reflection . In `` Written '' the character are always peeking out of window , listening at door or sneaking around . So in the end , after much violence , an accidental murder , a miscarriage & more Sirk end the movie with a final & startling scene of a `` reborn '' and reformed Malone in a man-tailored suit , sitting at a desk foundling a miniature oilwell .

An interesting movie with Jordana Brewster a a young woman who travel to Europe in an attempt to find out what became of her older sister ( Cameron Diaz ) who mysteriously died year earlier . Brewster is very good and keep you involved despite some unrealistic plotting , such a having her amazinly find and start a romance with her dead sister 's much older boyfriend ( Christopher Eccleston ) . Still , mostly good . GRADE : B

[ I saw this movie once late on a public tv station , so I do n't know if it 's on video or not . ] This is one of the `` Baby Burlesks '' ( sic ) that Shirley Temple did in the early 1930s . It is hard to believe that anyone would let their daughter be in this racy little film which today might just be considered this side of `` kiddie porn '' . Shirley Temple star in a cast which probably ha an average age of 5 . They are all in diaper , and are in a saloon which serf milk instead of alcohol . The `` cash '' is in the form of lollipop . Shirley playing a `` femme fatale '' sashay up to the bar and talk to soldier who make suggestive comment about her ( ! ) . But Shirley doe n't need really their lollipops/cash because her purse is full of one from other `` men '' . Meanwhile a little black boy doe a suggestive dance on a nearby table ( ! ) . What a strange film . . . infant using racy dialogue playing adult role in a saloon . Who thought up this stuff any way ?

Duck_of_Death need to watch this film again , a his major criticism is completely baseless . The film never once forgot about the time delay , and it wa mentioned explicitly in a couple of place . The crew were never shown having conversation with mission control that did n't obey the time delay rule . One thing I did think wa a bit far-fetched wa the amount of risk involved - would a crew land on a planet on which pressure suit would only last two hour ? I doubt it . Would a manned space ship go into a star 's corona ? I doubt it . Would human land on a moon that wa being bombarded with huge amount of radiation ? I doubt it . Also , the ship seemed overly sturdy . Would a ship designed like that risk atmospheric flight to slow it down ? I doubt it . Would it survive being hit by comet debris ? I doubt it . I think in both case the stress on the structure would be too much . But all-in-all , the unlikely scenario were compensated by some nicely done special effect , good editing and production , and some good acting , especially by the actor portraying the ship 's commander and the Russian cosmonaut .

I do n't remember this film getting a cinema release over here . I only saw it when it came onto cable . The film deal with the dehumanisation of child into killing machine . Specifically one person , the way he get replaced and dumped ( literally ) into an off-world community where he find himself unable to cope with coming to term with who he really is and what he feel . Seems to me that a lot of people expected this to be Rambo in space , and would have been happy if it wa . I 'm certainly happy it was'nt - Kurt doe a fine job of portraying an emotional cripple . The scene where he 's sitting outside the compound show this , albeit the decision for two slow-mo replay detracts from the moment . This is not a classic SF movie in the way that Bladerunner , Alien , Silent running , Logan 's run or THX1138 were , however it is unfortunately the nearest I 've seen to it in a long time . He change in the movie to a believable degree , he does'nt crack Arnie one liner , he does'nt become Snake Plissken and there is no definative happy ending . That 's why this film did'nt do well . It did'nt follow formula , and among a 18-25 year old target American audience , that 's unforgivable a it wa was'nt what they expected to see . Fear and discipline . Always .

However , the lady of all age will lap it up , no doubt ; at least the opposite sex understand what it is to be a mother , and most of u men try to fathom out what it is to be a father . Whether changing nappy is not at all my favourite occupation and trying to get those bottled baby-foodstuffs into errant toothless mouth must rank very high on household duty preferably left to it mother , ha absolutely nothing to do with the matter . Some good interpretation here , and a good story idea ; the handling of the matter , limited to rather scanty TV-production concept , give the film a rather over-mellowy taste with not much new to offer . An insipid way of delivering the good , and in the end the outcome is so forseeable during the last 20 minute or so , even my wife dozed off , and I wa jumping up to the computer to get the on-line scoring in the Barcelona-Deportivo match , hoping the away team would do something rather good . They did . This film did not . Better by far is Mike Leigh 's magnificent `` Secrets and Lies '' ( qv ) which touch on the same subject matter , but with Brenda Blethyn playing a far superior part .

This movie is not very good.In fact , it is the worst Elvis movie I have seen.It ha very little plot , mostly partying , beer drinking and fighting . Burgess Meredith and Thomas Gomez are wasted . I do n't know why they did this movie.You could say Elvis wa wasted a well , he is much , much better in `` Follow That Dream . ''

This wa the worst movie I 've ever seen , yet it wa also the best movie . Sci Fi original movie 's are supposed to be bad , that 's what make them fun ! The line , `` I like my dinosaur meat well done ! '' is probably the best quote ever ! Also , the plot sound like something out of a pot induced dream . I can imagine it now , the writer waking up after a long night of getting high and playing dance dance revolution , then putting idea together for this : Space marine got to alien planet , which is infested with dinosaur and ha medieval house in it , to protect a science team studying the planet . Best idea ever ! In fact , in fit the complete Sci Fi original movie checklist : gun dinosaur medieval time space travel terrible acting So go watch this movie , but do n't buy it .

A very hyped-up , slick , edgy reinterpretation . They 've fallen into the `` because it 's modern , it ha to be hyped-up , slick , etc . '' trap . `` Romeo and Juliet '' carried this idea off much more successfully , but I really think it 's time we move beyond the two extreme here ( period piece vs. edgy film ) . Just because this is a `` modern '' retelling , doe n't mean the movie ha to look like a magazine ad , or have anything to do with drug or gun . If the trapping were a subtle a the honeyed word , Macbeth would be a far more powerful film . As it is , read your Shakespeare . Read it out loud . Ask your Oxford dictionary some question . Skip the film . Or do n't , but you 've been warned . Sorry for the super-long review . IMDb made me do it .

I had heard interesting critic on this movie . I believed it wa a love story but I wa n't sure what wa the plot about . So , when I finally saw it , I found myself in the middle of a love relationship between the ex-con Isabel ( Isabel Ampudia ) and the junkie Rufo ( Sebastián Haro ) . So , a love story but not probably what I wa expecting . The movie is focused on Isabel , a she struggle to get back into society . She doe n't want to return back to her neighborhood and she find herself without a home or anywhere to go . So , while she just experience those first hour of freedom after being released from jail she came across Rufo , an old acquittance of her which while she wa in had become a junkie and life on the street . Not having where to go , and without money or feasible source of income , she decides to join Rufo on his residence : a covered area on a lonely street . The story by itself is moving . It explains how the , impossible , relationship between Isabel and Rufo get deeper until the the almost final twist of the movie . Definitely , the movie is worth watching . Sebastián Haro is splendid in his role of the junkie . A person being able of both being an innocent and tender giving person and a ruthless street scum . Just depending whom deal him with . I believe his role . On the other hand , I do n't quite believe the role of Isabel Ampudia . Although the movie try to show the bitterness inside her through several scene , she is not capable to make me believe it . She is in a way too sweet and too honest for which might be expected of somebody on the same situation . The movie try to show a love on a desperate situation . It is a enjoyable movie . But the feeling I get when the movie end is that Isabel , with the way of thinking and acting she ha , would never have arrived to that situation . Her role , partly because of the script , partly because of the acting is difficult to believe . I specially like the ending , and because of it I have raised my rating one or two point . I liked it bittersweetness and the fact of showing that sometimes , survival instinct is above other more spiritual consideration a love . Summarizing , an interesting movie , but it lacked some punch to be a total `` must see '' .

I bought this video on a throw-out table at the video store expecting a good cast in what wa touted a an award-winning Brit sex comedy . I guess I should have read the finer print . I rarely write a panning review , but here go . These actor in gay role really play game with your memory of a lot of far more worthy film . This comedy wa a very cruel joke at the expense of the actor , the theatre-going public and of all the nice film that have contributed to their reputation . I repeat : is the joke about trashing the actor ' other highly respectable on-screen persona with this scurrilously trashy flick ? Can the reference to the Austen classic 'Pride and Prejudice ' and 'Sense and Sensibility ' be anything else ? How much of a political statement wa it to produce this melodrama using these star ? Are we meant to simply take it a a lay-down misere that all actor are gay and thus letting their on-screen roleplay affect our lifestyle is accepting their private homosexual dealing in our face , too ? I 'm sorry , but I do n't think so . I say NO to this one .

First of all , nothing will ever compare to the original movie , but for gosh sake , they 're not trying to . It is just one person opinion about what could have happened after Rhett left Scarlett at Tara . I for one thought it wa a terrific movie and would like to add it to my GWTW collection . The scenery alone would make me want to watch the movie . Just view this movie a an extension of the original and do n't think they are trying to replace Vivian Leigh and Clark Cable and you will enjoy it a lot . They really captured the spoiled selfishness of Scarlett in many of the scene and you can see from the longing in the look from Rhett that he is clearly still in love with Scarlett . The fact that you can recognize many of the actor in the movie is another plus even though some of them have only been seen on TV . I always wanted them to have other child after Bonnie Blue died in the movie and this satisfied my need perfectly . Lore60

I do n't hand out ten star rating easily . A movie really ha to impress me , and The Bourne Ultimatum ha gone far beyond that . Furthermore , this trilogy ha come together so nicely , that I believe it to be one of the greatest motion picture trilogy of our time . Though all three film could not be any more different from the Ludlum novel , they still stand a a powerful landmark in cinematic achievement . The Bourne Ultimatum made me want to cry that the series wa complete , yet I could not even attempt to stop smiling for hour . From the moment that the opening title appeared , I knew we were in for a ride . Paul Greengrass ha done it again . Everything we love from the previous Bourne film is here once again : the action , the dialogue , and of course the shaky camera . However for me , that last one wa never a problem . I think it add to the suspense . I will be back to see this film several time before it is released on DVD , simply because it is genius . It is a perfectly satisfying conclusion , and should stand the test of time a a fantastic movie , and altogether , an unforgettable trilogy .

Seriously , I don´t really get why people here are bashing it . I mean , the idea of a killer snowman wreaking havoc on a tropical island paradise is pretty absurd . The good news is , the producer realized it and made it a comedy in the vein of Army of Darkness . Especially in the second half of the film , when the little killer snowball attack , I laughed my as off . For example , the put one of the little creep into a blender ( a la Gremlins 1 ) and mix it . After that , it morphs back into a snowball and squeal with a high pitched voice `` That wa fun ! '' . Bottom line - incredible movie , rent it .

It 's been a while since I 've watched this movie , and the series , but now I 'm refreshing my memory ! This wa a very funny movie based on the classic series ! Johnny Knoxville and Seann William Scott were hilarious together . Bo and Luke Duke help Uncle Jesse run Moonshine in the General Lee . When Boss Hogg force the Dukes off their farm , Bo and Luke sneak around Hogg 's local construction site and find sample of coal . They soon realize that Boss Hogg is gon na strip-mine Hazzard County , unless the Dukes can stop him , with the help of their beautiful cousin , Daisy . My only two problem with the movie wa that Burt Reynolds wa n't right for the part of Boss Hogg , and Sheriff Rosco P. Coltrane wa way too serious . Other than that , I highly recommend THE DUKES OF HAZZARD ! ! !

I had never heard of this movie , but I like Heath Ledger and Bryan Brown and the story sounded interesting , so I figured I 'd give it a shot . I found it to be very enjoyable . Heath Ledger play a 19 year old who work a kind of crappy job and want to start making some serious dough , so he go and asks for work from mobster Bryan Brown . I wo n't go into detail but thing go very bad for Ledger and get into big trouble with Bryan Brown . From their on the movie just get better and better , with one scene involving Ledger hooking up with a pair of bank robber . And let not forget the beautiful Rose Byrne , who play Ledger 's love interest . I would definitely recommend this movie .

Teamo Supremo are three kid , consisting of their leader- Captain Crandall , Rope Girl and Skate Lad , all with their own battlecry ( buza ! chika ! woopa ! ) and outfit and move . They work for the governor , Kevin , and were recruited after wishing to be hero and playing at that game . They lead normal life a well , and have family and school duty , but most of the action take place away from school fighting villain . The villain all have rather unique and singular trait , such a Mister Vague and his men who never seem to know what their plan are but act anyway . From an evil robot to a wicked baron the three have to encounter them and stop their evil , and often strange , plan to gain power , take revenge etc . The animation itself is quite nice and smooth , but the style appears to be simple on purpose . The background have overlapping colour and the building seem futuristic . The music is quite nice , and the show is n't too bad altogether , although the style is n't my favourite . The plot are almost always nonsensical and ridiculous , but after all this is a cartoon and one ca n't blame them for that . However this would not be in the same rank a Fillmore ! or Pepper Ann .

I can not believe how popular this show is . I consider myself an avid sci-fi fan . I have read countless sci-fi novel and have enjoyed many sci-fi movie and TV show . I really would n't even consider this true sci-fi . Every episode I have sat through wa like a lame , watered down version of a Star Trek episode , minus anything that might make it interesting or exciting . It 's basically a bunch of people standing around in ARMY fatigue , talking about something boring , who occasionally go through the Stargate and end up on a planet that look just like Earth , with people who look and sound just like Humans ! It seemed extremely low budget . The character are all forgettable one dimensional cutout , and the many attempt at humor fall flat . It reminds me when you see a commercial with a famous athlete in it , trying to be funny , but he is not . It is just sad . The movie wa terrible a well . There is so much you can do with a portal through space , yet every place the ARMY people go is BORING ! This show no imagination ! I actually thought the TV series `` Alien Nation '' from a few year back ( based on the movie Alien Nation ) wa much better . That show actually had good story line and decent character . I wa n't crazy about `` Alien Nation '' , but compared to this overrated crap , it wa great ! Also , unlike the great new `` Battlestar Galactica '' series , `` Stargate '' copied the look and feel of the lame movie too closely ! They should have at least updated the cheesy `` toilet flushing '' special effect of whenever somebody go through the Stargate .

After 10 viewing in 20 year I too think this wa the Crazy Gang 's best effort on film , with more cohesion in the plot than their next best , `` Alf 's Button Afloat '' . They were indeed a crazy trio of double act thrown together mainly on stage , sometimes in front of royalty , until Chesney Allen retired in the '40 's through `` ill-health '' . He outlived them all by year . Apparently they were just a mad outside `` work '' , regularly playing practical joke on one another . The Six Wonder Boys troupe head for I'll-Get-Her-To-Tell-Me ( Alaska ) to dig for the gold that wa being found there . It seemed a better idea than going to Mansfield ... because they 'd been there . When they get to Red Gulch they find their information wa a mere 40 year out of date - they thought that the chip that were in the guilty newspaper they 'd read tasted funny . But by then it doe n't matter a they 've all fallen in love with Snow White and want to help her grandad find his long lost stash of gold . Baddie Bill `` M '' McGrew want it himself however . The number of verbal and visual pun is astonishing , but most of them will probably only make sense ( ? ) to Brits and ex-pats interested in seeing '30 's British b & w comedy . Imho nearly all of the gag and routine work , including the Gold If patter between Bud & Chesney and the `` Whistle While You Work '' pastiche - even the `` Always Getting Our Man '' Mountie insert . A marvellous little film , in a rather tired looking condition but utterly recommended .

If like me , you enjoyed the first film `` Bruce Almighty '' , my advice to you is not to get your hope up too high ; in fact disregard any hope you posse for this movie if you are above the age of 12 and have any film-sense at all . Without giving too much away , the story see Evan ( Bruce 's nemesis co-anchor from the first film ) move home with his family to the Virginian suburb to `` Change the World '' with a new political path . What follows is a rather far-fetched and quite 'silly ' storyline , which is obviously set out to target young child a the main target audience . Unlike it 's predecessor , Evan Almighty is a family orientated film with the ambiguous genre of 'comedy ' tagged upon it 's misleading position of 'sequel ' to which some would regard a modern-day comedy classic that can be enjoyed by a slightly more mature , upscale audience . Generally speaking , Evan Almighty comprises itself of terrible cinematic value . The acting ; omit Steve Carell and Morgan Freeman , wa rigid and many of the character were seemingly thrown in to use up the unnecessarily large budget issued for the production . Additionally , the cast includes acting legend John Goodman who make an appearance a a heel and is seen just a few time in the movie 's entirety ; I did n't quite buy the character though and thought the storyline from which he wa involved in lacked depth even for a family comedy . Every other character in the movie ( especially the wife and kid ! ) deserve a mention for their acting so cheesy it could fill a king-size Kiev . Be warned though ; it is the typical Americanized cheddarfest associated with many mainstream family-orientated film , so I 'd advise you defend yourself with the nearest grater in sight . It may seem the movie is worthless thus-far , however , it doe have -some- promising aspect . The CGI wa outstanding and it wa clear that a lot of time went into modelling the Ark and producing water effect and animation of the computer generated animal towards the end . The particle , render and texture used were aesthetically stellar . Although part of me could n't help , but think these were undeserving to a movie with such poor ideal and were , in my opinion , 'too good ' for this piece of cinema and carried the movie throughout . Overall I view this film a a disaster in term of continuing what wa a franchise with huge potential , but unfortunately it fell short to a bad conclusion in the Almighty series and approaching the end of the film I had set my expectation high for an epic and somehow meaningful finale to make up for the mediocre content I had so far witnessed . This wa n't the case and I wa deeply disappointed and confused come the closing credit . As I sat discontent I could n't help , but think the movie wa n't anywhere near a 'Mighty ' a I hoped for . In many way the film reminded me of a watered down `` Night at the Museum '' a it showed similar styling and characteristic , but unfortunately wa league below even that . I give this movie 3 out of 10 , a it is watchable , but it 's definitely one to be avoided ! If you HAVE to see this film , be prepared for disappointment a 'mildly entertained ' is the best you could hope to obtain in watching the said production .

This movie is painfully slow and ha no plot . It conveys the life of a group of laid off boatworkers . One of the older one is sincere in his attempt to get a job . There may be some social commentary here , but , it is muddled a nobody is painted in a very sympathetic light . I do not understand why it had a 7.8 when I decided to watch it . I watched the whole tedious thing and built expectation for a huge redeeming payoff . No luck . The IMDb rating ha always been such a good match for my taste . Anything above 6.5 wa worth watching . And my wife say Javier Barem doe not even look good in this movie . He 's not my type , so , my agreement doe not mean much . Sigh . I give it a 1 .

My sibling and I stumbled upon The Champions when our local station aired re-runs of it one summer in the 1970 's . We absolutely adored it . There wa something so exotic and mysterious about it , especially when compared to the usual American re-runs ( Petticoat Junction , Green Acres ... you get the idea ) . It had a similar feel to The Avengers ( not too much of a surprise , since it wa also British and in the spy/adventure genre ) . I would love to see it again now -- hopefully it hold up . I 've mentioned this show to others and no one ha ever heard of it , so I began to wonder if I 'd imagined it whole existence . But the wonder that is the web ha allowed me track down information about it . Hopefully it will find a new generation of fan .

As a flying and war movie buff , this rank at he bottom of my list . It is historically completely inaccurate and the cast sound and act like they just stepped out of a high-school play . The acting , script , direction , production standard and casting are all garbage . The only saving grace is some of the flying sequence . If the people they portray were fictitious , I might rate it a 2 , but if there is one thing that annoys me more than anything else in movie , it is pretending that this is history and that the great people they are trying to be , actually did this ! Its almost a if they tried to write in a many notable WW1 personality a possible.There are many good WW1 flying film and this is NOT one of them .

The only part lacking in this movie is Shue 's part a the daughter wanting to follow in her `` aunt 's '' footstep a a daytime soap star . Otherwise it would be a perfect 10 . It seems that every actor enjoyed their part and overacting to fulfill their own enjoyment a well a the script - I have to wonder if a little ad lib'ing wa n't taking place in part . It wa well cast and there are some classic line that will stick with you . It 's a fantastic movie everyone should see at least once . I 'd recommend not drinking anything that would sting coming out your nose . You 'll definitely want to watch the last scene closely , 'Nurse Nan ' ha a little secret she 'd rather not have shared with you . If you love daytime soap or despise them , this move poke fun in all the right place .

This is an excellent little film about the loneliness of the single man . Phillipe Harel a Notre Heros is a bit like an amalgam of Robert de Niro in Taxi Driver , Inspector Clouseau ( in his stoicism ) and Chauncey Gardiner in Being There ( also Peter Sellers ) . He is single yet doe n't have a clue how to attract the opposite sex - in fact , he really make no effort at all ! He ha a stoicism and fatalism that defies any hope of ever achieving coupledom - his friend Jose Garcia a Tisserand is in the same plight yet at least make a brave effort to transcend his extended virginhood ( he 's 28 and admits he 's never had sex ) . Very good outdoor shot of Paris and Rouen , where the two software people travel on business . They try various nightclub and place but all to no avail . My theory is that they 're trying the wrong place - they go to more-or-less 'youth ' nightclub ; they should try the type that ha older people , more their own age . Harel increasingly becomes isolated and doe a little de Niro effort , a in Taxi Driver , urging his friend/colleague to go and stab some bloke who 's pulled a nice-looking girl in the nightclub . Worth watching .

Scratch is a documentary about DJs and their art of scratching . From that one line description of the film you would have no idea how entertaining and educational this little film is . It is a joyous and vibrant celebration of a cool subculture which is little known . It 's filled with great underground hip hop music and you get to see some top DJs ( e.g . DJ Q-Bert , DJ Shadow , and Mix Master Mike from the Beastie Boys ) showing off their stuff . Going into the film I wa n't sure that `` scratching '' can really be called an art form , or that the turntable can be viewed a an instrument in it own right . Scratch completely changed my mind on these point . What these guy do with their turntable is truly amazing -- it is definitely some kind of art -- and the turntable , if you know how to use it , can be transformed into an instrument that you can `` play , '' a much a a drum or a guitar . And you even get a lesson on the basic of scratching from DJ Q-Bert ( e.g . how to use the fader to get different sound effect ) . All these DJs in their own way were inspired to take up the art of scratching after watching Herbie Hancock perform his song `` Rock It '' ( you remember that song , do n't you ? ) live at the Grammys . What got their attention wa not Hancock himself but his DJ and his scratching . Not only is Scratch about scratching , but it doe some `` scratching '' of it own thanks to the creative way in which this documentary is shot and edited . There are moment where clip are quickly `` rewound '' and then `` forwarded '' several time , which mirror ( in the film medium ) what happens when a DJ quickly move the record on his turntable back and forth while using his fader ( that `` wicka-wicka-wicka '' sound ) . Whether you 're a fan of hip hop or not , you can count on Scratch to give you a very enjoyable night at the movie . After seeing it , I had an itch to go buy a turntable of my own . And I mean this a a compliment .

The dream of Karim Hussain are to be feared . When the right hemisphere of his character overpowers the left , shocking image of blood , dismemberment , and various abomination are released . Religion wo n't save you , nor will mother nature or your own family . Hussain 's dark poetry , because that 's what this film really is , destabalizes all institution of sanctuary . ` Subconcious Cruelty ' is a current crowd pleaser on the horror\fantasy festival circuit . The film 's opening meditation on madness is both well written and profound . The protagonist 's desire to profane the birthing process which brought him into the hell he inhabits unfolds with horrific and credible illogic . From here the film continues deeper into the subconcious and tackle mother nature . Hussain offer depiction of lusty pagan fertility and writhing mushroom madness . Nature is exposed a blood-drenched and violent in Hussain 's frightening enlightenment . ` Subconcious Cruelty ' is disturbing to all and rewarding to those who see past the shock into the mature theme of life , lust and madness this very worthy film explores . CJ Goldman deserves kudos for his special make-up , a do David Kristian for unnerving sound design and Teruhiko Suzuki for score .

Fearful Symmetry is a pleasant episode with a few fault . The first thing about the episode is that it take place near Mountain Home Air Force Base in southwest Idaho . Season one 's 'Deep Throat ' take place near Ellens Air Base , also in southwest Idaho . I 'm wondering if the air force base are one and the same but they decided to use the real name in Fearful Symmetry . Mulder and Scully have some good dialog , always a plus . Ed Meecham , the zoo keeper , reminds me of cranky , old school teacher . They must have liked child at one time , you just ca n't imagine how . Just like he must have cared more for animal at one point . I liked the concept of the episode , but I felt it had some inconsistency . If alien are so adept at abducting human and returning them safely , why ca n't they put the animal back in the right place ? And the alien are just now having problem returning the animal ? I do n't buy Mulder 's theory of a problem with the space-time continuum . As if he 's an expert on that . I also thought Jayne Atkinson 's performance a Willa Ambrose wa not well done . Besides those nitpicks , I still enjoyed this episode because of the intriguing concept of alien harvesting animal DNA a well a human DNA .

This is without a doubt one of the worst movie EVER , I emphasize , EVER made . What´s worse , my old hero Dolph is in it and he´s starring it . Jesus ... The story is actually quite good but the way it´s carried out made even my body hurt . The fighting scene for starter are about a well choreographed a a fight between two drunk slugging it out in the gutter . The actor , except for Dolph who kinda suck also , perform so badly you can´t help but wonder if their reason for being there is that they´re all friend of the director , who by the way must have been absent most , if not all , of the time . This is §12 million spent in an unimaginable way , because by the look of the effect and scenery , the cost can´t be a cent above §1000 .

I am a glutton for B-movies . I love the old Drive-In fare like this movie . This film , made for very little money it seems , doe do one thing that some bigger budgeted film fail . It is cheezy . It is gory . It ha no real plot , but it entertained me for an hour and a half . I wa either laughing or covering my eye in shock . There are a few great effect like a shot from INSIDE a guy 's mouth when he get stabbed in the chin by a knife and it poke up through his tongue and slam into the roof of his mouth , and one gross-out with a guy getting his eyeball yanked out . But there is also load of zombie , and some psycho killer patterned after Texas Chainsaw Massacre , and a demon possessed scarecrow . I loved the dialogue that the killer spout a they torture and kill people . It ha great camera work , and some cool editing trick . This one is more original than the first Bloodbath , and the undead look better , but it is still patterned after those dubbed trashy zombie movie of the 70 's and 80 's and it still ha a cheeze factor that rank mighty high . Do n't expect Romero , just second-rate Fulci . I would say that Horror fan will like it , and it is funny and cheezy and a fast ride through B-movie Land .

Eddie Murphy Delirious is undoubtedly the funniest thing I have ever seen in my life . When I saw it for the first time about 2 year ago I wa in stitch for week after it . To date I have seen it a further 17 time and i still laugh my as off each time . For those who dont know Eddie Murphy wa a brilliant stand up comedian before he wa a Hollywood superstar . There is not one dull spot in this piece of genius unlike Eddie Murphy Raw which wa released in 1987 which go flat during the middle . If you are not the sort of person who ca n't stand swearing then I would n't advise you to see it a you will probably hear swearing of some form every 5-10 second . I gave this a 10 out of 10 because it display the greatest comic genius of them all at his best .

This is a really funny ( and sexy ) movie - that is not just silly but ha great acting . It 's the kind of movie where the character are so entertaining that you feel like you are connected to everyone in the theater . I saw it at the Boston film festival , and I found myself frequently laughing out loud with everyone else , and also moved by some of the movie 's more serious part . It 's a unique movie about two doctor , and I do n't want to give anything away but there are some powerful scene a well really funny one - plus the dialogue is great . Wood Harris ' character ha a unique relationship with his girlfriend Zoe Saldana , and Brian White and Mya are also funny and sexy in their role . If you get a chance to see it - go - you wo n't be disappointed . It 's worth seeing again . Wood Harris deserves an award .

I very much looked forward to this movie . Its a good family movie ; however , if Michael Landon Jr. 's editing team did a better job of editing , the movie would be much better . Too many scene out of context . I do hope there is another movie from the series , they 're all very good . But , if another one is made , I beg them to take better care at editing . This story wa all over the place and did n't seem to have a center . Which is unfortunate because the other movie of the series were great . I enjoy the story of Willie and Missy ; they 're both great role model . Plus , the romantic side of the viewer always enjoy a good love story .

Now more than ever we need Peace & Love in this world ! This film really showcase the wonderful music of the Broadway show , and the fabulous Choreography of the legendary Twila Tharp ! I saw it again after many year , and it still hold up well . Thank you , MGM/UA for putting this on DVD ! I love the option of seeing in Widescreen . MGM rock for doing this on many of their DVD release . Ya got ta love Treat Williams a Berger and John Savage a Claude . They could n't have picked better actor & actress for this film ! Beverly D'Angelo is such a 'hot mama ' in this film -- I had forgotten just how hot ! WOW ! The supporting cast is absolutely great , with the late great Nell Carter making a singing cameo in a couple of scene , a well a the kooky Charlotte Ray ( Mrs. Garrett on 'Facts Of Life ' ) The story get a little weak toward the end , but the anti-war sentiment of the late 60 's still hold up , and is relevant today . It 's beautifully filmed ( quite a bit on location ) and is so colorful and lovely and really brings the spirit of 1968 back on the big screen . I saw this movie when it wa released in 1979 when I wa 15 , and wa moved by it then , and it still move me now at 40 . Some other review on here say they think it should have been made sooner -- I do n't think Hollywood wa ready to make such a movie back in the late 60's-early 70 's . The Vietnam War ended in 1975 , and the whole thing hit a little too close to home , I think for this story to be filmed before it wa ( like in 1969 , 70 , 71 ) Bravo to Director Milos Foreman ! I love this film ! ! ! ! ! ! ! It 's nice to see it again , this time on DVD . It never looked better !

If you enjoy Cleese & all the British 'Pythonesque ' humour of the time , then this little gem is absolutely hilarious . Arthur Lowe is a real treat ! I saw this with friend on TV when it first came out , and it classic quote have formed a part of our joke for 30 year , and will do forever ! I have it on tape and it is continually appreciated . Perhaps some reviewer are taking it too seriously . I ca n't believe it is now only available in the US ( NTSC of course ) , and not in UK , where it should be an essential part of the history of British humour ! !

This story had a good plot to it about four elderly men that share a deadly secret concerning a young woman that they met 50 year ago . After all this time , the young woman return to seek revenge on the men . This story occasionally made me nod off during the movie in the middle of tiring elevator music and the ever so consistent thunder storm . But it is well worth the wait in the end when we find out just who the mystery woman is that keep plaguing the old men in their dream and interfering in a young man 's life . The most of what I liked in this film wa the suspense in which the young woman appears to the men just before their death . The special effect were something . Every time I heard her call out to them I would think `` Not that face again . '' But it wa a good movie , I just wish that the pace wa not a slow or the acting not a tiresome . And what I also liked about the movie wa the flashback of the 20 's , very authentic a well a the costume being original .

This ingenious and innovate comedy pack many moment priceless and great sense of pace , though overlong . Chaplin 's satire with several classic scene , he ha dual role a a Jewish barber and dictator Hynkel , an offensive portrayal of Hitler . Then the barber is mistaken for the Hitlerian tyrant and happen bemusing event . Funny and extraordinaries acting of all casting , a the co-star Jack Oakie a Napolini ( Mussolini-alike ) , Henry Daniel a Gasbstich ( Himmler-alike ) and Billy Gilbert a Herring ( Goering ) . Chaplin 's first spoken film is brilliantly photographed by Karl Struss.This splendid film contains numerous amusing scene , the funniest are the following : 1 ) The one when during the WWI the barber-soldier along with a co-pilot are flying in a turned plane without aware 2 ) Dictator Adenoid Hynkel doing overacting speech including a twisted microphone 3 ) Hynkel playing with an enormous balloon of the world 4 ) The Jew-barber shaving a man fitting to Hungarian Dance number 5 of Brahms 5 ) when Hynkel and Napolini each try to keep his body higher than other in a barber 's chair ; among them . Hitler banned movie exhibition to the Germans due to it satire of him , and put him in his death list after his proposed conquest of America.The movie is co-starred by Paulette Goddard , third of his four wife , they were married in 1936 , although no announcement of the marriage wa made later , one time finished The Great Dictator.The picture wa released in 1940 , when Chaplin had survived a moral scandal by a paternity suit but a brush with the House of Un-American Activities wa the signal for the USA to refuse him re-entry from Britain and he fled to Switzerland .

I saw Anatomy when it came out and recently bought it and the 2003 sequel and a I watch a lot of foreign film in various genre , you have to watch movie in their original language for sure . Not only is it annoying to know the voice do n't belong to the actor , but they always seem cheerful , like the whole movie is one big long toothpaste commercial or something . It make an otherwise awesome movie seem horrible and I have had to convert a lot of my friend who used to think foreign film are n't a good a North American film - that they are n't `` Hollywood enough '' . Also , they translation is never right , it 's too literal , and screw up the vibe of the movie , even if it 's basically saying the same thing . I watched Anatomy by myself the other week in German then with subtitle with my roommate because he wa on his laptop and did n't want to have to miss part when he could n't see the subtitle because he wa typing . 30 min in and he begged me to let him finish his work then start the movie over with subtitle . He loved it ! Both movie are awesome a intellectual horror film ! Kelly

this could have been better , but it wa alright ... it helped me get away from my boredom.I didnt even wan na see it , the only reason i wanted to rent it is because Jamie Martz is in it .. he is a unknown actor but he is shining and is the highlight of the movie ... the ending wa so horrible and the acting wa good for a b movie ... i give it a 4 out of 10

Based on the true story of two young Americans who sold national secret to the Soviet Union in the height of the Cold War , `` Falcon And The Snowman '' want to be both suspenseful and philosophical , and wind up falling short in both department . It 's le le Carré than who care . Timothy Hutton star a Christopher Boyce , a former seminarian who , disgusted by Watergate and the middle-class value around him , is probably the wrong guy to be hired by a company running spy satellite for the CIA . Sean Penn play his drug-dealing pal , Daulton Lee , who make himself Boyce 's courier , delivering secret file to the Soviet embassy in Mexico City . An offbeat synth-jazz score , lack of sympathy or emotional attachment for anyone , and lot of scene of guy getting angry in room all combine to deaden what could have a decent moral-dilemma thriller . It 's really Penn 's movie despite the second billing ; his character get to talk turkey with the Russians while Hutton play with his pet falcon . Hutton look like they woke him up five minute before they called `` action '' . With Penn , it 's a crapshoot whether you get a brilliant performance or an over-the-top one . Here , it 's a bit of both , but more the latter , especially in the second half when Lee switch from coke to heroin . He screech . He snort . He crash Russian embassy party . He get pummeled with telephone book . He spit at himself in a mirror , a big goober he must have been saving for a paparazzo . `` I do n't know who my friend are anymore ! '' he cry out . It 's exhausting to just watch him . Penn seems to have modeled Lee somewhat on Dustin Hoffman 's Ratso Rizzo from `` Midnight Cowboy '' , complete with overly nasal line reading and constant eye shifting . John Schlesinger directed this film a well a `` Midnight Cowboy '' , but he seems to have had another Hoffman film in mind , `` The Graduate '' , throwing up scene after scene of Boyce and Lee poolside , trying to decide how to live their life in their gilded cage . Too bad no one suggested plastic . From the opening shot , news footage of American decline juxtaposed with Boyce and his bird , `` Falcon '' make clear it is a message movie , though the message itself is far from clear , probably because the character never come into focus . Is Boyce supposed to be an idealist ? Or is he just a mercenary ? Hutton and Schlesinger do n't seem to know , which make it harder for u . Meanwhile , opportunity to establish some suspense , like Boyce stealing document from the top secret `` Black Vault '' where he work or Lee playing game with the Russians , are interrupted by jump cut to scene of the pair with their family and friend . It 's the normalcy of the story that Schlesinger find interesting , but it 's the least interesting aspect for u . Good stuff : It 's interesting to see a film that work the 1970s vibe so early a this one , referencing Maria Muldaur and Tang . Dorian Harewood , memorable in `` Full Metal Jacket '' , ha a nice turn a Boyce 's paranoid colleague Gene , who show Boyce how to make margarita with a shredder but ha some serious 'Nam issue beneath his partying exterior . Macon McCalman is also fine in a totally different way a the no-nonsense bos who give Boyce his high-security job . David Suchet a the Russian embassy official who deal with Lee make for a fascinating blend of menace and amiability . But `` Falcon And The Snowman '' stand or fall on the the question of the two title character , and neither the actor nor Schlesinger are able to mine much in the way of answer . Worse , after more than two hour in their alternately feral and catatonic company , you do n't really want answer . You just want those credit to roll .

Watching CBS 's `` Surrender , Dorothy '' , I kept wondering why Diane Keaton would want to be in it ( not because it 's a television movie -- with the dearth of enticing role for slightly older actress , it is n't any wonder why Academy Award winning performer such a Keaton turn to TV -- but because it offer no opportunity for Keaton to shine ) . A single mother , grieving the sudden death of her twenty-something daughter , imposes upon -- and gradually becomes friend with -- the group of young people her daughter wa close to at the time of her accident . Adapted from the novel , this teleplay give u a group of self-absorbed character one would cross the street to avoid . Aside from being coarse and dim , these phony people are incredibly unconvincing , a is the tidy scenario and the bungalow near the beach where the kid reside ( one young man , who wear muscle shirt to tell u he 's gay , hears Diane Keaton say , `` Surrender , Dorothy '' and actually asks , `` That 's from `` The Wizard of Oz '' , right ? `` ... no , genius , it 's from `` Citizen Kane '' ! ) . Keaton may have wanted to do this material based on the subject matter of confronting death . She try turning this distinctly unlikable woman into a shadow of her own personage ( lot of kooky outfit ) , but it doe n't sit well with the viewer since Keaton ha always been warmly likable and flexible in a flaky way . Here , she 's a crazed harpy who doe n't learn many lesson on her journey of self-discovery ( the movie quickly forgets it 's about a dead young woman and becomes an odyssey for the nervous wreck of a mom , who appears to be an overage hippie who ha never lost anyone close to her ) . This is the kind of film actor promote on talk show with the caveat , `` It should help a lot of grieving mother out there '' . I ca n't imagine it helping anyone since it is intrinsically a downer , muddled and baffling . It 's deranged .

Dennis Quaid is tryin ' hard to prove u that Jerry Lee Lewis wa a dumb guy . And he 's doing too much to prove it . TV sequence are very good , like a photocopy of old black and white footage . Music is fine too , because Mr. Lewis himself is singing . But the rest is just Hollywood B-Movie style , with the fifty Happy Days complex . I think the only good thing in this movie is to see young Winona Ryder .

I saw The Merchant of Venice in London last week . Great acting by Al Pacino , Jeremy Irons , Joseph Finnes and Lynn Collins . Compare to other movie based on Shakespeare 's play , this production ha made the play so easy to understand and follow . Bravo to Michael Radford for directing such top actor . The costume and the scenery are great and since it wa filmed on location in Venice it give the film and authentic flavor . I had read the play over thirty year ago at school and the emphasis wa on the character ' anti-Semitic behavior toward the Jews and the cruelty of the Christians . I do not know if this movie is going to be controversial but in any case I am sure that it will get few Oscar nomination .

Really ! Here the French cinema hit rock bottom , and compared to it , the least appealing of the American adolescent horror movie , the like of `` Friday the thirteenth '' `` Freddy '' and co are masterpiece of the seventh art . It 's all the more infuriating a there were exciting original element : the forêt de Brocéliande and it legend , the druid and King Arthur , all were splendid asset for a dreamlike fantasy and horror film.Alas ! Filmed , a an user aptly pointed out in a fake forest , near Paris , the movie is fake horror , fake Celtic history , fake vestige -you should see the professor ( Wilms who wa a wonderful M.Le Quesnoy in `` la vie est un long fleuve tranquille ) scream for the `` invaluable scrap '' -which the production probably bought in a dime store-fake character , fake excavation ... The boy disguised a druid are unintentionally very funny ; so are the girl who seem to be expert in martial arts.And what can we say of the professor ? of the monster ? A ten year old would write a better screenplay than this grotesque farce.To think that people can spend money for such drivel when artist are still waiting for a producer ! Word to the wise : Maurice Leblanc wrote a marvelous story dealing with druid and old ceremony in his Arsene Lupin saga called `` l'île aux trente cercueils '' .A miniseries wa made 30 year ago.Avoid this `` Broceliande '' garbage and try to see it instead .

`` Intensive Care '' by Dorna von Rouveroy is easily one of the worst horror movie ever made.This extremely cheap Dutch slasher flick offer some gore and plenty of absurd situations.A horror veteran George Kennedy is completely wasted a a Professor Bruckner.The acting is abysmal , the action is slow and the climax is laughable.A famous surgeon ha a car accident.He lie in a coma seven year and then he wake up and go on a bloody rampage . `` Intensive Care '' is clearly influenced by American slasher film including `` Halloween '' and `` Friday the 13th '' series.The killing are hilarious and the dialog are painfully stupid.Still if you are in the right mood you can give this piece of trash a look.You 'll laugh until it hurt with this one-you can believe me !

One of the best 'guy ' movie I 've ever seen ha to be the Wind and the Lion . Gad , the scene ... Raisouli 's bandit swarm over the wall ... A staid British gentleman calmly get up from tea with Candice Bergen and drop three of them with a Webley revolver in his coat . A whisper from the ghost of Empire ... Lest we forget ! And the Winchester 97 blowing large hole in obstreperous native and even more obstreperous and faithless Europeans ...
