This is film that wa actually recommended to me by my dentist , and am I glad he did ! The blend of British humor ( should I say , Humour ? ) and the reality of a lost , middle-aged widow trying to maintain her lifestyle were a hoot . Add to that mix the reality of what it take to actually grow pot ( those plant under the bush were NOT going to make it without the TLC they received ) , and it is a truly hilarious , yet touching film . I laugh every time I conjure the vision of all the bar patron sitting in their lawn chair with sunglass on counting down the light ! Maybe it 's just my Mendocino County blood , but the Brits definitely got this one right ! ! 10/10

The small California town of Diablo is plagued with mysterious death after sheriff Robert Lopez unearths an ancient box.Legend ha it that the box hold the sixteenth-century Mexican demon named Azar.FBI agent Gil Vega is sent to investigate the murder and join force with the sheriff 's daughter , Dominique and Mary to fight with evil and bloodthirsty demon . `` The Legend of Diablo '' is an absolute garbage.The film lack scare and gore , the acting is amateurish and the direction is bad.The animation is the only one aspect of the film I enjoyed.I 'm a big fan of indie horror flick , for example I loved `` Torched '' , '' Live Feed '' , '' Bone Sickness '' or `` Neighborhood Watch '' , unfortunately `` The Legend of Diablo '' is a huge misfire.Definitely one to avoid .

Southern Cross , written and directed by James Becket is a waste of good celluloid and actor 's effort . A formula film is not necessarily bad if it pay off on it 's promise , which this film doe not . It is a tiresome concoction of movie cliche that can be traced to a thousand different film from the past . It is full of random and empty plot twist that add nothing but aimless action , such a a trip by the protagonist to a ghost town where the villain ( unexplainedly ) follow them . This wa obviously concocted a an excuse for a shoot out and escape scene bordering on the preposterous , with people popping in and out of doorway and running past window while firing pistol at each other . It make one believe that somebody told Becket there wa a ghost town in the Chilean foothill and he said , `` Oh great , let do a shoot out scene there . '' Do n't even waste your rental money on this . It is a bunch of random bit and piece from a hundred different film thrown together to call an action drama .

Besides the fact that my list of favorite movie maker is : 1 ) Stanley Kubrick 2 ) God Allmighty 3 ) the rest ... this movie actually is better than the book ( and the TV miniseries though this is an easy feat , considering the director ) . The flawless filming stile , the acting and ( Kubrick 's all time number one skill ) the music - make it THE masterpiece of horror . I watched the TV miniseries a few year ago and liked the story and I had my hope about this when I got a hold of it . IT BLEW ME AWAY ! ! ! It is far better than I ever imagined it . It start slow ( Kubrick trademark ) and ha a lot of downtime that build up the suspense . The intro scene is a classic by all mean and I watched it about 20 time just for the shear atmosphere it induces to the whole film . Also the film doe n't offer a lot of gore ( it ha just enough and it is by no mean tasteless ) a trend that I hate in recent day horror film . Just watch it !

What can be said about such a pathetic movie ? - Very bad acting ! The main actress seems to know only one facial expression : fear mixed with weakness . Like a poor beaten dog ... The other actress ( the one who play the evil ) look like the female double of Ozzy Osbourne , with an awful red wig . The other actor are so pitiful that they do n't even worth being described . - There 's absolutely no plot . The story begin with possibility but go nowhere : we do n't know anything about the meaning of `` 11:11 '' , nor who Rayden really is , excepted the simple `` she 's evil '' or `` she 's a child of Apocalypse '' ... which is not an explanation . We do n't know why the parent have been killed , what kind of danger is growing and why Sara wa chosen . As the film go on , we just watch pseudo-scary scene , with a bad music . Moreover , the end doe n't tell anything : we just see two possibility a if one of them wa a bonus scene or the director 's cut ... There 's no plot , so no possible interpretation . - `` 11:11 '' is just full of clichés ! It is so obvious that i could n't help laughing . For example : the deserted library or the bathroom scene , ghost silhouette walking with a blast of wind , ... there 's even the fashionable `` little scary girl '' a in `` Dark Water '' or `` The Ring '' . Of course , the main character is bullied at school and look like a stereotyped Gothic girl ( dark hair , red lip , skinny , black clothes ) . Is it an obligation to make her credible ? I do n't think so . The psychology of Sara is so few developed and so typical that it doe n't make her credible , nor endearing . - Terrible direction : a i said , nothing original , everything ha already been seen a thousand time and is used here without any real purpose . - There are some funny incoherence . For example , i do n't know if `` ghost science '' , `` paranormal course '' or whatever is taught in American university ... In Europe it is really not the case : teacher talking about negative energy or using `` unmaterial '' creature sensor ... ridiculous . Also : how can you watch a movie shot in the sixty with a Super-8 camera on a computer screen without spending hour of your time for a digitalization ( in the movie they watch it immediately on the computer screen ) AND how can you , on this old film , isolate a tiny detail then zoom in and see a perfectly identifiable face ? I wonder if the director ha ever tried to digitize an old analogical film ... Eventually , `` 11:11 '' just worth being watched if you like to laugh at silly movie , or maybe if you want to fall asleep on your couch ... But it 's an expensive way to fall asleep !

Before I start my review here is a quick lesson in australian slang which may help you with viewing the movie and understanding some of the other review from australia and overseas . In australian slang `` thong '' are a pair of rubber sandal ( not to be confused with the same american word that pertains to butt revealing underwear ) , `` stubbies '' are a brand of australian short , a `` stubby '' is a small can sized bottle of beer , and a `` stubby holder '' is a foam insulator for a small bottle of beer . If you love black comedy about smalltime criminal then you will love this movie , unfortunatley a lot of people on IMDB with weak stomach and no appreciation of dark humour have reviewed this movie which unfortunately make this movie appear to be more mediocre than what it is . A lot of reviewer have also compared it to Lock/Stock and Pulp Fiction , while it is the same genre , it is a completely different and original style . A lot of reviewer have also panned this movie for using Heath Ledger 's character dead brother to open and guide the narrative for this movie , without watching the movie closely enough to realise that his brother wa killed by the same villain that wish to kill heath character , this is explained midway through the movie but not clearly enough for most to understand . This movie is also reminiscent of Lock/Stock and Reservoir dog in that it is the Director/writers debut feature , and for a debut feature it rate a well a these two movie , a a matter of fact like Lock/Stock and Reservoir Dogs I rate this movie a a 10/10 for a director/writers debut , unfortunately unlike Tarantino and Ritchie Jordan fails to live up to expectation in his subsequent movie like Ned Kelly . This movie is one that you should definitely add to your DVD collection and is one that hold up to several viewing quite easily .

I know , I know , `` Plan 9 from Outer Space '' is the worst movie , or maybe `` Manos , the Hands of Fate . '' But I ca n't get worked up over those sock-monkey movie . Of * course * they 're bad . How could they be any good ? But if you 're talking about movie with respectable production value and bankable talent , the T. rex of all turkey ha to be `` Yentl . '' All the treacly phoniness , all the self-absorbed asininity , that stain everything Barbra Streisand ha done since 1964 , reach it culmination in this movie . From it lonely summit of awfulness , `` Yentl '' look back to `` A Star is Born '' and forward to `` The Mirror Has Two Faces . '' There is nothing else quite like it . What emotional undertow dragged Streisand out to make this movie I would rather not speculate , and what audience she wa playing to I can not possibly imagine , although I 'll bet there 's a nine in ten chance you are n't a member of it . Nobel Prize-winner and saintly guardian of Yiddish literature Isaac Bashevis Singer wa so outraged by what Streisand did to his story that he blasted her in public for it . It is a tribute to Streisand 's impenetrable vulgarity that she not only did n't commit suicide , but went on to make more awful movie .

When Jim Wynorski first announced he would be doing a new sequel for my favorite series of all time , the `` Slumber Party Massacre '' series , I wa ecstatic . I had been waiting for a new installment for literally year . So , production began and very small bit and piece on the shoot and the actor involved were released until the shoot wrapped . Then , the announcement of a title change . No longer would this new sequel be titled `` Slumber Party Massacre IV , '' but `` Cheerleader Massacre '' instead . I wa a bit disappointed , but having a different title would be a very small price to pay for a film I had waited so long to happen . I wa still extremely intrigued and on the edge of my seat to see it . Maybe a month ago , some very advanced copy of the film were released to some extremely lucky viewer , who got to see the film month before it release date . A few review leaked on the net and judging by them , I began to become apprehensive on Jim Wynorski 's `` Cheerleader Massacre . '' Tonight , I got to see the film for the first time in full length and I am still scratching my head . As I read in another review , `` Cheerleader Massacre '' is definitely NOT a new installment in the `` Slumber Party Massacre '' series , but a slasher flick all on it own . And a bad one at that . Before I get into the specific of the film , let me first state what an enormous fan of Jim Wynorski 's film I am . I always thought him to be a true camp genius , with a winner almost every time . Yes , his movie are made on shoestring budget and do n't contain the most top-notch acting around , but they 're fun nonetheless . They are what they are : campy movie you watch when you want to have a good time . From `` Sorority House Massacre II , '' to `` Hard to Die , '' to `` Chopping Mall , '' Jim ha produced the good on more than one occasion . One of the reason why I wa excited that this film would be his latest project . `` Cheerleader Massacre '' doe not ( in my opinion ) reflect any of the film I had seen this director/writer create in the past . Firstly , the production wa extremely inexpensive and the film wa actually shot on videotape , something I had never seen Jim do before . The actor were mediocre , to say the least , and the story is almost laughable . The killer is also extremely stupid and reminds you more of your cuddly old grandpa , rather than an escaped lunatic . Of course , the film is littered with female nudity . This is a Jim Wynorski movie we 're talking about , folk . But some of the boob-shots seen here almost seem like they were done for time . There is an extremely long shower scene , containing the cheerleading coach , that seems to go on forever and it greatly reflects a shower scene in Jim 's `` Sorority House Massacre II . '' The girl even bathe herself almost in the exact same way . `` Cheerleader Massacre '' is also extremely cliched , to say the least . The opening scene is literally something we 've all seen in HUNDREDS of past slasher flick . A guy and a girl making out , on the verge of consummating their relationship when ... you guessed it . They 're hacked to piece . Brinke Stevens , who I 've never really considered to be a tremendous actress in the first place , also give one of her stiffest and forced performance in her small cameo . We 're talkin ' possible cue card here . She recall some incident her character endured by the killer seen here twenty year ago to the police , while footage of the original `` Slumber Party Massacre '' play . Why wa footage from the original film used if it wa definitely not a new `` SPM '' ? I have no idea . There is also two explosion seen in this movie that I am almost certain were recycled from other film . Not only doe this film recycle FOOTAGE from past film , but it also recycles the score from other film a well . Some of the music used in `` Humanoids from the Deep '' ( which wa also recycled prior for `` The Coroner '' ) can be heard throughout the entire film . There are at least two more a well that I can not identify , but am certain have been used before . After sitting through this film 's horrendous acting , ridiculous story , non-existent gore/special effect , and camcorder-like quality , I am having some serious concern toward Mister Wynorski 's career . Has the man who delighted audience with film in the past finally lost his niche ? Only time will tell . Oh , and let 's not forget his newest film . A new installment in the `` Sorority House Massacre '' film , now titled `` Final Exam . '' I think I 'm seeing a pattern here ...

Too bad a couple of comment before me do n't know the fact of this case . It is based on actual event , a highly publicized disappearance and murder case taking place in the Wilmington , DE/Philadelphia PA region from '96 through 2000 . I have to admit I wa highly skeptical of how Hollywood would dramatize the actual history and event and wa actually quite impressed on how close they stayed to what wa constantly reported on local newscast and Philadelphia Inquirer news story throughout the time period . Of course I immediately pointed out that the actress ( who I really like in Cold Case ) who played Fahey looked nothing like her ( Anne Marie wa actually prettier ) . I have to admit though that Mark Harmon really nailed the type of personality that wa revealed a Capano 's and the behavior that Capano exhibited throughout this period . Details of the case were right on ... no deviation of dramatic effect ... even down to the carpet , gun , furniture , and cooler . In conclusion , I also wanted to add that I have met Tom Carper many time at various function ( a good man , despite being a politician ) and I am so glad that he pulled the string in the Federal realm necessary to solve this heinous crime . Guys like Capano are real and it wa great to see him finally put behind bar .

I tuned into this thing one night on a cable channel a few minute after the credit ran , so I did n't know who had done it at first . The longer I saw it , the more I started thinking , `` Jesus , this look like an Albert Pyun flick . '' Was n't quite sure , though , for two main reason : the photography wa quite good ( and the Utah desert scenery wa beautiful ) , and Scott Paulin gave an hilarious performance a Simon , a murderous cyborg , but with some style and a sense of humor . Paulin must have ad-libbed the many clever one-liner he shot out , because Albert Pyun ha n't written anything even remotely funny or coherent in his career . Unfortunately , Paulin doe n't have all that much screen time before he 's gone , and the movie 's the worse for it . Lance Henriksen , playing the evil head cyborg , growl his way through his part , a he 's done in countless other movie like this . I do n't know what the hell Kris Kristofferson is doing in this thing ; maybe he wanted to see what the Utah desert looked like and get paid for it . He go through the movie looking ( and sounding ) like he just woke up , and in fact spends most of the last half of the movie on his back in a tent . Kathy Long , the nominal hero , ha a great body , is attractive , ha a great body , fight extremely well , ha a great body , and doe n't have an iota of acting talent , but that doe n't matter in a movie like this . This being an Albert Pyun film , it 's full of the trademark that we 've all come to know and love : inane and idiotic dialog , choppy editing , and the impression that they lost a reel in the middle of the picture and figured , `` Ah , nobody 'll ever notice . '' As bad a this movie is , however , it 's a shade above most of Pyun 's other effort -- this is `` Citizen Kane '' compared to his brain-numbing `` Adrenaline : Feel the Rush '' , for example . The fight are pretty well done , if repetitive ( after she knock down eight or nine guy one after the other , you find yourself saying , `` Alright already , go to something else '' ) , and Long is very athletic ( and , a a previous poster ha noted , ha a great derrière ) . It 's not a good movie by any stretch of the imagination , but it 's not anywhere near a incoherent and incompetent a Pyun 's usual extravaganza . You could do worse than rent this movie -- not much worse , granted , but worse nonetheless .

The movie open upon Julian Sands , lying on his back , a black kitten drooling blood into his awaiting mouth from where he hold it , about two foot above him . That wa so provocative , and I thought , `` Here we go ! A good vampire movie ! '' And then it died . That wa literally the only scene which captured any part of the imagination . It wa slow , uneventful drivel thereafter . I wa vastly disappointed , a my previous experience with Sands ' acting wa quite enjoyable . However , this attempt wa obviously misdirected and the screenplay left a lot to be desired . Even Julian Sands 's questionable performance could not begin to save this already sunken barge of a movie . It rate a 1.1/10 from ... the Fiend : .

About twenty minute into this movie , I wa already bored . Quite simply , these character were fairly dull . Occasionally , something enjoyable would happen , but then thing would slow down again . Fortunately , my patience wa eventually rewarded , and the ending to this movie wa n't bad at all . However , it wa by no mean good enough to justify sitting through the first ninety minute . So , I would say that the movie wa mediocre overall , and considering all of the talent in the cast , I 'd call this a disappointment .

` Manna From Heaven ' is a delightfully compelling film . Within the shifting paradox of value in middle-class Americans from 40 year ago to the present day , the plot tweak the concern and hope of an interesting range of ` Damon Runyonesque ' character . Their struggle with moral dilemma , dotting on ` what might have been , ' hope to yet fulfill youthful dream , romantic yearning , and ` hit it big ' combine to make a most entertaining film . Rather than relying upon ` in-your- face ' sexual explicitness , the burgeoning relationship between Inez and Mac/Bake is classically subtle but clear . His untying the knot in her shoelace at the Art Gallery and their heat in their poker game is outstanding The script 's crisp writing is skillfully interpreted by an outstanding star and supporting cast . One of the few film I have ever fone to see twice in it opening run , ` Manna From Heaven ' definitely warrant national distribution . Conrad F. Toepfer

If I 'd only seen the poster for Nurse Betty , I probably would n't have touched it with a ten-foot pole . But after I heard some positive buzz , and knowing it made some noise at Cannes , I decided to give it a try . What I got is a truly enjoyable movie , based on a very entertaining plot . Rene Zelleweger is impressive in her role a nurse ' Betty , a woman who is sent into a delusional psychotic episode following a traumatic experience . I also liked Morgan Freeman ( no surprise ) and wa pleasantly surprised by foul-mouthed comedian Chris Rock . The film bounce continuously between comedy , drama , romance , and thriller . Yet despite this apparent identity crisis , it hold up quite well . I found my eye glued to the screen from beginning to end always waiting for the next twist in the story . The entire cast is strong , if not spectacular . My only real complaint is that director Neil Labute ( who made a splash a few year ago with the very impressive and dark In the Company of Men ' ) relied much too heavily on many cliched Hollywood convention . The mood-creating musical effect he crammed down our throat during each sentimental scene were unbearable ! And he did the standard old `` let 's take some of the minor character and pair them up at the end in an illogical and unnecessary romance '' trick , just to make absolutely certain everyone go home with a smile on their face . Why must director and writer treat their audience like idiot ? ? But the movie is still much too enjoyable to be dragged down very far by these annoying irritation . In a very subpar year for movie , 'Nurse Betty ' rank a one of the more pleasant surprise of 2000 . 8 out of 10 .

This flick wa even better then 'Waiting for Guffman ' . The great strength in these two film lie in the brilliant character acting by Guest and Levy 's little second-second city troupe . If one find this movie boring or pointless , God help 'em , they just did n't get it . It is a mockumentary , something at which Guest and Levy have a genius for . At the end of the movie where Guest 's southern down home dog lover tell u that to relax after the show , he went to Israel to work on a 'caboose ' , or when he tell u that ventriloquism is an ancient art and we see a hieroglyphic of an ancient Egyptian holding a tiny ancient Egyptian in it 's hand , I realized it is moment like this that make life worth living . Thank you Mr.Guest and Mr.Levy , and God bless you .

I stopped short of giving `` Mr. Blandings Builds His Dream House '' 10/10 due to an aspect that make u in the 21st century cringe a little bit : the fact that a black person is the faithful servant ( somewhat reminiscent of Stepin Fetchit ) . But other than that , the movie 's a hoot . Portraying middle class New York couple Jim ( Cary Grant ) and Muriel Blandings ( Myrna Loy ) trying to build a house in Connecticut , this flick ha something for everyone . Grant is his usual flippant self , while Loy doe quite well a merely a wife . But Melvyn Douglas add some real laugh a Jim 's and Muriel 's lawyer Bill Cole , who seems to have more plan than he 's making clear . As for the house itself ... throughout most of the movie , you 'll probably feel ambiguous a to whether or not you want to live there . The builder , contractor , and others also provide their fair share of laugh . All in all , a comedy classic . Also starring Louise Beavers , Reginald Denny , Sharyn Moffett , Connie Marshall and Jason Robards Sr .

This production wa made in the middle 1980s , and appears to be the first serious attempt to put BLEAK HOUSE on celluloid . No film version of the novel wa ever attempted ( it is remarkably rich in subplots that actually serve a counterpoint to each other , so that it would have been very hard to prune it down ) . The novel wa the only attempt by Dickens to make a central narrator ( one of two in the work ) a woman , Esther Summerson . Esther is raised by her aunt and uncle , who ( in typical Dickens style ) mistreat her . She is illegitimate , but they wo n't tell her anything about her parentage . Later we get involved with the gentry , Sir Leicester Dedlock , and his wife . Lady Honoria Deadlock ( Dame Diana Rigg ) is having an increasingly difficult time regarding her private life and the meddling involvement of the family solicitor Tulkinghorn ( Peter Vaughn ) . We also are involved with the action of Richard Carstone ( Esther 's boyfriend ) in trying to win a long drawn out estate chancery case , Jarndyce v. Jarndyce , which everyone ( even Richard 's cousin John Jarndyce - played by Desmond Elliot ) warns is not worth the effort . Dickens had been a law reporter and then a parliamentary reporter before he wrote fiction . Starting with the breach of promise case in PICKWICK PAPERS , Dickens looked closely at the law . Mr. Bumble said it wa `` a as '' in OLIVER TWIST and Dickens would consistently support that view . He look at the slum a breeding ground for crime in TWIST , that the law barely try to cure . He attack the Chancery and outdated estate law , a well a too powerful solicitor and greedy lawyer ( Tulkinghorn , Vholes ) in BLEAK HOUSE . In LITTLE DORRIT he attack the debtor ' prison ( he had hit it also in David COPPERFIELD ) . In OUR MUTUAL FRIEND he look at testator and will . In THE MYSTERY OF EDWIN DROOD he apparently wa going to go to a murder trial . Dickens wa far more critical of legal institution than most of his contemporary , including Thackeray . But the novel also look at other problem ( like charity and religious hypocrisy , the budding Scotland Yard detective force , social snobbery in the industrial revolution ) . He also us the novel to satirize various people : Leigh Hunt the writer , Inspector Fields of Scotland Yard , and even the notorious Maria Manning . Most of these point were kept in this fine mini-series version . If it is shown again on a cable station , catch it .

Without a doubt , the best Burt Reynolds film ever ! Even better than Smokey and the Bandit . This wa probably the first real bloody cop thriller of the 1980s and delivered the perfect blend of humor , action , mystery and style that is missing in today 's film . This one ha it all : A psychotic Henry Silva jacked up on PCP , $ 1,000 a night call girl , ninja assassin and Burt Reynolds getting his finger sliced off , one by one , with a butterfly knife . The film is based on the novel by William Diehl who also wrote PRIMAL FEAR , another one of my all-time favorite . This movie is worth watching just to see Henry Silva get shot six time , crash through a window , and fall thirty story from the top of an Atlanta high-rise . This is probably the coolest stunt in Hollywood history , performed by legendary stuntman Dar Robinson . Robinson also played `` Moke '' in the Elmore Leonard movie STICK , also starring Burt Reynolds . Stick feature another great Dar Robinson stunt . Robinson fall from a Miami apartment building and unloads all six shot from a .44 magnum on his way down . Very cool stuff . SHARKY 'S MACHINE is my favorite police drama . I never understood why this film flopped the way it did . If Burt did more film like this , he would 've built a better reputation for himself . He prof to be a talented director with Sharky , a well a a gifted actor . Burt is supported by Brian Kieth , Charles Durning , Bernie Casey , Richard Libertini , Rachel Ward , and everyone 's favorite bad guy Henry Silva . PLEASE remake this classic film ! Get Affleck and Samuel L. and some other hot actor and you 've got a great movie just waiting to be filmed . I give it a 9 out of 10

To be honest the real reason I wanted to watch this film is because Dana Kimmel of Friday The 13th pt 3 wa in it which is n't a proper reason why to rush out and see a movie . When I started watching it I realized that `` Sweet Sixteen '' is n't a very good slasher , it 's really dull and boring and just doe n't go anywhere . After over an hour , only three murder have occurred and the story ha n't really developed in any possible way . The movie is nicely shot with quite nice photography and good directing but just a with many other slasher flick from the 80 , the movie suffers from being too dark at time . The acting is actually pretty good though and Melissa 's character is easy to sympathize with , even though she 's a complete slut . The story line is n't completely rubbish but it 's just way too dull to keep you interested , the only thing that kept me interested wa Melissa she wa stunning and Dana Kimmel whose really sweet and cute in this movie . All in all pretty dull slasher flick that doe n't go anywhere I 'd definitely would n't recommend it to Slasher fan .

The first time I saw this movie , it did n't seem to go anywhere . When I watched it a second time though , it made a lot more sense . Give it a chance , watch it more than once , there are a lot of key element that shape the story that could be missed the first and even second time watching it . The Cohen brother brilliantly weave actual happening of the early 20th century into this story to make a believable setting and storyline . The combination of Clooney 's leading role blend well with Turturro and Nelson 's supporting act . John Goodman 's appearance in the movie is hilarious . The soundtrack is great a well . This movie ha become a household favorite for my family . 10/10 , for sure .

This barely watchable film wa a bit of an ordeal to sit through . None of the segment are good , but at least the first one wa mildly amusing , and the middle one wa somewhat imaginative . The final one wa just plain brutal , and after sitting through two weak comedic short , the third one wa truly painful to watch . Even by the low standard of a National Lampoon movie , this one seemed especially boring and joyless .

A wasted effort . On the surface it 's a typical disaster movie : we 're involved in the life of a few people who get caught up in the Big Event . However , the script is so awful and there 's so much explaining of the character ' background within the dialogue that we feel we 're being treated like moron . Even Sesame Street did n't explain the origin of Mr Snuffleupagus or how Mr Hooper died : we can work it out . Someone thought that entering 'Enron ' into the script would give it currency when discussing power company . The acting is by and large bland , with the exception of the older performer ( Randy Quaid , Brian Dennehy ) , and after the first hour , I could n't care le about who the storm took out . But maybe there are the special effect to watch . Sadly , no . Even on a 20-year-old TV set I could see one tractor and trailer were computer-generatedbadly . Maybe there are budgetary limitation , so I can forgive that one . Footage of a plane trying to land looked pretty real , but I kept telling myself I had seen that before . This site confirms it : it wa from an earlier film , Nowhere to Land . So in summary , the only good bit are from another film , and when you see the best action sequence compressed into a 30-second network promo , it make Category 6 look quite good . My advice : rely on your network to do some good 30-second clip , watch them , and save yourself two night .

First of all , we know that Bruce Willis is a good actor but if you take the majority of his movie you 'll see that the character have these moment where they are the same . His character in this movie is far beyond every single one so far ... and counting . The story begin in the ( not so far ) future where a man is sent to the past to find the source of a virus that ha swept most of humanity from the face of the earth . The story seems to go towards SF but i think it closer to a drama because of the slow rhythm of the story . About that . Movies tend to be faster and slower at some point and develop more towards the end than the beginning but a you see this movie you 'll be aware of this constant rhythm of story and revealing fact that doe not speed up nor slow down . Its the one and the same speed that flow gently and pretty good . But that doe n't mean that the ending wont pull your nerve , cause it pretty good . As far a the direction go , it is prefect . Movies a such are easily destroyed by bad directing but this one ha become far better . So , if you are getting ready to see a Sci-Fi movie or some action , you 'll miss it . B There should be more movie like this .

The basic plot of 'Marigold ' boast of a romantic comedy wherein the film industry is kept a a backdrop . An American actress Marigold , played by Ali Carter get stuck in India . Worse that , she is out of money . She then decides to play a small role in a Bollywood musical , so that she can earn enough money to get back to her nation . Here she get to meet Indian choreographer Prem , played by Salman Khan . Basically , the movie fails at the script level . Just by calling a film a Hollywood venture doe n't guarantee quality cinema . Marigold stand out a the best example . The art direction is weak and outdated . Musically , Marigold turn out to be a dud . Shankar-Ehsaan-Loy 's is far from being acknowledged a a decent hear . Actingwise , Salman delivers of his most amateurish performance till date . Ali Larter is good and ha immense screen presence . Performance wise too , she is good . One can also find good review regarding this movie at http : //www.comingsoon.net/films.php ? id=36310

Sharp , well-made documentary focusing on Mardi Gras bead . I have always liked this approach to film-making - communicate idea about a larger , more complex , and often inscrutable phenomenon by breaking the issue down into something familiar and close to home . I am sure most people have heard story about sweatshop and understand the basic motif behind profit and capitalism , and globalism 's effect on poorer nation ( however people feel about it ) . Rather than expound on these subject and get up on a soapbox ( not that there 's anything wrong with that , other than such documentary typically preach to the converted ) , this documentary simply show Mardi Gras bead , how they are manufactured , by what people , and under what condition , and then how they are utilized by consumer at the end of the process . It openly and starkly investigates the motivation of everyone involved in the process , including worker , factory management , American importer , and finally , the consumer at the end of the chain . I felt a little sickened by this ; equally by the Mardi Gras reveler , but also by the way the worker in China have accepted their situation a normal and par for the course ( even if they have some objection to the detail of how they are managed ) . The footage of the street sweeper cleaning up the bead off the street at the end , made a particular impression . But that wa just my reaction ; I can see how someone else might read this documentary a little differently . Unlike other documentary on this subject , I do n't think you have to have any specific political opinion to be affected by this . This is ultimately a story about human being and our relation to the good we produce and consume . If you have ever bought a product made in the Far East , this should give you something to think about . Outstanding and highly recommended . Need to see more documentary like this . Kudos to all of those involved in the making of this film .

As an avid Gone With the Wind fan , I wa disappointed to watch the original movie and see that they had left out many important character . Luckily , the film on it own wa a wonderful piece . When the book Scarlett came out , I read it in hope of following two of my favorite literary character farther on their journey together . While the book lack any true quality , it remains a good story , and , a long a I wa able to separate it from the original , wa and still is enjoyable . However , I consider the six hour I spent watching the `` Scarlett '' miniseries to be some of the worst-spent hour of my life . Discrediting any of the original character trait so well-formed in Margaret Mitchell 's book , this series also turned the story of the sequel into one of rape , mistrust , murder , and misformed relationship that even the book Scarlett stayed away from . The casting for many of the character refused to examine the trait that had been so well-formed in both the original novel and film , and even carried through in the second book , and again leaf out at least one incredibly crucial character . In the novel , Scarlett O'Hara Butler follows her estranged husband Rhett Butler to Charleston under the guise of visiting extended family . After coming to an `` arrangement '' with Rhett , she agrees to leave , and proceeds to reconnect with her O'Hara relative in Savannah . Eventually , she accompanies her cousin Colum , a passionate leader of the Fenian Brotherhood , to Ireland , to further explore her family 's `` root that go deep , '' and is eventually named `` The O'Hara , '' the head of the family . While her duty a The O'Hara keep her engaged in her town of Ballyhara , Scarlett venture out into the world of the English landowner , and instantly becomes a sought-after guest at many of their party . She , having been scorned by Rhett time and time again , eventually agrees to marry Luke , the earl of Fenton , until Rhett come along in a clichéd `` night-on-white-horse '' - type of a rescue . The `` Scarlett '' miniseries fails even to do this justice . Raped by her fiancé and scorned by her family , the series show Scarlett thrown in jail after she is blamed for a murder her cousin committed . I heartily advise anyone considering spending their day watching this to rethink this decision .

Just like last year event WWE New Years Revolution 2006 wa headlined by an Elimination Chamber match . The difference between last year and this year match however wa the entertainment value . In reality only three people stood a chance of walking out of the Pepsi Arena in Albany , New York with the WWE Championship . Those men were current champion John Cena , Kurt Angle and Shawn Michaels . There wa no way Vinnie Mac would put the belt on any of the rookie ; Carlito or Chris Masters . And Kane ? Kane last held the WWE Championship in June 1998 , and that wa only for one night . It wa obvious he wa n't going to be the one either . Last year match wa a thrilling affair with six of the best WWE had to offer . 2006 wa a predictable and disappointing affair but still the match of the night by far . The only surprise of the evening came after the bell had run on the main event . Out strolled Vince McMahon himself and demanded they lift the chamber . It wa then announced that Edge wa cashing in his money in the bank championship match right then and there . With no time to prepare and just off the back of winning the Elimination Chamber match John Cena did not stand a chance and dropped the title after a spear to one of the most entertaining heel in WWE . This wa the only entertaining piece of action that happened all night . The undercard , like last year , wa truly atrocious . Triple H and The Big Show put on a snore fest that had me struggling to stay away . HHH picked up the win but that wa never in any real doubt wa it ? Any pay-per-view that ha both Jerry Lawler and Viscera wrestling on the same card will never have any chance of becoming a success really doe it . The King pinned Helms ( who book this stuff ? ) and Big Vis tasted defeat against the wasted Shelton Benjamin with a little help from his Mama . The woman of the WWE also had a busy night . There wa the usual Diva nonsense with a Bra and Panties Gauntlet match which wa won by Ashley and the Woman 's Championship wa also on the line . In a match , I thought would have been left to brew till WrestleMania 22 Mickie James challenged Trish Stratus in a good match . Trish won the contest but it wa evident that this is going to continue for the foreseeable future . The opening contest of the night pitted soon to be WWE Champion Edge against Intercontinental Champion , Ric Flair . This could have been better but it wa a battered and bloody Flair that retained after a disqualification finish . Edge obviously had bigger fish to fry . So New Years Revolution kicked off the 2006 pay-per-view calendar in disastrous fashion . The only good thing from that is knowing that for the WWE the only way is up . They do n't get much worse than this .

I wa just looking at the 100 bottom movie according to IMDb user seeing if there wa anything to review that I have n't yet and I found this little screen gem . One of those occasion when you see a movie ranked a one of the worst and you just have to be one of the few that actually like it . Darn , well I guess I will get ridiculed and spat upon here , but for me this wa a pretty good flick when I saw it . It ha been awhile however , I remember it used to come on HBO late at night and I watched it two or three time and I have n't seen it really since and I would love to watch it again now knowing Jolie wa in it . The story follows a cyborg and a guy trying to escape the clutch of this corporation and some bounty hunter after them . I think that is basically all there is to it , throw in a few scene with Jack Palance and we have our movie . Some good action here and there , and some blood and violence a well . There is also a love story at play a well a the female cyborg and the guy who trained her to fight kind of fall in love with each other . The dialog sometimes becomes rather bad at time and it is by far not a top notch film , but for a b-movie it is really good . I do n't know if it wa a theatrical release though because it doe not seem high quality enough for that , but it doe make for one of the better direct to video if it wa one of those .

Attractive husband and wife writing team Robert Wagner ( a Joel Gregory ) and Kate Jackson ( a Donna Gregory ) arrive at the spooky mansion of actress `` Lorna Love '' ( actually , silent film star Harold Lloyd 's house ) . Mr. Wagner and Ms. Jackson are contracted to write the silent movie star 's biography . Wagner ha a personal interest in the project , since his father wa once the famed star 's lover . Mysterious event unfold , and Jackson must fight to save her husband from the spirit of the beautiful blonde , who is `` perfectly preserved '' in a crypt on the estate ; moreover , the evil woman seems bent on possessing her husband , and murdering Jackson ! This is very much a `` Night of Dark Shadows '' variation , co-starring genuine `` Dark Shadows '' alumnus Kate Jackson , who know and play her part well . Robert Wagner lack David Selby 's intensity . Sylvia Sidney ( a Mrs. Josephs ) sidestep Grayson Hall . Marianna Hill is not a match for Lara Parker ( or Diana Millay ) . Bill Macy ( a Oscar Payne ) is good in a part that would have been played by John Karlen ( in a Dan Curtis production ) . There are smooth cameo by Joan Blondell , John Carradine , and Dorothy Lamour . Ms. Lamour 's delivery resembles Joan Bennett , which begs the question : why did n't producer Aaron Spelling get more of the original `` Dark Shadows '' regular ? Director E.W . Swackhamer wa Bridget Hanley 's husband ; he worked with Ms. Blondell on `` Here Come the Brides '' , and with Jackson on `` The Rookies '' . `` Death at Love House '' ha , arguably , a tighter storyline than the `` Night of Dark Shadows '' film ; it differs in the movie star angle ; and , in it `` Father Eternal Fire '' ending , it more closely resembles the TVseries ' `` Laura the Phoenix '' storyline . * * * * Death at Love House ( 9/3/76 ) E.W . Swackhamer ~ Robert Wagner , Kate Jackson , Sylvia Sidney

This film is mildly entertaining if one neglect to acknowledge it numerous incongruity of plot and sheer lack of believability . Bruce Willis a `` The Jackal '' never seems to live up to his reputation a a cunning mastermind of the underworld . Instead , he bumbles about in broad daylight , parading a mishmash of shoddy disguise . Why this man ha never been captured before ( or even identified ) is beyond me . Not once is the audience impressed by his cleverness or daring ; considering the price he demand for his service ( an exorbitant $ 70 million ) , his method are decidedly low-budget and stupid . As for those in pursuit of him , they are at least a ridiculous in their behavior . They show no sense of expertise , instead relying on half-baked conjecture which sends them traversing across the country at their whim . Incredibly , these far-fetched guess ( maybe he bought a boat , maybe he 's in Chicago , etc etc ) invariably lead them straight to the Jackal , who yet again escape their clumsy grasp . Richard Gere , whose Irish accent fade in and out like a distant radio station , play the inexplicable role of an imprisoned convict who is released from jail to work alongside the FBI . He actually make a compatible partner , if only because his mean are a amateurish and inept a his professional pal . At one point , he actually confronts the infamous Jackal , but unfortunately the FBI , although they trust him enough to leave him out of their sight , fail to equip him with a weapon or any mean of communication . What kind of operation are they running here ? The film also appears overly reliant on gruesome violence , which is entirely superfluous and provides no suspense whatsoever . The supposedly stealthy Jackal act more like a demented and senseless serial killer , eliminating people for sport and writing on a victim 's cheek with blood . The film 's action scene are both predictable and unrealistic , and many moment are ruined with melodrama . This movie is poorly executed on many level , the one bright spot being the ever consistent Sidney Poitier . Avoid this movie if you are in the mood to think a you watch it .

Raymond Burr star a an attorney caught up in the murder of his best friend ( Dick Foran ) thanks to his affection for his friend 's wife ( Angela Lansbury ) . This wa a full year before he started doing Perry Mason , so the movie might be of particular interest to his fan if it wa the inspiration for his casting . There is n't all that much else here that 's interesting though . Lansbury is always good , but her character here is very one dimensional and the motif for her crime in the mystery are totally obvious . There 's an interesting performance by Lamont Johnson a a painter who 's also in love with the `` femme fatale '' , but the Burr character is pretty straightforward . It 's frankly bizarre to see an actor like Burr doing these romantic scene with Lansbury , and his halting delivery doe not match his character here very well a it doe in most film I 've seen him in . There 's no mystery at all really , and the whole suspense is supposed to be around the title of the film and the way that Burr 's character is setting up the Lansbury character to implicate herself ( double jeopardy prevents her being tried again for the original murder , presumably ) . He doe so with a very large tape recorder which she doe n't notice when she come into the room I guess . A few perhaps unintentionally fun moment and basically the rest of the thing could have been done for TV .

Purchased this film for one dollar and figured I could never go wrong , my big mistake wa watching it . Enjoyed the acting of Ice-T and the rapping which gave lot of class to this film about Los Angeles and the world of pimp . There is a boxer who kill one of his opponent in a practice ring and who ha a career , but because of mental problem from childhood and the killing of this other boxer he retires . He get hired by a pimp who is looking for a bodyguard to protect the girl that work for him at their trade and make sure they are not beaten up . This boxer fall in love with the bos 's girlfriend and all kind of trouble start . This is entertaining and it then becomes a big laughing comedy .

The story in this movie is fairly implausible B grade stuff , but the script called for a creepy guy to play the lead , and in 1940 , that meant Peter Lorre . And Peter is at his creepiest in this one a island owner Stephen Danel , who get prisoner paroled to his custody to work at his island diamond mine . Upon arrival the parolee discover that they are slave mine worker that can be beaten or killed at the whim of Danel . Only two thing seem to have it worse off than the slave ; Danel 's wife , and monkey . Monkeys tick him off so much that his violence towards them probably lead to the only meat the slave get . Lorre is perfect in his role here , and creep up the screen in industrial-strength fashion . Although the script is not Casablanca caliber , the editing is very tight and there are no wasted scene . This is a very watchable story , but I 'm not sure what niche this movie filled . Too long for a short subject , and too short for a feature length film , I 'm not sure how this wa marketed to theater . I just caught this for the first time on a late night/early morning TCM showing . Lorre fan will not want to miss this one if they have n't seen it .

I saw this with few expectation and absolutely loved it ! Bend it like Beckham is a fairly typical coming-of-age movie about a fairly atypical girl . This is Parminder Nagra ( `` ER '' ) 's breakout role , playing Jess , a teenager in England who is caught between her traditional Indian family and her love of football ( that 's soccer to u North Americans ) . And even though she 's actually much older than her character , she play the role pitch-perfect . This is a movie about friendship - specifically Jess 's friendship with Jules ( Keira Knightley ) , her teammate who is also going through family issue , especially with her mom , who wear purple nail polish and little bow on her shoe , and who want Jules to be more feminine , wear lacy underwear and flirt with boy and is terrified that playing sport mean her daughter is a lesbian . Jules and Jess both love playing the game and have issue trying to convince their family to let them go after their dream . They also , unfortunately , both love the same man - Joe , their coach ( played by Jonathan Rhys-Meyers ) . The love triangle cause some strain in their friendship . In some spot , Bend It Like Beckham fall into clichés . In others , scene drag on far too long , and this movie probably could have benefited from overall tighter editing . But this wa a refreshingly fun film about growing up , culture clash , and the love of football . It 's about female empowerment , chasing your dream , and supporting your friend . Funny , charming and fun , Bend It Like Beckham is the little film that could ... and did . Excellent . 8/10 .

Note , I only saw approximately the last half of this movie , so feel free to take my review with whatever grain of salt you deem appropriate , that being said , seeing what I saw wa more than enough to make me quite convinced that a one-star rating for this is enough . In short , it 's a dismal-plot slaughter of the wonderful precursor ( NL Christmas Vacation ) with Chevy Chase , only it doe n't have Chevy Chase in it , and it take place in a generic tropical island , essentially with no connection to Christmas at all . Ol ' Chevy probably did n't want in because the plot is that devoid of actual fun , instead they got the screwy Cousin Eddie , who , again , wa great in the original , but in this he is just over the top , and an extremely poor basis for any movie considering the plot and acting . The attempt at humor are generic to a degree where even contemporary television comedy trump it , and considering that this is supposed to be comedy , I doubt I need to say more . This is not to be seen for it quality , for it ha none , but for it 's failing and again , how Hollywood is spilling it 's life 's blood of the past in the pursuit of a quick buck . I think I 'll watch the original before the upcoming Christmas season just to try to regain my childhood innocence , from a lost time when motion picture were more than just high-budget , but mindless , garbage .

What can possibly said about this movie other than , `` viewer beware '' . Christmas Evil should come with a warning label like cigarette do , because this wa harmful to my eye and ear . I am rarely this unsatisfied with a `` b '' horror flick , but this movie could n't even bring a little scare to a five year old . The point of a relentless lunatic that ha a thirst for blood in a film is that he/she should seem almost god-like , like nothing can stop their maniacal rage , but in this film the resident psychopath get himself stuck in a chimney in a bizarre attempt to surprise his next victim and of course follow along with the all to popular legend of santa claus , it 's a reminder to the viewer that this man is in no way dangerous because he 's far too stupid to be dangerous . All in all a total waste of film .

Gary Busey is superb in this musical biography . Great singing and excellent soundtrack . The Buddy Holly Story is a much better movie than La Bamba . From reading other comment , there may be some historical inaccuracy . Regardless , it is a fun toe-tapping film , and a good introduction to Buddy Holly 's music .

Jean Dujardin get Connery 's mannerism down pat : the adjusting the cuff link when entering a club a all the woman turn to admire him , the nonchalant straightening and smoothing down of the tie , the swaggering , steely gait . It 's uncanny , and you come to realise just how much of Bond in the Sixties wa Connery 's creation and not really Ian Fleming 's character . The cinematography is a nod to those early film , the movie take off From Russia With Love and Thunderball mainly . The main joke is how chauvinistic the hero is , not just in term of sexism but nationalism and colonialism , and how he put nose out of joint when he is sent to Egypt . It 's not perfect - about 20 min in it seems a one-joke movie and bit of it remind one of spoof of the day , of which there were plenty . Morcecambe and Wise 's The Intelligence Men had suspect-looking men in fez 's following their hero around too , and that 's going back a bit . Unlike Sellers ' Clouseau or Baron Cohen 's Borat , Dujardin doe n't give his character that layer of realness or genuine pathos - he is too busy perfecting his Connery mannerism . It doe n't do enough with the credit or a big song , and there 's no funny or serious villain , like Mike Myers ' Dr Evil or Ricardo Montalban 's Naked Gun nemesis , for the hero to go up against . But the scene where OSS117 wake up in Cairo one morning had me laughing out loud in the three-quarters empty cinema , and the whole thing look wonderful , plus you 'll never get a chance to see Operation Kid Brother on the screen , and the woman are ace crumpet , really hot . It 's a Bond spoof without falling into the mad scientist/Ken Adam set or funny gadget routine . Throughly recommended .

First , I would like to apologize for my rating of `` 1 '' ... The only reason i give this film such a high rating is that I ca n't delve into negative integer . All `` This is a spoof '' musing aside , and while I certainly have tried to give it due consideration , have left me with a certain notion , namely ; `` This is quite possibly the worst film ever made . '' On any level and in any plausible quantification of qualitative measurement ... Seriously , I tried , I 'm just a in to any indie born-for-cult-video-distribution film a the next buff , but seriously , this movie sucked rhino ball ... Honestly , if I had directed this `` film '' I would have seen it a a legitimate cause for suicide .

- A newlywed couple move into the home of the husband 's dead former wife . It 's not long before the new wife begin to have the feeling that someone doe n't want her in the house . She see skull all around the house . But when the husband investigates , he ca n't find anything . Is someone trying to drive her back to the asylum that she wa recently discharged from ? Or , is the ghost of the dead wife trying to get the new wife out of her house ? - This is the first time that I 've watched The Screaming Skull without the assistance of the MST3K crew . And , it will in all likelihood be the last time I watch it this way . Can you say dull ? I 'm not talking ordinary dull - I 'm talking watching grass grow dull . There are great stretch of the movie where nothing happens . The screen could have gone blank and I would have gotten a much entertainment out of it . The character drone on and on with the most monotonous conversation imaginable . The Screaming Skull could probably be marketed a a sleep aide . - The actor do n't help matter much . Most of them deliver line with the conviction normally reserved for a grade school play . I have n't looked it up , but I would be shocked to find that anyone associated with this movie ever appeared in anything of cinematic value . I wo n't even go into the script the actor are given to work with . Let 's just say that the character are given some of the most idiotic line ever uttered on film . - You 've been warned ! Either avoid this one at all cost or , at least , seek out the MST3K version .

I have seen so many bad review on Supervivientes de los Andes that I felt compelled to stand for it ( or at least I 'll try ) . First of all , of course that it look dated , it wa made in the seventy with very low budget , but that 's part of it 's charm . I like contemporary film but also dig the old one for what they worth . I 'm not the one to feel the urge to only see or like movie with modern treatment and effect ; besides , almost every movie buff like old fashioned motion picture ( who doe n't like film from El Santo or Plan 9 from outer space , no matter it 's overall quality ? ) . In the aspect of pace , is just a tool for covering ( again ) it 's low cost , and I think the constant dialog are in order of a better character and situation development . Sure , Alive ha better FX , but I wo n't despise the old one just because of that , and I do n't feel quite attracted to English speaker in an event involving people from Uruguay and for me , that give a plus to Supervivientes de los Andes . It 's like , even if Canoa , from the seventy and based on a true event too , would have a better remake now due to the advance of technology , but I think I would stick to that one based on the emotion that offer regardless it 's production date . All of this is based in the impact that had on me because the first time I saw it wa on TV , and nowadays I do n't think it ha lost some of it 's primal force . Of course it 's been a long time and I 've seen ton of better movie in every aspect of cinema , but that doe n't diminish it 's true value . It 's not a bad film , and I place it above Alive without hesitation . Just give it a break .

This film is really bad . It maybe harsh , but it is . It really is . Poor script , every vampire cliché in the book is used , and no sympathy is given at all to the origin of the main character ... i.e . ole Dracula . There have been some truly brilliant Dracula/vampire movie in the past , but this doe n't even make it into the `` dire '' slot . Take a selection of people who seem to have dropped out of a teen-slasher move , add a dribble of Dracula Lore and mix in a heady tonic of religious/surreal day-dreaming ... and you get a confusing mess of a film - Dracula 2000 . I really can not find any good thing to say about this movie , a if it wa n't bad enough that it wa made in the first place , they seem to have made Johnny Lee Miller effect an English accent ... Whats the problem with that I hear you cry ... Well , he is English , but he sound like an American trying to do an English accent . All in all you may a well say your money ( if you were thinking of buying it ) , or rent it out , watch it , and discover for yourself why it 's about a scary a the Tellytubbies . P.S . Although La La is pretty frightening !

Looking backwards to that year 2002 when `` Furia '' wa made , one can easily recognize the heralding sings of today 's New Generation in Romania . The main quality of `` Furia '' stand in a very solid script , with a substantial dramatic core and a really professional developing , plus a cast of excellent actor . All four leading role are admirably performed , both with depth and casualness : Dragos Bucur and Andy Vasluianu confirmed , since then , being two of our best performer today , Dorina Chiriac follows them closely , and Adrian Tuli , a non-professional ( in real life , a graveyard manager ! ) cast a Gabonu , wa a genuine revelation ! Further , Radu Muntean 's directing is skilled and expressive , creating in a very compelling style that feeling of `` a fateful night '' and inescapable destiny . One can easily pas over the few awkward and even failed moment , since time proved them to be only the uncertainty inherent to a debut , never repeated in his subsequent movie : `` Hârtia va fi albasträ '' and `` Boogie '' .

Feeling Minnesota , directed by Steven Baigelmann , and starring Keanu Reeves , Cameron Diaz and Vincent D'Onofrio : The strained relationship between two brother , Sam ( D'Onofrio ) and Jjaks ( Reeves ) , is pushed to breaking point when Jjaks arrives at Sam 's wedding and make off with the bride , Freddie ( Diaz ) , a former stripper , marrying Sam to repay a gambling debt owed to night-club owner Red ( Lindo ) . Baigelman 's writing and directing debut is a frustrating mess , full of hateful character and lacking coherence . Putting Keanu and Diaz in the same movie should at least provide some eye candy , but Baigelman even cop out on that score , grudging his actor up with little positive effect . Very poor .

THE CELL ( 2000 ) Rating : 8/10 The Cell , like Antz , must be watched twice to be appreciated . The first time I saw this film I thought it wa mediocre , but the film had such a lasting impression on me after viewing , I decided I had to rent it again . I did , and I found the film to be much more likeable . The Cell is not for everyone , but it divide it story up with quality and is a visually intelligent film that dream up image and plot idea that could not be matched . The film 's script can be clunky at time , a can the acting , but the visuals are ingenious and bring the engaging story to an exotic and intriguing life . The Oscar nominated makeup is also daring and careful , while the beautiful costume and utterly brilliant set decoration went unnoticed . Tarsem Singh who ha also directed music video , go totally crazy with his direction and it result well . He ha major talent and this film ha a lot of potential if you give it a chance . Overall , The Cell is a powerful , disturbing and avoids being too tacky which make it a great , pleasurable watch .

This movie , despite it list of B , C , and D list celebs , is a complete waste of 90 minute . The plot , with it few peak , wa very predictable . It wa so silly that I can not believe that I am taking the time to even write a review of it . Flex , to his credit , ha grown in his ability to act since playing Michael Jackson in a made for TV movie a few year ago . Tangi , on the other hand , ha regressed , a she wa more talented in her role a Felicity 's flunkie some year ago . As I sat watching this train wreck of a film , with it pitiful production and horrible sound quality , other four letter word came to my mind to qualify what I thought of this film . However , in an effort to keep my writing G Rated , I 'll simply say this film is another four letter word starting with an L . LAME ! ! !

I loved this movie ! It wa all I could do not to break down into tear while watching it , but it is really very uplifting . I wa struck by the performance of Ray Liotta , but especially the talent of Tom Hulce portraying Ray 's twin brother who is mentally slow due to a tragic and terrible childhood event . But Tom 's character , though heartbreaking , know no self pity and is so full of hope and life . This is a great movie , do n't miss it ! !

This wa the worst movie I have ever seen Billy Zane in . I understand that this movie wa mainly to showcase the new comer , who did pretty good for newbie , but over all , the movie wa not believable . With all of the gunfire , you would think the police would have intervened . Even the coin being a bug on Sean wa stupid . The way Sean suddenly realizes the coin is the bug , wa not realistic . Looks like this movie wa slapped together fast . Poor job . Get a better writer . The count down to the end wa not in sync with anything . It took longer to fight . And what a coincidence that each time Billy wa going to blast Sean , he 'd be out of bullet . Once , I can believe , but not twice . Actually , Billy 's character wa goofy . It wa so stupid when Sean punch him out at the end . It wa like a comedy . Bad ! Bad ! Bad !
